the target takes additional physical damage and is yanked toward Kled.

column8: a ranged gun blast that knocks back Kled and restores courage.;Violent Tendencies;Kled gains massive attack speed for four attacks. The fourth attack deals more damage.;Jousting;Kled dashes

column1: A warrior as fearless as he is ornery
column2: the yordle Kled embodies the furious bravado of Noxus. Many claim Kled has fought in every campaign the warhosts have waged
column3: acquired every military title
column4: and never once backed down from a fight. Though the truth of the matter is often questionable
column5: one part of his legend is always the same: charging into battle on his un-trusty steed
column6: Skaarl
column7: Kled fights to protect what’s his… and takes whatever else he can get.

column1: Legends of the popular folk hero Kled can be traced back to the founding of Noxus
column2: and perhaps even further still. He is an icon revered by the common soldiery
column3: which is increasingly a cause of concern to their commanders—for there are some among the warhosts who claim to have literally served beside him.

column1: Tall tales such as “The Great Hussar’s Victory”
column2: “The Return of the High General Marshal-Sergeant”
column3: and “The Mountain Admiral” abound
column4: which strongly imply Kled has fought in every campaign ever waged
column5: acquired every military title
column6: and never once backed down from a fight. Though the details are often outlandish and contradictory
column7: the essence of the tale remains: charging into battle on his un-trusty steed
column8: Skaarl
column9: Kled fights to protect what’s his… and takes whatever else he can get.

column1: In truth
column2: the Cantankerous Cavalier hails from another land entirely—Bandle City. As a yordle
column3: he made his home among the proud Noxii tribes in the wake of the Rune Wars
column4: and has never looked back.

column1: The earliest mention of Kled in historical records was at the First Battle of Drugne. In the dusty hills of those badlands
column2: the warhost of General Zavaan was on the run from barbarian foes. Having lost the previous two engagements
column3: morale was low. The supply train had been abandoned in the rout
column4: and they were a week’s march from the nearest outpost. Zavaan
column5: in his spotless armor
column6: seemed more concerned with how this would appear back home than the welfare of his soldiers
column7: and ordered a defensive circle formation to buy himself time to think.

column1: Then
column2: as the morning sun rose
column3: the lone figure of Kled appeared on the hilltop
column4: mounted upon a desert drakalops. This warrior’s weapon was rusted
column5: his armor worn
column6: his clothes tattered—but contempt and anger burned in his one good eye.

column1: He bellowed an ultimatum to the barbarian horde
column2: demanding that they leave his lands or be destroyed. However
column3: he did not wait for any response
column4: spurring his steed and screaming the charge. Desperate
column5: starving
column6: and furious with their general
column7: the Noxian warhost’s anger ignited at the sight of this act of bravado. They rushed after Kled as he tore into the enemy.

column1: What followed was one of the bloodiest melees ever fought on the northern steppes. The initial momentum of the counterattack was crushed beneath a hail of barbarian arrows from higher ground
column2: but Kled fought on even after he was thrown from his saddle and his drakalops fled. He always seemed to be at the heart of the battle
column3: chopping down foes
column4: kicking out teeth
column5: and biting faces. The bodies piled up around him
column6: and his clothes were soaked with blood. He screamed louder challenges and cruder insults. Clearly
column7: this great warrior was willing to die before ever backing down.

column1: Cowardice can be infectious
column2: but so too can courage. Where the Noxians might have given up and fled for their lives
column3: instead they were inspired to make one last stand.

column1: Even Kled’s drakalops returned
column2: and crashed into the barbarians’ rearguard
column3: snarling and clawing as it dived in to free its master. With his mount again beneath him
column4: Kled became a veritable whirlwind of death
column5: and it was the barbarians who broke and ran.

column1: Though too few of the Noxian soldiers survived that day for it to be considered a victory
column2: Drugne was contested long enough that word reached the Immortal Bastion
column3: and reinforcements were sent. The war ground on for at least another decade
column4: until the barbarian leaders sued for peace—their strength was added to Noxus
column5: and Drugne became a foothold for continued campaigns across Dalamor and the north for many centuries to come.

column1: The body of General Zavaan—and his fine armor—was never found.
In time
column2: countless other warhosts of the empire acquired similar stories of Kled. It has long been said that he rides wherever Noxians march
column3: claiming the spoils of war for himself. Indeed
column4: in their wake
column5: good-humored signs can often be found proclaiming each new territory “Property of Kled”.

column1: 34;Anivia;the Cryophoenix;Team Spirit Anivia;Bird of Prey Anivia;Noxus Hunter Anivia;Hextech Anivia;Blackfrost Anivia;Prehistoric Anivia;Festival Queen Anivia;Papercraft Anivia;Cosmic Flight Anivia;Divine Phoenix Anivia;;;;;;Timing Flash Frost with Frostbite can lead to devastating combinations.;Anivia is extremely reliant on Mana for Glacial Storm. Try getting items with Mana or going for a Crest of the Ancient Golem buff on Summoner's Rift.;It can be very difficult for enemy champions to kill her egg early in game. Seize the advantage by playing aggressively.;;;Try to gank Anivia when she's laning. With multiple people, it is easier to ensure that her egg dies.;If you're playing a ranged champion, stay far enough away from Anivia so you can dodge Flash Frost more easily.;Try to fight Anivia in the lanes. In the jungle she can block pathways with lower ranks of Crystallize.;;Mage;Support;Mana;1;4;10;10;480.0;82;495.0;45.0;325;21;4.0;30.0;0.5;600;5.5;0.55;8.0;0.8;51.0;3.2;1.68;0.625;Flash Frost;Anivia brings her wings together and summons a sphere of ice that flies towards her opponents, chilling and damaging anyone in its path. When the sphere explodes it does moderate damage in a radius, stunning anyone in the area.;Crystallize;Anivia condenses the moisture in the air into an impassable wall of ice to block all movement. The wall only lasts a short duration before it melts.;Frostbite;With a flap of her wings, Anivia blasts a freezing gust of wind at her target, dealing damage. If the target was recently hit by Flash Frost or damaged by a fully formed Glacial Storm, the damage they take is doubled.;Glacial Storm;Anivia summons a driving rain of ice and hail to damage her enemies and slow their advance.;Rebirth;Upon taking fatal damage, Anivia reverts to an egg and is reborn with full health.;
Anivia is a benevolent winged spirit who endures endless cycles of life
column2: death
column3: and rebirth to protect the Freljord. A demi-god born of unforgiving ice and bitter winds
column4: she wields those elemental powers to thwart any who dare disturb her homeland. Anivia guides and protects the tribes of the harsh north
column5: who revere her as a symbol of hope
column6: and a portent of great change. She fights with every ounce of her being
column7: knowing that through her sacrifice
column8: her memory will endure
column9: and she will be reborn into a new tomorrow.

column1: Anivia is an ancient Freljordian demi-god who represents the eternal cycle of life
column2: death
column3: and rebirth
column4: intrinsically associated with the changing seasons. To those who venerate her
column5: she is the elemental soul of the Freljord—a symbol of hope
column6: and a sacred catalyst of change.

column1: Stories passed down through the ages often tell of how she rewards those who are kind and humble. On the rare occasion a mortal glimpses her—or at least claims to—she is described as a noble spirit-bird of ice
column2: with glittering wings that span the heavens
column3: and a piercing cry that can be heard over even the fiercest storm.

column1: The songs of the nomadic Notai tribe tell how Anivia’s birth first brought snow into the world. When she burst from her giant egg of ice
column2: tiny pieces of it were hurled into the sky
column3: and it has fallen as snow ever since. And
column4: according to the sagas of the Mourncrow tribe
column5: the frigid winds that scour the Freljord originate from the first beats of her wings.

column1: Indeed
column2: the full power of winter is Anivia’s to command
column3: and to those who seek to desecrate her homeland
column4: she is a bitter foe. When roused to anger
column5: she can cleave fortresses and mountains
column6: and her screech can summon blizzards cold enough to shatter steel.

column1: One of the most enduring and respected beliefs is that Anivia’s greatest gift to the Freljord was the creation of True Ice. Infused with elemental magic
column2: this unmelting substance is pure and potent
column3: and the greatest seers and ice-mages have long strived to use shards of True Ice to amplify their might
column4: while weapons that have even a tiny sliver forged into them are deadly beyond belief.

column1: When mortals first arrived in the Freljord
column2: Anivia welcomed them. Seeing that they could not withstand the cold
column3: she guided them to secluded valleys where they could shelter
column4: become established
column5: and slowly harden themselves against the elements. She nurtured and watched over them for those first precarious centuries—and they
column6: in turn
column7: worshipped her.

column1: Anivia hoped that these newly arrived tribes would remain unified in defending the Freljord from outsiders… but slowly
column2: infighting and blood-feuds became all too common
column3: making an invasion inevitable. According to legend
column4: a greedy southern king marched his warriors up through the mountains
column5: seeking to claim dominion over the northlands and shackle their wild magic for himself. So enraged was Anivia at the outsiders’ hubris and disrespect that she blasted them with a snowstorm that lasted a century and a day. Scattered standing stones can still be seen on the Scouring Plain
column6: which the locals claim are all that remain of that ancient army.

column1: Other tales include the Avarosan legend of Ulla Shatter-Spear
column2: an Iceborn warmother who was favored by Anivia for saving a young hawk from a rimefang wolf. Across her lifetime
column3: the Cryophoenix protected Ulla from harm
column4: and when she finally fell in battle
column5: having witnessed almost a hundred winters
column6: it is said that Anivia welcomed her with wings spread wide.

column1: If all these legends are true
column2: then Anivia must have witnessed the rise and fall of countless mortal civilizations. While there are still some dwindling remnants of those earlier times
column3: most have long been forgotten
column4: and buried beneath millennia of ice.

column1: But death cannot touch Anivia herself. The sagas speak of how she has been struck down and slain a handful of times throughout history
column2: though she is always reborn—for as long as the Freljord exists
column3: her soul is immortal. While it may be hundreds or even thousands of years before she rises again
column4: each rebirth coincides with the dawning of a new era. Thus
column5: her appearance
column6: while regarded as a wondrous blessing
column7: is often the harbinger of something terrible on the horizon.

column1: Once
column2: it is said
column3: she sacrificed herself against a march of towering Balestriders. Anvia knew she could not slay these colossal creatures
column4: and so she plunged into the ice beneath their feet
column5: shattering her own body in order to entomb them.

column1: Recently
column2: some claim Anivia has hatched from the egg once more
column3: and that she has appeared before the new leader of the Avarosans—the Warmother Ashe. In her
column4: perhaps Anivia sees one who may be able to finally reunite the Freljord.

column1: Yet if the Cryophoenix has indeed returned
column2: as more and more shamans and spirit walkers proclaim
column3: then it must be asked: what great threat has she come to face?

column1:
350;Yuumi;the Magical Cat;Battle Principal Yuumi;Heartseeker Yuumi;Yuubee;Bewitching Yuumi;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Support;Mage;Mana;5;1;8;2;480.0;70;400.0;45.0;330;25;3.0;25.0;0.3;500;7.0;0.55;10.0;0.4;55.0;3.1;1.0;0.625;Prowling Projectile;Yuumi fires a missile, dealing damage to the first target hit. It deals bonus damage and slows if it takes at least 1 second to get to its target.

While Attached, the missile can be controlled with your cursor.;You and Me!;Passively, Yuumi increases her ally's Adaptive Force and her own. Actively, Yuumi dashes to a target ally, becoming untargetable from everything except turrets.;Zoomies;Heals Yuumi and boosts Movement Speed and Attack Speed. If she's attached, she passes it to her ally instead.
;Final Chapter;Yuumi channels seven waves of damage, rooting anyone hit by three or more. Yuumi can move, attach, and cast Zoomies! while channeling.;Bop 'n' Block;Periodically, when Yuumi attacks a champion, she restores mana and gains a shield that follows her, protecting her and the ally she's attached to.;
A magical cat from Bandle City
column2: Yuumi was once the familiar of a yordle enchantress
column3: Norra. When her master mysteriously disappeared
column4: Yuumi became the Keeper of Norra’s sentient Book of Thresholds
column5: traveling through portals in its pages to search for her. Yearning for affection
column6: Yuumi seeks friendly companions to partner with on her journey
column7: protecting them with luminous shields and fierce resolve. While Book strives to keep her on task
column8: Yuumi is often drawn to worldly comforts
column9: such as naps and fish. In the end
column10: however
column11: she always returns to her quest to find her friend.

column1: In the outlands of Bandle City
column2: there was once a wooded glen where the moon-moths glimmered and the riverbanks overflowed with rainbowfish. In a cottage nestled between the verdant trees lived a yordle enchantress named Norra
column3: with her cat
column4: Yuumi.

column1: Born with magical powers of protection
column2: Yuumi enjoyed a life of leisure for many years
column3: pouncing on sunbeams and napping beneath the mouse-trees. Whenever adventure sparked her interest
column4: she joined Norra on explorations across the material and spirit realms. Norra spent her time collecting strange objects like broken cups
column5: shards of colored glass
column6: and fabric with funny stitching. She examined each artifact with deep reverence
column7: though Yuumi never understood their purpose. Nevertheless
column8: Yuumi would use her magic to protect Norra from harm
column9: and would warm her feet when they returned home.

column1: The doorways between realms are finicky and seldom open
column2: even to creatures as dexterous as cats. Yuumi watched as other yordles waited for days for the eastern star to align with a particular stone archway
column3: or waded impatiently between marsh-lilies
column4: seeking a silver blossom blooming from the mud—only then would a pathway appear. But Yuumi’s yordle
column5: Norra
column6: possessed the powerful Book of Thresholds
column7: which allowed her to instantly travel anywhere depicted in its pages. When Norra opened a portal
column8: she and Yuumi would gleefully dive into its glowing paper and arrive at their destination
column9: joined a moment later by the book.

column1: Yuumi never paid the book much attention until one starless night
column2: when she returned home from luring moon-moths with her shinylight to find Norra missing. She saw the book on her master’s desk and flipped through its pages in a panic
column3: noticing that some were torn out entirely. Unable to read its title
column4: Yuumi cried out to it in distress
column5: calling it
column6: simply
column7: “Book”. In response
column8: the book wiggled
column9: and Yuumi was surprised to learn she could understand thoughts amidst the rustling paper. Despite not having a voice
column10: Book made itself loud and clear. Yuumi learned that Norra had gone somewhere so perilous
column11: she had destroyed the portal as she traveled.

column1: Yuumi knew she had to rescue Norra
column2: and turned to Book for help. Each of its thousand pages led to a different location along the lines of magic that crossed the material and spirit realms. The page Norra had used to travel was lost
column3: but Book might be able to get them close. Yuumi and Book would have to explore every possible threshold. She became Book’s unlikely Keeper
column4: vowing to protect it with the courage of a lion—if it fell into the wrong hands
column5: the doorways to Bandle City could open to all kinds of unsavory and ravenous intruders.

column1: Yuumi and Book began their arduous journey
column2: visiting dangerous and unfamiliar lands. Yuumi sought Norra’s scent on the wind
column3: to little avail. While Yuumi would sometimes break from their search to follow the scent of a mouse or restore her strength with a quick catnap
column4: Book was frustratingly cautious
column5: grumpy over lost time and nervous about threats they might encounter. Nevertheless
column6: Yuumi and Book were both determined to find their master and bring her home.

column1: When Yuumi especially missed Norra
column2: she often sought out other companions. One of her favorites was a door-carrying shepherd with thick whiskers and a deep laugh like a babbling brook. Yuumi rested on his shoulders for a time
column3: protecting him from angry snow-spirits stirring up flurries in a hailstorm
column4: while he brought her wriggling fish.

column1: Eventually
column2: Yuumi uncovered the scent of her master lingering in a vast Shuriman ruin. Digging deep into the sand
column3: she unearthed a broken shard of blue pottery that looked like a piece from one of Norra’s teapots. Before she could burrow further
column4: a ferocious beast surfaced from the sand
column5: and Yuumi and Book barely escaped. She could only imagine the chaos if a creature like that ripped its claws into Book’s pages.

column1: Though unlikely companions
column2: Yuumi and Book have become fast friends
column3: united by their love for Norra. Yuumi continues to search everywhere for signs of her master
column4: so she can someday return to her life of napping in the sun by Norra’s side.

column1: 37;Sona;Maven of the Strings;Muse Sona;Pentakill Sona;Silent Night Sona;Guqin Sona;Arcade Sona;DJ Sona;Sweetheart Sona;Odyssey Sona;PsyOps Sona;Pentakill III: Lost Chapter Sona;;;;;;Make sure to tag your allies while Sona's auras are active, but avoid getting caught out by enemies.;Save Crescendo for the game-altering moment.;Well-timed uses of Aria of Perseverance will grant you maximum survivability.;;;Spread out when you see Sona so she can't make your entire team dance.;Kill Sona first, as she will heal up her team if left alone for too long.;;;Support;Mage;Mana;5;2;8;4;480.0;77;340.0;45.0;325;26;3.3;30.0;0.5;550;5.5;0.55;11.5;0.4;49.0;3.0;2.3;0.644;Hymn of Valor;Sona plays the Hymn of Valor, sends out bolts of sound, dealing magic damage to two nearby enemies, prioritizing champions and monsters. Sona gains a temporary aura that grants allies tagged by the zone bonus damage on their next attack against enemies.;Aria of Perseverance;Sona plays the Aria of Perseverance, sending out protective melodies, healing Sona and a nearby wounded ally. Sona gains a temporary aura that grants allies tagged by the zone a temporary shield.;Song of Celerity;Sona plays the Song of Celerity, granting nearby allies bonus Movement Speed. Sona gains a temporary aura that grants allied champions tagged by the zone bonus Movement Speed.;Crescendo;Sona plays her ultimate chord, stunning enemy champions and forcing them to dance and dealing magic damage to them. Each rank reduces the base cooldown of Sona's basic abilities.;Power Chord;Accelerando: Sona gains non-Ultimate ability haste permanently for her basic abilities as she uses her abilities well, up to a cap. Beyond that cap, further successful uses reduce her ultimate's remaining cooldown instead.Power Chord: Every few spell casts, Sona's next attack will deal bonus magic damage in addition to an additional effect based on what basic Ability Sona last activated.;
Sona is a virtuoso of the stringed etwahl
column2: speaking only through her graceful chords and vibrant arias. Her genteel manner has endeared her to the Demacian nobility
column3: though some speculate her arresting melodies actually emanate magic—a dangerous prospect in the kingdom. Silent to outsiders but understood easily enough by close companions
column4: Sona plucks her harmonies not only to soothe injured allies
column5: but also to strike down unsuspecting enemies.

column1: Sona’s earliest memories are of the Ionian monastery where she was raised
column2: in the province of Galrin. The monks
column3: along with kindhearted volunteers from the local villages
column4: took in any orphans or foundlings left at the front gates
column5: and made sure that they would want for nothing.

column1: As a young girl
column2: Sona was considered shy and quiet
column3: until it became apparent that she couldn’t speak at all. But she was unusually thoughtful and attentive
column4: and the other children tended to seek her out whenever they needed comfort
column5: their playful smiles quickly restored.

column1: And Sona discovered other ways to express herself.
Unlike her playmates
column2: she had one possession when she was first found—a curiously strung instrument
column3: packed into a plain wooden case. None of the visiting musicians or teachers knew what it was… though that did not stop several of them from attempting to procure it for themselves
column4: one way or another. Instead
column5: Sona taught herself how to play it
column6: and her simple
column7: beautiful melodies moved even the most skeptical listener to tears of joy.

column1: However
column2: dark times were approaching. The foreign empire of Noxus had begun landing troops in the northern provinces
column3: and the monks decided to evacuate their young charges to safety before the invasion reached Galrin. After their caretakers struck a deal with a Demacian trader
column4: Sona and a handful of her friends found themselves bundled onto one of the last ships to escape before the Noxian blockade of Ionia’s western coast. She looked back in anguish
column5: knowing that she would not be able to return for many years
column6: if at all.

column1: After months at sea
column2: they arrived in Demacia—a strange
column3: dour land where magic was widely distrusted. Their monks were called “Illuminators”
column4: and they worshipped no gods or spirits
column5: yet still placed great value on showing kindness to strangers and the needy.

column1: So it was that Sona was taken in by the Buvelle family. Lord Barrett and his wife
column2: Lestara
column3: were prominent supporters of the Illuminator order
column4: and renowned patrons of the arts in the Great City. Sona became like a sister to their daughter
column5: Kahina
column6: and Lestara in particular grew very attached to her. The Demacian language was often difficult to learn
column7: but the Buvelles developed a personalized sign language that enabled Sona to communicate easily with her new family
column8: and their friends.

column1: Yet she yearned to express so much more. To show her appreciation to her adopted countrymen
column2: she decided to use her gift to delight and soothe them
column3: and returned to her music with renewed passion.

column1: Soon
column2: word spread of her virtuoso talents. Her performances captivated audiences
column3: bringing them from sorrow to bliss
column4: from righteous martial pride to almost exquisite peace… and Lestara became intrigued by the mysterious instrument that made this possible.

column1: Delving deep into the libraries of the Illuminators
column2: she came to believe it was one of the fabled etwahls—wondrous artifacts dating back thousands of years before Demacia’s founding
column3: and now exceedingly rare in the world. If that were true
column4: then this was an object of magic
column5: and Sona’s preternatural connection to it was a dangerous gift indeed. Lestara urged her to keep it secret
column6: to avoid bringing unwanted attention from the Demacian mageseekers.

column1: Sona obeyed
column2: though she wondered how something that brought people peace could be seen as a threat.

column1: Some years later
column2: Lord Barrett Buvelle was slain fighting Noxus at the Gates of Mourning. When Kahina took up her father’s blade and military commission
column3: the heartbroken Lestara decided the time had come for Sona to return to Ionia
column4: and the two of them withdrew from all courtly engagements to make the journey together.

column1: In the war’s aftermath
column2: a great “restoration” was underway across the First Lands
column3: but the people were much changed by what they had endured
column4: and Sona realized there was no longer any place for her there. Saying farewell to Ionia once again
column5: she went back to Demacia with Lestara.

column1: Even so
column2: her chosen homeland is not without its own problems. In the wake of King Jarvan III’s assassination
column3: the mageseekers have gained significant power
column4: and many innocent citizens are persecuted for any supposed connection to magic.

column1: As a child of two wildly different cultures
column2: Sona increasingly finds herself at odds with her family’s political allegiances. With etwahl in hand
column3: her melodies now serve not only to provide comfort
column4: but also to defend what she knows is right and just.

column1: 74;Heimerdinger;the Revered Inventor;Alien Invader Heimerdinger;Blast Zone Heimerdinger;Piltover Customs Heimerdinger;Snowmerdinger;Hazmat Heimerdinger;Dragon Trainer Heimerdinger;Pool Party Heimerdinger;;;;;;;;;Turret placement can be a deciding factor in a battle. Against most enemies turrets are best when they can support each other, but if the enemy has a lot of area of effect damage your turrets can be destroyed quickly. Placing turrets in brush can lead to a surprise attack in your favor.;The success of Electron Storm Grenade is very important to Heimerdinger's survival. The slow and stun both are capable of keeping enemies in place long enough to punish them, but it is also the first line of defense against a surprise attack.;Spreading out Hextech Micro-Rockets leads to more reliable damage and more efficiency against multiple targets, but focusing it creates the biggest impact.;;;It's better to destroy all of Heimerdinger's turrets at once with the help of creeps than to fight them one at a time.;Be wary of Heimerdinger's Upgrade!!!, as he can use it to find an answer to most trouble he gets into. A brilliant yet eccentric yordle scientist
column2: Professor Cecil B. Heimerdinger is lauded as one of the most innovative minds and esteemed inventors Piltover has ever seen. Relentless in his work to the point of neurotic obsession
column3: he is fascinated by mysteries that have confounded his contemporaries for decades
column4: and thrives on answering the universe’s most impenetrable questions. Though his theories often appear opaque and esoteric
column5: Heimerdinger believes knowledge should be shared
column6: and is devoted to teaching all who desire it.

column1: 267;Nami;the Tidecaller;Koi Nami;River Spirit Nami;Urf the Nami-tee;Deep Sea Nami;SKT T1 Nami;Program Nami;Splendid Staff Nami;Cosmic Destiny Nami;Bewitching Nami;;;;;;;Aqua Prison has a long cooldown, make sure to use it at the right moment.;Using Ebb and Flow during an engagement with enemy champions will help sway the battle in your favor.;Nami's ultimate can come in very handy for initiating on enemies who are far away.;;;Aqua Prison is a very powerful ability with a long cooldown, take advantage of the situation if Nami misses this ability.;Tidal Wave has a very long range but travels slowly, be aware of when it is coming your way as you can move out of its path.;Try to avoid fighting an opponent affected by Tidecaller's Blessing, it lasts a short duration so waiting it out can help you greatly.;;Support;Mage;Mana;4;3;7;5;490.0;74;365.0;43.0;335;29;4.0;30.0;0.5;550;5.5;0.55;11.5;0.4;51.0;3.1;2.61;0.644;Aqua Prison;Sends a bubble to a target area, dealing damage and stunning all enemies on impact.;Ebb and Flow;Unleashes a stream of water that bounces back and forth between allied and enemy champions, healing allies and damaging enemies.;Tidecaller's Blessing;Empowers an allied champion for a short duration. The ally's basic attacks and spells deal bonus magic damage and slow the target.;Tidal Wave;Summons a massive Tidal Wave that knocks up, slows, and damages enemies. Allies hit gain double the effect of Surging Tides.;Surging Tides;When Nami's Abilities hit allied champions they gain Movement Speed for a short duration.;
A headstrong young vastaya of the seas
column2: Nami uses her mystical Tidecaller staff to reshape the tides and defend her fellow Marai from danger. The first of her kind to leave the ocean and venture onto dry land
column3: Nami faces the unthinkable with grit
column4: determination
column5: and daring mettle.

column1: In the seas to the west of Mount Targon dwells a tribe of vastaya known as the Marai. Long ago
column2: these mermadic creatures discovered a rift in the depths. The rift bore a horrible
column3: creeping darkness which sought to exterminate all forms of life.

column1: At the center of their village
column2: the Marai placed a glowing rock known as a moonstone
column3: which is said to be infused with the celestial magic of the heavens. Its haunting
column4: ethereal light protects the Marai from the creatures that crawl from the abyss. Every hundred years or so
column5: the moonstone’s light begins to dim. At that moment
column6: the tribe chooses their fiercest warrior and bestows upon them the title of Tidecaller.

column1: The Tidecaller must plunge into the icy darkness of the rift
column2: survive the horrors within and retrieve an abyssal pearl. If successful
column3: the Tidecaller rises to shore where a luminous wanderer from Targon’s peak awaits with a moonstone to trade for the pearl. It is an arduous ritual that holds the fate of many in its illusive hands
column4: but the exchange has kept the creatures of the dark contained. In the past
column5: the Marai had sent troops of their most elite warriors to collect the pearl
column6: but they learned the more forces they sent into the rift
column7: the stronger the monsters became
column8: as if it fed on their energy. While an army would be annihilated by the abominations below
column9: a single scout – armed with a legendary Marai staff capable of controlling the tides – could potentially elude the dangers of the deep long enough to escape with the pearl.

column1: Nami had always wanted to be the Tidecaller
column2: but she was impulsive and young. A fierce fighter
column3: she was known amongst the Marai for her stubborn determination
column4: which often got her in trouble. In Nami’s adolescence
column5: the moonstone once again dimmed for the first time in a century. Nami attempted the trial of the Tidecaller. Due to her impulsiveness
column6: however
column7: the elders chose Rasha
column8: a prudent warrior known for his level head in battle
column9: as their Tidecaller.

column1: Rasha dove into the depths of the abyss. A week passed
column2: then another. An entire month the Marai waited for their Tidecaller’s return
column3: but there was no sign of Rasha. No Tidecaller had ever failed to return.

column1: The elders waited and argued while the moonstone grew faint
column2: but Nami knew SOMEONE had to take up the mantle of Tidecaller soon
column3: or all would be lost.

column1: It might as well be her.
Nami grabbed her mother’s bathystaff and plunged into the abyss. After several days
column2: she returned with the pearl
column3: the fallen Tidecaller’s staff
column4: and a look of quiet horror in her eyes. Though furious at her impertinence
column5: the village elders nonetheless admired Nami’s bravery and officially designated her Tidecaller. Nami ascended to the surface and rode the tide to shore to meet the landwalker.

column1: The stonebearer
column2: however
column3: was nowhere to be found. Instead
column4: an elderly woman waited on the beach.

column1: The woman
column2: whose grandparents bore witness to the last Tidecaller exchange
column3: explained that there was no moonstone. The Aspect of the Moon was the only being who could conjure a moonstone
column4: but she had fled Targon.

column1: Nami was unwilling to accept this. She vowed to find the Aspect and retrieve the moonstone. The lives of her people depended on it.
Using the power of the mystical Tidecaller staff to summon a perpetual pool of moving water beneath her fins
column2: Nami took to land to continue her quest.

column1: Determined
column2: the Tidecaller swam into a brand new world.

Lux's next attack ignites the energy, dealing bonus magic damage (depending on Lux's level) to the target.;
Luxanna Crownguard hails from Demacia
column2: an insular realm where magical abilities are viewed with fear and suspicion. Able to bend light to her will
column3: she grew up dreading discovery and exile
column4: and was forced to keep her power secret in order to preserve her family’s noble status. Nonetheless
column5: Lux’s optimism and resilience have led her to embrace her unique talents
column6: and she now seeks to bring greater tolerance and understanding to her homeland.

column1: Luxanna—or Lux
column2: as she prefers to be called—grew up in the Demacian city of High Silvermere
column3: along with her older brother Garen. They were born to the prestigious Crownguard family
column4: which had served for generations as protectors of the kings of Demacia. Their grandfather saved the king’s life at the Battle of Storm’s Fang
column5: and their aunt Tianna was named commander of the elite Dauntless Vanguard regiment before Lux was born.

column1: Garen took to his family’s role with fervor
column2: joining the military when he was still little more than a boy. Lux
column3: in his absence
column4: was expected to help run the family’s many estates—a task she resented
column5: even as a young child. She wanted to explore the world
column6: to see what lay beyond the walls and borders of Demacia. She idolized Garen
column7: but railed against his insistence that she put her own ambitions aside.

column1: To the endless frustration of Lux’s tutors
column2: who sought to prepare her for a life of dutiful service to the Crownguard family
column3: she would question their every teaching
column4: examine differing perspectives
column5: and seek out knowledge far beyond what they were prepared for. Even so
column6: few could find it in themselves to stay angry at Lux
column7: with her zest for life and intoxicating optimism.

column1: Little did any of them know a time of change was approaching. Magic had once brought Runeterra to the brink of annihilation
column2: and Demacia had been founded as a place where such powers were forbidden. Many of the kingdom’s folktales told of pure hearts turned dark by the lure of magic. Indeed
column3: Lux and Garen’s uncle had been slain by a rogue mage some years earlier.

column1: And there were fearful whispers
column2: rumors from beyond the great mountains
column3: that magic was rising once more in the world…

column1: Riding home one fateful night
column2: Lux and her horse were attacked by a ravenous sabrewulf pack. In a moment of fear and desperation
column3: the young girl let loose a torrent of magical light from deep within her
column4: routing the beasts but leaving her shivering in fear. Magic
column5: the terror of Demacian myths
column6: was as much a part of Lux as her Crownguard lineage.

column1: Fear and doubt gnawed at her. Would she become evil? Was she an abomination
column2: to be imprisoned or exiled? At the very least
column3: if her powers were discovered
column4: it would see the Crownguard name disgraced forever.

column1: With Garen spending more time away from High Silvermere
column2: Lux found herself alone in the halls of their family home. Still
column3: over time
column4: she became more familiar with her magic
column5: and her sleepless nights—fists clenched
column6: willing her inner light to fade—became fewer and fewer. She began experimenting in secret
column7: playing with sunbeams in the courtyards
column8: bending them into solid form
column9: and even creating tiny
column10: glowing figures in her palm. She resolved to keep it a secret
column11: as much as she could.

column1: When she was sixteen
column2: Lux traveled with her parents Pieter and Augatha to their formal residence in the Great City of Demacia
column3: to witness Garen’s investiture into the honored ranks of the Dauntless Vanguard.

column1: The city dazzled Lux. It was a monument to the noble ideals of the kingdom
column2: with every citizen protected and cared for; and it was there that Lux learned of the Illuminators
column3: a charitable religious order working to help the sick and the poor. Between her family’s courtly engagements
column4: she became close with a knight of the order named Kahina
column5: who also taught Lux more martial skills
column6: sparring and training with her in the gardens of the Crownguard manor.

column1: Spending more time in the capital
column2: Lux has finally begun to learn about the wider world—its diversity
column3: and its history. She now understands that the Demacian way of life is not the only way
column4: and with clear eyes she can see her love for her homeland standing alongside her desire to see it made more just… and perhaps a little more accepting of mages like her.

column1: An Ionian of deep resolve
column2: Yasuo is an agile swordsman
column3: trained to wield the air itself against his enemies. As a young man
column4: pride led him down a path of loss
column5: costing him his position
column6: his mentor
column7: and ultimately his own brother. Disgraced by false accusations and now hunted as little more than a criminal
column8: Yasuo wanders his homeland seeking redemption for his past
column9: with only the wind to guide his blade.

column1: As a child
column2: Yasuo often believed what the others in his village said of him: on the best days
column3: his very existence was an error in judgement; on the worst
column4: he was a mistake that could never be undone.

column1: Like most pain
column2: there was some truth to it. His mother was a widow already raising a young son
column3: when the man who would be Yasuo’s father blew into her life like an autumn wind. And
column4: just like that lonely season
column5: he was gone again before the blanket of Ionian winter settled over the small family.

column1: Even though Yasuo’s older half-brother
column2: Yone
column3: was everything Yasuo was not—respectful
column4: cautious
column5: conscientious—the two were inseparable. When other children teased Yasuo
column6: Yone was there to defend him. But what Yasuo lacked in patience
column7: he made up for in determination. When Yone began his apprenticeship at the village’s renowned sword school
column8: a young Yasuo followed
column9: waiting outside in monsoon rain
column10: until the teachers relented and opened the gates.

column1: Much to the annoyance of his new peers
column2: Yasuo showed natural talent
column3: and became the only student in several generations to catch the attention of Elder Souma
column4: last master of the legendary wind technique. The old man saw Yasuo’s potential
column5: but like trying to bridle a whirlwind
column6: this pupil was known to ignore most teaching. Yone pleaded with his brother to set aside his arrogance
column7: gifting him a maple seed
column8: the school’s highest lesson in humility. The next morning
column9: Yasuo accepted the position as Souma’s apprentice
column10: and personal bodyguard.

column1: When word of the Noxian invasion reached the school
column2: some were inspired by the great stand that had been taken at the Placidium of Navori
column3: and soon the village was bled of the able bodied. Yasuo longed to add his sword to the cause
column4: but even as his classmates and brother left to fight
column5: he was ordered to remain and protect the elders.

column1: The invasion became a war. Finally
column2: one rain-slicked night
column3: the drums of a Noxian march could be heard in the next valley over. Yasuo abandoned his post
column4: foolishly believing he could turn the tide.

column1: But he found no battle—only a raw grave for hundreds of Noxian and Ionian corpses. Something terrible and unnatural had happened here
column2: something that no single blade could have stopped. The land itself seemed tainted by it.

column1: Sobered
column2: Yasuo returned to the school the next day
column3: only to be surrounded by the remaining students
column4: their swords drawn. Elder Souma was dead
column5: and Yasuo found himself accused not only of dereliction
column6: but of murder. He realized the true killer would go unpunished if he did not act quickly
column7: so he fought his way free
column8: though he knew this would all but confirm his apparent guilt.

column1: Now a fugitive in war-torn Ionia
column2: Yasuo sought any clue that might lead him to the murderer. All the while
column3: he was hunted by his former allies
column4: continually forced to fight or die. This was a price he was willing to pay
column5: until he was tracked down by the one he dreaded most—his own brother
column6: Yone.

column1: Bound by honor
column2: they circled each other. When their swords finally met
column3: Yone was no match and
column4: with a single flash of steel
column5: Yasuo cut his brother down.

column1: He begged forgiveness
column2: but Yone’s dying words were of the wind techniques responsible for Elder Souma’s death
column3: and that his brother was the only one who could have known them. Then he fell silent
column4: passing on before he could grant any absolution.

column1: Without master or brother
column2: Yasuo wandered the mountains distraught
column3: drinking away the pain of war and loss
column4: a sword without a sheath. There in the snow
column5: he met Taliyah
column6: a young Shuriman stone mage who had fled the Noxian military. In her
column7: Yasuo saw an unlikely student
column8: and in himself
column9: an even more unlikely teacher. He trained her in the ways of elemental magic
column10: wind shaping stone
column11: embracing at last the teachings of Elder Souma.

column1: Their world changed with rumors of a risen Shuriman god-emperor. Yasuo and Taliyah parted ways
column2: though he gifted her the treasured maple seed
column3: its lesson now learned.

column1: As she returns to her native desert sands
column2: Yasuo has set out for his own village
column3: determined to put right his mistakes...

Abandoning the Kinkou Order and her title of the Fist of Shadow
column2: Akali now strikes alone
column3: ready to be the deadly weapon her people need. Though she holds onto all she learned from her master Shen
column4: she has pledged to defend Ionia from its enemies
column5: one kill at a time. Akali may strike in silence
column6: but her message will be heard loud and clear: fear the assassin with no master.

column1: Ionia has always been a land of wild magic
column2: its vibrant people and powerful spirits seeking to live in harmony… but sometimes this peaceful equilibrium does not come easily. Sometimes it needs to be kept in check.

column1: The Kinkou are the self-appointed keepers of Ionia’s sacred balance. The order’s loyal acolytes walk the spirit and material realms
column2: mediating conflicts between them and
column3: when necessary
column4: intervening by force. Born among their ranks was Akali
column5: daughter of Mayym Jhomen Tethi
column6: the renowned Fist of Shadow. Mayym and her partner Tahno raised their daughter within the Kinkou Order
column7: under the watchful leadership of Great Master Kusho
column8: the Eye of Twilight.

column1: Whenever her parents were called away
column2: other members of the order stepped in as Akali’s surrogate family. Kennen
column3: the Heart of the Tempest
column4: spent many hours with the young girl
column5: teaching her shuriken techniques
column6: and emphasizing speed and agility over strength. Akali was a precocious child
column7: and soaked up the knowledge like a sponge. It became clear to all that she would follow her parents’ path—along with the Great Master’s son and appointed successor Shen
column8: she would lead a new generation dedicated to preserving Ionia’s balance.

column1: But balance can be fleeting. The order found itself divided.
A wayward acolyte named Zed returned
column2: and clashed violently with Kusho
column3: wresting power in a bloody coup. Akali fled into the eastern mountains along with Mayym
column4: Shen
column5: Kennen
column6: and a handful of other acolytes. Sadly
column7: Tahno was not among them.

column1: Zed’s transformation of the Kinkou into the merciless Order of Shadow was almost complete. But
column2: as the new Eye of Twilight
column3: Shen intended to rebuild what had been lost. They would return to the Kinkou’s three fundamental philosophies: the pure impartiality of Watching the Stars
column4: the passage of judgment in Coursing the Sun
column5: and the elimination of imbalance by Pruning the Tree. Even though they were now few
column6: they would train neophytes to restore and grow their numbers once more.

column1: When Akali came of age at fourteen
column2: she formally entered her Kinkou training
column3: determined to succeed her mother as the new Fist of Shadow.

column1: She was a prodigious fighter
column2: and mastered the kama and kunai—a handheld sickle and throwing dagger. Though she did not possess the magical abilities of many of her fellow acolytes
column3: she proved to all she was worthy of the title
column4: in time allowing her mother to step down and help mentor the younger neophytes.

column1: But Akali’s soul was restless
column2: and her eyes were open. Though the Kinkou and the Order of Shadow had come to an uneasy accord in the wake of the Noxian invasion of Ionia
column3: she saw that her homeland continued to suffer. She questioned whether they were truly fulfilling their purpose. Pruning the Tree was meant to eliminate those who threatened the sacred balance... yet Shen would always urge restraint.

column1: He was holding her back. All the mantras and meditations could quiet her spirit
column2: but such platitudes would not defeat their adversaries. Her youthful precociousness turned to outright disobedience. She argued with Shen
column3: she defied him
column4: and she took down Ionia’s enemies her way.

column1: In front of the whole order
column2: she declared the impotence of the Kinkou
column3: all its talk of spiritual balance and patience accomplishing little. Ionians were dying in the material realm
column4: and that was the realm Akali would defend. She was trained as an assassin. She was going to be an assassin. She did not need the order anymore.

column1: Shen let her go without a fight
column2: knowing this was a path that Akali must walk alone. Perhaps that path would bring her back one day
column3: but that would be for her to decide.

She can activate the spell again to release the storm. On release this storm will fly towards the direction it was cast in, dealing damage and knocking away any enemies in its path.;Zephyr;Janna summons an air elemental that passively increases her Move Speed and enables her to pass through units. She may also activate this ability to deal damage and slow an enemy's Move Speed. After the storm has settled, soothing winds heal nearby allies while the ability is active.;Tailwind;Janna passively gains bonus Move Speed, and nearby allied champions gain this bonus when moving toward her.Additionally, Janna's basic attacks cause additional magic damage based on her bonus Move Speed.;
Armed with the power of Runeterra’s gales
column2: Janna is a mysterious
column3: elemental wind spirit who protects the dispossessed of Zaun. Some believe she was brought into existence by the pleas of Runeterra’s sailors who prayed for fair winds as they navigated treacherous waters and braved rough tempests. Her favor and protection has since been called into the depths of Zaun
column4: where Janna has become a beacon of hope to those in need. No one knows where or when she will appear
column5: but more often than not
column6: she’s come to help.

column1: Many of Runeterra’s sailors have strange and unusual superstitions
column2: which is no wonder as they often live or die by the tempestuous whims of the weather. Some captains insist on pouring salt onto the deck so the sea doesn’t notice they’re from the shore. Others make sure to throw the first fish they catch back into the water as a show of mercy. It’s not surprising
column3: then
column4: that most implore the wind itself for steadfast breezes
column5: calm seas
column6: and clear skies.

column1: Many believe the spirit Janna was born out of these prayers.
She started small. Seafarers would sometimes spot a bright blue bird just before a healthy tailwind billowed their sails. Others could swear they’d hear a whistling in the air right before a storm
column2: as if to warn them of its approach. As word of these benevolent omens spread
column3: sightings of the bird grew more common. Some swore they had seen the bird transform into a woman. With tapered ears and flowing hair
column4: this mysterious maiden was said to float above the water and direct the wind with a flick of her staff.

column1: Seafarers created ramshackle shrines of seasparrow bones and shining oyster shells which they tucked into the bows of their ships. The more successful vessels built their shrines as figureheads on their masts
column2: hoping their more ostentatious displays of faith would be rewarded with even better winds.

column1: Eventually
column2: Runeterra’s seamen agreed upon a name for this wind spirit: “Janna
column3: ” an ancient Shuriman word meaning “guardian.” As more sailors came to believe in Janna and made increasingly elaborate offerings to gain her favor
column4: she grew ever stronger. Janna helped explorers traverse new waters
column5: blew ships from treacherous reefs
column6: and – on particularly starless nights – wrapped the comfort of a warm breeze around a homesick sailor's shoulders. For those sailing with ill intent – pirates
column7: raiders
column8: and the like – Janna was sometimes said to blow them off course with sudden squalls and storms.

column1: Janna took great joy in her work. Whether helping people or punishing the deserving
column2: she felt happy to watch over Runeterra’s oceans.

column1: For as long as Janna could remember
column2: a single isthmus separated the western and eastern oceans of Valoran. In order to move from the west to the east
column3: or from the east to the west
column4: ships would have to brave the long
column5: incredibly dangerous waters around the tip of the southern continent. Most ships subsequently made offerings to Janna for strong winds that would expedite their perilous journey around the rocky coast.

column1: The city fathers of the bustling trade city on the isthmus’s coast tired of watching ships make the long trek around the southern continent
column2: which could often take many months. They hired the most innovative scientists to use the rich chemical resources recently discovered in the area to create a massive waterway that would unite Valoran’s major seas.

column1: Word of the canal spread like a pox amongst sailors. Such a passage would open up boundless trade opportunities
column2: allow for easier passage through dangerous waters
column3: reduce time at sea and introduce the transportation of perishable goods. It would bring the east to the west
column4: the west to the east
column5: and above all: it would bring change.

column1: With the canal in place
column2: sailors wouldn’t need Janna’s winds to keep their ships safe from Valoran’s cliffs. They wouldn’t need to build elaborate shrines or watch the stormy horizon for bluebirds. Their ships’ safety and speed no longer depended on an unpredictable deity
column3: but the ingenuity of man. And so
column4: as construction progressed over the decades
column5: Janna fell out of favor. Her shrines grew ragged
column6: picked apart by gulls
column7: and seldom was her name whispered
column8: even as the waters grew sharp and choppy with winter.

column1: Janna felt herself weaken and her powers fade. When she tried to summon a squall
column2: she’d only conjure a light draft. If she transformed into her bird form
column3: she could only fly for a few minutes before needing to rest. She’d meant so much to those at sea only a few years prior – was this how easily they could forget someone who just wanted to keep them safe and honor their prayers? Janna was saddened by her slow decline into irrelevance and as the canal reached completion
column4: all that remained of her was a faded breeze.

column1: The opening of the canal was a joyful celebration. Thousands of chemtech devices were placed across the isthmus. The city fathers gathered for the ceremonial igniting of the charge as travelers from all over the world watched and waited
column2: smiles on their faces and pride in their hearts.

column1: The devices activated. Chemical fogs of molten rock bloomed. Booms echoed through the isthmus.
The cliff faces began to crack. The ground began to shake. Those assembled heard a roar of water and a hiss of gas.
That is when the screaming started.
In the years to come
column2: no one would know the exact cause of the disaster. Some said it was the instability of the chem bombs
column3: while others argued it was a miscalculation by the engineers. Whatever the cause
column4: the explosions caused a chain reaction of earthquakes that shook the isthmus to its core. Entire districts collapsed into the ocean
column5: and nearly half of the city’s denizens suddenly found themselves fighting for their lives against the clashing currents of the western and eastern seas.

column1: As thousands sank beneath the tides
column2: they begged for help
column3: praying for someone to save them. They called out for the name that
column4: until recently
column5: their hearts had always beckoned in times of great danger on the high seas:

column1: Janna.
Struck by a sudden surge of desperate pleas for aid
column2: Janna felt herself materialize with greater power than she’d ever felt before.

column1: Many of those who had fallen into the water had already drowned
column2: but as clouds of toxic chem-gas leaked from cracks in the streets
column3: poisoning and suffocating the hundreds of people unlucky enough to breathe them
column4: Janna knew how to help.

column1: She disappeared into the bleak
column2: billowing gas
column3: its acrid grasp overwhelming the helpless victims of the great canal’s birth. Holding her staff high
column4: she closed her eyes as wind swirled around her
column5: the vortex so powerful that those who had summoned her feared they might be swallowed whole or ripped to pieces. Her staff glowed a brighter and brighter blue until she finally slammed it down
column6: blowing the gas away in one ferocious burst of air. Those who had summoned Janna caught their breath and looked upon the woman who had saved them
column7: vowing never to forget her again.

column1: With that
column2: a gust of wind blew through the streets
column3: and Janna was gone… though some swore they saw a bright blue bird make a nest high atop the iron and glass spires overlooking the city.

column1: Years after the city called Zaun was repaired and the shining town of Piltover was built above it
column2: Janna’s name endures in countless stories that tell of the wandering wind spirit who appears in times of great need. When the Zaun Gray grows thick
column3: some say Janna blows it away
column4: then vanishes as quickly as she came. When a Chem-Baron’s thug goes too far or a victim’s screams go unanswered
column5: a fearsome torrent of wind might sweep through the alley and aid those who others are unwilling to help.

column1: Some say Janna is a myth: an optimistic fairy tale that Zaun’s most desperate tell themselves to bring an ounce of hope to their hour of need. Others – the ones who think of Janna when the wind whistles through narrow corridors of the city or huddle around handmade shrines (now crafted of scrap and gearworks rather than bird bones) – know better. When the gust rattles the shutters and blows the laundry off the line
column2: Janna is surely in the air. Every Progress Day
column3: no matter how cold the weather
column4: the believers throw open their windows and doors so Janna can blow away the stale air of the year past and welcome the new. Even skeptics can’t help but feel their spirits lift when they spy a curious blue bird swooping through the streets of Zaun. Though none can be sure when
column5: how
column6: or if Janna will appear
column7: most everyone can agree on one thing: it’s nice to have somebody watching over you.

column1: 147;Seraphine;the Starry-Eyed Songstress;K/DA ALL OUT Seraphine Indie;K/DA ALL OUT Seraphine Rising Star;K/DA ALL OUT Seraphine Superstar;Graceful Phoenix Seraphine;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Mage;Support;Mana;0;0;0;0;500.0;90;440.0;40.0;325;19;3.0;30.0;0.5;525;6.5;0.6;8.0;1.0;55.0;3.0;1.0;0.669;High Note;Seraphine deals damage in an area.;Surround Sound;Seraphine Shields and Hastes nearby allies. If she is already Shielded she will Heal nearby allies as well.;Beat Drop;Seraphine deals damage and impairs the movement of enemies in a line.;Encore;Seraphine deals damage and charms enemies hit, refreshing the range with every allied or enemy champion hit.;Stage Presence;Every third basic spell will cast twice from Seraphine. Additionally, casting spells near allies grants her bonus magic damage and range on her next basic attack.;
Born in Piltover to Zaunite parents
column2: Seraphine can hear the souls of others—the world sings to her
column3: and she sings back. Though these sounds overwhelmed her in her youth
column4: she now draws on them for inspiration
column5: turning the chaos into a symphony. She performs for the sister cities to remind their citizens that they’re not alone
column6: that they’re stronger together
column7: and that
column8: in her eyes
column9: their potential is limitless.

column1: In Piltover
column2: where anyone’s dream can become everyone’s progress
column3: a star is born.

column1: As a child
column2: Seraphine always loved music
column3: especially her father’s lullabies. The songs were beautiful
column4: but sad. He’d brought them up to Piltover as he and Seraphine’s mother—two lifelong Zaunites—sought a better life in the City of Progress.

column1: Leaning out the window of their hexcoustics workshop
column2: where broken sound tech was made to play again
column3: Seraphine sang along with the streets. The shanties of the Sun Gates
column4: the whistling of apprentices
column5: even the melody of conversation—in a bustling city like Piltover
column6: she was never alone.

column1: Over time
column2: Seraphine realized she could sense songs too private
column3: too personal
column4: for any ordinary person to hear. And as she grew
column5: so did the intensity of her gifts. She heard every person’s soul
column6: loving or cruel—turning the streets she’d once loved into an overwhelming cacophony of conflicting desires. How could she make sense of the voices if none of them harmonized? Some days
column7: she hid shivering in a corner
column8: hands over her ears
column9: unable to hear herself above the chaos.

column1: Seraphine’s parents had left everything behind so she could be born in Piltover; they couldn’t bear seeing her struggle. Scraping together their savings to purchase a shard of a rare hextech crystal
column2: they crafted a device that dampened her magical hearing. For the first time in years
column3: there was silence.

column1: Within that quiet
column2: though
column3: Seraphine heard something—someone. The crystal had a consciousness
column4: born of brackern blood. Though hard to hear
column5: and harder to comprehend
column6: the voice was kind. In a hymn of distant deserts and ancient conflicts of ancestors
column7: a thousand years of history sang in unison.

column1: Seraphine
column2: awed
column3: asked for guidance. Overwhelmed by the yearnings around her
column4: she worried she may have no song of her own. What if she was merely the voices of others?

column1: “We are all forged through others’ voices
column2: ” the presence sang back.

column1: And slowly
column2: she learned to manage the noise. The voice rarely spoke clearly
column3: but Seraphine felt its influence as it helped her understand how to resonate with a crowd
column4: to sing with them
column5: using her dampener less each day. The first time she performed in front of an audience
column6: testing her skills
column7: she was nervous beyond words. But she kept singing
column8: and the crowds swelled. Soon
column9: the biggest venues in Piltover had Seraphine’s fans spilling into the streets. Still
column10: something was missing—in the crowds
column11: and in herself. She resolved to seek perspective in the city her parents had worked so hard to leave: Zaun.

column1: The first time she rode the clanging lift down
column2: Seraphine felt somehow at home but still a stranger. In Zaun
column3: she heard refrains of resilience and ambition much like above
column4: yet with a thrum of freedom that was all their own. But as she spent more time below
column5: she also sensed pain. Fear of the chem-barons who controlled every opportunity. Hatred of the spoiled
column6: arrogant Pilties above. There was so much discord. She began to perform
column7: and listened to these new crowds
column8: their hearts singing their struggles. The two cities were divided by more than simple misunderstanding. She wanted to mend
column9: to unite. But she kept hearing the same refrain: “It’s not that simple in Zaun.”

column1: Eventually
column2: Piltover started to feel less like home.

column1: Her hextech crystal had sung an elegy of what hatred left unchecked could accomplish. Seraphine couldn’t let that happen to the cities she loved. Persuading her parents to help
column2: she dismantled her dampener
column3: and together
column4: they gave the crystal a new home in its opposite—a platform that would amplify her gifts
column5: not repress them
column6: allowing her to hear others in all their complexity. Seraphine hoped the crystal’s voice would be among them. She rode this platform down as a stage of sorts
column7: stepping out onto the Entresol between Piltover and Zaun. As the crowds gathered and the lights dazzled
column8: she heard citizens from both worlds
column9: mingled together to hear her.

column1: This was a new song. Not just understanding—unity.
It wasn’t perfect. It might never be. But her voice mattered. And so
column2: Seraphine realized
column3: maybe she could help others find their voice
column4: too.

column1: Seraphine has become the premier star in both Piltover and Zaun. Empowered by her gifts and her hextech
column2: she amplifies the voices of all with a fresh force of optimism
column3: because to her
column4: everyone deserves to be heard—especially those who are struggling. They inspire her
column5: and she will do her best to inspire them in return.

Once a member of Icathia’s governing council
column2: Zilean is a prodigious elemental mage who seeks mastery over time itself. After using his powers in an attempt to save his people from the Void
column3: he now drifts through the past
column4: present
column5: and future
column6: bending and warping the flow of time around him. Zilean has traveled from Runeterra’s mysterious creation
column7: all the way to its seemingly inevitable ending
column8: searching tirelessly for any strand of fate that might undo his homeland’s destruction.

column1: Icathia
column2: most desolate and cursed of lands
column3: was not always so. Theirs was a rich and diverse civilization
column4: ruled by benevolent Axamuk
column5: last of the Mage Kings of old. As the Shuriman empire expanded across the continent
column6: Axamuk’s calls for peaceful coexistence were ignored
column7: and his armies destroyed by the god-warriors of the Ascended Host.

column1: Though humbled by this defeat
column2: many Icathians saw an opportunity for mutual advancement. Accepting an offer of autonomous satrapy
column3: they installed a governing council of distinguished mages
column4: philosophers
column5: and lawmakers to oversee the transition of power.

column1: After almost nine centuries of imperial rule
column2: a young man named Zilean joined the council’s ranks. He was an elemental mage with a prodigious understanding of physical reality
column3: who had studied under the greatest minds of the age—from the great Yun of Ixtal
column4: to the astromancers of Faraj
column5: and countless others besides.

column1: There was one component of the material realm that few had ever truly grasped
column2: but Zilean was determined to master.

column1: Time.
Time was the one inescapable constant
column2: in all things. Even the mighty god-warriors were not immune to its passage… though they were revered above all others in Shuriman culture.

column1: As part of the political establishment
column2: Zilean now saw more clearly the smoldering discontent among the citizens of Icathia. While their land was home to some of the most heroic leaders and revolutionary thinkers in the empire
column3: not one had ever been deemed worthy of Ascension. Again and again
column4: the council submitted petitions to the distant emperor
column5: yet access to the Sun Disc was denied
column6: without explanation. For all they gave
column7: it seemed Icathians would never be seen as equals.

column1: Zilean’s own resentment grew
column2: yet he was worried by open talk of secession among his peers. He was a patriot through and through
column3: but in the face of the Ascended Host
column4: any rebellion could only end in calamity for his people. Seeking a diplomatic solution
column5: he went as an envoy to neighboring Kahleek
column6: Kalduga
column7: and Ixtal. He had made many allies in his lifetime
column8: and he implored them to stand with Icathia.

column1: Each time
column2: the answer was the same. They would not defy Shurima. If Zilean’s people wanted to
column3: they would do so alone.

column1: Returning home
column2: he was shocked to find the council had decided to crown a new Mage King. Breathlessly
column3: joyously
column4: they told Zilean of the ancient and forbidden power they had discovered—a power so great
column5: it would all but guarantee Icathia’s victory.

column1: They told Zilean of the power of the Void.
He looked to these reasoned
column2: wise Icathians
column3: but saw only madness in their eyes. As much as it grieved him
column4: Zilean would rather his homeland’s revolution be crushed
column5: than to let this abomination be set loose.

column1: Zilean’s worst fears proved true. Once unleashed in battle
column2: the Void overwhelmed the mages attempting to control it
column3: and Icathia was doomed.

column1: As he tried to escape the capital
column2: the ground shook. Buildings toppled. Such horrors as had no place in this world or the next erupted from the depths
column3: driving terrified citizens before them.

column1: They were trapped. Hundreds of thousands of innocents would die. In desperation
column2: Zilean urged as many as he could to take refuge in his tower
column3: and did the impossible.

column1: He removed the entire structure from time.
Crashing to the cold floor
column2: his power spent
column3: Zilean looked at the frozen figures all around him. The Void was halted
column4: but only within those walls—outside
column5: where Icathia once stood
column6: there was nothing.

column1: Zilean had spent decades trying to comprehend the mysteries of time and causality
column2: and it seemed only he could move freely back and forth within the anomaly he had somehow created. These people had been saved
column3: true enough. He just didn’t know how to undo what he had done to achieve it. Through deep meditations and esoteric devices of his own design
column4: he began to divine the strands of past and present that led to this moment
column5: gradually learning how to move back and forth along them
column6: looking for a future where his efforts had already succeeded…

column1: It was there that he found the true threat: the end of everything. The great unmaking that awaits Runeterra.
Effectively
column2: Zilean now exists everywhere
column3: and always has. Even so
column4: he is only too aware of the consequences of trying to bring about change in the world and sparking other unexpected destinies—often conflicting
column5: and almost always more dangerous. Perhaps if he can find a way to save his own people
column6: then the greater disaster might also be averted.

column1: The only question is
column2: what might he be willing to sacrifice along the way?

Born in an ancient
column2: sorcerous catastrophe
column3: Zyra is the wrath of nature given form—an alluring hybrid of plant and human
column4: kindling new life with every step. She views the many mortals of Valoran as little more than prey for her seeded progeny
column5: and thinks nothing of slaying them with flurries of deadly spines. Though her true purpose has not been revealed
column6: Zyra wanders the world
column7: indulging her most primal urges to colonize
column8: and strangle all other life from it.

column1: Zyra’s memory is long
column2: and runs as deep as the roots of the earth. Her kind was young when the Rune Wars raged
column3: when mortal armies fought one another for the very keys of creation.

column1: Hidden in the jungles south of Kumungu
column2: somewhere between the great rivers that divide eastern Shurima
column3: lay the fabled Gardens of Zyr. Elemental magics had turned the soil there in strange and unpredictable ways
column4: giving rise to fierce
column5: carnivorous plants that preyed upon any creature that strayed within reach. They infested and they devoured
column6: caring nothing for the squabbles of mortals
column7: content merely to coil their vines through the forests and swamplands. In their own way
column8: they were all Zyra… and nourishment was plentiful
column9: even in the midst of war.

column1: A small company of soldiers
column2: their allegiance long since lost to time
column3: advanced through those lands in search of some now-forgotten prize. They were led by an ambitious sorceress—but they were far from home
column4: bound to succumb to the noxious fumes and spores of that accursed place.

column1: The denizens of the Gardens set upon them
column2: spined tendrils lashing through armor and flesh with sadistic ease. Though they fought valiantly
column3: the warriors knew they could not hold out long
column4: and turned to their sorceress to save them. Gathering her powers
column5: she wrought a mighty blast. The air burned with runic symbols
column6: casting their eerie light even as the thorny overgrowth closed in.

column1: In that very instant
column2: a rogue spark ignited the gases of the swamp
column3: and the resulting magical explosion obliterated every living thing for miles around. Of the scattered survivors of the Rune Wars
column4: none would ever know what fate had befallen the Gardens of Zyr.

column1: Centuries passed. The land where the battle had been fought lay empty and lifeless above ground… but in the depths
column2: something stirred. Long had the energies that were unleashed there settled
column3: and curdled
column4: nourished by the fallout. A seedpod bulged
column5: pulsing with unnatural life
column6: until a creature clawed its way free
column7: gasping and confused.

column1: It beheld a broken and changed world
column2: brimming with new vitality and new ideas. Its mind was a puzzle of conflicting memories
column3: drawn from the loamy earth and forced into its fledgling consciousness. It could recall the warmth of the sun
column4: the taste of rain
column5: words of power
column6: and the agony of a hundred mortal deaths.

column1: It—she—called herself Zyra
column2: without quite understanding why.

column1: As she ventured out into the wildlands beyond her birthplace
column2: Zyra knew she was different from other creatures she encountered. Mortals were fearful and unpleasant things
column3: while more ethereal entities tended to be capricious
column4: or arrogant. None of them seemed to respect the realms they inhabited
column5: despoiling everything with their mere presence
column6: and that filled Zyra with rage and contempt. Almost unbidden
column7: new life sprang up in her footsteps—voracious plant forms that changed and evolved beneath her gaze
column8: hurling poisonous barbs or sprouting fresh tendrils at an alarming rate.

column1: Unrooted and free to wander
column2: Zyra and her deadly progeny feed
column3: and grow
column4: strangling all other life from the world. She has blighted farmland
column5: overrun entire settlements
column6: and crushed those warriors brave or foolish enough to confront her
column7: always leaving a menagerie of botanical horrors in her wake.

column1: As the rivers of Shurima begin to run anew
column2: strange flora has been sighted on their banks
column3: spreading slowly westward with each passing season. Whether pulled from the earth or purged by fire
column4: the growth does not seem to be slowing…
