If you're inside the spell, you can still move and attack.;Veigar's ultimate deals increased damage based on your missing health.;;Mage;;Mana;2;2;10;7;505.0;94;490.0;26.0;340;23;3.75;32.0;0.5;550;6.5;0.6;8.0;0.8;52.0;2.7;2.24;0.625;Baleful Strike;Veigar unleashes a bolt of dark energy that deals magic damage to the first two enemies hit. Units killed by this bolt grant Veigar some ability power permanently.;Dark Matter;Veigar calls a great mass of dark matter to fall from the sky to the target location, dealing magic damage when it lands. Stacks of Phenomenal Evil reduce Dark Matter's cooldown.;Event Horizon;Veigar twists the edges of space, creating a cage that Stuns enemies that pass through.;Primordial Burst;Blasts target enemy champion, dealing a large amount of magic damage, increasing based on the target's missing health.;Phenomenal Evil Power;Veigar is the greatest Evil to ever strike at the hearts of Runeterra - and he's only getting bigger! Striking an enemy Champion with a spell or scoring a takedown grants Veigar permanently increased Ability Power.;
An enthusiastic yordle sorcerer
column2: Veigar has embraced powers that few others dare even approach. As a free-spirited inhabitant of Bandle City
column3: he once longed to learn more of the celestial magic practiced by mortals
column4: but his natural curiosity was twisted by imprisonment in the Immortal Bastion. Now a stubborn creature with the dark fury of the stars at his command
column5: Veigar is often underestimated by others—and though he believes himself truly evil
column6: there are some who still question his deeper motivations…

column1: For most of the peoples of Runeterra
column2: yordles are not typically something to be feared. Their fabled home of Bandle City is said to be a mysterious
column3: spiritual place
column4: filled with odd trinkets and keepsakes gathered from across the material realm. While these curious creatures often leave to dwell among mortal races for a time
column5: they generally return with fresh tales and new experiences to recount.

column1: Yet
column2: sadly
column3: there are also those yordles who lose their way. Among them is the sorcerer Veigar.

column1: After the Great Darkin War left the world in ruin many centuries ago
column2: the only light that seemed to shine on Valoran came from the skies above. Scattered survivors looked to the heavens
column3: and their renewed study of ancient celestial magic piqued Veigar’s interest. Imagining himself already a master of these mystical arts
column4: the yordle joined an order of mages in the Noxii territories
column5: hoping to learn more of their craft. They did not think to question this eager newcomer
column6: and he taught them to draw hope from the patterns created by the movements of the stars.

column1: But while many toiled to rebuild the world
column2: others sought to conquer it. The brutal warlord Mordekaiser and his armies swept across the lands
column3: crushing and enslaving any who would oppose his rule
column4: and the mages of the order—unskilled in war—were of little value to this tyrant. Looming over them in his accursed battleplate
column5: his keen eye fell upon Veigar
column6: and Mordekaiser recognized the yordle for what he truly was. He snatched him up in one iron gauntlet
column7: and dragged his prize away as the other mages were put to the sword.

column1: Imprisoned in the heart of the warlord’s new
column2: monolithic fortress
column3: Veigar was forced to turn his magic to darker purposes. Knowing that yordles were craftier than any of the mortal races
column4: Mordekaiser bound Veigar to the physical plane
column5: preventing him even from escaping to Bandle City. He was not the only captive in that hellish place
column6: but such isolation was the worst and most cruel form of torture for a yordle. Veigar performed grisly enchantments against his will—some strengthening his master’s dominion
column7: others simply evoking terror for terror’s sake.

column1: Indeed
column2: terror was what seemed to fuel this dreadful empire. Miserable beyond imagining
column3: Veigar became a reluctant witness as Mordekaiser's vile deeds empowered him to near-immortality. Whether it was over the course of decades or centuries
column4: Veigar never knew
column5: but eventually the yordle’s magic and appearance started to twist in response…

column1: Memories of his past faded. Why had he come to Valoran? Where had he come from? Had he known any other life before this? Questions such as these weighed on his fragile mind
column2: like the last flickers of light before an eclipse.

column1: When the revenant warlord’s own followers conspired against him
column2: the nightmare of his reign was ended
column3: but by this point Veigar was nigh unrecognizable. His eyes blazed. Even his voice had become a sneer of malice. Fleeing from his ensorcelled cage
column4: the wretched creature had no interest in the wars of succession that inevitably followed. Deep down
column5: he most likely yearned to regain the sense of safety and freedom that all living things crave.

column1: And yet
column2: he chose not to turn away from evil
column3: but to embrace it. Clad in armor befitting a sinister warlock
column4: he vowed to seize respect in the only way he could remember—through ruthless villainy
column5: inspiring fear in all who encountered him. He would call down the fury of the stars themselves upon his foes
column6: and trap them in the timeless infinities between moments.

column1: And yet… Veigar could not quite find the same success as his former captor.
Certainly
column2: the good people of Valoran did learn to fear him
column3: to some extent. More often than not
column4: they would find their pastures scorched
column5: or the local baron’s mansion razed to its foundations. Sometimes though
column6: inexplicably
column7: bands of brigands would be driven from their woodland hideouts
column8: or the remains of feral murk wolves found scattered through the town square
column9: and it was difficult to tell whether these acts were malicious or actually reasonably helpful. For all his aspirations of evildoing
column10: it seemed Veigar would always come up a tiny bit short.

column1: Still
column2: the nefarious yordle has not abandoned his quest to become the world’s most wicked villain. With his diabolic staff in hand
column3: he seeks nothing less than to bring all before him to their knees
column4: and revels in the timely demise of those who dare to underestimate him.

column1:
150;Gnar;the Missing Link;Dino Gnar;Gentleman Gnar;Snow Day Gnar;El León Gnar;Super Galaxy Gnar;SSG Gnar;Astronaut Gnar;;;;;;;;;Managing your Rage is very important. Try to time out your transformations so you can get maximum benefit from both forms.;Position yourself next to walls to bait your enemies into getting stunned by your ultimate.;Know your strengths! Mini Gnar is fast, squishy, and has high sustained damage. Mega Gnar is slow, tough, and has high burst.;;;Gnar can't gain Rage for 15 seconds after he turns from big to little. Use this chance to engage on his team.;Gnar's animations and resource bar change as he gets closer to transforming. ;Gnar's ultimate stuns if he hits you into a wall. Be careful when fighting him near one.;;Fighter;Tank;Rage;6;5;5;8;510.0;65;100.0;0.0;335;32;2.5;30.0;0.5;175;4.5;1.75;0.0;0.0;57.0;3.0;6.0;0.625;Boomerang Throw / Boulder Toss;Gnar throws a boomerang that damages and slows enemies it hits before returning to him. If he catches the boomerang its cooldown is reduced.

Mega Gnar instead throws a boulder that stops on the first unit hit, damaging and slowing everything nearby. It can then be picked up to reduce the cooldown.;Hyper / Wallop;Gnar's attacks and spells hype him up, dealing bonus damage and granting him Movement Speed.

Mega Gnar is too enraged to be hyper and instead can rear up on his hind legs and smash down on the area in front of him, stunning enemies in an area.;Hop / Crunch;Gnar leaps to a location and bounces off the head of any unit he lands on, traveling further.

Mega Gnar is too large to bounce and instead lands with earth-shattering force, dealing damage in an area around him.;GNAR!;Mega Gnar throws everything around him in a chosen direction, dealing damage and slowing them. Any enemy that hits a wall is stunned and takes bonus damage.;Rage Gene;While in combat Gnar generates Rage. At maximum Rage his next ability will transform him into Mega Gnar, granting increased survivability and access to new spells.;
Gnar is an excitable yordle whose playful antics can erupt into a toddler’s outrage in an instant
column2: transforming him into a massive beast bent on destruction. Frozen in True Ice for millennia
column3: the curious creature broke free and now hops about a changed world he sees as exotic and wondrous. Delighted by danger
column4: Gnar flings whatever he can at his enemies
column5: be it his bonetooth boomerang... or an uprooted tree.

column1: Before the ice had given the Freljord its name
column2: there existed a land brimming with wonder—that is
column3: if one could see the world through the eyes of Gnar.

column1: A young yordle with boundless energy
column2: Gnar and others like him lived openly among the hardy tribes of the northlands. Though barely big enough to leave footprints in the snow
column3: his temper rivaled that of beasts ten times his size
column4: and he would erupt with a babble of curses the moment anything went amiss. For this reason
column5: he felt more kinship with the greater and wiser creatures
column6: who kept their distance from mortals. To Gnar
column7: they looked like overgrown
column8: white-furred yordles… and that was good enough for him.

column1: While the tribes foraged across the tundra
column2: gathering wild berries and tasty moss
column3: Gnar collected more essential items
column4: like rocks
column5: pebbles
column6: and the muddy remains of dead birds. His greatest treasure was the jawbone of a drüvask. When he tugged it from the cold earth
column7: he squealed with glee and flung it as far as he could.

column1: It landed two hops away.
Thrilled by this early success
column2: Gnar carried his “boomerang” wherever he went. The world would try its best to offer him new delights—shiny lint
column3: sweet nectar
column4: round things—but none could match the pure joy he felt in throwing and catching his cherished weapon. He now considered himself a hunter
column5: and trailed herds of wild beasts that paid him no mind.

column1: But even he could sense change coming to the land. The sky seemed darker. The winds felt colder. The mortal tribes who had once foraged together
column2: now appeared to hunt each other…

column1: The big white yordles would know what to do. Gnar would go to them.
Using all of his hunting skill
column2: he tracked them into the snow-capped peaks of a vast mountain range
column3: much farther than he had ever wandered before. As he approached unseen
column4: he also saw more mortals than he could count. This was exciting
column5: but no one else seemed too happy about it.

column1: Then the ground shook
column2: and split apart. For the first time in Gnar’s life
column3: it seemed as though everyone else was throwing tantrums. The mortals yelled. The big yordles roared.

column1: But the monster’s arrival silenced them all.
Heaving itself up from the newly opened abyss
column2: it bore huge horns
column3: whipping tentacles
column4: and a single eye
column5: burning with strange light that made the fur on Gnar’s back crawl. While some mortals fled at the sight
column6: he began to feel an odd pain in his chest—it was like the thought of losing his boomerang
column7: or never being hugged again. This horrible thing wanted to hurt his new friends.

column1: And this made him angry. In that moment
column2: Gnar truly raged.

column1: All he could see was the monster. In a flash
column2: he was in the air
column3: leaping toward it. In one paw
column4: he grasped a snowball… or so he thought. In fact
column5: it was a boulder plucked from the mountainside
column6: for Gnar had grown as large as the big white yordles. He would send this monster back where it came from
column7: by walloping its face!

column1: But the blow never landed. Gnar felt a chill colder than any winter
column2: one that seemed to turn the air itself into ice—truly
column3: this elemental magic froze him in place
column4: biting through his shaggy fur. Everything
column5: including the monster
column6: became quiet. The yordle’s strength and anger melted away. A deep tiredness crept into his limbs
column7: and he fell softly asleep.

column1: Gnar napped for a long time. When he finally awoke
column2: he shook the frost from his shoulders
column3: breathing heavily. Everyone else was gone. With no monsters to fight and no friends to protect
column4: he felt very small and alone again.

column1: The land was very different
column2: too. There was snow everywhere
column3: blanketing everything as far as his wide eyes could see. Still
column4: he let out a happy yelp when he saw his beloved boomerang lying beside him
column5: and scurried away to find something to hunt.

column1: Even now
column2: Gnar has no grasp of what took place that fateful day
column3: nor how he escaped. He simply marvels at the world before him
column4: with so many oddities to collect and places to explore.

column1:
90;Malzahar;the Prophet of the Void;Vizier Malzahar;Shadow Prince Malzahar;Djinn Malzahar;Overlord Malzahar;Snow Day Malzahar;Battle Boss Malzahar;Hextech Malzahar;Worldbreaker Malzahar;Beezahar;;;;;;;Wait to cast Void Swarm until there are nearby enemies for the Voidling to attack or kill.;Use Call of the Void and Nether Grasp to renew the duration of Malefic Visions on enemies.;Avoiding damage in lane maximizes the uptime on Void Shift, increasing Malzahar's safety dramatically.;;;When Malzahar hits a spell on enemies affected by Malefic Visions, the Visions are refreshed.;Avoid minion waves that have been affected by Malefic Visions. You never know when they may die and pass the Visions onto you.;Malzahar is especially dangerous when he has built up his Void Swarm.;;Mage;Assassin;Mana;2;2;9;6;510.0;87;375.0;27.5;335;18;3.5;30.0;0.5;500;6.0;0.6;8.0;0.8;55.0;3.0;1.5;0.625;Call of the Void;Malzahar opens up two portals to the Void. After a short delay, they fire projectiles that deal Magic Damage and silence enemy champions.;Void Swarm;Malzahar summons Voidlings to attack nearby enemies.;Malefic Visions;Malzahar infects his target's mind with cruel visions of their demise, dealing damage over time. Using Malzahar's other spells on the target will refresh the visions.

If the target dies while afflicted by the visions, they pass on to a nearby enemy unit and Malzahar gains Mana. Malzahar's Voidlings are attracted to affected units.;Nether Grasp;Malzahar channels the essence of the Void to suppress an enemy champion over a zone of damaging negative energy.;Void Shift;When he hasn't recently taken damage or been crowd controlled, Malzahar gains massive damage reduction and crowd control immunity, lingering for a short period after taking damage.;
A zealous seer dedicated to the unification of all life
column2: Malzahar truly believes the newly emergent Void to be the path to Runeterra’s salvation. In the desert wastes of Shurima
column3: he followed the voices that whispered in his mind
column4: all the way to ancient Icathia. Amidst the ruins of that land
column5: he gazed into the dark heart of the Void itself
column6: and was gifted new power and purpose. Malzahar now sees himself as a shepherd
column7: empowered to bring others into the fold… or to release the voidling creatures that dwell beneath.

column1: Beneath the glare of the Shuriman sun
column2: there have always been those blessed with the power of foresight. The only son of aging trinket peddlers
column3: Malzahar did not realize his gift until his parents had already succumbed to a wasting sickness
column4: leaving the young
column5: traumatized boy to fend for himself on the city streets of Amakra. He read fortunes in the gutter
column6: for a coin or scraps of bread.

column1: As his auguries proved more and more accurate
column2: his reputation grew. He used his second sight to predict who a curious cameleer might marry
column3: or where throwing daggers would land in games of chance at the bazaar. Soon
column4: he began to receive patrons dressed not in dirtied sandals
column5: but jeweled slippers.

column1: However
column2: for all this
column3: Malzahar could never see his own destiny. His future was hidden.

column1: Increasingly disillusioned with his success
column2: he noted the common disparities of wealth
column3: and witnessed those unhappy with their lives acting out in spiteful violence against one another. It was apparent to him that people were bound up in a never-ending cycle of pain
column4: often of their own making
column5: and no hopeful prophecy seemed able to break it. Malzahar himself soon felt nothing but a sense of emptiness
column6: finally relinquishing his mortal possessions and leaving Amakra for good.

column1: For years
column2: he roamed the land
column3: from the trackless wastes of the lesser sai to the ruins of old Shurima. By distancing himself from others
column4: he was alone with his thoughts at last. He divined not just how callous people could be
column5: but also how corrupt the world might yet become. Feverish visions began to plague his waking hours
column6: along with otherworldly whispers of war and strife
column7: and endless suffering.

column1: He wandered far
column2: until the sands turned to salt. He could not know that he had arrived in Icathia
column3: a lost city ravaged in the wars of a bygone age. There
column4: gazing into the depths of a ragged abyss
column5: Malzahar opened his unsteady mind
column6: desperate for understanding.

column1: And the Void answered.
That would have been the end of any other tale
column2: and yet somehow Malzahar endured. What lay in the darkness below brushed against the soul of the broken seer
column3: only for an instant
column4: and yet its strange and unknowable energies saturated his mind completely.

column1: The lone figure that eventually strode out of Icathia was no longer just a man
column2: but something greater. Malzahar had seen in the abyss an end to all the suffering he had witnessed in his mortal lifetime. He realized the future he had believed hidden from him all this time was in fact a vision of his true calling: to accelerate the world toward inevitable oblivion. He had to return to the people
column3: and spread word of the holy nothingness that would gladly embrace them
column4: the willing and non-believers alike. He would become the herald of the world’s salvation.

column1: Among the nomads of the deep desert
column2: he found his first disciples. Before their astonished eyes
column3: he used his new Void-given powers to rend the very earth itself
column4: summoning chittering
column5: nightmarish creatures to carry away any who dared to deny him. Within a matter of months
column6: strange rumors began to travel with the merchant caravans; rumors of men and women gladly sacrificing themselves to unseen powers
column7: and of powerful quakes opening up the bedrock of Shurima in new fault lines hundreds of miles long.

column1: In the years since
column2: Malzahar’s legend has spread even to the northern ports. As followers of “the Prophet” grow in number
column3: nearby settlers are said to experience malefic visions grasping at their hearts
column4: and fear gives rise to superstition—even the hardy villagers of the far wastes now make offerings of livestock to appease the voidling creatures below.

column1: Little do they know
column2: this only helps Malzahar in shepherding the coming of the end.

column1: 51;Caitlyn;the Sheriff of Piltover;Resistance Caitlyn;Sheriff Caitlyn;Safari Caitlyn;Arctic Warfare Caitlyn;Officer Caitlyn;Headhunter Caitlyn;Lunar Wraith Caitlyn;Pulsefire Caitlyn;Pool Party Caitlyn;Arcade Caitlyn;Arcade Caitlyn Prestige Edition;Battle Academia Caitlyn;;;;Make use of her Yordle Snap Traps by placing them pre-emptively to ensure that you'll have one off of cooldown during combat.;Avoid using Ace in the Hole in large team melees as it might be blocked by the wrong target.;Fire 90 Caliber Net away from the opponent to close the gap or hop over walls.;;;Keep behind allied minions if Caitlyn is harassing you with Piltover Peacemaker (it deals less damage with each subsequent target).;You can intercept Ace in the Hole's missile from hitting an ally if you stand in its path.;;;Marksman;;Mana;8;2;2;6;510.0;93;315.0;35.0;325;28;3.5;30.0;0.5;650;3.5;0.55;7.4;0.55;62.0;3.8;4.0;0.681;Piltover Peacemaker;Caitlyn revs up her rifle for 1 second to unleash a penetrating shot that deals physical damage (deals less damage to subsequent targets).;Yordle Snap Trap;Caitlyn sets a trap to find sneaky yordles. When sprung, the trap reveals and immobilizes the enemy champion for 1.5 seconds, granting Caitlyn an empowered Headshot.;90 Caliber Net;Caitlyn fires a heavy net to slow her target. The recoil knocks Caitlyn back.;Ace in the Hole;Caitlyn takes time to line up the perfect shot, dealing massive damage to a single target at a huge range. Enemy champions can intercept the bullet for their ally.;Headshot;Every few basic attacks, or against a target she has trapped or netted, Caitlyn will fire a headshot dealing bonus damage that scales with her critical strike chance. On trapped or netted targets, Caitlyn's Headshot attack range is doubled.;
A determined and skilled investigator
column2: Caitlyn is one of the sheriffs of Piltover
column3: the City of Progress. She is a fiercely intelligent woman with a strong sense of justice and a resolute devotion to the law. Armed with a magnificent hextech rifle
column4: Caitlyn is a patient hunter and the bane of criminals throughout her city.

column1: Born to a wealthy and influential family of hextech artificers in Piltover
column2: Caitlyn swiftly learned the social graces of city life
column3: but preferred to spend her time in the wilder lands to the south. Equally adept at mingling with the moneyed citizens of the City of Progress or tracking a deer through the mud of the forest
column4: Caitlyn spent the bulk of her youth beyond Piltover’s gates. She could track a bird on the wing or put a bullet through the eye of a hare at three hundred yards with her father’s Bilgewater repeater musket.

column1: Caitlyn’s greatest assets
column2: however
column3: were her intelligence and willingness to learn from her parents
column4: who reinforced her innate understanding of right and wrong. Though the family’s engineering skills had made them wealthy
column5: her mother always warned of Piltover’s seductions
column6: of how its gilded promises could harden even the kindest heart. Caitlyn paid little attention to her mother’s warning
column7: for Piltover was a city of beauty to her
column8: a place of order she would cherish after each trip into the wild.

column1: All that was to change one Progress Day
column2: five years later.

column1: Caitlyn returned from one of her long forays into the woodlands to find her home ransacked and empty. The family retainers were all dead
column2: and no trace could be found of her parents. Caitlyn secured her home
column3: and immediately set off in search of her mother and father.

column1: Tracking quarry that does not want to be found within the confines of a city was very different from hunting in the wild
column2: but
column3: one by one
column4: Caitlyn located the men who had invaded her home. None of these men knew the true identity of who had hired them
column5: only that they had acted via a proxy with the initial “C.” The trail eventually led Caitlyn to a secret hextech laboratory where her mother and father were being forced to work for a rival clan under pain of death. Caitlyn rescued her parents
column6: and the wardens
column7: acting upon Caitlyn’s information
column8: arrested the clan leader behind the kidnapping. She and her parents returned home and began to rebuild their lives
column9: but something fundamental had changed in Caitlyn.

column1: She had seen that Piltover could be a dangerous place
column2: where ambition and greed were as deadly as a cornered beast. During the course of her investigation
column3: Caitlyn had seen beneath Piltover’s veneer of progress and science. She had seen people in need of help
column4: a host of souls lost and alone. And she had seen that she could help them. Though she loved her parents
column5: Caitlyn had no desire to follow in their footsteps as an artisan
column6: and looked for a way to earn a living in the sprawling metropolis. She established herself as an investigator of sorts
column7: utilizing her skills as a superlative hunter to act as a finder of lost people and retriever of stolen property.

column1: For her twenty-first birthday
column2: Caitlyn’s parents presented her with a hextech rifle of exquisite artifice. The weapon was a thing of beauty
column3: with specialized shells that enabled it to shoot with greater accuracy than any rifle she had ever owned. The weapon could also be modified to fire a variety of different ammunition types
column4: and went with Caitlyn whenever she took a case.

column1: Caitlyn knew Piltover’s nooks and crannies as thoroughly as the forest paths of her childhood
column2: and turned a tidy profit in a profession that brought her into contact with the many and varied layers of society. Her profession exposed Caitlyn to a great deal of strange encounters that taught her
column3: first-hand
column4: the dangers of untested hextech and rogue chemtech development. Over the next few years
column5: she quickly made a name for herself as someone to go to for help in matters both mundane and esoteric.

column1: One particularly traumatic case involving a missing hextech device and a series of child abductions led to Caitlyn working closely with an agent of the Piltover Wardens; one who
column2: like her
column3: had developed something of an affinity for stranger cases. Caitlyn refused to give up
column4: even when the trail grew colder with every passing day. She chased it like a dog would a bone
column5: and eventually
column6: broke the case. Caitlyn and the warden rescued the children after a battle with a host of rogue chimerics in the employ of a lunatic chem-researcher driven mad by his own concoctions. As she and the warden shared a celebratory drink
column7: he offered her a job as a sheriff. At first
column8: Caitlyn refused
column9: but eventually came to realize that
column10: with all the resources the wardens had to offer
column11: she could potentially get closer to discovering the identity of the mysterious “C
column12: ” the only person involved in the attack on her family home she had yet to apprehend.

column1: Caitlyn now works as a highly respected officer within the ranks of the Piltover Wardens to keep order in the City of Progress - particularly in areas where overzealous hextech artisans cross the line of what is acceptable in Piltover. She has recently partnered with a new recruit from Zaun
column2: the brash and reckless Vi. How such an unlikely pairing came to be
column3: and has proven to be so effective
column4: is the subject of numerous wild rumors and tavern speculation among their fellow wardens and those they haul away to jail.

Wait for your teammates to initiate.;;;Vayne is fragile - turn the pressure up on her and she will be forced to play cautiously.;Deny Vayne the opportunity to pin you against walls.;;;Marksman;Assassin;Mana;10;1;1;8;515.0;89;231.8;35.0;330;23;3.4;30.0;0.5;550;3.5;0.55;6.97;0.4;60.0;2.36;3.3;0.658;Tumble;Vayne tumbles, maneuvering to carefully place her next shot. The third consecutive attack or ability against the same target deals a percentage of the target's max health as bonus true damage.;Condemn;Vayne draws a heavy crossbow from her back, and fires a huge bolt at her target, knocking them back and dealing damage. If they collide with terrain, they are impaled, dealing bonus damage and stunning them.;Final Hour;Readying herself for an epic confrontation, Vayne gains increased Attack Damage, Invisibility during Tumble, reduced Tumble cooldown, and more bonus Movement Speed from Night Hunter;Night Hunter;Vayne ruthlessly hunts evil-doers, gaining 30 Move Speed when moving toward nearby enemy champions.;
Shauna Vayne is a deadly
column2: remorseless monster hunter who has pledged her life to finding and killing the demon who murdered her family. Armed with her wrist-mounted crossbows and a heart full of vengeance
column3: Vayne is only truly happy when she’s slaying practitioners or creations of the dark arts.

column1: As the only child to a wealthy Demacian couple
column2: Vayne enjoyed an upbringing of privilege. She spent most of her childhood indulged in solitary pursuits – reading
column3: learning music
column4: and avidly collecting the various insects found on their manor’s grounds. Her parents had traveled across Runeterra in their youth
column5: but settled in Demacia after Shauna’s birth because more than any place they’d found
column6: Demacians looked out for one another.

column1: Shortly after Vayne’s sixteenth birthday
column2: she returned home from a midsummer banquet and saw something she would never forget.

column1: An unspeakably beautiful
column2: horned woman stood before the bloodied corpses of her parents.

column1: Vayne screamed in agony and terror. Before disappearing
column2: the demon looked down at the young girl and flashed her a terrible
column3: lustful smile.

column1: Vayne tried to brush the bloody hair out of her mother’s eyes
column2: but that haunting smile lingered in her mind
column3: growing and consuming her. Even as she shakily smoothed her father’s eyelids closed – his mouth still agape
column4: frozen in his last horrific moments of confusion – the demon’s smile seeped through her thoughts.

column1: It was a smile that would fill Shauna’s veins with hatred for the rest of her days.
Vayne tried to explain what happened
column2: but no one truly believed her. The thought of a demon on the loose – in the well-defended
column3: magic-averse kingdom of Demacia
column4: of all places – was too far-fetched to consider.

column1: Vayne knew better. She knew from the demon’s smile the enchantress would strike again. Even Demacia’s tall walls couldn’t keep dark magic from creeping through the cracks. It may disguise itself with subtleties or keep to shadowed corners
column2: but Vayne knew it was there.

column1: And she was done being afraid.
Vayne had a heart full of hatred and enough coin to outfit a small army
column2: but where she would go
column3: no army dared follow. She needed to learn everything about dark magic: How to track it. How to stop it. How to kill those who practiced it.

column1: She needed a teacher.
Her parents had told her stories of iceborn warriors who fought against an Ice Witch in the north. For generations
column2: they had defended themselves from her unknowable forces and dark minions. This
column3: Vayne knew
column4: would be where she would find her tutor. She evaded her appointed custodians and booked passage on the next ship to the Freljord.

column1: Shortly after arriving
column2: Vayne set out in search of a monster hunter. She found one
column3: although not in the way she intended. Traversing a frozen ravine
column4: Vayne was ensnared by a cleverly carved icetrap. After tumbling to the bottom of a jagged
column5: crystalline pit
column6: Vayne stared up to see a ravenous ice troll
column7: lips smacking with anticipation as he gazed upon his catch.

column1: His gigantic blue tongue fell limp as a spear whistled through the air
column2: pierced the troll’s skull and planted itself deep in his brain. The giant toppled into the pit and Vayne rolled aside just in time to escape being crushed. A sticky pool of drool and blood collected at her boots.

column1: Vayne’s savior was a grizzled
column2: middle-aged woman named Frey. She bandaged Vayne’s wounds as they clung to the warmth of a campfire that struggled to stay ablaze in the frigid canyon. Frey told Vayne of her life’s work spent fighting the Ice Witch’s minions who had murdered her children. Vayne implored the woman to take her on as a student and teach her to track the dark creatures of the world
column3: but the Freljordian had no interest. Vayne stank of privilege and money
column4: neither of which kept your teeth gritted or your blade sharp through the grueling perseverance of a fight.

column1: Vayne couldn’t accept Frey’s answer and challenged her to a duel: if she won
column2: Frey would train her. If she lost
column3: she’d offer herself as bait to the Ice Witch’s minions
column4: so Frey could ambush them. Vayne had no reason to think she’d win – her training amounted to a single afternoon of studying fencing before she wearied of trying to fight with one hand behind her back – but she refused to back down. To reward Vayne’s mettle
column5: Frey threw snow in Vayne’s eyes and subsequently taught her the first rule of monster hunting: don’t play fair.

column1: Frey saw a determination in Vayne she couldn’t help but respect. The girl had a long way to go as a fighter
column2: but each time Vayne pushed her bruised body up from the dirtied snow to continue the fight
column3: Frey saw a little more of the relentless hunter this girl could become. Beaten in skill
column4: but never in spirit
column5: Vayne beseeched Frey one last time: both of their families were dead. Frey could spend the rest of her days tracking ice trolls until one of them caved her head in
column6: or she could teach Vayne. Together
column7: they could kill twice as many monsters. Together
column8: they could save twice as many families from experiencing the pain that defined them both. Frey saw the same hatred and loss in Vayne’s eyes her own had burned with for years.

column1: Frey agreed to accompany Vayne back to Demacia.
Together they made the journey south
column2: heavily disguising Frey to illude Demacia’s border guards. Once back at Vayne’s estate
column3: the two spent years training. Despite the pageant of suitors who solicited Vayne’s company
column4: Shauna had no interest in anything other than training with Frey. As a result
column5: the two became incredibly close.

column1: Frey taught Vayne the fundamentals of dark magic
column2: conjured beasts
column3: and vile spells. Vayne committed every word of Frey's teachings to heart
column4: but found it slightly unnerving that Frey never explained how she came to know so many specifics of these malefic practices.

column1: Due to the kingdom’s watchful soldiers and antimagic trees
column2: dark creatures were rare within Demacia's walls
column3: so Frey and Vayne would venture into the border forests at night to hunt. Vayne earned her first kill – a bloodthirsty creature who preyed on traveling merchants – at the age of eighteen.

column1: Soaked in the creature’s viscera
column2: something awoke within Vayne: pleasure. The hot flush of vengeance and violence raced through her blood
column3: and she relished in the sensation.

column1: Vayne and Frey spent several years hunting dark creatures
column2: their respect for one another growing with every kill. One day
column3: Vayne realized that she loved Frey like a mother
column4: but her emotions of familial love were so tangled with pain and tainted by trauma
column5: Vayne fought them as she would any beast out to hurt her.

column1: Vayne and Frey traveled Valoran
column2: until tavern tales from the highlands caught their ear
column3: whispering of a demonic horned creature of mesmerizing beauty. According to the stories
column4: the demon had been busy: she’d formed a cult
column5: designed to attract worshippers who would do her bidding. People would walk into the hills
column6: never to be heard from again. It was said the cult’s high priests had a holy grounds near the cliffside
column7: where they’d prepare the demon’s sacrificial offerings. Vayne and Frey immediately set off on the hunt.

column1: As they journeyed into the hills by cover of night
column2: Vayne found herself distracted. For the first time since their partnership began
column3: she felt worried for Frey – worried she might lose her mother figure for a second time. Before she could confess her fear
column4: one of the demon’s priests lunged from the brush
column5: swinging a mace into Vayne’s shoulder.

column1: Vayne was badly wounded. Frey had a brief moment of hesitation
column2: but her eyes steeled with certainty as she apologized to her friend and transformed into a monstrous Freljordian wolf. As Vayne watched in shock
column3: Frey – in her animalistic form – tore the priest’s tendons from his throat with a swift snap of her mighty jaws.

column1: With the priest’s body laid strewn at Vayne’s feet
column2: Frey retook her human form
column3: yet her eyes betrayed the scared animal within. She explained that after the death of her family
column4: she had become a shaman
column5: inviting the curse upon herself in order to gain the power to change shape and fight against the Ice Witch. The ritual that gave her these powers involved dark magic
column6: but she made this sacrifice to protect–

column1: –Vayne put an arrow through Frey’s heart without allowing her another syllable. Whatever affection she had felt for Frey evaporated upon discovering her true nature. A tear formed in Frey’s eye as she collapsed
column2: but Vayne didn’t notice – whatever warmth the two had shared died with Frey.

column1: There were still hours left before dawn
column2: which meant hours left to continue the hunt. Vayne thought only of the demon. The kill that would be hers to savor. And all the kills to come. Runeterra’s underworld would come to fear her
column3: just as she had once feared them.

column1: For the first time since her parents’ death
column2: Vayne smiled.

column1: 42;Corki;the Daring Bombardier;UFO Corki;Ice Toboggan Corki;Red Baron Corki;Hot Rod Corki;Urfrider Corki;Dragonwing Corki;Fnatic Corki;Arcade Corki;Corgi Corki;Astronaut Corki;;;;;;Phosphorus Bomb can be used to reveal enemy units that might be hiding in a nearby patch of brush.;Valkyrie can be used defensively as well, so try using it for a quick escape.;Corki can continue to attack while using Gatling Gun. They deal splash damage, so you can get hit even when hiding behind minions.;Corki is vulnerable after he uses his Valkyrie or Special Delivery, so try switching focus to him if he uses them to enter a fight.;;;Marksman;;Mana;8;3;6;6;518.0;87;350.0;54.0;325;28;3.5;30.0;0.5;550;5.5;0.55;7.42;0.55;55.0;2.5;2.3;0.638;Phosphorus Bomb;Corki fires a flash bomb at a target location, dealing magic damage to enemies in the area. This attack additionally reveals units in the area for a duration.;Valkyrie;Corki flies a short distance, dropping bombs that create a trail of fire that damages opponents who remain in it.;Gatling Gun;Corki's gatling gun rapidly fires in a cone in front of him, dealing damage and reducing enemy Armor and Magic Resist.;Missile Barrage;Corki fires a missile toward his target location that explodes on impact, dealing damage to enemies in an area. Corki stores missiles over time, up to a maximum. Every 3rd missile fired will be a Big One, dealing extra damage.;Hextech Munitions;A percentage of Corki's basic attack damage is converted into magic damage.Corki can occasionally retrieve The Package inside his base, granting him movement speed and an empowered cast of Valkyrie.;
When Heimerdinger and his yordle colleagues migrated to Piltover
column2: they embraced science as a way of life
column3: and they immediately made several groundbreaking contributions to the techmaturgical community. What yordles lack in stature
column4: they make up for with industriousness. Corki
column5: the Daring Bombardier
column6: gained his title by test-piloting one of these contributions - the original design for the Reconnaissance Operations Front-Line Copter
column7: an aerial assault vehicle which has become the backbone of the Bandle City Expeditionary Force (BCEF). Together with his squadron - the Screaming Yipsnakes - Corki soars over Valoran
column8: surveying the landscape and conducting aerial acrobatics for the benefit of onlookers below.

column1: Corki is the most renowned of the Screaming Yipsnakes for remaining cool under fire and exhibiting bravery to the point of madness. He served several tours of duty
column2: often volunteering for missions that would take him behind enemy lines
column3: either gathering intelligence or delivering messages through hot zones. He thrived on danger
column4: and enjoyed nothing more than a good dogfight in the morning. More than just an ace pilot
column5: Corki also made several modifications to his copter
column6: outfitting it with an arsenal of weapons which some speculate were more for show than functionality. When open hostilities ceased
column7: Corki was forced into a retirement
column8: which he felt ""cut the engines and clipped the wings."" He tried to make do with stunt flying and canyon running
column9: but it was never the same without the refreshing smell of gunpowder streaking through the air around him.

column1: 63;Brand;the Burning Vengeance;Apocalyptic Brand;Vandal Brand;Cryocore Brand;Zombie Brand;Spirit Fire Brand;Battle Boss Brand;Arclight Brand;Eternal Dragon Brand;;;;;;;;You can deter enemies from standing near their minions by setting them ablaze, due to Conflagration.;You can use Brand's abilities in a variety of combinations to maximize his damage in different situations.;Pyroclasm bounces randomly between enemies, so try to cast it on a small group of enemies if you want to hit the same target multiple times.;;;Brand must land an ability before his combo is able to get started. Dodging his Sear or Pillar of Flame will disrupt his rhythm.;Try to move away from allies when you see Pyroclasm being cast. The initial missile speed is slow, which should give your team time to react.;Brand's passive allows him to excel against teams that cluster together. Be sure to split up against him.;;Mage;;Mana;2;2;9;4;520.0;88;469.0;21.0;340;22;3.5;30.0;0.5;550;5.5;0.55;10.67;0.6;57.0;3.0;1.36;0.625;Sear;Brand launches a ball of fire forward that deals magic damage. If the target is ablaze, Sear will stun the target for 1.5 seconds.;Pillar of Flame;After a short delay, Brand creates a Pillar of Flame at a target area, dealing magic damage to enemy units within the area. Units that are ablaze take an additional 25% damage.;Conflagration;Brand conjures a powerful blast at his target that spreads to nearby enemies, dealing magic damage. If the target is ablaze, Conflagration's spread is doubled.;Pyroclasm;Brand unleashes a devastating torrent of fire that bounces up to 5 times off of Brand and nearby enemies, dealing magic damage to enemies each time bounce. Bounces prioritize stacking Blaze to max on Champions. If a target is ablaze, Pyroclasm will briefly slow them.;Blaze;Brand's spells light his targets ablaze, dealing damage over 4 seconds, stacking up to 3 times. If Brand kills an enemy while it is ablaze he regains mana. When Blaze reaches max stacks on a Champion or large monster, it becomes unstable. It detonates in 2 seconds, applying spell effects and dealing massive damage in an area around the victim.;
Once a tribesman of the icy Freljord named Kegan Rodhe
column2: the creature known as Brand is a lesson in the temptation of greater power. Seeking one of the legendary World Runes
column3: Kegan betrayed his companions and seized it for himself—and
column4: in an instant
column5: the man was no more. His soul burned away
column6: his body a vessel of living flame
column7: Brand now roams Valoran in search of other Runes
column8: swearing revenge for wrongs he could not have suffered in a dozen mortal lifetimes.

column1: The son of a Freljordian healer
column2: Kegan Rodhe was born an outsider. The little magic and herbcraft his mother possessed allowed them both to survive on the fringes of a small coastal community named Rygann’s Reach. Friends were few and far between. Even as a young boy
column3: he knew his father was an enemy reaver
column4: and that he—and Kegan by extension—was the reason his mother was shunned. The villagers called him “the reaver-bastard”. Kegan allowed his loneliness and resentment to smolder
column5: often turning violent.

column1: After enduring years of seemingly endless winter
column2: his mother’s frail body finally gave in. As Kegan spread her funeral ashes
column3: he thought of the people she had spent her life healing. None had come to pay their respects. He knew they wished him to disappear into the cold air as well.

column1: He would oblige them
column2: but not before he took his revenge. He burned down the village and fled into the night
column3: leaving himself with scars that would never heal.

column1: Kegan wandered the frozen tundra of the Freljord. He told himself that he was searching for his father
column2: but he knew deep down he was looking for a friend... or
column3: at the very least
column4: a kind face. Finding neither
column5: he holed himself up in a cave
column6: and waited to die.

column1: It was not death that came to him
column2: but another outsider.

column1: The mysterious mage named Ryze saw potential in this half-frozen young man
column2: and took him on as an apprentice. Teacher and student struggled as Kegan’s nascent
column3: wild magic frustrated them both
column4: and Ryze’s requests for patience and humility often fell on deaf ears.

column1: Unfortunately
column2: instructing Kegan would always come second to Ryze’s original mission. He had long sought to collect and hide away a power that could be Runeterra’s unmaking—the legendary World Runes. After tracking down one such fragment
column3: Kegan faced the same desperate temptation that had driven so many before him to madness. The Runes were the source of all magic in the world and
column4: against his master’s warnings
column5: he chose to seize that power for himself.

column1: Ryze was forced to watch in failure as his apprentice was burned away by the raw magic
column2: Kegan’s soul utterly consumed. The creature that was born in that moment was no longer the bitter young man Ryze had rescued from the snows
column3: nor the Freljordian mage he had come to know as his friend.

column1: Rather
column2: this vengeful being of fire and fury that now walked the mortal realm would eventually become known as Brand.

column1: Cursing his former master
column2: and every other living thing that would ever come between him and the Runes
column3: Brand lashed out with magical flames
column4: and Ryze barely escaped with his life.

column1: Over the centuries since that day
column2: Brand has lived an anarchic
column3: wildfire existence
column4: taking and never giving anything back to the world. At times
column5: he blazes across the heavens like a comet. At others
column6: he sinks into the cold earth and slumbers
column7: waiting for the unmistakable scent of magic that will lead him to another World Rune… and should he find one
column8: there are precious few in Runeterra with the power to stop him.

column1: 235;Senna;the Redeemer;True Damage Senna;True Damage Senna Prestige Edition;High Noon Senna;PROJECT: Senna;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Marksman;Support;Mana;7;2;6;7;520.0;75;350.0;45.0;330;28;3.5;30.0;0.5;600;3.5;0.55;11.5;0.4;50.0;0.0;4.0;0.625;Piercing Darkness;From the twin barrels of her Relic Cannon, Senna fires a unified beam of light and shadow through a target, healing allies and damaging enemies.;Last Embrace;Senna sends forth a wave of Black Mist. If it hits an enemy it latches onto them hungrily, rooting them and everything nearby after a brief delay.;Curse of the Black Mist;Senna draws the Mist she has stored in her weapon into a storm around her, embracing darkness and becoming a wraith within. Allies who enter the area are camouflaged and also appear as wraiths as the Mist shrouds them. Wraiths gain increased Move Speed, are unselectable, and hide their identities.;Dawning Shadow;Senna calls upon the relic stones of fallen Sentinels, splitting her relic cannon into a holy array of shadow and light. She then fires a global beam that shields allies from harm, while damaging enemies caught in the center.;Absolution;When units die near Senna, their souls are periodically trapped by the Black Mist. Senna can attack these souls to free them, absorbing the Mist that held them in death. Mist fuels her Relic Cannon's power with increased Attack Damage, Attack Range, and Critical Strike Chance. Attacks from Senna's Relic Cannon take longer to fire, deal bonus damage, and briefly grant her a portion of her target's Move Speed.;
Cursed from childhood to be haunted by the supernatural Black Mist
column2: Senna joined a sacred order known as the Sentinels of Light
column3: and fiercely fought back—only to be killed
column4: her soul imprisoned in a lantern by the cruel wraith Thresh. But refusing to lose hope
column5: within the lantern Senna learned to use the Mist
column6: and reemerged to new life
column7: forever changed. Now wielding darkness along with light
column8: Senna seeks to end the Black Mist by turning it against itself—with every blast of her relic weapon
column9: redeeming the souls lost within.

column1: Senna’s journey to become a Sentinel of Light started with darkness. It started with the Black Mist…
Senna first encountered the Mist at an early age
column2: when wreckage from a distant Harrowing washed onto the shores of her home island. The Black Mist within the wreckage awakened upon contact with life. She and her village survived the ensuing storm of souls
column3: thanks to the intervention of a nearby Sentinel… but in the wake of the attack
column4: the Mist was still mysteriously drawn to Senna.

column1: She was cursed
column2: marked by the Mist so its horrors pursued her endlessly
column3: the darkness drawn to her like dying moth to living flame. She could never know when it would strike next—but worse was when it didn’t come
column4: and Senna had to imagine what awaited in every shadow.

column1: The Sentinel who saved Senna
column2: a brusque veteran named Urias
column3: did not understand why the Mist was drawn to a solitary girl—but he knew if she was going to survive
column4: she had to learn to fight back. And so
column5: Senna joined Urias in the Sentinels of Light
column6: a sacred order that could be traced back to the Blessed Isles
column7: where the Black Mist originated. She proved to be a deadly enemy of darkness
column8: mastering the relic-stone pistol Urias gave her
column9: learning to channel her soul into light.

column1: Yet even as Senna grew comfortable working with Urias
column2: relying on him for gruff guidance
column3: she learned to keep others at gun’s length. If she allowed them to get too close
column4: they would only be hurt when the Mist came again. Senna could never stay in one place for long
column5: something she and Urias learned when those who offered them shelter inevitably found themselves under siege. After even Urias was slain
column6: Senna wasn’t sure if she could let anyone get close again.

column1: Reluctantly
column2: Senna sought out Urias’ family in Demacia
column3: to tell them of his fate. There
column4: she met his son
column5: Lucian
column6: who would not relent until Senna allowed him to join Urias’ parting vigil. From the very first moment she found herself flustered
column7: wondering if her walls were enough to keep out someone so stubborn
column8: full of humor and love. It became clear over time that Lucian’s place was with the Sentinels
column9: as Senna’s partner
column10: and Senna as his.

column1: The more they served together
column2: the deeper their bond became
column3: and Senna realized that the value of her walls wasn’t what she kept out
column4: but who she let in. Yet as Lucian’s love for Senna grew
column5: so did his desire to save her from her curse. In time
column6: it became his only focus
column7: the light in his eyes passing into his gun—making Senna wary that Lucian would only see sorrow where there was love.

column1: It was while researching a cure that Senna and Lucian came into conflict with the sadistic wraith Thresh. So close to answering mysteries about the Ruination and Senna’s curse
column2: Lucian refused to turn back…

column1: Thresh’s chains whipped toward Senna as she stood between the wraith and her husband. More painful than the scythe was seeing the look of anguish on Lucian’s face. With her last breath
column2: Senna screamed for Lucian to run.

column1: But as Senna felt the deathblow and knew she had lost
column2: she realized there was a glimmer of hope. Her whole life
column3: the Mist had haunted her—she didn’t need to fear it anymore. She could ride it into the darkness of Thresh’s lantern
column4: and see what was inside.

column1: Her curse had become her only chance for salvation.
While Lucian spent years seeking to grant his beloved peace
column2: Senna explored her spectral prison. She learned that life had been the origin of her curse. Its spark shone brighter within her than in anyone else—she’d been infected with it when she first encountered the wreckage that brought the Harrowing. There
column3: she’d been touched by a powerful
column4: lingering soul
column5: given its unnatural life…

column1: It was life that the Black Mist could never let go.
She could use this force to pull the Mist into herself
column2: empowering her to sever its hold over others in the lantern. Among the souls she freed were Sentinels who possessed lost knowledge of the Ruination’s origins
column3: of her curse… and the love that created it.

column1: When Lucian drove his broken pistol into the lantern
column2: intending to end the torture of the souls within
column3: Senna was waiting. She escaped
column4: shrouded in Mist she’d drawn from other souls. She was dead
column5: but also alive
column6: thanks to her curse
column7: wielding a relic-stone cannon that could channel darkness along with light
column8: forged from the weapons of fallen Sentinels.

column1: No longer running from the Mist
column2: Senna now understands the suffering of the souls within. Though it is painful
column3: she draws their Mist into herself
column4: liberating them
column5: and blasting darkness with darkness. Embracing her death every time she transforms into a wraith
column6: she becomes like those she fought
column7: only to be reborn again thanks to the life infecting her.

column1: Though Senna and Lucian’s love survived even death
column2: now they face the consequences of her rebirth. Senna knows what they have to do next
column3: a secret gleaned within the lantern.

column1: Find the Ruined King
column2: and stop him at any cost…

column1: 161;Vel'Koz;the Eye of the Void;Battlecast Vel'Koz;Arclight Vel'Koz;Definitely Not Vel'Koz;Infernal Vel'Koz;Blackfrost Vel'Koz;;;;;;;;;;;When laning, use Void Rift to kill minions while building stacks of Organic Deconstruction on your opponent.
