Many champions have abilities that can interrupt the spell.;;;Vel'Koz is very dangerous if left alone in a fight. Try to focus him down early.;Vel'Koz has fairly low mobility and is vulnerable to ganks.;Life Form Disintegration Ray can be interrupted by stuns, silences and knockups.;;Mage;;Mana;2;2;10;8;520.0;88;469.0;21.0;340;22;3.5;30.0;0.5;525;5.5;0.55;8.0;0.8;55.0;3.1416;1.36;0.625;Plasma Fission;Vel'Koz shoots a bolt of plasma that splits in two on reactivation or upon hitting an enemy. The bolt slows and damages on hit.;Void Rift;Vel'Koz opens a rift to the void that deals an initial burst of damage, then explodes for a second burst of damage after a delay.;Tectonic Disruption;Vel'Koz causes an area to explode, knocking up enemies, and knocking close enemies slightly away.;Life Form Disintegration Ray;Vel'Koz unleashes a channelled beam that follows the cursor for 2.5 seconds that deals magic damage. Organic Deconstruction Researches enemy champions causing them to take true damage instead.;Organic Deconstruction;Vel'Koz's abilities apply Organic Deconstruction to enemies on hit. If 3 stacks are accumulated, the enemy will take a burst of true damage.;
It is unclear if Vel’Koz was the first Voidborn to emerge on Runeterra
column2: but there has certainly never been another to match his level of cruel
column3: calculating sentience. While his kin devour or defile everything around them
column4: he seeks instead to scrutinize and study the physical realm—and the strange
column5: warlike beings that dwell there—for any weakness the Void might exploit. But Vel’Koz is far from a passive observer
column6: striking back at threats with deadly plasma
column7: or by disrupting the very fabric of the world itself.

column1: To truly understand the horror that is Vel’Koz
column2: one must first know of the Watchers
column3: and how they were blinded to the mortal realm.

column1: Beyond the material plane
column2: outside and somehow below it
column3: lies the unknowable abyss. It is the realm of the Void
column4: where no mortal or immortal creature may ever walk. It is not necessary to know how such a place ever came to be
column5: nor why—only that it did. The Void is eternal. The Void consumes all.

column1: In that place
column2: in the cold
column3: endless dark
column4: all is equal and empty. For timeless eons
column5: there was purity in that fact. There was peace
column6: if such a term could have any meaning there.

column1: Then
column2: something changed. Not in the Void realm
column3: but elsewhere. It was existence
column4: it was... something
column5: where before there had been nothing
column6: and its mere presence scraped against the vast
column7: cold
column8: formless entities that drifted in the blackness. Before this
column9: they had not even been fully aware of their own sentience
column10: and yet now they knew that they could not tolerate the presence of this other place; this other-realm of mercurial
column11: overwhelming creation.

column1: The entities watched. They scrutinized.
And soon enough
column2: the Watchers found themselves being scrutinized in return. The tiny
column3: mortal minds that reached out to them were insignificant
column4: little more than fleeting motes of light at the very edges of the abyss. Yet
column5: in them
column6: the Watchers saw a chance to invade the material realm
column7: to destroy it
column8: to silence the intolerable pulsing of reality beyond the Void.

column1: The boldest of them tore open the veil and hurled themselves upward
column2: only to be horribly disoriented by the sudden shift between the abyss and the corporeal
column3: linear nature of reality. In an instant
column4: there was time
column5: and heat
column6: and pain...

column1: Then there was only cold. The way was shut
column2: and dozens of the Watchers were trapped in the liminal space between two realms
column3: frozen in the moment of transition.

column1: Those that remained in the Void recoiled. They had no concept of what had happened
column2: yet they knew they had been betrayed.

column1: And so
column2: they adapted.

column1: Reaching into the material realm
column2: the Watchers took from the crude matter that comprised it
column3: shaping
column4: corrupting and imbuing it with consciousness. These constructs were the first of the Voidborn
column5: and would be their masters’ eyes and ears
column6: sent forth into the nightmare of existence to watch
column7: listen
column8: and learn.

column1: Among them
column2: one stands apart. As perhaps the oldest surviving Voidborn
column3: certainly existing the longest outside of the abyss
column4: he has been known by countless names to those unfortunate enough to encounter him. Thousands of years before Icathia unleashed the Void in battle
column5: the primitive cultures of Shurima feared the devil Vel’Koz
column6: who crept forth from the underworld to steal the dreams of wiser men. Though his name has no literal translation in the modern tongue
column7: it equates roughly as “to understand by unmaking.”

column1: His insatiable hunger for knowledge has led Vel’Koz across the world
column2: to its highest peaks and darkest depths. Cunning and methodical
column3: he has quietly watched entire civilizations rise
column4: stagnate and decay
column5: spent centuries combing the ocean floor for its secrets
column6: even scrying the movements of the stars in the heavens above him.

column1: He carries all of this knowledge back to the great rifts in the fabric of Runeterra—so that the Watchers might know what he knows—and will annihilate
column2: without hesitation
column3: any mortal who stands in his path.

column1: For the Void is eternal
column2: and it will consume us all.

column1: 39;Irelia;the Blade Dancer;Nightblade Irelia;Aviator Irelia;Infiltrator Irelia;Frostblade Irelia;Order of the Lotus Irelia;Divine Sword Irelia;iG Irelia;PROJECT: Irelia;PROJECT: Irelia Prestige Edition;High Noon Irelia;Sentinel Irelia;;;;;Use Bladesurge to cover great distances by targeting low life minions on your way to champion targets.;Defiant Dance is not interrupted by crowd control, try timing it for incoming disables.;Flawless Duet does not have a maximum travel distance, try using it in creative ways.;;;Pay attention to Ionian Fervor stacks and try to engage Irelia when it is down.;Minion waves greatly enhance Irelia's mobility, beware fighting her inside one.;Beware of wasting your high impact spells on Defiant Dance.;;Fighter;Assassin;Mana;7;4;5;5;520.0;110;350.0;50.0;335;36;3.0;28.0;1.25;200;8.5;0.85;8.0;0.8;65.0;4.0;2.5;0.656;Bladesurge;Irelia dashes forward to strike her target, healing herself. If the target is Marked or dies to Bladesurge, its cooldown refreshes.;Defiant Dance;Irelia charges a strike that deals more damage as she charges. She takes reduced physical damage during the charge.;Flawless Duet;Irelia sends out two blades which converge on each other. Enemies caught in between are damaged, stunned and Marked.;Vanguard's Edge;Irelia fires a massive number of blades that explode outward upon hitting an enemy champion. Enemies hit by the blades are damaged and Marked. Afterwards the blades form a wall that will damage and slow enemies that walk through it.;Ionian Fervor;When Irelia strikes enemies with spells she gains stacking bonus Attack Speed. At maximum stacks she also gains bonus damage on hit.;
The Noxian occupation of Ionia produced many heroes
column2: none more unlikely than young Irelia of Navori. Trained in the ancient dances of her province
column3: she adapted her art for war
column4: using the graceful and carefully practised movements to levitate a host of deadly blades. After proving herself as a fighter
column5: she was thrust into the role of resistance leader and figurehead
column6: and to this day remains dedicated to the preservation of her homeland.

column1: Even as a small child
column2: Xan Irelia was fascinated by the grace and beauty of human movement. Under her grandmother’s tutelage
column3: she learned the traditional silk dances of her province—though she was dubious of their supposedly mystical connection to the Spirit of Ionia
column4: Irelia’s love for the dances was real. Seeking to master the art
column5: she eventually left home to study with some of Ionia’s most respected performers at the Placidium of Navori.

column1: Irelia’s people were peaceful and sought harmony with their neighbors
column2: but rumors of foreign invaders sighted off the coast unsettled many at the Placidium. Irelia returned to her village to find it already occupied
column3: with steel-helmed soldiers from distant Noxus shoving unarmed civilians through the streets with the butts of their spears. The Noxian Admiral Duqal had seized the Xan home to quarter his fleet officers.

column1: Irelia’s brothers and her father Lito had evidently protested; her entire family now lay in unmarked graves
column2: in the gardens.

column1: Ravaged by grief
column2: the young girl saw Duqal’s men hauling valuables from the house. Among the loot was a large metal crest
column3: depicting the Xan family emblem. Irelia raced to it
column4: wrenching it from Noxian hands. The admiral himself hurled her to the ground
column5: and had his warriors shatter the crest with a heavy iron maul
column6: before ordering them to dig a fresh grave for this upstart child.

column1: As they surrounded her
column2: Irelia averted her eyes
column3: looking to the pieces of the Xan crest scattered on the ground. From deep within her soul
column4: she felt a strange rhythm begin to beat. The shards of metal began to twitch
column5: to twist
column6: moving seemingly on their own
column7: and Irelia felt the serene joy of the ancient dances once more...

column1: With a sweep of her arm
column2: she sent the pieces flying like ragged blades
column3: cutting clean through two of the Noxians. As Duqal and his officers reeled in shock
column4: Irelia snatched up the shards of her crest
column5: and fled the village.

column1: In the quiet forests beyond
column2: Irelia mourned her family
column3: and thought back to her grandmother’s teachings. She realized that the techniques she had learned were more than mere dances—they were a powerful expression of something far greater.

column1: The Noxian occupation soon began to test the fragile peace of the First Lands. It was said that even the religious leader Karma had been forced to strike back at the invaders with deadly magic
column2: though her followers had now withdrawn to the Lasting Altar and would not condone any further violence. Across Navori
column3: dissenting voices began to band together. A resistance was forming
column4: one that would not rest until Ionia was free once more. Irelia joined their ranks
column5: performing her cherished dances for them in the woodland camps
column6: to preserve some vestige of their vanishing culture.

column1: She was barely fourteen years old when she found herself back at the Placidium. Her band of resistance fighters joined the militia who had sworn to guard the monasteries and wild
column2: sacred gardens.

column1: But Noxus knew only too well what this place represented. A particularly cunning general named Jericho Swain captured the Placidium and took its defenders hostage
column2: hoping to lure the inevitable reinforcements into a trap.

column1: It was in this moment that Irelia rose to meet her destiny. Freed from her bonds
column2: she unleashed the full potential of her ancient blade dance
column3: lashing out with graceful zeal. A dozen of Swain’s veterans fell
column4: sowing chaos in their ranks as the other captives joined her
column5: before she struck down the general himself—the sight of this rebellious girl hefting his severed arm over her head would be the turning point of the war.

column1: This victory
column2: the Great Stand at Navori
column3: ensured that everyone in Ionia knew the name of Xan Irelia
column4: and looked to her for leadership. Reluctantly
column5: she led the growing resistance for almost three years of grueling battle before her triumph at Dalu Bay. There
column6: she finally cornered the defeated Admiral Duqal
column7: and exacted the vengeance she had sought for so long.

column1: Though the war has long since ended
column2: Ionia has been permanently changed by it. The First Lands are now divided
column3: with rival factions fighting each other almost as bitterly as they did the Noxians. Many continue to look to Irelia for answers but
column4: while others might welcome such power
column5: Irelia remains uneasy with it.

column1: At heart
column2: she still yearns only to dance alone.

column1: 711;Vex;the Gloomist;Dawnbringer Vex;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Mage;;Mana;0;0;0;0;520.0;90;490.0;32.0;335;23;3.25;28.0;0.5;550;6.5;0.6;6.0;0.8;54.0;2.75;1.0;0.669;Mistral Bolt;Launch a damaging missile that accelerates mid-flight.;Personal Space;Gain a shield and damage nearby enemies.;Looming Darkness;Summon a damaging and slowing zone that applies Gloom to enemies.;Shadow Surge;Fire a missile that marks an enemy champion.  Recast to dash to them and deal damage.;Doom 'n Gloom;Vex periodically becomes empowered, causing her next basic Ability to fear enemies and interrupt dashes. Whenever a nearby enemy dashes, Vex applies a mark that can be consumed for bonus damage that also reduces the cooldown of her empowered state.;
In the black heart of the Shadow Isles
column2: a lone yordle trudges through the spectral fog
column3: content in its murky misery. With an endless supply of teen angst and a powerful shadow in tow
column4: Vex lives in her own self-made slice of gloom
column5: far from the revolting cheer of the “normie” world. Though she lacks ambition
column6: she is quick to strike down color and happiness
column7: stopping all would-be interlopers with her magical malaise.

column1: Growing up in Bandle City
column2: Vex never felt she belonged. The whimsy and color of the yordle realm was cloying to her. Despite the best efforts of her parents
column3: she never seemed to find her “yordle spirit” or any like-minded friends
column4: and chose to spend most of her time sulking in her room.

column1: There
column2: she found an unlikely soulmate in her own shadow. It was black (her favorite color)
column3: and it didn’t talk—the perfect companion for the sullen youth. She learned to entertain herself with the shadow
column4: performing gloomy pantomimes for her own amusement.

column1: Alas
column2: it was just a shadow
column3: incapable of shielding Vex from the loathsome cheerfulness that surrounded her. Surely something more lay in store. Something darker. Something sad. Something just like her.

column1: That something arrived in the form of a Harrowing
column2: thick clouds of Black Mist that billowed through Bandle City
column3: stirring its residents to panic. While most yordles fought valiantly to beat back the Mist
column4: Vex was intrigued by the foul miasma and began to follow it to its source.

column1: When she arrived in the Shadow Isles
column2: Vex couldn’t believe her eyes. Vast tracts of land and sea
column3: devoid of all life and color
column4: stretched out before her. Here
column5: she could finally sulk
column6: unbothered by the laughter and merriment of others.

column1: As the days passed
column2: Vex realized the Black Mist was having a strange effect on her. Her shadow had taken on a new ghostly persona—much more lively and expressive than its host—and her benign yordle magic had transformed into something far more sinister. Vex could now spread her misery far and wide.

column1: “Who made this wonderfully awful place?” she wondered.
Her question was soon answered when the Ruined King
column2: Viego
column3: appeared in the Isles
column4: seeking to spread his Mist to all corners of Runeterra. Upon meeting Vex
column5: Viego realized the yordle had a unique ability to spread despair
column6: making people more vulnerable to his Harrowing. Vex
column7: in turn
column8: was inspired by his vision for a world covered in Black Mist. The two became fast allies and set out to turn the entire world into a harrowed wasteland.

column1: Before Viego’s vision could be fully realized
column2: Vex discovered his ulterior motive: to reclaim the soul of his dead queen Isolde
column3: and reunite with her in matrimonial bliss. She shuddered in disgust
column4: feeling betrayed that the man she had trusted to kill the world’s happiness had
column5: in fact
column6: been seeking it himself. Vex left Viego to be defeated by the Sentinels of Light
column7: his dreams of a ruined world dashed upon the stones of the Camavoran wreckage. Alone once more
column8: she watched in disappointment as the world returned to the bright
column9: colorful place she had always hated. Finding a lasting melancholy was going to be tougher than she’d thought.

column1: She knew one last place she could go—a surefire way to achieve the misery she craved. She paid a visit to her parents in Bandle City
column2: eager to show them who she had become and bask in their disapproval.

column1: The young yordle watched as her parents turned dumbstruck
column2: still as tree stumps. Their expressions changed from shock
column3: to denial
column4: to reluctant acceptance.

column1: “Honey. We don’t understand... this
column2: ” said her mother
column3: motioning with her finger at Vex’s entire being.

column1: “But we love you unconditionally
column2: ” said her father. “And if you’re happy
column3: we’re happy for you.”

column1: Rolling her eyes
column2: Vex released a loud
column3: exasperated sigh. “You guys are the worst
column4: ” she moaned.

column1: She trudged out of her parents’ living room
column2: anxious to return to the Shadow Isles where she could sulk undisturbed.

column1: 246;Qiyana;Empress of the Elements;Battle Boss Qiyana;True Damage Qiyana;True Damage Qiyana Prestige Edition;Battle Queen Qiyana;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Assassin;Fighter;Mana;0;2;4;8;520.0;110;320.0;50.0;335;28;3.5;32.0;1.25;150;7.5;0.9;8.0;0.7;66.0;3.1;2.1;0.688;Elemental Wrath / Edge of Ixtal;Qiyana swings her weapon, dealing damage with a bonus effect based on her element.;Terrashape;Qiyana dashes to a location and enchants her weapon with an element. Her attacks and abilities deal bonus damage while her weapon is enchanted. ;Audacity;Qiyana dashes to an enemy, damaging them.;Supreme Display of Talent;Qiyana sends out a shockwave that detonates whatever elements she hits with it, stunning and damaging nearby enemies.;Royal Privilege;Qiyana's first basic attack or ability against each enemy deals bonus damage.;
In the jungle city of Ixaocan
column2: Qiyana plots her own ruthless path to the high seat of the Yun Tal. Last in line to succeed her parents
column3: she faces those who stand in her way with brash confidence and unprecedented mastery over elemental magic. With the land itself obeying her every command
column4: Qiyana sees herself as the greatest elementalist in the history of Ixaocan—and by that right
column5: deserving of not only a city
column6: but an empire.

column1: The youngest child in a ruling family
column2: Qiyana grew up believing she would never inherit the high seat of the Yun Tal. As her parents governed Ixaocan
column3: a city-state hidden deep in the jungles of Ixtal
column4: they raised their children to succeed them
column5: schooling them in the proud traditions of their isolated nation. Primed to rule before her
column6: Qiyana’s nine older sisters received most of the attention
column7: and she often longed to find her own meaningful place in the family.

column1: That place became clear the day young Qiyana began to learn the ancient elemental magic of Ixtal. Soon after she took up lessons
column2: she realized she was blessed with extraordinary talent. Though Qiyana was only seven years old
column3: she mastered advanced techniques within weeks
column4: while some of her older sisters had yet to grasp the basics after years of study.

column1: One by one
column2: Qiyana surpassed her sisters in the elemental arts
column3: and the more she progressed
column4: the more resentful she became. Why did her parents waste so much effort grooming her inferior siblings? Each time they were chosen to preside over the grand rituals that shrouded Ixtal from the outside world
column5: Qiyana lashed out in frustration
column6: picking fights to prove her worth. It wasn’t long before Inessa
column7: the eldest sister and immediate successor
column8: became the target for Qiyana’s aggression.

column1: Rather than defusing the conflict
column2: Inessa bristled at the disrespect from her sister
column3: who was twelve years her junior. As both grew older
column4: their words became increasingly heated
column5: culminating in physical threats from Inessa
column6: and a challenge from Qiyana: they should decide who was strongest in ritual combat
column7: for all of Ixaocan to see—and for the right to succeed their parents. Inessa accepted the challenge to teach her sister some much needed humility.

column1: When the contest was over
column2: Inessa was never to walk again
column3: while Qiyana stood unscathed.

column1: She was eager to take her place as the rightful heir
column2: but Qiyana’s parents were furious at her actions. They denied her the prize—tradition decreed that Qiyana would always be tenth in line to inherit the high seat of the Yun Tal. Though the news was bitter
column3: Qiyana soon discovered that the duel had made her elemental prowess known across all of Ixaocan. At last
column4: she had found what had long eluded her: respect.

column1: That respect quickly became an addiction. Qiyana felt a burning need to be recognized for her exceptional skill. In fact
column2: all of Ixaocan should stand proud with her
column3: and put the world in its place with their powerful elemental magic. Instead
column4: they were hiding from foreign explorers
column5: and miners who were uprooting the jungle on their borders.

column1: In her parents’ court
column2: Qiyana laid out her ambitions—to drive off the miners and restore the lands. Qiyana’s parents rejected the idea. Contact with the “outlanders” would bring hatred
column3: war
column4: and disease
column5: jeopardizing what their dynasty had protected for centuries. Qiyana stewed
column6: impatient to prove her strength to the world
column7: and determined to prove her parents wrong.

column1: Acting against their will
column2: Qiyana raided the mining site
column3: killing all the miners but one. As the man’s eyes shone brightly with fear
column4: Qiyana knew he would spread her message—he would tell everyone in his Pilt-over about the grand elementalist who destroyed their mine.

column1: In Ixaocan
column2: Qiyana gladly took credit for the slaughter
column3: infuriating her mother and father. They told her the Piltovan merchants were sending fresh miners and armsmen into the jungle. Qiyana’s parents would not risk their insubordinate daughter drawing even more outlanders toward their borders
column4: and regretfully ordered her imprisoned for her crime.

column1: Just as she was detained
column2: several elementalists of the court came to Qiyana’s defense. The elemental talent displayed in the jungle was unheard of
column3: and they convinced her parents that Qiyana should aid them in powering and defending the city. Qiyana was released
column4: once she swore renewed fealty to her elders
column5: and vowed to never cross paths with an outlander again.

column1: As a growing number of admirers throw their support behind Qiyana
column2: she has finally realized her true place in the world. She holds a power stronger than tradition
column3: and she will climb the ladder of succession by any means necessary.

column1: She is the greatest elementalist the world has ever seen. She is the inevitable ruler of Ixaocan
column2: and the future empress of all Ixtal.

column1: 134;Syndra;the Dark Sovereign;Justicar Syndra;Atlantean Syndra;Queen of Diamonds Syndra;Snow Day Syndra;SKT T1 Syndra;Star Guardian Syndra;Pool Party Syndra;Withered Rose Syndra;Bewitching Syndra;;;;;;;To maximize your ultimate's damage use it when there are many spheres on the battlefield.;After you hit an enemy champion with Force of Will follow up with Dark Sphere, they'll be slowed and have a hard time avoiding it.;Get one of your spells to rank 5 as quickly as possible, they gain powerful bonus effects at max rank.;;;Get boots early when playing against Syndra, they'll help you avoid many of her spells.;Attack Syndra after she's used Scatter the Weak, it has a long cooldown so she'll be vulnerable.;At max rank Syndra's spells gain bonus effects and change in appearance.;;Mage;Support;Mana;2;3;9;8;523.0;90;480.0;40.0;330;25;3.4;30.0;0.5;550;6.5;0.6;8.0;0.8;54.0;2.9;2.0;0.625;Dark Sphere;Syndra conjures a Dark Sphere dealing magic damage. The sphere remains and can be manipulated by her other powers.;Force of Will;Syndra picks up and throws a Dark Sphere or enemy minion dealing magic damage and slowing the Movement Speed of enemies.;Scatter the Weak;Syndra knocks enemies and Dark Spheres back dealing magic damage. Enemies hit by Dark Spheres become stunned.;Unleashed Power;Syndra bombards an enemy Champion with all of her Dark Spheres.;Transcendent;Syndra's spells gain extra effects at max rank.Dark Sphere: Bonus damage against champions.Force of Will: Bonus true damage.Scatter the Weak: Increased width.Unleashed Power: Increased range.;
Syndra is a fearsome Ionian mage with incredible power at her command. As a child
column2: she disturbed the village elders with her reckless and wild magic. She was sent away to be taught greater control
column3: but eventually discovered her supposed mentor was restraining her abilities. Forming her feelings of betrayal and hurt into dark spheres of energy
column4: Syndra has sworn to destroy all who would try to control her.

column1: As a young child of Navori
column2: Syndra was prone to distraction. She would often get lost in the magical beauty of a pond eclipsed in shadow
column3: or a trail of sugarbeetles climbing the wall. Whenever her chores at home went unfinished
column4: she was scolded harshly by her mother for her lack of focus. Syndra was even blamed when the milk soured
column5: or when any other minor misfortunes befell the family.

column1: Her older brother
column2: Evard
column3: teased her more than anyone. Syndra often fled to her favorite hiding spot—the ghost-willow
column4: a tree sacred to the people of her village. Alone
column5: she would whisper to the tree for hours
column6: seeking solace. Unbeknownst to her
column7: one warm evening
column8: Evard and his friends followed her in secret. They snickered at her childish tears. Her shame and rage grew as she tried to ignore their insults
column9: until one of them threw a clump of dirt at her head.

column1: Syndra could no longer control her emotions. All her anger erupted from deep within her
column2: in the form of darkly shining magical orbs
column3: heavy with the weight of her anguish.

column1: This powerful ability had been dormant until now. It flared with volatile strength
column2: the orbs like pearls of negativity that leached the spirit magic from the world around her
column3: draining the ghost-willow of its life essence. Evard and his friends backed away in horror as the ancient tree twisted
column4: its bark withering to a tarry black.

column1: Deprived of the ghost-willow
column2: the villagers grew concerned that their connection to the Spirit of Ionia had been severed
column3: and Syndra’s family was to blame. Forced to move on in search of a new home
column4: all had become fearful of her magic.

column1: After months of travel
column2: they reached the coast and encountered a hermit-priest named Konigen. He spoke of his home on the island of Fae’lor
column3: where he taught those who wished to learn to control their wild magic
column4: and Syndra’s family could see no other option—perhaps he could succeed where they had not. Young Syndra climbed the steps to a cliffside temple
column5: crafted long ago from dark stone
column6: and overlooking the sea. Though she missed her old life
column7: she tried to embrace her teacher’s wisdom
column8: and put all her effort into tempering her emotions.

column1: However
column2: Syndra grew frustrated as
column3: instead of gaining more control
column4: over the years her magic seemed to weaken. Konigen now locked himself away each morning
column5: meditating in solitude rather than teaching her anything new
column6: and so she confronted him. His teeth gritted with exhaustion
column7: he confessed that he was deliberately dampening her power
column8: for her own safety. Such negativity had a strange
column9: unpredictable effect on reality
column10: and Syndra had grown far beyond his ability as a mentor.

column1: She felt more betrayed than she ever had before. Konigen tried to calm her
column2: which only fueled her anger… and in that moment
column3: his focus was lost.

column1: The foundations of the temple shook. The morning light seemed to pale. Syndra rose from the floor
column2: as her frustrations surged within her. She snatched dark orbs from the air
column3: and cast them through her mentor’s body
column4: forcing him to feel all of her bitter outrage as he died.

column1: The ceiling gave way
column2: rubble raining down
column3: burying the sacred gardens in dust. Syndra turned her powers against what was left of the temple
column4: sending shockwaves throughout Fae’lor
column5: and draining raw magic from the island itself.

column1: Never had such negative energy been so concentrated in one place
column2: and it was the Spirit of Ionia that swelled to counter it. The bedrock opened up beneath Syndra
column3: dragging her down to a cavern deep underground—roots pulled her into a pool of living water to suppress her powers
column4: and trap her in a magical slumber.

column1: Syndra dreamed for what seemed an eternity. Most of the world forgot she had ever existed.
War with the Noxian empire divided the people of Ionia
column2: and Syndra was eventually awakened by those who had once stood guard over Fae’lor. Some came to kill her
column3: while others hoped she would aid them against Noxus
column4: but she unleashed chaos upon them all. She refused to be a pawn in someone else’s game. Ripping apart the walls of the fortress that had been built on top of her island prison
column5: Syndra raised the greatest tower into the skies to carry her far away.

column1: She would not be controlled. Not ever again.

Dangerous
column2: yet disarmingly precocious
column3: Annie is a child mage with immense pyromantic power. Even in the shadows of the mountains north of Noxus
column4: she is a magical outlier. Her natural affinity for fire manifested early in life through unpredictable
column5: emotional outbursts
column6: though she eventually learned to control these “playful tricks.” Her favorite includes the summoning of her beloved teddy bear
column7: Tibbers
column8: as a fiery protector. Lost in the perpetual innocence of childhood
column9: Annie wanders the dark forests
column10: always looking for someone to play with.

column1: Boram Darkwill’s last years on the throne were a time of great uncertainty for Noxus
column2: and many with an aptitude for magic left the capital for the relative peace of more distant provinces. Gregori the Gray and his wife
column3: a witch by the name of Amoline
column4: preferred to demonstrate their Noxian strength by taming the borderlands
column5: rather than partaking in the political intrigue of the noble houses.

column1: The young couple claimed a piece of land beyond the Ironspike Mountains to the north
column2: finishing their small home just before winter and the arrival of their first child. During their journey
column3: other colonists’ tales of the great shadow bears that once roamed the territory had captivated Amoline—now heavily pregnant
column4: she passed the time sitting near the fireplace
column5: creating a toy version of the protective creatures. Just as she finished sewing the last button eye on the stuffed bear
column6: the quickening of labor overcame her. Gregori remarked later that his daughter was eager to play with her new toy
column7: for there
column8: on an ember-warmed hearth
column9: Amoline brought Annie into the world.

column1: When Annie was still a toddler
column2: she and her father took ill. As night fell
column3: Annie began to burn with fever
column4: and soon she was so hot
column5: she could no longer be held in her mother’s arms. Amoline grew desperate
column6: deciding at last to fetch icy water from the nearby river. The next morning Gregori awoke
column7: weak and groggy from his sickness. In the crib
column8: a now-healthy Annie played with her stuffed bear
column9: Tibbers
column10: but Amoline was gone.

column1: Naïvely
column2: Annie believed her mother would one day return. Gregori would often find the girl sitting in her mother’s rocking chair near the hearth
column3: hugging Tibbers and staring into a crackling fire
column4: where he was sure there had been nothing but cold ashes. He chalked up these slips of the mind to the burden of parenting a child alone.

column1: Years passed
column2: bringing more colonists to the region. And in time
column3: Gregori met Leanna
column4: a woman seeking a new life outside the capital with her own young daughter
column5: Daisy.

column1: Annie was eager for a playmate
column2: but spoiled by the indulgences of being an only child
column3: so acclimation to her new stepfamily was difficult. Whenever Annie’s fiery temper erupted
column4: it left Leanna uneasy
column5: and quick to take her own daughter’s side. It fell to Gregori to keep an uneasy peace between the three.

column1: Unused to the dangers of the untamed borderlands
column2: Daisy’s playing ended in catastrophe for the family. Leanna
column3: of course
column4: blamed Annie for the loss of her daughter
column5: focusing her rage and grief on her stepdaughter’s most prized possession: Tibbers. Annie was horrified as the last physical memory of her mother was threatened. The girl’s terror grew to an unbridled rage
column6: releasing her latent and powerful pyromancy
column7: and the stuffed bear was brought to life in a maelstrom of protective fire.

column1: When the flames died down and the swirl of ash settled
column2: Annie was left orphaned and alone.

column1: Believing most city adults to be like her stepmother
column2: Annie has kept to the wilder parts of her frontier homeland. On occasion
column3: she will use her disarmingly adorable exterior to be taken in by some pioneer family long enough to be offered new clothes and a hot meal. However
column4: fire and death awaits anyone foolish enough to try parting Annie from the stuffed bear at her side.

column1: Kept safe by Tibbers
column2: she wanders the dark forests of Noxus
column3: oblivious to danger—and the dangers posed to others by her own unchecked power—hoping
column4: one day
column5: to find someone like her to play with.

column1: 117;Lulu;the Fae Sorceress;Bittersweet Lulu;Wicked Lulu;Dragon Trainer Lulu;Winter Wonder Lulu;Pool Party Lulu;Star Guardian Lulu;Cosmic Enchantress Lulu;Pajama Guardian Lulu;Space Groove Lulu;Space Groove Lulu Prestige Edition;;;;;;Glitterlance can be fired at odd angles depending on where your cursor is - Moving your cursor closer to Pix and Lulu will change your area of effect size considerably.;Consider casting Help, Pix! on ranged attackers for the Pix boost and Wild Growth on Tanks or Fighters for the added initiation power.;;;;The shots from Lulu's faerie can be intercepted - hide behind your minions to avoid the additional Faerie attacks.;Lulu excels when opponents heavily commit. Don't give her this chance! Use heavy harass tactics instead to force Lulu and her partner out of lane.;;;Support;Mage;Mana;4;5;7;5;525.0;74;350.0;55.0;330;29;3.7;30.0;0.5;550;6.0;0.6;11.0;0.6;47.0;2.6;2.25;0.625;Glitterlance;Pix and Lulu each fire a bolt of magical energy that damages and heavily slows all enemies it hits.;Whimsy;If cast on an ally, grants them Attack Speed and Movement Speed for a short time. If cast on an enemy, turns them into an adorable critter that can't attack or cast spells.;Help, Pix!;If cast on an ally, commands Pix to jump to an ally and shield them. He then follows them and aids their attacks. If cast on an enemy, commands Pix to jump to an enemy and damage them. He then follows them and grants you vision of that enemy.;Wild Growth;Lulu enlarges an ally, knocking nearby enemies into the air and granting the ally a large amount of bonus health. For the next few seconds, that ally gains an aura that slows nearby enemies.;Pix, Faerie Companion;Pix fires magical bolts of energy whenever the champion he's following attacks another enemy unit. These bolts are homing, but can be intercepted by other units.;
The yordle mage Lulu is known for conjuring dreamlike illusions and fanciful creatures as she roams Runeterra with her fairy companion Pix. Lulu shapes reality on a whim
column2: warping the fabric of the world
column3: and what she views as the constraints of this mundane
column4: physical realm. While others might consider her magic at best unnatural
column5: and at worst dangerous
column6: she believes everyone could use a touch of enchantment.

column1: Lulu was always a caring and deeply empathetic yordle
column2: who lived as much in her whimsical daydreams as in reality. One day
column3: while wandering the material realm
column4: she came upon what appeared to be a bird with a broken wing. She ran to help
column5: at which point the bird turned into a tiny
column6: mischievous fae spirit. Before she could react
column7: the faerie grabbed her walking stick and took off. Giggling
column8: Lulu gave chase.

column1: The spirit led her far into the forest. They went over boulders
column2: under logs
column3: and around ancient
column4: overgrown stone circles. The faerie darted into a cave hidden behind a waterfall
column5: and Lulu went after it. It flittered ahead
column6: always just out of reach.

column1: Down and down and down they went. Lulu tumbled and scrambled around twisted roots and glowing mushrooms
column2: and at some point they crossed over into the spirit realm without her realizing it. Their surroundings became progressively stranger and more disorienting; up became down
column3: forward became backward
column4: big became small.

column1: Finally
column2: after what seemed forever
column3: Lulu caught up with the faerie
column4: whose name
column5: she discovered
column6: was Pix.

column1: With a click of his tiny fingers
column2: Pix turned her humble walking stick into a spiraling staff
column3: and tossed it back to her. It sprouted leaves and flowers
column4: making Lulu gasp in delight. So began their forever-friendship
column5: built of mischief
column6: fun
column7: and love of nature.

column1: Pix had led her to the Glade.
Bandle City
column2: Lulu’s home
column3: was a bizarre and magical place that defied logic
column4: where time was meaningless and the natural laws of the material realm did not wholly apply. And yet the Glade was a place stranger still—it existed long before yordles came into the world
column5: and it was perhaps from the Glade that Bandle City itself sprung. A place of raw primordial magic
column6: it was hidden away so deeply that no yordle had ever found it… until now.

column1: Here
column2: Lulu’s own magic became wildly magnified. Laughing joyfully
column3: she discovered she could reshape her surroundings at will
column4: as well as alter her form to whatever she wanted. Everything and anything from her overactive imagination came to life.

column1: Lulu didn’t know if Pix had brought her here because he saw in her a kindred soul and simply wanted someone to play with
column2: or if the Glade needed her for some other purpose—but she fell in love with it instantly. Her life became one of endless creation and play
column3: and she soon forgot anything else existed.

column1: When finally she remembered
column2: it was like waking from a dream.

column1: She found herself back in the material realm
column2: not knowing if a single day had passed
column3: or a thousand years. To her surprise and joy
column4: she found that some of her newfound power had come with her
column5: allowing her to make small things large
column6: change colors to those more pleasing to her
column7: and cause creatures to fall spontaneously asleep. To Pix’s endless amusement
column8: she turned the mightiest beasts into tiny
column9: bewildered frogs or squirrels with a flick of her staff.

column1: Nevertheless
column2: she began to miss the Glade. She decided to go back
column3: but realized she didn’t remember the way. Pix was no help
column4: claiming to have forgotten as well
column5: though it was possible he just didn’t want to return quite yet.

column1: Unperturbed
column2: Lulu set out anyway. She was certain the route back to the Glade was always shifting
column3: making one way as good as another. She simply picked whatever direction took her fancy at any particular moment
column4: and even threw herself into seemingly terrible danger whenever it looked fun. Her travels took her far and wide
column5: and magic
column6: mayhem
column7: and mishap tended to follow wherever she went.

column1: In Demacia
column2: she freed a group of children from their boring history lessons
column3: and led them off into a nearby meadow. Her game resulted in them being turned into toadstools for a full turn of the moon
column4: while their desperate parents and the local militia searched for them in vain. It wasn’t quite what Lulu had intended
column5: but fun nonetheless. When the children finally returned home and told everyone what had happened
column6: no one believed them.

column1: In the borderlands of the Freljord
column2: Lulu thought it would be hilarious to change the weapons of two rival tribes into flowers just as they clashed
column3: which resulted in absolute chaos and confusion. More recently
column4: she has found herself happily lost in Ionia
column5: playing in the glowing everblooms of Qaelin
column6: and playing pranks on bewildered acolytes of the Order of Shadow
column7: who she thinks are far too serious for their own good.

column1: While Lulu seeks to return to the Glade
column2: and misses it
column3: she is happy
column4: for every day brings more opportunity for adventure and fun.

column1: And besides
column2: she has come to realize that she carries a part of the Glade in her heart
column3: wherever she goes.

column1: 50;Swain;the Noxian Grand General;Northern Front Swain;Bilgewater Swain;Tyrant Swain;Dragon Master Swain;Hextech Swain;Crystal Rose Swain;;;;;;;;;;If you're having trouble rooting an enemy with Nevermove, try throwing it at opponents when they are near their minions so the explosion surprises them.;While laning, try to use Death's Hand's piercing damage to damage opponents from a safe distance.;Vision of Empire is quite difficult to land on its own, look for skirmishes around the map where enemies may be distracted or crowd controlled so you can land it more easily.;Demonic Ascension may make Swain very hard to kill but he's pretty easy to get away from. Try building items that can slow opponents to keep them in range if their mobility is overwhelming.;;Swain's passive is very potent if you are immobilized. Make sure to be extra careful around enemies who have immobilizing effects.;High mobility counters all of Swain's basic abilities: Death's Hand does more damage the closer he is, Vision of Empire has a very long delay and Nevermove must start returning back to him to be dangerous.;Buying an item with Grievous Wounds will make Swain much easier to kill during his Demonic Ascension.;;Mage;Fighter;Mana;2;6;9;8;525.0;85;468.0;28.5;325;23;4.0;30.0;0.5;525;7.0;0.65;8.0;0.8;58.0;2.7;2.11;0.625;Death's Hand;Swain unleashes several bolts of eldritch power that pierce through enemies. Enemies hit take more damage for each bolt they are struck by.;Vision of Empire;Swain opens a demon eye that deals damage and slows enemies. Champions hit are revealed and also grant Swain a Soul Fragment.;Nevermove;Swain launches a wave of demonic power forward. It then returns to Swain and roots enemies it hits.;Demonic Ascension;Swain transforms into a demon and drains health from nearby enemy champions, minions, and neutral monsters. Swain can cast Demonflare to decimate nearby enemies with a nova of soulfire, dealing damage equal to a portion of the health he drained and ending his transformation.;Ravenous Flock;Swain's ravens collect Soul Fragments that heal him and permanently increase his maximum health. Swain can right-click an immobilized enemy champions to pull them closer to him, dealing damage and ripping out a Soul Fragment.;
Jericho Swain is the visionary ruler of Noxus
column2: an expansionist nation that reveres only strength. Though he was cast down and crippled in the Ionian wars
column3: his left arm severed
column4: he seized control of the empire with ruthless determination… and a new
column5: demonic hand. Now
column6: Swain commands from the front lines
column7: marching against a coming darkness that only he can see—in glimpses gathered by shadowy ravens from the corpses all around him. In a swirl of sacrifice and secrets
column8: the greatest secret of all is that the true enemy lies within.

column1: Born into a patrician family
column2: one of many to exist since the first walls were raised around Noxus
column3: Jericho Swain seemed destined for a life of privilege. The noble houses had played a key role in Boram Darkwill’s rise to power
column4: stoking rhetoric that their proud heritage was the nation’s greatest strength.

column1: However
column2: many hungered for greater influence
column3: plotting against Darkwill in a secret cabal united by nothing more than the symbol of a black rose. Uncovering their intrigue
column4: Swain personally executed the most prominent conspirators. Among them were his own parents
column5: whose whispers of a “pale woman” had first alerted him of the danger to Noxus
column6: which he valued more than house or kin.

column1: They sought a power
column2: a shapeless voice cackling in the darkness of the Immortal Bastion. Something like a raven’s caw…

column1: For exposing the cabal
column2: Swain was granted a commission in the Noxian army
column3: far from anything he had ever known. There
column4: he learned firsthand that the empire was not strong because of Noxians
column5: as he had believed
column6: but because of the way it could unite all men in spite of their origins. On the front lines
column7: a foreign slave could be the equal of a highborn noble.

column1: But still
column2: Swain found only darkness in the wake of each battle. Clouds of carrion crows…

column1: After securing the western borders
column2: Swain’s own reputation was secured in Shurima
column3: where his forces raised countless noxtoraa above the desert sands. Yet
column4: in time
column5: it became clear that greed was the sole purpose driving the empire forward. Fighting wars on too many fronts
column6: lusting over magical relics
column7: the aging Boram Darkwill was clearly growing unhinged.

column1: When Noxus invaded Ionia
column2: Darkwill began to move even more brazenly
column3: retasking entire warbands to scour the land for anything rumored to extend a mortal lifespan. With Swain’s forces depleted
column4: it became nearly impossible to engage the enemy. Finally
column5: at the Battle of the Placidium
column6: after luring the local militia into what should have been a trap
column7: Swain’s warhost was overrun. His veterans were routed
column8: and Swain was gravely wounded
column9: his knee shattered
column10: Ionian blades cleaving through his left arm.

column1: As he lay on the verge of death
column2: a raven approached to feed
column3: and Swain felt an old
column4: familiar darkness press upon him again. But he would not let it take him. He could not. Staring into the the bird’s eye
column5: he saw reflections of the evil strangling the heart of Noxus. A black rose. The pale woman... and her puppet emperor. Swain realized that he had not defeated the hidden cabal
column6: and they had betrayed him to what should have been his death
column7: after seducing Darkwill
column8: the man they failed to overthrow.

column1: All this was glimpsed
column2: not in the mind of a raven
column3: but something more. The power his parents had been seeking
column4: the demonic eyes blazing in the dark…

column1: Cast out of the military for his “failure
column2: ” considered nothing more than a cripple
column3: Swain set about uncovering what truly lay within the Immortal Bastion—an ancient entity
column4: preying upon the dying and consuming their secrets
column5: as it had attempted to consume his own. Swain stared into that darkness
column6: seeing what even it could not: a way to wield it.

column1: Though his meticulous preparations took many years
column2: Swain and his remaining allies seized control of Noxus in a single night. Physically restored by the demon
column3: he crushed Darkwill in full view of his followers
column4: leaving the throne shattered and empty.

column1: Swain’s vision for the future of Noxus is one of strength through unity. He has pulled back the warhosts from Darkwill’s unwinnable campaigns and
column2: with the establishment of the Trifarix
column3: ensured that no individual can rule unopposed. He embraces any who will pledge themselves to the empire—even the Black Rose
column4: though he knows
column5: in secret
column6: they still plot against him.

column1: Gathering knowledge as the demon did before him
column2: Swain has foreseen far greater dangers lurking just beyond. However
column3: many Noxians secretly wonder if the darkness they face will pale in comparison to the dark things Swain has done…

column1: The sacrifices are only beginning
column2: for the good of Noxus.

After a delay, magical energy explodes from the intersection point dealing damage.;Kingslayer;Sylas lunges at an enemy with magical force dealing damage and healing himself against enemy champions.;Abscond / Abduct;Sylas dashes to a location. Sylas can recast the ability to throw his chains out, pulling himself to an enemy he hits.;Hijack;Sylas steals the enemy's ultimate ability and can cast it freely.;Petricite Burst;After casting a spell, Sylas stores a charge of Petricite Burst. Sylas's basic attacks will expend a charge and whirl his energized chains around him dealing bonus magic damage to enemies hit. While Sylas has a charge of Petricite Burst, he gains attack speed. ;
Raised in one of Demacia’s lesser quarters
column2: Sylas of Dregbourne has come to symbolize the darker side of the Great City. As a boy
column3: his ability to root out hidden sorcery caught the attention of the notorious mageseekers
column4: who eventually imprisoned him for turning those same powers against them. Having now broken free
column5: Sylas lives as a hardened revolutionary
column6: using the magic of those around him to destroy the kingdom he once served… and his band of outcast mage followers seems to grow by the day.

column1: As a mage born to a poor Demacian family
column2: Sylas of Dregbourne was perhaps doomed from the start. Despite their low social standing
column3: his parents were firm believers in their country’s ideals. So
column4: when they discovered their son was “afflicted” with magical abilities
column5: they convinced him to turn himself in to the kingdom’s mageseekers.

column1: Noting the boy’s curious ability to sense magic
column2: they used Sylas to identify other mages living among the citizenry. For the first time in his life he felt he had a future
column3: a life in service to his country
column4: and he performed these duties faithfully. He was proud
column5: but lonely—forbidden from associating with anyone but his handlers.

column1: Through his work
column2: Sylas began to notice that magic was far more prevalent than Demacia cared to admit. He could sense glimmers of hidden power even among the wealthy and prominent… some of whom were the most outspoken decriers of mages. But while the poor were punished for their afflictions
column3: the elite seemed above the law
column4: and this hypocrisy planted the first seeds of doubt in Sylas’ mind.

column1: Those doubts finally bloomed in one deadly
column2: fateful event
column3: when Sylas and his handlers encountered a mage living in hiding in the countryside. After discovering it was only a young girl
column4: Sylas took pity on her. When he tried to shield the child from the mageseekers
column5: he accidentally brushed against her skin. The girl’s magic rushed through Sylas’s body—but rather than killing him
column6: it shot forth from his hands in raw
column7: uncontrolled bursts. It was a talent he did not know he possessed
column8: and it resulted in the deaths of three people
column9: including his mageseeker mentor.

column1: Knowing he would be called a murderer
column2: Sylas went on the run
column3: and quickly gained notoriety as one of the most dangerous mages in Demacia. Indeed
column4: when the mageseekers found him
column5: they showed no mercy.

column1: Though he was still just a youth
column2: Sylas was sentenced to life imprisonment.

column1: He languished in the darkest depths of the mageseeker compound
column2: forced to wear heavy shackles of magic-dampening petricite. Robbed of his arcane sight
column3: his heart turned as hard as the stone that bound him
column4: and he dreamed of vengeance on all who had put him there.

column1: After fifteen wretched years
column2: a young volunteer from the Illuminators named Luxanna began to visit him. Even with his shackles
column3: Sylas recognized her as a singularly powerful mage
column4: and over time the two forged an unusual and secretive bond. In exchange for Sylas’ knowledge of the control of magic
column5: Lux educated him about the world outside his cell
column6: and brought him whatever books he desired.

column1: Eventually
column2: through careful manipulation
column3: he convinced the girl to smuggle a forbidden tome into his cell—the original writings of the great sculptor Durand
column4: detailing his work with petricite.

column1: The work revealed the secrets of the stone to Sylas. It was the foundation of Demacia’s defenses against harmful sorcery
column2: but he came to see that it did not suppress magic
column3: but absorb it.

column1: And if the power was held within the petricite
column2: Sylas wondered
column3: could he release it…?

column1: All he needed was a source of magic. A source like Lux.
But she never visited Sylas again. Her family
column2: the immensely powerful Crownguards
column3: had learned of their contact
column4: and were furious that Lux had broken the law to help this vile criminal. Without explanation
column5: it was arranged for Sylas to be hanged.

column1: At the gallows
column2: Lux pleaded for her friend’s life
column3: but her cries fell on deaf ears. As the hangman pushed past her to tighten the noose
column4: Sylas managed to touch against Lux with his chains. As he had predicted
column5: her power surged into the petricite shackles
column6: ready for him to unleash—and with that stolen magic
column7: Sylas blasted his way free
column8: sparing only the terrified young Crownguard.

column1: He left the mageseeker compound not as an outcast
column2: but as a new
column3: defiant symbol of the broken and persecuted in Demacia. Traveling the kingdom in secret
column4: he has amassed a following of exiled mages
column5: all now aligned toward a common goal: to topple the throne
column6: and demolish the oppressive system that has made them suffer for so long.
