Targets in the middle receive additional damage and a stronger slow.;Shocking Orb;Deals magic damage to an enemy and stuns them.;Rite of the Arcane;Xerath immobilizes himself and gains numerous long-range barrages.;Mana Surge;Xerath's basic attacks periodically restore Mana.;
Xerath is an Ascended Magus of ancient Shurima
column2: a being of arcane energy writhing in the broken shards of a magical sarcophagus. For millennia
column3: he was trapped beneath the desert sands
column4: but the rise of Shurima freed him from his ancient prison. Driven insane with power
column5: he now seeks to take what he believes is rightfully his and replace the upstart civilizations of the world with one fashioned in his image.

column1: The boy who would eventually be called Xerath was born a nameless slave in Shurima thousands of years ago. He was the son of captured scholars
column2: with only the prospect of endless servitude ahead. His mother taught him letters and numbers
column3: while his father told him tales from history in the hopes that such skills might allow him a better life. The boy vowed he would not end up bent-backed and whipped like every other slave.

column1: When the boy’s father was crippled during the excavations for the foundations of a monument to the Emperor’s favorite horse
column2: he was left to die at the site of the accident. Fearing her son would suffer a similar fate
column3: the boy’s mother begged an esteemed tomb architect to take him on as an apprentice. Though at first reluctant
column4: the architect was impressed with the boy’s eye for detail and innate understanding of mathematics and language
column5: and accepted. The boy never saw his mother again.

column1: He was a swift learner and his master dispatched him on errands to the Great Library of Nasus to retrieve specific texts and plans on an almost daily basis. On one trip
column2: the boy met Azir
column3: the least-favored son of the emperor. Azir was struggling to read a difficult passage in an ancient text
column4: and
column5: despite knowing that to talk to royalty was to invite death
column6: the boy paused to help the young prince with its complex grammar. In that moment
column7: a tentative friendship was established
column8: and over the coming months that friendship only grew stronger.

column1: Though slaves were forbidden names
column2: Azir gave one to the boy. He named him Xerath
column3: which means ‘one who shares
column4: ’ though that name was only ever spoken between the two boys. Azir saw to it that Xerath was appointed to his household’s slaves
column5: and made him his personal attendant. Their shared love of knowledge saw them devour texts from the library and become as close as brothers. Xerath was Azir’s constant companion
column6: learning all he could from this new proximity to culture
column7: power and knowledge
column8: finally daring to dream that Azir might one day free him.

column1: On the annual tour of the emperor’s dominion
column2: assassins struck the royal caravan as it spent the night at a well-known oasis. Xerath saved Azir from an assassin’s blade
column3: but Azir’s brothers were all slain
column4: leaving the young prince a heartbeat away from Shurima’s throne. As a slave
column5: Xerath could expect no reward for his deed
column6: but Azir promised that one day they would be as brothers.

column1: In the wake of the assassination attempt
column2: Shurima endured years of horror and fear of the emperor’s retribution. Xerath knew enough of history and the workings of the Shuriman court to understand that Azir’s life hung by the slenderest of threads. That he was heir to the throne meant nothing
column3: for the emperor hated Azir for living while his more beloved sons had died. Of more immediate danger
column4: the emperor’s wife was still young enough to bear other children
column5: and thus far she had borne many healthy sons. The odds were good that she would produce another male heir for her husband
column6: and as soon as she did
column7: Azir’s life was forfeit.

column1: Though Azir was a scholar at heart
column2: Xerath persuaded him that to survive
column3: he must also learn to fight. This Azir did
column4: and in return the young heir elevated Xerath
column5: insisting he continue his education. Both youths excelled
column6: and Xerath proved to be an exceptionally gifted pupil
column7: one who took to the pursuit of knowledge with gusto. Xerath became Azir’s confidant and right hand man
column8: a position unheard of for a mere slave. This position gave him great - and some said
column9: undue - influence over the young prince
column10: who came to rely on Xerath’s judgement more each day.

column1: Xerath bent his every effort into seeking out knowledge wherever he could find it
column2: no matter the cost
column3: no matter its source. He unlocked long-sealed libraries
column4: delved into forgotten vaults and consulted with mystics entombed deep beneath the sands; all to further his knowledge and ambition
column5: both of which grew with unchecked rapidity. Whenever the whispers around court that spoke of his delving into unsavory places grew too loud to ignore
column6: he would find cunning means to silence them. That Azir never mentioned these whispers was
column7: to Xerath
column8: tacit approval of how he was keeping his emperor safe.

column1: Years passed
column2: and Xerath took ever darker steps to keep the emperor’s wife from carrying a child to term
column3: using his nascent magical abilities to corrupt every infant in the womb. Without rivals to the throne
column4: Azir would be safe. When rumors of a curse arose
column5: Xerath ensured they were never spoken again
column6: and oft-times those who had voiced such suspicions vanished without trace. By now
column7: Xerath’s desire to escape his roots as a slave had become a burning ambition to achieve power of his own
column8: though he justified every murderous act by telling himself he was doing it to keep his friend alive.

column1: Despite Xerath’s best efforts to thwart the queen’s midwives
column2: a new prince of Shurima was brought into the world
column3: but on the night of his birth
column4: Xerath used his growing magical powers to summon the elemental spirits of the deep desert and craft a terrible storm. Xerath brought bolt after bolt of lightning down upon the queen’s chambers
column5: reducing it to burning rubble and killing the queen and her newborn son. The emperor rushed to his queen’s chambers
column6: only to be confronted by Xerath
column7: his hands ablaze with arcane power. The emperor’s guards attacked
column8: but Xerath burned them and the emperor to cindered skeletons. Xerath ensured that the mages of a conquered territory were blamed for these deaths
column9: and Azir’s first act upon taking the throne was to lead a brutal campaign of retribution against its people.

column1: Azir was crowned emperor of Shurima with Xerath at his side
column2: the boy who had once been a nameless slave. Xerath had long dreamed of this moment
column3: and expected Azir to end slavery in Shurima before finally naming him brother. Azir did none of these things
column4: continuing to expand his empire’s borders and deflecting Xerath’s overtures regarding the end of slavery. To Xerath
column5: this was further proof of Shurima’s moral bankruptcy
column6: and he raged at Azir’s breaking of his promise. Azir’s face was thunderous as he reminded Xerath that he was a slave and should remember his place. Something once noble died in Xerath that day
column7: but he bowed in supplication
column8: outwardly accepting Azir’s decision. As Azir continued his campaigns of conquest
column9: Xerath remained at his side
column10: but his every action was carefully designed to increase his influence over a realm he now planned to take for himself. To steal an empire was no small thing
column11: and Xerath knew he needed more power.

column1: The famous legend of Renekton’s Ascension revealed that a mortal did not have to be chosen by the Sun Priests
column2: that anyone could rise up. So Xerath plotted to steal the power of Ascension. No slave could ever stand upon the sun disc
column3: so Xerath fed the Emperor’s vanity
column4: inflating his ego and filling his head with impossible visions of a world-spanning empire. But such a dream would only be possible if Azir could Ascend as the greatest heroes of Shurima had before. In time Xerath’s perseverance paid off
column5: and Azir announced he would undertake the Ascension ritual
column6: that he had earned the right to stand alongside Nasus and Renekton as an Ascended being. The Sun Priests protested
column7: but such was Azir’s hubris that he ordered them to comply on pain of torture and death.

column1: The Day of Ascension arrived and Azir marched toward the Dais of Ascension with Xerath at his side. Nasus and Renekton were absent from the day’s events
column2: for Xerath had arranged a distraction for them by weakening the seal on a magical sarcophagus containing a beast of living fire. When that creature finally broke its bindings
column3: Renekton and Nasus were the only warriors capable of defeating it. Thus Xerath had stripped Azir of the only two beings who might save him from what was to come.

column1: Azir stood beneath the sun disc and in the final moment before the priests began the ritual
column2: events took a turn Xerath had not anticipated. The emperor turned to Xerath and told him that he was now a free man. He and all Shurima’s slaves were now released from their bonds of servitude. He embraced Xerath before naming him his eternal brother. Xerath was stunned. He had been given everything he desired
column3: but the success of his plans hinged upon Azir’s death and nothing was going to dissuade him from acting. Too many pieces were in motion and Xerath had already sacrificed too much to turn back now – no matter how much that part of him wanted to. The emperor’s words pierced the bitterness enclosing Xerath’s heart
column4: but came decades too late. Unaware of his peril
column5: Azir turned as the priests began the ritual and brought down the awesome power of the sun.

column1: With a roar of anger and grief combined
column2: Xerath blasted Azir from his place on the dais
column3: watching through tears as his former friend burned to ash. Xerath took Azir’s place and the light of the sun filled him
column4: reshaping his flesh into that of an Ascended being. But the power of the ritual was not his to take
column5: and the consequences of his betrayal of Azir were devastating. The unbound power of the sun all but destroyed Shurima
column6: sundering its temples and bringing ruination upon the city. Azir’s people were consumed in a terrifying conflagration as the desert rose up to claim the city. The sun disc fell and an empire built by generations of emperors was undone in a single day.

column1: Even as the city burned
column2: Xerath held the sun priests in the grip of his magic
column3: preventing them from ending the ritual. The energies filling him were immense
column4: alloying with his dark sorcery to create a being of incredible power. As he drew ever more of the sun’s power into his body
column5: his mortal flesh was consumed and remade as a glowing vortex of arcane power.

column1: With Xerath’s treachery revealed
column2: Renekton and Nasus rushed to the epicenter of the magical storm destroying the city. They bore with them the magical sarcophagus that had imprisoned the spirit of eternal fire. The Ascended brothers fought their way to the Dais of Ascension just as Xerath fell from the deadly radiance engulfing the city. Before the newly-Ascended Magus could react
column3: they hurled his crackling body within the sarcophagus and sealed it once more with blessed chains and powerful sigils of binding.

column1: But it was not enough. Xerath’s power had been great as a mortal
column2: and that power - combined with the gift of Ascension - made him all but invincible. He shattered the sarcophagus
column3: though its shards and chains remained bound to him. Renekton and Nasus hurled themselves at Xerath
column4: but such was his newfound strength that he fought them both to a standstill. The battle raged throughout the collapsing city
column5: destroying what had not already sunk beneath the sands. The brothers were able to drag Xerath toward the Tomb of Emperors
column6: the greatest mausoleum of Shurima
column7: a vault whose locks and wards were impossible to break and which answered only to the blood of emperors. Renekton wrestled Xerath within and called upon Nasus to seal the vault behind them. Nasus did so with heavy heart
column8: knowing it was the only way to prevent Xerath’s escape. Renekton and Xerath fell into eternal darkness
column9: and there they remained
column10: locked in an endless battle as the once-great civilization of Shurima collapsed.

column1: Uncounted centuries passed and
column2: in time
column3: even Renekton’s mighty strength waned
column4: leaving him vulnerable to Xerath’s influence. With poisoned lies and illusions
column5: Xerath twisted Renekton’s mind
column6: filling him with misplaced bitterness toward Nasus
column7: the faithless brother who had - in Xerath’s fictive narrative - abandoned him so long ago.

column1: When the Tomb of Emperors was finally discovered beneath the desert and broken open by Sivir and Cassiopeia
column2: both Xerath and Renekton were freed in an explosion of sand and rubble. Sensing his brother still lived
column3: Renekton charged from the ruins
column4: his distorted mind leaving him little better than a savage beast. After an age lost to legend
column5: Shurima was reborn
column6: and as it rose majestically from the desert
column7: Xerath felt another soul return to life beneath the sand
column8: one he had thought long dead. Azir was also newly resurrected as one of the Ascended
column9: and Xerath knew there could be no peace for either of them while the other yet lived.

column1: Xerath sought the heart of the desert to regain his strength and understand how the world had changed in the millennia since his imprisonment. His stolen power grew with every passing moment
column2: and he beheld a world ripe for conquest
column3: a world brimming with mortals ready to worship at the feet of a new and terrible god.

column1: Yet for all his newfound power
column2: however far he has come from that nameless slave boy
column3: a part of Xerath knows he is still in chains.

column1: 103;Ahri;the Nine-Tailed Fox;Dynasty Ahri;Midnight Ahri;Foxfire Ahri;Popstar Ahri;Challenger Ahri;Academy Ahri;Arcade Ahri;Star Guardian Ahri;K/DA Ahri;K/DA Ahri Prestige Edition;Elderwood Ahri;Spirit Blossom Ahri;K/DA ALL OUT Ahri;Coven Ahri;;Use Charm to set up your combos, it will make landing Orb of Deception and Fox-Fire dramatically easier.;Initiate team fights using Charm, and chase down stragglers with Spirit Rush.;Spirit Rush enables Ahri's abilities, it opens up paths for Charm, helps double hitting with Orb of Deception, and closes to make use of Fox-Fire.;;;Ahri's survivability is dramatically reduced when her Ultimate, Spirit Rush, is down.;Stay behind minions to make Charm difficult to land, this will reduce Ahri's damage potential significantly.;;;Mage;Assassin;Mana;3;4;8;5;526.0;92;418.0;25.0;330;21;3.5;30.0;0.5;550;5.5;0.6;8.0;0.8;53.0;3.0;2.0;0.668;Orb of Deception;Ahri sends out and pulls back her orb, dealing magic damage on the way out and true damage on the way back. ;Fox-Fire;Ahri gains a brief burst of movement speed and releases three fox-fires, that lock onto and attack nearby enemies.;Charm;Ahri blows a kiss that damages and charms an enemy it encounters, instantly stopping movement abilities and causing them to walk harmlessly towards her. The target temporarily takes increased damage from Ahri.;Spirit Rush;Ahri dashes forward and fires essence bolts, damaging nearby enemies. Spirit Rush can be cast up to three times before going on cooldown.;Essence Theft;When Ahri strikes 9 enemies with her abilities, her next ability also heals her for each enemy hit.;
Innately connected to the latent power of Runeterra
column2: Ahri is a vastaya who can reshape magic into orbs of raw energy. She revels in toying with her prey by manipulating their emotions before devouring their life essence. Despite her predatory nature
column3: Ahri retains a sense of empathy as she receives flashes of memory from each soul she consumes.

column1: Abandoned in the snowy woods of northern Ionia
column2: Ahri knew nothing of her original family save the token they left her: a pair of matching gemstones. She joined a pack of icefoxes as they stalked prey on their morning hunt
column3: and before long they adopted her as one of their own. With no one to teach her the magic of her kind
column4: Ahri instinctively learned to draw it from the world around her
column5: shaping destructive spheres and quickening her reflexes to take down prey. If she was close enough
column6: she could even soothe a deer into a state of tranquility
column7: so much that it remained serene even as she sank her teeth into its flesh.

column1: Ahri first encountered humans when a troop of foreign soldiers camped near her den. Their behaviors were strange to Ahri and
column2: curious to learn more
column3: she watched them from afar. She was especially drawn to a hunter who
column4: unlike his wasteful companions
column5: used every part of the animals he killed
column6: reminding her of her fox family.

column1: When the hunter was wounded by an arrow
column2: Ahri felt his life seeping away. She instinctively devoured the essence leaving his body
column3: and gained brief flashes of his memories—the lover he had lost in battle
column4: his children from a strange land of iron and stone. She found she could push his emotions from fear to sorrow to joy
column5: and charmed him with visions of a sun-soaked meadow as he died.

column1: Euphoric at the rush of absorbing the hunter’s life
column2: Ahri felt more alive than ever
column3: and traveled Ionia in search of more victims. She relished toying with her prey
column4: shifting their emotions before consuming their life essence. She alternated between dazzling them with visions of beauty
column5: hallucinations of deep longing
column6: and occasionally dreams colored by raw sorrow.

column1: She grew drunk with memories that were not her own
column2: and exhilarated in the lives of others. Through stolen visions
column3: Ahri watched through their eyes as they pledged fealty to a temple of shadow
column4: sacrificed offerings to a deity of the sun incarnate
column5: encountered an avian tribe of vastaya that spoke only in song
column6: and glimpsed mountainous landscapes unlike any she had seen. She experienced heartbreak and elation in tantalizing flashes that left her craving more
column7: and wept at the massacres of Ionian villagers at the hands of Noxian invaders.

column1: Ahri was surprised when the memories led her to discover the tale of an unearthly fox demon. As she absorbed more life essence
column2: she grew to identify more and more with her victims
column3: and felt guilty at ending so many lives. She feared that the myths about her were true—she was no more than a cruel monster. But whenever too much time passed between feedings
column4: she sensed her own power fade
column5: and could not help but partake once more.

column1: Ahri tested her self-control by consuming small quantities of life essence
column2: enough to absorb a memory or two but not enough to kill. She was successful
column3: for a time
column4: but was tortured by her unending hunger and soon succumbed to temptation
column5: indulging in the dreams of an entire coastal village.

column1: Tormented by her mistake
column2: Ahri could not forgive herself and felt a deep sorrow that forced her to question her own existence. She withdrew to the forest caves
column3: isolating herself in hopes of controlling her relentless desire. Years later she emerged
column4: determined to experience every facet of life through her own eyes. Though she might indulge in occasional essence
column5: she resisted consuming entire lives. With the twin gemstones as the only clue to her origin
column6: Ahri set out in search of others like her. No more would she rely on borrowed memories and unfamiliar dreams.

column1: 7;LeBlanc;the Deceiver;Wicked LeBlanc;Prestigious LeBlanc;Mistletoe LeBlanc;Ravenborn LeBlanc;Elderwood LeBlanc;Program LeBlanc;iG LeBlanc;Coven LeBlanc;Championship LeBlanc;Coven LeBlanc Prestige Edition;;;;;;Distortion allows you to be aggressive with your other spells while being able to return to safety.;Using Distortion can help your positioning to land Ethereal Chains.;You can chain Sigil of Malice and Ethereal Chains to prevent characters with blink from escaping for up to 4 seconds.;;;LeBlanc's ultimate can create fake LeBlancs during her spellcast or, rarely, at a distant position. ;The fake LeBlanc created at a distance will always run at the nearest Champion, cast a harmless spell, then immediately disappear.;Attacking LeBlanc first avoids most of her tricks, especially if she's recently used her dash, Distortion.;Stunning or silencing LeBlanc will prevent her from activating the return part of Distortion.;Assassin;Mage;Mana;1;4;10;9;528.0;97;334.0;50.0;340;22;3.5;30.0;0.5;525;7.5;0.55;6.0;0.8;55.0;3.5;1.4;0.625;Sigil of Malice;LeBlanc projects a sigil, dealing damage and marking the target for 3.5 seconds. Damaging the marked target with an ability detonates the sigil, dealing additional damage.;Distortion;LeBlanc dashes to a location, dealing damage to enemies near her destination. For the next 4 seconds, activate Distortion again to return LeBlanc to her starting location.;Ethereal Chains;LeBlanc launches a chain that shackles the first enemy hit. If the target remains shackled for 1.5 seconds, LeBlanc roots them and deals additional damage.;Mimic;LeBlanc casts a mimicked version of one of her basic spells.;Mirror Image;When LeBlanc drops below 40% Health, she becomes invisible for 1 second and creates a Mirror Image that deals no damage and lasts for up to 8 seconds.;
Matron of the Black Rose
column2: LeBlanc’s identity is as intangible as the whispers that describe her
column3: as ephemeral as the illusions that give her shape. Perhaps it is unknown even to herself
column4: after so many centuries of mimicry and deception…

column1: Remnants of an order that has existed far longer than Noxus itself
column2: initiates of the Black Rose have schemed from the shadows for centuries
column3: drawing the rich and powerful to their ranks. Though they do not often learn the origins of their matron
column4: many have uncovered legends of a pale sorceress who aided the broken barbarian tribes
column5: in their struggle against the infamous Iron Revenant subjugating lands already ravaged by the darkin. Even today
column6: his name is whispered in fear: Mordekaiser.

column1: Uniquely skilled among the revenant’s inner circle before she betrayed him
column2: the sorceress pledged to neutralize the source of his power
column3: the Immortal Bastion
column4: cutting him off from the well of death that fueled his nightmarish empire. Yet
column5: even as the barbarians built an empire of their own in the bastion’s shadow
column6: they failed to realize that the arcane secrets it held had not completely been locked away. The pale sorceress had always been gifted at illusion
column7: and her greatest trick was to make Noxus forget the dark power roiling in its own heart
column8: before she was burned from the pages of history around the time of the Rune Wars.

column1: The Black Rose exists now to further the clandestine interests of those who can wield such magic—with its rank-and-file composed of mundane nobles
column2: drawn to rumors of miracles
column3: kept in thrall and ruthlessly exploited. Even the most powerful military commander could only ever serve the cult’s true masters
column4: as they fight one another for influence in games of intrigue and conquest
column5: both in the Noxian capital and beyond its borders.

column1: For centuries
column2: LeBlanc has served in secret as an advisor to foreign dignitaries
column3: appearing in many nations at once
column4: her illusions driving order into chaos. Rumors of a new matron rising with each generation only raise further questions—which is the “true” version of herself? When she speaks
column5: is it with her own voice? And what will the price be
column6: for the favor she offers?

column1: Boram Darkwill was but the latest to learn this last answer for himself. Though the Black Rose had aided his bid for the throne
column2: he refused the counsel of their hand-picked advisors
column3: requiring LeBlanc to take drastic measures. Manipulating a young nobleman named Jericho Swain into revealing the cult’s involvement
column4: LeBlanc allowed herself to be executed along with the most prominent conspirators… or at least
column5: so it appeared. In time
column6: she reached out to Darkwill herself
column7: and found an increasingly paranoid ruler
column8: fearful of his own mortality.

column1: After promising him the secrets to extend his life
column2: LeBlanc slowly poisoned Darkwill’s mind
column3: even as she empowered him. Under his rule
column4: the Noxian reverence of strength became something far more sinister
column5: and together they ensured Swain’s legend would end in disgrace on the battlefields of Ionia.

column1: But Swain
column2: emboldened by forbidden lore from within the Immortal Bastion
column3: did something wholly unexpected
column4: managing to drag Darkwill from the throne and seize Noxus for himself. This new Grand General was not interested in his own legacy
column5: but the glory of the empire—and such a man could not so easily be corrupted. After countless centuries
column6: LeBlanc wondered
column7: had she finally found a worthy nemesis?

column1: Her actions have pushed Runeterra to the brink of all-out war many times. In the wake of desperate campaigns across the Freljord
column2: on Targon’s peaks
column3: and deep in Shurima’s deserts
column4: the darkest magic has begun to spread once more
column5: circling closer and closer to Noxus. Whether LeBlanc is still the same pale sorceress who betrayed the Iron Revenant
column6: or merely one of countless hollow reflections
column7: her influence clearly stems from ancient roots.

column1: The Black Rose has yet to truly bloom.

17;Teemo;the Swift Scout;Happy Elf Teemo;Recon Teemo;Badger Teemo;Astronaut Teemo;Cottontail Teemo;Super Teemo;Panda Teemo;Omega Squad Teemo;Little Devil Teemo;Beemo;Spirit Blossom Teemo;Spirit Blossom Teemo Prestige Edition;;;;Teemo's mushrooms can be used to farm creep waves very effectively.;Place your mushrooms at key locations on the map, such as by the Dragon or Baron Nashor, to reveal when your enemies might be attempting to kill them.;;;;Teemo's Toxic Shot punishes players who get hit and back out, so stay at a safe range until you're ready to commit.;It can be valuable to use Oracle's Lens(Trinket) to destroy mushrooms around key locations.;;;Marksman;Assassin;Mana;5;3;7;6;528.0;90;334.0;20.0;330;24;3.75;30.0;0.5;500;5.5;0.65;9.6;0.45;54.0;3.0;3.38;0.69;Blinding Dart;Obscures an enemy's vision with a powerful venom, dealing damage to the target unit and blinding it for the duration.;Move Quick;Teemo scampers around, passively increasing his Move Speed until he is struck by an enemy champion or turret.
