Teemo is a legend among his yordle brothers and sisters in Bandle City. As far as yordles are concerned
column2: there is something just slightly off about him. While Teemo enjoys the companionship of other yordles
column3: he also insists on frequent solo missions in the ongoing defense of Bandle City. Despite his genuinely warm personality
column4: something switches off inside Teemo's mind during combat so that the lives he must end while on patrol do not burden him. Even as a young recruit
column5: the drill instructors and other trainees found it a little disconcerting that
column6: while Teemo was normally charming and kind
column7: he turned deadly serious and highly efficient the minute combat exercises began. Teemo's superiors quickly steered him toward the Scouts of the Mothership
column8: which is one of Bandle City's most distinguished Special Forces unit alongside the Megling Commandos.

column1: While most yordles do not handle solo scouting missions with a great deal of finesse
column2: Teemo is remarkably efficient at them. His record of success in defending Bandle City from infiltrators easily makes him one of the most dangerous yordles alive
column3: though you'd never know it by having a cup of honey mead with him at his favorite inn. His signature weapon - a blowgun - uses a rare ajunta poison he personally gathers from the jungles of Kumungu. To help cope with his lengthy periods of isolation
column4: Teemo recently struck up a friendship with Tristana
column5: a fellow member of Bandle City's Special Forces. Teemo is a pint-sized foe that many have come to fear and whose small size belies his fearsome resolve.

column1: 81;Ezreal;the Prodigal Explorer;Nottingham Ezreal;Striker Ezreal;Frosted Ezreal;Explorer Ezreal;Pulsefire Ezreal;TPA Ezreal;Debonair Ezreal;Ace of Spades Ezreal;Arcade Ezreal;Star Guardian Ezreal;SSG Ezreal;Pajama Guardian Ezreal;Battle Academia Ezreal;PsyOps Ezreal;PsyOps Ezreal Prestige Edition;Use Arcane Shift to help line up your other skill shots.;You can play Ezreal either as a Attack Damage carry or Ability Power carry depending on how you build him.;You can line up Trueshot Barrage to hit multiple minion waves or even Monsters.;;;Ezreal is a very fragile champion so take the fight to him.;Ezreal is completely skill shot based, so make sure to keep minions in between you.;Mystic Shot applies on-hit effects including the Crest of Cinders.;;Marksman;Mage;Mana;7;2;6;7;530.0;88;375.0;70.0;325;24;3.5;30.0;0.5;550;4.0;0.65;8.5;0.65;60.0;2.5;2.5;0.625;Mystic Shot;Ezreal fires a damaging bolt of energy which reduces all of his cooldowns slightly if it strikes an enemy unit.;Essence Flux;Ezreal fires an orb that sticks to the first champion or objective hit. If Ezreal hits an enemy with the orb, it detonates and deals damage.;Arcane Shift;Ezreal teleports to a target nearby location and fires a homing bolt which strikes the nearest enemy unit. Prioritizes enemies stuck with Essence Flux.;Trueshot Barrage;Ezreal winds up before firing a powerful barrage of energy that deals massive damage to each unit it passes through (damage is reduced for minions and non-epic monsters).;Rising Spell Force;Ezreal gains increasing Attack Speed each time he successfully hits a spell, stacking up to 5 times.;
A dashing adventurer
column2: unknowingly gifted in the magical arts
column3: Ezreal raids long-lost catacombs
column4: tangles with ancient curses
column5: and overcomes seemingly impossible odds with ease. His courage and bravado knowing no bounds
column6: he prefers to improvise his way out of any situation
column7: relying partially on his wits
column8: but mostly on his mystical Shuriman gauntlet
column9: which he uses to unleash devastating arcane blasts. One thing is for sure—whenever Ezreal is around
column10: trouble isn’t too far behind. Or ahead. Probably everywhere.

column1: Born and raised in a wealthy neighborhood of Piltover
column2: Ezreal was always a curious child. His parents were renowned archaeologists
column3: so he became used to their long absences from the family home
column4: often fantasizing about joining them on their travels. He loved hearing tales of high adventure
column5: and shared their desire to fill in the blank spaces on every map.

column1: He was often left in the care of his uncle
column2: the esteemed Professor Lymere. The professor did not enjoy having to wrangle such a rash and unruly child
column3: and assigned the strictest tutors to teach him subjects including advanced cartography
column4: hextech mechanics
column5: and the ancient histories of Runeterra. But the boy had a knack for simply absorbing information
column6: and found studying a waste of time. He passed assessments easily
column7: with little or no preparation
column8: infuriating his uncle and giving himself more time to roam the university grounds. Ezreal took great pleasure in evading the campus wardens
column9: navigating the tunnels beneath the lecture halls as easily as the library rooftops. He even practiced lockpicking
column10: sneaking into his teachers’ offices and rearranging their belongings for his own amusement.

column1: Whenever Ezreal’s parents returned to Piltover
column2: his father in particular would tell him all they had seen
column3: and their plans for future expeditions—none more ambitious and secretive than the search for the lost tomb of Ne’Zuk
column4: a Shuriman tyrant who was said to be able to jump instantly from one place to another. If Ezreal’s father could learn whatever sorcery Ne’Zuk had possessed
column5: he joked that wherever he was traveling
column6: he would simply drop into Piltover for dinner with his son each night.

column1: As the boy grew older
column2: the time between his parents’ visits grew longer until
column3: one year
column4: they did not return at all. Professor Lymere tearfully admitted that they had most likely perished
column5: somewhere out in the desert.

column1: But Ezreal could not accept that. They had been too careful in their preparations. They must still be out there
column2: somewhere…

column1: Abandoning his reluctant studies
column2: the budding explorer would strike out on his own. He knew
column3: if he was ever to find his mother and father
column4: he had to start with the final resting place of Ne’Zuk. He spent weeks secretly gathering supplies from the university—celestial diagrams
column5: translations of runic sigils
column6: guides on the burial rites of Shurima
column7: and a pair of protective goggles. Leaving a note of farewell for his uncle
column8: he snuck onto a supply ship bound for Nashramae.

column1: Following his mother’s meticulous field notes
column2: he crossed the Great Sai with merchant caravans heading south. For many months
column3: he delved into cavernous ruins beneath the shifting sands
column4: relishing the freedom of the unknown
column5: facing unspeakable horrors that guarded hidden chambers. With each step
column6: Ezreal imagined himself following his parents’ path
column7: drawing ever closer to solving the mystery of their disappearance.

column1: Finally
column2: he managed what they evidently had not. Beneath the newer mausoleum of some unnamed emperor
column3: he uncovered the tomb of Ne’Zuk.

column1: The great sarcophagus lay empty
column2: save for a gleaming bronze gauntlet
column3: with a bright
column4: crystalline matrix at its center. As soon as Ezreal laid his hands upon it
column5: the tomb itself seemed to turn upon him
column6: with cunningly wrought traps and wards laid down thousands of years ago. With scarcely a thought
column7: he donned the gauntlet and blasted his way through
column8: even teleporting the last hundred yards back to the hidden entrance before the whole structure collapsed in a plume of sand and masonry dust.

column1: Breathing hard
column2: Ezreal looked down at the gauntlet as it hummed along with his heartbeat. He could feel it siphoning and amplifying his own essence. This
column3: he realized
column4: was a fearsome weapon of a previous age. A weapon fit for a god-warrior of Shurima
column5: and the perfect tool for an explorer.

column1: Soon after returning to Piltover
column2: Ezreal found himself bounding from adventure to adventure. From lost cities to mystical temples
column3: his nose for treasure-seeking led him to places most university professors could only read about on maps
column4: and his reputation began to grow. Naturally
column5: to Ezreal’s mind
column6: these tales rarely conveyed the true scope and scale of his exploits… but they did give him an idea. If he could make a name for himself as the greatest adventurer in the world
column7: then his parents would surely return
column8: and seek him out in person.

column1: From the untamed borders of Noxus and Demacia
column2: to the seedy depths of Zaun
column3: and the frozen wilderness of the Freljord—Ezreal chases fame and glory
column4: uncovering long-lost artifacts and solving the riddles of history. While some may dispute the details of his anecdotes
column5: or call his methods into question
column6: he never answers his critics.

column1: After all
column2: they’re clearly just jealous.

column1: 412;Thresh;the Chain Warden;Deep Terror Thresh;Championship Thresh;Blood Moon Thresh;SSW Thresh;Dark Star Thresh;High Noon Thresh;Pulsefire Thresh;Pulsefire Thresh Prestige Edition;FPX Thresh;Spirit Blossom Thresh;Unbound Thresh;Steel Dragon Thresh;;;;Communication is key when making use of Thresh's lantern. Let your teammates know how you like to use it.;Death Sentence and Flay can be combined in either cast order for powerful combinations.;Thresh can collect souls without needing to kill units himself. Planning your map position to be near the most deaths will help to maximize soul collection.;;;Thresh's Death Sentence has a long cast time. Watch for the cast to begin to take evasive actions.;Intentionally breaking a wall of The Box can allow a vulnerable ally to escape unscathed.;Thresh relies on collecting souls for a portion of his defense and damage. Try punishing him when he moves to collect them.;;Support;Fighter;Mana;5;6;6;7;530.0;95;274.0;44.0;330;28;0.0;30.0;0.5;450;7.0;0.55;6.0;0.8;56.0;2.2;3.5;0.625;Death Sentence;Thresh binds an enemy in chains and pulls them toward him. Activating this ability a second time pulls Thresh to the enemy.;Dark Passage;Thresh throws out a lantern that shields nearby allied Champions from damage. Allies can click the lantern to dash to Thresh.;Flay;Thresh's attacks wind up, dealing more damage the longer he waits between attacks. When activated, Thresh sweeps his chain, knocking all enemies hit in the direction of the blow.;The Box;A prison of walls that slow and deal damage if broken.;Damnation;Thresh can harvest the souls of enemies that die near him, permanently granting him Armor and Ability Power.;
Sadistic and cunning
column2: Thresh is an ambitious and restless spirit of the Shadow Isles. Once the custodian of countless arcane secrets
column3: he was undone by a power greater than life or death
column4: and now sustains himself by tormenting and breaking others with slow
column5: excruciating inventiveness. His victims suffer far beyond their brief mortal coil as Thresh wreaks agony upon their souls
column6: imprisoning them in his unholy lantern to torture for all eternity.

column1: The horrifying specter now known as Thresh was once a simple
column2: if troubled
column3: man. In an age history has all but forgotten
column4: he was a lowly warden of an order devoted to the gathering and protection of arcane knowledge. This order was established on the Blessed Isles
column5: which were hidden and protected from the outside world by magical pale mists.

column1: The masters of the order acknowledged Thresh’s long years of service
column2: and tasked him with the custodianship of certain hidden vaults beneath the city of Helia. It was there that a vast
column3: secret collection of dangerous artifacts was kept under lock and key. Incredibly strong-willed and methodical
column4: Thresh was well suited to such work… but even then
column5: his penchant for cruelty had been noted by his brethren. While it had not yet manifested in murderous ways—at least
column6: none that could be proven—he was shunned by many.

column1: It became clear he had been given a job that kept him away from others
column2: preventing him from gaining the recognition he felt he deserved. Solitary years in the darkness took their toll
column3: and Thresh grew ever more bitter and jealous as he patrolled the long halls with his lantern-stave
column4: and only his own resentful thoughts for company.

column1: His moment of opportunity came when the armies of a mad king managed to pierce the veiling mists
column2: and arrived unbidden upon the shores of the Blessed Isles.

column1: Secretly
column2: Thresh delighted in the slaughter that followed. The invading king was obsessed with resurrecting his dead queen—and Thresh willingly led him to the fabled Waters of Life.

column1: None but the most senior members of the order had ever been permitted to enter the hidden catacomb that housed the Waters. Now
column2: with the king’s greatest warriors at his back
column3: Thresh laughed as the guardians of that sacred place were cut down before him. Finally
column4: he believed
column5: he would get what he had long deserved.

column1: Only those who were there could say what truly occurred when the king lowered the lifeless corpse of his wife into the Waters
column2: but the aftermath would shake the whole of Runeterra.

column1: A catastrophic blastwave of dark energy surged outward
column2: engulfing Helia and spreading rapidly across the rest of the Blessed Isles
column3: and the white mist that had once protected them turned black and predatory. Every living thing in its path perished in an instant
column4: and yet their spirits could not move on
column5: caught in a horrifying new existence somewhere between life and death. Thresh himself was among the first to be claimed… but while others screamed in anguish at their fate
column6: he reveled in it.

column1: He arose from this cataclysm
column2: this Ruination
column3: as a spectral monstrosity
column4: relishing the chance to torment others without fear of reprisal
column5: and unfettered by the limits of mortality.

column1: Over the decades and centuries that followed
column2: his supernatural appearance slowly changed to match the malice and cruelty that had always festered in his heart. To his amusement
column3: Thresh came to realize most other spirits trapped within the Black Mist retained only fragments of their former selves—even the strongest of the foreign invaders
column4: such as Hecarim or Ledros—while his power continued to grow.

column1: Driven by spite to prey upon those he perceives as lesser souls
column2: Thresh’s favorite victims have always been those who will suffer the most from his attentions. No matter how strong their resolve
column3: resilience
column4: or faith
column5: he strives to break them as slowly as possible
column6: by learning their fears and weaknesses
column7: and toying with them to the very end. Only when their lives lie in tatters
column8: their loved ones taken from them
column9: their sense of purpose lost and their last glimmer of hope snuffed out
column10: do Thresh’s hooked chains finally drag them into his undying grasp.

column1: Even so
column2: death brings no merciful release
column3: for he tears out the souls of all he kills—imprisoning them within his accursed lantern
column4: to be unwilling witnesses to his depredations for all eternity.

column1: Only a single soul has ever escaped him.
Senna
column2: one of the hated “Sentinels of Light”
column3: died a futile death after facing Thresh in some forgotten eldritch vault. Her distraught husband
column4: Lucian
column5: then pursued the cruel spirit for years
column6: becoming singularly obsessed with the hunt
column7: letting his grief and rage consume him almost entirely. To Thresh
column8: it was delectable.

column1: However
column2: before he could finally claim Lucian’s soul
column3: a vengeful blow split Thresh’s lantern open
column4: and freed Senna from it.

column1: Intrigued by the obvious strength of their mortal bond
column2: he has decided to allow them this small and insignificant victory
column3: knowing all too well that the game of light and shadow they all play is still far from over…

column1:
523;Aphelios;the Weapon of the Faithful;Nightbringer Aphelios;Lunar Beast Aphelios;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Each of Aphelios' weapons have different strengths, so try to find the right situation for your current weapons. ;;;;;Each of Aphelios' weapons have different weaknesses, try to exploit the ones that work best for your champion. Watch out for the purple Gravity gun, it can root you.;;;;Marksman;;Mana;6;2;1;10;530.0;88;348.0;42.0;325;28;3.0;30.0;0.5;550;3.25;0.55;6.5;0.4;55.0;3.0;2.1;0.64;Weapon Abilites;Aphelios has 5 different activated abilities, based on his main-hand weapon:

Calibrum (Rifle): Long range shot that marks its target for a long-range follow-up attack.
Severum (Scythe Pistol): Run fast while attacking nearby enemies with both weapons.
Gravitum (Cannon): Root all enemies slowed by this weapon.
Infernum (Flamethrower): Blast enemies in a cone and attack them with your off-hand weapon.
Crescendum (Chakram): Deploy a sentry that shoots your off-hand weapon.
;Phase;Aphelios swaps his main-hand gun with his off-hand gun, replacing his basic attack and activated ability.;Weapon Queue System;Aphelios has no third ability. This slot shows the next weapon Alune will give him. Weapon order begins fixed but may change over game time -- when a weapon is out of ammo it goes to the end of the order.;Moonlight Vigil;Fire a concentrated blast of moonlight that explodes on enemy champions. Applies the unique effect of Aphelios' main-hand gun.;The Hitman and the Seer;Aphelios wields 5 Lunari Weapons made by his sister Alune. He has access to two at a time: one main-hand and one off-hand. Each weapon has a unique Basic Attack and Ability. Attacks and abilities consume a weapon's ammo. When out of ammo, Aphelios discards the weapon and Alune summons the next of the 5. ;
Emerging from moonlight’s shadow with weapons drawn
column2: Aphelios kills the enemies of his faith in brooding silence—speaking only through the certainty of his aim
column3: and the firing of each gun. Though fueled by a poison that renders him mute
column4: he is guided by his sister Alune in her distant temple sanctuary from where she pushes an arsenal of moonstone weapons into his hands. For as long as the moon shines overhead
column5: Aphelios will never be alone.

column1: The moon looms over the towering slopes of Mount Targon
column2: distant
column3: yet impossibly close.

column1: Born during a rare lunar convergence
column2: when the physical moon was eclipsed by its reflection in the spirit realm
column3: Aphelios and his twin sister
column4: Alune
column5: were celebrated as children of destiny by those of Targon’s Lunari faith.

column1: Mirroring the celestial event that heralded their birth
column2: the two children knew they had been marked by fate—Aphelios physically gifted like the moon of stone
column3: and Alune magically like its spiritual reflection. Zealously devout
column4: they grew up within a faith of mystery
column5: reflection
column6: and discovery
column7: and embraced darkness not just out of belief
column8: but as the only thing that could keep them safe.

column1: The Solari who ruled Targon considered the Lunari heretics
column2: driving them into hiding until most forgot the Lunari even existed. The Lunari were left to the shadows
column3: dwelling in temples and caves far from the Solaris’ sight.

column1: The pressure to be exemplary weighed heavily upon Aphelios. He practiced tirelessly with mystical moonstone blades
column2: spilling his own blood in training so he could spill that of others to protect the faith. Intense and vulnerable
column3: he bonded deeply with his sister in lieu of any other friendships.

column1: While Aphelios was sent on increasingly dangerous missions to protect the Lunari
column2: Alune trained separately as a seer
column3: using her luminous magic to reveal hidden pathways and truths by the moon’s light. In time
column4: her tasks required her to leave the temple where they were raised.

column1: Without Alune
column2: Aphelios’ faith wavered.

column1: Desperate for purpose
column2: he undertook a ceremonial journey into darkness where Lunari were said to discover their paths—their orbits. He followed the moon’s light to a pool where rare noctum flowers bloomed beneath the water’s surface. Though poisonous
column3: the flowers could be distilled into a liquid that opened him to the night’s power.

column1: Drinking the noctum’s essence
column2: Aphelios felt so much pain that it numbed him to everything else.

column1: Soon after
column2: an ancient temple
column3: the Marus Omegnum
column4: began to come into phase from the spirit realm for the first time in centuries. Lunari from across the mountain gathered
column5: emerging from hiding to witness the balance of power shift as celestial cycles in the heavens turned.

column1: The fortress accepted only one occupant
column2: gifted in magic
column3: each time it appeared. This time it would be Alune
column4: her orbit guiding her to the temple. Aphelios
column5: usually asking for nothing
column6: requested to attend the event.

column1: But as the fortress passed through the veil in a luminous display of magic
column2: a harsher radiance filled the night. Somehow
column3: the Lunari had been discovered even as the celestial cycles turned in their favor.

column1: An army of Solari descended upon them.
All seemed lost
column2: the Solari purging the Lunari heresy with fire and steel. Even Aphelios was beaten
column3: his moonstone blades shattered on the ground
column4: blood spilling from his lips as he reached for the noctum…

column1: But as the battle raged
column2: Alune traveled deeper into the temple—and when she reached its heart
column3: her full potential unlocked. Through the noctum
column4: Aphelios could feel Alune’s power embrace him… and he could hear her voice. With a whisper
column5: she pushed magic into his hands—a replacement for his blades solidifying into moonstone.

column1: Like the moon of stone and its spiritual reflection
column2: Aphelios’s skill and Alune’s magic converged.

column1: Those Solari would not live to see the sun again.
As her power flared
column2: Alune pushed the temple
column3: and herself within
column4: back into the spirit realm where it would remain safe from the Solari. From inside
column5: amplified by the temple’s focusing power
column6: Alune was able to project her magic anywhere
column7: so long as it found a focus—like the poison coursing through Aphelios’ veins.

column1: Only now did they understand their destiny. Aphelios would hollow himself out with pain
column2: but would become a conduit for the moon’s power. Alune would live alone
column3: isolated in her fortress
column4: but she would guide her brother
column5: able to see through his eyes.

column1: Together
column2: they would be the weapon the Lunari needed
column3: bound by pain and sacrifice. Only apart could they be together—their souls brushing across the veil
column4: distant
column5: yet impossibly close
column6: converging into something they could not understand.

column1: To protect the survivors of the attack who retreated back into the shadows of the mountain
column2: Aphelios’ training as an assassin has been given reach by Alune’s magic—his blades now an arsenal of mystical weapons
column3: perfected by Alune over the course of many missions together.

column1: Now that the power balance of Targon is shifting
column2: and the Solari know the Lunari still endure
column3: Aphelios and Alune are needed more than ever.

column1: 61;Orianna;the Lady of Clockwork;Gothic Orianna;Sewn Chaos Orianna;Bladecraft Orianna;TPA Orianna;Winter Wonder Orianna;Heartseeker Orianna;Dark Star Orianna;Victorious Orianna;Pool Party Orianna;;;;;;;Command: Protect can be used on yourself to return the Ball back to you quickly. Combine this with Command: Attack for a quick harassment.;Command: Dissonance is a very powerful escape tool if Orianna has the Ball. The combination of speed and leaving a slowing obstacle can be quite powerful.;Command: Shockwave can be used to drag enemies towards you or away from you if you position the Ball properly.;;;Orianna can only affect the area the Ball is around. Use this to your advantage.;Watch out for Orianna's Ball returning to her due to leashing. This may cause some unexpected situations.;;;Mage;Support;Mana;4;3;9;7;530.0;91;418.0;25.0;325;17;3.0;26.0;0.5;525;7.0;0.55;8.0;0.8;40.0;2.6;3.5;0.658;Command: Attack;Orianna commands her Ball to fire toward a target location, dealing magic damage to targets along the way (deals less damage to subsequent targets). Her Ball remains at the target location after.;Command: Dissonance;Orianna commands her Ball to release a pulse of energy, dealing magic damage around it. This leaves a field behind that speeds up allies and slows enemies.;Command: Protect;Orianna commands her Ball to attach to an allied champion, Shielding them and dealing magic damage to any enemies it passes through on the way. Additionally, the Ball grants additional Armor and Magic Resist to the champion it is attached to.;Command: Shockwave;Orianna commands her Ball to unleash a shockwave, dealing magic damage and launching nearby enemies towards the Ball after a short delay.;Clockwork Windup;Orianna's Attacks deal additional magic damage. This damage increases the more Orianna Attacks the same target.;
Once a curious girl of flesh and blood
column2: Orianna is now a technological marvel comprised entirely of clockwork. She became gravely ill after an accident in the lower districts of Zaun
column3: and her failing body had to be replaced with exquisite artifice
column4: piece by piece. Accompanied by the extraordinary brass orb that houses her hextech heart
column5: Orianna is now free to explore the wonders of Piltover
column6: and beyond.

column1: Nestled among the eclectic storefronts of Piltover sat the workshop of the renowned artificer Corin Reveck. Famous for his masterful craft in artificial limbs
column2: Corin’s intricate brass designs made the prosthetics both breathtakingly beautiful and often superior to the originals. His daughter
column3: Orianna
column4: served as his apprentice—friendly and inquisitive
column5: she was a natural fit to run the shop
column6: and blossomed into a capable artisan in her own right.

column1: Orianna had an adventurous spirit
column2: but her father
column3: fearing for her safety
column4: never allowed her to venture beyond their neighborhood. Instead
column5: he took her to the theater
column6: where dancers
column7: through leaps and pirouettes
column8: told stories of distant lands. Orianna dreamed of visiting these strange and marvelous places
column9: and would scurry home to build clockwork dancers of her own.

column1: News of disaster in the undercity of Zaun made its way to their shop. An explosion had ruptured a chemical line
column2: venting clouds of poisonous gas. Orianna insisted they help the victims
column3: but Corin forbade it. Zaun was far too dangerous.

column1: So
column2: with as many supplies as she could carry
column3: Orianna snuck away in the night and rode the hexdraulic descender into the depths.

column1: The devastation was overwhelming. Debris still filled the streets
column2: and Zaunites walked through the toxic haze
column3: faces covered with little more than oily rags. Night after night
column4: Orianna repaired respirators and installed esophilters. She even gave her own mask to a child who could scarcely breathe.

column1: Her father was furious
column2: but soon after her return
column3: Orianna fell gravely ill. Her lungs were ravaged past all hope of recovery. Refusing to accept this
column4: Corin threw himself into his most ambitious project yet: a fully functional set of artificial lungs.

column1: After weeks of sleepless nights
column2: he completed his desperate task and carried out the surgery himself. To keep her from ever venturing too far again
column3: the lungs were wound with a special key Corin kept in his safe.

column1: Orianna returned to work
column2: and yet the poison continued to spread throughout her body. Father and daughter worked feverishly to develop new implants and prosthetics
column3: replacing each of her organs as they failed. Piece by piece
column4: Orianna's body was transformed from mortal to mechanical until only her healthy heart remained. This long—and expensive—process cost Corin his fortune
column5: forcing him to relocate their business to Zaun… but he saved his daughter's life. And
column6: for a time
column7: they were happy.

column1: Gradually
column2: Orianna began to feel disconnected from who she had been before. Old memories felt like stories. Even her creativity began to fade
column3: and her beloved clockwork dancers became more like masterfully tuned mechanisms than works of art.

column1: But
column2: even as time seemed to stand still for Orianna
column3: it marched onward for her father.

column1: Long
column2: lean years brought Corin agonizing chest spasms that meant he could no longer work
column3: and Orianna was forced to provide for him. She'd become profoundly adept at crafting her figurines
column4: even if she took only distant pleasure in recalling what once inspired their creation. The miniature dancers brought in good coin and barter
column5: but never enough to afford the one thing she believed could save her father. For that
column6: she turned to a local chem-baron.

column1: Orianna never asked how the man came by a hextech crystal. She simply paid what he asked. Even so
column2: before she could use it
column3: the chem-baron returned demanding a second payment. Then a third. When the money ran out
column4: Orianna knew his next visit would end in violence. She looked to the crystal device
column5: still incomplete
column6: too unrefined and powerful for a human body. She saw the logical solution—she didn't need her human heart anymore
column7: and Corin needed a heart no one could ever take from him.

column1: She spent weeks in preparation
column2: building a clockwork orb—integrating it into her own mechanisms
column3: readying it to house the crystal so she could defend herself in the journey ahead. Slipping her father a sleeping draught
column4: she commenced the surgery.

column1: Corin became one with the last remnant of the daughter he had known and loved. She listened to his steady heartbeat through the night
column2: the quiet hum of hextech in the beautifully intricate ball by her side. Only then did she realize she had shed the last of her humanity—but she felt no fear or remorse
column3: merely acceptance. She had become something entirely new
column4: a lady of clockwork
column5: and she needed to find where in the world's vast machine she might fit.

column1: At dawn
column2: she collected the key that wound her lungs
column3: a single pulse from her ball welding it firmly to her back. Then she left for good.

column1: Corin woke to find his workshop filled with hundreds of figurines. But among them was one he vowed never to sell: pirouetting to an endless ballet
column2: a golden dancer that needed no key.

column1: 360;Samira;the Desert Rose;PsyOps Samira;Space Groove Samira;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Marksman;;Mana;8;5;3;6;530.0;88;348.88;38.0;335;26;3.0;30.0;0.5;500;3.25;0.55;8.18;0.7;57.0;3.0;3.3;0.658;Flair;Samira fires a shot or swings her sword, dealing damage. If cast during Wild Rush, strike all enemies in her path upon completion.;Blade Whirl;Samira slashes around her, damaging enemies and destroying enemy missiles.;Wild Rush;Samira dashes through an enemy (including structures), slashing enemies she passes through and gaining Attack Speed. Killing an enemy champion refreshes this ability's cooldown.;Inferno Trigger;Samira unleashes a torrent of shots from her weapons, wildly shooting all enemies surrounding her.;Daredevil Impulse;Samira builds a combo by hitting attacks or abilities unique from the previous hit. Samira's attacks in melee range deal additional magic damage. Samira's attacks against enemies affected by Immobilizing effects will dash her to her attack range. If the enemy is Knocked Up, she also keeps them Knocked Up briefly.;
Samira stares death in the eye with unyielding confidence
column2: seeking thrill wherever she goes. After her Shuriman home was destroyed as a child
column3: Samira found her true calling in Noxus
column4: where she built a reputation as a stylish daredevil taking on dangerous missions of the highest caliber. Wielding black-powder pistols and a custom-engineered blade
column5: Samira thrives in life-or-death circumstances
column6: eliminating any who stand in her way with flash and flair.

column1: In the city of Amakra
column2: on the eastern edge of the Great Sai
column3: Samira and her parents made a living as street performers. They dazzled
column4: beguiled
column5: and awed onlookers
column6: which thrilled Samira
column7: but worried her parents. Despite the fun their daughter had
column8: they wished she could enjoy a more stable life.

column1: But wishes are as fickle as the desert rain.
On the eve of Samira’s fourteenth birthday
column2: armed strangers swarmed Amakra. Hidden among the rafters of her home
column3: Samira watched as the strangers invoked the name of an ancient magus and seized innocent villagers. Many people were slain before her eyes.

column1: Samira did not cry. She did not scream. Instead
column2: she seethed in anger—not at the killers
column3: but at herself for hiding. She had never felt crippled by fear before
column4: even when she attempted the most daring stunts. In that moment
column5: Samira hated herself
column6: and vowed never to feel so scared and helpless again.

column1: Though wounded
column2: Samira and her parents escaped to Bel’zhun
column3: a port city under Noxian rule
column4: with a handful of others. To the Amakrans
column5: Noxus provided a safe haven. To Samira
column6: Noxus opened a door.

column1: While other refugees found comfort in living quietly
column2: Samira was determined to reclaim her courage. She took to the streets alone since her parents
column3: weary and injured
column4: could not. Performing was no longer a job—it was her stage to be fearless. She outdid herself with every stunt
column5: even when no one bothered to look. But it was still not enough to support her family.

column1: That was when Samira stumbled upon a call to join a Noxian warband. Drawn to the excitement and the financial resources it would provide
column2: she enlisted.

column1: Her physical prowess amazed her peers. Deft with a blade and sharp with her aim
column2: Samira reveled in her raw athleticism
column3: excelling in combat… but faltering in discipline. After two years of training
column4: her recklessness frustrated her commanding officers
column5: save for one: Captain Indari. A former saboteur
column6: Indari valued Samira’s fearlessness and offered her a position in her private warband—a specialized unit charged with missions that were deemed too perilous for standard military personnel. Hungry for the dangers it promised
column7: Samira agreed without hesitation.

column1: She fully embraced Noxian culture
column2: finding her own strength and style amid life-and-death shootouts and breathtaking sword fights. In her free time
column3: Samira regaled her family with stories of her tattoos
column4: each representing only her most unforgettable feats. To her
column5: what mattered most was challenging herself to turn danger into thrill
column6: and thriving off the constant risk that made her feel truly alive.

column1: On orders from the capital
column2: Indari’s unit found themselves on the Rokrund Plains
column3: sent to crush a secessionist uprising. As the warband located the enemy stronghold and approached the rebel leader
column4: the fortress exploded. Samira dove headfirst into the chaos as the structure collapsed
column5: permanently injuring her right eye. Feeling neither scared nor helpless
column6: she wasted no time in recovering Indari
column7: who had sustained a more serious injury—the captain could no longer move her legs. Indari
column8: frustrated at her failure as their leader
column9: disbanded the unit upon the return of its survivors.

column1: Discharged
column2: and with no other opportunities rousing her interest
column3: Samira drifted back home to Bel’zhun—but it was no longer a lifestyle she could endure.

column1: Samira returned to the Noxian capital and located Indari. She believed her former captain understood her craving for challenges in ways nobody else could
column2: and wanted to make use of Indari’s connections in the military and noble houses. She proposed they team up again in a new partnership
column3: where Indari could operate behind the scenes to find Samira high-stakes mercenary work.

column1: Reluctantly
column2: Indari agreed
column3: but it left her former protégé alone with no field support…

column1: And Samira couldn’t have been happier. She eagerly undertook missions meant for entire warbands—and thrived.
Her daredevil reputation spread far and wide. From beating a chem-baron in hand-to-hand combat
column2: to being the lone survivor of a Bilgewater raid
column3: Samira completed every job no matter the odds. With Indari’s support
column4: even the Noxian high command accepted her
column5: recognizing there was no one better suited to take on their most perilous missions.

column1: Now
column2: Samira shows no signs of slowing down. She can be found scaling mountain cliffs one day
column3: and arm-wrestling outlaws in crowded taverns the next. But wherever she may be
column4: one thing is certain: Samira never fails to find her next big thrill.

column1: 110;Varus;the Arrow of Retribution;Blight Crystal Varus;Arclight Varus;Arctic Ops Varus;Heartseeker Varus;Varus Swiftbolt;Dark Star Varus;Conqueror Varus;Infernal Varus;PROJECT: Varus;Cosmic Hunter Varus;;;;;;An early point in Blighted Quiver helps harass enemy champions and get killing blows on minions.;During short range fights it's sometimes best to fire Piercing Arrow quickly, rather than charging it to full power.;Try to take advantage of Piercing Arrow's very long range to snipe at enemy champions before a fight or as they're trying to flee.;;;If you are affected by Blight, Varus' abilities will deal extra damage to you.;When he gets a kill or assist, Varus temporarily gains Attack Speed and is much more dangerous.;You'll get bound in place if a tendril from Varus' ultimate, Chain of Corruption, reaches you. You can cause the tendril to die however by running far enough away from it.;;Marksman;Mage;Mana;7;3;4;2;530.0;91;360.0;40.0;330;27;3.4;30.0;0.5;575;3.5;0.55;8.0;0.8;59.0;3.4;4.0;0.658;Piercing Arrow;Varus readies and then fires a powerful shot that gains extra range and damage the longer he spends preparing to fire.;Blighted Quiver;Passive: Varus' basic attacks deal bonus magic damage and apply Blight. Varus' other abilities detonate Blight, dealing magic damage based on the target's maximum Health. Active: Varus empowers his next Piercing Arrow.;Hail of Arrows;Varus fires a hail of arrows that deal physical damage and desecrate the ground. Desecrated ground slows enemies' Movement Speed and reduces their self healing and regeneration.;Chain of Corruption;Varus flings out a damaging tendril of corruption that immobilizes the first enemy champion hit and then spreads towards nearby uninfected champions, immobilizing them too on contact.;Living Vengeance;On kill or assist, Varus temporarily gains Attack Speed. This bonus is larger if the enemy is a champion.;
One of the ancient darkin
column2: Varus was a deadly killer who loved to torment his foes
column3: driving them almost to insanity before delivering the killing arrow. He was imprisoned at the end of the Great Darkin War
column4: but escaped centuries later in the remade flesh of two Ionian hunters—they had unwittingly released him
column5: cursed to bear the bow containing his bound essence. Varus now seeks out those who trapped him
column6: in order to enact his brutal vengeance
column7: but the mortal souls within still resist him every step of the way.

column1: Regardless of what he would later become
column2: Varus was once a paragon of loyalty and honor. A skilled archer of the ancient Shuriman empire
column3: he was appointed as a temple warden in the eastern states
column4: and he held this duty sacred above all else.

column1: During the earliest stages of the war with Icathia
column2: even though it lay far from that cursed place
column3: Varus’ homeland was attacked. While other wardens abandoned their posts to join the defense of the outlying villages
column4: he alone remained
column5: screaming in anguish with every arrow he loosed—for he had chosen to uphold his oaths rather than return home to protect his own family.

column1: Emissaries from the Ascended Host found him kneeling in solemn meditation amid the corpses of his foes. It was said that his cold gaze unsettled even the god-warriors themselves
column2: and yet
column3: in recognition of his noble sacrifice
column4: Varus was offered a place in their ranks.

column1: As one of the great Ascended
column2: he was utterly consumed by his pursuit of vengeance against the Icathians
column3: and the voidling horrors they had unleashed. It is likely that Varus did not even fully comprehend Shurima’s ultimate victory in that war
column4: so twisted had his mind become—nor the empire’s fall centuries later. Atrocity after atrocity blurred together
column5: leaving him as a withdrawn
column6: callous killer
column7: reshaped and sent into battle countless times by his degenerate brethren.

column1: Their name became feared throughout the known world.
The darkin.
Warring among themselves
column2: they destroyed any other who stood against them. With his crystalline bow
column3: Varus assassinated enemy commanders and champions
column4: helping the darkin defeat entire mortal armies with ever greater ease.

column1: Eventually
column2: Varus was cornered by vastayan moon-stalkers and human mages in service of a golden-armored warrior queen of Valoran. They bound him within his bow
column3: leaving him to howl in impotent rage. By then
column4: the raw
column5: corrupting influence of the darkin was known
column6: and yet still the queen chose to wield the deadly weapon in the final days of the war
column7: gladly sacrificing herself for a greater victory.

column1: In the months that followed
column2: the queen carried Varus to the First Lands—those that would later be known as Ionia. Now made monstrous by the bow’s power
column3: her last act was to command her followers to bury her alive in a lightless well
column4: sunk deep beneath a mountain temple overlooking the village of Pallas.

column1: And there Varus was imprisoned
column2: both by the natural magic of Ionia
column3: and the ritual ministrations of the temple guardians.

column1: The bow remained hidden for centuries
column2: unknown
column3: untouched
column4: and all but forgotten
column5: until Noxian invaders attacked the First Lands. Two beast hunters—Valmar and his heartlight
column6: Kai—fought against the first wave at the Temple of Pallas. Though their courage was great and they drove off the attackers
column7: Kai was mortally wounded
column8: and a grief-stricken Val carried him inside
column9: believing the well’s forbidden magic could restore him.

column1: But the temple held only damnation
column2: and both hunters were consumed by the unleashed power of the darkin within it. The very matter of their bodies was unraveled and bound together again to craft a new body
column3: a body fit to free Varus from his imprisonment. What emerged from the well was a gestalt creature
column4: pale and inhumanly beautiful
column5: part human and part darkin. After more than a thousand years
column6: Varus was reborn.

column1: Even so
column2: the human and darkin elements of this imperfect form are in constant flux
column3: with each managing to wrest control for a short time before being reined in by the other. Varus fights to silence the two mortal souls once and for all
column4: and wreak vengeance for the destruction of his race. Still
column5: Kai and Val struggle against his malevolent influence
column6: hoping against hope that their love can overcome the darkin’s hatred.

column1: How long they can keep Varus conflicted is anyone’s guess—but should this sadistic and egotistical killer come to fully dominate his new host
column2: it is certain he will seek to reunite with others of his kind
column3: and reduce all of Runeterra to an ashen wasteland.

column1:
112;Viktor;the Machine Herald;Full Machine Viktor;Prototype Viktor;Creator Viktor;Death Sworn Viktor;PsyOps Viktor;;;;;;;;;;;Death Ray is a powerful poke and a strong area of denial tool. Use it in combination with Gravity Field to control your enemy's position.;Make sure you choose the right augment at the right time.;;;;Be careful about how close you let Viktor get to you. Viktor's control of the battlefield increases with his proximity to his opponent.;Be aware of how many augments Viktor has upgraded by looking at the color of the light on his staff (purple, yellow, blue, red).;;;Mage;;Mana;2;4;10;9;530.0;90;405.0;45.0;335;23;4.0;30.0;0.5;525;8.0;0.65;8.0;0.8;53.0;3.0;2.11;0.658;Siphon Power;Viktor blasts an enemy unit dealing magic damage, gaining a shield and empowering his next basic attack.

Augment: Siphon Power's shield is increased by 60% and Viktor gains bonus Movement Speed after casting.;Gravity Field;Viktor conjures a heavy gravitational field that slows enemies in its radius. Enemies who stay within the device for too long are stunned.

Augment: Viktor's non-periodic spells apply a slow to enemies.;Death Ray;Viktor uses his robotic arm to fire a chaos beam that cuts across the field in a line, dealing damage to all enemies in its path.

Augment: An explosion follows the Death Ray's wake, dealing magic damage.;Chaos Storm;Viktor conjures a singularity on the field which deals magic damage and interrupts enemy channels. The singularity then periodically does magic damage to all nearby enemies. Viktor can redirect the singularity.

Augment: The Chaos Storm moves 25% faster.;Glorious Evolution;Viktor can augment his basic abilities when he gets kills on enemies.;
The herald of a new age of technology
column2: Viktor has devoted his life to the advancement of humankind. An idealist who seeks to lift people to a new level of understanding
column3: he believes that only by embracing a glorious evolution of technology can humanity’s full potential be realized. With a body augmented by steel and science
column4: Viktor is zealous in his pursuit of this bright future.

column1: Viktor was born in Zaun on the borders of the Entresol level
column2: and
column3: encouraged by his artisan parents
column4: discovered a passion for invention and building. He devoted every waking minute to his studies
column5: hating to interrupt his work even to eat or sleep. Even worse was having to rapidly relocate if there was a nearby chemical spill
column6: accidental detonation or incoming chem-cloud. Abandoning his work
column7: even for a short time
column8: was anathema to Viktor.

column1: In a bid to impose a level of order and certainty on his world
column2: Viktor researched Zaun’s many accidents and came to realize that almost all of them were the result of human error
column3: not mechanical failure. He offered his services to the local businesses
column4: developing inventions that made them far safer working environments. Most turned him away
column5: but one - the Fredersen Chem-forge - took a chance on this earnest young man.

column1: Viktor’s inventions in automation reduced the number of accidents in the forge to zero within a month. Soon
column2: other establishments sought his work and Viktor’s designs became common in Zaun
column3: improving production with every innovation that removed human error from a process. Eventually
column4: at the age of nineteen
column5: he was surprised to be offered a place in Zaun’s prestigious Academy of Techmaturgy. But Viktor’s work had attracted the eye of Professor Stanwick of Piltover
column6: who convinced him to leave Zaun and travel to Piltover’s academy instead. There
column7: he could work in the most advanced laboratories and gain access to all the resources the City of Progress could offer. Thrilled to be singled out
column8: Viktor accepted his offer and took up residence in Piltover
column9: where he refined his craft and sought to perfect his theorems in ways that would benefit everyone.

column1: Viktor worked with Piltover’s best and brightest; including an insufferable genius named Jayce. The two were equally matched in intellect
column2: but where Viktor was methodical
column3: logical and thorough
column4: Jayce was flamboyant and arrogant. The two worked together frequently
column5: but never truly became friends. Often
column6: the two would butt heads over their perceptions of intuition vs logic in the process of invention
column7: but a level of mutual respect developed as each saw the flawed brilliance in the other.

column1: In the midst of his studies in Piltover
column2: a major chem-spill devastated entire districts of Zaun
column3: and Viktor returned home to offer his help in the rescue efforts. By grafting a sophisticated series of cognitive loops upon existing automata-technology
column4: he crafted a custom-built golem
column5: Blitzcrank
column6: to help in the clean-up. Blitzcrank was instrumental in saving scores of lives and appeared to develop a level of sentience beyond anything Viktor had envisioned.

column1: Even with the spill contained
column2: Viktor remained in Zaun to help those afflicted by the released toxins. With the golem’s help
column3: he attempted to use his techmaturgical brilliance to save those whose lives had been blighted by the spill. Their attempt was ultimately unsuccessful in preventing more deaths
column4: and the two parted ways. Though Viktor was distraught at the loss of life in Zaun
column5: the work taught him a great deal about the merging of human anatomy with technology and how mortal anatomy could be enhanced with technology.

column1: When Viktor returned to Piltover
column2: weeks later
column3: it was to find that Professor Stanwick had held a symposium on Blitzcrank and presented Viktor’s researches as his own. Viktor lodged formal complaints with the masters of the college
column4: but his impassioned claim that he had designed Blitzcrank fell on deaf ears. He turned to Jayce to verify his claims
column5: but his fellow student refused to speak up
column6: further widening the rift between them
column7: and the matter was decided in Professor Stanwick’s favor.

column1: Bitter
column2: but resigned
column3: Viktor returned to his studies
column4: knowing that his ultimate goal of making people’s lives better and enhancing humanity was more important than one stolen project and a bruised ego. He continued to excel
column5: finding ever new ways to eliminate human error and weakness from his work
column6: a facet of his researches that came to dominate his thinking. He saw human involvement in any part of a process as a grossly inefficient aberration - a view that put him at odds with a great many of his fellow students and professors
column7: who saw the very things Viktor sought to remove as the source of human ingenuity and creativity.

column1: This came to a head during a reluctant collaboration with Jayce to improve the diving suits used to keep Piltover’s docks clear of underwater debris and lingering chemical waste. Viktor and Jayce’s enhanced suits allowed the wearer to go deeper
column2: remain underwater for longer
column3: and lift heavier weights. But many wearers claimed they saw phantom corpse lights in the depths or suffered from chem-induced hallucinations. When divers experienced such symptoms
column4: they panicked and often got themselves or their fellow divers killed. Viktor saw the problem was not technical
column5: but with the wearer’s nerves unraveling in the inky depths. He devised a chem-shunt helm that allowed an operator on the surface to bypass the wearer’s fear response and
column6: effectively
column7: control the diver. A heated discussion between Viktor and Jayce on free will and mental enslavement turned bitter - almost violent - and the two vowed never to work together again.

column1: Jayce reported the incident to the college masters
column2: and Viktor was censured for violating basic human dignity - though
column3: in his eyes
column4: his work would have saved many lives. He was expelled from the college
column5: and retreated to his old laboratory in Zaun
column6: disgusted by the narrow-minded perceptions of Piltover’s inhabitants. Alone in the depths
column7: Viktor sank into a deep depression
column8: enduring a traumatic period of introspection for many weeks. He wrestled with the ethical dilemma he now faced
column9: finding that
column10: once again
column11: human emotion and weakness had stood in his way. He had been trying to help
column12: to enhance people beyond their natural capabilities to avoid error and save lives. Revelation came when he realized that he too had succumbed to such emotions
column13: allowing his naive belief that good intentions could overcome ingrained prejudice to blind him to human failings. Viktor knew he could not expect others to follow where he did not go first
column16: he operated on himself to remove those parts of his flesh and psyche that relied upon or were inhibited by emotion.

column1: When the surgery was done
column2: almost no trace of the young man who had traveled to Piltover remained. He had supplanted the majority of his anatomy with mechanical augmentations
column3: but his personality had also changed. His idealistic hope to better society was refined into an obsession with what he called the Glorious Evolution. Viktor now saw himself as the pioneer of Valoran's future - an idealized dream where man would renounce flesh in favor of superior hextech augmentations. This would free humanity from fatal errors and suffering
column4: though Viktor knew it was a task that would not be completed easily or quickly.

column1: He threw himself into this great work with a vengeance. He used technological augmentations to help rebuild Zaunites injured in accidents
column2: perfected breathing mechanisms
column3: and worked tirelessly to reduce human inefficiency by decoupling physicality from emotion. His work saved hundreds of lives
column4: yet seeking Viktor’s help could be dangerous
column5: as his solutions often brought unexpected consequences.

column1: But if you were desperate
column2: Viktor was the man you went to.

column1: Some in Zaun
column2: hearing fragments of his philosophy and seeing the successes of his work
column3: saw him as a messianic figure. Viktor couldn’t care less for them
column4: viewing their quasi-religious cult as an aberration; yet another reason to eliminate emotional foibles and the belief in that which could not be empirically proven.

column1: After a toxic event in the Sump saw hundreds of men and women in the Factorywood transformed into rabid psychotics
column2: Viktor was forced to use a powerful soporific to sedate the victims and bring them back to his labs to try and undo the damage. The toxins had begun to eat away portions of their brains
column3: but Viktor was able to slow the degenerative process by opening up their craniums and employing machinery to slowly filter their bloodstreams of poison. The technology available to him wasn’t up to the task
column4: and Viktor knew many people were going to die unless he found a way to greatly enhance his purgative machinery.

column1: As he fought to save these people
column2: he detected a surge in hextech energy from Piltover and saw immediately that this could give him the power he needed. He followed the powerful energy surge to its source.

column1: Jayce’s lab.
Viktor demanded Jayce hand over the source of this power
column2: a pulsing crystal from the Shuriman desert. But his former colleague refused
column3: leaving Viktor no option but to take it by force. He returned to Zaun and hooked the strange crystal to his machinery
column4: readying a steam golem host for each afflicted person in case their body gave out under the stress of the procedure. Empowered by the new crystal
column5: Viktor’s machines went to work and
column6: gradually
column7: the damage from the toxins began to reverse. His work would save these people - in a manner of speaking - and had Viktor retained more than a fragment of his humanity
column8: he might have celebrated. As it was
column9: the barest hint of a smile was all he allowed himself.

column1: Before the process could complete
column2: a vengeful Jayce burst in and started smashing the laboratory with an energized hammer. Knowing an arrogant fool like Jayce would never listen to reason
column3: Viktor ordered the automatons to kill Jayce. The battle was ferocious
column4: and only ended when Jayce shattered the crystal Viktor had taken
column5: bringing the entire warehouse down in an avalanche of steel and stone
column6: thus ending the existence of those Viktor was trying to save. And for this
column7: Jayce returned to Piltover
column8: feted as a hero.

column1: Viktor escaped the destruction of the laboratory
column2: and returned to his mission of bettering humanity by ridding it of its destructive emotional impulses. In Viktor’s mind
column3: Jayce’s impetuous attack only proved the truth of his cause and strengthened his desire to unburden humanity of the failings of flesh. Viktor did send chem-augmented thugs to raid Jayce’s laboratory not long afterward. This was - Viktor told himself - not for revenge
column4: but to learn if there were any more shards of the Shuriman crystal he could use for the advancement of mankind. The raid was unsuccessful
column5: however
column6: and Viktor thought no more of Jayce.

column1: Instead
column2: he intensified his efforts to find ways in which humanity could be shepherded beyond their emotional weaknesses and brought into a new
column3: more reasoned stage of their evolution. Such researches sometimes transgress the boundaries of what would be considered ethical in Piltover (and Zaun)
column4: but they are all necessary steps in bringing about Viktor’s Glorious Evolution.

column1: 163;Taliyah;the Stoneweaver;Freljord Taliyah;SSG Taliyah;Pool Party Taliyah;;;;;;;;;;;;;Try to throw enemies into Unraveled Earth using Seismic Shove.;Remember, you don't always have to ride Weaver's Wall.;Once you have Rylai's Crystal Scepter, casting Threaded Volley at enemies chasing you is a great way of making them regret everything.;;;When Taliyah casts Unraveled Earth in the lane, be on the lookout for Seismic Shove. If she throws you into her minefield, the throws and stones will break your bones.;Taliyah's Threaded Volley is locked into a direction. If she's throwing rocks at you, dodge to the side!;;;Mage;Support;Mana;1;7;8;5;532.0;90;425.0;30.0;335;20;3.5;30.0;0.5;525;7.0;0.7;9.34;0.85;58.0;3.3;1.36;0.625;Threaded Volley;Taliyah throws a volley of missiles in a target direction, moving freely as she does. This works the ground below her. If Taliyah casts Threaded Volley on worked ground, she only throws one missile.;Seismic Shove;Taliyah causes an area of ground to erupt and throws enemies within in a direction of her choosing.;Unraveled Earth;Taliyah creates a slowing minefield that explodes if enemies dash through it or are pushed/pulled through it.;Weaver's Wall;Taliyah creates a very long wall and then surfs it.;Rock Surfing;Taliyah gains movement speed near walls.;
Taliyah is a nomadic mage from Shurima who weaves stone with energetic enthusiasm and raw determination. Torn between teenage wonder and adult responsibility
column2: she has crossed nearly all of Valoran on a journey to learn the true nature of her growing powers. Compelled by rumors of the rise of a long-dead emperor
column3: she returns to protect her tribe from dangers uncovered by Shurima’s shifting sands. Some have mistaken her tender heart for weakness and paid the price for their error
column4: for beneath Taliyah’s youthful demeanor is a will strong enough to move mountains
column5: and a spirit fierce enough to make the earth tremble.

column1: Born in the rocky foothills bordering Icathia’s corrupted shadow
column2: Taliyah spent her childhood herding goats with her tribe of nomadic weavers. Where most outsiders see Shurima as a beige and barren waste
column3: her family raised her to be a true daughter of the desert and to see beauty in the rich hues of the land. Taliyah was always fascinated by the stone beneath the dunes. When she was a toddler
column4: she collected colorful rocks as her people followed the seasonal waters. As she grew older
column5: the earth itself seemed drawn to her
column6: arcing and twisting to follow her tracks through the sand.

column1: After her sixth high summer
column2: Taliyah wandered from the caravan in search of a lost goatling that had been placed in her charge. Determined not to disappoint her father—the master shepherd and headman of the tribe—she tracked the young animal into the night. She followed the hoofprints through a dry wash to a box canyon. The little beast had managed to get high up the rock wall
column3: but could not get down.

column1: The sandstone called to her
column2: urging her to pull handholds from the sheer wall. Taliyah laid a tentative palm against the rock
column3: determined to rescue the scared animal. The elemental power she felt was as urgent and overwhelming as a monsoon rain. As soon as she opened herself to the magic
column4: it poured over her
column5: the stone leaping to her fingertips
column6: bringing both the canyon wall and the beast down on top of her.

column1: The next morning
column2: Taliyah’s panicked father tracked the skittish bleats of the goatling. He fell to his knees when he found his daughter unconscious
column3: covered loosely in a blanket of woven stone. Grief-stricken
column4: he returned to the tribe with Taliyah.

column1: Two days later
column2: the girl awoke from fevered dreams in the tent of Babajan
column3: the tribe’s grandmother. Taliyah began to tell the wise woman and her concerned parents of her night in the canyon
column4: of the rock that called to her. Babajan consoled the family
column5: telling them that the patterns of rock were evidence the Great Weaver
column6: the desert tribe’s mythical protector
column7: watched over the girl. In that moment
column8: Taliyah saw her parents’ deep worry and decided to conceal what really happened that night: that she—not the Great Weaver—had pulled at the desert stone.

column1: When children in Taliyah’s tribe were old enough
column2: they performed a dance under the face of the full moon
column3: the manifestation of the Great Weaver herself. The dance celebrated the children’s innate talents and demonstrated the gifts they would bring to the tribe as adults. This was the start of their path to true learning
column4: as those children then became apprenticed to their teachers.

column1: Taliyah continued to hide her growing power
column2: believing the secret she carried was a danger
column3: not a blessing. She watched as her childhood playmates spun wool to keep the tribe warm on cold desert nights
column4: demonstrated their skill with shears and dye
column5: or wove patterns that told the stories of her people. On those nights
column6: she would lie awake long after the coals had burned to ash
column7: tormented by the power she felt stirring within.

column1: The time finally came for Taliyah’s dance beneath the full moon. While she had talent enough to be a capable shepherd like her father
column2: or a pattern mistress like her mother
column3: the young girl dreaded what her dance would truly reveal. As Taliyah took her place on the sand
column4: the tools of her people—the shepherd’s crook
column5: the spindle
column6: and the loom—surrounded her. She tried to concentrate on the task at hand
column7: but it was the distant rocks
column8: the layered colors of the land
column9: that called to her. Taliyah closed her eyes and danced. Overwhelmed by the power flowing through her
column10: she began to spin not thread
column11: but the very earth beneath her feet.

column1: Startled cries from Taliyah’s tribe broke her out of her spell. An imposing braid of sharp rock reached up to the light of the moon. Taliyah looked at the shocked faces of the people who surrounded her. Her will over the stone broken
column2: the earthen tapestry crashed down. Taliyah’s mother ran to her only daughter
column3: to protect her from the falling rock. When the dust finally settled
column4: Taliyah saw the destruction she had woven
column5: the alarm on the faces of her tribe. But it was the small cut across her mother’s face that justified Taliyah’s fear. Though the cut was minor
column6: Taliyah knew in that moment that she was a threat to the people she loved most in this world. She ran into the night
column7: so weighed down by despair that the ground trembled beneath her feet.

column1: It was her father who found her again in the desert. As they sat in the light of the rising sun
column2: Taliyah confessed her secret in choked sobs. In turn
column3: he did the only thing a parent could do: He hugged his daughter tightly. He told her that she couldn’t run from her power
column4: that she must complete her dance and see where her path would take her. Turning her back on the Great Weaver’s gift was the only danger that could truly break his and her mother’s heart.

column1: Taliyah returned with her father to the tribe. She entered the dancer’s circle with her eyes open. This time
column2: she wove a new ribbon of stone
column3: each color and texture a memory of the people surrounding her.

column1: When it was over
column2: the tribe sat in awe. Taliyah waited nervously. It was time for one of her people to stand as her teacher and claim the student. What felt like eons stretched between Taliyah’s hammering heartbeats. She heard gravel shift as her father stood. Next to him
column3: her mother stood. Babajan and the dye mistress and the master spinner stood. In a moment
column4: the whole tribe was on its feet. All of them would stand with the girl who could weave stone.

column1: Taliyah looked at each of them. She knew that a power like hers had not been seen in generations
column2: perhaps longer. They stood with her now
column3: their love and trust surrounding her
column4: but their worry was palpable. None among them heard the earth call as she did. As much as she loved these people
column5: she did not see the one who could show her how to control the elemental magic that coursed within her. She knew that to stay with her tribe was to risk their lives. Though it pained all of them
column6: Taliyah said farewell to her parents and her people
column7: and set off alone into the world.

column1: She journeyed west toward the distant peak of Targon
column2: her natural connection to rock drawing her toward the mountain that brushed the stars. However
column3: at the northern edge of Shurima
column4: it was those who marched beneath the banner of Noxus who discovered her power first. In Noxus
column5: magic like hers was celebrated
column6: they told her; revered
column7: even. They promised her a teacher.

column1: The land had raised Taliyah to be trusting
column2: so she was unprepared for the smooth promises and practiced smiles of Noxian dignitaries. Soon
column3: the desert girl found herself on an unbending path
column4: passing under the many Noxtoraa
column5: the great iron gates that marked the Empire’s claim over a conquered land.

column1: The crush of people and the layers of politics within the capital city were claustrophobic to a girl from the open desert. Taliyah was paraded through the tiers of Noxian magical society. Many took an interest in her power
column2: its potential
column3: but it was a fallen captain who swore to take her to a wild place across the sea
column4: a place where she could hone her abilities without fear
column5: who made the most convincing case. She accepted the young officer’s offer and crossed the sea to Ionia. However
column6: it was made clear as their ship dropped anchor that she was intended as a glorified weapon for a man desperate to regain his place at the highest ranks of the Noxian navy. At dawn
column7: the captain gave her a choice: Bury a sleeping people in their homes
column8: or be discarded in the surf.

column1: Taliyah looked across the bay. The cooking smoke had not yet risen from the village’s sleeping hearths. This was not the lesson she had come so far to learn. Taliyah refused
column2: and the captain threw her overboard to drown.

column1: She escaped the tide and the fighting on the beach and found herself wandering
column2: lost
column3: in the wintry mountains of Ionia. It was there she finally discovered her teacher
column4: a man whose blade harnessed the wind itself
column5: someone who understood the elements and the need for balance. She trained with him for a time and began to find the control she had long sought.

column1: While resting at an isolated inn
column2: Taliyah heard that the Ascended Emperor of Shurima had returned to his desert kingdom. Rumor had it this emperor turned god sought to gather his people
column3: the disparate tribes
column4: back to him as slaves. Even with her training unfinished
column5: there was no other choice; she knew she must return to her family to protect them. Sadly
column6: she and her mentor parted ways.

column1: Taliyah returned home to the sand-swept dunes of Shurima. As the punishing rays of the sun beat down on her
column2: Taliyah pushed farther into the desert
column3: determined to find her people. Hers was a will of stone
column4: and she would do whatever was necessary to protect her family and her tribe from the danger that loomed on the horizon.
