Behind Enemy Lines can enable Valor to cross the map very quickly and attack you by surprise.;When Quinn is using Behind Enemy Lines, damaging her removes her movement speed bonus temporarily.;;Marksman;Assassin;Mana;9;4;2;5;533.0;85;269.0;35.0;335;28;3.5;30.0;0.5;525;5.5;0.55;6.97;0.4;59.0;2.4;3.1;0.668;Blinding Assault;Quinn calls Valor to mark an enemy and hinder its vision before damaging all enemies in the immediate area.;Heightened Senses;Passively grants Quinn Attack Speed and Movement Speed after she attacks a <font color='#FFF673'>Vulnerable</font> target. Activate to have Valor reveal a large area nearby.;Vault;Quinn dashes to an enemy, dealing physical damage and slowing the target's Movement Speed. Upon reaching the target, she leaps off the target, briefly interrupting it, and lands near her maximum Attack Range away from the target.;Behind Enemy Lines;Quinn and Valor team up to fly around at great speed.  Ending the ability casts Skystrike, which deals damage to nearby enemies and marks champions as Vulnerable.;Harrier;Valor, Quinn's Demacian eagle, periodically marks enemies as Vulnerable. Quinn's first basic attack against Vulnerable targets will deal bonus physical damage.;
Quinn is an elite ranger-knight of Demacia who undertakes dangerous missions deep in enemy territory with her legendary eagle
column2: Valor. The two share an unbreakable bond that is uniquely deadly
column3: and their foes are often slain before they realize they are fighting not one
column4: but two Demacian heroes.

column1: Quinn and her twin brother
column2: Caleb
column3: were born in Uwendale
column4: a remote mountain hamlet in the northeastern hinterlands of Demacia. Raised to believe in the nobility and righteousness of their homeland’s values
column5: the two were inseparable. Uwendale was a thriving town of hunters and farmers
column6: protected by mountain rangers expert in intercepting and killing any monsters that came down from the high peaks to hunt.

column1: While the twins were young
column2: King Jarvan III visited Uwendale on an inspection tour of the East Wall
column3: the barrier between Demacia and the lawless
column4: tribal states beyond. Hoisted high on her father’s shoulders
column5: Quinn thrilled to the pageantry of the king and his warriors
column6: resplendent in gleaming sunsteel plate. Quinn and Caleb were captivated
column7: vowing to become knights of Demacia and one day fight alongside the king. Their childhood games cast them as heroic knights
column8: bravely defending the land from vile monsters
column9: savage Freljordians or black-hearted Noxians.

column1: They spent every moment they could in the wilds surrounding Uwendale. Their mother - one of the village’s foremost rangers - taught them how to track beast of the forest
column2: how to survive in the wild
column3: and
column4: most importantly
column5: how to fight. Over the years
column6: Quinn and Caleb developed into a formidable team
column7: working together in a way that brought out the best in both of them; her keen eye for tracks
column8: his skill at baiting their prey
column9: her aim with a bow
column10: his prowess with a hunting spear.

column1: But one excursion high into the mountains north of Uwendale ended in tragedy when the twins encountered a party of Buvelle nobles hunting a giant tuskvore
column2: a predatory killer known for its thick hide
column3: long razorhorns and ferocious temperament. The nobles had failed to kill the creature outright
column4: and the wounded beast turned on them
column5: goring several of the family’s young scions to death. Quinn and Caleb were quick to intervene. They drove the tuskvore off with a flurry of arrows to its skull
column6: but not before Caleb was gored to death by the creature while saving the Buvelle matriarch’s life. The nobles thanked Quinn profusely and helped her bury her brother before gathering their dead heirs and returning home to mourn.

column1: Caleb’s death almost broke Quinn. They had dreamed of fighting as a pair
column2: and without her twin by her side
column3: Quinn’s hopes of becoming a knight seemed hollow. She fulfilled her duties to her village
column4: as was expected of any daughter of Demacia
column5: but her heart was broken and the joy that had previously energized her dimmed like the last light of summer. Without her brother by her side
column6: her prowess in the wilderness waned and she started making mistakes. Nothing life threatening
column7: but she missed easy tracks
column8: her aim was off
column9: and became dour and uncommunicative.

column1: Quinn regularly visited Caleb’s grave at the site of their battle with the tuskvore
column2: unable to move on and forever reliving her moment of loss. A year to the day after Caleb’s death
column3: she returned to the mountain clearing as she had many times before. Lost in grief and reflection
column4: Quinn didn’t hear the approaching tuskvore. Amid the razorhorns crowning its skull were the broken shafts of arrows she and Caleb had loosed in their previous battle with the beast.

column1: The monster charged
column2: and Quinn desperately fought for her life against the enraged beast. She fired a dozen shafts at the creature
column3: but none of her arrows were accurate enough to find the weaknesses in its thick hide. Exhausted from the battle
column4: Quinn stumbled
column5: and the beast was upon her. She dived from its path
column6: but not quickly enough
column7: and the tip of its horn sliced her from hip to collarbone. Badly wounded
column8: Quinn fell as the beast circled around to finish her.

column1: Quinn looked the beast in the eye and knew this was her death. She reached for the last arrow in her quiver as a flash of blue sliced through the air. A beautiful
column2: blue-pinioned bird swooped in and raked its claws over the tuskvore’s face. The bird was an Azurite Eagle
column3: the breed said to have inspired the winged symbol of Demacia and long thought extinct. The screeching bird dived again and again
column4: its claws and beak ripping bloody gouges in the tuskvore’s skull even as the beast’s horns gouged its body and tore its wings.

column1: Quinn slowed her breathing and drew back her last arrow as the monster bellowed in fury and charged. She loosed
column2: her bowstave snapping with the force of her draw. But her aim was true
column3: and the arrow flew into the monster’s open mouth to pierce its brain. The tuskvore’s body plowed a great furrow in the earth toward her
column4: but it was dead and Quinn let out a shuddering breath of relief. She crawled to where the eagle lay
column5: its wing broken
column6: and saw in its eyes a deep well of kinship.

column1: She bound the wounded bird’s mighty pinion and returned to Uwendale with the tuskvore’s horns as a trophy. The wounded bird perched on her shoulder the entire way
column2: refusing to leave her side. She named the eagle Valor
column3: and nursed him back to health. The bond that formed between them rekindled the fire in Quinn’s heart
column4: and
column5: once more
column6: her thoughts turned to serving Demacia in battle. With her father’s help
column7: she crafted a new weapon from the horns of the tuskvore
column8: a finely-wrought repeater crossbow capable of firing multiple bolts with a single pull of the trigger.

column1: With her parents’ blessing
column2: Quinn and Valor traveled to the capital and petitioned the drill-masters of the Demacian army to join their ranks as a ranger-knight. Ordinarily
column3: years of training were required to serve in the highly disciplined Demacian military. Quinn did not have such training
column4: but she easily passed every test the full ranger-knights set her.

column1: The drill-masters had no idea how such an individualistic hunter and her unique eagle might fit within their rigid command structure
column2: so prepared to reject her petition. But before their verdict was delivered
column3: Lady Lestara Buvelle
column4: the noblewoman whose life Caleb had saved
column5: intervened and vouched for Quinn’s courageous heart and great skill.

column1: Quinn was immediately inducted into the Demacian army and though she proved a fine ranger-knight
column2: she struggled with the inflexible hierarchy and (in her view) needlessly prescriptive regulations. Her fellow warriors acknowledged her skills
column3: but still viewed her as something of a wild card
column4: a Demacian who preferred operating outwith the established order
column5: who crafted her own missions and came and went as she pleased. She never remained within the city walls for long
column6: preferring to live out in the wild as opposed to keeping the company of her fellow soldiers. Only the fact that she was so successful in uncovering nascent threats and rooting out hidden enemies allowed her a degree of leeway unheard of in Demacian ranks.

column1: When a Noxian assassin struck down Castle Jandelle’s commander on the Day of Lost Light
column2: Quinn’s talents proved themselves once again. The killer escaped battalions of knights dispatched to capture him
column3: but Quinn and Valor tracked and killed the assassin after a night of lethal traps
column4: counterattacks and ambushes. She returned with the assassin’s blade
column5: earning the nickname
column6: Demacia’s Wings. Quinn remained in Jandelle just long enough to receive her commendation before she and Valor once again departed the city to return to the wilderness where they were most comfortable.

column1: Since then
column2: Quinn has ventured far and wide in service of Demacia
column3: risking journeys to the far north of the Freljord and deep into the Noxian empire. Each time she and Valor have returned with intelligence vital to the security and defence of Demacia’s borders. While her methods do not easily fit within the heavily codified strictures of the Demacian military
column4: none can doubt Quinn and Valor’s preternatural brilliance in the field.

column1:
43;Karma;the Enlightened One;Sun Goddess Karma;Sakura Karma;Traditional Karma;Order of the Lotus Karma;Warden Karma;Winter Wonder Karma;Conqueror Karma;Dark Star Karma;Dawnbringer Karma;Odyssey Karma;Ruined Karma;Tranquility Dragon Karma;;;;Gathering Fire rewards aggressive play. Look to land abilities and basic attacks on your opponent to lower Mantra's cooldown and stay on the offensive.;When using Focused Resolve, slow your opponents with Inner Flame or speed yourself up with Inspire if you're having trouble sticking to a target. ;Don't be too conservative with Mantra. Gathering Fire is strongest in teamfights, making it easy to recharge Mantra multiple times.;;;Karma's passive lowers her Mantra cooldown when she hits enemy champions with abilities and basic attacks. Deny her from getting free hits on you.;Karma's Soulflare erupts for bonus damage in the area in which it's placed. React quickly and escape the circle to avoid taking heavy damage.;Focused Resolve is a strong disengage tool. Create distance to avoid being rooted and seek to engage afterwards.;;Mage;Support;Mana;1;7;8;5;534.0;95;374.0;50.0;335;28;3.8;30.0;0.5;525;5.5;0.55;13.0;0.5;51.0;3.3;2.3;0.625;Inner Flame;Karma sends forth a ball of spirit energy that explodes and deals damage upon hitting an enemy unit.

Mantra Bonus: In addition to the explosion, Mantra increases the destructive power of her Inner Flame, creating a cataclysm which deals damage after a short delay.;Focused Resolve;Karma creates a tether between herself and a targeted enemy, dealing damage and revealing them. If the tether is not broken, the enemy will be rooted and damaged again.

Mantra Bonus: Karma strengthens the link, healing herself and extending the root duration.;Inspire;Karma summons a protective shield that absorbs incoming damage and increases the Move Speed of the protected ally.

Mantra Bonus: Energy radiates out from her target, strengthening the initial shield and applying Inspire to nearby allied champions.;Mantra;Karma empowers her next ability to do an additional effect. Mantra is available at level 1 and does not require a skill point.;Gathering Fire;Attacks and abilities on enemy champions reduce Mantra's cooldown.;
No mortal exemplifies the spiritual traditions of Ionia more than Karma. She is the living embodiment of an ancient soul reincarnated countless times
column2: carrying all her accumulated memories into each new life
column3: and blessed with power that few can comprehend. She has done her best to guide her people in recent times of crisis
column4: though she knows that peace and harmony may come only at a considerable cost—both to her
column5: and to the land she holds most dear.

column1: Karma is the living embodiment of an ancient Ionian soul
column2: who serves as a spiritual beacon to each generation of her people. Her most recent incarnation came in the form of a 12-year-old girl named Darha. Raised in the northern highlands of Shon-Xan
column3: she was headstrong and independent
column4: always dreaming of a life beyond her provincial village.

column1: But Darha began to suffer strange
column2: fitful visions. The images were curious—they felt like memories
column3: yet the girl was certain they had not happened to her. At first
column4: the problem was easy enough to conceal
column5: but the visions grew in intensity until Darha was convinced she was descending into madness.

column1: Just when it seemed she would be confined to the healing huts forever
column2: a group of monks visited her village. They had come from a place known as the Lasting Altar
column3: where the divine leader Karma had passed away some months earlier. The monks were in search of the old man’s next incarnation
column4: believing him to be among the villagers. They applied a series of tests to everyone they met
column5: but eventually prepared to leave empty handed.

column1: As they passed the healing huts
column2: Darha threw herself out of her cot and ran to stop them. She wept
column3: telling them of her visions
column4: and that she had known the monks’ voices from the babble in her head.

column1: They recognized the signs immediately. This was their Karma. The visions were past lives rushing to fill a new vessel.
In that moment
column2: Darha’s life changed forever. She bid farewell to all she’d ever known
column3: and journeyed to the Lasting Altar to learn from the monks. Over the years
column4: they taught her to connect with her ancient soul
column5: and to commune with thousands of previous incarnations
column6: each espousing the wisdom of ages past. Karma had always advocated peace and harmony
column7: teaching that any act of evil would bring about its own repercussions
column8: and so required no response.

column1: But Darha questioned these principles
column2: even as she became Karma. Some of her followers were confused. How could she be invested with the Spirit of Ionia
column3: the First Lands’ most sacred manifestation
column4: and yet disagree with their most self-evident philosophies?

column1: Indeed
column2: these beliefs were truly tested when Noxus invaded Ionia. Many thousands were killed as the enemy warbands advanced inland
column3: and Karma was forced to face the harsh realities of war. She could feel the immense destructive potential that swelled in her soul
column4: and wondered what the point of this power could be
column5: if it was not to be used.

column1: The voices of the past urged her to remain at the Lasting Altar
column2: to comfort her people and allow this conflict to pass. And yet
column3: a far deeper truth compelled her to act...

column1: Karma agonized over this
column2: until she could stand it no longer. She confronted a Noxian commander on the deck of his own war frigate
column3: and unleashed her divine fury. This was no single
column4: measured attack—she obliterated the entire vessel and its crew in a heartbeat.

column1: Though many Ionians rejoiced at this apparent victory
column2: the monks believed she had made a huge mistake. She had upset the spiritual harmony of their homeland
column3: disgracing all who had borne the name of Karma before her
column4: and tarnished her own undying soul along with those of her followers. Even if it meant a life of solitary meditation and penance
column5: they implored her to do no further injury.

column1: Karma silenced them with a raised hand. Though she could still hear the voices in her head
column2: it was the Spirit of Ionia in her heart that guided her… and the First Lands were stirring to defend themselves. She did not know if she had been chosen for her courage and strength of will
column3: but Karma knew that sometimes harmony came only at a great cost. Their world was changing
column4: and true wisdom lay not in resisting that fact
column5: but accepting it.

column1: Though the war with Noxus is now long over
column2: there are still many in Ionia who have become only too glad to meet violence with violence
column3: even against their own neighbors. Karma has pledged to guide as many of them as she can to a more enlightened path—to peace when possible
column4: to action when necessary.

column1: 4;Twisted Fate;the Card Master;PAX Twisted Fate;Jack of Hearts Twisted Fate;The Magnificent Twisted Fate;Tango Twisted Fate;High Noon Twisted Fate;Musketeer Twisted Fate;Underworld Twisted Fate;Red Card Twisted Fate;Cutpurse Twisted Fate;Blood Moon Twisted Fate;Pulsefire Twisted Fate;Odyssey Twisted Fate;DWG Twisted Fate;Crime City Nightmare Twisted Fate;;Coordinate with your allies for the best time to use Destiny to ambush enemies.;Stealth characters often escape a battle with very low hit points. Take advantage of Destiny's ability to reveal stealthed units to finish them off.;Twisted Fate is viable as an Attack Damage or Ability Power character, letting him fit on many different team compositions.;;;Focus on dodging Wild Cards early when your champion doesn't have the hit points to afford getting hit.;If you have low Health, use Destiny as an indicator to run to safety. It will give you a head start in escaping any possible ganks.;;;Mage;;Mana;6;2;6;9;534.0;94;333.0;39.0;330;21;3.15;30.0;0.5;525;5.5;0.6;8.0;0.8;52.0;3.3;3.22;0.651;Wild Cards;Twisted Fate throws three cards, dealing damage to each enemy unit they pass through.;Pick a Card;Twisted Fate chooses a magic card from his deck, and uses that for his next attack, causing bonus effects.;Stacked Deck;Every 4 attacks, Twisted Fate deals bonus damage. In addition, his Attack Speed is increased.;Destiny;Twisted Fate predicts the fortunes of his foes, revealing all enemy champions and enabling the use of Gate, which teleports Twisted Fate to any target location in 1.5 seconds.;Loaded Dice;Upon killing a unit, Twisted Fate rolls his 'lucky' dice receiving 1 to 6 bonus gold.;
Twisted Fate is an infamous card sharp and swindler who has gambled and charmed his way across much of the known world
column2: earning the enmity and admiration of the rich and foolish alike. He rarely takes things seriously
column3: greeting each day with a mocking smile and an insouciant swagger. In every possible way
column4: Twisted Fate always has an ace up his sleeve.

column1: Born to the nomadic river folk of the Serpentine Delta
column2: the boy Tobias Felix quickly learned what it was to be an outsider. Tolerated for the exotic goods they peddled
column3: but shunned for their strange traditions
column4: his people found only short welcomes wherever they berthed their colorful river barques. His elders would shrug
column5: and say this was just the way of the world… but the obvious prejudice always stuck in Tobias’ craw.

column1: He found his true calling in the gambling tents
column2: between games of chance and skill like Mortwheel and Stabberscotch
column3: when he first picked up a deck of playing cards. Many years earlier
column4: his superstitious grandfather had shown him how to read omens in the shuffle and cut
column5: while his aunt had later taught him how to read all an opponent’s tells. Between the two
column6: Tobias took to the high-stakes game of Krakenhand like an old master. He could almost feel each card’s place in the deck
column7: and follow their movements through each successive hand. He was often accused of cheating
column8: but it was difficult for anyone to explain exactly how.

column1: Finally
column2: one night
column3: a group of men who’d lost their fortunes to young Tobias returned in the dead of night to settle the score. They came bearing cudgels and
column4: emboldened by cheap rotgut
column5: went from tent to tent in their search for him
column6: beating down any of the river folk who got in their way. Fearing for his life
column7: Tobias turned and fled into the darkness.

column1: When dawn came
column2: the lad sheepishly crept back to find his people breaking down the camp. No one would look him in the eye. He had thought only of himself
column3: and left others to face the consequences of his actions.

column1: Though he begged and pleaded with them all
column2: Tobias was exiled for what he had done. With his whole world falling apart around him
column3: he watched helplessly as the barques left
column4: leaving him alone on the riverbank with nothing but his grandfather’s worn deck of cards clutched in his hands.

column1: He grew to manhood as a drifter
column2: trawling the gambling halls of every settlement he came to
column3: using his preternatural skill to earn enough coin to survive. That Tobias was able to relieve the boastful
column4: the arrogant
column5: and the cruel of their cash was just an added bonus—though he was always careful to let his marks win at least a few hands
column6: here and there.

column1: Across one table
column2: he met a deplorable fellow named Malcolm Graves.

column1: Each recognizing a kindred soul
column2: Tobias and Graves quickly joined forces
column3: and the two of them spent years running various… dubious endeavors across the northeastern coastal towns
column4: and beyond. With every con
column5: swindle
column6: and heist
column7: Tobias felt the pull of the cards growing stronger
column8: and he knew it was more than mere gambler’s luck that guided him. His people had always waved away concerns over primitive magic and “cartomancy”
column9: but now Tobias began to seek out ever more dangerous means to bend the cards to his will.

column1: That search ended badly when a particularly daring heist went wrong. The exact details of that night remain shrouded in mystery
column2: for neither of them likes to speak of it—but Graves was taken alive
column3: while Tobias and their other accomplices ran free.

column1: Though he tried to break Graves out
column2: he failed. Instead
column3: seeking to begin again
column4: he returned his birth name to the river’s waters
column5: and took another: Twisted Fate.

column1: After that
column2: Twisted Fate continued to ply his criminal trade in the high parlors and low dens of every city he visited
column3: though without his partner to help him
column4: he tended to find himself cornered far more often. Indeed
column5: he was imprisoned with great fanfare too many times to count
column6: yet no cell ever seemed able to hold him for long; Twisted Fate was always gone with morning’s light
column7: leaving only a mocking calling card to confirm he had ever been there at all.

column1: In the port of Bilgewater
column2: Twisted Fate and Graves finally had their day of reckoning. They were forced to put aside their differences after being caught up in a power struggle between the ship captains who ran the place—but following the death of the reaver king Gangplank
column3: the pair managed a swift reconciliation before shoving off and making for distant Piltover.

column1: All in all
column2: Twisted Fate is glad to have his old friend back
column3: even if it might take another job or two—or ten—to restore their once easy partnership.

column1:
429;Kalista;the Spear of Vengeance;Blood Moon Kalista;Championship Kalista;SKT T1 Kalista;Marauder Kalista;;;;;;;;;;;;Rend is a valuable last hitting aid, since its cooldown resets if it kills a target. ;Entering a move order once to trigger Martial Poise will not clear Kalista's basic attack target.;Due to her passive, Kalista's Movement Speed is effectively increased by Attack Speed.;;;Kalista's mobility is dependent upon attacking. This means it is low when she is outside of her attack range and that Attack Speed slows reduce the amount of distance she can cover in an engagement.;Kalista cannot cancel her basic attack wind up. While she is very mobile, this offers a window to land spells on her if you anticipate when she will begin attacking.;If you can break line of sight from Kalista, including through brush, her basic attacks will miss you, falling harmlessly to the ground.;;Marksman;;Mana;8;2;4;7;534.0;100;250.0;45.0;325;21;4.0;30.0;0.5;525;3.75;0.55;6.3;0.4;69.0;3.5;4.0;0.694;Pierce;Throw a fast moving spear that passes through enemies it kills.;Sentinel;Gain bonus damage when Kalista and her Oathsworn strike the same target.

Activate to send a soul to scout out the path, revealing the area in front of it.;Rend;Attacks impale their targets with spears. Activate to rip the spears out, slowing and dealing escalating damage.;Fate's Call;Kalista teleports the Oathsworn ally to herself. They gain the ability to dash toward a position, knocking enemy champions back.;Martial Poise;Enter a movement command while winding up Kalista's basic attack or Pierce to lunge a short distance when she launches her attack.;
An undying specter of wrath and retribution
column2: Kalista is an armored nightmare summoned from the Shadow Isles to hunt deceivers and traitors. The betrayed may cry out in blood to be avenged
column3: but Kalista only answers those willing to pay with their very souls. Those who become the focus of Kalista’s wrath should make their final peace
column4: for any pact sealed with this grim hunter can only be ended by the cold
column5: piercing fire of her soul-spears.

column1: In life
column2: Kalista was a proud general
column3: niece to the king of an empire that none now recall. She lived by a strict code of honor
column4: serving the throne with utmost loyalty. The king had many enemies
column5: and when they sent an assassin to slay him
column6: it was Kalista’s vigilance that averted disaster.

column1: But in saving the king
column2: she damned the one he loved most—the assassin’s deflected blade was envenomed
column3: and sliced the arm of the queen. The greatest priests and surgeons were summoned
column4: but none could draw the poison from her body. Wracked with grief
column5: the king dispatched Kalista in search of a cure
column6: with Hecarim of the Iron Order taking her place at his side.

column1: Kalista traveled far
column2: consulting learned scholars
column3: hermits and mystics… but to no avail. Finally
column4: she learned of a place protected from the outside world by shimmering pale mists
column5: whose inhabitants were rumored to know the secrets of eternal life. She set sail on one last voyage of hope
column6: to the almost legendary Blessed Isles.

column1: The guardians of the capital city Helia saw the purity of Kalista’s intent
column2: and parted the mists to allow her safe passage. She begged them to heal the queen
column3: and after much consideration
column4: the masters of the city agreed. Time was of the essence. While the queen yet breathed
column5: there was hope for her in the fabled Waters of Life. Kalista was given a talisman that would allow her to return to Helia unaided
column6: but was warned against sharing this knowledge with any other.

column1: However
column2: by the time Kalista reached the shores of her homeland
column3: the queen was already dead.

column1: The king had descended into madness
column2: locking himself in his tower with the queen’s festering corpse. When he learned of Kalista’s return
column3: he demanded to know what she had found. With a heavy heart
column4: for she had never before failed him
column5: she admitted that the cure she had found would be of no use. The king would not believe this
column6: and condemned Kalista as a traitor to the crown.

column1: It was Hecarim who persuaded her to lead them to the Blessed Isles
column2: where her uncle could hear the truth of it from the masters themselves. Then
column3: perhaps
column4: he would find peace—even if only in accepting that the queen was gone
column5: and allowing her to be laid to rest. Hesitantly
column6: Kalista agreed.

column1: And so the king set out with a flotilla of his fastest ships
column2: and cried out in joy as the glittering city of Helia was revealed to him. However
column3: they were met by the stern masters
column4: who would not allow them to pass. Death
column5: they insisted
column6: was final. To cheat it would be to break the natural order of the world.

column1: The king flew into a fevered rage
column2: and commanded Kalista to slay any who opposed them. She refused
column3: and called on Hecarim to stand with her… but instead he drove his spear through her armored back.

column1: The Iron Order joined him in this treachery
column2: piercing Kalista’s body a dozen times more as she fell. A brutal melee erupted
column3: with those devoted to Kalista fighting desperately against Hecarim’s knights
column4: but their numbers were too few. As Kalista’s life faded
column5: and she watched her warriors die
column6: swearing vengeance with her final breath…

column1: When next Kalista opened her eyes
column2: they were filled with the dark power of unnatural magic. She had no idea what had transpired
column3: but the city of Helia had been transformed into a twisted mockery of its former beauty—indeed
column4: the entirety of the Blessed Isles was now a place of shadow and darkness
column5: filled with howling spirits trapped for all eternity in the nightmare of undeath.

column1: Though she tried to cling to those fragmented memories of Hecarim’s monstrous betrayal
column2: they have slowly faded in all the centuries since
column3: and all that now remains is a thirst for revenge burning in Kalista’s ruined chest. She has become a specter
column4: a figure of macabre folklore
column5: often invoked by those who have suffered similar treacheries.

column1: These wretched spirits are subsumed into hers
column2: to pay the ultimate price—becoming one with the Spear of Vengeance.

column1: 16;Soraka;the Starchild;Dryad Soraka;Divine Soraka;Celestine Soraka;Reaper Soraka;Order of the Banana Soraka;Program Soraka;Star Guardian Soraka;Pajama Guardian Soraka;Winter Wonder Soraka;Dawnbringer Soraka;Nightbringer Soraka;Star Guardian Soraka Prestige Edition;;;;Soraka is a powerful ally in battle, using her strong healing to keep the party moving forward.;You can use Wish on your allies from across the map to save them from otherwise fatal events.;Equinox can be used as a powerful zoning tool to keep enemies at bay.;;;Focus on attacking Soraka when she ever ventures to the frontline to heal her allies.;Take advantage of Soraka's long cooldown on Equinox if she uses it to harass.;It's easier to focus Soraka than the ally she is healing.;;Support;Mage;Mana;2;5;7;3;535.0;74;425.0;40.0;325;32;3.8;30.0;0.5;550;2.5;0.5;11.5;0.4;50.0;3.0;2.14;0.625;Starcall;A star falls from the sky at the target location dealing magic damage and slowing enemies. If an enemy champion is hit by Starcall, Soraka recovers Health.;Astral Infusion;Soraka sacrifices a portion of her own health to heal another friendly champion.;Equinox;Creates a zone at a location that silences all enemies inside. When the zone expires, all enemies still inside are rooted.;Wish;Soraka fills her allies with hope, instantly restoring health to herself and all friendly champions.;Salvation;Soraka runs faster towards nearby low health allies.;
A wanderer from the celestial realm
column2: Soraka gave up her immortal form to protect the mortal races from their own ignorance and violent instincts. She endeavors to spread the virtues of compassion and mercy to everyone she meets—guiding the lost
column3: and healing the wounded. For all Soraka has seen of this world's struggles
column4: she still believes the people of Runeterra have yet to reach their full potential.

column1: An age ago
column2: when time itself was young
column3: the inhabitants of the celestial realm regarded the fledgling races of Runeterra with growing concern.

column1: These creatures deviated wildly
column2: unpredictably
column3: and dangerously from the great designs intended for them by those above. The guidance and fates that had been woven into the night sky often went unseen—or worse
column4: were misinterpreted by their simple mortal minds
column5: leading to chaos
column6: uncertainty
column7: and suffering.

column1: No longer able to merely watch
column2: one celestial being chose to descend to the mortal realm
column3: determined to untangle the knots in the tapestry of the world. This child of the stars took on a form of flesh and blood
column4: and though the powerful magic coursing through her veins burned this new body from the inside out
column5: she knew her suffering meant little if she could help to heal all that was broken and incomplete.

column1: And so Soraka came to be
column2: and set upon her journey to soothe the mortals she encountered.

column1: Even so
column2: she quickly learned the capacity for cruelty that the peoples of Runeterra possessed. Whether on the battlefields of inescapable conflicts
column3: in the seedy underbellies of sprawling cities
column4: or on the frontiers of the untamed wilderness beyond them
column5: there seemed to be no end to the fighting
column6: betrayal
column7: and suffering Soraka witnessed. She watched
column8: helpless
column9: as mortals ignorantly broke the threads of destiny they could have woven together. Their lives were too short
column10: she reasoned. They were simply unable to see the greater patterns
column11: now lost.

column1: But as Soraka lived among them
column2: as one of them
column3: trying to repair what little of the damage she could… something incredible and wholly unforeseen happened.

column1: From the snarls and tangles and knots
column2: the messy breaks in the great patterns
column3: Soraka noticed a new
column4: unintended design emerging—intertwined
column5: and of a staggering complexity.

column1: Unintended and wild
column2: the mortals were forging new and unknown futures for themselves. From the celestial realm above
column3: it had seemed like pure chaos; but with her new perspective
column4: and blessed by the stars to stand against the erosion of time
column5: Soraka now beheld an almost perfect beauty. Just as mortals had the deepest capacity for cruelty
column6: so too did they possess infinite potential for kindness
column7: and inspiration to rival anything among the stars.

column1: Soraka realized her place was not to repair or replicate the celestial pattern. While a part of her craved the fixed
column2: comforting destinies of the stars
column3: she knew in her heart that static fates could not contain the unbridled
column4: dynamic potential of mortality.

column1: And so her work took on renewed vigor
column2: driven to unlock the untapped possibilities of all she met. Soraka sought now to inspire and guide rather than shepherd
column3: to see what unblazed trails each mortal would discover for themselves in their brief
column4: radiant moment.

column1: Over the millennia
column2: legends of the Starchild have filtered through all the lands of Runeterra. Some tribes of the Freljord still speak of a far wanderer
column3: a horned healer who soothed the icy bite of the most brutal winters. In the depths beneath Zaun
column4: rumors float of a lilac skinned medic who would purify weary lungs from the ravages of the alchemical Gray. In troubled Ionia
column5: the oldest myths of the Vastayashai’rei recall a seer who communed with the stars themselves
column6: and called upon their light both to heal the wounded and scorch those who would do further harm to the First Lands.

column1: Currently
column2: Soraka calls the westernmost peaks of Targon her home. She watches over an isolated tribe of vastaya
column3: teaching them her healing ways
column4: and tending quietly to her own needs—though what brings her so close to the great mountain
column5: or how long she will stay
column6: only Soraka knows.

column1: Many times
column2: she has watched entire civilizations dance close to the brink of destruction
column3: and she has learned that she cannot save those who do not wish it
column4: nor force them to see what they will not.

column1: All the same
column2: Soraka is determined never to stop trying.

column1: 115;Ziggs;the Hexplosives Expert;Mad Scientist Ziggs;Major Ziggs;Pool Party Ziggs;Snow Day Ziggs;Master Arcanist Ziggs;Battle Boss Ziggs;Odyssey Ziggs;Sugar Rush Ziggs;Hextech Ziggs;;;;;;;Even if you're far from a fight you can still help from afar with Mega Inferno Bomb.;Slowing your enemies with Hexplosive Minefield makes it easier to land other abilities.;Knocking yourself over walls with Satchel Charge can be great when chasing after or escaping from enemies.;;;Don't step on Ziggs' mines! They'll slow you and make it much easier for him to hit you with his other abiltiies.;Many of Ziggs' abilities have long cooldowns. Try catching him just after he's used his abilities.;Ziggs' ultimate, Mega Inferno Bomb, deals more damage in the center of the explosion.;;Mage;;Mana;2;4;9;4;536.0;92;480.0;23.5;325;22;3.3;30.0;0.5;550;6.5;0.6;8.0;0.8;54.0;3.1;2.0;0.656;Bouncing Bomb;Ziggs throws a bouncing bomb that deals magic damage.;Satchel Charge;Ziggs flings an explosive charge that detonates after 4 seconds, or when this ability is activated again. The explosion deals magic damage to enemies, knocking them away. Ziggs is also knocked away, but takes no damage. Ziggs can use the Satchel to hexplode vulnerable enemy turrets.;Hexplosive Minefield;Ziggs scatters proximity mines that detonate on enemy contact, dealing magic damage and slowing. Successive mine detonations on the same target deal reduced damage.;Mega Inferno Bomb;Ziggs deploys his ultimate creation, the Mega Inferno Bomb, hurling it an enormous distance. Enemies in the primary blast zone take more damage than those farther away.;Short Fuse;Periodically, Ziggs' next basic attack deals bonus magic damage. This cooldown is reduced whenever Ziggs uses an ability.;
With a love of big bombs and short fuses
column2: the yordle Ziggs is an explosive force of nature. As an inventor's assistant in Piltover
column3: he was bored by his predictable life and befriended a mad
column4: blue-haired bomber named Jinx. After a wild night on the town
column5: Ziggs took her advice and moved to Zaun
column6: where he now explores his fascinations more freely
column7: terrorizing the chem-barons and regular citizens alike in his never ending quest to blow stuff up.

column1: 8;Vladimir;the Crimson Reaper;Count Vladimir;Marquis Vladimir;Nosferatu Vladimir;Vandal Vladimir;Blood Lord Vladimir;Soulstealer Vladimir;Academy Vladimir;Dark Waters Vladimir;Nightbringer Vladimir;Cosmic Devourer Vladimir;;;;;;Transfusion instantly deals damage to the enemy before healing Vladimir, making it one of the best last hitting tools in the game.;Cast Hemoplague where it will afflict the most units.;Sanguine Pool pops incoming missiles, so it can be used to dodge disables.;;;Try to take Vladimir down before Hemoplague detonates, as it will heal him for each afflicted enemy Champion.;Making Vladimir use Sanguine Pool at the start of a fight will maximize the Health cost of the ability to him.;Items that counter Health stacking, such as Liandry's Torment and Blade of the Ruined King, are very effective against Vladimir.;;Mage;;Crimson Rush;2;6;8;7;537.0;96;2.0;0.0;330;23;3.3;30.0;0.5;450;7.0;0.6;0.0;0.0;55.0;3.0;2.0;0.658;Transfusion;Vladimir steals life from the target enemy. When Vladimir's resource is full, Transfusion will benefit from massively increased damage and healing for a brief time.;Sanguine Pool;Vladimir sinks into a pool of blood, becoming untargetable for 2 seconds. Additionally, enemies on the pool are slowed and Vladimir siphons life from them.;Tides of Blood;Vladimir pays his own health to charge up a reservoir of blood which, when released, deals damage in the area around him but can be blocked by enemy units.;Hemoplague;Vladimir infects an area with a virulent plague. Affected enemies take increased damage for the duration. After a few seconds, Hemoplague deals magic damage to infected enemies and heals Vladimir for each enemy Champion hit.;Crimson Pact;Every 30 points of bonus Health gives Vladimir 1 Ability Power and every 1 point of Ability Power gives Vladimir 1.6 bonus Health (does not stack with itself).;
A fiend with a thirst for mortal blood
column2: Vladimir has influenced the affairs of Noxus since the empire’s earliest days. In addition to unnaturally extending his life
column3: his mastery of hemomancy allows him to control the minds and bodies of others as easily as his own. In the flamboyant salons of the Noxian aristocracy
column4: this enabled him to build a fanatical cult of personality around himself—while in the lowest back alleys
column5: it allows him to bleed his enemies dry.

column1: A master of ancient
column2: forbidden sorcery
column3: Vladimir is among the oldest enigmas of Noxus. He was present at the dawn of the empire
column4: and has since woven his influence deep into its foundations… but he remembers little of those days. His mind is mortal
column5: and so most of his unnaturally extended life endures not in his memory
column6: but in his chronicles.

column1: History has lost track of Vladimir on many occasions
column2: though its pages are littered with figures suspected to have been him. Legend once told of a prince in a kingdom threatened by the infamous darkin
column3: as their great war spilled into Valoran. With his father’s crown at stake
column4: and many more heirs ahead of him in the line of succession
column5: the unfortunate youth was traded to the fallen god-warriors as a hostage.

column1: Mortals were little more than cattle under the tyranny of the darkin
column2: their supremacy apparent in the sorceries they had conceived—the arts of crafting flesh and transmuting blood
column3: granting them mastery over life itself.

column1: Believing himself above other mortal vassals
column2: and therefore worthy of such power
column3: Vladimir was the first of his kind permitted to study this terrifying magic. His devotion earned him a place of favor in his patron’s warhost
column4: and the right to practice hemomancy and enforce the darkin’s will on lesser beings. Over time
column5: the god-warrior watched with amusement as Vladimir came to govern his subjects with as little mercy as the darkin themselves.

column1: The fall of these cruel tyrants is
column2: likewise
column3: the stuff of legend. An account of it
column4: written in the dead High Shuriman language
column5: is kept hidden within the Immortal Bastion. It speculates that Vladimir’s master was not imprisoned like so many of his kin
column6: but instead died at the hands of his own warhost. The few surviving mortals fled
column7: taking what knowledge they had of blood magic with them.

column1: Unknown to all but Vladimir himself
column2: it was he who struck the killing blow. Scarred
column3: blinded
column4: driven mad by the radiance of a darkin’s undoing
column5: he absorbed enough power to renew flesh that was never meant to last beyond a mortal lifespan.

column1: And he has done this countless times since
column2: through rituals too vile to speak of.

column1: At the height of Mordekaiser’s dark reign
column2: it was said that a mythic and bloodthirsty fiend haunted the coastal cliffs of eastern Valoran
column3: demanding young lives and savage worship from the local tribes. Few were welcome in his lair
column4: until the day a pale sorceress approached this barbarian god with an offer. The two feasted together as equals
column5: weaving magic so dark that the wine at their table soured
column6: and the roses withered
column7: vibrant red turning to black.

column1: Thus began the pact between Vladimir and LeBlanc
column2: rife with disputes
column3: and games of politics and war. Over the centuries
column4: others joined them—powerful nobles
column5: exalted masters of magic
column6: and beings darker still. This cabal grew into the hidden power that would guide the throne of Noxus for more than a thousand years
column7: orchestrating many of the empire’s most ambitious campaigns.

column1: Uniquely among the leaders of the Black Rose
column2: Vladimir has rarely limited himself to scheming from the shadows. In the past
column3: he deigned to join the Noxian noble courts during the most interesting of times
column4: only to fade into seclusion decades later
column5: his extreme age—and the atrocities his sorcery could wreak—a well-kept secret. Even so
column6: under Vladimir’s tutelage
column7: the art of hemomancy has found a place in the military of Noxus
column8: and among scions of the old aristocracy. Among these diverse practitioners is the Crimson Circle
column9: a youthful cult dedicated as much to Vladimir’s personality as to blood magic itself.

column1: With the death of the previous Grand General and the rise of Jericho Swain
column2: the political landscape of the empire changed dramatically
column3: and Vladimir has been forced to rouse himself once more.

column1: Wearing the guise of a benevolent socialite
column2: he has returned to the public eye as a vocal opponent of the ruling Trifarix council… much to the concern of more cautious members of the Black Rose. Indeed
column3: his reappearance may have come too soon
column4: as time has not yet washed away all the stains of his previous lifetime
column5: and it seems likely that Swain himself has begun to grasp Vladimir’s true nature.

column1: As a new and darker conflict approaches Noxus
column2: Vladimir drinks deeply from the renewed vitality of the empire
column3: reminding himself of his past glories. To him
column4: this life is a mere revelry
column5: a masquerade spanning centuries
column6: and the prologue to greatness—for though the darkin eventually fought amongst themselves and lost their immortal grip on the world
column7: Vladimir knows he is strongest alone.

column1:
526;Rell;the Iron Maiden;Battle Queen Rell;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Tank;;Mana;0;0;0;0;540.0;90;350.0;45.0;335;32;3.0;32.1;1.25;175;7.0;0.55;6.0;0.35;55.0;3.0;2.0;0.55;Shattering Strike;Rell thrusts her lance to deal magic damage to units in a line, breaking their Shields. The first unit hit additionally suffers Break the Mold's defense steal.

If Rell is bound to an ally with Attract and Repel, they both recover health for each enemy champion hit by this spell.;Ferromancy: Crash Down;Passive: Rell gains additional Move Speed while mounted and additional Armor and Magic Resist while armored.

Active: Rell changes forms, casting a different spell based on form.
  • Mounted: Rell crashes down in her armor, knocking enemies up and gaining a large shield.
  • Armored: Rell forms her mount, gaining a burst of speed and flipping the next enemy she attacks.
    • ;Attract and Repel;Rell binds a piece of her Armor to another allied champion to grant them Armor and Magic Resist while near.

    While she has an ally bound in this way, Rell can cast this ability without targeting an allied champion to snap the binding and Stun enemies caught in it.;Magnet Storm;Rell explodes in a magnetic fury, violently Pulling nearby enemies towards herself. Then Rell constantly Drags nearby enemies towards herself for a short while, dealing magic damage over time.;Break the Mold;Rell attacks slowly but steals her target's Armor and Magic Resist on hit, dealing bonus damage based on the amount stolen.;
The product of brutal experimentation at the hands of the Black Rose
column2: Rell is a defiant
column3: living weapon determined to topple Noxus. Her childhood was one of misery and horror
column4: enduring unspeakable procedures to perfect and weaponize her magical control over metal... until she made a violent escape
column5: killing many of her captors in the process. Now branded as a criminal
column6: Rell attacks Noxian soldiers on sight as she searches for survivors of her old “academy”
column7: defending the meek while delivering merciless death to her former instructors.

column1: Posters across Noxus warn of a dangerous criminal
column2: armed with a massive
column3: blunted spear and borne atop a magical fiend
column4: whose mere existence poses a threat to the safety and security of the entire nation. Even some within the steeled ranks of the Trifarian Legion have begun to worry that they will be sent after her to their almost certain deaths.

column1: What kind of monster could be behind such heinous
column2: unchecked destruction?

column1: The simple answer is a sixteen-year-old girl.
The complicated one is unforgivable.
Rell was special from the moment of her birth—and fated to suffer for it. Born the daughter of a Noxian footsoldier and the heir to a fallen noble house
column2: she enjoyed neither the trappings of wealth nor the gilded upbringing common to children of the lower aristocracy. Nevertheless
column3: her parents had grand plans to mold her into someone who could shatter through Noxus’ dense political landscape. As Rell’s mother always said
column4: “Excellence is measured in sacrifice.”

column1: Rell’s unhappiness grew with time
column2: sparking something unique within her—a magic unlike anything seen in centuries: the ability to manipulate metal. To Rell’s parents
column3: this was something to be exploited—for Rell’s own sake
column4: of course!—and they tried unsuccessfully to apprentice her with many powerful mages who might whisk their daughter into the political or military elite.

column1: But someone else took notice of the young girl’s magic. Seeing in Rell a weapon who could one day face Noxus’ most hated
column2: ancient foe
column3: a certain pale woman visited the family with a dark bargain. Rell soon found herself the star pupil of a very special academy
column4: hidden far from the capital and away from the council’s prying eyes. And though they rarely made appearances in her new boarding school
column5: her mother and father never seemed more proud or more hopeful of their daughter’s future.

column1: It seemed
column2: at least for a moment
column3: that perhaps Rell would be loved after all.

column1: Then the true horrors began.
Rell was first forced into combat with another student when she was eight
column2: and
column3: afterward
column4: a kind of magic sigil was painfully grafted into her arm
column5: amplifying her powers so that she could become even stronger. Yet while this had been framed as a training exercise
column6: Rell never saw the boy again. She never saw any of her opponents again.

column1: Every day
column2: she grew more powerful
column3: honing her magic for martial combat. Her body became covered with sigils that amplified her magical abilities to impossible heights. In time
column4: she could rip a vein of raw ore from deep out of the ground
column5: twist the walls into deadly weapons
column6: and superheat an opponent’s armor until it collapsed and crushed them. But her instructors desired even more from her—all in the hopes that Rell would be the most powerful soldier the empire had ever known.

column1: On her sixteenth birthday
column2: after a particularly barbaric duel
column3: she’d finally had enough. Casting her instructors aside
column4: Rell tore past the guards and ripped open the doors of a forbidden wing of the academy
column5: discovering the true nature of her school: Every opponent she’d defeated had been Nullified—their magic forcibly extracted from them and placed into the very sigils covering Rell’s body—and left as emotionless puppets devoid of memories. This was the price of her power
column6: and she could never give it back.

column1: Worst of all was the headmistress who oversaw the procedures herself: Rell’s own mother. All of this had been for Rell
column2: she said. After all... excellence is measured in sacrifice.

column1: Rell raged.
To the small handful of faculty who survived her escape from the academy
column2: it was like the earth had been torn open into a twisting whirlwind of razor-sharp slag. The building ripped itself apart
column3: forming an impenetrable suit of black armor around Rell as she crushed those who stood before her
column4: flattening seasoned soldiers with a lance heavier than a mountain. Bursting through the front gate on a steed made of rippling iron
column5: she led as many of her classmates as she could to freedom—leaving the Rose scrambling to recover the Null and erase any trace of what their organization had done.

column1: But it was far too late. Soon enough
column2: the surviving faculty members began to die in increasingly public ways
column3: and the Null could no longer be kept secret.

column1: Rell is now a threat to Noxus
column2: but not in the way the handbills proclaim. She is a self-styled defender of the meek
column3: full of unchecked fury
column4: distrustful of everyone
column5: and merciless toward a government that turned a blind eye to years of suffering and abuse. Not because the empire was personally responsible—but because they stood by and did nothing.

column1: Riding atop her iron steed
column2: Rell’s eyes are set on nothing less than the complete destruction of Noxus and saving any children who
column3: like her
column4: survived the Black Rose academy.

column1: And there is nothing in this world that can stop her.

203;Kindred;The Eternal Hunters;Shadowfire Kindred;Super Galaxy Kindred;Spirit Blossom Kindred;;;;;;;;;;;;;Moving around between attacks while jungling will help you avoid damage and also generate more heals from Wolf's Frenzy.;Pick which Hunts you want to pursue carefully; getting many of them is the key to success as the game goes on.";Don't go in first to a large team fight. Wait for your teammates to initiate.;;;Kindred is fragile - turn the pressure up on her
column2: and she will be forced to play cautiously.;Clear the Hunts Wolf activates on jungle camps to slow down Kindred's damage output.;When Kindred uses Lamb's Respite get inside
column3: it stops all champions from dying.;;Marksman;;Mana;8;2;2;4;540.0;85;300.0;35.0;325;29;3.5;30.0;0.5;500;7.0;0.55;7.0;0.4;65.0;2.5;3.5;0.625;Dance of Arrows;Kindred tumbles and shoots up to three arrows at nearby targets.;Wolf's Frenzy;Wolf enrages and attacks enemies around him.  Lamb passively gains stacks by moving and attacking. When fully charged
column4: Lamb's next attack restores health.;Mounting Dread;Lamb fires a carefully placed shot
column5: slowing the target. If Lamb attacks the target two more times
column6: her third attack instead directs Wolf to pounce on the enemy
column7: savaging them for massive damage.;Lamb's Respite;Lamb grants all living things inside a zone a respite from death. Until the effect ends
column8: nothing can die. At the end
column9: units are healed.;Mark of the Kindred;Kindred can mark targets to Hunt. Successfully completing a Hunt permanently empowers Kindred's basic abilities. Every 4 hunts completed also increases Kindred's basic attack range.;"

column1: Separate
column2: but never parted
column3: Kindred represents the twin essences of death. Lamb’s bow offers a swift release from the mortal realm for those who accept their fate. Wolf hunts down those who run from their end
column4: delivering violent finality within his crushing jaws. Though interpretations of Kindred’s nature vary across Runeterra
column5: every mortal must choose the true face of their death.

column1: Kindred is the white embrace of nothingness and the gnashing of teeth in the dark. Shepherd and the butcher
column2: poet and the primitive
column3: they are one and both. When caught on the edge of life
column4: louder than any trumpeting horn
column5: it is the hammering pulse at one’s throat that calls Kindred to their hunt. Stand and greet Lamb’s silvered bow and her arrows will lay you down swiftly. If you refuse her
column6: Wolf will join you for his merry hunt
column7: where every chase runs to its brutal end.

column1: For as long as its people have known death
column2: Kindred has stalked Valoran. When the final moment comes
column3: it is said a true Demacian will turn to Lamb
column4: taking the arrow
column5: while through the shadowed streets of Noxus
column6: Wolf leads the hunt. In the snows of the Freljord
column7: before going off to fight
column8: some warbands “kiss the Wolf” vowing to honor his chase with the blood of their enemies. After each Harrowing
column9: the town of Bilgewater gathers to celebrate its survivors and honor those granted a true death by Lamb and Wolf.

column1: Denying Kindred is to deny the natural order of things. There are but a wretched few who have eluded these hunters. This perverse escape is no sanctuary
column2: for it only holds a waking nightmare. Kindred waits for those locked in the undeath of the Shadow Isles
column3: for they know all will eventually fall to Lamb’s bow or Wolf’s teeth.

column1: The earliest dated appearance of the eternal hunters is from a pair of ancient masks
column2: carved by unknown hands into the gravesites of people long-forgotten. But to this day
column3: Lamb and Wolf remain together
column4: and they are always Kindred.

column1: 518;Neeko;the Curious Chameleon;Winter Wonder Neeko;Star Guardian Neeko;Star Guardian Neeko Prestige Edition;Shan Hai Scrolls Neeko;;;;;;;;;;;;You can set her passive to use hotkeys in the options menu. The default is Shift+F1~F5;Try to use Inherent Glamour sparingly, ineffective uses will put enemies on the alert.;;;;Standing behind minions against Neeko is very dangerous as Tangle-Barbs become stronger.;Pop Blossom's warning visuals are invisible if Neeko is disguised.;;;Mage;Support;Mana;1;1;9;5;540.0;90;450.0;30.0;340;21;4.0;30.0;0.5;550;7.5;0.75;7.0;0.7;48.0;2.5;3.5;0.625;Blooming Burst;Neeko throws a seed dealing magic damage. The seed blooms again on hitting champions or killing units.;Shapesplitter;Neeko passively deals bonus magic damage every third attack. Neeko can activate to send a clone in a direction.;Tangle-Barbs;Neeko slings a tangle that damage and root everything it passes through. If the tangle kills an enemy or passes through a champion, it becomes larger, faster, and roots for longer.;Pop Blossom;After a short preparation, Neeko leaps into the air and gains a shield. Upon landing, nearby enemies are damaged and stunned. The preparation is hidden if Neeko is disguised.;Inherent Glamour;Neeko can look like an ally champion. Taking damage from enemy Champions or casting damaging spells breaks the disguise.;
Hailing from a long lost tribe of vastaya
column2: Neeko can blend into any crowd by borrowing the appearances of others
column3: even absorbing something of their emotional state to tell friend from foe in an instant. No one is ever sure where—or who—Neeko might be
column4: but those who intend to do her harm will soon witness her true colors revealed
column5: and feel the full power of her primordial spirit magic unleashed upon them.

column1: Neeko was born on a remote and largely unknown island
column2: far to the east
column3: where the last members of an ancient vastayan tribe remained isolated from the rest of the world. They were called the Oovi-Kat
column4: and could trace their lineage generation by generation back to the legendary Vastayashai’rei—the ancestors of all vastaya.

column1: The Oovi-Kat were peaceful beings
column2: of unrivaled potential. Their harmonious society blended seamlessly with the spirit realm
column3: so that their sho’ma—their spiritual essence—could intermingle with other beings through mere proximity
column4: and even help them mimic other physical forms. No secrets existed between the Oovi-Kat
column5: but few were as curious
column6: resilient
column7: or energetic as young Neeko.

column1: She developed a fondness for games
column2: hiding trinkets and thoughts to see if others could find them. Her inquisitive nature knew no bounds
column3: and she was pure and innocent in her charmed existence.

column1: But it was not to last. Cataclysm loomed on the horizon.
Thanks to the quick thinking and self-sacrifice of the Oovi-Kat elders
column2: Neeko escaped the death of her homeland. She clumsily took the form of a bird
column3: and fled the smoldering destruction
column4: feeling the screams of her people fading into the ethereal gulf between realms.

column1: Days later
column2: desperate and exhausted
column3: Neeko plummeted into the sea. She clung to driftwood
column4: entirely at the mercy of the currents
column5: until an odd silhouette rose into view. She could hear voices carrying over the waves
column6: and so she swam toward the strange structure.

column1: With the last of her strength
column2: she crept aboard what turned out to be a mercantile vessel destined for Harelport. Neeko rested where she could
column3: calling out into the spirit realm for her lost tribe. She felt only scattered
column4: sad echoes in response
column5: and images of towering
column6: dead trees that lay somewhere over a fragile horizon…

column1: When Neeko emerged from the ship into the city
column2: it was a strange and unfamiliar new world. All her senses tingled. Many a creature
column3: even another Oovi-Kat
column4: might be afraid in that situation—but not Neeko. The society bustled with unique personalities
column5: strangers with a vast array of motives and shapes. This was a place of countless stories and experiences
column6: and it entranced her completely.

column1: Before she could get far
column2: she was spotted by a vastayan sailor named Krete. Neeko could not understand all his words
column3: but he demanded to know which tribe she belonged to. Neeko reached out with her sho’ma
column4: mimicking his face and expression to make her peaceful intentions understood
column5: but Krete did not seem to like this at all. Overwhelmed by his darkening thoughts
column6: Neeko fled into the crowd
column7: altering her shape many times until she escaped.

column1: Surrounded by lush
column2: tropical greenery in the hinterlands beyond Harelport
column3: Neeko grappled with her recent experiences. She simply could not understand how anyone might rely solely on words as their singular form of communication. It seemed so… limiting?

column1: Seeking solace
column2: she took on the shape of the sleek jungle cats she encountered among the trees
column3: and tried to run with them. Neeko loved being fast and agile
column4: and their bright
column5: keen eyes reminded her of home—until
column6: quite unexpectedly
column7: the leader transformed into a beautiful
column8: strong
column9: dark-haired woman. After a tense standoff
column10: she introduced herself as Nidalee
column11: and reluctantly accepted Neeko into the group.

column1: Neeko hesitated to entrust the truths of the Oovi-Kat to others
column2: but she felt a deep kinship with Nidalee
column3: because she suspected this bestial huntress might share some forgotten connection with the vastayan race. Their friendship blossomed
column4: and for many months they roamed the wilds together.

column1: But the towns and cities
column2: with all their flaws
column3: still called to Neeko. Her ancestors came to her in dreams
column4: showing her the pale branches of those dead trees
column5: over and over. The trees needed color
column6: to bloom again—of that much
column7: Neeko was certain. She asked her friend to join her on this new journey
column8: but Nidalee could not be persuaded.

column1: Crestfallen
column2: but determined
column3: Neeko set out alone.

column1: Her old life among the Oovi-Kat may be lost forever
column2: but Neeko envisions a magical future—a larger tribe of like-hearted vastaya
column3: yordles
column4: humans
column5: and whatever other creatures might share her dream. As far as she is concerned
column6: everyone has the potential to find a place in her new tribe. She has pledged to seek these souls out
column7: to befriend them
column8: and defend their sho’ma with her life.

column1: To know Neeko is to love Neeko
column2: and to love Neeko is to be Neeko.
