Try to hang back before rushing into a team fight.;;;Interrupting the charge up on Absolute Zero will lower the amount of damage your team takes.;Using Summoner Flash is a surefire way to escape Absolute Zero.;Biggest Snowball Ever moves very fast but cannot turn as quickly, so don't try to escape it by running away in a straight line.  Instead, make sudden, sharp turns.;;Tank;Fighter;Mana;4;6;7;4;540.0;82;280.0;42.0;345;29;3.0;32.0;1.25;125;5.0;0.8;7.0;0.5;61.0;3.0;2.25;0.625;Consume;Willump takes a bite out of a minion, monster, or enemy champion, dealing damage and healing himself.;Biggest Snowball Ever!;Willump creates a snowball that grows in size and speed as he rolls it.  The snowball damages and knocks up enemies.;Snowball Barrage;Nunu throws multiple snowballs that damage enemies.  When he's finished, Willump roots any champions or large monsters that were hit by a snowball.;Absolute Zero;Nunu & Willump create a powerful blizzard in an area that slows enemies and deals massive damage at the end.;Call of the Freljord;Nunu increases the attack speed and movement speed of Willump and a nearby ally, and causes Willump's basic attacks to damage enemies around the target.;
Once upon a time
column2: there was a boy who wanted to prove he was a hero by slaying a fearsome monster—only to discover that the beast
column3: a lonely and magical yeti
column4: merely needed a friend. Bound together by ancient power and a shared love of snowballs
column5: Nunu and Willump now ramble wildly across the Freljord
column6: breathing life into imagined adventures. They hope that somewhere out there
column7: they will find Nunu’s mother. If they can save her
column8: maybe they will be heroes after all…

column1: One of the Notai
column2: a nomadic tribe that long traveled the Freljord
column3: Nunu learned from his mother
column4: Layka
column5: that behind every thing is a story. Together
column6: they gathered tales that Layka turned into songs. For Nunu
column7: nothing was better than journeying from village to village
column8: hearing his mother sing of ancient heroes. With music and dance
column9: the Notai brought one last celebration to everyone they met
column10: as each winter’s chill set in.

column1: Riding the wave of frost spilling from Anivia’s wings
column2: his heart beating the rhythm of a jubilant song
column3: Nunu’s world was full of possibility.

column1: On his fifth nameday
column2: Layka gave Nunu a special gift: a flute
column3: so he could learn to play her melodies himself. In the safety of their cart
column4: the two bundled together and followed the knotted string that served as Layka’s heart-song
column5: recording everywhere they’d been together
column6: as the years came and went.

column1: When the caravan was attacked by raiders
column2: Nunu was separated from his mother. Dragged to safety by a band of Frostguard
column3: the surviving Notai children were taken to a village near their towering citadel. Nunu was left to wonder what happened to Layka
column4: waiting to hear her songs on the wind.

column1: Snow fell. Weeks passed.
Nunu missed his mother desperately
column2: but the Frostguard assured him no child could safely search for her. They weren’t even impressed when he showed them the flute he now called Svellsongur—the name of a mighty blade existing only in his imagination.

column1: Nunu spent more and more time alone
column2: escaping into his mother’s songs—the legends and heroes of old. He yearned to be one of these heroes
column3: a warrior like the Frostguard
column4: who could have saved his mother. He even met their leader
column5: Lissandra
column6: who asked countless questions about his mother’s stories
column7: always seeking information about one particular song.

column1: No one believed Nunu could be a hero
column2: not even the other Notai children
column3: who teased him for his flute when they now had daggers. But Nunu knew the songs in his heart
column4: and one night
column5: he realized how he could prove himself and earn the Frostguard’s help to find his mother.

column1: From Lissandra
column2: he’d learned of a fierce monster that killed all who sought its power
column3: thwarting the Frostguard who were sent each year
column4: never to return. There was a song that Nunu’s mother sang… could it be the one Lissandra would always ask about? Suddenly
column5: Nunu understood. Lissandra wanted to know about the yeti.

column1: Nunu could name the beast. It would answer his challenge
column2: and feel the wrath of Svellsongur!

column1: Using his flute to tame a herd of elkyr
column2: Nunu snuck out into the snow. One lonely child traveled to face a monster
column3: finally living out a legend that not even he could imagine.

column1: An ancient and noble race that once ruled over the mountains of the Freljord
column2: the yeti civilization was destroyed in a cataclysm of ice. Forced to watch his brethren descending into savagery after being stripped of their magic
column3: one yeti swore to protect what remained of their power—a gem that swirled with the frozen dreams of any mortal mind nearby.

column1: As the last magical yeti
column2: the guardian was also shaped by perception. Though he had been chosen to safeguard the magic until it would be needed again
column3: he could find no worthy vessel. The men who intruded upon his ruined home had only malice in their hearts… and so a monster greeted them with fang and claw.

column1: But the guardian knew he was forgetting something. His name… and the names of those he had loved...
Once
column2: there had been song.

column1: That all changed when a young boy stumbled into the ruins. After centuries of unbroken vigil
column2: the monster was prepared to end the boy’s life
column3: snarling as he sensed the human approach.

column1: Unexpectedly
column2: the gem brought forth images of heroes slaying dragons and beheading ancient serpents from the boy’s mind. The child roared
column3: drawing his flute like a fearsome sword. But the blow never came
column4: for even as the boy saw visions of heroes swirling around him
column5: he realized the deeper truths of the songs his mother sang…

column1: When he looked at the guardian
column2: he didn’t see a monster. He saw someone who needed a friend.

column1: Still enraged
column2: the yeti did not expect the first snowball to the face. Or the second. Snowball fight! In anger
column3: then shock
column4: then joy
column5: the guardian joined in
column6: shaped not by fear
column7: but by a child’s imagination. He was growing furrier and friendlier. His growl was becoming a laugh.

column1: Until the beast accidentally broke the boy’s flute.
As the child began to cry
column2: the guardian felt a kindred grief take shape around the gem. For centuries
column3: he had looked into it and seen the end of his people—the threat they had buried
column4: betrayal by the blind one—and now
column5: instead
column6: he saw a caravan burning. He heard a voice on the wind. He sensed something else within the boy
column7: something he had never felt from a human
column8: not even the three sisters who had come to him long ago. It was love
column9: fighting back despair.

column1: In that moment
column2: the guardian knew the Freljord’s only hope lay in the power already within this child. The magic he’d been guarding was a tool; what truly mattered was the heart that would shape it. With a gesture
column3: the magic passed from the gem into the boy
column4: giving him the ability to make his imagination real. To repair his flute
column5: freezing it in dreams that hardened into True Ice.

column1: To imagine a best friend named “Willump.”
Escaping into the Freljordian plains
column2: Nunu’s heart and Willump’s strength now enable the pair to do what they never could alone: to have an adventure! Following the songs of Nunu’s mother
column3: they snowball wildly from one place to the next
column4: holding onto the hope that she is still out there
column5: somewhere.

column1: But Willump knows that with magic and dreams come responsibility. One day the games will end
column2: as the dark ice at the heart of the Freljord thaws
column3: and thaws…

column1: 78;Poppy;Keeper of the Hammer;Noxus Poppy;Lollipoppy;Blacksmith Poppy;Ragdoll Poppy;Battle Regalia Poppy;Scarlet Hammer Poppy;Star Guardian Poppy;Snow Fawn Poppy;Hextech Poppy;Astronaut Poppy;Bewitching Poppy;;;;;Iron Ambassador tends to land near walls, try to take advantage of this with Heroic Charge.;Keeper's Verdict can be released immediately to send the enemy straight up, take advantage of this in duels.;;;;Poppy can stop nearby enemies from dashing with Steadfast Presence.;When Poppy starts to spin her hammer, she is charging Keeper's Verdict.;You can step on Poppy's shield to deny it from her.;;Tank;Fighter;Mana;6;7;2;6;540.0;90;280.0;40.0;345;38;3.5;32.0;1.25;125;8.0;0.8;7.0;0.7;64.0;4.0;2.5;0.625;Hammer Shock;Poppy swings her hammer, dealing damage and creating a zone that will slow enemies and explode after a delay.;Steadfast Presence;Poppy passively gains Armor and Magic Resist. This bonus increases when she is low on Health. Poppy can activate Steadfast Presence to gain movement speed and stop enemy dashes around her. If a dash is stopped, the enemy is slowed and grounded.;Heroic Charge;Poppy dashes to the target and pushes it back. If the target is pushed into a wall, it is stunned.;Keeper's Verdict;Poppy channels a hammer strike that knocks enemies very far away.;Iron Ambassador;Poppy throws her buckler that bounces off the target. Poppy can pick it up to gain a temporary shield.;
Runeterra has no shortage of valiant champions
column2: but few are as tenacious as Poppy. Bearing a hammer twice the length of her body
column3: this determined yordle has spent untold years searching for the “Hero of Demacia” a fabled warrior said to be the rightful wielder of her weapon.

column1: As legend describes it
column2: this hero is the only person who can unlock the full power of the hammer and lead Demacia to true greatness. Though Poppy has searched the furthest corners of the kingdom for this legendary fighter
column3: her quest has proven fruitless. Each time she has attempted to pass the hammer on to a potential hero
column4: the results have been disastrous
column5: often ending in the warrior’s death. Most people would have abandoned the task long ago
column6: but most people do not possess the pluck and resolve of this indomitable heroine.

column1: Poppy was once a very different yordle. For as long as she could remember
column2: she had been in search of a purpose. Feeling alienated by the chaotic whimsy of other yordles
column3: she preferred to soak up stability and structure where she could find it. This drive brought her to the human settlements of western Valoran
column4: where she gazed in wonder at the caravans striping the countryside in an endless file. Many of the people there looked tattered and weary
column5: but they stumbled on in pursuit of some ephemeral better life that might lie just beyond the horizon.

column1: One day
column2: however
column3: a different sort of caravan passed through. Unlike the other travelers
column4: these people seemed to move with purpose. They all awoke at the exact same time each morning
column5: roused by the sound of a watchman’s horn. They took their meals together every day at the same hour
column6: always finishing within a few minutes. They set up their camps and took them down with remarkable efficiency.

column1: While yordles used their innate magic to fashion extraordinary things
column2: these humans achieved equally astounding feats through coordination and discipline. They acted in concert like the cogs of a gear
column3: becoming something much larger and stronger than any single person could ever be. To Poppy
column4: that was more marvelous than all the magic in the world.

column1: As Poppy watched the camp from the safety of her hiding place
column2: her eyes caught the gleam of armor emerging from a tent. It was the group’s commanding officer
column3: wearing a brigandine of gleaming steel plates
column4: each piece overlapping
column5: each an integral part of the whole. The man’s name was Orlon
column6: and his presence seemed to stir the souls of everyone there. If someone became discouraged
column7: he was there to remind them of why they pressed on. If someone collapsed from exhaustion
column8: he inspired them to get up. It reminded Poppy of certain yordle charms
column9: though again
column10: without magic.

column1: Poppy crept in for a closer look. She found herself following this shining commander
column2: as if drawn to him by fate itself. She observed Orlon as he led his soldiers in training exercises. He was not a large fellow
column3: yet he swung his massive battle hammer with surprising alacrity. At night
column4: Poppy listened intently to his hushed discussions with the elders of the camp. She heard them making plans to pull up stakes and head west to build a permanent settlement.

column1: Poppy’s mind was overwhelmed with questions. Where was Orlon going? Where did he come from? How did he assemble this meticulous band of travelers
column2: and was there a place for a yordle in it? At that moment
column3: she made the most important decision in her life: For the first time ever
column4: she would reveal herself to a human
column5: as this was the first time she’d ever felt a connection with one.

column1: The introduction was a jarring one
column2: with Orlon having just as many questions for Poppy as she had for him
column3: but the two soon became inseparable. He became a mentor to her
column4: and she a devotee to his cause. In the training grounds
column5: Poppy was an invaluable sparring partner–the only member of Orlon’s battalion who was unafraid to strike him. She was never obsequious
column6: questioning his decisions with an almost childlike innocence
column7: as though she didn’t know she was supposed to meekly follow orders. She accompanied him to the site of the new settlement–an ambitious new nation called Demacia
column8: where all were welcome
column9: regardless of station or background
column10: so long as they contributed to the good of the whole.

column1: Orlon became a beloved figure throughout the kingdom. Though few had actually seen him wield his hammer
column2: he always bore it on his back
column3: and the weapon quickly became a revered icon for the fledgling nation. People whispered that it had the power to level mountains and tear the earth itself asunder.

column1: Orlon passed the hammer to Poppy on his deathbed
column2: and with it
column3: his hope of an enduring kingdom. It was only then that Orlon told her the story of his weapon’s creation
column4: and how it was never truly intended for his hands. He explained to Poppy that the hammer was meant to go to the Hero of Demacia–the only one who could keep Demacia whole. As her friend drew his last breath
column5: Poppy swore to him that she would find this hero and place the weapon in his hands.

column1: But what Poppy possesses in resolve
column2: she lacks in ego
column3: as it never even occurred to her that she might be the hero Orlon described.

Try to find him alone.;;Support;;Mana;2;4;8;5;540.0;85;315.0;50.0;335;32;3.9;32.0;1.25;300;5.0;0.5;8.75;0.5;62.0;3.5;3.0;0.635;Gleaming Quill;Flings a magical feather that deals magic damage. Can be re-cast for free for a short duration.;The Quickness;Gains movement speed, charming and dealing magic damage to enemies touched.;Fey Feathers;Rakan periodically gains a shield.;
As mercurial as he is charming
column2: Rakan is an infamous vastayan troublemaker and the greatest battle-dancer in Lhotlan tribal history. To the humans of the Ionian highlands
column3: his name has long been synonymous with wild festivals
column4: uncontrollable parties
column5: and anarchic music. Few would suspect this energetic
column6: traveling showman is also partner to the rebel Xayah
column7: and is dedicated to her cause.

column1: On the ancient
column2: mystical borders of Ionia’s deep forests live the last of the Lhotlan vastaya. It is a place where magic is breathed like air and time has little meaning. To these chimeric creatures
column3: the mortal realms have become like an unforgiving desert
column4: virtually devoid of magic. Few willingly travel far from their shrinking lands
column5: but Rakan has long walked a riskier path. He journeys along the edges of the world’s magical streams
column6: as an explorer
column7: emissary
column8: and song catcher for his tribe.

column1: An entertaining rogue
column2: a welcome performer for any tavern or village carnival
column3: Rakan was content with the simple adventures of this life on the road… until he had a chance encounter with Xayah at the harvest festival in Vlonqo.

column1: Seeing her in the crowd
column2: Rakan performed one of his old songs
column3: entrancing the entire town with his gleaming plumage. Though countless human and vastayan women had fallen for him in the past
column4: this violet raven seemed immune to his charms
column5: though not uninterested. How could she see him and yet choose not to follow him? It was a puzzle with no easy answer.

column1: Intrigued
column2: the battle-dancer decided he would accompany Xayah on her travels. He became fascinated by how she interacted with the world. She seemed always prepared
column3: aloof
column4: and focused where he was uninformed
column5: affable
column6: and frivolous—but in any dangerous situation
column7: they fought together with uncanny harmony. Soon enough
column8: the pair became inseparable.

column1: After months of courtship
column2: Rakan began to see the world through Xayah’s eyes. Inspired by his partner’s singular drive
column3: he joined her crusade to reclaim the power of the vastaya
column4: and take back all that their people had lost.

column1: Through Xayah
column2: he had found purpose
column3: and Rakan had fallen in love.

On arrival, Braum and the ally gain Armor and Magic Resist for a few seconds.;Unbreakable;Braum raises his shield in a direction for several seconds, intercepting all projectiles causing them to hit him and be destroyed. He negates the damage of the first attack completely and reduces the damage of all subsequent attacks from this direction.;Glacial Fissure;Braum slams the ground, knocking up enemies nearby and in a line in front of him. A fissure is left along the line that slows enemies.;Concussive Blows;Braum's basic attacks apply Concussive Blows. Once the first stack is applied, ally basic attacks also stack Concussive Blows. Upon reaching 4 stacks, the target is stunned and takes magic damage. For the next few seconds they cannot receive new stacks, but take bonus magic damage from Braum's attacks.;
Blessed with massive biceps and an even bigger heart
column2: Braum is a beloved Iceborn hero of the Freljord. Every mead hall north of Frostheld toasts his legendary strength and tells tales of how he felled a forest of oaks in a single night
column3: and punched an entire mountain into rubble. With his shield
column4: an enchanted vault door forged in ages past
column5: Braum roams the frozen north as a cheerful protector
column6: helping the vulnerable as he works toward his dream of a peaceful Freljord.

column1: Even as a child
column2: Braum was much larger than other Freljordian youngsters
column3: but his mother taught him never to use his size to intimidate or bully. She came from a proud line of herders
column4: and believed true courage lay in using one’s power not to dominate
column5: but to protect those in need.

column1: When Braum was still a boy
column2: ice giants devastated a neighboring tribe. That tribe had long preyed upon the herds of Braum’s people
column3: but his mother didn’t hesitate to head out across the tundra to help the survivors
column4: bearing furs
column5: foodstuffs
column6: and healing supplies. At first
column7: Braum didn’t understand why she would aid their rivals—but after her actions saved many lives
column8: they became lifelong allies. He finally understood what his mother meant when she said all the Freljord’s people were a family
column9: and from that day forth
column10: he pledged to bring that family together.

column1: As Braum grew
column2: it was clear he was one of the revered Iceborn
column3: though even among their number
column4: his strength and ability to endure the elements were legendary. He became a local hero
column5: rescuing children who had slipped into icy ravines
column6: saving travelers stranded in blizzards
column7: and protecting families from ravaging wildclaws. Whenever he appeared
column8: people knew help had arrived. He was a figure of hope
column9: known for his liveliness and laughter
column10: and the easy way he made friends.

column1: Eventually
column2: Braum realized he was needed beyond the valleys and tundra where he’d been raised. Bidding his mother a tearful farewell
column3: he set out to travel the Freljord.

column1: Over the years
column2: countless stories spread of Braum’s mighty feats and good deeds. While most had at least a kernel of truth
column3: they grew increasingly far-fetched and mythic—such as the legend of how he chopped down an entire forest in a single night using only his bare hands
column4: or how during a volcanic eruption
column5: he saved an isolated farmstead by picking it up and carrying it to higher ground.

column1: A more recent tale spoke of how Braum found his immense ram-headed shield. As the story went
column2: it was an enchanted vault door
column3: forged in ancient times and set into a mountain. Braum heard cries from within
column4: but he couldn’t break the door down. Undeterred
column5: he punched his way through the mountain’s bare rock
column6: rescuing a troll boy who was trapped inside. He ripped the unbreakable door off its hinges
column7: and has borne it ever since.

column1: As with many legends about him
column2: Braum laughed uproariously when he first heard this particular tale—but far from refuting such stories
column3: he embraces them. Why let the truth get in the way of inspiring others to acts of generosity and kindness?

column1: No matter how he actually found his shield
column2: soon afterward Braum made his way to the sacred site of Rakelstake
column3: where many tribes had gathered to hear the words of the Avarosan warmother
column4: Ashe—said to be the reincarnation of Avarosa herself. There
column5: he witnessed the barbarian Tryndamere
column6: desperate to prove his worth
column7: savagely beating any who would face him.

column1: As Braum watched
column2: he saw that Tryndamere was growing increasingly unhinged. During one duel
column3: he was so lost in his fury that it seemed certain he would kill his opponent
column4: despite having already prevailed. Deciding things had gone far enough
column5: Braum planted himself in front of the downed fighter
column6: shield raised
column7: and Tryndamere hacked and smashed against the impenetrable bulwark. When the barbarian’s rage finally subsided
column8: Braum’s good humor won him over
column9: and before long the pair were laughing and drinking to each other’s health. Some even say that it was Braum who first introduced Tryndamere to Ashe. The barbarian would later marry her
column10: becoming her only bloodsworn.

column1: Braum doesn’t hold any particular tribal allegiance
column2: for he views all within the Freljord as brothers and sisters. Even so
column3: he sees in Ashe someone who can end the centuries-old feuding among the Freljord’s tribes
column4: and the Avarosans have informally adopted him into their number. Braum’s dream
column5: as he often tells adoring children
column6: is that someday the Freljord will be united in one big family… and then he can retire to become a humble poro herder.

column1: Though Braum counts no one as his enemy
column2: he has had a few run-ins with the Frostguard since he started carrying his shield. He doesn’t understand why they have a grudge against him
column3: nor why they seem so interested in what he now bears…

Enemies struck take damage and are knocked up.;Stone Skin;Wukong gains stacking armor and max health regeneration while fighting champions and monsters.;
Wukong is a vastayan trickster who uses his strength
column2: agility
column3: and intelligence to confuse his opponents and gain the upper hand. After finding a lifelong friend in the warrior known as Master Yi
column4: Wukong became the last student of the ancient martial art known as Wuju. Armed with an enchanted staff
column5: Wukong seeks to prevent Ionia from falling to ruin.

column1: Within Ionia’s magical forests dwells a tribe of vastaya known as the Shimon. A cautious people
column2: they see life as an evolutionary climb to wisdom—upon death
column3: they believe they become stones
column4: returning to the soil to begin the climb of life anew.

column1: Impulsive
column2: clever
column3: and easily bored
column4: young Kong never had much in common with other Shimon. For countless years
column5: they endured his pranks… until the day he arrived in a panic
column6: insisting that a great elemental dragon was coming to burn their woodland home.

column1: But Kong only chuckled as his tribe began to flee. Realizing he had fooled them
column2: and with their patience finally at an end
column3: the Shimon named him outcast. Kong
column4: for his part
column5: was ambivalent. He would seek out people with a better sense of humor.

column1: Living as something of a charlatan
column2: he proclaimed himself “the Monkey King” and often challenged mortals to duels
column3: or games of cunning. He claimed to be undefeated—until he crossed a Noxian headsman in the hinterlands of Zhyun. The Noxian and his comrades chased the Monkey King deep into the wilderness
column4: where he hid
column5: only emerging again after the invaders left the shores of the First Lands for good.

column1: And in time
column2: Kong saw the brutality Noxus had inflicted upon his homeland.

column1: He set out to meet the fabled combat-masters of Wuju
column2: but found that their village had been annihilated. The only living soul was a man sitting quietly among the ruins
column3: so Kong challenged him to a good-natured fight. In a single motion
column4: the man stood
column5: knocked the vastaya down
column6: then resumed his meditation.

column1: For weeks
column2: Kong returned again and again
column3: determined to defeat this dour man—but the Monkey King was always outmaneuvered
column4: no matter if he approached from behind
column5: above
column6: or below. The warrior could sense whenever Kong was about to attack
column7: even when the vastaya tried to distract him with hilarious jokes
column8: and he somehow knew not to drink his tea when Kong laced it with stupefying spirits.

column1: Eventually
column2: the Monkey King knelt before the man and begged to learn his ways. Kong wanted to be the greatest warrior
column3: but he also sought something more. He just couldn’t quite put it into words.

column1: The man saw Kong’s humility
column2: and knew the vastaya was ready. He introduced himself as Yi
column3: the last master of Wuju
column4: and agreed to train Kong in its virtues of discipline and patience. He could help channel Kong’s recklessness and impulsiveness into a lethally swift and surprising fighting style.

column1: The two grew to respect each other
column2: yet Yi refused to speak much of his past
column3: or why he would not leave the ruined village. Kong made a proposition. The two would engage in a friendly sparring bout. If Kong won
column4: Yi had to reveal why he’d stopped fighting. If Yi prevailed
column5: Kong wouldn’t speak for four full seasons.

column1: Yi eagerly accepted.
When Kong had first arrived at Wuju
column2: he crept through a field of smokepoppies
column3: and he lured his master back there now. Each time Yi attacked
column4: the agitated flowers would burst around him—until finally he struck out through the growing haze at what he believed was Kong
column5: but instead hit a straw decoy. Kong seized his opportunity
column6: and grappled Yi to the ground.

column1: Finally
column2: Yi told Kong the truth. He and his fellow disciples had gone to defend Ionia during the war
column3: bringing the wrath of Noxus down upon Wuju in turn. He blamed himself for the death of every last villager
column4: and watched over the ruins as penance.

column1: This
column2: Kong realized
column3: was what he sought. Although his tribe had cast him out
column4: he wanted to defend the Shimon
column5: who had sheltered him for so long
column6: and set him on the path to wisdom and enlightenment. Proud of his student
column7: Yi also felt a renewed sense of purpose—he granted Kong an enchanted staff
column8: crafted by the legendary weaponsmith Doran
column9: and a new honorific
column10: reserved only for the brightest students of Wuju.

column1: From that day forward
column2: he was known as Wukong.

column1: Though the war is long over
column2: Noxus’ influence continues to defile Ionia. Roads have been carved through the ancient forests
column3: self-styled “tax collectors” hound peaceful folk who have nothing left to give
column4: and the great festivals of renewal have been slowly declining
column5: year after year.

column1: But the great warriors Wukong and Master Yi are ready. Side by side
column2: they roam the First Lands
column3: resolved to combat injustice and hatred wherever they find it.

column1: 98;Shen;the Eye of Twilight;Frozen Shen;Yellow Jacket Shen;Surgeon Shen;Blood Moon Shen;Warlord Shen;TPA Shen;Pulsefire Shen;Infernal Shen;PsyOps Shen;;;;;;;Keep an eye on allies and be ready to save them with your teleport.;Leverage your Energy to get a long-term advantage over Mana users.;;;;Be ready to dodge Shen's taunt and punish him if he misses.;Once Shen reaches level 6, watch out for his global-range ultimate, which can turn fights quickly.;;;Tank;;Energy;3;9;3;4;540.0;85;400.0;0.0;340;34;3.0;32.0;1.25;125;8.5;0.75;50.0;0.0;60.0;3.0;3.0;0.751;Twilight Assault;Shen recalls his spirit blade to attack with it, dealing damage based on the target's max health. The attacks are greatly empowered if it collides with an enemy champion, and all collided enemies are slowed while running away from Shen.;Spirit's Refuge;Attacks that would hit Shen or his allies near his spirit blade are blocked.;Shadow Dash;Shen dashes in a direction, taunting enemies in his path.;Stand United;Shen shields target allied champion from incoming damage, and soon after teleports to their location.;Ki Barrier;After casting a spell, Shen gets a shield. Affecting other champions reduces the cooldown of this effect.;
Among the secretive
column2: Ionian warriors known as the Kinkou
column3: Shen serves as their leader
column4: the Eye of Twilight. He longs to remain free from the confusion of emotion
column5: prejudice
column6: and ego
column7: and walks the unseen path of dispassionate judgment between the spirit realm and the physical world. Tasked with enforcing the equilibrium between them
column8: Shen wields blades of steel and arcane energy against any who would threaten it.

column1: An enigma to the spirit realm
column2: as well as the mortal world
column3: Shen belongs to neither. Although born to one of the most revered families of northern Navori
column4: it was his father’s role as the Eye of Twilight that set his destiny in the Kinkou Order.

column1: As the son of Great Master Kusho
column2: he was immersed in the order’s culture
column3: and its core tenets were as familiar to him as the Ionian sunset. He knew the necessity of Pruning the Tree
column4: the determination of Coursing the Sun
column5: but above all
column6: he learned the wisdom of Watching the Stars. He meditated and studied throughout his childhood
column7: and was considered exemplary by all his teachers.

column1: His closest friend
column2: the only one who could match him in practice bouts
column3: was the young acolyte Zed. They grew up as brothers
column4: often confiding in each other their personal hopes and dreams. Shen could turn to Zed for a fresh perspective on any matter
column5: and the two became known as the Kinkou’s most promising students.

column1: As their skills developed
column2: Kusho brought them on dangerous missions
column3: including a hunt for the Golden Demon plaguing the province of Zhyun. Their search took years
column4: but Shen stayed committed even after uncovering countless gruesome murders. When they at last captured the “demon”
column5: it was revealed to be Khada Jhin
column6: a mere stagehand from a traveling theater. Instead of execution
column7: Great Master Kusho ordered the criminal imprisoned.

column1: Though he and Zed both thought the killer deserved heavier punishment
column2: Shen accepted his father’s decision. He strived to emulate the Eye of Twilight’s dispassion
column3: and so found himself failing to console a bitter and resentful Zed.

column1: Even when Noxian invaders threatened the peace of the First Lands
column2: Shen reluctantly supported Kusho’s inaction. But when Zed abandoned the Kinkou to join the fight
column3: Shen stayed within the temple walls.

column1: Many of the provinces were soon occupied by the enemy. Despite this
column2: Shen focused on maintaining Ionia’s spiritual harmony. So it was
column3: when he was far from home
column4: he felt a jolting imbalance within the Kinkou Order—rushing back
column5: he came upon the survivors of a bloody coup. From them
column6: he learned Zed had raised acolytes of his own
column7: and seized the temple.

column1: Worst of all
column2: Shen’s father had been slain by the man he once saw as kin.

column1: Repressing his anguish
column2: he led the remnants of the Kinkou to safety in the mountains. Shen took up his father’s spirit blade
column3: as well as the title of Eye of Twilight. His role was not to seek vengeance
column4: but to rebuild the order. Following the core tenets
column5: he began to recruit and train others
column6: hoping to restore its strength.

column1: One acolyte in particular showed boundless potential. Shen taught the girl
column2: Akali Jhomen Tethi
column3: to master the arts of stealth and subterfuge. Her mother
column4: Mayym
column5: had stood alongside Kusho as the Fist of Shadow
column6: and it seemed as though her daughter could follow the same path. Even so
column7: Shen found himself forced to urge restraint whenever Akali would seek to strike back at their mortal foes.

column1: When Noxus finally withdrew
column2: many Ionians celebrated the victorious resistance. Others
column3: like Shen
column4: endured the consequences of war—he persisted in his duty
column5: while in private he wrestled with his hatred for Zed
column6: and doubt in his own ability to lead. The years of conflict had taken a heavy toll on the First Lands
column7: and Shen was uncertain whether the rebuilt Kinkou would ever be able to redress the balance.

column1: Indeed
column2: even as Akali became the new Fist of Shadow
column3: he felt her beginning to drift away. In time
column4: she openly denounced his teachings
column5: and left the order.

column1: Shen meditated
column2: watching the stars
column3: and understood that Akali would need to find her own way… and so would the Kinkou.

column1: Sometimes
column2: between unseen struggles in the spirit realm
column3: Shen still contemplates the value of his beliefs. He has never let his emotions stop him from preserving tradition
column4: but the question remains: how long can one man walk two worlds
column5: before the acts of one destroy the other?

column1: 85;Kennen;the Heart of the Tempest;Deadly Kennen;Swamp Master Kennen;Karate Kennen;Kennen M.D.;Arctic Ops Kennen;Blood Moon Kennen;Super Kennen;Infernal Kennen;DWG Kennen;;;;;;;You can stun your opponents by inflicting 3 Marks of the Storm upon them.;Lightning Rush can be used to initiate fights with its Energy return component, allowing him to use other abilities afterward.;You can land an initial Mark of the Storm debuff on an opponent with Thundering Shuriken, and then add to it with Electrical Surge.;;;Consider playing a bit more cautiously around Kennen when you have a Mark of the Storm debuff. If he hits you with 3 Marks of the Storm, you will get stunned.;Kennen is flimsy by nature - turn and attack him if he gets careless with Lightning Rush.;;;Mage;Marksman;Energy;6;4;7;4;541.0;84;200.0;0.0;335;29;3.75;30.0;0.5;550;5.5;0.65;50.0;0.0;48.0;3.75;3.4;0.625;Thundering Shuriken;Kennen throws a fast moving shuriken towards a location, causing damage and adding a Mark of the Storm to any opponent that it hits.;Electrical Surge;Kennen passively deals extra damage and adds a Mark of the Storm to his target every few attacks, and he can activate this ability to damage and add another Mark of the Storm to targets who are already marked.;Lightning Rush;Kennen morphs into a lightning form, enabling him to pass through units and apply a Mark of the Storm. Kennen gains movement speed when entering this form, and attack speed when leaving it.;Slicing Maelstrom;Kennen summons a storm that strikes at nearby enemy champions for magical damage.;Mark of the Storm;Kennen stuns enemies he hits 3 times with his abilities.;
The longest-standing member of the ancient Kinkou Order
column2: the yordle Kennen is the first and only Heart of the Tempest. For centuries
column3: he has used diplomacy—and force—to maintain the sacred balance in his adopted home of Ionia. Lightning fast and bearing the wisdom of a long and storied life
column4: Kennen works with the Eye of Twilight
column5: Shen
column6: to protect the fragile harmony of the First Lands with a whirling storm of shuriken and devastating electrical energy.

column1: A riotous domain of constant transformation
column2: Bandle City was no place for a yordle like Kennen. Searching for harmony and balance
column3: he ventured out from the spirit realm millennia ago. He explored the material realm with boundless curiosity
column4: traveling great distances in a heartbeat. But he was drawn in particular to Ionia.

column1: In the First Lands
column2: he witnessed ancient wars that none now remember
column3: and a land struggling to rebuild afterward. Kennen grew fascinated by a people seeking balance for themselves and their home. Over time
column4: he returned to Bandle City less and less
column5: choosing to remain in Ionia
column6: where yordles were respected as creatures of the spirit realm. Though he did not age as beings of the material realm did
column7: Kennen embraced mortals
column8: studying them for generations. He admired how
column9: despite their fragile lives
column10: they were diligent protectors of the sacred balance.

column1: Even so
column2: there were threats to the tranquility of Ionia. Malevolent entities of the spirit realm traversed the land with ill intent. Kennen battled these disturbances alone for years
column3: enjoying the fun each challenge brought
column4: but in the end he understood he was doing little to address why the incursions were happening: imbalance. He discovered a fledgling order whose members actively pursued balance between the realms—who
column5: after careful observation
column6: would judge what needed to be done to restore it.

column1: They called themselves the Kinkou.
Kennen was intrigued by the order
column2: led by a distant Eye of Twilight and a vindictive Fist of Shadow. He realized that the Kinkou’s leadership required another aspect. A consensus builder
column3: one who would prevent the warlike Fist from domineering over the introspective Eye
column4: and likewise keep the Eye’s tireless observation from paralyzing the Fist.

column1: As a creature of both the spirit and material realms
column2: Kennen proposed that he was uniquely suited to be an arbiter. The order accepted Kennen’s wisdom
column3: and he became the Kinkou’s first Heart of the Tempest. As part of the new triumvirate with the Eye of Twilight and the Fist of Shadow
column4: Kennen passed judgment on how best to preserve balance
column5: and his affability and diplomacy kept the Kinkou in harmony.

column1: Moreover
column2: Kennen noticed that a rift had grown between the order and the people around them
column3: as judgments were carried out swiftly
column4: mysteriously
column5: and without chance for appeal. Again
column6: the yordle realized he could fill a need for the Kinkou. With his fantastic speed and compassion
column7: he was the ideal representative to communicate the judgments of the order to those affected by them. He’d seen how the Kinkou distanced themselves from the people
column8: wearing masks over their faces
column9: and took care to remove his to connect with those he sought to protect.

column1: Yet there was another side to Kennen
column2: a far more serious aspect as Heart of the Tempest. Charged with Coursing the Sun
column3: he addressed challenges to the Kinkou’s judgments
column4: and not always with words.

column1: For sometimes
column2: the cost of balance was the blood of the offender—and Kennen’s shuriken and summoned maelstroms were quite capable of silencing all dissent.

column1: There have been many threats to the Kinkou over the centuries
column2: but none as grave as the Noxian invasion and its aftermath. When Noxus invaded the First Lands
column3: Kennen opposed joining the resistance
column4: even as the war threatened to tear the Kinkou apart. In their darkest hour
column5: after a coup led by a former acolyte named Zed
column6: the yordle guided the order while the new Eye of Twilight
column7: Shen
column8: struggled to lead. Kennen urged the Fist of Shadow
column9: Mayym
column10: to look to her daughter Akali
column11: whom he’d trained since childhood
column12: and see her as a successor.

column1: But even he couldn’t find the words to stop Akali from eventually leaving the Kinkou
column2: frustrated at the order’s failure to act against Ionia’s enemies.

column1: Recent events have tested Kennen
column2: a new age of disruption and violence that has thrown Ionia into chaos. Come what may
column3: he will protect the fractured Kinkou Order
column4: fighting alongside Shen to defend the balance of the First Lands. Do not let Kennen’s diminutive appearance fool you—for the heart of the tempest is its calmest part
column5: but when it turns its eye upon you
column6: its force is never more than a moment behind.

column1: 14;Sion;The Undead Juggernaut;Hextech Sion;Barbarian Sion;Lumberjack Sion;Warmonger Sion;Mecha Zero Sion;Worldbreaker Sion;Blackfrost Sion;;;;;;;;;You only have very slight turning ability during Unstoppable Onslaught, so make sure to use it in straight paths.;Roar of the Slayer is a great setup ability to land a very powerful Decimating Smash.;The Soul Furnace buff displays how much shield strength is remaining, use this information to time its explosion perfectly.;;;Even if Sion still hits a Decimating Smash, making him release the charge earlier reduces its impact.;Use the time after Sion has died to reposition and prepare for his return.;;;Tank;Fighter;Mana;5;9;3;5;545.0;73;330.0;42.0;345;32;3.0;32.0;1.25;175;7.5;0.8;8.0;0.6;68.0;4.0;1.3;0.679;Decimating Smash;Sion charges a powerful swing in an area in front of himself that will deal damage to enemies when released. If he charges for enough time, enemies hit by the swing will also be knocked up and stunned.;Soul Furnace;Sion shields himself and can reactivate after 3 seconds to deal Magic Damage to enemies nearby. When Sion kills enemies, he passively gains maximum Health.;Roar of the Slayer;Sion fires a short range shockwave that damages and slows and reduces the Armor of the first enemy hit. If the shockwave hits a minion or monster, it will be knocked back, damaging, slowing, and reducing the Armor of all enemies that it passes through.;Unstoppable Onslaught;Sion charges in a direction, ramping up speed over time. He can steer his charge slightly with the mouse cursor location. When he collides with an enemy he deals damage and knocks them up based on the distance he has charged.;Glory in Death;After being killed, Sion will temporarily reanimate with rapidly decaying Health. His attacks become very rapid, heal him, and deal bonus damage based on his target's maximum Health.;
A brutal warlord from a bygone era
column2: Sion was revered in Noxus for choking the life out of a Demacian king with his bare hands—but
column3: denied the peace of death
column4: he was resurrected to serve his empire once more. His indiscriminate slaughter claims all who stand in his way
column5: regardless of allegiance
column6: proving he has retained little of his former humanity. With crude armor bolted onto his rotten flesh
column7: Sion continues to charge into battle with reckless abandon
column8: struggling to remember his true self between the swings of his mighty axe.

column1: Over a century past
column2: the brutal warlord Sion rose to prominence
column3: slaughtering all who dared stand in his way. Greatly feared by friend and foe alike
column4: he was the last of a proud warrior culture that had been part of Noxus since its founding. Sion had sworn oaths to his ancestors to never take a backward step in battle
column5: and to die a proud warrior’s death when his time came.

column1: While not noted for his subtlety or strategic acumen
column2: Sion’s methods were ruthlessly effective
column3: and he won many vicious triumphs for Noxus. The empire’s might was at a peak not seen for hundreds of years
column4: and so it took the generals of high command by surprise when a nation from the west first resisted
column5: then began pushing back their steady advance. These Demacians drove the Noxian warbands eastward
column6: harrying them back behind the walls of Hvardis. Sion
column7: who had been campaigning in the Argent Mountains
column8: now turned south
column9: filled with fury.

column1: He arrived at the city to find the Demacians on the horizon. They had no intention of besieging Hvardis—having driven the Noxians from the lands neighboring their own
column2: they were preparing to return home. Sion readied his troops
column3: determined to punish these upstarts for their impudence. The Noxian commander at Hvardis
column4: however
column5: had already suffered several defeats to the enemy
column6: and was content to hide behind the city walls and let them leave unscathed.

column1: It had been Sion and his warriors who had paid the claim to the land now lost in blood; outraged
column2: he hurled the commander from the city walls
column3: and ordered the attack.

column1: Sion tore straight through the Demacian lines
column2: seeking out their leader—King Jarvan the First. But while his own warband charged with him
column3: fearless of death
column4: those who had been cowering in Hvardis were weak. Their spirit broke
column5: and they retreated back to the city
column6: leaving Sion and his trusted few surrounded. One by one
column7: they fell
column8: but Sion ploughed on.

column1: Alone
column2: pierced by a dozen swords and a score of crossbow bolts
column3: he finally reached Jarvan. The fight was brutal
column4: and it was the Demacian who delivered the killing blow. Sion dropped his axe and
column5: with a final burst of strength
column6: tore the king’s crown from his head with one hand
column7: clamping the other around his throat. Jarvan’s guards stabbed Sion again and again
column8: but his grip did not loosen.

column1: Only when the enemy king was slain did Sion allow death to claim him.
His body was recovered—along with the Demacian king’s crown
column2: still in his grip—and borne back to the Immortal Bastion in honor. Noxus mourned Sion’s passing
column3: and his corpse was interred within a towering monument constructed to honor him for all time.

column1: Half a century passed before Sion’s tomb was reopened.
Noxian dominance had waned in the years since Sion’s death
column2: and the ruling Grand General of the empire
column3: Boram Darkwill
column4: was willing to pay almost any price to restore its lost glory. Darkwill’s allies
column5: a mysterious cabal known as the Black Rose
column6: reanimated the long-dead hero using forbidden magics
column7: and presented him to the Grand General.

column1: He could not refuse this gift
column2: and so Sion returned to life
column3: driven by unnatural bloodlust and utterly inured to pain.

column1: He hurled himself like a living battering ram against the enemies of Noxus
column2: destroying all he faced. More so than before his death
column3: the victories Sion brought were costly. He was uncontrollable
column4: killing friend and foe without remorse
column5: and those forced to fight alongside him began to desert. Finally
column6: Darkwill ordered Sion reinterred.

column1: Hundreds of warriors died trying to restrain him before he was finally bound in chains and dragged back to the Immortal Bastion. Without slaughter
column2: the blood magic that sustained him quickly engulfed his mind in an all-consuming rage. His roars finally fell silent as he was sealed in beneath his giant statue.

column1: There he languished for many years
column2: neither alive nor truly dead. When his tomb opened once more
column3: it was to a very different empire. Darkwill was gone
column4: overthrown by the general Jericho Swain—but Sion cared little
column5: roaring and pulling against his bindings in a frenzy that could only be sated in battle.

column1: Chained within an iron cage
column2: he returned to Hvardis
column3: which had broken away from Noxian rule under Darkwill’s reign; Sion was the new Grand General’s punishment for their rebellion.

column1: He butchered the defenders of Hvardis and leveled the city
column2: laughing as he ripped its towers apart with his bare hands. Other regions that had abandoned Noxus soon bent the knee
column3: fearing the undead juggernaut would be unleashed upon them next.

column1: When harsh daylight floods his opening tomb
column2: Sion now welcomes it… for with it comes the chance to shed his chains and sate his hunger for bloodshed
column3: to briefly silence the screaming madness drowning out all thought of rest.

column1: Sion remembers only fragments of his life
column2: and less of the times since
column3: but one truth has remained as stark as on the day of his death—now
column4: as then
column5: the world trembles before him.

column1: 30;Karthus;the Deathsinger;Phantom Karthus;Statue of Karthus;Grim Reaper Karthus;Pentakill Karthus;Fnatic Karthus;Karthus Lightsbane;Infernal Karthus;Pentakill III: Lost Chapter Karthus;;;;;;;;Ask your allies to help point out when you should use Requiem to get kills in different lanes.;Lay Waste is very strong at farming minions and harassing enemy champions.;;;;Karthus can cast spells for a short duration after he is killed. Move away from his corpse to be safe.;Make sure you always have enough health to survive Requiem, even if you have to go back to the base more frequently to heal.;;;Mage;;Mana;2;2;10;7;550.0;87;467.0;30.5;335;18;3.5;30.0;0.5;450;6.5;0.55;8.0;0.8;46.0;3.25;2.11;0.625;Lay Waste;Karthus unleashes a delayed blast at a location, dealing damage to nearby enemies. Deals increased damage to isolated enemies. ;Wall of Pain;Karthus creates a passable screen of leeching energy. Any enemy units that walk through the screen have their Movement Speed and Magic Resist reduced for a period.;Defile;Karthus passively steals energy from his victims, gaining Mana on each kill. Alternatively, Karthus can surround himself in the souls of his prey, dealing damage to nearby enemies, but quickly draining his own Mana.;Requiem;After channeling for 3 seconds, Karthus deals damage to all enemy champions.;Death Defied;Upon dying, Karthus enters a spirit form that allows him to continue casting spells.;
The harbinger of oblivion
column2: Karthus is an undying spirit whose haunting songs are a prelude to the horror of his nightmarish appearance. The living fear the eternity of undeath
column3: but Karthus sees only beauty and purity in its embrace
column4: a perfect union of life and death. When Karthus emerges from the Shadow Isles
column5: it is to bring the joy of death to mortals
column6: an apostle of the unliving.

column1: Karthus was born into abject poverty in the sprawl of dwellings built beyond the walls of the Noxian capital. His mother died at the moment of his birth
column2: leaving his father to raise him and his three sisters alone. They shared a crumbling
column3: rat-infested almshouse with scores of other families
column4: subsisting on a diet of rainwater and vermin. Of all the children
column5: Karthus was the best ratter
column6: and regularly brought gnawed corpses for the cook-pot.

column1: Death was commonplace in the slums of Noxus
column2: and many mornings began with the wailing of bereaved parents who woke to discover their child cold and lifeless beside them. Karthus learned to love these laments
column3: and would watch
column4: fascinated
column5: as the tally-men of Kindred notched their staffs and bore the bodies from the almshouse. At night the young Karthus would sneak through the cramped rooms
column6: seeking those whose lives hung by a thread
column7: hoping to witness the moment their soul passed from life to death. For years
column8: his nightly travels were fruitless
column9: as it was impossible to predict exactly when a person would die. He was denied witnessing the moment of death until it reached his own family.

column1: Outbreaks of disease were frequent in such cramped confines
column2: and when Karthus’s sisters sickened with the plague
column3: he watched over them intently. While his father drowned his grief
column4: Karthus was the ever dutiful brother
column5: caring for his sisters as the disease consumed them. He watched each of them as they died
column6: and a sublime connection seemed to reach into him as the light faded from their eyes - a yearning to see what lay beyond death and unlock the secrets of eternity. When the tally-men came for the bodies
column7: Karthus followed them back to their temple
column8: asking them question after question about their order and the workings of death. Could a person exist at the moment where life ends
column9: but before death begins? If such a liminal moment could be understood and held
column10: might the wisdom of life be combined with the clarity of death?

column1: The tally-men quickly recognized Karthus’s suitability for their order and he was inducted into their ranks
column2: first as a digger of graves and pyre-builder
column3: before ascending to the rank of corpse collector. Karthus guided his bone-cart around the streets of Noxus to gather the dead every day. His dirges quickly became known throughout Noxus
column4: mournful laments that spoke to the beauty of death and the hope that what lay beyond was something to be embraced. Many a grieving family took solace in his songs
column5: finding a measure of peace in his heartfelt elegies. Eventually
column6: Karthus worked in the temple itself
column7: tending to the sick in their final moments
column8: watching as whatever death had laid its claim upon them took its due. Karthus would speak to each person laid before him
column9: ushering their souls into death
column10: in search of further wisdom in their fading eyes.

column1: Eventually
column2: Karthus reached the conclusion that he could learn no more from mortals
column3: that only the dead themselves could answer his questions. None of the dying souls could tell of what lay beyond
column4: but whispered rumors and tales told to frighten children echoed of a place where death was not the end - The Shadow Isles.

column1: Karthus emptied the temple’s coffers and bought passage to Bilgewater
column2: a city plagued by a strange black mist said to draw souls to a cursed island far out at sea. No captain was willing to take Karthus to the Shadow Isles
column3: but eventually he came upon a rum-sodden fisherman with a mountain of debts and nothing to lose. The boat plied the ocean for many days and nights
column4: until a storm drove them onto the rocks of an island that appeared on no charts. A black mist rolled out from a haunted landscape of gnarled trees and tumbled ruins. The fisherman freed his boat and turned its prow in terror for Bilgewater
column5: but Karthus leapt into the sea and waded ashore. Steadying himself with his notched tally-staff
column6: he proudly sang the lament he had prepared for the moment of his own death
column7: and his words were carried on a cold wind to the heart of the island.

column1: The black mist flowed through Karthus
column2: ravaging his flesh and spirit with ancient sorcery
column3: but such was the force of his desire to transcend mortality that it did not destroy him. Instead
column4: it remade him
column5: and Karthus was born anew in the waters of the island as a fleshless revenant.

column1: Revelation filled Karthus as he became what he always believed he should have been; a being poised at the threshold of death and life. The beauty of this eternal moment filled him with wonder as the wretched spirits of the island rose to behold his transformation
column2: drawn to his passion like predators scenting blood in the ocean. Finally
column3: Karthus was where he belonged
column4: surrounded by those who truly understood the boon undeath truly was. Filled with righteous zeal
column5: he knew he had to return to Valoran and share his gift with the living
column6: to free them from petty mortal concerns.

column1: Karthus turned and the Black Mist bore him over the waves to the fisherman’s boat. The man fell to his knees before Karthus
column2: begging for his life
column3: and Karthus granted him the blessing of death
column4: ending his mortal suffering and raising him up as an immortal spirit as he sang his lament for passing souls. The fisherman was the first of many such souls Karthus would free
column5: and soon the Deathsinger would command a legion of unliving wraiths. To Karthus’s awakened senses
column6: the Shadow Isles was in a state of apathetic limbo
column7: where the blessings of death were squandered. He would galvanize the dead in a crusade to bring the beauty of oblivion to the living
column8: to end the suffering of mortality and usher in a glorious age of undeath.

column1: Karthus has become the emissary of the Shadow Isles
column2: the herald of oblivion whose laments are paeans to the glory of death. His legions of unbound souls join with his funereal dirges
column3: their haunting song reaching beyond the Black Mist to be heard on cold nights over graveyards and charnel houses all across Valoran.

column1:
777;Yone;the Unforgotten;Spirit Blossom Yone;Battle Academia Yone;Dawnbringer Yone;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Assassin;Fighter;Flow;8;4;4;8;550.0;85;500.0;0.0;345;28;3.4;32.0;1.25;175;7.5;0.75;0.0;0.0;60.0;2.0;3.5;0.625;Mortal Steel;Thrusts forward, damaging all enemies in a line.

On hit, grants a stack of Gathering Storm for a few seconds. At 2 stacks, Mortal Steel dashes Yone forward with a gust of wind knocking enemies Airborne.

Mortal Steel is treated as a basic attack and scales with all the same things.;Spirit Cleave;Cleaves forward, damaging all enemies in a cone. Grants a shield to Yone, the value is increased by the number of champions hit by the swipe.

Spirit Cleave's cooldown and cast time scale with attack speed.;Soul Unbound;Yone's spirit leaves his body behind, gaining movement speed. When this skill ends, Yone's spirit is forced back to his body and he repeats a portion of the damage he dealt as a spirit.;Fate Sealed;Yone blinks behind the last champion in a line with a slash so powerful it pulls all enemies hit towards him.;Way of the Hunter;Yone deals magic damage with every second Attack. In addition, his critical strike chance is increased.;
In life
column2: he was Yone—half-brother of Yasuo
column3: and renowned student of his village’s sword school. But upon his death at the hands of his brother
column4: he found himself hunted by a malevolent entity of the spirit realm
column5: and was forced to slay it with its own sword. Now
column6: cursed to wear its demonic mask upon his face
column7: Yone tirelessly hunts all such creatures in order to understand what he has become.

column1: In life
column2: Yone adhered to a strict code of honor and duty. Even as a child
column3: his love for his family led him to assume the mantle of protector
column4: motivated in no small way by the loss of his father. This was in stark contrast to his half-brother
column5: Yasuo
column6: who was brash and reckless where Yone was patient and disciplined.

column1: Still
column2: the two were inseparable—and when Yone began his studies at the renowned sword school near their village
column3: Yasuo followed.

column1: As they trained
column2: Yone was often forced to temper his younger brother’s impulsiveness. However
column3: when Yasuo refused the personal tutelage of Elder Souma
column4: master of the legendary wind technique
column5: Yone gifted him a maple seed—a symbol of humility—as a sign of his support and encouragement.

column1: Yone was proud of his brother
column2: but he had doubts about the wise master’s judgment
column3: fearing that Yasuo’s impulsive nature would make him a poor student. But Elder Souma was well respected
column4: and did not make careless decisions.

column1: Putting his concerns aside
column2: Yone continued to practice with dual blades
column3: his prowess quickly earning the respect and admiration of his fellow disciples. Though Yone’s skill was unmatched
column4: Yasuo’s use of the wind technique made their sparring sessions a sight to behold
column5: and a joy to the brothers themselves.

column1: But that joy did not last long. War came to Ionia.
Yone
column2: along with many other disciples
column3: left to defend against the approaching Noxian forces while Yasuo reluctantly stayed behind to protect his master. But one fateful night
column4: Elder Souma was discovered dead—slain by the very wind technique that he taught.

column1: When Yone returned
column2: he found that Yasuo had fled.

column1: This shook Yone to his core. His fears were proven true—Elder Souma had been wrong.
Yone blamed himself. If Yasuo had murdered Souma
column2: Yone had failed to teach him the righteous path. If Yasuo had simply abandoned his post and allowed his master to die
column3: then Yone had failed to instill him with discipline. Either way
column4: Yasuo had already killed several of those who pursued him—and to Yone
column5: their blood stained his own hands as much as his brother’s.

column1: He tracked Yasuo down. When their swords finally crossed
column2: Yone’s steel was unmatched… but Yasuo’s mastery of the wind cut his brother down.

column1: Death
column2: however
column3: was not the end. When Yone awoke within the spirit realm
column4: the weight of his failure crushed him. His fury flared
column5: and he pounded his fists on the ground in rage.

column1: A rumbling laugh pierced his thoughts. He turned
column2: and beheld a monstrous
column3: humanoid spirit with a blood-red blade. It was a powerful azakana
column4: a predatory entity that had long stalked Yone from beyond the veil.

column1: Before Yone could speak
column2: it struck.

column1: He drew the spiritual echoes of his blades to his side just in time to block the attack. He once again found himself in a duel where his swordsmanship was unparalleled
column2: but he was overwhelmed by magic.

column1: Anger consumed him. A lifetime of honor and duty snapped. In one furious moment
column2: Yone wrested the azakana’s blade from it and ran the creature through.

column1: The last thing he heard before a new darkness took him was that same rumbling laughter…
As he came to
column2: Yone found himself back in the material realm
column3: though it was a grim shadow of what it had been. He struggled to his feet
column4: the spirit realm hazy in his mind
column5: and a blood-red sword in his hand. Upon his head
column6: a mask had coalesced in the form of the azakana’s face—he could not remove it
column7: but he could now see other azakana through its eyes. They were not yet true demons
column8: content to feed on negativity before eventually manifesting to devour their hosts. But
column9: as Yone would discover
column10: if an azakana’s name was learned
column11: they could be reduced to inert masks of personified emotion.

column1: Even so
column2: he could not tell if—or when—the azakana he wore would reawaken to consume him. In life
column3: Yone had worn the mask of protector
column4: brother
column5: and disciple for so long that it had become his identity. But now
column6: in moments of stillness
column7: he swears he can feel the mask shifting upon his face
column8: his own past and unresolved conflict with Yasuo now paling in comparison to this new threat.

column1: Yone hunts these insidious creatures in an attempt to understand what he has become—with each name bringing him a step closer to uncovering that of the one whose laughter still haunts him.
Nothing else matters. There is only the chase of truth.

19;Warwick;the Uncaged Wrath of Zaun;Grey Warwick;Urf the Manatee;Big Bad Warwick;Tundra Hunter Warwick;Feral Warwick;Firefang Warwick;Hyena Warwick;Marauder Warwick;Urfwick;Lunar Guardian Warwick;PROJECT: Warwick;Old God Warwick;;;;Follow your Blood Hunt trails to low health enemy champions.;Infinite Duress (R)'s distance scales with any movement speed you gain, even from ally buffs and summoner spells.;Jaws of the Beast (Q) will follow enemies who run, dash or teleport if you keep the button held down.;;;Warwick's attacks heal him at low health. Save your disables to finish him off.;Warwick is empowered versus low health enemies. Manage your health to keep him at bay.;Warwick's ultimate cast range scales with his movement speed.;;Fighter;Tank;Mana;9;5;3;3;550.0;85;280.0;35.0;335;33;3.2;32.0;1.25;125;4.0;0.75;7.47;0.58;65.0;3.0;2.3;0.638;Jaws of the Beast;Warwick lunges forward and bites his target, dealing damage based on their maximum health and healing for damage dealt.;Blood Hunt;Warwick senses enemies below 50% health, gaining movement speed toward and attack speed against them. At the end, or if re-activated, he howls, causing nearby enemies to flee for 1 second.;Infinite Duress;Warwick leaps in a direction (scaling with his bonus Move Speed), suppressing the first champion he collides with for 1.5 seconds.;Eternal Hunger;Warwick's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage. If Warwick is below 50% health, he heals the same amount. If Warwick is below 25% health, this healing triples.;
Warwick is a monster who hunts the gray alleys of Zaun. Transformed by agonizing experiments
column2: his body is fused with an intricate system of chambers and pumps
column3: machinery filling his veins with alchemical rage. Bursting out of the shadows
column4: he preys upon those criminals who terrorize the city’s depths. Warwick is drawn to blood
column5: and driven mad by its scent. None who spill it can escape him.

column1: Though many think of Warwick as no more than a beast
column2: buried beneath the fury lies the mind of a man—a gangster who put down his blade and took up a new name to live a better life. But no matter how hard he tried to move on
column3: he could never escape the sins of his past.

column1: Memories of that time come to Warwick in flashes before they’re inevitably lost
column2: replaced by searing echoes of the days he spent strapped to a table in Singed’s lab
column3: the mad chemist’s face looming above him.

column1: His world a haze of pain
column2: Warwick could not recall how he fell into Singed’s grasp… and even struggled to remember a time before the suffering began. The scientist patiently carved into him
column3: installing pumps and hoses to inject chemicals into his veins
column4: seeking what an alchemist always seeks: transmutation.

column1: Singed would reveal his subject’s true nature—the deadly beast hidden within a “good man.”
The chemicals pumped into Warwick’s veins boosted his healing
column2: allowing Singed to gradually and painfully reshape the man. When his hand was severed in the course of the experiment
column3: Singed was able to reattach it
column4: augmenting it with powerful
column5: pneumatic claws
column6: and bringing Warwick ever closer to his true potential.

column1: A chemical chamber was installed on Warwick’s back and integrated with his nervous system. Whenever he felt rage
column2: or hate
column3: or fear
column4: it would drive liquid fury deeper into his veins
column5: fully awakening the beast within.

column1: He was forced to endure it all
column2: every cut of the mad chemist’s scalpel. Pain
column3: Singed assured his subject
column4: was necessary; it would prove to be the “great catalyst” of his transformation. Though the chemicals enabled Warwick’s body to heal through most of the physical damage
column5: his mind was shattered by the unending agony.

column1: Warwick struggled to recall a single memory from his past... All he could see was blood. But then he heard a little girl screaming. Screaming something he couldn’t understand. It sounded like a name.
He’d already forgotten his. He sensed that was for the best.
Pain soon overwhelmed all other thoughts. Blood was the only thing left.
Though his body and mind were broken after weeks on the slab
column2: Warwick stubbornly resisted the chemicals transmuting him. Toxins leaked from his eyes in place of tears. He coughed up gobs of caustic phlegm that sizzled against his chest
column3: before burning shallow holes in the floor of the lab. Restrained against the cold steel of the table
column4: Warwick writhed in agony for hours on end
column5: until his body finally gave out.

column1: With the untimely death of his subject
column2: Singed disposed of the corpse in a charnel pit deep in Zaun’s Sump
column3: before turning his mind to the next experiment.

column1: But death proved to be the true catalyst needed for Warwick’s transformation. As he lay cooling atop the pile of corpses
column2: the chemicals could finally complete their work. The chamber on his back began to pump.

column1: His body contorted unnaturally
column2: bones bending and snapping
column3: teeth growing
column4: sinews tearing and then healing with a faint alchemical glow
column5: dead flesh replaced by something new and powerful. By the time his heart started beating once again
column6: the man Warwick had been and the lives he’d lived were gone.

column1: He awoke to hunger. Everything hurt. Only one thing mattered.
He needed blood.
First
column2: it was the blood of a nearby sump-scrapper
column3: rooting through the charnel pile. And then a priestess of the Glorious Evolved
column4: seeking a member of her flock. Then a Piltovan apprenta taking a shortcut
column5: and a philter-faced merchant avoiding a gang
column6: and a dram-dealer
column7: and a tallyman
column8: and a chem punk...

column1: He set up a den not far from a place that itched at the back of his now-animal mind. There
column2: he continued the slaughter
column3: not caring who fell to his claws. So long as blood dripped from gnashing teeth
column4: he would feel nothing but a smear of red on his conscience
column5: the hunger in his gut overwhelming any concern for his random victims.

column1: Yet
column2: even as he surrendered to the beast
column3: glimpses of his past began to haunt him. He saw a bearded man reflected in the eyes of a beggar as he tore out his throat. The other man looked somber
column4: somehow familiar; there were scars on his arms. Sometimes
column5: as he fed in dark alleys on stray gangers
column6: the flash of knives would remind him of an old blade covered in blood. Blood passing from the blade to his hands. From his hands
column7: to everything he touched. Sometimes
column8: he remembered the girl again.

column1: And still there was blood.
It had always been there
column2: he realized
column3: his entire life
column4: and nothing he did could wash it off. He’d left so many scars that even if he didn’t remember his past
column5: the city would. When he peered into the eyes of Zaun’s criminals—the gang bosses
column6: murderers
column7: and thieves—he saw himself. The chamber on his back would fill his body with hate. His claws tore out of his fingers.

column1: He hunted.
No longer content to kill indiscriminately
column2: Warwick now pursues those already covered in the stench of blood. Just as he was the day he was dragged to Singed’s door.

column1: He still wonders if he’d truly wanted this. He can’t remember details
column2: but he remembers enough. Enough to know Singed had been right all along—the good man had been a lie
column3: before disaster had burned it away
column4: revealing the truth.

column1: He is Warwick. He is a killer.
And there are so many killers to hunt.

column9: after a delay

column1: As the reclusive leader of the Frostguard
column2: many believe Lissandra is a living saint whose followers bring healing and wisdom to the tribes of the Freljord. The truth is perhaps more sinister
column3: as she uses her elemental magic to twist the power of True Ice into something dark and terrible
column4: entombing or impaling any who would reveal her deepest secrets. Indeed
column5: the legacy of her past may yet be the beginning of the end for Runeterra.

column1: In a time long forgotten
column2: before the sands birthed and then swallowed Shurima
column3: beings of old magic freely walked Runeterra. The borders between the mortal realm and what lay beyond it were hotly contested.

column1: Into this dangerous and volatile age
column2: Lissandra and her sisters
column3: Serylda and Avarosa
column4: were born. Each sought to harness the powers at war
column5: and each paid a terrible price. Attempting to command the heavens above them
column6: Serylda lost her voice to the first twilight. Avarosa faced the twisting dark beneath the world
column7: and was deafened by its emptiness
column8: waiting to consume all creation.

column1: It was Lissandra who stood against the wild magic of the mortal world itself. For this defiance
column2: the savage claws of a primal god raked across her eyes
column3: blinding her.

column1: Though each sister had lost a part of themselves
column2: it was on the frozen fields of Lissandra’s many battles that they were able to unite and prevail. Together
column3: they were unstoppable… but even a bond of blood could only weather so much.

column1: With her sight taken
column2: Lissandra chose instead to walk in dreams. As she navigated the fitful visions of those around her
column3: she realized only she could see the darkness below for what it was: the lingering abyss promised not only an ending
column4: but infinity. It was death
column5: both dangerous and full of potential. Unknown to her sisters
column6: Lissandra struck a deal on their behalf with the god-like entities she had communed with—the Watchers would grant them near-immortality in exchange for preparing Runeterra for the coming of the Void.

column1: The three sisters and their most powerful followers were named Iceborn. Those with this ability to withstand the worst of the numbing frost would be spared until the very end.
However
column2: Lissandra’s sisters grew displeased. Avarosa argued that the only thing worse than death was servitude. Even Serylda bristled against what would become of the world they had fought so hard for. Caught in the middle
column3: Lissandra tried to soothe her sisters’ concerns while appealing to the Watchers for more time
column4: but the unknowable nothingness cared not for such platitudes.

column1: The Void erupted into the mortal world in the far north
column2: and with it
column3: Lissandra’s hidden allegiance to the Watchers became undeniable. In that moment
column4: her only choices were to let all the world be consumed
column5: or to give up what she cared for most—Lissandra sacrificed her sisters and the allies they had gathered
column6: entombing the Watchers beneath a glacial barrier of magical ice that could never be melted.

column1: Lissandra soon discovered that even this elemental power was not enough. The monstrous beings she had frozen were merely slumbering
column2: slowly tainting the True Ice around them into something darker. Now
column3: they wandered through Lissandra’s dreams as easily as she had theirs
column4: and always she would wake
column5: terrified
column6: professing her loyalty to the chilling eternity they promised.

column1: Ever the survivor
column2: she gathered her remaining followers to venerate her and her departed sisters. If True Ice would delay the inevitable end of all things
column3: then they had to gather as much of it as they could find
column4: and scour the frozen lands for any of Iceborn descent to join their cause.

column1: Lissandra and the first among her Frostguard did everything in their power to rewrite history
column2: seizing all records of what had truly happened… and yet
column3: rumors and prophecies persisted in myth and song. It was whispered that Avarosa and Serylda would one day return to unite the disparate tribes
column4: and so Lissandra had any who were hailed as their reincarnations quietly killed. Even she retreated into the shadows
column5: periodically renewing herself with the powers she had been gifted.

column1: Like the threat that lies trapped beneath the ice
column2: Lissandra has never been able to completely control her sisters’ legends. Whether from guilt or arrogance
column3: her failure to eradicate their legacy has manifested once more in two powerful Iceborn—one an idealist
column4: the other a conqueror—and now
column5: between them
column6: they lead many tribes within the Freljord.

column1: Lissandra watches them carefully
column2: seeking any opportunity to pit them against one another
column3: all the while redoubling her own efforts to lock away the terrible secrets she has buried deep under her citadel.

column1: And she must hurry
column2: for the ice is beginning to melt.
