The most feared duelist in all Valoran
column2: Fiora is as renowned for her brusque manner and cunning mind as she is for the speed of her bluesteel rapier. Born to House Laurent in the kingdom of Demacia
column3: Fiora took control of the family from her father in the wake of a scandal that nearly destroyed them. House Laurent's reputation was sundered
column4: but Fiora bends her every effort to restore her family's honor and return them to their rightful place among the great and good of Demacia.

column1: From an early age
column2: Fiora defied every expectation placed upon her. Her mother had the finest craftsmen of Demacia fashion the most lifelike dolls for her. Fiora gave them to her maids and took up her brother's rapier
column3: forcing him to give her lessons in secret. Her father obtained a host of dressmaking mannequins for her personal seamstress to craft wondrous dresses. Fiora used them to practice lunges and ripostes.

column1: At every stage in her life
column2: Fiora has embodied all that is noble in Demacia
column3: striving for perfection in all things and brooking no insult to her honor or that of her family's ideals. As the youngest daughter of House Laurent
column4: she was destined for a life as a political pawn
column5: to be married off in the grand game of alliances between patrician houses. This did not sit well with Fiora
column6: whose temperament saw only dishonor in being maneuvered by another's will
column7: even that of her beloved father. Despite her resistance
column8: a politically advantageous marriage was arranged with an outlying branch of House Crownguard
column9: and plans were set for a summer wedding.

column1: The ancient families of Demacia sent their invited representatives to House Laurent to attend the marriage ceremony
column2: but instead of meekly accepting her fate
column3: Fiora defied it. She declared before the assembled host that she would sooner die than be dishonored by allowing someone else to control her fate. Her husband-to-be was publicly shamed and his family demanded a duel to the death to wipe away Fiora's scandalous insult.

column1: Fiora immediately stepped forward
column2: but as Master of House Laurent
column3: it was her father's duty to accept. The champion of House Crownguard was a truly deadly warrior
column4: and defeat was almost certain. To lose would see House Laurent ruined and his daughter exiled in disgrace. Presented with so stark a choice
column5: Fiora's father made a decision that would damn his family for years to come. That night
column6: he attempted to drug his opponent with a draught to rob his blows of speed
column7: but his attempt was discovered and the Master of House Laurent was arrested.

column1: Demacian law is notoriously harsh and unforgiving. Its justice allows no leeway
column2: and Fiora's father had broken its most fundamental code of honor. He would suffer public humiliation upon the executioner's scaffold
column3: hanged like a common criminal
column4: and his entire family expelled from Demacia. On the eve of his death
column5: Fiora visited her father's cell
column6: but what passed between them is a secret known only to her.

column1: An ancient and all but forgotten code of honor allowed for a family member to expunge the shame of one of its number in blood
column2: and thus avoid the virtual death-sentence of exile. Knowing they had no choice
column3: father and daughter faced each other within the Hall of Blades. Justice would not be served by a mere slaying
column4: Fiora's father had to fight and be fought. The battle was blindingly swift
column5: a dance of blades so exquisite that those who witnessed it would never forget what they had seen. Fiora's father was a fine swordsman in his own right
column6: but he was no match for his daughter. They said farewell in every clash of the blade
column7: but in the end a tearful Fiora buried her rapier in her father's heart and assured her family's continued place in Demacia. With her father dead at her feet
column8: Fiora became the head of House Laurent (much to the surprise of her older brothers...).

column1: Though the honor of House Laurent was not entirely ruined
column2: scandals are not easily erased. In the years that followed
column3: Fiora proved a sagacious leader of her House and swiftly learned not to make the mistakes of brash youth. She became a formidable mistress of blade and negotiation
column4: cutting to the heart of any matter with her customary clarity and seemingly cruel directness. Some still speak of her House's disgrace or decry how standards have fallen that a woman should dare call herself ruler of a noble House
column5: but only in private. For when such gossip reaches Fiora's ear
column6: she is quick to call out those rumormongers and demand justice on the edge of a sword. Yet even here
column7: she is not without pragmatic cunning
column8: offering each challenger a way out that will allow honor to be satisfied without death. So far
column9: none have accepted her offers
column10: and none have ever walked away from a duel with Fiora.

column1: With the fortunes of House Laurent on the rise
column2: Fiora has no shortage of suitors
column3: but none have yet proven worthy of her hand. Many suspect Fiora herself puts every suitor through an impossible gauntlet of courtship in order to remain aloof and unmarried
column4: for a wife would
column5: traditionally
column6: relinquish power to her husband.

column1: And Fiora has never done anything traditionally.

887;Gwen;The Hallowed Seamstress;Space Groove Gwen;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Always be Attacking - In addition to dealing bonus damage, Gwen's Attacks empower or reset many of her Abilities.;Gwen can still damage enemies outside her Hallowed Mists, especially with her Ultimate's range.;Some of Gwen's Abilities can apply her passive to multiple enemies, so aim them at groups to get maximum damage and healing.;;;Gwen's Hallowed Mist shroud will only follow her once, after that it will dissipate when she leaves.;Gwen must hit something to recast her Ultimate, try to evade her between casts.;Gwen needs to attack a few times to set up her damage, so try to get the jump on her.;;Fighter;Assassin;Mana;7;4;5;5;550.0;90;330.0;40.0;340;39;4.0;32.0;1.25;150;8.5;0.55;7.5;0.7;63.0;3.0;2.25;0.69;Snip Snip!;Gwen snips her scissors in a cone up to 6 times dealing magic damage. Gwen deals true damage to units in the center and applies her passive to them on each snip.;Hallowed Mist;Gwen summons mist that protects her from enemies outside of it. She can only be targeted by enemies who enter the mist.;Skip 'n Slash;Gwen dashes a short distance then gains Attack Speed, attack range, and magic damage On-Hit for a few seconds. If she hits an enemy during that time, this Ability's cooldown is partially refunded. ;Needlework;Gwen hurls a needle that slows enemies hit, deals magic damage, and applies A Thousand Cuts to champions hit.

This ability can be cast up to two more times, with each cast throwing additional needles and dealing more damage. Gwen must hit an enemy between each cast to unlock the next one. ;A Thousand Cuts;Gwen's attacks deal bonus magic damage based on the targets health. She heals for a portion of the damage dealt to champions by this effect. ;
A former doll transformed and brought to life by magic
column2: Gwen wields the very tools that once created her. She carries the weight of her maker’s love with every step
column3: taking nothing for granted. At her command is the Hallowed Mist
column4: an ancient and protective magic that has blessed Gwen’s scissors
column5: needles
column6: and sewing thread. So much is new to her
column7: but Gwen remains joyfully determined to fight for the good that survives in a broken world.

column1: Within the long-lost kingdom of Camavor
column2: there once lived a village of people far from the throne. It was here
column3: in the rural colonies
column4: where a humble seamstress made her beloved doll
column5: Gwen.

column1: What Gwen can remember of her past
column2: she remembers with love. The seamstress and the doll spent their days crafting
column3: scissors resting in Gwen’s still hands as her maker stitched nearby with needle and thread. At night
column4: the two could be found crouched under the dinner table
column5: the seamstress challenging Gwen to makeshift duels
column6: the clash of silverware against scissors echoing in their candlelit kitchen.

column1: In time
column2: the games stopped and the light faded. Gwen could not understand why
column3: but whenever she struggled to recall details
column4: she felt a twinge of pain
column5: tied to a man whose name and face escaped her. As her memories washed away with the ocean tide
column6: Gwen lay still for centuries
column7: quiet and forgotten.

column1: Then one night
column2: her eyes opened. Gwen awoke for the very first time on a shadowy beach far from her home. By magic unbeknownst to her
column3: she had been transformed into a living girl who could move her hands and feet—all on her own!

column1: Gwen took to life with joy. She skipped across the sand
column2: amazed by how far her eyes could see
column3: how wondrous every pebble was to her touch
column4: and how incredible the wind felt on her back. Along the coast
column5: scattered debris left abandoned for a millennium caught her attention. Lying beside broken chests were oddly familiar tools.

column1: Scissors. Needles. Thread.
Gwen recognized them immediately. These were her maker’s tools. When her fingers touched them
column2: a burst of mist glinting with light flowed from her hands. To her
column3: it felt safe and warm
column4: like the soothing embrace of a hallowed past.

column1: But Gwen was not the only one drawn to this magic.
Lurking in the isles
column2: a different mist swarmed. Black in color
column3: it coiled and twisted
column4: forming into fearsome wraiths. Something within Gwen’s newfound presence attracted them—something they hungered for with obsession.

column1: As the wraiths came for her
column2: Gwen was undeterred. She thrust her scissors at them. To her delight
column3: more of her mist filled the air
column4: enchanting the size and strength of her tools and turning them from mere steel into spectral magic.

column1: But the wraiths were relentless. They swelled in number
column2: fueled by the ever-growing Black Mist. Gwen began to feel a tragic
column3: strangely familiar pain. Surrounded by wraiths
column4: suppressed memories surfaced. She recalled images of her maker
column5: sick and wounded
column6: lying in anguish. Near her was a man whose face finally returned to Gwen.

column1: Viego.
Remembering his name brought Gwen to her knees. Wistfully
column2: she reflected on the bygone moments spent with her maker—a happier
column3: simpler time—and stole one final glance at her scissors...

column1: It was then Gwen realized something amazing. Her maker
column2: victim to that man’s twisted vanity
column3: was not fully gone. The seamstress’ tools
column4: the very tools that first sewed and stitched Gwen together
column5: were now in her hands. Gwen believed this was no accident. She knew
column6: deep down
column7: her maker was still with her
column8: still fighting.

column1: This was a gift Gwen would not take for granted.
Grasping needles and thread
column2: she spun clouds of Hallowed Mist to push back the swarming wraiths. Her scissors slashed hard and fast
column3: reminiscent of those blissful nights when her maker imagined grand battles beneath their kitchen table. Soon
column4: the wraiths were no more.

column1: Though triumphant
column2: Gwen recognized this was only the beginning. She could sense these wraiths and Viego were linked
column3: both responsible for the spread of immense pain. With no time to lose
column4: she resolved to track the Black Mist and stop it at any cost. Gwen expected this endeavor to be strenuous
column5: yet she reveled in every second of being alive—for who knew how long this blessing would last?

column1: Having been given a unique chance at life
column2: Gwen chooses to be an indomitable
column3: positive force against all odds. She journeys across Runeterra
column4: determined to restore joy to those who are hurt and suffering. To Gwen
column5: each moment is precious
column6: and each step driven with purpose.

column1: 268;Azir;the Emperor of the Sands;Galactic Azir;Gravelord Azir;SKT T1 Azir;Warring Kingdoms Azir;Elderwood Azir;;;;;;;;;;;Be careful about putting down both of the soldiers stored by Arise! Unless you're going all-in, always have a soldier in your back pocket if you need to escape over a wall or if you misposition your other soldier and need damage now.;In the lane, try to position your soldiers between the enemy's minions and the enemy champion. This way you can use them both to last hit and to project threat onto your lane opponent.;Think of Emperor's Divide as a defensive ability first and foremost. Try to capitalize on windows of time when his soldiers are stationary.;Azir has immense damage over a prolonged amount of time but lacks the upfront burst of other mages. Don't stand in the fire.;;Mage;Marksman;Mana;6;3;8;9;552.0;92;480.0;21.0;335;19;3.0;30.0;0.5;525;7.0;0.75;8.0;0.8;52.0;2.8;3.0;0.625;Conquering Sands;Azir sends all Sand Soldiers towards a location. Their attacks deal magic damage to enemies in a line. Arise! also passively grants attack speed to Azir and his Sand Soldiers.;Shifting Sands;Azir shields himself briefly and dashes to one of his Sand Soldiers, damaging enemies. If he hits an enemy champion, he instantly readies a new Sand Soldier for deployment and halts his dash.;Emperor's Divide;Azir summons a wall of soldiers which charge forward, knocking back and damaging enemies.;Shurima's Legacy;Azir can summon the Disc of the Sun from the ruins of allied or enemy turrets.;
Azir was a mortal emperor of Shurima in a far distant age
column2: a proud man who stood at the cusp of immortality. His hubris saw him betrayed and murdered at the moment of his greatest triumph
column3: but now
column4: millennia later
column5: he has been reborn as an Ascended being of immense power. With his buried city risen from the sand
column6: Azir seeks to restore Shurima to its former glory.

column1: Thousands of years ago
column2: the Shuriman empire was a sprawling realm of vassal states conquered by powerful armies led by all but invincible warriors known as the Ascended. Ruled by an ambitious and power hungry emperor
column3: Shurima was the greatest realm of its day; a fertile land blessed by the power of the sun that shone from a great golden disc floating atop the temple at the heart of its capital.

column1: The youngest and least-favored son of the emperor
column2: Azir was never destined for greatness. With so many siblings ahead of him
column3: he would never be emperor. Most likely he would take up a position in the priesthood or as governor of some backwater province. He was a slender
column4: studious boy who spent more time perusing the texts collected in the Great Library of Nasus than training to fight under the stern tutelage of the Ascended hero
column5: Renekton.

column1: Amid the twisting shelves of scrolls
column2: books and tablets
column3: Azir met a young slave boy who visited the library almost every day in search of texts desired by his master. Slaves in Shurima were forbidden to take names
column4: but as the two boys became friends
column5: Azir broke that law and called his new friend Xerath
column6: which means ‘one who shares.’ He appointed Xerath - though he was careful never to endanger him by naming him publicly - as his personal slave and the two boys shared their love of history by learning all they could of Shurima’s past and its long legacy of Ascended heroes.

column1: While traveling with his father
column2: brothers and Renekton on the yearly tour of the empire
column3: the royal caravan stopped at a well-known oasis for the night. Azir and Xerath stole away in the middle of the night to draw the stars and add their own celestial maps to those they had studied in the Great Library. While they drew the patterns of constellations
column4: the royal caravan was attacked by a cabal of assassins sent by the emperor’s enemies. One of the assassins found the two boys out in the desert and was poised to cut Azir’s throat when Xerath intervened
column5: throwing himself upon the assassin’s back. In the ensuing melee
column6: Azir freed his dagger and plunged it into his attacker’s throat.

column1: Azir took up the dead man’s sword and rushed back to the oasis
column2: but by the time he returned
column3: the assassins were already defeated. Renekton had protected the emperor and slain the attackers
column4: but Azir’s brothers were all dead. Azir told his father of Xerath’s courage and asked him to reward the slave boy
column5: but his words fell on deaf ears. In the emperor’s eyes
column6: the boy was a slave and beneath his notice
column7: but Azir swore that one day he and Xerath would be brothers.

column1: The emperor returned to his capital
column2: with the fifteen year old Azir now his heir
column3: and unleashed a merciless campaign of bloodshed against those he believed had sent the assassins. Shurima descended into years of paranoia and murder as the emperor took revenge on any he suspected of treason. Though he was now heir to the throne
column4: Azir’s life yet hung by a thread. His father hated him - wishing he had died instead of his brothers - and the queen was still young enough to bear sons.

column1: Azir trained in combat
column2: for the attack at the oasis had revealed how little he knew of the deadly arts. Renekton took up the task of teaching the growing prince
column3: and under his aegis
column4: Azir learned to wield sword and spear
column5: to command warriors
column6: and to read the ebb and flow of battle. The young heir elevated Xerath
column7: his only trusted confidant
column8: and made him his right hand man. To better counsel him
column9: Azir tasked Xerath with seeking out knowledge wherever he could find it.

column1: Years passed
column2: but the queen was never able to carry a child to term
column3: every conceived infant perishing before it could be born. So long as the queen remained barren
column4: Azir’s life was relatively safe. Some around the court believed a curse was at work and a few even whispered the young heir’s name in connection with this – though Azir claimed innocence and even executed some who dared voice such accusations openly.

column1: Eventually
column2: the queen bore a healthy son
column3: but on the night of his birth a terrible storm engulfed Shurima. The queen’s chambers were struck again and again by powerful bolts of lightning
column4: and in the subsequent blaze
column5: both the queen and her newborn son were killed. It was said the emperor went mad with grief and took his own life upon hearing the news
column6: but tales soon spread of how he and his guards had been found lying in pieces on the palace floor
column7: their bodies little more than charred skeletons.

column1: Azir was shocked by their deaths
column2: but the empire needed a leader
column3: and with Xerath at his side he took control of Shurima as its emperor. Over the next decade
column4: he expanded Shurima’s borders and ruled with a harsh
column5: but just hand. He instituted reforms to better the lives of slaves and privately developed a plan to overturn millennia of tradition and eventually free them all. He kept his plans secret
column6: even from Xerath
column7: and the issue of slavery would prove to be a continual bone of contention between them. The empire had been built on the back of slavery
column8: and many of the great noble houses depended on enforced labor for their vast wealth and power. Such monolithic institutions could not be overturned overnight
column9: and Azir’s plans would be undone were they to become common knowledge. Despite Azir’s desire to name Xerath his brother
column10: he could not do so until all Shurima’s slaves were free.

column1: Through these years
column2: Xerath protected Azir from his political rivals and guided the expansion of the empire. Azir married and fathered numerous children
column3: some by wedlock
column4: others by ill-advised liaisons with slaves and harem girls. Xerath stoked the emperor’s grand vision of an empire greater than any the world had ever known. But to stand as ruler over the entire world
column5: Xerath convinced Azir that he would need to be all but invincible
column6: a god amongst men – an Ascended being.

column1: As the kingdom reached the zenith of its power
column2: Azir announced he would undertake the Ascension ritual
column3: that the time was right for him to take his place alongside Nasus and Renekton and their glorious forebears. Many questioned this decision; the Ascension ritual was highly dangerous and intended only for those near the end of their lives
column4: those who had devoted their lives to Shurima and whose service was to be honored with Ascension. It was for the Sun Priests to decree who would be blessed with Ascension
column5: not the hubris of an emperor to bestow it upon himself. Azir would not be dissuaded from his rash course of action
column6: for his arrogance had grown along with his empire
column7: and he ordered them to comply on pain of death.

column1: The day of the ritual finally came and Azir marched toward the Dais of Ascension
column2: flanked by thousands of his warriors and tens of thousands of his subjects. The brothers Renekton and Nasus were absent
column3: having been dispatched by Xerath to deal with an emergent threat
column4: but still Azir would not turn from what he saw as his great destiny. He climbed to the great golden disc atop the temple at the heart of the city and in the moments before the sun priests began the ritual
column5: he turned to Xerath and finally freed him. And not just him
column6: but all slaves…

column1: Xerath was stunned into speechlessness
column2: but Azir was not yet done. He embraced Xerath and named him his eternal brother
column3: as he had promised he would all those years ago. Azir turned as the priests began the ritual to bring down the awesome power of the sun. Azir was unaware that Xerath had studied more than just history and philosophy in his quest for knowledge. He had learned the dark arts of sorcery
column4: all the while nursing a desire for freedom that had grown like a cancer into a burning hatred.

column1: At the height of the ritual
column2: the former slave unleashed his powers and Azir was blasted from his place on the dais. Without the protection of the runic circle
column3: Azir was consumed by the sun’s fire as Xerath took his place. The light filled Xerath with power
column4: and he roared as his mortal body began to transform.

column1: But the magic of the ritual was not intended for Xerath
column2: and such awesomely powerful celestial energies could not be diverted without dire consequence. The power of the Ascension ritual exploded outward
column3: devastating Shurima and laying waste to the city. Its people burned to ash and its towering palaces fell to ruin as the desert sands rose up to swallow the city. The sun disc sank from the sky and what had taken centuries to build was brought to ruin in an instant by one man’s ambition and another’s misplaced hate. All that remained of Azir’s city were sunken ruins and echoes of its people’s screams on the night winds.

column1: Azir saw none of this. For him
column2: all was nothingness. His last memories were of pain and fire; he knew nothing of what befell him atop the temple
column3: nor what became of his empire. He remained lost in timeless oblivion until
column4: thousands of years after Shurima’s doom
column5: the blood of his last descendant spilled onto the temple ruins and resurrected him. Azir was reborn
column6: but was yet incomplete; his body little more than animate dust given form
column7: held together by the last vestiges of his indomitable will.

column1: Gradually resuming his corporeal form
column2: Azir stumbled through the ruins and came across the corpse of a woman with a treacherous knife wound in her back. He did not know her
column3: but saw in her features the distant echo of his bloodline. All thoughts of empires and power were forgotten as he lifted this daughter of Shurima and bore her to what had once been the Oasis of the Dawn. The oasis was empty and dry
column4: but with every step Azir took
column5: clear water began filling the rocky basin. Azir immersed the woman’s body in the restorative waters of the oasis and as the blood washed away
column6: only a faint scar remained where the blade had pierced her.

column1: And with that act of selflessness
column2: Azir was lifted up in a column of fire as the magic of Shurima renewed him
column3: remaking him as the Ascended being he was meant to become. The sun’s immortal radiance poured into him
column4: crafting his magnificent
column5: hawk-armored form and granting him the power to command the very sand itself. Azir lifted his arms and his ruined city shrugged off the dust of centuries spent beneath the desert to rise anew. The sun disc lifted into the sky once more
column6: and healing waters flowed between temples heaving themselves back into the light at the emperor’s command.

column1: Azir climbed the steps of the newly-risen sun temple
column2: weaving the desert winds to recreate the city’s last moments. Ghosts formed of sand relived his city’s last moments from long ago
column3: and Azir watched in horror as Xerath’s treachery unfolded. He wept as he saw his family murdered
column4: his empire fall and his power stolen. Only now
column5: millennia too late
column6: did he finally understand the depths of hatred harbored by his former friend and ally. With the power and prescience of an Ascended being
column7: Azir sensed Xerath somewhere abroad in the world and summoned an army of sand warriors to march alongside their reborn emperor. As the sun blazed from the golden disc above him
column8: Azir swore a mighty oath.

column1: I will reclaim my lands and take back what was mine!

He must reload when he runs out of ammo. Attacks fire 4 bullets, which cannot pass through units. Non-champions struck by multiple bullets are knocked back.;
Malcolm Graves is a renowned mercenary
column2: gambler
column3: and thief—a wanted man in every city and empire he has visited. Even though he has an explosive temper
column4: he possesses a sense of criminal honor
column5: often enforced at the business end of his double-barreled shotgun Destiny. In recent years
column6: he has reconciled a troubled partnership with Twisted Fate
column7: and together they have prospered once more in the turmoil of Bilgewater’s criminal underbelly.

column1: Raised in the wharf alleys of Bilgewater
column2: Malcolm Graves quickly learned how to fight and how to steal
column3: skills that would serve him very well in all the years ahead. He could always find work hauling contraband up from the smugglers’ skiffs that came into the bay each night—with a tidy side-gig as hired muscle for various other unsavory local characters
column4: as they went about their business in the port.

column1: But the alleys were small-time
column2: and he craved more excitement than they could offer. Still little more than a youth
column3: Graves stole a blunderbuss and smuggled himself aboard a ship headed out of Bilgewater to the Shuriman mainland
column4: where he stole
column5: lied
column6: and gambled his way from place to place along the coast.

column1: Across the table of a high-stakes—and highly illegal—card game in Mudtown
column2: Graves met a man who would change the course of his life
column3: and his career: the trickster now known to many as Twisted Fate.

column1: Each immediately saw in the other the same reckless passion for danger and adventure
column2: and together they formed a most lucrative partnership. Between Graves’ raw brawn and Twisted Fate’s ability to talk his way out of (and occasionally back into) almost any situation
column3: they were an unusually effective team from the outset. Their mutual sense of roguish honor grew into genuine trust
column4: and together they stole from the rich
column5: swindled the foolish
column6: handpicked skilled crews for specific jobs
column7: and sold out their rivals whenever they could.

column1: Though at times Twisted Fate would blow all their shares and leave them with nothing to show for it
column2: Graves knew that the thrill of some new escapade was always just around the corner…

column1: On the southern borderlands of Valoran
column2: they set two renowned noble houses of Noxus at each other’s throats as cover for the rescue of a kidnapped heir. That they pocketed the reward money
column3: only to ransom the vile young man to the highest bidder
column4: should really have come as no surprise to their original employer. In Piltover
column5: they still hold the distinction of being the only thieves ever to crack the supposedly impenetrable Clockwork Vault. Not only did the pair empty the vault of all its treasures
column6: they also tricked the guards into loading the loot onto their hijacked schooner
column7: for a quick getaway through the Sun Gates.

column1: In almost every case
column2: only once they and their accomplices were safely over the horizon were their crimes even discovered—usually along with one of Twisted Fate’s trademark calling cards left where it would be easily found.

column1: But
column2: eventually
column3: their luck ran out.

column1: During a heist that rapidly turned from complex to completely botched
column2: Graves was taken by the local enforcers
column3: while Twisted Fate merely turned tail and abandoned him.

column1: Thrown into the infamous prison known as the Locker
column2: Graves endured years of torture and solitary confinement
column3: during which time he nursed his bitter anger toward his old partner. A lesser man would surely have been broken by all this
column4: but not Malcolm Graves. He was determined to have his revenge.

column1: When he finally clawed his way to freedom
column2: with the prison warden’s brand new shotgun slung over his shoulder
column3: Graves began his long-overdue pursuit of Twisted Fate.

column1: The search led him back home to Bilgewater
column2: where he found that the wily old cardsharp had acquired a few new bounties on his head—and Graves would be only too happy to claim them. However
column3: just as he got Twisted Fate in his sights
column4: they were forced to put aside their differences in order to escape almost certain death in the ongoing conflict between the reaver king Gangplank and his rival ship captains.

column1: Once again
column2: Graves found himself escaping his hometown… only this time
column3: he had his old friend in tow. While both of them might have liked to pick up their partnership where they left off all those years ago
column4: such resentment couldn't simply be forgotten overnight
column5: and it would be a while before Graves could bring himself to trust Twisted Fate again.

column1: Still
column2: he feels Bilgewater calling to him once more. Maybe this time around
column3: the pair of them will find their stride and be able to pull off the ultimate heist…

column3:
and her Human Form more potent when you are at high health.;Rappel will only move Elise straight up and down unless she can descend upon an enemy unit.;Rappel has a long cooldown. Elise is vulnerable after she has used it.;;Mage;Fighter;Mana;6;5;7;9;555.0;93;324.0;50.0;330;27;4.0;30.0;0.5;550;5.5;0.6;6.0;0.8;55.0;3.0;1.75;0.625;Neurotoxin / Venomous Bite;Human Form: Deals damage based upon how high the target's Health is.

Spider Form: Lunges at an enemy and deals damage based upon how low their Health is.;Volatile Spiderling / Skittering Frenzy;Human Form: Releases a venom-gorged Spiderling that explodes when it nears a target.

Spider Form: Elise and her Spiderlings gain Attack Speed.;Cocoon / Rappel;Human Form: Stuns the first enemy unit hit and reveals them if they are not stealthed.

Spider Form: Elise and her Spiderlings ascend into the air and then descend upon target enemy. After descending on an enemy target
column4: Elise's bonus damage and healing from Spider Queen is increased.;Spider Form;Transforms into a menacing spider
column5: reducing her attack range in exchange for movement speed
column6: new abilities
column7: and a Spiderling swarm that will attack her foes.;Spider Queen;Human Form: When Elise's abilities hit an enemy
column8: she gains a dormant Spiderling.Spider Form: Basic attacks deal bonus magic damage and restore health to Elise.;"

column1: Elise is a deadly predator who dwells in a shuttered
column2: lightless palace
column3: deep in the Immortal Bastion of Noxus. Once she was mortal
column4: the mistress of a once-powerful house
column5: but the bite of a vile spider god transformed her into something beautiful
column6: undying
column7: and utterly inhuman. To maintain her eternal youth
column8: Elise preys upon the innocent
column9: and there are few who can resist her seductions.

column1: The Lady Elise was born many centuries ago to House Kythera
column2: an old and powerful family of Noxus
column3: and swiftly learned the power of beauty to influence the weak-minded. When she came of age
column4: she plotted to marry the scion of House Zaavan to augment her house’s power. The match was opposed by many within Zaavan
column5: but Elise beguiled her intended husband and manipulated her detractors to secure a betrothal.

column1: As Elise had planned
column2: her influence upon her new husband proved considerable. House Zaavan grew stronger
column3: which in turn saw House Kythera’s star rise. Elise’s husband was the face of his house
column4: but those in the know understood who truly wielded power. At first
column5: Elise’s husband tolerated this
column6: but as the years went by
column7: his discontent festered as he became alight joke among Noxian families.

column1: Eventually
column2: his resentment grew ever more rancorous until one night over a typically frosty dinner
column3: he revealed he had tainted her wine with a disfiguring poison. He offered his terms; withdraw from society and stay out of his way as he took up the reins of power and he would give her the antidote. Refuse
column4: and he would watch her die slowly and painfully. With every breath the poison did its evil work
column5: dissolving her flesh and bone from the inside out. Believing he would have the antidote somewhere about his person
column6: Elise palmed a sharp knife and played the role of remorseful wife to the hilt. She wept and begged her husband to forgive her
column7: using every wile in her arsenal to approach without alerting him to her deadly intent. All the while
column8: the poison was wracking her body
column9: discoloring her flesh with grotesque lesions and filling her limbs with agony.

column1: When Elise reached her husband
column2: he realized - too late - just how badly he had underestimated her disdain. She leapt upon him and rammed the knife through his heart
column3: twisting the blade slowly as she watched him die. Elise found and drank the antidote
column4: but the damage was done. Her face was monstrously disfigured with grotesque weals and necrotic flesh
column5: like a cadaver given hideous animation.

column1: Elise was now mistress of House Zaavan
column2: and such was the nature of Noxian politics that she was lauded for cutting a weakness from the empire. Yet so entwined were her particular notions of beauty and power that she retreated from public life and took to wearing a face-covering veil. Eschewing daylight
column3: and turning away all allies and petitioners from her door
column4: her once powerful house began a slow descent into obscurity. Elise roamed the empty halls of her palace in isolation and became a denizen of darkness
column5: only ever venturing beyond its high walls at night.

column1: On one of her midnight wanderings
column2: Elise was approached by another veiled woman
column3: who pressed a waxen sigil of a Black Rose into her palm and whispered that the Pale Woman would greatly value her talents. Elise pressed on
column4: but as she walked away
column5: the woman’s voice echoed after her with the promise of being made whole again. However absurd she told herself it was
column6: vanity and the hope of her beauty being renewed drove Elise to investigate further. She prowled the streets for weeks until she saw the Black Rose sigil again
column7: etched onto a shadowed archway leading into the catacombs beneath Noxus.

column1: Following the hidden sigils brought her to the Black Rose
column2: a secret society where those who dabbled in the darker powers of magic shared hidden knowledge and secrets. Elise became a regular visitor
column3: going unveiled among its members and swiftly establishing a close rapport with the Pale Woman
column4: an agelessly beautiful individual of great power. Elise embraced the society’s ways
column5: but always sought the gift she had been promised; her beauty made whole again.

column1: The Pale Woman spoke of a haunted place known as the Shadow Isles and a serpent-bladed athame belonging to one of her acolytes who had been slain in the lair of a voracious spider god. The dagger was imbued with powerful magic
column2: and if it was returned to her
column3: then she would use its magic to restore Elise’s beauty. Elise immediately accepted and led a group of Black Rose devotees to the shunned island
column4: knowing there would be a blood price to pay for such a prize.

column1: Elise found a desperate
column2: debt-ridden captain willing to bear her and her fellow pilgrims across the ocean. The ship sailed for weeks until a craggy island loomed from seething banks of black mist. Elise came ashore on a beach of ashen sand and led her followers deep into the island’s haunted depths like lambs to the slaughter. Many were stolen away by spiteful wraiths
column3: but half a dozen remained by the time they reached the web-wreathed lair of the Spider God.

column1: A bloated
column2: monstrous creature of chitin and fangs erupted from the darkness and feasted on the screaming men and women. As they died or were swept up in streams of web
column3: Elise saw the dagger the Pale Woman sought - held in the grip of a desiccated corpse. She snatched it up as the Spider God sank its envenomed fangs into her shoulder. Elise fell forward and the blade of the athame pierced her heart
column4: its powerful magic flooding her and mixing with the lethal venom to wreak terrible changes on her body. Elise was transformed as the magically-empowered venom renewed her flesh
column5: transforming it into a form even more beautiful than before. Her scars vanished and her skin became flawless and porcelain smooth
column6: but the god’s venom had ambitions of its own. Elise’s back writhed with undulant motion as a host of arachnoid legs pushed their way from her flesh.

column1: Elise rose
column2: breathless with the agony of her transformation
column3: to find the Spider God looming above her. Shared power flowed between them
column4: and both immediately sensed how they might benefit from this unexpected symbiosis. Elise returned to her ship
column5: untroubled by the island’s spirits
column6: and set sail for Noxus. When her ship arrived at the docks in the dead of night
column7: Elise was the only living thing aboard.

column1: Elise returned the athame to the leader of the Black Rose
column2: though the Pale Woman warned that the magic maintaining her restored beauty would eventually fade. The two sealed a pact; the Black Rose would provide Elise with acolytes to offer up to the Spider God
column3: and she in turn
column4: would return any artifacts of power she discovered upon the isles.

column1: Elise once again took up residence in the neglected halls of House Zaavan
column2: becoming known as a beautiful yet unreachable recluse. None suspected her true nature
column3: yet fanciful rumors cling to her
column4: wild tales of her immortal beauty and a terrifying creature said to lair high in her dilapidated
column5: dust-wreathed palace.

column1: Centuries have passed since her first voyage to the Shadow Isles
column2: and whenever Elise sees streaks of white in her hair or crow’s feet at her eyes
column3: she ventures forth to cull easily swayed souls from the Black Rose and set sail for the isle of black mists. None who accompany her ever return
column4: and with each voyage
column5: it is said she is renewed and invigorated
column6: bearing another ancient artifact for the Pale Woman.

column1: 18;Tristana;the Yordle Gunner;Riot Girl Tristana;Earnest Elf Tristana;Firefighter Tristana;Guerilla Tristana;Buccaneer Tristana;Rocket Girl Tristana;Dragon Trainer Tristana;Bewitching Tristana;Omega Squad Tristana;Little Demon Tristana;Pengu Cosplay Tristana;Hextech Tristana;;;;Her massive gun allows Tristana to fire on targets at a great distance. Utilize this to prevent your enemies from ever laying a hand on you.;Use Rocket Jump after you have stacked up your Explosive Charge on an enemy to finish them off with a burst of damage.;Use Rapid Fire to help stack up your Explosive Charge on enemy champions.;;;If you see Tristana activate Rapid Fire in a fight, stun her and try to back off until the spell dissipates.;Stand away from your creeps in a lane to take less collateral damage from Explosive Charge.;;;Marksman;Assassin;Mana;9;3;5;4;559.0;88;250.0;32.0;325;26;3.0;30.0;0.5;525;3.75;0.65;7.2;0.45;59.0;3.3;1.5;0.656;Rapid Fire;Tristana fires her weapon rapidly, increasing her Attack Speed for a short time.;Rocket Jump;Tristana fires at the ground to propel her to a distant location, dealing damage and slowing surrounding units for a brief period where she lands.;Explosive Charge;When Tristana kills a unit, her cannonballs burst into shrapnel, dealing damage to surrounding enemies. Can be activated to place a bomb on a target enemy that explodes after a short duration dealing damage to surrounding units.;Buster Shot;Tristana loads a massive cannonball into her weapon and fires it at an enemy unit. This deals Magic Damage and knocks the target back. If the target is carrying the Explosive Charge bomb, the bomb detonation radius is doubled.;Draw a Bead;Increases Tristana's Attack Range as she levels.;
While many other yordles channel their energy into discovery
column2: invention
column3: or just plain mischief-making
column4: Tristana was always inspired by the adventures of great warriors. She had heard much about Runeterra
column5: its factions
column6: and its wars
column7: and believed her kind could become worthy of legend too. Setting foot in the world for the first time
column8: she took up her trusty cannon Boomer
column9: and now leaps into battle with steadfast courage and optimism.

column1: Like most yordles
column2: Tristana was always fascinated by the world beyond Bandle City. She traveled far and wide
column3: full of wonder and enthusiasm for the varied places
column4: people
column5: and creatures she encountered. Using the hidden pathways that only yordles know
column6: she explored the length and breadth of the material realm
column7: remaining mostly unseen.

column1: She witnessed such breathtaking sights as ice trolls migrating across the floes of the far north beneath kaleidoscopic auroras. She marveled as warships blasted each other to pieces in naval battles that churned the seas. She watched
column2: awestruck
column3: as great armies marched with unity and precision—incredibly strange concepts to a yordle!—across the endless sands to the south.

column1: But Tristana’s carefree
column2: wandering ways changed the day she witnessed the destruction of a bandlewood. These places are steeped in the magic of the gateways they grow around
column3: giving yordles a safe haven from the world. Tristana
column4: dozing in the dappled sunshine
column5: was shaken awake as the trees around her began to burn and topple. A warband of armored marauders rampaged through the woodland with fire and axes
column6: led by a sorcerer wreathed in dark energy.

column1: Tristana hid in horror. The sorcerer focused his power upon the portal at the heart of the bandlewood
column2: speaking one final utterance. Her ears still ringing with pain
column3: Tristana watched the gateway collapse
column4: never to be opened again. The ripples of that destruction were felt in Bandle City itself
column5: causing great despair among the yordles.

column1: Tristana had never experienced anything like the pain of this loss
column2: or the guilt she felt for not acting. Never again would she allow such a terrible thing to happen. In that moment
column3: she dedicated herself to become the guardian of all bandlewoods
column4: and her fellow yordles.

column1: Tristana had often marveled at how mortals protected the things that were dear to them. While she couldn’t comprehend their reasons to guard shiny metals
column2: or walls of stone
column3: she respected their methods
column4: and decided to emulate them. Other yordles watched with curiosity as she took to marching around the borders of Bandle City stern-faced
column5: and watching out for danger. She started calling her food “rations”
column6: and set herself strict times for rest and relaxation.

column1: But something was missing. In her travels
column2: she had seen many powerful inventions
column3: including the black powder cannons of Bilgewater. Inspired by them
column4: she collected enough precious metal discs to commission a gun suited to her diminutive size.

column1: With a wry smile
column2: she named it Boomer.

column1: Since then
column2: Tristana has defended the bandlewoods from innumerable threats. In the jungles of the Serpent Isles
column3: she intervened in a clash between the local Buhru people and treasure hunters from Valoran that was getting too close to a hidden portal
column4: sending them all running for their lives after she leapt into their midst
column5: Boomer roaring. And in the burning deserts at the edge of Shurima
column6: she destroyed a Void-horror after it began consuming a secret bandlewood oasis
column7: killing it with an explosive bomb down the gullet.

column1: Tristana has become something of a legend in Bandle City
column2: and recently
column3: a number of yordles have started to imitate her
column4: trying—and mostly failing—to copy her disciplined ways. Some have even had weapons mimicking Boomer constructed for them by the scrappy inventor Rumble
column5: who is always seeking to win Tristana’s approval. While Tristana finds this all rather embarrassing
column6: she has come to the conclusion that if they are going to defend the pathways to Bandle City
column7: they had better do it properly. As such
column8: she has started training these new recruits
column9: and they have adopted a new moniker—the Bandle Gunners.

column1: Nevertheless
column2: Tristana can often be found out in the wilds on patrol by herself—simultaneously protecting the bandlewoods and also getting away from her new
column3: and rather annoying
column4: trainees.

column1: 432;Bard;the Wandering Caretaker;Elderwood Bard;Snow Day Bard;Bard Bard;Astronaut Bard;;;;;;;;;;;;It's important to collect chimes to improve your meep's attacks, but don't neglect your lane partner! Try to make a big entrance by bringing an ally into the lane with you with Magical Journey.;Let your Caretaker's Shrines charge up - they heal for a lot more when at full power.;Don't forget that enemies can also use your Magical Journey doorways, and that your ultimate can also hit your allies!;;;Bard's opponents can also travel through his Magical Journey doorways.
