Sometimes it can be to your advantage to jump into it!;;Support;Mage;Mana;4;4;5;9;560.0;89;350.0;50.0;330;34;4.0;30.0;0.5;500;5.5;0.55;6.0;0.45;52.0;3.0;2.0;0.625;Cosmic Binding;Bard fires a missile which will slow the first enemy struck
column2: and continue onward. If it strikes a wall
column3: it will stun the initial target; if it strikes another enemy
column4: it will stun them both.";Caretaker's Shrine;Reveals a healing shrine which powers up over a short time
column5: disappearing after healing and speeding up the first ally that touches it.;Magical Journey;Bard opens a portal in nearby terrain. Allies and enemies alike can take a one-way trip through that terrain by moving into the portal.;Tempered Fate;Bard sends spirit energy arcing to a location
column6: putting all champions
column7: minions
column8: monsters
column9: and turrets hit into stasis for a brief time.;Traveler's Call;Meeps: Bard attracts lesser spirits that assist with his basic attacks to deal extra magic damage. When Bard has collected enough  Chimes
column10: his meeps will also deal damage in an area and slow enemies hit.Chimes: Ancient chimes randomly appear for Bard to collect. These grant experience
column11: restore mana
column12: and provide out of combat Move Speed.;"

column1: Bard travels through realms beyond the imagination of mortal beings. Some of Valoran's greatest scholars have spent their lives trying to understand the mysteries he embodies. This enigmatic spirit has been given many names throughout the history of Valoran
column2: but titles such as Cosmic Vagabond and Great Caretaker only capture a fleeting aspect of his true purpose. When the unknowable structure of the universe is threatened
column3: Bard steers all existence away from utter annihilation.

column1: 25;Morgana;the Fallen;Exiled Morgana;Sinful Succulence Morgana;Blade Mistress Morgana;Blackthorn Morgana;Ghost Bride Morgana;Victorious Morgana;Lunar Wraith Morgana;Bewitching Morgana;Majestic Empress Morgana;Coven Morgana;Dawnbringer Morgana;Bewitching Morgana Prestige Edition;;;;Shrewd use of Black Shield can determine the outcome of team fights.;Items that provide survivability allow Morgana to become extremely difficult to kill in conjunction with Black Shield and Soul Shackles.;Tormented Shadow is an excellent farming tool if you're by yourself in a lane.;;;Tormented Shadow deals tons of damage to units missing large amounts of Health. When low on Health, be wary of Morgana's attempts to trap you within its reach.;Morgana often needs to land Dark Binding to setup her other attacks. Use your minions as shields against Dark Binding.;Black Shield makes Morgana immune to disabling effects, but can be broken with magic damage.;;Mage;Support;Mana;1;6;8;1;560.0;90;340.0;60.0;335;25;3.8;30.0;0.5;450;5.5;0.4;11.0;0.4;56.0;3.5;1.53;0.625;Dark Binding;Morgana binds an enemy in place with dark magic, forcing them to feel the pain they've caused and dealing magic damage. ;Tormented Shadow;Morgana casts a cursed shadow on an area, damaging enemies who dare stand in her dark circle. They receive magic damage over time, which increases the lower health they are.;Black Shield;Morgana anoints an ally with a protective barrier of starfire, which absorbs magical damage and disabling effects until it is broken.;Soul Shackles;Morgana unleashes the full force of her Celestial power as she unbinds her wings and hovers above the ground. She lashes chains of dark pain onto nearby enemy champions, gaining Move Speed towards them. The chains slow and deal initial damage and, after a delay, stun those who are unable to break them.;Soul Siphon;Morgana drains spirit from her enemies, healing as she deals damage to champions, large minions, and medium and larger jungler monsters.;
Conflicted between her celestial and mortal natures
column2: Morgana bound her wings to embrace humanity
column3: and inflicts her pain and bitterness upon the dishonest and the corrupt. She rejects laws and traditions she believes are unjust
column4: and fights for truth from the shadows of Demacia—even as others seek to repress it—by casting shields and chains of dark fire. More than anything else
column5: Morgana truly believes that even the banished and outcast may one day rise again.

column1: Whether through destiny or circumstance
column2: Morgana and her sister were born to a world in conflict. The cataclysmic Rune Wars had ripped through most of Valoran and Shurima
column3: and seemed poised to engulf even the peaks of Targon. Morgana’s parents
column4: Mihira and Kilam
column5: knew the legends of the great mountain granting divine power—they saw no other choice than to attempt the long and perilous journey
column6: if their tribe was to be saved.

column1: Even when they learned Mihira was with child
column2: they could not turn back. Finally
column3: where Runeterra touches the stars
column4: Kilam watched in wonder and fear as Mihira was chosen to embody the Aspect of Justice.

column1: The couple returned not only with the salvation they sought
column2: but twin daughters—Morgana and Kayle. However
column3: the celestial power that claimed Mihira began to overshadow her mortal personality and affections. She would often push the girls into their father’s arms
column4: abandoning them to answer battle’s call.

column1: For many months
column2: uncertainty gnawed at Kilam. The wars still raged on countless fronts
column3: and his beloved wife was slipping away. Fearing for his daughters’ safety
column4: he waited for Mihira to leave once more
column5: then fled Targon with them both.

column1: Though their destination did not yet have a name
column2: it would become known as a haven from magic and persecution: the kingdom of Demacia.

column1: There the twins grew different as day and night. While Kayle studied the settlement’s growing set of laws
column2: dark-haired Morgana became troubled by their distrust of new arrivals. Knowing what it was to be a refugee
column3: she wandered the wilds
column4: talking to wayward mages and others cast out for the dangers they might bring. At home
column5: she felt her father’s heartbreak at leaving Mihira behind
column6: and grew bitter at her mother for causing such pain.

column1: Morgana’s fears that she and Kayle might carry some remnant of the Aspect’s power were eventually confirmed
column2: when a great blade wreathed in shadow and starfire fell from the heavens. As it pierced the ground
column3: splitting in two
column4: feathered wings burst from the girls’ shoulders. Their father wept at the sight of them each taking up half of the weapon
column5: and turned away even as Morgana reached out to comfort him.

column1: While Kayle embraced their new calling
column2: rallying an order of judicators to enforce the laws
column3: Morgana resented her gifts… until the night their settlement was raided. Kilam found himself surrounded as the fighting spread. In that moment
column4: Morgana rushed to shield him
column5: burning his attackers to ash. Together
column6: the sisters saved countless lives
column7: and were hailed as the Winged Protectors of Demacia.

column1: But Kayle grew more extreme in her ideologies
column2: and Morgana increasingly found herself pleading the case of those who wanted to atone for their crimes. An accord was struck between the sisters and their mortal devotees—though it was uneasy
column3: and did not last. Kayle’s most ardent disciple
column4: Ronas
column5: came to arrest Morgana herself. Attempting to protect her penitent followers
column6: she shackled him with dark flame until he fell to the floor
column7: dead.

column1: Divine fire lit the city from above as Kayle swore to bring Ronas’ killer to justice
column2: and Morgana met her sister in the skies.

column1: They raised their blades
column2: each matching the other with arcs of blinding light and burning darkness that lashed down at the buildings beneath them. It seemed certain that one of them would win… but Morgana faltered when she heard their father’s anguished voice. Kilam lay in the rubble
column3: mortally wounded. Howling with grief
column4: Morgana hurled her half of their mother’s sword at Kayle
column5: and plunged to the surface like a meteorite.

column1: She cradled her father
column2: cursing their inheritance for the destruction around them. Kayle landed
column3: dumbstruck
column4: and Morgana demanded to know if the smiting of wicked mortals included Kilam
column5: whose crime was stealing them away from their mother. Kayle gave no answer
column6: but soared into the heavens without looking back.

column1: Morgana’s wings became an inescapable reminder of her pain. She tried to cut them from her flesh
column2: but could find no blade strong enough. Instead
column3: she bound them with iron chains
column4: resolving instead to walk the world of mortals.

column1: Over the centuries
column2: her tale fell into myth
column3: and the name Morgana was all but forgotten. To this day
column4: the people of Demacia venerate “the Winged Protector
column5: ” but recall only the glory and truth of one sister
column6: while Morgana’s dark outbursts and belief in personal redemption became the mysteries of “the Veiled One.”

column1: Through all of this
column2: she still refuses to abandon those who would seek her aid. Bitter
column3: betrayed
column4: she bides her time in the kingdom’s shadows
column5: knowing with certainty that Kayle’s light will someday return to Runeterra
column6: and all will face her judgment.

column1: As magic begins to rise again
column2: Morgana sees that dawn is nearly upon them.

column1: 92;Riven;the Exile;Redeemed Riven;Crimson Elite Riven;Battle Bunny Riven;Championship Riven;Dragonblade Riven;Arcade Riven;Championship Riven 2016;Dawnbringer Riven;Pulsefire Riven;Valiant Sword Riven;Valiant Sword Riven Prestige Edition;Spirit Blossom Riven;Sentinel Riven;;;Riven's Broken Wings locks onto the champion your cursor is over at the time of cast. If you want to move past your opponent, make sure that your cursor is past your opponent as well.;Riven lacks a source of healing or strong defense and must compensate with burst combos. Lead into fights with Broken Wings and Ki Burst, while using Valor to escape and absorb counter-harass.;;;;Riven has a great deal of mobility but she cannot move very far with any one skill. Rooting or silencing her during her combo will greatly reduce her effectiveness.;All of Riven's damage is physical, prioritize high Armor if an opposing Riven gets out of control.;Riven excels at dueling multiple melee attackers at once, as she will be on an almost equal footing damage-wise. If pairing up against Riven, don't go in as double melee until she has expended her full combo.;;Fighter;Assassin;None;8;5;1;8;560.0;86;0.0;0.0;340;33;3.2;32.0;1.25;125;8.5;0.5;0.0;0.0;64.0;3.0;3.5;0.625;Broken Wings;Riven lashes out in a series of strikes. This ability can be reactivated three times in a short time frame with the third hit knocking back nearby enemies.;Ki Burst;Riven emits a Ki Burst, damaging and stunning nearby enemies.;Valor;Riven steps forward a short distance and blocks incoming damage.;Blade of the Exile;Riven empowers her keepsake weapon with energy, and gains Attack Damage and Range. During this time, she also gains the ability to use Wind Slash, a powerful ranged attack, once.;Runic Blade;Riven's abilities charge her blade, and her basic attacks expend charges to deal an additional damage.;
Once a swordmaster in the warhosts of Noxus
column2: Riven is an expatriate in a land she previously tried to conquer. She rose through the ranks on the strength of her conviction and her brutal efficiency
column3: and was rewarded with a legendary runic blade—however
column4: on the Ionian front
column5: Riven’s faith in her homeland was tested and ultimately broken. Having severed all ties to the empire
column6: she now wanders with her shattered sword
column7: seeking to atone for a past she cannot fully recall.

column1: Built on perpetual conflict
column2: Noxus has never had a shortage of war orphans. Her father lost to an unnamed battle and her mother to the girl’s own stubborn birth
column3: Riven was raised on a farm run by the empire on the rocky hillsides of Trevale.

column1: Physical strength and ferocious will kept the children alive and working on the hard scrap of land
column2: but Riven hungered for more than simply bread on the table. She watched conscriptors from regional warbands visiting the farms
column3: year after year
column4: and in them
column5: she saw a chance at the life she dreamed of. When she finally pledged the empire her strength
column6: she knew Noxus would embrace her as the daughter she longed to be.

column1: Riven proved a natural soldier. Young as she was
column2: her years of hard labor allowed her to quickly master the weight of a longsword taller than herself. Her new family was forged in the heat of battle
column3: and Riven saw her bond to her brothers- and sisters-in-arms as unbreakable.

column1: So exceptional was her dedication to the empire
column2: that Boram Darkwill himself recognized her with a runic blade of dark stone
column3: enchanted by a pale sorceress within his court. The weapon was heavier than a kite shield and nearly as broad—perfectly suited to Riven’s tastes.

column1: Not long after
column2: the warhosts set sail for Ionia as part of the long-planned Noxian invasion.

column1: As this new war dragged on
column2: it became clear that Ionia would not kneel. Riven’s unit was assigned to escort another warband making its way through the embattled province of Navori. The warband’s leader
column3: Emystan
column4: had employed a Zaunite alchymist
column5: eager to test a new kind of weapon. Across countless campaigns
column6: Riven would gladly have given her life for Noxus
column7: but now she saw something awry in these other soldiers—something that made her deeply uncomfortable. The fragile amphorae they carried on their wagons had no purpose on any battlefield she could imagine...

column1: The two warbands met increasingly fierce resistance
column2: as if even the land itself sought to defy them. During a heavy rain storm
column3: with mud pouring down the hillsides
column4: Riven and her warriors were stranded with their deadly cargo—and it was then that the Ionian fighters revealed themselves. Seeing the danger
column5: Riven called to Emystan for support.

column1: The only answer she received was a flaming arrow
column2: fired out from the ridgeline
column3: and Riven understood this was no longer a war to expand the borders of Noxus. It was to be a complete annihilation of the enemy
column4: no matter the cost.

column1: The wagon was hit straight on. Instinctively
column2: Riven drew her sword
column3: but it was too late to protect anyone but herself. Chemical fire burst from the ruptured containers
column4: and screams filled the night—both Ionian and Noxian falling victim to an agonizing
column5: gruesome death. Shielded from the scorching
column6: poisonous mists by the magic of her blade
column7: she bore unwilling witness to scenes of horror and betrayal that would haunt her forever.

column1: For Riven
column2: memories of the time that followed come only in fragments
column3: and nightmares. She bound her wounds. She mourned the dead. But
column4: most of all
column5: she came to hate the sword that saved her life. The words carved into its surface mocked her
column6: reminding her of all she had lost. She would find a way to break it
column7: severing her last tie to Noxus
column8: before the dawn.

column1: But when the blade was finally shattered
column2: still she found no peace.

column1: Stripped of the faith and conviction that had bolstered her entire life
column2: Riven now wanders Ionia’s battle scarred landscape in self-imposed exile
column3: seeking atonement from those who cannot forgive: the land
column4: the dead
column5: and herself.

column1: 142;Zoe;the Aspect of Twilight;Cyber Pop Zoe;Pool Party Zoe;Star Guardian Zoe;Arcanist Zoe;Arcanist Zoe Prestige Edition;;;;;;;;;;;Paddle Star deals more damage the further it has flown. Casting it behind yourself before redirecting can deal tons of damage.;Break Sleep with your biggest damage source, since enemies who are asleep take double damage.;Sleepy Trouble Bubble travels further over walls. Find a hiding spot to set up for a long distance kill.;;;Zoe's Paddle Star deals more damage the further it has flown.;Zoe must return to her starting point after casting Portal Jump, making her vulnerable to a counterattack.;Sleepy Trouble Bubble travels further over walls. Stop Zoe from hiding in fog of war to prevent her from setting the spell up.;;Mage;Support;Mana;1;7;8;5;560.0;92;425.0;25.0;340;21;3.5;30.0;0.5;550;6.5;0.6;8.0;0.65;58.0;3.3;2.5;0.625;Paddle Star!;Zoe fires a missile that she can redirect in flight. Deals more damage the longer it flies in a straight line.;Spell Thief;Zoe can pick up the remnants of enemy summoner spell and active item casts and cast them once herself. Whenever she casts a summoner spell, she gains 3 missiles that fire at the nearest target.;Sleepy Trouble Bubble;Causes the target to become drowsy, then fall asleep. The first source of damage that breaks the sleep is doubled, up to a cap.;Portal Jump;Blink to a nearby position for 1 second. Then blink back.;More Sparkles!;Zoe's next basic attack after casting a spell deals bonus magic damage.;
As the embodiment of mischief
column2: imagination
column3: and change
column4: Zoe acts as the cosmic messenger of Targon
column5: heralding major events that reshape worlds. Her mere presence warps the arcane mathematics governing realities
column6: sometimes causing cataclysms without conscious effort or malice. This perhaps explains the breezy nonchalance with which Zoe approaches her duties
column7: giving her plenty of time to focus on playing games
column8: tricking mortals
column9: or otherwise amusing herself. An encounter with Zoe can be joyous and life affirming
column10: but it is always more than it appears and often extremely dangerous.

column1: As befits her Targonian aspect’s nature
column2: Zoe did not ascend to power in one of the traditional ways. She didn’t win a great victory against overwhelming odds
column3: or sacrifice herself for a noble ideal
column4: or overcome the existential trial of climbing Mount Targon. Instead
column5: Zoe was a normal girl
column6: seemingly chosen at random.

column1: Her Lunari teachers reported Zoe to be an imaginative child
column2: but willful
column3: lazy
column4: easily distracted
column5: and mischievous. One day
column6: as she skipped away from her studies of the holy magics to pursue something “less boring
column7: ” she was noticed by the Targonian Aspect of Twilight.

column1: It observed as the young girl playfully mocked the angry cries of the Lunari priests chasing her. Then
column2: after an hour-long pursuit
column3: she found herself cornered by her angry teachers. Before they could grab Zoe
column4: the aspect summoned six objects in front of the girl: a bag of golden coins
column5: a sword
column6: a completed study book
column7: a devotion rug
column8: a silk rope
column9: and a toy ball. Five of these objects could have let her flee or defuse the situation. Zoe chose the sixth option.

column1: Unconcerned with escape
column2: she instead grabbed the toy ball
column3: kicked it toward the wall of an adjoining house
column4: and sang gleefully as it ricocheted among the humorless priests.

column1: Delighted by Zoe’s carefree exuberance
column2: the aspect opened a shimmering portal to the apex of Mount Targon
column3: offering the girl a chance to see the universe. She dove backward into the portal
column4: instantly merging with the aspect
column5: then stuck her tongue out at her dumbfounded teachers as she disappeared.

column1: Following this unusual transcendence
column2: Zoe journeyed to dimensions at the very edge of Targon’s control
column3: playing within realties beyond human comprehension.

column1: Returning home after millennia
column2: Zoe has aged barely a year. Though Runeterra has changed little from her perspective
column3: she arrives full of teenage curiosity for humans and her fellow aspects.

column1: Perhaps her most curious new relationship is with Aurelion Sol. The cosmic dragon’s arrogance
column2: lies
column3: and world-weariness annoy Zoe. In return
column4: she teases the giant creature relentlessly
column5: but when needed
column6: she also protects her “space doggy” and his stars from Pantheon’s wrath. Whether this is simply a whim
column7: possessiveness
column8: or her function as a disrupter
column9: no one can be certain. Because
column10: with Zoe
column11: one can never be sure of what she’s really aiming for… other than her own amusement.

column1:
166;Akshan;the Rogue Sentinel;Cyber Pop Akshan;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Raising an eyebrow in the face of danger, Akshan fights evil with dashing charisma, righteous vengeance, and a conspicuous lack of shirts. He is highly skilled in the art of stealth combat, able to evade the eyes of his enemies and reappear when they least expect him. With a keen sense of justice and a legendary death-reversing weapon, he rights the wrongs of Runeterra's many scoundrels while living by his own moral code: “Don't be an ass.”;;;;;;;;;Marksman;Assassin;Mana;0;0;0;0;560.0;90;350.0;40.0;330;26;3.0;30.0;0.5;500;3.75;0.65;8.175;0.7;52.0;3.5;4.0;0.638;Avengerang;Akshan throws a boomerang that deals damage going out and coming back, extending its range each time it hits an enemy.;Going Rogue;Akshan passively marks enemy champions as Scoundrels when they kill his ally champions. If Akshan kills a Scoundrel, he resurrects the allies they killed, gains bonus gold, and clears all marks.

When activated, Akshan enters camouflage and gains Move Speed and Mana Regen while moving towards Scoundrels. Akshan loses the camouflage quickly while he is not in brush or near terrain.;Heroic Swing;Akshan fires a grappling hook into terrain then swings around it, repeatedly firing at the nearest enemy while swinging. He can jump off early or gets knocked off when colliding with champions or terrain.;Comeuppance;Akshan locks onto an enemy champion and starts storing bullets. When released, he fires all stored bullets, dealing damage based on missing health to the first champion, minion, or structure hit.;Dirty Fighting;Every three hits from Akshan's Attacks and Abilities deals bonus damage and grants him a Shield if the target was a champion.When Akshan Attacks, he fires an additional Attack for reduced damage. If he cancels the additional Attack, he instead gains Move Speed.;
Raising an eyebrow in the face of danger
column2: Akshan fights evil with dashing charisma
column3: righteous vengeance
column4: and a conspicuous lack of shirts. He is highly skilled in the art of stealth combat
column5: able to evade the eyes of his enemies and reappear when they least expect him. With a keen sense of justice and a legendary death-reversing weapon
column6: he rights the wrongs of Runeterra’s many scoundrels while living by his own moral code: “Don’t be an ass.”

column1: Dashing through the shadows of eastern Shurima
column2: a righteous avenger stalks those who have harmed others. His punishment is swift
column3: certain
column4: and exacted by a curious weapon that rights the wrongs of his foes.

column1: Raised on the streets of the city of Marwi
column2: Akshan was introduced to injustice at birth. In a place where local warlords took what they wanted
column3: most people survived by keeping their heads down and minding their own affairs. Try as he might
column4: young Akshan could never manage to let bad deeds go unnoticed and was often quick to intervene when he saw someone being mistreated. This approach made the boy many powerful enemies
column5: and on one fateful occasion
column6: left him beaten within an inch of his life.

column1: But luck was on his side. An old woman named Shadya found the boy unconscious in the street outside her dwelling. Though Marwian custom said she should not get involved
column2: she took young Akshan inside and
column3: against all odds
column4: he pulled through.

column1: As Akshan regained his faculties
column2: he realized his savior was no ordinary woman. Shadya was a member of the Sentinels of Light
column3: an ancient order committed to fighting Harrowings and eradicating agents of the Black Mist. She saw Akshan as a troubled youth
column4: stubborn and defiant
column5: but vulnerable. After butting heads with the boy over her numerous sentinel house rules
column6: Shadya quickly discovered there was much to like about him. He had guts and a conscience—a combination seldom found in Marwi. Seeing the immense potential in the young man
column7: Shadya made a deal with him: she would allow him to stay
column8: free from the grasp of his countless enemies
column9: and
column10: in return
column11: he would dedicate himself to the sentinel order.

column1: Shadya and Akshan formed a fast bond as she taught him everything she knew about surviving as a solo sentinel. Akshan the scrappy street urchin grew into Akshan the full-grown bane of scoundrels. But even as Akshan’s skills grew by the day
column2: he could see his mentor growing more distant
column3: and more troubled.

column1: At last
column2: Shadya told her pupil the reason for her concern: A Harrowing was coming
column3: bigger than any the world had ever seen
column4: bearing an army of wraiths and ghouls from the Shadow Isles. Their only hope of stopping the cataclysm rested with the ancient sentinel weapons that lay buried within Shurima's crypts and tombs. If the world was to be saved from ruination
column5: they needed to collect these weapons
column6: and quickly.

column1: To Shadya’s dismay
column2: she found that the ancient weapons had already been plundered by local warlords. She pleaded with them to relinquish the artifacts for the fight against the inevitable Harrowing
column3: but the warlords refused
column4: determined to unlock the weapons’ mysterious power for themselves.

column1: With time running out
column2: Akshan and Shadya were forced to make due with what they had. As they took stock of their arsenal
column3: Akshan discovered a particularly striking gun hidden away in the base’s vault. Alarmed
column4: his mentor snatched it away and forbade Akshan from ever using it. The weapon
column5: known as the Absolver
column6: was imbued with an ancient enchantment that granted it a strange
column7: unspeakable power—it could take the life of a killer and
column8: by doing so
column9: restore their most recent victims to life.

column1: “It must not be wielded by anyone
column2: ” said Shadya. “Such matters of life and death are best left in the hands of fate.”

column1: But Akshan still bristled at sentinel rules
column2: and he had even stronger opinions on fate. He had spent his whole life seeing good people horribly mistreated while bad people did as they pleased without consequence. If fate was real
column3: it definitely needed help—help that the Absolver could provide.

column1: As his interest in the weapon deepened
column2: Akshan continued to pry its history from Shadya and came to a shocking discovery: She had used the gun to save Akshan when she found him unconscious in the street all those years ago. With it
column3: she’d slain the criminal who had nearly killed him
column4: and
column5: in doing so
column6: restored young Akshan to life. He wondered: Why did he alone deserve to be revived by the gun? Surely there were others who were more worthy.

column1: While Akshan questioned the antiquated rules of his order
column2: his mentor continued to press the warlords to turn over their stolen weapons. Tensions between the two parties built until one tragic day Akshan returned home to find Shadya murdered in the street
column3: almost exactly where he had fallen all those years ago.

column1: Akshan knew what he had to do. He made some key alterations to the Absolver and set out into the scorching desert with the forbidden weapon
column2: hungry for vengeance. Though he could not determine which of the warlords had killed his mentor
column3: he knew one way to be certain: he would pick them off one by one until Shadya was returned to Runeterra.

column1: 69;Cassiopeia;the Serpent's Embrace;Desperada Cassiopeia;Siren Cassiopeia;Mythic Cassiopeia;Jade Fang Cassiopeia;Eternum Cassiopeia;Spirit Blossom Cassiopeia;Coven Cassiopeia;;;;;;;;;Use Twin Fang on poisoned stationary targets like monsters and units stunned by her Petrifying Gaze for maximum damage.;Lead your enemy when targeting with Noxious Blast to ensure the hit.;;;;Be wary of Cassiopeia's damage potential with Twin Fang when she has you poisoned.;Turn away from Cassiopeia when she is casting Petrifying Gaze to get slowed instead of stunned.;;;Mage;;Mana;2;3;9;10;560.0;90;350.0;60.0;328;18;3.5;32.0;0.5;550;5.5;0.5;8.0;0.8;53.0;3.0;1.5;0.647;Noxious Blast;Cassiopeia blasts an area with Poison after a brief delay, granting her increased Move Speed if she hits an enemy champion.;Miasma;Cassiopeia releases several clouds of poison, slowing, grounding, and lightly damaging enemies that pass through them. Grounded enemies cannot use Movement abilities.;Twin Fang;Cassiopeia lets loose an attack that deals increased damage to Poisoned targets and heals her for a percentage of the damage dealt. If the target dies from this attack, Cassiopeia regains Mana.;Petrifying Gaze;Cassiopeia releases a swirl of magical energy from her eyes, stunning any enemies in front of her that are facing her and slowing any others with their back turned.;Serpentine Grace;Cassiopeia gains Move Speed per level, but she cannot purchase Boots items.;
Cassiopeia is a deadly creature bent on manipulating others to her will. Youngest and most beautiful daughter of the noble Du Couteau family of Noxus
column2: she ventured deep into the crypts beneath Shurima in search of ancient power. There
column3: she was bitten by a gruesome tomb guardian
column4: whose venom transformed her into a viper-like predator. Cunning and agile
column5: Cassiopeia now slithers under the veil of night
column6: petrifying her enemies with her baleful gaze.

column1: The youngest child of General Du Couteau
column2: Cassiopeia was born to a life of possibility and privilege among the Noxian noble houses. From an early age
column3: she displayed a keen mind and sharp wit
column4: and while her sister Katarina flourished under their father’s tutelage
column5: it was their mother Soreana in whose footsteps Cassiopeia would follow.

column1: A hero of Noxus’ expansion into Shurima
column2: General Du Couteau eventually sent for his family
column3: installing them close to the governor of the coastal city of Urzeris. Surrounded by strangers in an unfamiliar land
column4: Cassiopeia remained close to her mother
column5: learning much of politics
column6: diplomacy
column7: and subtle influence. As she grew
column8: Cassiopeia could not help but glimpse other
column9: hidden concerns within Soreana
column10: beyond those of the empire…

column1: One day
column2: quite unexpectedly
column3: Soreana collapsed in the family residence—her hairbrush had been laced with caustic venoms by an unknown hand
column4: leaving her close to death. General du Couteau was well versed in the ways of an assassin
column5: and so he had all the household staff removed
column6: leaving his wife and daughters alone in an empty house.

column1: Still little more than a child
column2: Cassiopeia never left her mother’s bedside. While Soreana’s recovery took many months
column3: the bond between them became stronger than ever before.

column1: When the general was recalled to Noxus to prepare for the long-awaited invasion of Ionia
column2: he took Katarina with him
column3: but Cassiopeia remained in Urzeris. Seemingly relieved
column4: Soreana confided in her daughter that she belonged to a clandestine and secretive cabal
column5: known by some as “the Black Rose”. Having guided the empire for centuries
column6: they had finally managed to spread their influence into Shurima.

column1: Now free of her husband’s watchful eye
column2: Soreana’s real work could begin.

column1: In time
column2: and under her mother’s tutelage
column3: Cassiopeia blossomed into a young woman of tremendous beauty
column4: cunning and intelligence
column5: if somewhat lacking in empathy. She saw those around her as tools to be used to achieve her goals
column6: and then cast aside just as quickly.

column1: Though she had barely reached the cusp of womanhood
column2: she was initiated into the Black Rose by hunting down and eliminating those who had sought the death of her mother. She surprised even Soreana with her speed and efficiency
column3: and left no trace of her activities—or her proxies—behind. Only then was Cassiopeia made privy to the cabal’s broader plan for Shurima. Using her family’s tremendous resources
column4: she undertook a number of expeditions into the deep desert
column5: raiding ancient ruins with the help of a local mercenary named Sivir.

column1: Her efforts were made all the more urgent when word reached Urzeris from the capital. Grand General Boram Darkwill had been deposed by Jericho Swain
column2: and a number of noble houses had chosen to honor this coup… including Du Couteau.

column1: Outraged and disgusted by her husband’s betrayal
column2: and fearing that all members of the Black Rose were now in jeopardy
column3: Soreana became desperate. She dispatched Cassiopeia to seek out the godlike power that had been the key to Shurima’s supremacy in ages past. Cassiopeia swore she would return with a weapon ready for the looming secret war
column4: or not at all.

column1: Fulfilling this oath would leave her changed forever. Upon unearthing a long lost tomb of the mythical Ascended
column2: she knew this was the threshold to the power she sought
column3: and intended to dispatch all witnesses from her expedition before claiming it. The guide Sivir was the first to fall to Cassiopeia’s blade
column4: but then an ancient stone tomb guardian reared up
column5: and buried its fangs into her flesh.

column1: Overcome by its arcane toxins
column2: she was carried back through the desert by her hired soldiers
column3: screaming as her body twisted into something new and unspeakable…

column1: Cassiopeia locked herself in the disused crypt of the Urzeris residence
column2: and endured the untold agonies of this transformation. Gone was the brilliant and beautiful daughter of Soreana Du Couteau
column3: replaced by a monstrous
column4: slithering creature that skulked in the shadows
column5: spitting poison
column6: and crushing stone as easily as glass.

column1: For weeks she wept and howled
column2: grieving her lost life… until the day she could weep no more. She dragged herself up from the depths of despair
column3: determined to accept—maybe even someday embrace?—her fate. It was not the Ascension she had hoped for
column4: but Cassiopeia had unearthed the magic of dead Shuriman gods. She would turn it to the schemes of the Black Rose just as she and her mother had planned
column5: and she could feel this power growing within her
column6: day by day.

column1: Though into what
column2: even she cannot guess.

column1:
126;Jayce;the Defender of Tomorrow;Full Metal Jayce;Debonair Jayce;Forsaken Jayce;Jayce Brighthammer;Battle Academia Jayce;Resistance Jayce;Arcane Jayce;;;;;;;;;Be sure to switch stances often. It will enhance your attacks and grant you quick bursts of speed.;If you find yourself taking lots of damage, try using Jayce's Hammer Stance, as it grants you additional defenses.;For increased range and damage, try casting Shock Blast through the Acceleration Gate.;;;Jayce can attack in melee or at range. Pay attention to his stance and weapon color to know how he is going to attack.;If you see Jayce drop his Acceleration Gate, be careful, he is probably about to cast Shock Blast.;Jayce is strong in the early game. If he gains the advantage, play defensively.;;Fighter;Marksman;Mana;8;4;3;7;560.0;90;375.0;45.0;335;27;3.5;30.0;0.5;125;6.0;0.6;6.0;0.8;54.0;4.25;3.0;0.658;To the Skies! / Shock Blast;Hammer Stance: Leaps to an enemy dealing physical damage and slowing enemies.

Cannon Stance: Fires an orb of electricity that detonates upon hitting an enemy (or reaching the end of its path) dealing physical damage to all enemies hit.;Lightning Field / Hyper Charge;Hammer Stance: Passive: Restores Mana per strike. Active: Creates a field of lightning damaging nearby enemies for several seconds.

Cannon Stance: Gains a burst of energy, increasing Attack Speed to maximum for several attacks.;Thundering Blow / Acceleration Gate;Hammer Stance: Deals magic damage to an enemy and knocks them back a short distance.

Cannon Stance: Deploys an Acceleration Gate increasing the Move Speed of all allied champions who pass through it. If Shock Blast is fired through the gate the missile speed, range, and damage will increase.;Mercury Cannon / Mercury Hammer;Hammer Stance: Transforms the Mercury Hammer into the Mercury Cannon gaining new abilities and increased range. The first attack in this form reduces the target's Armor and Magic Resist.

Cannon Stance: Transforms the Mercury Cannon into the Mercury Hammer gaining new abilities and increasing Armor and Magic Resist. The first attack in this form deals additional magic damage.;Hextech Capacitor;When Jayce swaps weapons he gains movement speed for a short duration.;
Jayce is a brilliant inventor who has pledged his life to the defense of Piltover and its unyielding pursuit of progress. With his transforming hextech hammer in hand
column2: Jayce uses his strength
column3: courage
column4: and considerable intelligence to protect his hometown. While revered throughout the city as a hero
column5: he hasn’t taken well to the attention it brings. Still
column6: Jayce’s heart is in the right place
column7: and even those who envy his natural skills are grateful for his protection in the City of Progress.

column1: A native son of Piltover
column2: Jayce was raised to believe in the principles that made the city great: Invention. Discovery. Not going to Zaun if you could help it. With a knack for understanding machinery
column3: Jayce earned the honor of being the youngest apprenta to ever be offered patronage by Clan Giopara
column4: one of Piltover’s most respected ruling clans. Utterly unsurprised
column5: Jayce took the offer
column6: and spent most of his early years constructing potential hextech devices and designing transformable multi-tools for Piltover’s working class: a wrench that transformed into a prybar
column7: a pickaxe that could morph into a shovel
column8: a hammer that could turn into a demolition beam
column9: if only it had a sufficiently powerful battery. Everything Jayce touched put his contemporaries to shame.

column1: Most things came easy to Jayce
column2: and he could never understand why his peers had so much trouble with what
column3: to him
column4: were simple concepts. As a result
column5: nearly everyone who worked alongside Jayce found him arrogant
column6: dismissive
column7: and unwilling to slow his pace to help his colleagues catch up. As time went on
column8: his patience became shorter
column9: while at the same time
column10: a chasm grew between decorum
column11: charm
column12: and Jayce’s natural demeanor.

column1: Only one person ever managed to match Jayce’s intelligence while also maintaining a healthy indifference to his superior attitude.
His name was Viktor.
The two met at a mandatory Progress Day party
column2: and immediately bonded over how little either of them wanted to be there. They started working together shortly after. Viktor expanded Jayce’s intellectual horizons and challenged many of his assumptions. While Jayce sought to improve humanity via versatile technology
column3: Viktor sought to solve problems inherent to humanity itself
column4: such as physical decay or illogical prejudices. They constantly argued with one another
column5: but their conflicts never got personal – though their methods were different
column6: the two colleagues knew their ultimate goals were very much the same. More than that
column7: they both knew what it was like to be ostracized by their colleagues: Viktor because of his unconventional thinking
column8: Jayce because of his rudeness.

column1: Together
column2: Jayce and Viktor invented a mechanized construction suit for Piltover’s dockworkers – something hearty enough to enhance the wearer’s strength
column3: but light enough that its wearer wouldn’t immediately drown upon falling overboard. However
column4: the two reached an impasse when Viktor’s design for the next version of the suit included a chemtech implant that would increase the wearer’s strength output by tenfold
column5: while also preventing them from getting tired
column6: panicking
column7: or disobeying instructions from their superiors. While Viktor considered this feature a brilliant means of reducing the frequency of construction accidents
column8: Jayce found its indifference toward free will immoral. The two nearly came to blows over the design and ultimately
column9: after Jayce warned the academy of Viktor’s invention
column10: Viktor was stripped of his honors and ostracized from Piltover’s scientific community.

column1: Viktor was the closest thing Jayce had ever really had to a friend
column2: and distraught over their falling-out
column3: went back to working on his own. He grew more insular. His patience toward others grew even thinner.

column1: As Jayce studied in solitude
column2: Clan Giopara’s explorers discovered a raw
column3: blue crystal deep within the Shuriman desert. Though Jayce volunteered to experiment on it (specifically by suggesting the clan’s other scholars wouldn’t be smart enough to get anything out of it)
column4: his lack of tact in doing so prompted Clan Giopara to give it to their better-mannered scholars as a form of punishment. Yet
column5: after many months
column6: the scholars reached a unanimous conclusion: the crystal was worthless. A power-drained hunk of rock. The disappointed clan leaders finally handed the crystal over to Jayce
column7: assuming that even he
column8: with his remarkable intelligence
column9: wouldn’t be able to learn anything from it.

column1: Something inside the crystal called to Jayce. No
column2: more than that – it sang to him. He couldn’t explain why
column3: but he knew the Shuriman gem still held mysteries yet to be discovered.

column1: He spent many months running every variety of test on the crystal. He braced it into a cogwheel centrifuge; he superheated it and deep-froze it; he tinkered
column2: and observed
column3: and hypothesized
column4: and beat his head against his copper pantograph. Quite simply
column5: Jayce wasn’t used to working hard: this damned crystal was the first thing that had ever resisted his considerable mental aptitude. For the first time
column6: he realized how his peers must have felt
column7: trying so hard to solve a problem
column8: only to bump against your own limitations. It felt frustrating. It felt unfair.

column1: And it probably felt much
column2: much worse if you were working alongside an arrogant inventor who dismissed your every effort.

column1: Jayce realized that despite how dismissive he’d been toward his fellow scholars
column2: none of them ever gave up. None of them ever stopped seeking the very things that defined Piltover: Progress. Discovery. If they wouldn’t give up
column3: Jayce decided
column4: he wouldn’t either.

column1: And maybe he’d try to be nicer.
Maybe.
Jayce approached the problem from a completely different angle. Rather than trying to experiment on the crystal as a whole
column2: he wondered
column3: why not run more invasive experiments on a smaller shard? Jayce chiseled off a piece of the crystal and suspended it in a liquid alloy. As he sent a voltaic current through the liquid metal
column4: Jayce’s eardrums nearly shattered from the booming baritone note that blasted from the shard. Heat radiated from the crystal and
column5: with a flash
column6: it glowed bright enough to nearly blind him. This was unexpected. This was potentially dangerous. But this was progress. Jayce couldn’t erase the smile from his face as he worked well through the night
column7: into the dawn.

column1: The next day
column2: Jayce was surprised to find his old friend Viktor on his doorstep. Alerted by the massive power spike from the crystal shard
column3: Viktor had a simple proposition.

column1: Since his expulsion from the Piltovan scientific community
column2: Viktor had commenced work on a secret project in Zaun. He’d finally learned how to achieve his dream – how to eradicate disease
column3: hunger
column4: hatred. If Jayce joined him
column5: the two would accomplish more than anyone from Piltover or Zaun could have dreamed of: they’d save humanity from itself.

column1: Jayce had heard a monologue like this before from Viktor. He never liked where it led.
Viktor told Jayce that he only needed one thing for his Glorious Evolution – a power source like Jayce’s crystal. Jayce disagreed
column2: informing Viktor that what he truly needed was a moral compass. Viktor
column3: who had long grown tired of Jayce’s rudeness
column4: leapt upon him
column5: grabbed the crystal and knocked Jayce unconscious with it. When Jayce awoke hours later
column6: he noticed that though the Shuriman crystal was gone Viktor hadn’t seemed to notice or care about the smaller shard.

column1: Jayce knew whatever Viktor was planning
column2: he would only resort to these measures if he were close to completion. Even though he didn’t know what Viktor’s Glorious Evolution consisted of
column3: it probably didn’t have a lot of respect for the free will of others. Without wasting a second
column4: Jayce retrieved the suspended shard and installed it into a massive
column5: transforming hammer – a demolitions invention he’d abandoned years ago for lack of a strong enough battery to power it. Though he had no idea where Viktor might have taken the crystal
column6: he could feel the hextech hammer vibrate
column7: pulling him not north
column8: south
column9: east or west
column10: but down
column11: toward the undercity of Zaun.

column1: The shard
column2: eager to be reunited with the crystal from which it was chiseled
column3: eventually led Jayce to a warehouse in the depths of the sump. Within the cavernous building
column4: Jayce found something horrifying. Dozens of corpses
column5: their skulls sawed open and hollowed out
column6: their brains transplanted into an army of immobile metal soldiers
column7: hooked up to the now-pulsing crystal.

column1: This was the first step in Viktor’s Glorious Evolution.
Jayce’s stride grew less confident as he approached Viktor. He and Viktor had not always seen eye to eye
column2: but this was something else entirely. For the first time
column3: it occurred to Jayce that he might have to kill his old friend.

column1: He called out to Viktor
column2: flinching as the army of robots stood to attention. Jayce asked him to look around – to see what he was doing. Whatever this was – this Evolution – wasn’t the progress they fought for in their youths. He even
column3: to Viktor’s surprise
column4: apologized for acting like such a jerk.

column1: Viktor sighed. He had only two words in response: “Kill him.”
The automatons sprinted toward Jayce
column2: breaking free of the wires connecting them to the crystal and introducing Jayce to another new emotion: panic. He gripped the hammer tight
column3: realizing he’d never actually used it before. When the first golem was within reach
column4: he swung as hard as he could
column5: feeling the shard’s energy surge through his muscles
column6: accelerating the hammer’s movement until Jayce was worried it might fly out of his hands.

column1: It slammed into the automaton
column2: all but exploding it into a hail of metal. Despite the obliteration of their comrade
column3: the other machines didn’t even pause as they rushed at Jayce
column4: trying to pummel him into unconsciousness.

column1: Jayce analyzed the formation of the mechanical wave coming at him and attempted to quickly calculate how to take out the largest number of them with the fewest amount of swings. It was pointless; they were on him before he could swing even once. As he fell to the ground under a storm of their blows
column2: Jayce saw Viktor looking on
column3: not with triumph
column4: but with sadness. He’d outsmarted Jayce and ensured humanity’s future
column5: but he knew that future came at a cost: he couldn’t let his old friend live. Jayce vanished under a sea of swinging metal limbs.

column1: That’s when Jayce
column2: for the first time in his life
column3: decided to stop thinking and just break stuff.

column1: No longer caring for his own safety
column2: Jayce used every last bit of strength he had to break free from Viktor’s automatons. He sprinted to the glowing crystal
column3: and struck it with all of the hextech-enhanced force his hammer could muster
column4: crushing the mystical object.

column1: Viktor cried out in horror as the crystal shattered to fragments
column2: the shockwave blasting them all backward as the army of automatons collapsed lifelessly to the floor. The very foundations of the warehouse shook
column3: and Jayce barely managed to escape before the entire building toppled.

column1: Viktor’s body was never found.
Upon his return to Piltover
column2: Jayce informed his clan masters of Viktor’s nefarious plans. Soon
column3: Jayce found himself a topic of discussion in both Zaun and Piltover alike. Hailed for his quick thinking in a time of crisis
column4: Jayce became a beloved figure (at least
column5: amongst those who hadn’t met him)
column6: earning himself a nickname: the Defender of Tomorrow.

column1: Jayce cared little for the adoration of his fellow Piltovans
column2: but took the nickname to heart. He knew that Viktor was still out there
column3: plotting his revenge. One day – maybe someday soon – an awful lot of trouble was headed for Piltover.

column1: And Jayce would be waiting.

Once ruler of a long-lost kingdom
column2: Viego perished over a thousand years ago when his attempt to bring his wife back from the dead triggered the magical catastrophe known as the Ruination. Transformed into a powerful
column3: unliving wraith tortured by an obsessive longing for his centuries-dead queen
column4: Viego now stands as the Ruined King
column5: controlling the deadly Harrowings as he scours Runeterra for anything that might one day restore her
column6: and destroying all in his path as the Black Mist pours endlessly from his cruel
column7: broken heart.

column1: Few know of the kingdom to the east
column2: far across the seas
column3: whose name lies all but forgotten among the ruins that dot its shores. Fewer still know of its foolish young ruler
column4: whose lovestruck heart was doomed to destroy it.

column1: Now a grave threat to all
column2: that man’s name was—and is—Viego.

column1: The second son of a dynastic king
column2: Viego was never intended to lead. Instead
column3: he lived a life of comfort that made him complacent and selfish. Yet
column4: when his older brother died unexpectedly
column5: Viego
column6: who possessed neither the inclination nor the aptitude for rulership
column7: suddenly found himself crowned.

column1: He showed little interest in his position until he met a poor seamstress
column2: Isolde. So taken was he by her beauty that the young king offered her his hand in marriage
column3: and thus
column4: one of the most powerful rulers of the age was wed to a peasant girl.

column1: Their romance was enchanting
column2: and Viego
column3: who’d rarely shown interest in anyone other than himself
column4: devoted his life to her. The two were inseparable—he scarcely went anywhere without Isolde
column5: always lavishing gifts upon his queen
column6: and his attention could seldom be broken when she was present.

column1: Viego’s allies fumed. Unable to interest him in governance
column2: and with the nation beginning to unravel under his questionable rulership
column3: some plotted in secret to end their new king’s reign before it had begun. His nation’s enemies
column4: meanwhile
column5: saw an opportunity to strike. And the vipers began to circle.

column1: Thus did an assassin’s poisoned dagger one day come for Viego. But the king was well defended
column2: and the dagger did not strike true—instead grazing Isolde.

column1: The toxin worked quickly
column2: and Isolde fell into a ruinous torpor
column3: while Viego could only watch in horror as his wife’s condition grew ever more serious. Overwhelmed with fury and despair
column4: he spent every last coin within his coffers trying to save her.

column1: But it was all for naught. Isolde perished in her bed
column2: and Viego was consumed by madness.

column1: His search for an antidote became desperate
column2: crazed. Unable to accept his wife’s death
column3: every treasure of the kingdom—every scrap of wealth—was sacrificed to his quest to return her to him. As the land fell into disarray
column4: Viego hid himself away with Isolde’s body
column5: becoming hateful and violent.

column1: Then came the day he learned the secret of the Blessed Isles
column2: of its water that healed any ailment. With his great army
column3: he stormed the peaceful country by force
column4: slaughtering everyone who stood in his way until he at last breached its inner sanctum and let his wife drift beneath the blessed water. She would return to him
column5: no matter the destruction he wrought. No matter the cost.

column1: And for just one moment
column2: she did.

column1: Isolde arose a horrifying wraith of shadow and rage
column2: and in her pain
column3: her anger
column4: her confusion at being ripped from death
column5: she took Viego’s own enchanted blade and thrust it through his heart. The magic of the waters and the ancient sword clashed
column6: and the chamber’s energy erupted
column7: tearing across the Isles and trapping everything it touched in tortured
column8: conscious undeath.

column1: Yet of this
column2: Viego remembers nothing. His country collapsed into ruin
column3: great nations rose and fell
column4: and in time
column5: even his name was forgotten... until
column6: a thousand years after his death
column7: Viego stood once more. And this time
column8: he would not fail.

column1: His mind twisted by the same dangerous obsession he possessed in life
column2: Viego’s unflinching
column3: deranged love fuels his every action
column4: his every desire
column5: his every atrocity. The deadly Black Mist pours freely from Viego’s broken heart—ripping the life from everything it touches—and he uses the Mist to scour the world for some way to return Isolde to his side.

column1: Legions will fall before him only to rise again in his service
column2: continents will be swallowed by living darkness
column3: and the world will pay for every moment of happiness it stole from an ancient ruler laid low by all-consuming love. He cares naught for the destruction he causes
column4: so long as he can see Isolde’s face again.

column1: His reign is terror.
His love is eternal.
And until Isolde returns to him
column2: all will fall before the Ruined King.

Sejuani is the brutal
column2: unforgiving Warmother of the Winter’s Claw
column3: one of the most feared tribes of the Freljord. Her people’s survival is a constant
column4: desperate battle against the elements
column5: forcing them to raid Noxians
column6: Demacians
column7: and Avarosans alike to survive the harsh winters. Sejuani herself spearheads the most dangerous of these attacks from the saddle of her drüvask boar Bristle
column8: using her True Ice flail to freeze and shatter her enemies.

column1: Sejuani was the child of a Freljordian political marriage that ended as coldly as it began. Her mother
column2: the Iceborn warrior Kalkia of the Winter’s Claw
column3: abandoned her new family to pursue the man who had captured her heart years before
column4: and the tribe fell into decline and chaos without a young Warmother to lead it.

column1: Sejuani was instead raised by her grandmother
column2: Hejian. Though Sejuani tried her best to earn Hejian’s love
column3: she was never able to meet her arduous expectations. As the tribe’s troubles grew in the years that followed
column4: Hejian had even less time for the girl.

column1: Wealth
column2: love
column3: safety—these were things Sejuani only experienced secondhand
column4: through visits to the Winter’s Claw’s sister tribe
column5: the Avarosans. During the summers
column6: Grena
column7: the most famous warrior in the region
column8: took Sejuani into her household. After discovering Grena had in fact once bested Kalkia in a duel
column9: the Avarosan Warmother instantly became Sejuani’s idol… and Grena’s daughter Ashe became the only person she ever truly considered a friend.

column1: After Grena questioned the treatment of the young girl by her grandmother
column2: an affronted Hejian cut all ties with the Avarosans. The Winter’s Claw then instigated a series of conflicts with other neighboring tribes
column3: attempting to reclaim the lands and honor they had lost with Kalkia’s flight
column4: but these desperate tactics only led them further into ruin.

column1: Somehow
column2: word of this reached Kalkia.

column1: Hearing of her former tribe’s misfortunes
column2: she returned and took up the mantle of Warmother once more. Even so
column3: quelling these hostilities left the Winter’s Claw with game-poor lands and precious few other resources
column4: forcing them to rely on the grim Frostguard for protection.

column1: Sejuani was galled by this
column2: and resolved to seize leadership from her mother. She swore a sacred oath to lead a perilous raid against a Noxian warship
column3: hoping that fulfilling this oath would be enough to rally the tribe to her
column4: with enough support to wrest power from Kalkia and the Frost Priests.

column1: During the vicious assault
column2: Sejuani freed a juvenile drüvask from the ship’s butchery stores
column3: naming it Bristle for the feel of its hide. Though she could not have guessed it at the time
column4: this creature would grow to become one of the largest drüvasks ever seen
column5: and remained with Sejuani as her loyal steed.

column1: Her raid a success
column2: Sejuani decided it was time to challenge her mother directly for the tribe. By the ancient customs
column3: a duel between a mother and her daughter was unthinkable—but Sejuani would not be deterred.

column1: Outraged
column2: the Frost Priests were forced to intervene
column3: and Kalkia died in the struggle before Sejuani could reach her.

column1: As the new Warmother of the Winter’s Claw
column2: Sejuani began attacking and absorbing nearby tribes
column3: consolidating her power and gathering a veritable horde of followers. Her defiance of the Frostguard also attracted outcast shamans
column4: spirit walkers
column5: Iceborn and Stormborn
column6: and unrepentant worshippers of all the old gods from across the Freljord.

column1: Where once they had been weak
column2: disgraced
column3: and preyed upon by their neighbors
column4: in only a few years the Winter’s Claw had become feared throughout the northlands for their speed
column5: brutality
column6: and absolute devotion to their Warmother.

column1: Now
column2: as the seasons turn
column3: Sejuani marches on the southern tribes
column4: Noxian interlopers
column5: and even the borderlands of Demacia—raiding
column6: pillaging
column7: and conquering any who stand against her. Ultimately
column8: she seeks to cast down and destroy the burgeoning coalition of tribes formed by her childhood friend
column9: Ashe. As far as Sejuani is concerned
column10: the Avarosan Warmother has betrayed not only their friendship but
column11: far worse
column12: she has also betrayed Grena’s legacy.

column1: And so
column2: Sejuani will prove that only she is worthy of ruling the Freljord.
