Nasus is an imposing
column2: jackal-headed Ascended being from ancient Shurima
column3: a heroic figure regarded as a demigod by the people of the desert. Fiercely intelligent
column4: he was a guardian of knowledge and peerless strategist whose wisdom guided the ancient empire of Shurima to greatness for many centuries. After the fall of the empire
column5: he went into self-imposed exile
column6: becoming little more than a legend. Now that the ancient city of Shurima has risen once more
column7: he has returned
column8: determined to ensure it never falls again.

column1: Nasus’s brilliance was recognized from a young age
column2: long before he was chosen to join the ranks of the Ascended. A voracious scholar
column3: he read
column4: memorized and critiqued the greatest works of history
column5: philosophy and rhetoric within the Library of the Sun before he’d seen ten summers. His passion for reading and critical thinking were not passed down to his younger brother Renekton
column6: who was quickly bored
column7: and spent his time fighting with other local children. The brothers were close
column8: and Nasus kept a protective eye over his younger brother
column9: helping to ensure he didn’t get into too much trouble. However
column10: it wasn’t long before Nasus was welcomed into the exclusive Collegium of the Sun
column11: leaving home to take up his place in this prestigious academy.

column1: While the pursuit of knowledge would always be his passion
column2: Nasus’s grasp on military strategy and logistics ensured he became the youngest general in Shuriman history. While he was a competent soldier
column3: his genius lay not in fighting battles
column4: but in planning them.

column1: His strategic foresight became legendary. In war
column2: he was always a dozen moves ahead of the enemy
column3: able to predict their movement and reactions
column4: as well as pinpoint the exact moment to push the attack or pull back. A deeply empathetic man who took his responsibilities incredibly seriously
column5: he always ensured his soldiers were well provisioned
column6: paid on time
column7: and treated fairly. Every loss of life pained him deeply
column8: and he often refused to rest as he planned and replanned his troop movements and battle dispositions until they were perfect. He was loved and respected by all who served in his legions
column9: and he guided the armies of Shurima to countless victories. His brother Renekton often served on the front lines of these wars
column10: and the two of them quickly garnered an aura of invincibility.

column1: Despite the acclaim Nasus won
column2: he did not enjoy war. Though he understood its importance - for now at least - in ensuring the continued progress of the empire
column3: he firmly believed his greatest contribution to Shurima was in the knowledge he gathered for future generations.

column1: At Nasus’s urging
column2: all the books
column3: scrolls
column4: teachings and histories of the cultures he defeated were preserved in great libraries and repositories throughout the empire
column5: the greatest of which bore his name. His hunger for knowledge was not for selfish reasons
column6: but to share wisdom with all of Shurima
column7: to enhance understanding of the world and bring enlightenment to the empire.

column1: After decades of dutiful service
column2: Nasus was cruelly struck down by a terrible wasting sickness. Some say he encountered Amumu
column3: a long-dead child-king said to bear a terrible curse; others believed he was laid low by the evil magicks of an Icathian cult-leader. Whatever the truth
column4: the emperor’s own physician declared
column5: with a heavy heart
column6: that Nasus was incurable
column7: and would be dead within a week.

column1: The people of Shurima went into mourning
column2: for Nasus was its brightest star and beloved by all. The emperor himself begged the priesthood for an augury. After a day and night of communing with the divine
column3: the priests declared it the will of the sun-god that Nasus be blessed with the Ascension ritual.

column1: Renekton
column2: now a great war-leader
column3: raced back to the capital to be with his brother. The terrible sickness had advanced dramatically
column4: and Nasus was little more than a skeleton
column5: his flesh wasted away and his bones as fragile as glass. So weak was he that as the golden light from the sun disc streamed onto the Ascension dais
column6: Nasus was unable to climb the final stairs and step into the light.

column1: Renekton’s love for his brother was stronger than any sense of self-preservation
column2: and he nobly bore Nasus onto the dais. Ignoring his brother’s protests
column3: he willingly accepted oblivion in order to save Nasus. However
column4: Renekton was not destroyed
column5: as was expected. When the light faded
column6: two Ascended beings stood before Shurima. Both brothers had been deemed worthy
column7: and the emperor himself dropped to his knees to give thanks to the divine.

column1: Nasus was now a towering
column2: jackal-headed being of great strength
column3: his eyes glittering with fierce intelligence
column4: while Renekton had been transformed into a heavily muscled behemoth bearing the likeness of a crocodile. They took their place alongside the other rare Ascended beings of Shurima
column5: and became its protectors.

column1: While Renekton had always been a great warrior
column2: now he was virtually unstoppable. Nasus too had been gifted with powers far beyond the understanding of mortal men. The greatest boon of his Ascension - his newly extended longevity
column3: which allowed him countless lifetimes to spend in study and contemplation - would
column4: after the fall of Shurima
column5: also prove to be his curse.

column1: One side-effect of the ritual that disturbed Nasus was the increased savagery he saw within his brother. At the culmination of the siege of Nashramae
column2: which finally brought that ancient city under Shuriman rule
column3: Nasus witnessed the victorious Shuriman soldiers butchering everyone they came across and setting the city ablaze. Renekton led the massacre
column4: and it was he who set fire to the great library of Nashramae
column5: destroying countless irreplaceable volumes before Nasus was able to contain it. This was the closest the brothers ever came to bloodshed
column6: standing in the center of the city
column7: weapons drawn against each other. Under the stern
column8: disappointed gaze of his brother
column9: Renekton’s bloodlust waned
column10: and he finally turned away in shame.

column1: Over the following centuries
column2: Nasus bent his every effort to learning all he could
column3: scouring the desert for years in search of ancient artifacts and wisdom
column4: eventually going on to discover the legendary Tomb of the Emperors hidden beneath the Shuriman capital.

column1: Nasus and Renekton had both been lured away when the Ascension ritual of Emperor Azir went terribly wrong
column2: the young emperor betrayed by his closest advisor
column3: the magus Xerath. The brothers returned as fast as they could
column4: but were too late. Azir was dead
column5: along with most of the capital’s citizens. Filled with rage and grief
column6: Nasus and Renekton battled the malevolent being of pure energy that Xerath had become.

column1: Unable to kill Xerath
column2: they sought to bind him in a magical sarcophagus
column3: but even that was not enough to hold him. Renekton
column4: perhaps attempting to atone for Nashramae years earlier
column5: grabbed Xerath and bore him into the Tomb of the Emperors
column6: bidding Nasus seal them in. Nasus refused
column7: desperate to find another way
column8: but there was no other option. With a heavy heart
column9: he sealed Xerath and his brother within the fathomless darkness
column10: locking them away for all eternity.

column1: The Shuriman empire collapsed. Its great central city sank into ruin
column2: and the holy sun disc fell from the sky
column3: drained of power by Xerath’s magic. Without it
column4: the divine waters flowing from the city ran dry
column5: bringing death and famine to Shurima.

column1: Bearing the heavy burden of guilt for having damned his brother to darkness
column2: Nasus took to roaming the sands
column3: accompanied only by the ghosts of the past and his grief. A melancholy figure
column4: he stalked the now dead cities of Shurima
column5: watching as they were slowly swallowed by the desert
column6: lamenting the fallen empire and its lost people. He embraced isolation
column7: a lean
column8: solitary nomad who the occasional traveler claimed to glimpse before he disappeared into a sandstorm or an early morning haze. Few believed such stories
column9: and Nasus became little more than a legend.

column1: Centuries passed
column2: and Nasus all but forgot his old life and former purpose
column3: until the moment when the now buried Tomb of the Emperors was rediscovered
column4: and its seal broken. In that moment
column5: he knew Xerath was free.

column1: Ancient vigor stirred in his breast
column2: and as Shurima rose from the sands
column3: Nasus traversed the desert
column4: angling toward the newly reborn city. Though he knew he had to battle Xerath once more
column5: hope stirred within him for the first time in millennia. Not only was this potentially the dawn of a new Shuriman empire
column6: but he dared believe it might also herald a long-awaited reunion with his beloved brother.

column1: 3;Galio;the Colossus;Enchanted Galio;Hextech Galio;Commando Galio;Gatekeeper Galio;Debonair Galio;Birdio;Infernal Galio;Dragon Guardian Galio;;;;;;;;You can release Shield of Durand even while crowd controlled.;You can use the minimap ally icons to cast Hero's Entrance.;You can use the step back from Justice Punch to dodge enemy spells.;;;Galio moves slower when he is charging Shield of Durand.;Hero's Entrance can be interrupted before Galio jumps into the air.;Galio cannot traverse walls with Justice Punch.;;Tank;Mage;Mana;1;10;6;5;562.0;112;500.0;40.0;335;24;3.5;32.0;1.25;150;8.0;0.8;9.5;0.7;59.0;3.5;1.5;0.625;Winds of War;Galio fires two windblasts that converge into a large tornado that deals damage over time.;Shield of Durand;Galio charges a defensive stance, moving slowly. Upon releasing the charge, Galio will taunt and damage nearby enemies.;Justice Punch;Galio will briefly step back and charge, knocking up the first enemy champion he encounters.;Hero's Entrance;Galio designates an ally's position as his landing spot, granting all allies in the area a magic shield. After a delay Galio smashes down location, knocking up nearby enemies.;Colossal Smash;Every few seconds, Galio's next basic attack deals bonus magic damage in an area.;
Outside the Great City of Demacia
column2: the stone colossus Galio keeps vigilant watch. Built as a bulwark against enemy mages
column3: he often stands motionless for decades until the presence of powerful magic stirs him to life. Once activated
column4: Galio makes the most of his time
column5: savoring the thrill of a fight and the rare honor of defending his countrymen. But his triumphs are always bittersweet
column6: for the magic he destroys is also his source of reanimation
column7: and each victory leaves him dormant once again.

column1: Galio’s legend begins in the aftermath of the Rune Wars
column2: when countless refugees fled from the destructive power of magic. In the west of Valoran
column3: a band of these displaced people were hounded by a vicious band of dark mages—exhausted from days without rest
column4: the refugees hid among the shadows of an ancient
column5: petrified forest
column6: and their pursuers suddenly found their magic to be ineffective.

column1: It seemed the fossilized trees were a natural magic-dampener
column2: and any sorcery used within them would simply fail. No longer helpless
column3: the refugees turned their swords on the dark mages and drove them from the land.

column1: Some decided that this sanctuary from magic was a gift from the gods
column2: others saw it as a fair reward for their terrible journey
column3: but all agreed this should be their new home.

column1: As years passed
column2: the settlers crafted items of protection from the enchanted wood. Eventually
column3: they found it could be mixed with ash and lime to make petricite—a material with a powerful resistance to magic. It would be the foundation for their new civilization
column4: forming the walls of the new kingdom of Demacia.

column1: For years
column2: these petricite barriers were all the Demacians needed to feel secure from the threat of magic within the borders of their homeland. In the rare event that they needed to settle a conflict abroad
column3: their military proved fierce and formidable… but when their enemies employed sorcery
column4: Demacia’s roaming army had little recourse. Somehow
column5: they needed to take the security of their magic-dampening walls into battle.

column1: The sculptor Durand was commissioned to fashion some manner of petricite shield for the military
column2: and two years later the artist unveiled his masterpiece. While it was not what many were expecting
column3: the winged statue Galio would become vital to the defense of the nation
column4: and serve as a symbol of Demacia across Valoran.

column1: Using a system of pulleys
column2: steel sledges
column3: and countless oxen
column4: they would pull the great stone figure to the battlefield. Many would-be invaders simply froze at the sight of the awe-inspiring silhouette looming before them—the titan who “ate magic” inspired a kingdom
column5: and terrified those who opposed it.

column1: However
column2: no one thought to consider what exposing the statue to such unpredictable energies might do…

column1: Demacia had been mired in battle with enemy forces in the Greenfang Mountains. A skilled order of warmages
column2: known as the Arcane Fist
column3: bombarded the Demacians with crackling bolts of raw
column4: mystical power for thirteen days. Those who had survived this long felt their morale dwindling
column5: and huddled close to Galio. Just when their spirits could be brought no lower
column6: a slow
column7: deafening rumble shook the vale
column8: as if two mountains were grinding against each other. As a great shadow grew above them
column9: the Demacian soldiers steeled themselves for death.

column1: A deep voice bellowed from above. To the Demacians’ astonishment
column2: the sound came from the colossus at their backs—Galio was moving
column3: and speaking
column4: entirely on his own. Somehow
column5: the accumulation of absorbed magic had given him life. He threw himself in front of the Demacians
column6: shielding them from attack after attack
column7: absorbing each fresh bolt into his massive
column8: stone frame.

column1: Then Galio turned
column2: bounded up the mountainside
column3: and crushed every last one of the Arcane Fist into the craggy soil.

column1: The Demacians cheered. They were eager to thank the petricite sentinel that had saved them… but as quickly as he’d come to life
column2: their fearsome protector had ceased moving
column3: returning to his pedestal
column4: just as before. Back in the Great City
column5: this bizarre tale was told in hushed tones by the few who had survived the Battle of the Greenfangs
column6: and was usually received with silent incredulity. That day passed into legend—perhaps a mere allegory of ancient days to help people through hard times.

column1: Certainly
column2: no one would have believed that the colossus continued to see all that transpired around him. Even while immobile
column3: Galio retained consciousness
column4: longing to experience the sensations of battle once again.

column1: He watched mortals pass beneath him
column2: paying him tribute year after year. It puzzled him to see them disappear one by one as time rolled on. Galio wondered where they went when they vanished. Perhaps they were sent away to be mended
column3: as he often was when he returned from war?

column1: As the years slipped by
column2: Galio began to realize the sorrowful answer to his question—unlike himself
column3: the people of Demacia could not be repainted
column4: or have their damage easily repaired. Mortals were frail
column5: ephemeral creatures
column6: and he now understood just how badly they needed his protection. Fighting had been his passion
column7: but the people were now his purpose.

column1: Even so
column2: Galio has been called to battle only a handful of times in all the centuries since. Demacia has begun to look inward
column3: with magic becoming rarer in his world than it once was
column4: and so the petricite colossus remains dormant
column5: observing the world through the murk of his waking dreams. The statue’s greatest hope is to be blessed by a magic so powerful that he will never be forced to sleep again.

column1: Only then will Galio be able to truly serve his purpose: to stand and fight as Demacia’s protector
column2: forevermore.

column1: 15;Sivir;the Battle Mistress;Warrior Princess Sivir;Spectacular Sivir;Huntress Sivir;Bandit Sivir;PAX Sivir;Snowstorm Sivir;Warden Sivir;Victorious Sivir;Neo PAX Sivir;Pizza Delivery Sivir;Blood Moon Sivir;Odyssey Sivir;;;;Sivir's Boomerang Blade returns to her after reaching the max range, so you can shift position to hit enemies who would otherwise have evaded it.;Ricochet resets Sivir's basic attack timer on activation, so activating this immediately after landing a normal basic attack will maximize damage output.;Try saving Spell Shield for enemy abilities that can disable you such as stuns and roots.;;;Boomerang Blade costs a lot of mana to cast, so dodging it sets Sivir back. If it hits you on the way out, avoid its path on the way back.;Sivir is a powerful pushing champion, so leaving her unattended in a lane for too long will often result in your turrets being destroyed.;When laning against Sivir, it is possible to throw off the timing of her Spell Shield by faking an advance, then backing off.;;Marksman;;Mana;9;3;1;4;562.0;90;325.0;50.0;335;26;3.25;30.0;0.5;500;3.25;0.55;8.0;0.9;63.0;3.0;1.6;0.625;Boomerang Blade;Sivir hurls her crossblade like a boomerang, dealing damage each way.;Ricochet;Sivir's next few basic attacks will bounce to nearby targets, dealing reduced damage to secondary targets.;Spell Shield;Creates a magical barrier that blocks a single enemy ability cast on Sivir. She receives Mana back if a spell is blocked.;On The Hunt;Sivir leads her allies in battle, granting them a surge Move Speed for a period of time. Additionally passively grants Sivir bonus Attack Speed while Ricochet is active.;Fleet of Foot;Sivir gains a short burst of Movement Speed when she attacks an enemy champion.;
Sivir is a renowned mercenary captain who plies her trade in the deserts of Shurima. Armed with her legendary jeweled crossblade
column2: she has fought and won countless battles for those who can afford her services
column3: and prides herself on recovering lost treasures from the catacombs beneath the old empire—for a generous share of the profits
column4: of course. With ancient forces stirring the very bones of Shurima
column5: Sivir now finds herself torn between conflicting destinies…

column1: From an early age
column2: Sivir learned firsthand the harsh lessons of Shuriman desert life. With her entire family slain by marauding Kthaons—one of the Great Sai’s most infamous raider tribes—the young girl and other orphans like her could only hope to survive by stealing food from local markets
column3: and delving into half-buried ancient ruins in search of trinkets to sell. They would brave cramped tunnels and forgotten crypts
column4: hunting for anything of value
column5: often scrapping viciously with one another over the best finds.

column1: Sivir would lead others into the depths
column2: but could rarely hold on to what few treasures she managed to unearth. After being robbed by her supposed friend Mhyra
column3: she swore she would never allow herself to be betrayed again
column4: and in time she joined a group of mercenaries led by the renowned Iha Ziharo
column5: serving as their guide and general lackey.

column1: Though her flourishing skill at arms eventually led her to become Ziharo’s personal sergeant
column2: Sivir noted that the domineering leader took the greatest share of gold and glory from every raid… even when it was Sivir’s clever strategies that brought them their wealth. Rallying her fellow sellswords
column3: Sivir decided to strike against Ziharo
column4: and replace her as leader. Unwilling to kill her former mentor
column5: though
column6: Sivir left her alone in the desert with a hollow offer of good luck.

column1: Over the years
column2: Sivir and her new followers earned a fearsome reputation. They accepted any task for good pay
column3: including a commission from a Nashramae patriarch looking for a lost heirloom—a blade known as “the Chalicar”. Accompanied by his personal guards
column4: Sivir searched for many months
column5: until she finally pried a cross-shaped blade from the sarcophagus of some hero of the old Shuriman empire.

column1: This was a treasure indeed
column2: crafted by cunning and magic in a long-forgotten age. Sivir marveled at it—never had a weapon felt so natural in her grip. When the captain of the guard demanded they return it to their master
column3: Sivir threw the blade in a curved arc
column4: decapitating the captain and cutting down the three men behind him in an instant. She fought her way from the tomb
column5: leaving only the dead in her wake.

column1: Sivir’s reputation soon spread beyond the desert. Indeed
column2: when Noxian expeditions began to move inland from the northern coast
column3: she found herself in the employ of Cassiopeia
column4: the youngest daughter of General Du Couteau
column5: to help plunder Shurima’s lost capital. As they traversed twisting catacombs
column6: many of Sivir’s mercenaries fell to ancient traps
column7: but Cassiopeia refused to turn back.

column1: When they finally reached a great tomb door
column2: surrounded by statued guardians and bas-reliefs depicting the mighty god-warriors of old
column3: Sivir felt her blood stir. She was mesmerized by these beast-headed heroes
column4: and their wars against the foul creatures of the underworld.

column1: Taking advantage of Sivir’s inattention
column2: Cassiopeia thrust a dagger into the mercenary’s back.

column1: Sivir collapsed in agony
column2: her blood soaking the sand. Using the Chalicar itself
column3: Cassiopeia unlocked the tomb door
column4: unknowingly triggering the sorcerous curse that had been placed upon it. On the verge of death
column5: Sivir watched as a stone serpent came to life before her eyes
column6: searing Cassiopeia's skin with venom. The last thing the sellsword heard before her senses dimmed were the roars of maddened gods
column7: unleashed from the tomb to walk the earth once more…

column1: But fate
column2: it seemed
column3: was not yet done with Sivir.

column1: Unknown to her
column2: she carried the last trace of an ancient
column3: royal bloodline in her veins. She awoke to find herself tended by none other than Azir—the last ruler of the empire
column4: who had been denied his rite of Ascension and passed into legend. Her spilled blood had reawakened his spirit after almost three thousand years
column5: completing the ritual and imbuing him with all the celestial power of a god-emperor. There
column6: in the Oasis of the Dawn
column7: he used the healing waters of that sacred pool to miraculously undo Sivir’s mortal wound.

column1: She had heard tales of Azir and his prophesied return
column2: and always thought only fools could believe in such fantasy… and yet she could not deny what was unfolding before her very eyes.The earth split
column3: and great plumes of dust whirled into the air as the ancient city of Shurima rose from its grave
column4: crowned by an enormous golden disc that shone with the heavenly rays of the sun. Shaken to her very core
column5: Sivir fled with the Chalicar on her back.

column1: While she would have liked nothing more than to return to her former life
column2: she instead found herself caught up in the struggles of powers greater than most mortals could comprehend. At the city of Vekaura
column3: she crossed paths with another Ascended being—the freed magus Xerath
column4: now seeking to end Azir’s bloodline for good—but with the help of the scholar Nasus and a young stoneweaver named Taliyah
column5: Sivir survived once more.

column1: The time has now come when she must choose a path
column2: either embracing the destiny she has been given
column3: or forging her own amid the shifting sands of Shurima.

column1: 33;Rammus;the Armordillo;King Rammus;Chrome Rammus;Molten Rammus;Freljord Rammus;Ninja Rammus;Full Metal Rammus;Guardian of the Sands Rammus;Sweeper Rammus;Hextech Rammus;Astronaut Rammus;;;;;;Powerball can be used as an effective escape mechanism.;Using taunt on a champion by your tower can cause the tower to attack your enemy.;Tremors and Defensive Ball Curl can be used late in the game to obliterate towers. Idolized by many
column2: dismissed by some
column3: mystifying to all
column4: the curious being
column5: Rammus
column6: is an enigma. Protected by a spiked shell
column7: Rammus inspires increasingly disparate theories on his origin wherever he goes - from demigod
column8: to sacred oracle
column9: to a mere beast transformed by magic. Whatever the truth may be
column10: Rammus keeps his own counsel and stops for no one as he roams the desert.

column1: Some believe Rammus is an Ascended being
column2: an ancient god amongst men who rolls to Shurima’s aid as an armored guardian in its times of need. Superstitious folk swear he is a harbinger of change
column3: appearing when the land is on the verge of a great shift in power. Others speculate he is the last of a dying species that roamed the land before the Rune Wars sundered the desert with uncontrolled magic.

column1: With so many rumors of great power
column2: magic
column3: and mystery surrounding him
column4: Rammus compels many Shurimans to seek his wisdom. Soothsayers
column5: priests
column6: and deranged lunatics alike claim to know where Rammus dwells
column7: but the Armordillo has proved elusive. Despite this
column8: proof of his presence predates living memory
column9: with crumbling mosaics depicting his image on the most ancient walls of Shuriman ruins. His likeness adorns colossal stone monuments made in the early days of Ascension
column10: leading some to believe he is no less than an immortal demigod. Skeptics often point to a simpler explanation: that Rammus is just one of many such creatures.

column1: It is said that he appears only to worthy pilgrims in great need of his aid
column2: and those blessed by his presence experience great turning points. After the Armordillo rescued the heir to a vast kingdom from a terrible fire
column3: the man renounced his position to become a goat farmer. An elderly mason was inspired by a profound
column4: yet brief conversation with Rammus
column5: and constructed an enormous marketplace which became the bustling heart of Nashramae.

column1: Knowing Rammus’s guidance can pave an enlightened path
column2: devout believers perform elaborate rituals designed to attract the favor of their deity. Disciples of the cult devoted to Rammus demonstrate their unwavering faith in a yearly ceremony by imitating his famous roll and somersaulting through the city in droves. Every year
column3: thousands of Shurimans trek through the most treacherous and remote corners of the desert on a quest to find Rammus
column4: for many teachings indicate he will answer a single question of those he finds deserving
column5: if they are able to find him. Knowing his enthusiasm for desert treats
column6: the pilgrims arm themselves with offerings thought to attract his blessing
column7: packing their mules with flasks of sweet goat’s milk
column8: chests filled with colonies of ants sealed in wax
column9: and jars of honeycombs. Many never return from the deep desert
column10: and fewer still with stories of the demigod
column11: though travelers describe waking to find their packs mysteriously emptied of all edible provisions.

column1: Whether he is truly a wise oracle
column2: Ascended deity
column3: or a mighty beast
column4: Rammus is known for his miraculous feats of endurance. He entered the impenetrable Fortress of Siram
column5: an imposing bastion designed by a crazed sorcerer. The structure was said to contain untold magical horrors - fearsome beasts mutated beyond recognition
column6: corridors wreathed in flames
column7: impenetrable tunnels guarded by shadow demons. Not an hour had passed when the enormous fortress collapsed in a plume of dust
column8: and Rammus was seen rolling away. None knew why Rammus entered the darkened gate
column9: nor what secrets he learned within the basalt walls of the fortress. In the year of the great flood he crossed the vast lake of Imalli in just two days
column10: and dug many miles deep to destroy a giant anthill and kill its queen
column11: whose daughters had devastated the nearby farmland.

column1: Sometimes he appears as a benevolent hero. When invading Noxian warbands attacked a Northern Shuriman settlement
column2: disparate tribes banded together to defend the territory beneath the Temple of the Ascended. They were no match for the invaders in size or skill
column3: and the battle was all but lost when Rammus entered the fray. Each side was so shocked to see the elusive creature that fighting halted completely as they watched him roll between them. As Rammus passed the towering temple
column4: the foundations of the building shook
column5: and enormous stone blocks toppled onto the invading army
column6: crushing many of its warriors. Now outnumbered
column7: the army retreated to elated cheers from the Shurimans. While many swear Rammus saved the town out of love for Shurima
column8: others argue he was merely defending the territory in which his favorite cactus flowers grew. At least one tribesman claims Rammus was simply sleeprolling and had no intention of taking down a temple.

column1: Whatever the truth
column2: stories of Rammus are treasured by the people of Shurima. Any Shuriman child can list a dozen theories on the question of his origin
column3: half of which they likely invented on the spot. Tales of the Armordillo have only increased with the rise of Ancient Shurima
column4: as they did just before its fall
column5: giving way to a belief that his presence heralds darker times to come.

column1: But how can such a benevolent
column2: epicurean soul herald an age of destruction?

column1: 96;Kog'Maw;the Mouth of the Abyss;Caterpillar Kog'Maw;Sonoran Kog'Maw;Monarch Kog'Maw;Reindeer Kog'Maw;Lion Dance Kog'Maw;Deep Sea Kog'Maw;Jurassic Kog'Maw;Battlecast Kog'Maw;Pug'Maw;Hextech Kog'Maw;Arcanist Kog'Maw;Bee'Maw;;;;Kog'Maw can outrange most champions with his Bio-Arcane Barrage ability.;Use Void Ooze to set up a perfect Living Artillery.;Make the most out of your Icathian Surprise.;;;Kog'Maw doesn't have a good escape ability, so he is especially prone to ganks.;Run away from Kog'Maw after he dies!!!!;The range on Living Artillery increases each rank.;Bio-Arcane Barrage allows Kog'Maw to kill Baron Nashor extremely early. Additionally, multiple Living Artilleries in a short period of time cause them to cost additional Mana.;Icathian Surprise;4 seconds after dying, Kogmaw explodes, dealing true damage to surrounding enemies.;
When the prophet Malzahar was reborn in Icathia
column2: he was led there by an ominous voice which thereafter anchored itself to his psyche. From within
column3: this voice bestowed upon him terrible purpose
column4: and though Malzahar was no longer tormented by its call
column5: the voice did not cease its unrelenting summons. This baleful beacon's gentle flicker - now fastened to Runeterra - drew forth a putrid beast that ambled across a threshold it did not understand
column6: widening a fissure between the spaces which were never meant to meet. There amongst the haunting ruins of Icathia
column7: Kog'Maw manifested in Valoran with unsettling curiosity. The spark which led him to Runeterra teased him still
column8: urging him gently towards Malzahar. It also encouraged him to familiarize himself with his new environment
column9: to the stark horror of everything he encountered on his journey.

column1: The enchanting colors and aromas of Runeterra intoxicated Kog'Maw
column2: and he explored the fruits of the strange world the only way he knew how: by devouring them. At first he sampled only the wild flora and fauna he happened across. As he traversed the parched Tempest Flats
column3: however
column4: he came upon a tribe of nomads. Seemingly unhampered by conventional rules of physics
column5: Kog'Maw consumed every nomad and any obstacles they put in his way
column6: amounting to many times his own mass and volume. The most composed of his victims may have had time to wonder if this was due to the caustic enzymes which stung the ground as they dripped from his gaping mouth
column7: although such musings were abruptly concluded. Even this feeding frenzy did nothing to satiate Kog'Maw's appetite. His swathe of destruction continues still as he is inexorably drawn towards Malzahar. What happens when he finds him is anyone's guess.

Maokai is a rageful
column2: towering treant who fights the unnatural horrors of the Shadow Isles. He was twisted into a force of vengeance after a magical cataclysm destroyed his home
column3: surviving undeath only through the waters of life infused within his heartwood. Once a peaceful nature spirit
column4: Maokai now furiously battles to banish the scourge of unlife from the Shadow Isles and restore his home to its former beauty.

column1: Long before living memory
column2: a chain of islands erupted from deep beneath the ocean tides as blank slates of rock and clay. With its creation
column3: the nature spirit Maokai was born. He took the form of a treant
column4: with his tall body covered in bark and long limbs resembling branches. Maokai felt the profound loneliness of the land and its potential for teeming growth. He wandered from island to island in search of signs of life
column5: growing ever more forlorn in his solitude.

column1: On a hilly isle covered in soft
column2: rich soil
column3: Maokai sensed a boundless energy radiating from deep beneath the ground. He plunged his great roots downward until they reached a spring of magical
column4: life-giving water and drank deeply. From this potent liquid
column5: he grew hundreds of saplings and planted them across the islands.

column1: Soon the land was shawled with verdant forests
column2: groves of towering virenpine
column3: and tangled woods
column4: all steeped in wondrous magic. Magnificent skytrees with expansive canopies and thickly winding roots covered the isles with lush green foliage. Nature spirits were drawn to the lavish vegetation
column5: and animals reveled in the fertile greenery.

column1: When humans eventually came to the islands
column2: they too thrived in the land’s abundance and formed an enlightened society of scholars devoted to studying the world’s mysteries. Though Maokai was wary of their presence
column3: he saw how they respected the sanctity of the land. Sensing the deep magic within the woods
column4: the humans built their homes in areas not heavily forested
column5: to avoid disturbing any nature spirits. Maokai occasionally revealed himself directly to those he trusted and blessed them with knowledge of the verdant isles
column6: even its greatest gift – the underground spring that could heal mortal wounds.

column1: Centuries passed
column2: and Maokai lived in idyllic contentment until a fleet of soldiers from across the sea beached upon the shores of the isles. Maokai sensed something was terribly wrong. Their grief-maddened king bore the corpse of his queen and in hopes of reviving her
column3: bathed her decayed flesh in the healing waters. Reanimated as a rotting corpse
column4: the queen begged to return to death. The king sought to reverse what he had done
column5: unwittingly casting a terrible curse upon the land.

column1: From leagues away
column2: Maokai felt the first ripples of the disaster that would soon devastate the isles. He sensed a horrific force gathering beneath the soil
column3: and a bitter chill washed over him.

column1: As the ruination spread
column2: Maokai desperately plunged his roots deep into the ground and drank of the healing waters
column3: saturating every fiber of his being with their magic. Before the cursed water reached him
column4: Maokai withdrew his roots
column5: severing all connection to the pool. He howled in rage as the sacred reservoir he had entrusted to men was fully corrupted – the spiraling coils churning underwater until nothing pure remained.

column1: Moments later
column2: the mists surrounding the islands blackened and spread over the land
column3: trapping all living things in an unnatural state between life and death. Maokai watched in helpless agony as all he knew – plants
column4: nature spirits
column5: animals
column6: and humans alike – twisted into wretched shades. His fury grew; the great beauty he had cultivated from tiny saplings fell to ruin in an instant at the careless hand of man.

column1: The enervating mist coiled around Maokai
column2: and he wept as the bright flowers adorning his shoulders crumbled and fell to dust. His body shuddered and contorted into a mass of gnarled roots and tangled branches as the mist leached life from him. But Maokai’s heartwood was saturated with the precious waters of life
column3: saving him from the terrible fate of undeath.

column1: As grotesque wraiths and horrific abominations flooded the land
column2: Maokai was overcome by a host of lifeless men. He struck the spirits with his branchlike limbs in manic violence
column3: realizing the force of his blows could shatter them to dust. Maokai shuddered with revulsion: he had never killed before. He flew at the breathless shapes in a frenzy
column4: but hundreds more overwhelmed him
column5: and eventually he was forced to retreat.

column1: With his home all but decimated and his companions turned to deathless horrors
column2: Maokai was tempted to try and escape the nightmare of the isles. But from deep within his twisted form
column3: he felt the sacred waters giving him life. He had survived the Ruination by carrying the very heart of the islands within him
column4: and he would not abandon his home now. As the Blessed Isles’ first nature spirit
column5: he would remain and fight for the soul of the land.

column1: Though surrounded by endless hosts of malicious foes and darkening mist
column2: Maokai fights with furious vengeance to conquer the evil that plagues the isles. His only pleasure comes from dealing savage violence to the soulless wraiths who roam his land.

column1: Some days
column2: Maokai subdues the mist and its deathless spirits
column3: breaking their hold on a grove of trees or a small thicket. Though new life has not bloomed in such cursed soil for an age
column4: Maokai strives to carve havens
column5: however temporary
column6: free from regret and decay.

column1: So long as Maokai continues to fight
column2: hope remains
column3: for steeped within his heartwood are the uncorrupted waters of life
column4: the last remaining chance of restoring the isles. If the land returns to its joyous state
column5: Maokai
column6: too
column7: will shed his twisted form. The nature spirit brought life to these isles long ago
column8: and he refuses to rest until the isles bloom once more.

column1:
131;Diana;Scorn of the Moon;Dark Valkyrie Diana;Lunar Goddess Diana;Infernal Diana;Blood Moon Diana;Dark Waters Diana;Dragonslayer Diana;Battle Queen Diana;Battle Queen Diana Prestige Edition;Sentinel Diana;;;;;;;Landing Crescent Strike is critically important, but don't be afraid to miss. The cooldown is short and the mana cost is low.;Consider when to cast Lunar Rush without Moonlight and when to wait for another Crescent Strike.;Use Moonfall and Lunar Rush to stay on targets and activate Moonsilver Blade for extra damage.;;;Dodge Crescent Strike, or move to safety if you are affected by Moonlight.;Pale Cascade orbs only last a few seconds. Avoid Diana and engage her after the shield dissipates.;Diana can play very aggressively if she uses Lunar Rush without Moonlight, but you can punish her by slowing or stunning her when she has no way to get back into position.;;Fighter;Mage;Mana;7;6;8;4;570.0;95;375.0;25.0;345;31;3.1;32.0;1.25;150;6.5;0.85;8.0;0.8;57.0;3.0;2.25;0.625;Crescent Strike;Unleashes a bolt of lunar energy in an arc dealing magic damage.

Afflicts enemies struck with Moonlight, revealing them if they are not stealthed for 3 seconds.;Pale Cascade;Diana creates three orbiting spheres that detonate on contact with enemies to deal damage in an area. She also gains a temporary shield that absorbs damage. If her third sphere detonates, the shield gains additional strength.;Lunar Rush;Becomes the living embodiment of the vengeful moon, dashing to an enemy and dealing magic damage.

Lunar Rush has no cooldown when used to dash to an enemy afflicted with Moonlight. All other enemies will have the Moonlight debuff removed regardless of whether they were the target of Lunar Rush.;Moonfall;Diana reveals and draws in all nearby enemies and slows them.

If Diana pulls in one or more enemy champions, the moonlight crashes down onto her after a short delay, dealing magic damage in an area around her, increased for each target beyond the first pulled.;Moonsilver Blade;Every third strike cleaves nearby enemies for an additional magic damage. After casting a spell, Diana gains Attack Speed for her next 3 attacks.;
Bearing her crescent moonblade
column2: Diana fights as a warrior of the Lunari
column3: a faith all but quashed in the lands around Mount Targon. Clad in shimmering armor the color of winter snow at night
column4: she is a living embodiment of the silver moon’s power. Imbued with the essence of an Aspect from beyond Targon’s towering summit
column5: Diana is no longer wholly human
column6: and struggles to divine her power and purpose in this world.

column1: Diana was born as her mother and father sheltered from a storm on the unforgiving slopes of Mount Targon. They had travelled from a distant land
column2: drawn by dreams of a mountain they had never seen and the promise of revelation. Exhaustion and blinding stormwinds overwhelmed them on the eastern slopes of the mountain
column3: and there
column4: beneath cold
column5: pitiless moonlight
column6: Diana came into the world as her mother breathed her last.

column1: Hunters from the nearby Solari Temple found her the next day as the storm abated and the sun reached its zenith
column2: wrapped in bearskin and cradled in the arms of her dead father. They brought her to the temple
column3: where the foundling child was presented to the sun and named Diana. The girl with the sable hair was raised as one of the Solari
column4: a faith that dominated the lands around Mount Targon. Diana became an initiate
column5: and was raised to venerate the sun in all its aspects. She learned the legends of the sun and trained every day with the Ra-Horak
column6: the warrior templars of the Solari.

column1: The Solari elders taught that all life came from the sun
column2: and that the light of the moon was false
column3: offering no nourishment and crafting shadows in which only creatures of darkness found succor. Yet Diana found moonlight entrancing and beautiful in a way the harsh sun glaring down the mountain could never match. Every night the young girl would wake from dreams of climbing the mountain to sneak from the initiates’ dormitories to pick night-blooming flowers and watch freshwater springs turn silver in the moonlight.

column1: As the years went by
column2: Diana found herself ever at odds with the elders and their teachings. She couldn’t help but question all she was told
column3: always suspecting there was more that went unsaid in every teaching
column4: as though what she was being taught was willfully incomplete. As she grew
column5: Diana’s sense of isolation only became stronger as childhood friends distanced themselves from the mordant
column6: questioning girl who never quite fit in. At night
column7: watching the silver moon rise over the impossibly distant summit
column8: she felt more and more like an outcast. The urge to climb the mountain’s flanks was like an itch that could never be scratched
column9: but everything she had been taught since birth told her the mountain would claim more than just her life should she ever try. Only the most worthy and heroic dared make such an ascent. With every passing day
column10: Diana felt more alone and more certain that some vital aspect of her life remained unfulfilled.

column1: Her first clue as to what that might be came when she was sweeping the temple library as punishment for arguing with one of her elders. A glint of light behind a sagging bookcase drew Diana’s eyes
column2: and upon investigation
column3: she discovered the partially burned pages of an ancient manuscript. Diana took the pages and read them beneath the full moon that very night
column4: and what she read unlocked a door into her soul.

column1: Diana learned of an all-but-extinct group known as the Lunari
column2: whose faith saw the moon as a source of life and balance. From what Diana could glean from the fragmentary texts
column3: the Lunari spoke of the eternal cycle — night and day
column4: sun and moon — as essential for universal harmony. This was a revelation to the girl with the sable hair
column5: and as she looked beyond the moonlit temple walls
column6: she saw an elderly woman wrapped in a bearskin cloak trudging up the far path that eventually led to the mountain’s summit. The woman’s steps were faltering and she leaned on a carved staff of willow to remain upright. She saw Diana and called for help
column7: saying that she had to reach the top of the mountain before morning — an ambition Diana knew was utterly impossible.

column1: Diana’s desire to help the woman and climb the mountain warred with everything the Solari taught. The mountain was for the worthy
column2: and Diana had never felt worthy of anything. Again the woman asked for her help
column3: and this time Diana did not hesitate. She scrambled over the walls and took the woman’s arm
column4: leading her up the mountain
column5: amazed someone so aged had even made it this far. They climbed for hours
column6: above the clouds and into the chill air where the moon and stars glittered like diamonds. Despite her age
column7: the woman kept climbing
column8: urging Diana onwards when she stumbled or when the air grew thin and cold.

column1: As the night wore on
column2: Diana lost track of time as the stars wheeled overhead and all but the mountain faded from view. Together
column3: Diana and the woman climbed ever upwards and each time her steps faltered
column4: she drew strength from the pale glow of the moon. Eventually Diana fell to her knees
column5: exhausted and weary beyond imagining
column6: her entire body strained to the limits of exhaustion. When Diana looked up
column7: it was to see that somehow they had reached the mountaintop
column8: a feat that should not have been possible in a single night. The summit was wreathed in cascades of spectral illumination
column9: veils of brilliant light
column10: spirals of vivid color and the glimmering ghost of a vast city of silver and gold hovering in the air.

column1: She searched for her companion
column2: but the woman was nowhere to be seen — only the bearskin cloak mantling Diana’s shoulders suggested she had existed at all. Looking into the light
column3: Diana saw the promise of the emptiness within her being filled
column4: of acceptance and the chance to be part of something greater than she could ever imagine. This was what Diana had sought all her life without truly knowing it
column5: and fresh vitality flowed through her limbs as she rose to her feet. She took a hesitant step towards the incredible vista
column6: her resolve growing stronger with every breath.

column1: The light surged and Diana screamed as it poured into her
column2: a union with something vast and inhuman
column3: impossibly ancient and powerful. The sensation was painful
column4: but also joyous - a moment or an eternity that was both revelatory and hallucinatory. When the light faded
column5: the sense of loss was an ache like nothing she had known before.

column1: Diana stumbled down the mountain in a fugue state
column2: oblivious to her surroundings
column3: until she found herself before a cleft in the mountainside; a cave mouth that would have been invisible but for the moonlight shadows. Cold and needing shelter for the night
column4: Diana sought refuge within the cave. Inside
column5: the narrow cleft widened into the crumbling ruin of what might once have been a temple or vast audience chamber. Its crumbling walls were painted in faded frescoes depicting warriors of silver and gold fighting back to back against an unending host of grotesque monsters as the sky rained comets of searing light.

column1: At the center of the chamber stood a crescent sword and a suit of armor unlike any other; a mail shirt of spun silver rings and wondrously crafted warplate of polished steel. Reflected in the gleam of the armor
column2: Diana saw her once sable hair was now purest white
column3: and a rune shone on her forehead with incandescent light. She recognized the symbol so exquisitely etched into the plates of the armor; the same symbol depicted in the pages of the burned manuscript she had found in the library. This was Diana’s moment of truth. She could turn away from this destiny or choose to embrace it.

column1: Diana reached out
column2: and as her fingers touched the cold steel of the armor
column3: her mind exploded with images of lives she had never lived
column4: memories she had never experienced and sensations she had never known. Scraps of ancient history raged like a blizzard in her mind; secret knowledge she but dimly grasped and innumerable futures scattered like wind-blown dust.

column1: When the visions faded
column2: Diana saw she was now fully clad in the silver warplate
column3: armor that fitted her as though wrought especially for her. Her mind was still afire with newly-acquired knowledge
column4: but much of it remained frustratingly out of reach
column5: like a picture half in shadow
column6: half in light. She was still Diana
column7: but she was also something more
column8: something eternal. Feeling vindicated with this new knowledge
column9: Diana left the mountain cave and made her way unerringly towards the Solari Temple
column10: knowing she had to tell the elders what she had learned.

column1: She was met at the temple gates by Leona
column2: the master of the Ra-Horak and the Solari’s greatest warrior. Diana was brought before the temple elders
column3: who listened with mounting horror as she told of what she had learned of the Lunari. When she had finished her tale
column4: the elders immediately denounced her as a heretic
column5: a blasphemer and peddler of false gods. For such a heinous crime
column6: only one punishment could suffice; death.

column1: Diana was appalled. How could the elders reject what was so patently true? How could they turn their back on revelations brought from the very summit of the holy mountain? Her fury built at their willful blindness
column2: and blazing orbs of silver fire spun in the air around her. With a scream of rage-fueled frustration
column3: Diana’s sword swept out
column4: and where it struck
column5: silver fire burned with killing light. Again and again
column6: Diana lashed out and when her fury ebbed
column7: she saw the carnage she had unleashed. The elders were dead and Leona lay on her back
column8: her armor smoking as though fresh from the forge. Appalled at what she had done
column9: Diana fled the site of the massacre
column10: escaping into the wilds of Mount Targon as the Solari reeled from the savagery of her attack.

column1: Hunted by the warriors of the Ra-Horak
column2: Diana now seeks to piece together the fragmentary memories of the Lunari hidden within her mind. Driven by half-remembered truths and glimpses of ancient knowledge
column3: Diana has only one truth to cling to — that the Lunari and the Solari need not be foes
column4: that there is a greater destiny for her than that of a simple warrior. What her destiny might be is unknown
column5: but Diana will find it
column6: whatever the cost.

column1: 76;Nidalee;the Bestial Huntress;Snow Bunny Nidalee;Leopard Nidalee;French Maid Nidalee;Pharaoh Nidalee;Bewitching Nidalee;Headhunter Nidalee;Warring Kingdoms Nidalee;Challenger Nidalee;Super Galaxy Nidalee;Dawnbringer Nidalee;Cosmic Huntress Nidalee;DWG Nidalee;;;;Use brush to your advantage! Moving in and out of brush can heavily alter your effectiveness in battle.;Start team fights by harassing with your Javelin Toss, and then switch to cougar form to chase down Hunted targets.;Bushwhack traps deal damage based on their victim's current Health. Set them up in your team's backline before fights break out during sieges to help your team deal damage to the enemy frontline.;;;Nidalee's Hunt debuff is only applied with Javelin Toss and Bushwhack. Avoiding being hit by these abilities will impair her ability to deal follow-up damage.;Nidalee's Javelin Toss deals more damage the farther she is. If she is far away, it's imperative to dodge it.;Nidalee's Takedown deals extreme damage to Hunted targets, but she has to get close to use it. Save your crowd control or defensive abilities for when she goes in for the kill.;;Assassin;Mage;Mana;5;4;7;8;570.0;95;295.0;45.0;335;28;3.5;30.0;0.5;525;6.0;0.6;6.0;0.8;58.0;3.5;3.22;0.638;Javelin Toss / Takedown;In human form, Nidalee throws a spiked javelin at her target that gains damage as it flies.  As a cougar, her next attack will attempt to fatally wound her target, dealing more damage the less life they have.;Bushwhack / Pounce;In human form, Nidalee lays a trap for unwary opponents that, when sprung, damages and reveals its target. As a cougar, she jumps in a direction, dealing damage in an area where she lands.;Primal Surge / Swipe;In human form, Nidalee channels the spirit of the cougar to heal her allies and imbue them with Attack Speed for a short duration. As a cougar, she claws in a direction, dealing damage to enemies in front of her.;Aspect Of The Cougar;Nidalee transforms into a cougar, gaining new abilities.;Prowl;Moving through brush increases Nidalee's Movement Speed by 10% for 2 seconds, increased to 30% toward visible enemy champions within 1400 range.Hitting champions or monsters with Javelin Toss or Bushwhack triggers a Hunt, granting True Sight of them for 4 seconds. During this time, Nidalee gains 10% Movement Speed (increased to 30% toward the Hunted target) and her Takedown and Pounce are enhanced against them.;
Raised in the deepest jungle
column2: Nidalee is a master tracker who can shapeshift into a ferocious cougar at will. Neither wholly woman nor beast
column3: she viciously defends her territory from any and all trespassers
column4: with carefully placed traps and deft spear throws. She cripples her quarry before pouncing on them in feline form—the lucky few who survive tell tales of a wild woman with razor-sharp instincts
column5: and even sharper claws...

column1: Far
column2: far from the harsh deserts of the Great Sai
column3: over savanna plains and mountain steppes
column4: lie the great eastern jungles of Shurima. Swathed in mystery
column5: they are home to wild
column6: fantastical beasts
column7: and dense forests blooming with life. But while there is overwhelming beauty to be found there
column8: danger and death lurk nearby in equal measure.

column1: No one knows how Nidalee came to be alone in the heart of the jungle. Dressed in little more than rags
column2: the infant child sat alone on the leafy soil
column3: her cries echoing between the trees.

column1: Undoubtedly
column2: that was what brought the cougars.

column1: A mother
column2: roaming with her cubs
column3: approached the abandoned girl
column4: perhaps catching the scent of something familiar… or at least something worth saving. She accepted Nidalee without hesitation
column5: half leading
column6: half dragging her back to their den.

column1: The girl lived in the company of beasts
column2: scrapping and playing alongside her new siblings
column3: with no connection to her own kind
column4: or mortal society at large. The cougars raised Nidalee as a creature of the forest
column5: and as the years passed she grew into a capable huntress—but where her guardians favored tooth and claw
column6: Nidalee learned to take advantage of her surroundings. She worked up healing salves from honeyfruit
column7: sought out curiously glowing flowers to illuminate the night
column8: and even used explosive seeds to send territorial murk wolves flying.

column1: Even so
column2: at times Nidalee began to lose control of her own body. Without warning
column3: her hands and feet flickered between human and bestial forms. Occasionally she would stumble from the den
column4: delirious with fever
column5: following the hazy silhouettes of two strange figures—they whispered after her
column6: their voices jumbled but sweet. They brought Nidalee a sense of comfort and warmth
column7: even though the cougars had taught her to be wary of outsiders.

column1: And with good cause.
It was at the height of the summer rains when she first encountered the Kiilash. These vastayan hunters ranged into the forests every season in search of prestigious kills
column2: and trophies to show their prowess. Nidalee's adopted mother tried to chase them away
column3: but fell
column4: wounded by their blades and spears.

column1: But before the Kiilash could finish the ageing cougar
column2: Nidalee lunged from the undergrowth
column3: howling with grief and rage. Something had changed. She felt the spirit of the jungle cats within her
column4: and was transformed like never before. Lashing out as a beast
column5: she brought down the nearest hunter with her razor-sharp claws
column6: before whirling around in human form once more to snatch up his spear. The other Kiilash growled and hissed at this sight
column7: and to her surprise Nidalee found she understood some of their speech.

column1: They cursed her
column2: invoking the name of their Vastayashai'rei ancestors as they retreated from the fight
column3: empty-handed.

column1: Hurling the spear aside
column2: Nidalee held the dying cougar close. Her siblings approached warily
column3: but with the passing of their mother they came to accept this shapechanger as their new leader—from that day forth
column4: she vowed to defend her adopted home against any who would seek to plunder it.

column1: Over time
column2: she learned to better control her powers
column3: eventually shifting between both forms with ease. Perhaps it was a yearning to find others of her kind that led her to the chameleon-like wanderer Neeko
column4: but the two became inseparable for a time. Nidalee delighted in mentoring her inquisitive new companion
column5: and they reveled in exploring the jungle's numerous wonders together
column6: before Neeko eventually departed to follow her own destiny beyond Shurima's shores.

column1: Even now
column2: the dense forests remain the last truly untamed wilderness in the known world
column3: and something of an enigma even to Nidalee. Still
column4: in rare
column5: quiet moments
column6: the huntress finds herself dwelling on her own origins—and her encounter with the Kiilash—and whether she will learn the truth behind any of it…

column1: 5;Xin Zhao;the Seneschal of Demacia;Commando Xin Zhao;Imperial Xin Zhao;Viscero Xin Zhao;Winged Hussar Xin Zhao;Warring Kingdoms Xin Zhao;Secret Agent Xin Zhao;Dragonslayer Xin Zhao;Cosmic Defender Xin Zhao;Marauder Xin Zhao;;;;;;;Xin Zhao is a great initiator to combat. Lead the front to start a fight and use your ultimate to do the most damage possible.;Try to position yourself so your ultimate's knockback is most effective.;;;;Xin Zhao is a powerful initiator with both his charge and ultimate dealing damage to all units around him. Try having your team stay spread out until he's used his ultimate.;Xin Zhao relies heavily on his Three Talon Strikes for damage and cooldown resets, so preventing him from finishing his combo will have a dramatic effect.;;;Fighter;Assassin;Mana;8;6;3;2;570.0;92;274.0;55.0;345;35;3.5;32.0;1.25;175;8.0;0.7;7.26;0.45;63.0;3.0;3.5;0.645;Three Talon Strike;Xin Zhao's next 3 standard attacks deal increased damage with the third attack knocking an opponent into the air.;Wind Becomes Lightning;Xin Zhao slashes in front of himself with his spear, then thrusts it forward, slowing affected enemies and marking them as Challenged.;Audacious Charge;Xin Zhao charges to an enemy, gaining increased Attack Speed and dealing damage to all enemies in the area, slowing them briefly. Audacious Charge gains increased range against Challenged targets.;Crescent Guard;Xin Zhao challenges an enemy he damaged recently. Xin Zhao deals damage to nearby enemies based on their current Health and knocks non-challenged targets back, becoming impervious to damage dealt by champions outside of the circle created.;Determination;Every third attack deals bonus damage and heals Xin Zhao.;
Xin Zhao is a resolute warrior loyal to the royal family of Demacia. Once condemned to the fighting pits of Noxus
column2: he survived countless gladiatorial bouts. It was not until he faced the forces of King Jarvan III in battle that he decided to relinquish his past life
column3: in favor of serving what he saw as a more honorable cause. Armed with his favored three-talon spear
column4: Xin Zhao now fights for his adopted kingdom
column5: audaciously challenging any foe
column6: no matter the odds.

column1: Rumored to have never lost in one-on-one combat
column2: Xin Zhao spent much of his life fighting an uphill battle. Some of his earliest memories are of the Viscero
column3: an Ionian fishing boat he served aboard off the coast of Raikkon. A diligent cabin boy
column4: he obeyed his elders’ every request—from cleaning grimy decks to fixing tangled nets—and enjoyed a peaceful existence… until the day they unknowingly ventured too deep into foreign waters.

column1: A pair of privateer ships from Noxus chased down the smaller vessel. Their commander cited the glory of the empire as he boarded
column2: claiming the Viscero and its crew as his rightful property. They were mostly ageing fishermen
column3: unfit for military service
column4: but they would be taken back to Noxian territory regardless.

column1: After enduring a tough journey across the open ocean
column2: Xin Zhao found himself in a strange new land. There was no delicate beauty in the waters here
column3: no magic in the trees. Imposing gateways and fortified stone walls unlike anything he had ever seen lined the streets
column4: and the people were crammed into every available inch of space. He learned this was the capital of Noxus
column5: and it was from here that a man known as “Darkwill” ruled the vast empire. Separated from the rest of the Viscero’s crew
column6: and with no means of returning home
column7: Xin Zhao entered the service of the man who had taken him prisoner.

column1: His skill with a spear did not go unnoticed
column2: and soon he was promised a better life—with meals served on plates—in exchange for his martial prowess. Noxus celebrated strength
column3: and his patron deemed him to be a strong fighter.

column1: Having nothing to lose
column2: the young man accepted. He shed his ragged clothes for crude armor
column3: and entered the Reckoning arenas.

column1: Truly
column2: this was a strange form of entertainment. Mighty warriors
column3: known by even mightier titles
column4: fought each other before ravenous crowds
column5: who cheered for displays of skill and showmanship as often as they did for blood. Xin Zhao
column6: taking the name “Viscero”
column7: was catapulted into success. His bouts soon filled the seats of every arena… and also the pockets of his sponsors. In only a few short years
column8: Viscero became a celebrated name—one that audiences adored
column9: and other Reckoners came to fear.

column1: But this good fortune did not last.
Beyond the distractions of the Reckoner circuit
column2: the empire faced difficult times. Hostile nations encroached upon its territories
column3: provoking rebellion all along the Noxian frontier. It was rumored that Darkwill and his advisors had offered a fortune in gold for the private release of mercenaries
column4: prisoners
column5: and Reckoners alike
column6: to be conscripted into the empire’s warhosts. With little more than a handshake
column7: Xin Zhao and his fellows were bought out
column8: and placed on a transport ship heading west.

column1: Here
column2: at the coastal fortress of Kalstead
column3: the names and reputations of even the most well-known Reckoners counted for little. They were hurled into battle against the elite forces of King Jarvan III of Demacia
column4: who was determined to curb Noxian influence on Valoran… and Xin Zhao quickly learned that war was unlike any arena duel.

column1: While many of the former Reckoners deserted in the face of inevitable defeat
column2: Xin Zhao held his ground
column3: staining his spear with the blood of hundreds. When the king’s Dauntless Vanguard—some of whom were silently impressed by his skill—finally surrounded him
column4: still he refused to run. Xin Zhao stood tall
column5: welcoming his execution.

column1: However
column2: Jarvan thought differently. Unlike the arena crowds
column3: the king of Demacia took no pleasure in needless killing. He granted the defeated Noxians their freedom
column4: if they would swear to leave Kalstead in peace. Surprised by this show of mercy
column5: Xin Zhao thought about what awaited him back in Noxus. He could return to a society where his life had meant little beyond the gold he earned for his patrons… or he could fight for those who embodied the virtues to which he
column6: himself
column7: aspired.

column1: Compelled by honor
column2: he knelt before Jarvan III
column3: pledging himself to the king’s service.

column1: In the decades since
column2: Xin Zhao has proven his loyalty time and again. As a seneschal of the royal household
column3: he acts not only as bodyguard and advisor to his friend and master
column4: but also to the king’s son—the young Prince Jarvan
column5: who will one day inherit the crown. Xin Zhao’s path to becoming a Demacian may have been unusual
column6: and yet he never falters in his commitment to the kingdom and its ideals. This is not from a sense of duty
column7: he reasons
column8: but by choice.

Avoid getting hit to move very fast.;Use Double Up on the furthest enemy minion if enemy champions are hiding in back; it will bounce to them for lots of damage.";Make sure to utilize Love Tap while Strut is on cooldown to maximize the active's availability.;;;Miss Fortune's speed boost is removed if she is damaged by an enemy.;"Miss Fortune is easy to kill if you can reach her; target her first in team fights.";;;Marksman;;Mana;8;2;5;1;570.0;93;300.0;35.0;325;28;3.0;30.0;0.5;550;3.75;0.65;8.04;0.65;52.0;2.7;3.0;0.656;Double Up;Miss Fortune fires a bullet at an enemy
column2: damaging them and a target behind them. Both strikes can also apply Love Tap.;Strut;Miss Fortune passively gains Movement Speed when not attacked. This ability can be activated to grant bonus Attack Speed for a short duration. While it's on cooldown
column3: Love Taps reduce the remaining cooldown of Strut.;Make It Rain;Miss Fortune reveals an area with a flurry of bullets
column4: dealing waves of damage to opponents and slowing them.;Bullet Time;Miss Fortune channels a barrage of bullets into a cone in front of her
column5: dealing large amounts of damage to enemies. Each wave of Bullet Time can critically strike;Love Tap;Miss Fortune deals bonus physical damage whenever she basic attacks a new target.;"

column1: A Bilgewater captain famed for her looks but feared for her ruthlessness
column2: Sarah Fortune paints a stark figure among the hardened criminals of the port city. As a child
column3: she witnessed the reaver king Gangplank murder her family—an act she brutally avenged years later
column4: blowing up his flagship while he was still aboard. Those who underestimate her will face a beguiling and unpredictable opponent… and
column5: likely
column6: a bullet or two in their guts.

column1: Like most who rise to notoriety in the twisting
column2: salt-crusted labyrinth of Bilgewater
column3: Sarah Fortune has no shortage of blood on her hands…

column1: Beloved daughter of the renowned gun-dame Abigale Fortune
column2: Sarah spent much of her happy childhood in the forge of their island settlement just off the coast—learning to file wheel locks
column3: set trigger pulls
column4: and even cast batches of custom pistol shot. Her mother’s skill in crafting firearms was legendary
column5: and her bespoke handguns were to be found in the collections of many a wealthy merchant captain.

column1: But oft-times
column2: they were coveted by those with more meager means
column3: and darker hearts.

column1: One such individual was an up-and-coming Bilgewater reaver
column2: known to his crew as Gangplank. Cocksure and certain of his power
column3: he demanded a pair of Fortune pistols the like of which no other man could hope to possess. A reluctant deal was struck
column4: and a year later to the day
column5: Gangplank returned. With no intention of paying for the work
column6: he had masked his face with a grimy scarf. He was there to take the guns by force.

column1: Abigale had crafted two masterpieces
column2: twin hand cannons of exquisite workmanship and pinpoint lethality—indeed
column3: she declared
column4: too fine for the likes of him. She could see the brutish thug that Gangplank had become. Enraged
column5: he seized the pistols and gunned her down with her own creations before turning them on her husband
column6: and young Sarah too. Then
column7: out of nothing but spite
column8: he set the workshop ablaze and smashed both pistols on the cobblestones
column9: to wipe the Fortune legacy from the face of Runeterra completely.

column1: Sarah awoke to agony. Her wounds were grave
column2: but she managed to crawl from the burning ruins with the remains of the two pistols clutched to her chest. In time
column3: her body healed
column4: but waking nightmares and night terrors would torment her for many years to come.

column1: Even so
column2: she endured. She was determined to have vengeance. She rebuilt her mother’s pistols
column3: and learned all she could of the masked murderer who had since declared himself the new reaver king of Bilgewater
column4: and forced even the most influential ship captains to honor his claim.

column1: No matter. When Sarah faced him again
column2: she would be ready.

column1: Taking a ship to Bilgewater Bay
column2: she killed her first man within minutes of setting foot on the crooked timbers of the quayside—a drunken pirate with a gallon of Myron’s Dark in his belly
column3: and a price on his head. Sarah dragged his corpse to the bounty board officials
column4: before tearing off a dozen more warrants and heading off into the city.

column1: Within a week
column2: every one of them was settled
column3: and those with the misfortune to be hunted by Sarah were either dead or in chains. She quickly earned a reputation in the taverns and gambling dens
column4: becoming known only as “Miss Fortune”. Gangplank would never see her coming. What was one more bounty hunter on the streets of his city?

column1: In the years that followed
column2: tales of Miss Fortune’s exploits spread far and wide
column3: each more fanciful than the last. She drowned the leader of the Silk-Knife Corsairs in a barrel of her own stolen rum. She took the Syren from a captain who learned the hard way what it meant to slip a hand where it wasn’t wanted. She tracked the insane Doxy-Ripper to his lair in the belly of a half-dismembered leviathan down on the slaughter docks
column4: and shot him in the back as he fled.

column1: In spite of all this
column2: Gangplank was far too powerful to confront openly
column3: with the fierce Jagged Hooks crew always at his side—but Miss Fortune knew just killing him would never be enough. Only his abject humiliation
column4: and the burning to ash of all he had stolen
column5: would satisfy the girl who had died on the floor of her mother’s workshop.

column1: And so
column2: little by little
column3: she began to surround herself with a small but loyal cadre of allies that would eventually help her lay her demons to rest.

column1: Miss Fortune risked everything to make her move against Gangplank. Plots within plots saw his ship
column2: the Dead Pool
column3: blown to flaming wreckage in the harbor
column4: and the tyrannical reaver king overthrown. Best of all
column5: everyone in Bilgewater saw him fall. It was everything Sarah could have hoped for
column6: exactly as she’d planned.

column1: And it was over in moments.
With Gangplank gone
column2: the other rival captains quickly descended into fighting amongst themselves for control of the city. What little semblance of law there had been was gone in an instant
column3: with countless innocent civilians caught between the warring crews. Reluctantly
column4: Miss Fortune stepped up—as captain of the Syren
column5: and backed by her own people
column6: she brokered an uneasy truce that has somehow held to this day.

column1: But little is ever really permanent in the port city
column2: and Captain Fortune still finds herself having to impose her own brand of order on every reaver
column3: ganglord
column4: and distant threat that comes her way.

column1: The real battle for Bilgewater has only just begun.
