Iceborn warmother of the Avarosan tribe
column2: Ashe commands the most populous horde in the north. Stoic
column3: intelligent
column4: and idealistic
column5: yet uncomfortable with her role as leader
column6: she taps into the ancestral magics of her lineage to wield a bow of True Ice. With her people’s belief that she is the mythological hero Avarosa reincarnated
column7: Ashe hopes to unify the Freljord once more by retaking their ancient
column8: tribal lands.

column1: Ashe hails from the northern Freljord
column2: where brutal tribal raids and inter-clan warfare are as much a part of the landscape as the scream of the frozen winds
column3: and the unyielding cold of the tundra.

column1: The only child of Grena
column2: the matriarchal chieftain of the tiny Avarosan tribe
column3: Ashe was Iceborn: a member of the warrior caste
column4: gifted with an ancestral connection to the magic of her lands
column5: and the rare ability to wield the power of True Ice. Everyone assumed that Ashe would follow her mother as the tribe's next leader. However
column6: this was never a glory Ashe desired. The grim responsibility of her warlike lineage and extraordinary gifts instead left Ashe feeling isolated
column7: burdened
column8: and alone.

column1: Her only respite was when Sejuani
column2: an Iceborn girl from a sister tribe
column3: would stay with them for the summer hunts around the Ornnkaal Rocks. The girls' friendship defined their childhoods
column4: but was cut short just as they reached their teens. Somehow
column5: Grena had offended Sejuani's grandmother
column6: and the fellowship between their tribes ended suddenly.

column1: Soon after
column2: with her youth fading
column3: Ashe's mother began her lifelong quest for the “Throne of Avarosa”
column4: a supposed hoard of treasures and magical items that she hoped would return her people to greatness.

column1: But Grena’s belief in prophecies and legends led her to take risks
column2: which often left her tribe enfeebled. Finally
column3: during a dangerous and unnecessary raid in another tribe's lands
column4: Grena was killed. Her sudden death left young Ashe on the run
column5: while most of her tribe was wiped out.

column1: Alone
column2: pursued
column3: Ashe followed her mother's last map to a deserted glacier where she found the supposed grave of Avarosa
column4: and her magical bow of True Ice. Ashe used the weapon to avenge her mother's death
column5: then turned west.

column1: Whether it was out of duty or loneliness
column2: Ashe gained a reputation by protecting the many scattered hearthbound tribes she encountered. She spurned the custom of taking thralls
column3: and instead chose to adopt these desperate people as full members of her new tribe
column4: and her fame grew quickly. Soon many began to believe that she did not just carry the weapon of Avarosa—Ashe was the legend herself
column5: reborn and destined to reunite the Freljord.

column1: But tall tales would not feed her followers
column2: and their long march south left the tribe on the verge of starvation. So
column3: Ashe leveraged the myths surrounding her
column4: using them to form alliances with the powerful and land-rich southern tribes
column5: promising to unite them into a nation capable of challenging neighboring kingdoms.

column1: These new alliances brought new dangers
column2: and Ashe quickly found herself at the center of a political feud. A Warmother
column3: as Freljordian tribal leaders are known
column4: was expected to wed
column5: and taking a husband from one of the major tribes would anger the others. Ashe could take several husbands
column6: but this would only bring the conflict to a boil within her own household
column7: and the ensuing bloodshed would shatter the alliances she had fought to build.

column1: Her answer was an impoverished vagabond from a mountain clan that had been nearly wiped out—the warrior Tryndamere. He was neither a spirit-walker nor blessed with any elemental powers
column2: but upon his arrival in Ashe’s new capital
column3: Tryndamere had thrown himself into every dueling ring he could find. He fought with abandon
column4: desperate to prove the destitute survivors of his clan were worthy of adoption by one of the stronger tribes. But even for the Freljord
column5: his brutal fighting style and extraordinary vitality were unsettling
column6: and many suspected he was touched by dark magic. Ignoring this
column7: Ashe offered to adopt his people as her own
column8: if he became her first and only bloodsworn.

column1: Tryndamere accepted reluctantly. Though a political marriage
column2: the attraction they felt for each other was palpable
column3: and slowly a true affection blossomed.

column1: Now
column2: Ashe stands at the head of the largest coalition of Freljordian tribes in many generations. Even so
column3: the unity she would bring rests upon an uneasy peace threatened by internal intrigues
column4: foreign powers
column5: the growing violent horde of the Winter's Claw
column6: and a supposed destiny that Ashe must at least pretend to believe…

Fizz is an amphibious yordle
column2: who dwells among the reefs surrounding Bilgewater. He often retrieves and returns the tithes cast into the sea by superstitious captains
column3: but even the saltiest of sailors know better than to cross him—for many are the tales of those who have underestimated this slippery character. Often mistaken for some manner of capricious ocean spirit
column4: he seems able to command the beasts of the deep
column5: and delights in confounding his allies and enemies alike.

column1: In ages past
column2: the oceans of Runeterra were home to civilizations far older than those of the land. In the depths of what is now the Guardian’s Sea
column3: a great city once stood—it was here that the yordle Fizz made his home. He lived alongside the artisans and warriors of that proud
column4: noble race. Even though he was not one of them
column5: they treated him as an equal
column6: and his playful nature and tall tales of adventures in the open sea made him welcome at any gathering.

column1: But the world was changing. The oceans were growing warmer
column2: emboldening fierce predators to rise up from the deepest trenches. Other settlements had fallen silent
column3: but the rulers of the great city could still not agree on how to deal with the threat. Fizz pledged to roam the seas in search of survivors
column4: or anyone who knew what had happened.

column1: Then
column2: one dark day
column3: the gigalodons came.

column1: These huge dragon-sharks stunned their prey with fell shrieking
column2: and the avenues of the great city were soon clouded red. Thousands died in a matter of hours
column3: the immense bulk of their killers crushing towers and temples in a monstrous feeding frenzy. Scenting blood in the water
column4: Fizz raced back
column5: determined to join the fight and save the city.

column1: He was too late. There was nothing left of the city to save. When the debris finally settled
column2: not a single living creature remained
column3: nor any stone upon another
column4: and the ravenous shoal had moved on. Alone in the cold depths
column5: Fizz sank into mournful despair. As his yordle magic began to fade
column6: he let himself be carried by the currents
column7: drifting in a catatonic torpor
column8: dreaming away the millennia…

column1: It was only chance that reawakened him. A handful of copper coins fell from above
column2: scattered to the seabed in the wake of a huge
column3: wooden fish that swam upon the surface. This was no gigalodon
column4: but Fizz was alarmed nonetheless—he knew little of the world overhead
column5: but surely no fish could survive up there? He ventured up and peered into the salty air for the first time.

column1: There were people
column2: people who lived outside of the water and sailed in wooden fish of all sizes. Fizz found the thought both frightening and exciting
column3: but the curious gifts they cast into the water made it clear that they wanted to be his friends. In time
column4: following their movements to and fro across the oceans
column5: he came to the port city of Bilgewater.

column1: To the inhabitants of that lawless place
column2: this strange and slippery creature quickly became something of a legend—the Tidal Trickster
column3: a spirit of the ocean itself. It is said that he can summon great beasts to do his bidding
column4: hole a ship’s hull with his stone trident
column5: and breathe air or water as it suits him. Many a misbehaving child has been warned on a moonless night: “Go quickly to sleep
column6: or the Trickster will come and feed you to the fishes…”

column1: Fizz is good-natured
column2: but mischievous even for a yordle
column3: and delights in confounding the people of Bilgewater. The most seasoned fishermen know
column4: just as the ocean may rise and fall
column5: the Tidal Trickster is as likely to lead them into windless doldrums as to an easy catch that would fill their nets. Even so
column6: Fizz does not take kindly to the greedy or selfish
column7: and more than one haughty sea captain hoping to make a quick pile of silver has found that her mysterious guide has led her crew not to safety
column8: but to shipwreck.

As unpredictable as he is brutal
column2: the dethroned reaver king known as Gangplank is feared far and wide. Where he goes
column3: death and ruin follow
column4: and such is his infamy and reputation that the merest sight of his black sails on the horizon causes panic among even the hardiest crew.

column1: Having grown rich preying upon the trade routes of the Twelve Seas
column2: Gangplank has made himself many powerful enemies. In Ionia
column3: he incurred the wrath of the deadly Order of Shadow after ransacking the Temple of the Jagged Knife
column4: and it is said that the Grand General of Noxus himself has sworn to see Gangplank torn asunder after the pirate stole the Leviathan
column5: Swain’s personal warship and the pride of the Noxian fleet.

column1: While Gangplank has incurred the wrath of many
column2: none have yet been able to bring him to justice
column3: despite assassins
column4: bounty hunters
column5: and entire armadas being sent after him. He takes grim pleasure in the ever-increasing rewards posted for his head
column6: and makes sure to nail them to the Bounty Board in Bilgewater for all to see whenever he returns to port
column7: his ships heavy with loot.

column1: In recent times
column2: Gangplank has been brought down by the machinations of the bounty hunter Miss Fortune. His ship was destroyed with all of Bilgewater watching
column3: killing his crew and shattering his aura of invincibility. Now that they have seen he is vulnerable
column4: the gangs of Bilgewater have risen up
column5: fighting amongst themselves to claim dominion over the port city.

column1: Despite receiving horrific injuries in the explosion
column2: Gangplank survived. Sporting a multitude of fresh scars
column3: and with a newly crafted metal arm to replace his amputated limb
column4: he is now determined to rebuild his strength
column5: reclaim what he sees as rightfully his – and to ruthlessly punish all those who turned against him.

Prince Jarvan IV comes from a lineage of kings
column2: and is favored to lead Demacia in the next era. Raised to be the paragon of Demacia’s greatest virtues
column3: Jarvan IV often struggles with the heavy expectations placed upon him. On the battlefield
column4: he inspires his troops with his fearsome courage and selfless determination
column5: revealing his true strength as a leader of men.

column1: Though the Demacian ruler is chosen by a high council from a selection of worthy candidates
column2: the last three kings were descendants of the same line. As King Jarvan III’s only child
column3: Jarvan IV was groomed since birth to continue that tradition. His family’s intentions were reflected in all aspects of his life
column4: from his courtly duties to his name. Educated by the finest historical scholars and tutored in the ways of ruling a kingdom
column5: Jarvan IV also studied the techniques of war.

column1: During Jarvan’s combat training
column2: he was often paired against a young warrior named Garen
column3: who was preparing to serve as the next ruler’s Crownguard. Jarvan admired Garen’s sheer fortitude
column4: and Garen
column5: the prince’s quick thinking. The two were soon inseparable.

column1: When Jarvan IV came of age
column2: his father bestowed upon him the honor of serving as a general in the Demacian army. Though Jarvan IV had studied the theories and tactics of warfare
column3: and could win a duel against his swordmaster
column4: he had never stood on the front lines of a battle
column5: much less taken a life.

column1: Determined to prove his worth through victories in battle
column2: Jarvan IV led his troops against bands of Winter’s Claw reavers
column3: warring tribes
column4: and even a coven of rogue mages. Though he commanded his troops to great success
column5: Jarvan was always flanked on all sides by guards sworn to protect him
column6: and felt that his impact as a fighter was often stifled.

column1: When Noxian warbands raided the farmlands near Demacia’s border
column2: Jarvan IV led his troops to defend the nation. He and his men rode for days in the wake of the Noxians. To Jarvan’s horror
column3: the atrocities were far worse than he had anticipated. The Noxians had razed entire townships and slaughtered hundreds of Demacians
column4: with only a handful of injured survivors left to tell the tale.

column1: His officers advised the prince to withdraw and send for reinforcements. But Jarvan was shaken by the faces of the dead
column2: and he could not turn his back on survivors in need. He would protect the wounded while ensuring the enemy forces did not escape without a fight. Besides
column3: he reasoned
column4: a secondary force of Demacian soldiers could not possibly arrive in time to face the Noxians. He was convinced that he had to act now.

column1: Jarvan split his troops
column2: ordering some to remain and care for the injured civilians
column3: while he led the remaining soldiers onward. They ambushed the Noxians during the night
column4: but in the chaos of battle
column5: Jarvan was separated from his guards. He fought fiercely and slew many enemies
column6: but was ultimately overwhelmed. The Noxians took Jarvan IV prisoner
column7: to be paraded through the Immortal Bastion in chains upon reaching Noxus.

column1: As Jarvan was dragged further from Demacia during his weeks of captivity
column2: he was ashamed that the rashness of his decision to pursue the Noxians had led to needless Demacian deaths. Crushed by the loss
column3: he came to believe he no longer deserved to live in Demacia
column4: let alone inherit its throne.

column1: One moonless night
column2: Garen and an intrepid band of soldiers known as the Dauntless Vanguard attacked the Noxian encampment. Though the Demacian warriors could not reach Jarvan
column3: he used the distraction to fight his captors and escape. As he ran
column4: a Noxian soldier shot an arrow into Jarvan’s side
column5: but the young prince persevered and fled into the wilderness.

column1: Jarvan sprinted until he collapsed
column2: hiding in the hollow of a fallen tree and bandaging his wound as best as he could. He lay for days drifting in and out of consciousness
column3: knowing his death must be near. Unsure if he was awake or dreaming
column4: Jarvan would later recall a purple-skinned woman with eyes of fire who carried him to a remote Demacian village. There
column5: he rested under the care of local healers
column6: who treated him with medicinal herbs as they nursed him back to health.

column1: As Jarvan regained his strength
column2: he found solace in the small settlement nestled in the wild hills of outer Demacia. For the first time in his life
column3: he was free from the pressures and demands of his royal duties. He felt at peace in the village that had welcomed him so openly
column4: though he was a stranger. Jarvan also learned that his strange
column5: purple-skinned savior was a fellow newcomer known as Shyvana.

column1: The serenity of village life was disrupted when a monstrous dragon terrorized the nearby communities
column2: burning buildings to cinders and farmlands to ash. Jarvan knew the settlement would not survive a dragon attack
column3: so he led the villagers to a nearby stronghold - Castle Wrenwall.

column1: That night
column2: Jarvan caught Shyvana leaving the compound. She confessed that she was half-dragon
column3: and that the ruinous creature plaguing them was her own mother
column4: Yvva
column5: who resented Shyvana as a blemish on her bloodline. The monster would not stop until Shyvana was dead. Like all Demacians
column6: Jarvan had been raised to distrust the magical beings of the world - but he saw Shyvana’s goodness and strength
column7: and was determined to repay his life-debt to her. Only together could they take down such a fearsome enemy.

column1: With the dragon’s return an ever-present threat
column2: Jarvan trained the Demacian villagers to fight alongside the soldiers of Castle Wrenwall. He chose the ancient petricite ruins to the west as the scene of their battle. The structure had once been a high temple built during the cataclysmic upheaval of the Rune Wars
column3: but now the magic-nullifying stones would serve as their best defense against the dragon. He even tipped their arrows with sharpened petricite
column4: knowing that only by drawing all their efforts together did they have a chance of killing such a mighty beast.

column1: Jarvan and the soldiers hid themselves nearby
column2: while Shyvana stood in the center of the ruined courtyard. Jarvan watched in awe as she transformed into a dragon
column3: roaring plumes of fire into the sky as an open challenge to her mother. Though the villagers backed away in fear
column4: Jarvan steadied their courage
column5: reminding them that Shyvana would help destroy their enemy.

column1: Soon enough
column2: an even more fearsome silhouette blackened the sun
column3: and Yvva
column4: the great dragon
column5: was upon them. On Jarvan’s command
column6: the soldiers loosed dozens of petricite arrows into the dragon’s back
column7: weakening her powers with every strike. The dragon reared up in pain and exhaled streams of flame. Soldiers were charred in their armor
column8: but still more arrows flew and the close confines of the nullifying ruins anchored her to the earth.

column1: Jarvan stood in awe as Shyvana and her mother collided with earthshaking force. The colossal beasts battled in a furious blur until Jarvan could hardly tell them apart
column2: and he held his archers back in fear that he would wound his friend. He despaired as Shyvana collapsed back into her human form with blood streaming from her neck. But she looked her mother in the eyes and
column3: with flaming claws
column4: tore the steaming heart from her breast.

column1: With the threat vanquished
column2: Jarvan IV finally felt worthy of returning home. He had come to understand that true Demacian values were not simply about victory
column3: but about standing together as one
column4: no matter their differences. To reward Shyvana’s bravery
column5: he promised that she would always have a home in his kingdom. But they both knew Demacia as a kingdom remained deeply suspicious of magic
column6: and Shyvana vowed not to reveal her dual nature as she fought at Jarvan’s side. Together they traveled to the capital with the skull of the dragon Yvva in tow.

column1: Though many were thrilled to see their prince return safely
column2: others questioned Jarvan’s judgment in recruiting Shyvana into his guard
column3: and suspicions grew as to why he had not gone to the capital immediately after escaping the Noxians. No matter what King Jarvan III himself thought
column4: outwardly he welcomed his son back into the court. As Jarvan IV resumed his royal duties
column5: he swore to uphold Demacian ideals by building a nation that valued each one of its citizens
column6: uniting them together against whatever threats they faced.

column1:
223;Tahm Kench;The River King;Master Chef Tahm Kench;Urf Kench;Coin Emperor Tahm Kench;Arcana Tahm Kench;;;;;;;;;;;;Your most important function as a support is to keep fragile allies safe. Keep Devour's range and cooldown in mind and position accordingly!;Consider carefully when to use Thick Skin's active. Sometimes shielding early to avoid further damage is good, but sometimes the healing is more beneficial.;;;;When you see Tahm Kench use the shield from Thick Skin, remember that he just opted out of a good deal of healing. He will also not accumulate new gray health until Thick Skin comes off cooldown. Use this to your advantage!;Watch out for Kench's Abyssal Dive - you can cancel it's channel with immobilizing crowd control effects.;;;Support;Tank;Mana;3;9;6;5;570.0;95;325.0;50.0;335;42;3.5;32.0;1.25;175;6.5;0.55;8.0;1.0;56.0;3.2;2.5;0.658;Tongue Lash;Tahm Kench lashes out with his tongue, damaging and slowing the first unit hit and healing himself it he strikes an enemy champion.

Applies a stack of An Acquired Taste to enemy champions. If the champion already has 3 stacks of An Acquired Taste, they are stunned and the stacks are consumed.;Abyssal Dive;Dive down and then re-appear at target location, damaging and knocking up all enemies in an area.;Thick Skin;Passive: Tahm Kench stores a percent of the damage he takes and heals based on it while out of combat.

Active: Convert all stored damage into a temporary shield.;Devour;Tahm Kench devours a champion for a few seconds, dealing magic damage if they are an enemy, or shielding them if they are an ally.;An Acquired Taste;Tahm Kench puts the heft of his immense body behind his attacks, gaining extra damage based on his total health. Damaging enemy champions builds stacks of An Acquired Taste. At three stacks, he can use Devour on an enemy champion.;
Known by many names throughout history
column2: the demon Tahm Kench travels the waterways of Runeterra
column3: feeding his insatiable appetite with the misery of others. Though he may appear singularly charming and proud
column4: he swaggers through the physical realm like a vagabond in search of unsuspecting prey. His lashing tongue can stun even a heavily armored warrior from a dozen paces
column5: and to fall into his rumbling belly is to tumble into an abyss from which there is little hope of return.

column1: The waterways of Valoran are old
column2: but far older still is the demon Tahm Kench. From muddy gambling tents along the Serpentine River
column3: through the salt-crusted dice halls of Bilgewater
column4: to the gilded wagering tables of Piltover and Zaun—all those who have given a covetous glance to another’s wealth know the unending hunger that comes from an encounter with the River King.

column1: The first tales of the creature were told by a traveling people who plied the Serpentine. They warned of a giant fish with a cavernous mouth
column2: who would lure in the dissatisfied with the promise of more. One such story was that of a young man renowned for his honesty. Though born to the ways of a raftsman
column3: he desired a life beyond the poor banks he knew so well
column4: and the River King promised him an unforgettable experience if only he would tell one little lie. It seemed harmless enough
column5: so the raftsman bent the truth in conversation with his own brother. That night the demon appeared
column6: revealing a fork in the river the raftsman had never noticed before. He followed it to a camp of foreign folk who offered him food and drink
column7: and fresh companionship. As dawn neared
column8: and the raftsman was full and ready to return to his people
column9: the demon appeared again
column10: promising an even greater experience for another lie. His interested piqued
column11: the man accepted the bargain
column12: telling falsehoods to his hosts. The river parted again and he followed it to an evening of even greater luxury. This continued
column14: until the once-honest raftsman’s deceits came as easily as breathing.

column1: When the river finally emptied into the sea
column2: he found himself alone and lost—there was no one left to lie to. So many dark choices
column3: all of them his own
column4: had left the raftsman with no way back home.

column1: The brackish rivers of the mainland carried the tales of the River King to the Blue Flame Isles
column2: where the creature gained a name as his legend grew—Tahm Kench. In Bilgewater
column3: fortunes are boom or bust
column4: with as much wealth going out with the tide as comes in. Many a tavern yarn tells of ol’ Tahm
column5: a demon of the water with an unending appetite for games of chance
column6: such that the loquacious beast became a symbol for many of the city’s gambling dens and houses of sin.

column1: Once the Sun Gates opened easy trade from Bilgewater to Piltover
column2: tales of Tahm Kench became more common in the City of Progress and its underbelly
column3: Zaun. There
column4: children know Tahm as “Two-Coats
column5: ” a fish so monstrously large that he wears two fine jackets stitched together. With a jaunty top hat and a smile wider than the Pilt itself
column6: he drives the jealousies of young artificers. It is said he came one Progress Day to a struggling Piltovan inventor
column7: and offered her an idea certain to make a wealthy clan take notice. All he asked in return was a single lock of her hair. The ambitious woman made the trade and
column8: true enough
column9: her work landed her a lucrative contract. But one invention would not satisfy
column10: and Two-Coats wandered by
column11: this time asking for all of her lovely braids. Not wishing to disappoint her new patrons
column12: the inventor agreed—and Two-Coats ate them up on the spot. Still the woman was unable to find the one great innovation that would make her name. The demon came again
column13: offering a deal that would take the tip of one finger. The following week it was an ear. A year passed
column14: and by then there was little left of the woman to give. Finally she called Two-Coats herself
column15: begging him to make it all stop.

column1: He laughed as he opened his jaws wide
column2: telling her he would protect her from herself
column3: and promptly swallowed her whole.

column1: The River King. The Great Waddler. Old Yawn-Belly. Two-Coats. The demon Tahm Kench is known by many names
column2: but all who speak them have learned a singular truth: no matter how alluring his words may be
column3: in his mouth you will be lost.

column1:
421;Rek'Sai;the Void Burrower;Eternum Rek'Sai;Pool Party Rek'Sai;Blackfrost Rek'Sai;;;;;;;;;;;;;Keeping tunnels spread out across the map will ensure you have choices when you want to cast Void Rush.;Cast Burrow before travelling around the map to take advantage of the increased Movement Speed and the safety provided by Tremor Sense.;Tremor Sense can warn you of enemies closing in, and is particularly useful when entering enemy territory.;;;If you see one of Rek'Sai's tunnels, briefly stand on one of the entrances to destroy it.;Rek'Sai's Furious Bite gains damage as she builds Fury. Be very careful around her when her Fury is full.;When Rek'Sai is near, she can see the position of you and your allies, but only if you're moving.;;Fighter;;Rage;8;5;2;3;570.0;85;100.0;0.0;335;36;3.75;32.0;1.25;175;7.5;0.65;0.0;0.0;64.0;3.0;2.0;0.667;Queen's Wrath / Prey Seeker;Rek'Sai's next 3 basic attacks deal bonus Physical Damage to nearby enemies.

While Burrowed, Rek'Sai launches a burst of void-charged earth that deals Physical Damage and reveals enemies hit.;Burrow / Un-burrow;Rek'Sai burrows into the ground, gaining new abilities and increased Movement Speed. Her vision range is reduced and she cannot use basic attacks.

While Burrowed, Rek'Sai may cast Un-burrow to knock up and damage nearby enemies.;Furious Bite / Tunnel;Rek'Sai bites her target, dealing double and True Damage if she has max Fury.

While Burrowed, Rek'Sai creates a re-usable, long lasting tunnel. Enemies can destroy it by standing on top of either entrance.;Void Rush;Rek'sai passively marks targets by damaging them. She can activate this ability to become briefly untargetable and lunge at a marked target for heavy damage based on their missing health.;Fury of the Xer'Sai;Rek'sai generates Fury by Attack and hitting with basic abilities. She consumes this Fury while Burrowed to restore health.;
The largest and fiercest of her species
column2: Rek'Sai is a merciless predator that tunnels through the earth to ambush and devour her prey. Her insatiable hunger has laid waste to entire regions of the once-great Shuriman empire. Merchants
column3: traders and armed caravans will go hundreds of miles out of their way to avoid these vast areas
column4: though cunning bandits have been known to lure the unwary into her killing grounds. Once Rek'Sai detects you
column5: your fate is sealed. There is no hope of escape; she is death from below the sand.

column1: 236;Lucian;the Purifier;Hired Gun Lucian;Striker Lucian;PROJECT: Lucian;Heartseeker Lucian;High Noon Lucian;Demacia Vice Lucian;Pulsefire Lucian;Pulsefire Lucian Prestige Edition;Victorious Lucian;Arcana Lucian;;;;;;For optimal burst, try to combine Relentless Pursuit into Piercing Light.;Ardent Blaze actually explodes in a star pattern. Try to line it up so the spokes hit enemy champions.;Once you have chosen an angle for The Culling, you cannot change it. Pick your moment well!;Because of Lightslinger, Lucian benefits more from Attack Damage than he does from Attack Speed.;;Lucian has strong burst, but little sustained damage.;Lucian cannot change the aim of The Culling. Take advantage of this by avoiding the angle of the bullets.;Piercing Light does not give Lucian extra Attack Range. He still needs to find a target in range to line up his shot. Avoid Piercing Light by anticipating the angle Lucian will choose.;;Marksman;;Mana;8;5;3;6;571.0;86;348.88;38.0;335;28;3.0;30.0;0.5;500;3.75;0.65;8.18;0.7;62.0;2.3;3.3;0.638;Piercing Light;Lucian shoots a bolt of piercing light through a target.;Ardent Blaze;Lucian shoots a missile that explodes in a star shape, marking and briefly revealing enemies. Lucian gains Movement Speed for attacking marked enemies.;Relentless Pursuit;Lucian quickly dashes a short distance. Lightslinger attacks reduce Relentless Pursuit's cooldown.;The Culling;Lucian unleashes a torrent of shots from his weapons.;Lightslinger;Whenever Lucian uses an ability, his next attack becomes a double-shot. When Lucian is empowered by another Ally, his next 2 basic attacks will deal bonus magic damage.;
Lucian
column2: a Sentinel of Light
column3: is a grim hunter of undying spirits
column4: pursuing them relentlessly and annihilating them with his twin relic pistols. After the wraith Thresh slew his wife
column5: Lucian embarked on the path of vengeance—but even with her return to life
column6: his rage is undiminished. Merciless and single-minded
column7: Lucian will stop at nothing to protect the living from the long-dead horrors of the Black Mist.

column1: From an early age
column2: Lucian wanted nothing more than to be like his father
column3: Urias
column4: who was a member of the ancient order of the Sentinels of Light. While Lucian remained home in Demacia
column5: Urias ranged far and wide
column6: protecting the living from the wraiths of the Black Mist.

column1: Urias would regale Lucian with tales of his adventures
column2: where courage and ingenuity carried the day. Lucian hung on every word
column3: picturing himself saving the people of Runeterra at his father’s side. But Urias did not want his son to follow in his footsteps
column4: hoping to keep his family safe from the dangerous life he had chosen.

column1: Lucian waited for the day he would become Urias’ apprentice
column2: but it never came.

column1: Instead
column2: Lucian stayed in Demacia
column3: where he found himself increasingly at odds with the kingdom’s culture. It especially rankled him that Demacia would exile peaceful mages to the hinterlands. Lucian found fulfillment in safeguarding the banished on their perilous journey. Where his countrymen saw only outlaws
column4: reducing the world to good or evil
column5: Lucian looked closer
column6: and saw people in need of help.

column1: After returning home from one such journey
column2: Lucian found a stranger waiting at his door. She introduced herself as Senna
column3: a Sentinel of Light. Cradling Urias’ relic pistol in her hands
column4: Senna explained that Lucian’s father had died
column5: falling in battle against the the long-dead wraiths of the Black Mist.

column1: Senna had been Urias’ apprentice
column2: fighting at his side for years.

column1: Lucian reeled in shock—not only was his father dead
column2: but before him stood a woman who had lived the life he had wanted for so long. As Senna made to take her leave
column3: Lucian stopped her at the door
column4: insisting he join her. He knew what came next—the vigil for lost Sentinels. Senna reluctantly allowed Lucian to accompany her.

column1: Along the way
column2: the two traded stories of their time with Urias
column3: Senna comforting Lucian with her plainspoken wisdom
column4: and Lucian easing her pain with fond remembrances. They arrived at Urias’ birthplace
column5: far away from Demacian lands. There
column6: they held the vigil for lost Sentinels.

column1: As they prepared to depart
column2: dark clouds rolled in over the coast
column3: and wraiths manifested from the foulness
column4: attacking them. Where Lucian was horrified
column5: Senna drew her weapons with a grim familiarity—this was her curse. Since she was a child
column6: tendrils of the Black Mist had stalked her wherever she went
column7: unleashing its horror should she tarry anywhere for too long.

column1: As Senna fought one of the creatures
column2: it clawed Urias’ pistol from her grip. Lucian retrieved it
column3: sensing his fate opening up before him. The blazing sorrow in his heart manifested in a bolt of light that blasted from the pistol
column4: distracting the wraith so Senna could banish it. Senna fought off the remaining spirits before the pair left
column5: the Mist ever on her trail.

column1: Never before had one of the uninitiated fired a Sentinel’s relic weapon. For the first time
column2: Lucian had shown Senna his potential to join the order.

column1: Eventually
column2: Senna entrusted Lucian with his father’s pistol
column3: and instructed him in the tactics and doctrines of the Sentinels. He proved himself worthy of the lessons. A bond slowly formed between them
column4: Lucian’s warmth and charm the perfect balance to Senna’s discipline and unbreakable resolve.

column1: Lucian and Senna battled the myriad evils that ushered forth from the Black Mist
column2: and their reliance upon each other blossomed into love. The closer Lucian grew to Senna
column3: the more he witnessed the curse she bore. Each conflict hardened him
column4: splitting the world apart into light and shadow
column5: good and evil. Lucian’s urge to heal Senna became a crusade he pursued with reckless zeal.

column1: Scouring a forgotten vault for a cure
column2: the two Sentinels were attacked by the monstrous wraith Thresh. The ghoulish Chain Warden was a dangerous foe
column3: and when Senna called to withdraw and regroup
column4: Lucian refused to turn back. Throwing himself blindly into the attack
column5: Lucian realized his mistake as Thresh gained the upper hand. Senna stepped into Thresh’s path
column6: imploring Lucian to run.

column1: As the dust settled
column2: Senna lay dead before him
column3: her soul claimed by Thresh’s eldritch lantern.

column1: Senna’s sacrifice was nearly Lucian’s undoing. For years
column2: he stalked Runeterra
column3: a husk of the man he once was
column4: his former warmth replaced with anger and bitterness. Wielding both his pistol and Senna’s
column5: Lucian hunted Thresh in the hope of destroying the lantern and granting oblivion to his captive love. On the day that battle finally came
column6: Lucian shattered the lantern—but instead of finding her eternal rest
column7: Senna reemerged.

column1: Lucian and Senna’s love is a bond even death could not sever. As Lucian struggles to grasp Senna’s altered form
column2: he is forced to confront his own. Lucian now fights to return to his former self
column3: while grappling with the reality that the dark forces he hates are all that keep Senna with him.

column1: While Senna has returned with knowledge of a new mission
column2: Lucian remains obsessed with exacting vengeance from Thresh
column3: as he is certain the Chain Warden’s machinations have only begun.

column1: 28;Evelynn;Agony's Embrace;Shadow Evelynn;Masquerade Evelynn;Tango Evelynn;Safecracker Evelynn;Blood Moon Evelynn;K/DA Evelynn;K/DA Evelynn Prestige Edition;Sugar Rush Evelynn;K/DA ALL OUT Evelynn;Coven Evelynn;;;;;;Allure's arm time might seem long, but the Charm and magic resist shred put Evelynn at an exteme advantage so are worth the wait.;While stealthed, pay attention to when you are (near) being detected by enemy champions. This is identified by the glowing yellow and red eyes over nearby enemy champions.;If at low health, you can take advantage of Demon Shade's healing and Camouflage to return to the fight and surprise opponents.;;;Purchasing Vision Wards can help you detect Evelynn's location in order to prepare for her ambushes.;A large share of Evelynn's threat is in her charm, 'Allure.' Protect allies marked with 'Allure' or, if you are marked, make sure allies are between you and where Evelynn may attack from.;If you suspect Evelynn is about to ambush one of your teammates, let them know by pinging the minimap and typing in chat.;;Assassin;Mage;Mana;4;2;7;10;572.0;84;315.0;42.0;335;37;3.5;32.1;1.25;125;8.5;0.75;8.11;0.6;61.0;3.0;2.1;0.667;Hate Spike;Evelynn strikes out with her Lasher, dealing damage to the first unit hit. Then, Evelynn can shoot a line of spikes at nearby foes up to 3 times.;Allure;Evelynn curses her target, causing her next attack or spell after a delay to charm her target and reduce their magic resist.;Whiplash;Evelynn whips her target with her Lasher, dealing damage. She then gains movement speed for a short duration.;Last Caress;Evelynn briefly goes untargetable and decimates the area in front of her before warping backwards a long distance.;Demon Shade;When out of combat, Evelynn enters Demon Shade. Demon Shade heals Evelynn when she is low on health and grants Camouflage after level 6.;
Within the dark seams of Runeterra
column2: the demon Evelynn searches for her next victim. She lures in prey with the voluptuous façade of a human female
column3: but once a person succumbs to her charms
column4: Evelynn’s true form is unleashed. She then subjects her victim to unspeakable torment
column5: gratifying herself with their pain. To the demon
column6: these liaisons are innocent flings. To the rest of Runeterra
column7: they are ghoulish tales of lust gone awry and horrific reminders of the cost of wanton desire.

column1: Evelynn was not always a skilled huntress. She began eons ago
column2: as something primordial
column3: shapeless
column4: and barely sentient. This nascent wisp of shadow existed
column5: numb and unroused by any stimulation
column6: for centuries. It might have remained so
column7: had the world not been upended by conflict. The Rune Wars
column8: as they would come to be known
column9: brought an era of mass suffering the world had never known.

column1: As people across Runeterra began to experience a vast array of pain
column2: anguish
column3: and loss
column4: the shadow stirred. The nothingness it had known for so long had been replaced by the manic vibrations of an agonized world. The creature quivered with excitement.

column1: As the Rune Wars escalated
column2: the world’s torment grew so intense that the shadow felt as if it might burst. It drank in all of Runeterra’s pain
column3: which it experienced as boundless pleasure. The sensation nourished the creature
column4: and over time
column5: it transformed into something more. It became a demon
column6: a ravenous spiritual parasite that fed on the basest of human emotions.

column1: When the wars finally ended
column2: the world’s suffering waned
column3: and the demon found itself growing desperate. The only pleasure it had ever known was born of other creatures’ misery. Without their pain
column4: it felt nothing
column5: just as it had in its earliest days.

column1: If the world would not provide the suffering the demon needed to thrive
column2: it would have to make its own. It needed to inflict pain on other beings so that it could experience that elation again.

column1: At first
column2: catching prey was a challenge for the demon. It could move undetected in its shadow form
column3: but to touch a human
column4: the creature needed to manifest as something tangible. It made several attempts to fashion a physical body from its shadow-flesh
column5: but each result was more monstrous than the last
column6: scaring off her prey.

column1: The demon realized it needed a shape that was pleasing to humans
column2: one that would not only lure them right into its claws
column3: but would offer them ecstasy born of their own desires
column4: so that their pain would be that much sweeter.

column1: From the shadows
column2: it began to study those it sought to prey upon. It tailored its flesh to their liking
column3: learned to say what they wanted to hear
column4: and to walk in a manner they found alluring.

column1: In a matter of weeks
column2: the demon had perfected her physique
column3: leading dozens of enamored victims to be tortured to death at her hands. Though she relishes the exquisite pain of each of her victims
column4: she always finds herself wanting more. Each human’s desires are so small
column5: and they always expire too soon. Their pain
column6: too fleeting to give her anything more than tiny morsels of pleasure
column7: is just enough to tide her over to the next feeding.

column1: She yearns for the day she can plunge the world into utter chaos
column2: and she can return to an existence of pure
column3: rapturous ecstasy.

column1: 121;Kha'Zix;the Voidreaver;Mecha Kha'Zix;Guardian of the Sands Kha'Zix;Death Blossom Kha'Zix;Dark Star Kha'Zix;Championship Kha'Zix;Odyssey Kha'Zix;;;;;;;;;;Enemies are considered isolated if they have no allies within a short distance. Kha'Zix's abilities have interactions with Isolated targets.When Kha'Zix is not visible to the enemy team, he gains Unseen Threat, causing his next basic attack against an enemy champion to deal bonus magic damage and slow them for a few seconds.;
A vicious Void predator
column2: Kha'Zix infiltrated Valoran to devour the land's most promising creatures. With each kill he absorbs his prey's strength
column3: evolving to grow more powerful. Kha'Zix hungers most to conquer and consume Rengar
column4: the one beast he considers his equal.

column1: When Kha'Zix crossed over into this world
column2: he was fragile and ravenous. The animals he first encountered were too small to fuel the rapid evolution he craved. Kha'Zix focused his hunger on the most dangerous creatures he could find
column3: risking his life to satisfy his need. With each kill he feasted and changed
column4: becoming a stronger
column5: faster predator. Kha'Zix soon chased his prey with unrestrained aggression
column6: believing he was unstoppable. One day
column7: while savoring a fresh kill
column8: the predator became the prey. From cover a creature pounced in a blur of fangs and steel
column9: tackling him to the ground. It roared in his face slashing and clawing
column10: and Kha'Zix felt his blood spill for the first time. Screeching in fury
column11: he sliced at the brute's eye driving it back. They fought from sunset to sunrise. Finally
column12: near death
column13: they reluctantly separated. As his wounds closed
column14: Kha'Zix burned with anticipation at the idea of devouring one who could match the Void's strength. He resumed his search for powerful prey with renewed vigor. Someday

column1: 31;Cho'Gath;the Terror of the Void;Nightmare Cho'Gath;Gentleman Cho'Gath;Loch Ness Cho'Gath;Jurassic Cho'Gath;Battlecast Prime Cho'Gath;Prehistoric Cho'Gath;Dark Star Cho'Gath;Shan Hai Scrolls Cho'Gath;;;;;;;;Try to line up your attacks with Vorpal Spikes so that they kill minions and harass enemy champions at the same time.;If you're having difficulty feasting upon champions, try eating minions until you're larger.;Using Rupture on creeps in combination with Carnivore is a good way to gain Health and Mana.;;;Purchasing a few HP items decreases the chances of Cho'Gath killing you quickly.;Focus on preventing Cho'Gath from reaching his max size.;Rupture has a smoke cloud indicating the area it will strike. Try to watch out for it to prevent Cho'Gath from being able to combo his abilities.;;Tank;Mage;Mana;3;7;7;5;574.0;80;270.0;60.0;345;38;3.5;32.0;1.25;125;9.0;0.85;7.2;0.45;69.0;4.2;1.44;0.625;Rupture;Ruptures the ground at target location, popping enemy units into the air, dealing damage and slowing them.;Feral Scream;Cho'Gath unleashes a terrible scream at enemies in a cone, dealing magic damage and Silencing enemies for a few seconds.;Vorpal Spikes;Cho'Gath's attacks release deadly spikes, dealing damage and slowing all enemy units in front of him.;Feast;Devours an enemy unit, dealing a high amount of true damage. If the target is killed, Cho'Gath grows, gaining maximum Health.;Carnivore;Whenever Cho'Gath kills a unit, he recovers Health and Mana. The values restored increase with Cho'Gath's level.;
There is a place between dimensions
column2: between worlds. To some it is known as the Outside
column3: to others it is the Unknown. To those that truly know
column4: however
column5: it is called the Void. Despite its name
column6: the Void is not an empty place
column7: but rather the home of unspeakable things - horrors not meant for minds of men. Cho'Gath is a creature born of the Void
column8: a thing whose true nature is so awful most will not speak its name. Its fellows have been poking at the walls that divide dimensions for a crack
column9: a way into Runeterra
column10: where they can visit their own personal paradise of horror upon the world. They are called the Voidborn
column11: creatures so ancient and terrible that they have been removed from history altogether. It is rumored that the Voidborn command vast armies of unspeakable creatures on other worlds
column12: that they were once driven from Runeterra by powerful magic lost to antiquity.

column1: If such tales are true
column2: then the rumors that follow must be equally true - that one day
column3: the Voidborn will return. Even now
column4: something dark stirs in Icathia. Cho'Gath
column5: an alien creature of malice and violence
column6: causes all but the most stalwart to cringe in fear. Cho'Gath even appears to feed on its predations
column7: growing and swelling as it gorges itself. Worse yet
column8: the creature is intelligent
column9: perhaps greatly so
column10: hinting at the sentient horror of the Void.

When those games occur, try getting Aegis of the Legion, Mercury's Treads, and Guardian Angel.;;;;If you're a physical damage character stay behind your allies when fighting Malphite. Ground Slam can significantly reduce your damage output.;Malphite is one of a couple tanks who are capable of jungling. Watch out if he gets Smite.;;;Tank;Fighter;Mana;5;9;7;2;574.0;90;280.0;60.0;335;37;3.75;28.0;1.25;125;7.0;0.55;7.32;0.55;62.0;4.0;3.4;0.736;Seismic Shard;Malphite sends a shard of the earth through the ground at his foe, dealing damage upon impact and stealing Movement Speed for 3 seconds.;Thunderclap;Malphite attacks with such force that it creates a sonic boom. For the next few seconds, his attacks create aftershocks in front of him.;Ground Slam;Malphite slams the ground, sending out a shockwave that deals magic damage based on his Armor and reduces the Attack Speed of enemies for a short duration.;Unstoppable Force;Malphite launches himself to a location at high speed, damaging enemies and knocking them into the air.;Granite Shield;Malphite is shielded by a layer of rock which absorbs damage up to 10% of his maximum Health. If Malphite has not been hit for a few seconds, this effect recharges.;
A massive creature of living stone
column2: Malphite was born from the heart of the great Ixtali construct known as the Monolith. He has studied the elemental balance of Runeterra for centuries
column3: using his tremendous strength to maintain order in a frequently chaotic world
column4: and crush the dark things that crawl beneath it. Now
column5: roused all too often from his slumbers
column6: Malphite endures the fluid temperaments of mortals
column7: in pursuit of the only cause worthy of the last of his kind.

column1: For more than two millennia
column2: Shurima dominated the known world—an empire that reigned over countless peoples without challenge
column3: and without threat.

column1: Until the day Icathia fell.
From the moment the Void tore its way into the material realm
column2: the armies of Shurima faced an enemy that could not only lay their grand empire low
column3: but one that seemed to grow stronger the more they fought it. The corruption spread rapidly from Icathia’s ruins
column4: boiling over the land and beneath the oceans
column5: before its hideous tendrils reached the southernmost jungles of Ixtal.

column1: Ne’Zuk of the Ascended Host was an Ixtali elemental mage of colossal power
column2: and almost unrivaled arrogance. He went before the emperor
column3: pledging to create a weapon powerful enough to take the fight to the Void
column4: and eradicate it at the source of its original eruption.

column1: After months of inhuman labor
column2: Ne’Zuk revealed the Monolith—a floating fortress of living stone
column3: maintained by the greatest elemental mages
column4: and its ramparts manned by his fellow Ixtali god-warriors. The size of a city itself
column5: the Monolith glided titanically toward the wastelands of Icathia
column6: the lightning crackling from its magical inhibitors fusing the sands to glass beneath it. Ne’Zuk and his superweapon arrived at their destination
column7: to face once more the howling infinite darkness of the abyssal realm
column8: and the hordes of Voidborn monstrosities it had created.

column1: The battle dragged into weeks. It was violence of a scale and intensity never before witnessed in Runeterra. Sorcery enough to raze entire civilizations
column2: or render whole continents into naught but a memory
column3: was unleashed upon the Void.

column1: The darkness retaliated in kind. Its hideous energies gouged deep wounds into the living stone of the Monolith
column2: whose surfaces became pocked and seared with unnatural malphite—from the Ixtali for “bad stone”—and leaving mineral-like scars. The fortress was pushed to the very limits of its design
column3: struggling to self-repair and reknit its weakened superstructure… but even the incredible magics that held it aloft had a breaking point.

column1: As Ne’Zuk fought to rally his Ascended brethren for one last
column2: desperate charge
column3: the unthinkable happened. Sagging for an instant
column4: the Monolith crashed down to earth
column5: cleaving through the bedrock of Icathia and opening the Void beneath to the skies.

column1: Much of the fortress was lost within that gaping maw
column2: vanishing into the silent nothingness beyond. The rest rained down as great ruins
column3: littering a landscape already blackened by the terrible conflict that had been cut so abruptly short. Only a single Ascended survived—Ne’Zuk hauled himself from the wreckage
column4: choking on the ashes of what was meant to be his grandest triumph
column5: now his greatest folly
column6: and fled for his life.

column1: In defiance of all worldly reason
column2: some disparate fragments of the Monolith endured
column3: still imbued with something like magical life. The far-flung shards struggled to heal
column4: to reform the whole to which they had once belonged. But the Void’s endless hunger leached away at them
column5: rendering them as little more than inert shapes clawing feebly in the dust.

column1: However
column2: against all that had been lost
column3: a single shard remained.

column1: Buried deep beneath the surface
column2: forgotten even by those that dwelt in the abyss
column3: it slowly gathered in strength. It lived
column4: until at last it awakened after uncounted centuries
column5: and realized it was alone.

column1: In all the centuries since that dark day
column2: Malphite
column3: the last shard of the Monolith
column4: has become something of a legend in Runeterra. It has reputedly been sighted everywhere
column5: from Targon to Zaun; heard sometimes as a tectonic roar in the deepest caverns
column6: and sometimes as a quiet voice
column7: humming to itself
column8: that it might still remember the sounds of the world it once knew.

column1: Despite the enormous span of its existence
column2: the overwhelming drive enkindled by Ne’Zuk’s creation of the Monolith has not wavered. Now
column3: Malphite knows it must soon rise to meet the resurgent darkness it once battled
column4: as the Void awakens to threaten all of Runeterra once more.

column1: 136;Aurelion Sol;The Star Forger;Ashen Lord Aurelion Sol;Mecha Aurelion Sol;Storm Dragon Aurelion Sol;;;;;;;;;;;;;You can use Comet of Legend's flight to grow Starsurge to massive proportions.;Save Voice of Light to use as a defense against melee opponents if you need to - otherwise, use its slow to start a fight at long range.;Comet of Legend allows you to move quickly around the map; use it to put pressure on other lanes.";;;Try to get inside his orbit
column2: since his stars can't hurt you up close.;His stars disappear while stunned or silenced
column3: giving you an easy opportunity to fight him.;He gains speed while chasing in a straight line
column4: but taking damage makes him lose that momentum.;His Starsurge ability can grow to cover a huge area - don't stay in the same place too long!;Mage;;Mana;2;3;8;7;575.0;92;350.0;50.0;325;19;3.6;30.0;0.5;550;7.0;0.6;6.0;0.8;57.0;3.2;1.36;0.625;Starsurge;Aurelion Sol creates an expanding disk
column5: which explodes to stun and damage enemies when it moves too far away from him.;Celestial Expansion;Aurelion Sol pushes his stars farther out
column6: increasing their damage and speed.;Comet of Legend;Aurelion Sol takes off flying for a long distance.;Voice of Light;Aurelion Sol projects a blast of pure starfire
column7: damaging and slowing all enemies caught in it and knocking nearby enemies back to a safer distance.;Center of the Universe;Stars orbit Aurelion Sol
column8: dealing magic damage when they hit an enemy.;"

column1: Aurelion Sol once graced the vast emptiness of the celestial realm with wonders of his own devising
column2: but was tricked by the Aspects of Targon into revealing the secrets of a sun that he himself created. His awesome power was channeled into immortal god-warriors to protect the apparently insignificant world of Runeterra—now
column3: desiring a return to his mastery of the cosmos
column4: Aurelion Sol will drag the very stars from the sky
column5: if he must
column6: in order to regain his freedom.

column1: The appearance of a comet in the night sky is often said to portend upheaval and unrest. Under the auspices of such fiery harbingers
column2: new empires rise
column3: old cultures fall
column4: and even the stars themselves may vanish from the heavens…

column1: The truth is
column2: perhaps
column3: more unsettling.

column1: The almighty being known as Aurelion Sol was already ancient before the rise of the mortal races of Runeterra. Born in the first breath of creation
column2: he and those like him roamed the vast nothingness of a pristine celestial realm
column3: seeking to fill this canvas of incalculable breadth with marvels whose twinkling spectra would bring fulfillment and delight to all who witnessed them.

column1: As he wandered
column2: Aurelion Sol seldom encountered any equals. The eternal Aspects were dispassionate and incurious things
column3: contributing little to existence
column4: content only to compose amusingly self-centered philosophies on the nature of creation.

column1: But then
column2: bathed in the light of a fairly unremarkable sun he had crafted eons earlier
column3: he discovered something. A world. New realms.

column1: He did not know who had created this world
column2: or why—only that it had not been him.

column1: The Aspects
column2: who seemed unusually invested in it
column3: implored him to come closer. There was life here
column4: and magic
column5: and fledgling civilizations that cried out for guidance from beings greater than themselves. Flattered by this new audience to his supreme majesty
column6: Aurelion Sol descended to bask in their adulation
column7: in the form of a vast and terrible dragon from the stars.

column1: The tiny inhabitants of the insignificant land of Targon named him for the golden light of the sun he had gifted them
column2: and the Aspects commanded them to bring forth a suitable offering in return. The mortals climbed to the peak of their tallest mountain
column3: and presented him with a splendorous crown
column4: crafted with careful and cunning magic
column5: and etched with the inscrutable patterns of the celestial realm.

column1: From the moment it touched Aurelion Sol’s brow
column2: he knew this was no gift at all.

column1: The accursed thing clamped in place with unimaginable force
column2: enough that even he could not remove it
column3: and he could feel his knowledge of the sun and its creation being stolen and scrutinized by intelligences vastly inferior to his own. Worse still
column4: the power of the crown hurled him back into the heavens
column5: and prevented him from getting any closer to that world again.

column1: Instead
column2: he was forced to watch as the duplicitous Aspects of Targon set the mortals to work in the construction of a great
column3: gleaming disc. With this
column4: they channeled his celestial power to raise up immortal god-warriors
column5: for some unknown conflict that was apparently still to come.

column1: Outraged
column2: Aurelion Sol could see other stars fading across the firmament for lack of care and maintenance
column3: and he strained to break free of the crown’s control. It was he who had birthed their light into the universe! Why must he be shackled
column4: now
column5: by the Aspects and their lowly pawns? He roared with glee when the Sun Disc failed… only to see a second
column6: more powerful one take its place. Eventually
column7: resigned to his fate
column8: he saw the god-warriors cast down their rivals
column9: then chittering creatures of pure darkness
column10: and eventually each other.

column1: Then
column2: in little more than the blink of a star dragon’s eye
column3: the world was ravaged by a succession of sorcerous catastrophes
column4: and Aurelion Sol finally knew that Targon and the hated Aspects were all but defenseless. As he cautiously circled back
column5: he realized the magic that bound him was weakening. Flecks of gold began to fall from his crown
column6: each one blazing across the skies like a comet.

column1: Driven by the tantalizing possibilities of freedom and revenge
column2: Aurelion Sol now regards Runeterra with simmering
column3: eternal fury. Surely
column4: it is here
column5: upon this world
column6: that the cosmic balance will tip in his favor once more—and with it
column7: the universe itself shall bear witness to the fate of those who dare steal the power of a star forger.

column1: 82;Mordekaiser;the Iron Revenant;Dragon Knight Mordekaiser;Infernal Mordekaiser;Pentakill Mordekaiser;Lord Mordekaiser;King of Clubs Mordekaiser;Dark Star Mordekaiser;PROJECT: Mordekaiser;Pentakill III: Lost Chapter Mordekaiser;;;;;;;;Offense is your defense. Keep fighting to build up larger Indestructible shields.;Hitting multiple champions with the same ability can help quickly activate Darkness Rise.;Use Realm of Death on a low health enemy to guarantee the kill and keep their stats for the rest of a teamfight.;;;Mordekaiser builds up a powerful damage aura when fighting champions, so keep your distance.;Damage he deals can be converted into a large shield, and consumed for health;Realm of Death will cut you off from your teammates completely. Try to save mobility spells to escape Mordekaiser once inside;;Fighter;;Shield;4;6;7;4;575.0;90;100.0;0.0;335;37;3.0;32.0;1.25;175;5.0;0.75;0.0;0.0;61.0;4.0;1.0;0.625;Obliterate;Mordekaiser smashes the ground with his mace dealing damage to each enemy struck. Damage is increased when hitting a single enemy.;Indestructible;Mordekaiser stores damage he deals and takes to create a shield. He may consume the shield to heal.;Death's Grasp;Mordekaiser pulls all enemies in an area.;Realm of Death;Mordekaiser drags his victim to a different dimension with him and steals a portion of their stats. If he kills them, he keeps the stats until the victim respawns.;Darkness Rise;Mordekaiser gains a powerful damage aura and Move Speed after landing 3 attacks or spells against champions or monsters.;
Twice slain and thrice born
column2: Mordekaiser is a brutal warlord from a foregone epoch
column3: who uses his necromantic sorcery to bind souls into an eternity of servitude. Few now remain who remember his earlier conquests
column4: or know the true extent of his powers—but there are some ancient souls that do
column5: and they fear the day when he may return to claim dominion over both the living and the dead.

column1: In a previous epoch
column2: the fierce warlord Sahn-Uzal rampaged across the northern wildlands. Driven by dark faith
column3: he crushed every tribe and settlement in his path
column4: forging an empire in blood and death. As his mortal life neared its end
column5: he took great satisfaction in knowing he had doubtless earned a seat at the gods’ table
column6: in the glorious Hall of Bones
column7: for all eternity.

column1: Yet
column2: when he died
column3: he found no halls or glory awaiting him. Instead
column4: Sahn-Uzal stood in an empty
column5: gray wasteland
column6: shrouded by ethereal fog and plagued by discordant whispers. Occasionally
column7: other lost souls drifted nearby—little more than ghostly shapes
column8: wandering their own personal oblivion.

column1: Anger consumed Sahn-Uzal. Had his faith been false? Or was his domination of the world simply not enough to grant him the immortality he craved? Surely this emptiness could not be all there was… yet there seemed no end to it. He watched as the lesser spirits slowly faded into the fog
column2: unmade and lost to time.

column1: But Sahn-Uzal refused to fade.
His will
column2: tempered by rage and torment
column3: held him together. Over time
column4: the unknowable
column5: disembodied whispering in that place crystalized into words he could almost comprehend—this
column6: he learned
column7: was Ochnun
column8: a profane tongue unspoken by any among the living. Slowly
column9: a deceitful plan began to form in what was left of Sahn-Uzal’s mind. He began to whisper temptations across the veil between realms
column10: promising his indomitable strength to any who dared listen.

column1: And
column2: sure enough
column3: the day came when a coven of sorcerers resolved to bring Sahn-Uzal back from the dead. Lacking any flesh or bone
column4: he spurred them to make him stronger than any mortal
column5: binding his spirit-form in dark metal plates wrought in the likeness of his old armor. So he rose
column6: a hulking revenant of iron and hate.

column1: These power-hungry sorcerers had hoped to use him as a weapon in their trivial wars. Instead
column2: he slew them where they stood
column3: their weapons and magic useless against him.

column1: In desperation
column2: they screamed out his name to bind him—but to no avail
column3: for Sahn-Uzal was no more.

column1: With an ethereal rumble
column2: he spoke his spirit-name in Ochnun: Mordekaiser.

column1: Thus began his second conquest of the mortal realm. As before
column2: his ambitions were great
column3: only now empowered by necromantic sorceries he could never have previously imagined. From the fearful
column4: dissipating souls of the sorcerers
column5: Mordekaiser forged a weapon fit for an emperor of death—his brutal mace
column6: Nightfall—and seized control of the army they had raised.

column1: To his foes
column2: it seemed he cared only for massacre and destruction. Entire generations perished under his relentless campaigns.

column1: However
column2: there was far more to Mordekaiser’s plan. He raised the Immortal Bastion at the center of his empire; while most assumed it was merely a seat of power
column3: some came to know the secrets it held. Mordekaiser hungered for all the forbidden knowledge of spirits and death
column4: and a true understanding of the realm… or realms… beyond.

column1: Such tyranny could only bring him enemies. The Iron Revenant was defeated
column2: surprisingly
column3: by an alliance of the Noxii tribes
column4: and betrayal from within his own inner circle. This hidden cabal managed to sever the anchors of his soul from his armor
column5: and sealed the empty iron shell away in a secret place.

column1: And so
column2: Mordekaiser was cast out of the material realm. However
column3: unbeknownst to anyone
column4: he had planned for this—indeed
column5: it was a pivotal part of his design. Domination and deceit had carried him far
column6: but he knew that a destiny far grander than the Hall of Bones awaited him.

column1: There
column2: in the once empty wasteland
column3: all those who had died under his latest reign were waiting. Perverted by dark sorcery
column4: their spirits would never fade. The strongest became his devout
column5: eternal army
column6: bound to his will… but even the weak were given purpose.

column1: From the subtle matter of their souls
column2: Mordekaiser would forge a new empire. They would be the building blocks and mortar of his Afterworld.

column1: Centuries have passed on Runeterra
column2: and another empire has arisen around the Immortal Bastion. Mordekaiser’s name is still whispered in fear and awe by those who study the old histories
column3: and remembered unkindly by the few ancient souls who knew him. For them
column4: the greatest terror would be for Mordekaiser to find his own way to return permanently.

column1: It is something they pray will not come to pass
column2: for they know of no way to stop him.

column1:
13;Ryze;the Rune Mage;Young Ryze;Tribal Ryze;Uncle Ryze;Triumphant Ryze;Professor Ryze;Zombie Ryze;Dark Crystal Ryze;Pirate Ryze;Ryze Whitebeard;SKT T1 Ryze;Championship Ryze;Guardian of the Sands Ryze;;;;Use Overload's passive to optimize for maximum damage or maximum speed.;Spell Flux's short cooldown allows it to be used to spread Flux to many enemies.;Ryze can move and cast other spells while Realm Warp is charging without cancelling the portal.;;;Ryze is especially dangerous to opponents that are marked with Flux.;Use Realm Warp's windup time to figure out how to deal with what may be coming out of the portal.;Crowd controlling Ryze during Realm Warp's windup will cancel the portal.;;Mage;Fighter;Mana;2;2;10;7;575.0;110;300.0;70.0;340;22;3.0;36.0;0.5;550;8.0;0.8;8.0;1.0;58.0;3.0;2.112;0.625;Overload;Passively, Ryze's other basic abilities reset the cooldown of Overload and charge a rune. When Ryze casts Overload with 2 runes charged, he gains a brief burst of Movement Speed.

On cast, Ryze throws a charge of pure energy in a line, dealing damage to the first enemy struck. If the target has Flux on it, Overload deals extra damage and bounces to nearby enemies with Flux.;Rune Prison;Ryze traps a target in a cage of runes, damaging them and slowing their movement. If the target has Flux on it, they are instead rooted.;Spell Flux;Ryze releases an orb of pure magical power that damages an enemy and debuffs all nearby enemies. Ryze's spells have additional effects against the debuffed enemy.;Realm Warp;Passively, Overload deals even more damage against targets with Flux.

On cast, Ryze creates a portal to a nearby location. After a few seconds, allies standing near the portal are teleported to the target location.;Arcane Mastery;Ryze's spells deal extra damage based on his Bonus Mana, and he gains a percentage increase to his maximum Mana based on his Ability Power.;
Widely considered one of the most adept sorcerers on Runeterra
column2: Ryze is an ancient
column3: hard-bitten archmage with an impossibly heavy burden to bear. Armed with immense arcane power and a boundless constitution
column4: he tirelessly hunts for World Runes—fragments of the raw magic that once shaped the world from nothingness. He must retrieve these artifacts before they fall into the wrong hands
column5: for Ryze understands the horrors they could unleash on Runeterra.

column1: Ryze was just a young apprentice when he first learned of the arcane powers that had shaped the world.
His master
column2: a sorcerer named Tyrus of Helia
column3: was a member of an ancient order whose mission had been to gather and protect the most dangerous artifacts in Runeterra. Ryze overheard Tyrus speaking in hushed tones with another mage
column4: discussing something called “World Runes.” When Tyrus noticed his apprentice
column5: he abruptly ended the conversation
column6: tightly clutching the scroll that never left his side.

column1: In spite of the order’s best efforts
column2: knowledge of the Runes began to spread—few could even begin to understand their importance
column3: or the sheer power held within them
column4: and yet all saw them as weapons that could be turned against their rivals. Ryze and Tyrus traveled between the various peoples of Valoran
column5: trying to quell paranoia and encourage restraint. But over time
column6: their missions became increasingly precarious
column7: and Ryze could sense his master’s growing desperation. Finally
column8: in the Noxii territories where Ryze was born
column9: the first cataclysmic blow was struck in what would eventually be known as the Rune Wars.

column1: Two nations were pitted against one another
column2: and tensions were running high. Tyrus pleaded with their leaders in parley at the village of Khom
column3: but he saw this conflict had already escalated beyond his ability to mediate. Fleeing into the hills
column4: he and Ryze bore horrified witness to the destructive power of the World Runes firsthand.

column1: The earth fell away beneath them
column2: the bedrock itself seeming to retch and squeal
column3: while the sky above them recoiled as if mortally wounded. They looked back upon the valley where the rival armies had stood
column4: and beheld insanity—destruction on a scale so massive that it defied all physical sense. The buildings
column5: the people
column6: all were gone
column7: and the ocean
column8: once a day’s journey to the east
column9: now rushed to meet them.

column1: Ryze fell to his knees and stared into the great hole torn in the world. Nothing remained. Not even the village he once called home.
Open warfare soon raged across Runeterra. Ryze felt compelled to join the conflict
column2: to pick a side and lend his magical strength to the cause
column3: but Tyrus stayed his hand. The two of them had to guide others back toward peace
column4: and pray there was anything left of the world by the time it was all over.

column1: Wherever they met those who held the World Runes
column2: Tyrus pleaded for restraint. Many were deeply sobered by the threat of total annihilation—indeed
column3: those who had already suffered most bitterly in the war might have agreed to turn over their Runes to him
column4: and yet none of them wished to be the first to do so.

column1: As time passed and the conflict spread
column2: Ryze noticed his master growing more distant. While Tyrus attended clandestine meetings with great leaders and archmages
column3: he sent his apprentice on errands that seemed of little importance
column4: often for many weeks at a time. Eventually
column5: Ryze decided to confront him and
column6: to his horror
column7: discovered that Tyrus of Helia had secretly come into possession of not one Rune
column8: but two.

column1: Bitter and angry
column2: the older mage insisted that common mortals were like reckless children
column3: toying with powers they did not understand. He would no longer play diplomat to ignorant power-mongers. He had to stop them. Ryze tried to reason with Tyrus
column4: but it was no use—before him stood a flawed man
column5: susceptible to the same temptations as those he decried. The allure of the Runes had left its mark upon him. Where once he desired only peace
column6: now he had the means to bring about the end of all things. Ryze had to act
column7: even if it meant destroying his only true friend and ally in the world.

column1: In an instant
column2: he unleashed all the magic he could muster. A moment later
column3: Tyrus’s corpse lay smoldering on the floor.

column1: Ryze trembled as his mind struggled to process what he had done. If these deadly artifacts could corrupt a mage with the strength and integrity of Tyrus
column2: how was Ryze to handle them? At the same time
column3: he knew he could not entrust them to any other living soul...

column1: Soon
column2: the greatest civilizations all but destroyed one another
column3: ending the war. Ryze now understood the task he had inherited—as long as any World Rune remained unsecured
column4: Runeterra was surely doomed. This knowledge was to become a lonely burden indeed
column5: for ever since that day he has scoured the world in search of the last remaining Runes. He continues to reject the promise of power within each one
column6: choosing instead to bind them in secret locations
column7: far from prying and greedy eyes.

column1: Even with his life abnormally prolonged by the magic he is exposed to
column2: Ryze cannot afford to rest
column3: for rumors of the World Runes have begun to emerge once more
column4: and the peoples of Runeterra seem to have forgotten the price of wielding them.

column1:
44;Taric;the Shield of Valoran;Emerald Taric;Armor of the Fifth Age Taric;Bloodstone Taric;Pool Party Taric;Taric Luminshield;;;;;;;;;;;The cooldown reducing component of Bravado makes Cooldown Reduction items like Frozen Heart, Iceborn Gauntlet, and Spirit Visage exceptionally powerful on Taric.;Using Starlight's Touch at lower charges makes its healing less Mana efficient, but can greatly increase Taric's sustained damage via Bravado.;Rather than saving Cosmic Radiance for the last moment and risking someone dying during the delay, it can be more beneficial to cast it as soon as you know a teamfight is guaranteed to start.;;;Taric's ultimate, Cosmic Radiance, has a long delay before its effect. Try to quickly assess whether to disengage the fight or attempt to kill his allies before it goes off.;Taric reduces his spell cooldowns by basic attacking enemies with Bravado. Try to kite him in teamfights and punish him for approaching the minion wave in lane.;;;Support;Fighter;Mana;4;8;5;3;575.0;85;300.0;60.0;340;40;3.4;32.0;1.25;150;6.0;0.5;8.5;0.8;55.0;3.5;2.0;0.625;Starlight's Touch;Heals nearby allied champions based on charges stored. Bravado-empowered attacks grant a charge of Starlight's Touch.;Bastion;Passively increase the Armor of Taric and any allied champion with Bastion.

Actively shields an ally and grants them Bastion for as long as they remain near Taric. Taric's spells also cast off the ally with Bastion.;Dazzle;Taric readies a beam of starlight that, after a brief delay, deals magic damage and stuns enemies.;Cosmic Radiance;Pulses cosmic energy onto nearby allied champions after a delay, making them invulnerable for a short duration.;Bravado;Spellcasts empower Taric's next 2 basic attacks to deal bonus magic damage, reduce his spell cooldowns, and attack in quick succession.;
Taric is the Aspect of the Protector
column2: wielding incredible power as Runeterra’s guardian of life
column3: love
column4: and beauty. Shamed by a dereliction of duty and exiled from his homeland Demacia
column5: Taric ascended Mount Targon to find redemption
column6: only to discover a higher calling among the stars. Imbued with the might of ancient Targon
column7: the Shield of Valoran now stands ever vigilant against the insidious corruption of the Void.

column1: Expected to serve as a stalwart guardian of Demacia
column2: Taric’s life was meant to be the model of focused
column3: selfless dedication to the ideals of king and country. Though he always saw himself as a protector
column4: he never felt the need to limit or define whom and what he protected—be it an ideal
column5: a piece of art
column6: or a stranger’s life. Each could be considered worthy. Each could be seen as beautiful.

column1: Most of Taric’s contemporaries were focused on the martial principles of battle (things that came naturally and effortlessly to him). The young warrior was drawn instead to the fragile wonders that give life meaning
column2: not endless brutish contests for flag or crown.

column1: This was a potentially treasonous philosophy
column2: especially for one of Taric’s standing and role within the Demacian military hierarchy
column3: but he chose to dedicate himself to understanding the simple truths of love
column4: beauty
column5: and life
column6: so he could become their champion. Admired by all
column7: Taric used his disarming manner and innate warmth to charm his way past most obstacles
column8: and on the rare occasion they failed
column9: his skill with hammer and sword could be counted on to settle the matter.

column1: As his quest for understanding broadened
column2: Taric would miss combat training to wander the forest in search of a glimpse of a rare animal
column3: neglect parade drills to sit in a tavern and listen to a bard’s hauntingly simple ballad
column4: and skip regimental meetings to take horseback rides to observe the silver cloak of night settle across the countryside. Taric knew that
column5: in his own way
column6: he was training in a manner just as dedicated and focused as his fellow Demacians
column7: but it wasn’t seen that way by his superiors.

column1: Taric’s casual nature
column2: disregard for orders
column3: and disinterest in his patriotic calling finally put him at odds with nearly everyone in authority—his family
column4: his king
column5: and especially his long-time friend Garen. And while the commoners saw Taric as a charming rogue
column6: Garen recognized him for what he truly was—a man with the potential to become one of Demacia’s greatest heroes. The fact that Taric seemed to be thumbing his nose at his destiny as well as his country enraged Garen.

column1: Eventually
column2: even his former friend could no longer protect him
