column3: and Taric’s military career started to crumble. Demotion after demotion pushed Taric further from Demacia’s heart
column4: until
column5: at last
column6: he found himself commanding a small squad of lowly recruits assigned to guard an inconsequential ruined fortress out in the borderland wilds. After weeks spent standing in the rain and mud as ordered
column7: and with no threat evident
column8: Taric decided to let his men sleep while he wandered to a nearby temple to take in its cyclopean architecture.

column1: As morning lit up the temple’s overgrown cloisters
column2: Taric finally decided to head back and check on his men. He was greeted by a scene of carnage. His troops had been butchered in their sleep
column3: their corpses bearing the jagged hallmarks of the Void’s monstrous predators.

column1: Taric had failed his men
column2: his country
column3: and most painfully
column4: his self-avowed mission to protect life.

column1: Returning to Demacia in shame
column2: Taric was stripped of his rank and sentenced by Garen to endure “the Crown of Stone
column3: ” a ceremony that demanded a dishonored soldier ascend Mount Targon
column4: known to all as a death sentence
column5: as few mortals had ever survived the climb.

column1: And while the Crown of Stone was traditionally used by the dishonored to simply flee Demacia and make a new life in exile
column2: Taric decided to actually atone for his mistake and set out for the towering spire of Mount Targon.

column1: The ascent nearly claimed him
column2: body and soul
column3: numerous times
column4: but Taric pushed past the pain
column5: past the memories of his mistake
column6: the ghosts of his dead men
column7: and other tests inflicted upon him by the mountain.

column1: As he approached the summit
column2: Taric was challenged by a seemingly neverending myriad of conflicting realities
column3: each warped existence offering a new
column4: horrifying vision. Taric experienced the infinite fates that could befall those who had no one to protect them in their times of crisis. He saw the Alabaster Library engulfed in pitch and flame
column5: and still he dashed into the roiling inferno to retrieve the poetry of Tung. He screamed in rage as the Frostguard ran the last dreamstag off a blind cliff
column6: and then leapt into the abyss himself in a desperate attempt to save it. Before the ebon gates of Noxus
column7: Taric slumped to his knees at the sight of Garen’s shattered body chained aloft as a warning. Between Taric and his friend stood the sum total of Noxus’s might. And yet still
column8: without hesitation
column9: Taric raised his shield and drove all before him. Claiming Garen from the gates
column10: the young warrior marched toward Demacia
column11: heavy with his burden
column12: knowing full well that his return would ensure his execution. As he walked
column13: Taric looked upward—and the blood-strewn fields of Noxus gave way to the star-filled expanse above Mount Targon.

column1: His trials complete
column2: and freed from all illusion
column3: Taric found himself at the pinnacle of the mountain
column4: and he was not alone.

column1: Before him
column2: cut from the sackcloth of night itself
column3: stood something wearing the shape of a man. Its features composed from the pinpoints of stars
column4: Taric was struck by the odd familiarity of its nature.

column1: Its voice spoke in a thousand whispers that cut through Taric like a mountain wind. Though he heard no recognizable words
column2: he understood the figure’s intent with utter clarity.

column1: It called itself “the Protector.”
Impressed by Taric’s steadfast resolve
column2: the otherworldly being deemed the fallen Demacian hero a worthy avatar
column3: imbuing him with its ethereal powers. The Protector spoke of the truths Taric had known his entire life
column4: and of the mantle that he had unknowingly been preparing for with every decision that brought him to the top of the mountain.

column1: As the Protector’s whispers faded
column2: Taric received a final warning: He would stand as the Shield of Valoran
column3: but crashing against him would be a wave of howling madness
column4: an ocean of gnashing teeth intent on consuming all
column5: a squalid horror born of the Void.

column1: Reborn with power and purpose
column2: Taric gladly accepted the seemingly impossible challenge and now dedicates himself to his sworn duty—as the steadfast guardian of an entire world.

column1:
64;Lee Sin;the Blind Monk;Traditional Lee Sin;Acolyte Lee Sin;Dragon Fist Lee Sin;Muay Thai Lee Sin;Pool Party Lee Sin;SKT T1 Lee Sin;Knockout Lee Sin;God Fist Lee Sin;Playmaker Lee Sin;Nightbringer Lee Sin;Nightbringer Lee Sin Prestige Edition;FPX Lee Sin;Storm Dragon Lee Sin;;;Use Sonic Wave before Dragon's Rage so you can chase the target with Resonating Strike.;Take advantage of Flurry by weaving in basic attacks between spell casts - this maximizes damage output and minimizes Energy loss.;Self-casting Safeguard and using Iron Will are powerful tools for killing neutral monsters (in the jungle).;;;Stay spread out to minimize the impact of Lee Sin's ultimate, Dragon's Rage.;Lee Sin has powerful tools to combat physical damage in Iron Will and Cripple but he is still vulnerable to magic damage.;Lee Sin relies heavily on following up with his abilities. Use disables to prevent him from chaining together his abilities and attacks.;;Fighter;Assassin;Energy;8;5;3;6;575.0;85;200.0;0.0;345;36;3.7;32.0;1.25;125;7.5;0.7;50.0;0.0;68.0;3.7;3.0;0.651;Sonic Wave / Resonating Strike;Sonic Wave: Lee Sin projects a discordant wave of sound to locate his enemies, dealing physical damage to the first enemy it encounters. If Sonic Wave hits, Lee Sin can cast Resonating Strike for the next 3 seconds.
Resonating Strike: Lee Sin dashes to the enemy hit by Sonic Wave, dealing physical damage based on the target's missing Health.;Safeguard / Iron Will;Safeguard: Lee Sin rushes to target ally, shielding himself from damage. If the ally is a champion, they are also shielded. After using Safeguard, Lee Sin can cast Iron Will for the next 3 seconds.
Iron Will: Lee Sin's intense training allows him to thrive in battle. For 4 seconds, Lee Sin gains Life Steal and Spell Vamp.;Tempest / Cripple;Tempest: Lee Sin smashes the ground, sending out a shockwave that deals magic damage and reveals enemy units hit. If Tempest hits an enemy, Lee Sin can cast cripple for the next 3 seconds.
Cripple: Lee Sin cripples nearby enemies damaged by Tempest, reducing their Move Speed for 4 seconds. Move Speed recovers gradually over the duration.;Dragon's Rage;Lee Sin performs a powerful roundhouse kick launching his target back, dealing physical damage to the target and any enemies they collide with. Enemies the target collides with are knocked into the air for a short duration. This technique was taught to him by Jesse Perring, although Lee Sin does not kick players off the map.;Flurry;After Lee Sin uses an ability, his next 2 basic attacks gain Attack Speed and return Energy.;
A master of Ionia’s ancient martial arts
column2: Lee Sin is a principled fighter who channels the essence of the dragon spirit to face any challenge. Though he lost his sight many years ago
column3: the warrior-monk has devoted his life to protecting his homeland against any who would dare upset its sacred balance. Enemies who underestimate his meditative demeanor will endure his fabled burning fists and blazing roundhouse kicks.

column1: Among the many spirits Ionians revere
column2: none are as storied as that of the dragon. While some believe it embodies ruin
column3: others view it as a symbol of rebirth. Few can say for certain
column4: and fewer still have ever been able to channel the dragon’s spirit
column5: and none so completely as Lee Sin.

column1: He arrived at the Shojin monastery as a boy
column2: claiming the dragon had chosen him to wield its power. The elder monks saw flashes of its fire in the talented child
column3: but also sensed his reckless pride
column4: and the disaster it could bring. Warily
column5: they nonetheless took him as a pupil—though
column6: as others advanced
column7: the elders kept him cleaning dishes and scrubbing floors.

column1: Lee Sin grew impatient. He longed to fulfill his destiny
column2: not waste time on chores.

column1: Sneaking into the hidden archives
column2: he found ancient texts describing how to call upon the spirit realm
column3: and chose to flaunt his skill during a combat lesson. Brashly
column4: he unleashed the dragon’s rage in a wild kick
column5: paralyzing his learned instructor. Consumed with shame and banished for his arrogance
column6: the young man set out to atone.

column1: Years passed. Lee Sin wandered far
column2: to distant places
column3: benevolently aiding those in need. Eventually he reached the Freljord
column4: where he met Udyr
column5: a wildman who channeled the primal beasts of his homeland. The so-called Spirit Walker struggled to control the powers that warred within him
column6: and Lee Sin began to wonder if controlling the dragon was even possible. Sharing a need for spiritual guidance
column7: the two men forged a bond
column8: and he invited Udyr on his journey back home.

column1: The two were dismayed to hear that the empire of Noxus had invaded and occupied Ionia. Monks from every province had fallen back to defend the holy monastery at Hirana
column2: high up in the mountains.

column1: Lee Sin and Udyr found it besieged. Noxian soldiers had broken through to Hirana’s great hall. As Udyr leapt to join the fray
column2: Lee Sin hesitated
column3: seeing his former peers and elders fall to the enemy’s blades. The wisdom of Hirana
column4: Shojin
column5: so much of Ionia’s ancient culture—all would be lost.

column1: With no other choice left
column2: he invoked the dragon spirit.

column1: A tempest of flames engulfed him
column2: searing his skin and burning the sight from his eyes. Imbued with wild power
column3: he crippled the invaders with a flurry of breakneck punches and rapid kicks
column4: the untamable spirit flaring brighter and hotter with each blow.

column1: The monks were victorious
column2: but Lee Sin’s desperate actions left the monastery in ruins
column3: and his vision would never return. At last
column4: in the blind darkness
column5: he understood that no mortal could ever bend the might of the dragon spirit to their will completely. Devastated
column6: agonized
column7: he bound a cloth over his sightless eyes and tried to stagger away down the mountain paths.

column1: But the surviving elders stopped him. In forsaking all desire for power
column2: their disgraced pupil was finally ready to begin anew. Although they would not forget his previous arrogance
column3: the monks offered absolution: the dragon’s wrath was deadly and unpredictable
column4: true enough
column5: but the humblest and worthiest mortal souls could counter its fiery nature
column6: and direct it from time to time.

column1: Gratefully
column2: Lee Sin stayed with the monks to rebuild their monastery
column3: and after the work was done and the Spirit Walker returned to the Freljord
column4: Lee Sin devoted himself fully toward the pursuit of enlightenment.

column1: In the years since the war with Noxus ended
column2: he has continued to meditate on his role in Ionia. Knowing his homeland has not faced the last of its trials
column3: Lee Sin must master himself
column4: and the dragon spirit within
column5: to face whatever foe is yet to come.

column1: 2;Olaf;the Berserker;Forsaken Olaf;Glacial Olaf;Brolaf;Pentakill Olaf;Marauder Olaf;Butcher Olaf;SKT T1 Olaf;Dragonslayer Olaf;Sentinel Olaf;Pentakill III: Lost Chapter Olaf;;;;;;Olaf can combine Berserker Rage, Vicious Strikes, and Ragnarok at low life to become deceptively strong.;The bonus healing granted by Vicious Strikes amplifies your Life Steal from all sources as well as heals from allies.;;;;Olaf becomes more dangerous the lower life he is. Save your disables to finish him off.;Preventing Olaf from reaching his axe will minimize the amount of harassment he can cause in the laning phase.;Olaf has reduced defenses from damage during Ragnarok, despite being immune to disables. If you can't escape from Olaf during Ragnarok, try focusing your damage on him with your teammates.;;Fighter;Tank;Mana;9;5;3;3;575.0;100;316.0;42.0;350;35;3.0;32.0;1.25;125;8.5;0.9;7.5;0.6;68.0;3.5;2.7;0.694;Undertow;Olaf throws an axe into the ground at a target location, dealing damage to enemies it passes through and slowing their Move Speed. If Olaf picks up the axe, the ability's cooldown is reduced by 4.5 seconds.;Vicious Strikes;Olaf's Attack Speed is increased, he gains Life Steal and has increased healing from all sources based on how much Health he is missing.;Reckless Swing;Olaf attacks with such force that it deals true damage to his target and himself, refunding the Health cost if he destroys the target.;Ragnarok;Olaf temporarily becomes immune to disables.;Berserker Rage;Olaf gains Attack Speed based on his missing Health.;

Most men would say that death is a thing to be feared; none of those men would be Olaf. The Berserker lives only for the roar of a battle cry and the clash of steel. Spurred on by his hunger for glory and the looming curse of a forgettable death
column2: Olaf throws himself into every fight with reckless abandon. Surrendering to the bloodlust deep within his being
column3: Olaf is only truly alive when grappling with the jaws of death.

column1: The coastal peninsula of Lokfar is among the most brutal places in the Freljord. There
column2: rage is the only fire to warm frozen bones
column3: blood is the only liquid that flows freely
column4: and there is no worse fate than to grow old
column5: frail
column6: and forgotten. Olaf was a warrior of Lokfar with no shortage of glories and no hesitation to share them. While boasting one evening with his clansmen over the burning embers of a razed village
column7: one of the elder warriors grew tired of Olaf's bluster. The old fighter goaded Olaf to read the omens and see if Olaf's fortunes matched his gloating. Emboldened by the challenge
column8: Olaf mocked the aged raider's envy and tossed the knuckle bones of a long-dead beast to predict the heights of glory he'd achieve in death. All mirth left the gathering as the clansmen read the portents: the bones spoke of a long life and a quiet passing.

column1: Infuriated
column2: Olaf stormed into the night determined to prove the prediction false by finding and slaughtering Lokfar's feared frost serpent. The monster had consumed thousands
column3: man and ship alike
column4: in its long lifetime and to die in battle with it would be a fitting end for any warrior. As Olaf hurled himself into the blackness of its maw
column5: he fell deeper into the blackness of his mind. When the shock of freezing water roused him from the dark
column6: there was only the butchered carcass of the beast afloat beside him. Thwarted but not defeated
column7: Olaf set out to hunt down every legendary creature with claws and fangs
column8: hoping that the next battle would be his last. Each time he charged headlong toward his coveted death
column9: only to be spared by the frenzy that washed over him while on its brink.

column1: Olaf concluded that no mere beast could grant him a warrior's death. His solution was to take on the most fearsome tribe in the Freljord: the Winter's Claw. Sejuani appeared amused by Olaf's challenge to her warband
column2: but his audacity would earn him no mercy. She ordered the charge and sent scores of her warriors to overwhelm Olaf. One by one
column3: they fell until he lost himself in the bloodlust once again
column4: effortlessly cutting a path to the leader of the Winter's Claw. The clash between Olaf and Sejuani rocked the glaciers with its force
column5: and though he seemed unstoppable
column6: Sejuani battled the berserker to a standstill. As they stood deadlocked
column7: Sejuani's glare penetrated Olaf's berserker haze in a way no weapon ever could. His frenzy abated long enough for her to make him an offer: Sejuani swore that she would find Olaf his glorious death if he would lend his axe to her campaign of conquest. In that moment
column8: Olaf vowed he would carve his legacy into the Freljord itself.

column1: 89;Leona;the Radiant Dawn;Valkyrie Leona;Defender Leona;Iron Solari Leona;Pool Party Leona;PROJECT: Leona;Barbecue Leona;Solar Eclipse Leona;Lunar Eclipse Leona;Mecha Kingdoms Leona;Battle Academia Leona;DWG Leona;Battle Academia Leona Prestige Edition;;;;Lead the charge and mark your foes with Sunlight before your allies deal damage.;Shield of Daybreak and Zenith Blade form a powerful offensive combo.;You can absorb a huge amount of damage using Eclipse, but you must stay near enemies to gain the bonus duration.;;;When Leona activates Eclipse, you have three seconds to get away from her before she deals damage.;Only foes in the center of Solar Flare get stunned, so you can often avoid this if you're quick.;;;Tank;Support;Mana;4;8;3;4;576.0;87;302.0;40.0;335;47;3.6;32.0;1.25;125;8.5;0.85;6.0;0.8;60.0;3.0;2.9;0.625;Shield of Daybreak;Leona uses her shield to perform her next basic attack, dealing bonus magic damage and stunning the target.;Eclipse;Leona raises her shield to gain Damage Reduction, Armor, and Magic Resist. When the duration first ends, if there are nearby enemies, she will deal magic damage to them and prolong the duration of the effect.;Zenith Blade;Leona projects a solar image of her sword, dealing magic damage to all enemies in a line. When the image fades, the last enemy champion struck will be briefly immobilized and Leona will dash to them.;Solar Flare;Leona calls down a beam of solar energy, dealing damage to enemies in an area. Enemies in the center of the area are stunned, while enemies on the outside are slowed.;Sunlight;Damaging spells afflict enemies with Sunlight for 1.5 seconds. When allied Champions deal damage to those targets, they consume the Sunlight to deal additional magic damage.;
Imbued with the fire of the sun
column2: Leona is a warrior templar of the Solari who defends Mount Targon with her Zenith Blade and Shield of Daybreak. Her skin shimmers with starfire while her eyes burn with the power of the celestial Aspect within her. Armored in gold and bearing a terrible burden of ancient knowledge
column3: Leona brings enlightenment to some
column4: death to others.

column1: To live in the lands surrounding the towering peak of Mount Targon is to embrace a life of hardship. That many willingly do so is testament to the power of the human spirit to endure anything in search of meaning and higher purpose. As harsh as the rugged foothills of the mountain’s base are
column2: it is nothing compared to the hardships borne by those who dwell on the mountain itself.

column1: Living high on Targon is fraught with danger. When the glittering mist wreathing the summit descends
column2: it does not come alone. All manner of otherworldly things are left behind when it withdraws; radiant creatures that kill at random and muttering voices that whisper unspeakable secrets to drive mortals mad.

column1: Eking a living from mountain plants and their precious herds
column2: the Rakkor tribe dwells at the very limits of human endurance; honing their warrior skills to fight the war at the end of the world. Rakkor means Tribe of the Last Sun
column3: and its people believe that many worlds have existed before this one
column4: each of which has been destroyed by a great catastrophe. Its seers teach that when this sun is destroyed there will be no more
column5: so its warriors must be ready to fight those who seek to extinguish its light.

column1: To the Rakkor
column2: battle is an act of devotion
column3: an offering to keep the sun’s light shining. All members of the tribe are expected to fight and kill without mercy or hesitation
column4: and Leona was no exception. She learned to fight as soon as she could walk
column5: mastering sword and shield with ease. She was fascinated by the mists wreathing the summit and often wondered what might lie beyond them. That fascination did not stop her from fighting the ferocious beasts
column6: inhuman entities and pallid
column7: eyeless strangers that came down the mountain.

column1: She fought and killed them as she had been taught until one day when young Leona encountered a golden-skinned boy with horns and bat-like wings wandering on the mountainside. He did not speak her language
column2: but it was clear he was lost and frightened. His skin shimmered with soft light
column3: and though everything she had been taught since birth told her to attack
column4: Leona could not bring herself to murder someone so obviously helpless. Instead
column5: she led the boy to a pathway leading to the summit
column6: watching as he walked into a ray of sunlight and vanished.

column1: When she returned to the Rakkor
column2: she found herself accused of failing in her duty to the sun. A boy named Atreus had seen her leading a creature of the mountain to safety instead of killing it. Atreus had told his father what Leona had done and he in turn denounced her as a heretic for going against the beliefs of her people. Leona did not dispute this
column3: and the laws of the Rakkor allowed only one sentence for such a transgression – trial by combat. Leona would face Atreus in the fighting pits beneath the noonday sun
column4: and by its light would judgment be rendered. Leona and Atreus were evenly matched; her warrior skills were formidable
column5: but Atreus had ever been single-minded in his pursuit of martial excellence. Leona took up her sword and shield
column6: Atreus his long spear
column7: and none who gathered around the pit could predict the battle’s outcome.

column1: Leona and Atreus fought beneath the blazing sun
column2: and though both bled freely from dozens of wounds
column3: neither could land a deathblow. As the sun dipped toward the horizon
column4: an elder of the Solari marched into the Rakkor camp with three gold-armored warriors and called a halt to the duel. The Solari were adherents of a martial faith built around sun worship
column5: whose unforgiving tenets dictated life around and upon Mount Targon. The elder had been led to the Rakkor by dreams and an ancient Solari prophecy that spoke of a warrior whose fire burned brighter than the sun
column6: a daughter of Targon who would bring unity to the celestial realm. The elder believed Leona was that daughter and upon learning the nature of her transgression
column7: his belief was only strengthened.

column1: The tribal seers warned against interfering in the duel
column2: but the elder was adamant; Leona must come with him and become one of the Solari
column3: to be fully instructed in their beliefs. The Rakkor were fiercely independent
column4: but even they paid heed to the holy decrees of the Solari. The warriors lifted Leona from the pit and bore her wounded body from the Rakkor toward her new life.

column1: The Solari temple was a towering citadel on the eastern slopes of Mount Targon
column2: a glittering spire of gold-veined marble and polished granite. Here
column3: Leona learned the ways of the sacred order  – how they worshipped the sun as the source of all life and rejected all other forms of light as false. Its strictures were absolute and unyielding
column4: but fueled by her belief in the elder’s prophecy
column5: Leona excelled in this disciplined environment
column6: devouring her new faith’s teachings as a parched man in a desert seizes upon fresh water. Leona trained every day with the warrior order of the Solari
column7: the Ra-Horak - a Rakkor title which means Followers of the Horizon - honing her already fearsome skills with a blade into something sublime. In time
column8: Leona rose to command the Ra-Horak
column9: becoming known around Mount Targon as a just
column10: devoted and
column11: some might say
column12: zealous servant of the Sun.

column1: Her path changed forever when she was called to escort a young member of the Solari to the heart of the temple. The girl’s hair was purest white and a shimmering rune glowed upon her forehead. Her name was Diana
column2: a troublemaker well known to Leona from the exasperated woes of the temple elders. Diana had gone missing months before
column3: but now returned
column4: clad in a suit of pale armor that glinted with strange silver light. Diana claimed to bring great news
column5: revelations that would shake the Solari to its foundations
column6: but which she would only reveal to the temple elders.

column1: Leona brought Diana in under armed guard
column2: for her warrior instinct sensed something awry in the girl’s demeanor. Presented to the elders
column3: Diana spoke of the Lunari
column4: an ancient and proscribed faith that venerated the moon
column5: and how all the truths the Solari clung to were incomplete. She described a realm beyond the mountaintop
column6: a place where the sun and moon were not enemies
column7: where new truths could show them fresh ways to look at the world. Leona felt her anger build with every word Diana spoke
column8: and when the elders rejected her words and named her a blasphemer
column9: Leona knew it would be her blade that ended the heretic’s life.

column1: Leona saw Diana’s incredulous fury at the elders’ denial
column2: but before she could react
column3: the white-haired girl hurled herself forward. Blinding light exploded from Diana’s outstretched hands
column4: and orbs of silver fire burned the elders to dust in the blink of an eye. White flames surged in a hurricane of cold lightning and blasted Leona from the chamber. When she regained consciousness
column5: she found Diana gone and the Solari leaderless. As its remaining members struggled to come to terms with this attack on their most sacred space
column6: Leona knew there was only one path open to her. She would hunt down and destroy the heretic Diana for the murder of the Solari elders.

column1: Diana’s trail was easy to find. The heretic’s footsteps were like shimmering mercury to Leona’s eyes
column2: leading ever higher up the slopes of Mount Targon. Leona did not falter
column3: climbing through a landscape that seemed strange and unfamiliar
column4: as though she followed paths that had never existed until this moment. The sun and moon passed overhead in a blur
column5: as if many days and nights passed with her every breath. She neither stopped to eat nor drink
column6: letting fury sustain her beyond what should have been humanly possible.

column1: Eventually Leona reached the top of the mountain
column2: breathless
column3: exhausted
column4: starved and stripped of all thought save punishing Diana. There
column5: sitting on a rock at the top of the mountain was the same golden-skinned boy whose life she had spared as a child. Behind him
column6: the sky burned with blazing light
column7: a borealis of impossible colors and the suggestion of a majestic city of gold and silver. In its fluted towers and glittering minarets
column8: Leona saw how the Solari temple echoed its magnificence and fell to her knees in rapture.

column1: The golden-skinned boy spoke to her in the old Rakkor tongue
column2: telling her he had been waiting for her to follow him since that day
column3: and that he hoped she wasn’t too late. He held out his hand and offered to show her miracles and to know the minds of gods.

column1: Leona had never turned from anything in her life. She took the boy’s hand as he smiled and led her into the light. A column of searing illumination stabbed down from the heavens and engulfed Leona. She felt an awesome presence filling her limbs with terrifying power and forgotten knowledge from the earliest epochs of the world. Her armor and weapons burned to ash in the cosmic fire and were in turn reborn as ornate warplate
column2: a shield of sunlight wrought in gold and a sword of chained dawnlight.

column1: The warrior who came down the mountain looked the same as the one who had climbed it
column2: but inside Leona was much changed. She still had her memories and thoughts
column3: was still master of her own flesh
column4: but a sliver of something vast and inhuman had chosen her to be its mortal vessel. It gifted her with incredible powers and awful knowledge that haunted her eyes and weighed heavily upon her soul; knowledge she could only ever share with one person.

column1: Now
column2: more than ever
column3: Leona knew she had to find Diana.

column1: 38;Kassadin;the Void Walker;Festival Kassadin;Deep One Kassadin;Pre-Void Kassadin;Harbinger Kassadin;Cosmic Reaver Kassadin;Count Kassadin;Hextech Kassadin;;;;;;;;;Kassadin has multiple item paths; he can go caster via Mana and Ability Power or anti-caster with Cooldown Reduction and Magic Resist.";Kassadin's ultimate has many uses and is on a shorter cooldown than most
column2: use it often.;Try to get the Ancient Golem buff to counteract Riftwalk's increasing Mana cost.;;;Kassadin deals mostly magic damage. If he's doing well consider buying magic resist items like Mercury's Treads and Banshee's Veil.;Each time Kassadin consecutively uses Riftwalk
column3: he pays more and more mana. Keep this in mind as you chase him.;It takes 6 spell casts for Kassadin's slow
column4: Force Pulse
column5: to become castable. If he levels up that ability
column6: judiciously use your own skills while laning against him.;;Assassin;Mage;Mana;3;5;8;8;576.0;105;400.0;87.0;335;19;2.8;30.0;0.5;150;6.0;0.5;6.0;0.8;59.0;3.9;3.7;0.64;Null Sphere;Kassadin fires an orb of void energy at a target
column7: dealing damage and interrupting channels. The excess energy forms around himself
column8: granting a temporary shield that absorbs magic damage.;Nether Blade;Passive: Kassadin's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage. Active: Kassadin's next basic attack deals significant bonus magic damage and restores Mana.;Force Pulse;Kassadin draws energy from spells cast in his vicinity. Upon charging up
column9: Kassadin can use Force Pulse to damage and slow enemies in a cone in front of him.;Riftwalk;Kassadin teleports to a nearby location dealing damage to nearby enemy units. Multiple Riftwalks in a short period of time cost additional Mana but also deal additional damage.;Void Stone;Kassadin takes reduced magic damage and ignores unit collision.;"

column1: Cutting a burning swath through the darkest places of the world
column2: Kassadin knows his days are numbered. A widely traveled Shuriman guide and adventurer
column3: he had chosen to raise a family among the peaceful southern tribes—until the day his village was consumed by the Void. He vowed vengeance
column4: combining a number of arcane artifacts and forbidden technologies for the struggle ahead. Finally
column5: Kassadin set out for the wastelands of Icathia
column6: ready to face any monstrous Void-construct in his search for their self-proclaimed prophet
column7: Malzahar.

column1: Kassadin started life as a lowly offcast
column2: walking the harsh sands of the Great Sai alongside merchant caravans to draw predators away from their more valuable goods. He survived many of these treks across the desert
column3: and began to serve less as bait
column4: and more as a guide.

column1: The foreign tongues that sought his talents
column2: “Kas sai a dyn?” or “whom does the desert know?” often slurred their Shuriman
column3: and so he became fondly known as Kassadin in the back alleys and markets of Bel’zhun. He spent many years exploring the ancient ruins of his homeland
column4: making his employers exceedingly wealthy
column5: but it wasn’t until a dig near Zirima that he found a treasure of his own—he fell in love with a woman from one of the desert tribes.

column1: With his wife and newborn daughter
column2: Kassadin settled in a small village in the rocky canyons to the south. He was on the road often
column3: his work sometimes requiring him to accompany particularly valuable relics to some faraway sponsor. But
column4: no matter where his travels took him
column5: Kassadin would always return with exciting tales from the world beyond.

column1: Journeying home from distant Piltover
column2: Kassadin and his fellow caravaneers were watering their beasts at an oasis when they encountered the first terrified survivors stumbling out of the desert. They spoke of the disaster that had claimed their homes
column3: as if the maw of the underworld itself had opened up to devour them. They had barely escaped with their lives.

column1: Fearing for his own family’s safety
column2: Kassadin left the others behind
column3: riding hard
column4: driving his mount almost to exhaustion. When he finally reached the place where his village had once stood
column5: he found only shifting sand and rubble. He clawed at the debris until his hands bled
column6: screaming out his wife and daughter’s names
column7: though no answer came. Days later
column8: Kassadin’s companions caught up to him
column9: now just a broken and empty man weeping beneath the scorching sun.

column1: They dragged him back to Zirima
column2: but Kassadin would go no further. For years
column3: he tried to drown his grief
column4: reduced to little more than a vagrant… until word reached town of “the Prophet.”

column1: Whispers of unspeakable horrors that dwelt beneath the earth
column2: and of sacrifices made in their name
column3: chilled Kassadin to the bone. He knew well the legends of old Icathia
column4: and the fate that befell that accursed place—if the Void had been deliberately drawn toward Shurima once more
column5: then it had likely been the death of his entire village
column6: and countless more besides. He also knew there were few
column7: if any
column8: who could stand against it.

column1: In that moment
column2: Kassadin swore that he would avenge his wife and daughter
column3: by destroying this insidious Prophet
column4: and the source of his abyssal power. He was a man who had made his living by finding safe paths through the most dangerous places
column5: and resolved to arm himself with the most arcane and esoteric weapons ever known in Valoran
column6: fused with Zaunite ingenuity
column7: and blessed by Ionian spirit-healers. He called in every favor he could
column8: from scholars of antiquities to common smugglers
column9: for their help in… acquiring what he sought. Many called him a madman
column10: believing this the last time they would ever see their old friend alive—Kassadin merely thanked them for their concern
column11: and bid them farewell. He would face the Void alone.

column1: Last of all
column2: he stole the infamous Nether Blade of Horok
column3: the sword that had slain a thousand deceivers in the latter days of the empire. He could feel the cold pull of oblivion in its edge
column4: but no longer had any regard for his own mortality
column5: and nothing of his old life left to lose.

column1: Disguised in the robes of a pilgrim
column2: more than a decade since he had last set foot anywhere near that desolate land
column3: Kassadin made his way into Icathia. He would go where no man was ever meant to walk.

column1: He would have his vengeance
column2: even if it killed him.

column1: 164;Camille;the Steel Shadow;Program Camille;Coven Camille;iG Camille;Arcana Camille;;;;;;;;;;;;Try waiting until the other team is distracted with fighting your team, and use Hookshot to pick off vulnerable targets.;Use the CC from your abilities to land both of your Precision Protocol attacks on enemies.;;;;Camille's shield only works against one damage type, so hit her when she's vulnerable to your damage.;The Hextech Ultimatum has a very short range to cast, so try to flash away from her before she gets close.;;;Fighter;Tank;Mana;8;6;3;4;576.0;85;339.0;52.0;340;35;3.8;32.1;1.25;125;8.5;0.8;8.15;0.75;68.0;3.5;2.5;0.644;Precision Protocol;Camille's next attack deals bonus damage and grants bonus movement speed. This spell can be recast for a short period of time, doing significantly increased bonus damage if Camille delays a period of time between the two attacks.;Tactical Sweep;Camille blasts in a cone after a delay, dealing damage. Enemies in the outer half are slowed and take extra damage, while also healing Camille.;Hookshot;Camille pulls herself to a wall, leaping off and knocking up enemy champions upon landing.;The Hextech Ultimatum;Camille dashes to target champion, anchoring them to the area. She also deals bonus magic damage to the target with her basic attacks.;Adaptive Defenses;Basic attacks on champions grant a shield equal to a percentage of Camille's maximum health against their damage type (Physical or Magic) for a brief duration.;
Weaponized to execute outside the boundaries of the law
column2: Camille is an elegant and elite operative who ensures the Piltover machine and its Zaunite underbelly runs smoothly. Camille's true strength is her adaptability and attention to detail
column3: viewing sloppy technique as an embarrassment that must be put to order. Raised among manners and money
column4: she is the Principal Intelligencer of Clan Ferros
column5: tasked with cutting down her family's darker problems with surgical precision. With a mind as sharp as the blades she bears
column6: Camille's pursuit of superiority through hextech body augmentation has left many to wonder if she is more machine than woman.

column1: Camille's family gained most of its wealth through a rare crystal harvested from a creature native to the sands of a distant valley. These first hex-crystals
column2: or “first crystals
column3: ” contained power normally reserved to those born with innate magical ability. Camille's Great-Great Aunt Elicia lost an arm
column4: and nearly her life
column5: during one such early expedition. Her sacrifice was celebrated
column6: and it set an expectation that is still reflected in the Ferros family motto today
column7: “For family
column8: will I give.”

column1: The creatures Elicia Ferros found
column2: the Brackern
column3: were not an unending resource
column4: and Camille's family had to look for ways to augment the crystals they had accumulated. Utilizing certain shadow investments in chemtech and runic alchemy
column5: the Ferros family brought to market the less powerful
column6: but easier to procure
column7: synthetic hex-crystals. Such power often comes with consequences
column8: and the production of synthetic crystals is rumored to be a heavy contributor to the Zaun Gray.

column1: Born into one of the wealthiest houses in Piltover's illustrious Bluewind Court
column2: Camille was the sixth child of Rhodri and Gemma
column3: then Masters of Clan Ferros. However
column4: Camille and her younger brother
column5: Stevan
column6: were the only children who survived to adulthood.

column1: With the family's focus set upon Camille as the eldest surviving child
column2: no expense was spared in her education
column3: instilling both her aristocratic attitude and sense of duty at an early age. With so many of Valoran's finest visiting Piltover
column4: Camille had no shortage of exceptional tutors. Accordingly
column5: she speaks the Zhyun dialect of Southern Ionia and Ur-Noxian fluently. As a child
column6: Camille was encouraged to take an interest in Valoran history
column7: and learned to read and write Ancient Shuriman while assisting her father on digs in the Odyn Valley. Camille also became quite an accomplished musician and plays the cellovinna at a concert master level.

column1: Among the leading families of Piltover
column2: it is customary for one of the younger children to take up the mantle of the family's principal intelligencer
column3: the sword and shield of their clan. Those chosen are tasked with operating in the best interest of a Piltover family
column4: working with the clan master to secure the family's continued success by any means necessary. Clan Ferros
column5: with its wealth of secrets
column6: has always taken this position seriously
column7: putting forward considerable resources to ensure its intelligencer was always the best. Camille's brother
column8: Stevan
column9: had been born with a weak constitution and was considered ineligible. Her parents—her father especially—were extremely proud when Camille took Stevan's place as the principal intelligencer for the clan. Stevan's jealousy simmered as he watched Camille embrace her additional training and tutoring. She became quite adept in combat
column10: espionage
column11: and interrogation. Camille's favorite techniques were fighting with the Shon-Xan footed glaive
column12: gaining intelligence through classic inquisition
column13: and rappelling from a certain broken clock tower with a grappling line and hook native to the Western Serpent Isles.

column1: When Camille was 25
column2: she and her father were attacked by a band of augmented thugs. The gang was determined to move up in Zaun's underworld by laying hands on some of the family's more lucrative secrets. Both Camille and her father were wounded. Camille recovered
column3: but her father succumbed to his wounds. Camille's mother passed away soon after
column4: unable to bear the anguish that settled over the house. The title of clan master passed to Camille's brother
column5: Stevan. Young
column6: impetuous
column7: and eager to prove himself as a strong leader of the family
column8: Stevan doubled the already extensive Ferros research in human hextech augmentation.

column1: After a year of mourning
column2: the Ferros house was decorated resplendently for the next Progress Day auditions. Stevan personally oversaw the induction of Hakim Naderi as the lead artificer for the family
column3: a promising young crystallographer from the Shuriman coastal city of Bel'zhun.

column1: Shaken by her inability to protect her father
column2: Camille requested a hextech augmentation from Hakim to push her power beyond that of her human body. When Hakim met Camille
column3: he was instantly enamored and was determined to draw Camille out of the darkness surrounding her parent's death. They bonded over the work at hand and late night stories of the sands of Shurima. After months of intimate work together
column4: Camille could no longer deny she returned Hakim's feelings. As the day of Camille's augmentation approached
column5: they grew reckless in their affair
column6: as they knew the surgery would mark the end of their time together. Hakim would move onto other projects for the family
column7: and Camille would once again be fully committed to her duty as principal intelligencer. More than that
column8: Hakim worried that in carving away Camille's heart
column9: he might cut too deeply and deprive her of her humanity as well.

column1: Days before Camille's operation
column2: Hakim's reservations about the procedure boiled over. He proposed marriage and begged Camille to run away with him instead. He painted a picture of their future--wandering the sun-kissed sands of Bel'Zhun
column3: uncovering the ruins of Ancient Shurima
column4: raising their children together--a future far away from the duty that bound Camille to her house. For the first time in her life
column5: Camille was torn.

column1: Stevan's position as clan master depended heavily on Camille's ability to execute his vision. When he learned of the secret proposal
column2: he saw his principal intelligencer dangerously close to slipping away
column3: and by extension
column4: his control over the Ferros family. Stevan devised a plan to remind Camille of the duty she swore to their father. Stevan set himself up to be attacked the next time he knew Camille and Hakim were to be together. Using the fragility that had once denied him his place
column5: Stevan presented himself bloodied and beaten to his sister
column6: preying on her dark memories of the night she failed her father. Camille could not deny the evidence that stained her hands
column7: proof of what could happen when the intelligencer's attention was divided.

column1: Hakim pleaded with Camille
column2: but she would not have it. Hers was a duty going back generations
column3: one that if she had been better prepared could have saved her father's life and should have prevented injury to her brother. Camille insisted her surgery go forward and ended her relationship with Hakim.

column1: Hakim still loved Camille and knew that he was the only one who could perform the surgery safely. Unable to let the love of his life die on the operating table
column2: he cut away Camille's heart as she asked. Once he was sure that her new mechanical heart would beat without him
column3: Hakim resigned. Camille awoke to find the lab she and Hakim had shared empty and abandoned.

column1: Camille threw herself into her work
column2: taking on further refinements in the form of bladed legs
column3: grapple-spindled hips
column4: and other
column5: minor hex-augmentations. Each addition pushed Camille and the ever more ambitious technology to the limits. This led some to wonder how much of the lady was still left. As Clan Ferros amassed more power and wealth
column6: the missions Camille ran for her brother became darker and more deadly.

column1: Thanks to the rejuvenating vibrations of her hex-tech heart
column2: time passed for Camille without age
column3: and soon
column4: Hakim Naderi became a distant memory. The years were not so kind to her brother. Stevan's body grew more frail
column5: but that did nothing to loosen his iron grip on the title of Clan Master.

column1: On a recent assignment
column2: Camille uncovered a naïve Piltovan's ill-fated engagement and with it a series of events that exposed the depth of Stevan's treason. The lies that drove Hakim away now threatened to destroy Camille and the clan. She saw his greedy machinations for what they were; selfish and no longer in the best interest of the family. In that moment
column3: she discarded the last sentiment she felt toward her brother and took control of Clan Ferros.

column1: Camille now runs the family's public affairs through her favorite grand-niece she installed as master of the clan. This allows Camille to continue the more shadowy operations that ensure her family's success. Committed to her role as a solver of difficult problems
column2: Camille has embraced her more-than-human transformation and the cutting judgment it affords her. With hex-crystal energy coursing through her veins
column3: Camille has never been content to sit idle
column4: and instead gains invigoration from well-executed industrial espionage
column5: a fresh-brewed cup of tea
column6: and long walks in the Gray.

column1: 111;Nautilus;the Titan of the Depths;Abyssal Nautilus;Subterranean Nautilus;AstroNautilus;Warden Nautilus;Worldbreaker Nautilus;Conqueror Nautilus;Shan Hai Scrolls Nautilus;;;;;;;;;While ganking, consider aiming Dredge Line at nearby terrain and following it up with Riptide for a higher hit rate.;Riptide has a delayed blast timing on activation - you can use this while running away or when enemies are incoming to serve as a deterrent.;;;;If Nautilus uses Riptide right next to you, hold in place until the ripple effect finishes before running. Running early will run straight into the secondary explosions, causing you to take additional damage and slow.;While Nautilus is shielded, he is capable of dealing large amounts of area of effect damage with his basic attacks - consider taking down the shield if you have time.;;;Tank;Fighter;Mana;4;6;6;6;576.0;86;400.0;47.0;325;39;3.75;32.0;1.25;175;8.5;0.55;8.63;0.5;61.0;3.3;1.0;0.706;Dredge Line;Nautilus hurls his anchor forward.  Colliding with an enemy pulls them and Nautilus together, dealing magic damage.  Colliding with terrain pulls Nautilus towards it.;Titan's Wrath;Nautilus gains a temporary Shield.  While it persists, his Attacks deal damage over time to his target and surrounding enemies.;Riptide;Nautilus creates three exploding waves around himself. Each explosion damages and slows enemies.;Depth Charge;Nautilus fires a shockwave into the earth that chases an opponent. This shockwave rips up the earth above it, knocking enemies into the air. When it reaches the opponent, the shockwave erupts, knocking his target into the air and stunning them.;Staggering Blow;Nautilus' first Attack against a target deals increased physical damage and roots them briefly.;
A lonely legend as old as the first piers sunk in Bilgewater
column2: the armored goliath known as Nautilus roams the dark waters off the coast of the Blue Flame Isles. Driven by a forgotten betrayal
column3: he strikes without warning
column4: swinging his enormous anchor to save the wretched
column5: and drag the greedy to their doom. It is said he comes for those who forget to pay the “Bilgewater tithe”
column6: pulling them down beneath the waves with him—an iron-clad reminder that none can escape the depths.

column1: To understand the legend of Nautilus
column2: one must first know the man—for even the tallest of tavern tales agree
column3: he was indeed a man.

column1: Though the waves have washed away the name he was born with
column2: most remember Nautilus as no mere sailor
column3: but as a salvage diver. Just beyond the southernmost reach of the Blue Flame Isles lies a graveyard of ships
column4: rumored lost while searching for a blessed land
column5: looking to trade wealth for immortality. On a fair day
column6: their glittering holds beckon from beneath the surface. Many crews sought divers to collect the lost fortune
column7: and none could match the skill of the quick-sinking hulk of solid muscle that was Nautilus.

column1: With lungs that could steal the air from a galleon’s sails
column2: Nautilus preferred to freedive. Always bringing up plenty of gold or jewels for the crew
column3: the man demanded no special wages—he asked only that the captain toss a coin overboard as they set out
column4: honoring and appeasing the vast ocean. A sailor’s superstition to be sure
column5: but many a sea-fearing crew made such offerings to ensure a safe return.

column1: Years of salvage depleted the easy treasure
column2: each haul becoming less and less
column3: until one day Nautilus’s crew learned that their ship and working papers had been bought out from under them.

column1: The dawn was scarlet the morning the new captain came aboard. Hailing from a foreign port
column2: he brought with him a giant suit of brass and iron. He zeroed in on Nautilus; indeed
column3: he had purchased the command because of Nautilus. It was clear the captain was obsessed with a specific wreck
column4: one shrouded in darkness even on a fair day. The diving armor could withstand the pressures of the ocean floor far longer than any man
column5: long enough to collect what was hidden in the abnormal murk.

column1: The crew agreed working was better than starving
column2: and Nautilus found himself being bolted into the suit
column3: the wooden deck groaning under the load. Panic rose in his throat when he realized that they had nothing to pay the tithe. The foreign captain laughed as Nautilus was lowered into the water. He assured the crew that whatever the Bearded Lady was protecting would make them all rich beyond their wildest dreams. When Nautilus returned to the surface
column4: they would make their silly sacrifice.

column1: As Nautilus sank
column2: the light above dimmed
column3: and all grew quiet
column4: the man’s own breath the only sound echoing in the iron suit. Then something reached out from the depths. He was being pulled down
column5: and for the first time Nautilus felt liquid fear wrap itself around his heart. It was not treasure his captain sought
column6: but some slumbering
column7: eldritch power.

column1: Nautilus grabbed the anchor chain
column2: his last connection to the world above
column3: and hauled himself up even as the thing below sought to drag him down. But the weight was too much. Just as his giant metal fingers were about to breach the surface
column4: the chain snapped. Nautilus screamed within the suit
column5: but none could hear him. He tumbled back into the inky maelstrom
column6: clutching the sinking anchor in desperation. Dark tendrils enveloped him
column7: and he could only watch as the dimming outline of his ship faded away. Then everything went black.

column1: When Nautilus awoke on the ocean floor
column2: he was something… different. The darkness could no longer hurt him. The great metal suit had become a seamless shell around him
column3: concealing the bond that the primordial power had made with his spirit. Trapped in the sunless depths
column4: he could remember only one thing—the new captain’s broken promise.

column1: Nautilus vowed
column2: there and then
column3: that all would pay the ocean’s tithe. He would see to it himself.

column1: Driven ever forward by this thought
column2: he trudged toward the shore. But by the time he reached Bilgewater
column3: years had passed
column4: and he could find no traces of his captain or crew. There was no life to which he could return
column5: no revenge he could take. Instead he returned to the sea
column6: allowing his anger to surface on the greedy
column7: gutting their ships with his mighty anchor.

column1: Sometimes
column2: in the tumble of waves
column3: distant memories of who he was push up above the waterline… but always the man who is Nautilus stays drowned just below the surface.

column1: 27;Singed;the Mad Chemist;Riot Squad Singed;Hextech Singed;Surfer Singed;Mad Scientist Singed;Augmented Singed;Snow Day Singed;SSW Singed;Black Scourge Singed;Beekeeper Singed;Resistance Singed;;;;;;Poison Trail is very effective at farming and harassing, allowing Singed to dominate the flow of whatever lane he's in.;Use Insanity Potion to trick your opponents into chasing you through your Poison Trail.;Flinging enemies into your tower can deal heavy amounts of damage to them.;;;Keep your distance to avoid being Flung back into Singed's allies.;Singed needs to run close to your team to be effective. Try to take advantage of this by using crowd control effects on him while attacking his allies.;Be careful when chasing Singed. He's very difficult to bring down, and can leave his Poison Trail to damage you in your pursuit.;;Tank;Fighter;Mana;4;8;7;5;580.0;85;330.0;45.0;345;34;3.5;32.0;1.25;125;9.5;0.55;7.5;0.55;63.0;3.38;1.9;0.613;Poison Trail;Leaves a trail of poison behind Singed, dealing damage to enemies caught in the path.;Mega Adhesive;Throws a vial of mega adhesive on the ground, slowing and grounding enemies who walk on it.;Fling;Damages target enemy unit and flings them into the air behind Singed. If the target Singed flings lands in his Mega Adhesive, they are also rooted.;Insanity Potion;Singed drinks a potent brew of chemicals, granting him increased combat stats, and making his Poison Trail apply Grievous Wounds.;Noxious Slipstream;Singed drafts off nearby champions, gaining a burst of movement speed when passing them.;
Singed is a Zaunite alchymist of unmatched intellect
column2: who has devoted his life to pushing the boundaries of knowledge—with no price
column3: even his own sanity
column4: too high to pay. Is there a method to his madness? His concoctions rarely fail
column5: but it appears to many that Singed has lost all sense of humanity
column6: leaving a toxic trail of misery and terror in his wake.

column1: The twisted
column2: unfathomable madman known across Runeterra as Singed began his life as an ordinary man in Piltover. As a child
column3: he displayed a prodigious intellect and a boundless sense of curiosity. The principles and interactions of the natural world fascinated him
column4: eventually leading him to pursue a scholarship at the prestigious University of Piltover.

column1: It did not take long for his brilliance to be recognized.
Singed’s research into the natural sciences was impressive—groundbreaking even—but he found that Piltover’s attention had been stolen away ever since the discovery of hextech
column2: and the opportunities the hybrid of magic and technology presented. Singed found himself on the outside looking in
column3: seeing magic as a crutch leaned upon by those who were either incapable of understanding how the world worked
column4: or simply didn’t care enough to find out. He became a vocal critic of what he saw as a new and ignorant fad within the university.

column1: Singed instead delved into the chemical potential of alchemy
column2: and despite the boon his intellect garnered for the field
column3: his efforts earned him little more than the ridicule of his fellow academics. Before long
column4: his funding had dried up
column5: and he was forced out of the university
column6: and out of Piltover. Singed had no choice but to begin a new life—in Zaun.

column1: In the undercity
column2: life was cheap
column3: and the demand for innovation high. Singed was quickly able to find work in the emergent chemtech industries
column4: lending his skills and relentless drive for a variety of increasingly unscrupulous clients. His experiments
column5: often of questionable ethicality
column6: cast a wide net: augmenting humans
column7: animals
column8: and even fusions of the two
column9: among countless other endeavours. Nonetheless
column10: he pushed his new field forward at an incredibly rapid pace
column11: but often at the expense of his own health. Understanding better than anyone the chemical needs of a living body
column12: he engineered stimulants that could keep him alert and working for weeks at a time
column15: and sleep for days on end.

column1: Singed’s obsessive
column2: tireless efforts as an alchymist meant he found no shortage of patrons and clients
column3: eventually including even the warmasons of Noxus. The gossip was rampant across both Piltover and Zaun that the empire and their Grand General were on the verge of bankruptcy from paying Piltover’s extortionate tithes for military passage to the campaigns in northern Shurima
column4: and soon they might be looking elsewhere for new
column5: less expensive conquests. So long as they paid his fees
column6: Singed didn’t care.

column1: After years of smaller
column2: off-and-on projects
column3: Singed was approached by a Noxian military commander named Emystan
column4: who contracted the alchymist to help her break the bitter stalemate of the war in Ionia. She needed a new kind of weapon from him
column5: the like of which no one had ever seen before… and she could make him a wealthy man indeed.

column1: Putting aside all other concerns
column2: Singed poured all of his intellect
column3: knowledge
column4: and experience into the synthesis of this new weapon. The result of his efforts was an alchemical fire that was unstable
column5: volatile
column6: and utterly horrifying. When it was finally unleashed in Ionia against the enemies of Noxus
column7: it burned hot enough to fracture stone
column8: and tainted the earth around it with dense
column9: metallic poisons so completely that almost nothing would grow there. Even Emystan’s own allies were appalled
column10: though not quite enough to name her and Singed as war criminals.

column1: Now
column2: without any restraint for capital
column3: materials
column4: or even subjects to experiment upon
column5: Singed nonetheless feels the weight of years upon him. His most recent work has taken a decidedly more biological angle
column6: and of a far more dramatic scope. A recent exercise in the melding of animal
column7: man
column8: and machine left his laboratories in ruins
column9: his face held together with filthy bandages
column10: and his subject freely prowling the streets of Zaun
column11: yet Singed remains undeterred.

column1: He has already mastered the destruction of flesh
column2: and thus now has turned to the preservation and transformation of it… and perhaps even the possibility that life need not end with an inescapable death.

She can activate this to deal magic damage to nearby enemies, dealing extra true damage on the edge.;Watch Out! Eep!;Lillia deals damage in a nearby area, dealing heavy damage in the center.;Swirlseed;Lillia hurls a seed that damages and slows those it lands on. If it doesn't hit anything, it will continue rolling until it hits a wall or target.;Lilting Lullaby;Lillia causes all enemies with Dream Dust on them to become Drowsy before falling asleep. Those enemies will take extra damage on being forcibly woken up.;Dream-Laden Bough;Hitting a champion or monster with a skill will deal additional max Health damage over time.;
Intensely shy
column2: the fae fawn Lillia skittishly wanders Ionia’s forests. Hiding just out of sight of mortals—whose mysterious natures have long captivated
column3: but intimidated
column4: her—Lillia hopes to discover why their dreams no longer reach the ancient Dreaming Tree. She now travels Ionia with a magical branch in hand
column5: in an effort to find people’s unrealized dreams. Only then can Lillia herself bloom and help others untangle their fears to find the sparkle within. Eep!

column1: In Ionia
column2: magic is woven into the land. Forests spread vibrantly
column3: and trees often boast nearly as many colors as leaves
column4: touched by the wonders of the spirit realm.

column1: But there is one forest
column2: hidden away
column3: that draws on a different kind of magic—a garden with a tree at its heart that gathers humanity’s dreams in its blooms.

column1: The Dreaming Tree grew from a seed of the God-Willow
column2: which towered over the ancient grove of Omikayalan. Cast loose when the God-Willow was tragically felled
column3: the seed took root in what came to be known as the Garden of Forgetting. Nurtured by the Green Father
column4: Ivern—as many of the descendants of Omikayalan were—the Dreaming Tree spiraled up
column5: spreading the magic of humanity’s desires each time the dream-laden buds bloomed.

column1: Lillia was born when one of the tree’s own dreams was captured in a bud that fell to the ground before it could bloom—something that had never happened before. Sprouting into an awkward fawn creature with the flower bud still on her head
column2: Lillia’s only company was her mother tree
column3: and the dreams that drifted to the garden each night.

column1: Lillia helped tend the buds
column2: and learned about humanity through them. Enchanted by the people and places she glimpsed
column3: she spent every waking moment experiencing a swirl of emotions and desires that mortals could only see when they closed their eyes.

column1: In caring for the dreams
column2: Lillia also cared for the dreamers. She came to consider each of them a new friend
column3: wanting nothing more than to one day greet the people who imagined such wonders. Lillia wanted it so badly that her own desires eventually gathered in a bud on the tree.

column1: But when Lillia finally did meet humans
column2: it wasn’t like remembering a familiar dream. It was more like waking up.

column1: Something was happening in the world outside Lillia’s forest. War blazed like a fire through the land
column2: and in time
column3: fewer dreams began to reach the garden. The tree itself grew sick
column4: and became infected with burls—writhing tangles in its trunk
column5: which oozed darkness.

column1: Lillia did her best to nurture her mother tree and the dreams that remained in its buds
column2: but it was not long before the garden became so weak that the violence of the world spilled in. One night
column3: warriors entered the forest and chased a lone figure all the way to the Dreaming Tree. With a single errant blade’s slash
column4: the branch containing Lillia’s unrealized dream came thudding to the ground.

column1: Lillia panicked and forced them all to sleep
column2: shocked at the difference between the mortals she thought she knew
column3: and the ones she had found.

column1: They were so afraid—more tangle than sparkle. They were like the burls…
But as the warriors slept and Lillia wept
column2: a dream emerged from the lone figure the others had been chasing. Weakly
column3: it floated toward the broken branch on the ground and moved into the bough’s bud.

column1: Lillia picked it up. She could feel the dream. As she whispered to it and soothed it
column2: it glowed ever brighter—and so did she. The bud upon her head unfurled
column3: and magic swirled around like sparkling pollen. In that moment
column4: swept up in possibility and wonder
column5: Lillia herself bloomed… until
column6: with a sneeze
column7: she sent the magic curling into the surrounding forest.

column1: The humans awoke one by one
column2: unable to remember what had brought them to the forest
column3: or what they had done. None noticed the timid fawn behind the tree. With relief
column4: Lillia watched the humans go
column5: still seeing only confusing tangles—but knowing now that there was still a sparkle beneath it all.

column1: And if their dreams wouldn’t come to the tree
column2: she would have to bring the tree to them.

column1: Taking up her branch
column2: Lillia left the garden and entered the world of humans—a world she had always wanted to know
column3: but one that frightened her now more than anything. It was so unlike what she understood.

column1: Hiding just out of sight
column2: Lillia now helps people’s dreams be born
column3: drawn forward by glimpses of who they could be
column4: and by what may be trapped beneath their tangles. By helping humans realize their deepest wishes
column5: Lillia realizes her own
column6: the bud on her head blooming as she is filled with joy.

column1: Though darkness may be encroaching on Ionia once more
column2: it is but a mask
column3: and beneath it lies the familiar sparkle of hope. Only by braving the world
column4: and braving herself
column5: can Lillia hope to untangle its burls.

One of the brackern
column2: Skarner is an immense crystalline scorpion from a hidden valley in Shurima. Known for their great wisdom and deep connection to magic
column3: the brackern’s bodies are fused with powerful life crystals which hold the living thoughts and memories of their ancestors. In an age long past
column4: they entered hibernation to avoid destruction—but recent
column5: threatening events have roused Skarner
column6: and he now strives to protect his dormant kin from those who would harm them.

column1: Long before the rise of Shurima’s great empire
column2: the remote northwestern valleys were home to an age-old race known as the brackern.

column1: These noble creatures were quite unlike any other. While individually they may have seemed primitive and aggressive
column2: their arachnoid bodies held a wondrous secret—they existed as custodians of a truly ancient gestalt consciousness
column3: perhaps one of the very oldest in Runeterra. Each brackern was host to a single magical crystal
column4: which retained their memories
column5: their hopes and dreams
column6: and everything that made them who they were.

column1: After the body’s death
column2: the core of the crystal was buried with great reverence in the deepest valleys. There they waited for new
column3: younger brackern to inherit them
column4: and take up the mantle of all those who had come before.

column1: So it was
column2: through the eternal harmony of their crystals’ song
column3: the brackern had all but achieved immortality.

column1: The one who would become known as Skarner heard his crystal calling to him from somewhere beneath the earth. Day and night
column2: he burrowed in a methodical pattern that covered the entire valley with intricate spirals
column3: until his claws finally closed around a crystal larger than any he had seen before. Its surface was cracked and dull
column4: yet the dim glow within it pulsed in response to his presence
column5: and its song enveloped him.

column1: When Skarner emerged once more
column2: the crystal was fused with his body
column3: and he was one with all his kin in a wordless meeting of countless minds. He could feel the magic of the material realm all around him—a deep connection to the world
column4: like a low constant hum that resonated through every facet of his being.

column1: Mortals
column2: such as they were
column3: knew and respected the brackern… but also feared them. They would sometimes leave offerings at the entrances to the valleys
column4: which they named things like “the Crystal Scar” in their imperfect
column5: fleshy languages. Over time
column6: though
column7: their focus began to turn toward conflict and conquest
column8: and the brackern resolved to hibernate until this danger was passed. Even if the mortal races wiped each other from existence
column9: it would amount to little more than a single
column10: somber note in the crystals’ unending song.

column1: And so
column2: the brackern slept.

column1: Then
column2: without warning
column3: the song became a scream. Skarner was jolted awake as explosions tore through the brackern’s hiding place. The land had become parched and barren
column4: but mortals persisted—they came armed with fire and metal
column5: delving down beneath the surface to hack the living crystals from his sleeping kin.

column1: Skarner erupted from the sand in a frenzy. He killed many of the murderous thieves
column2: and the rest fled in terror
column3: leaving him to revive his dormant companions. But those brackern whose crystalline forms had been damaged died moments after they woke
column4: and most of the others could not be roused at all
column5: so deep was the trauma to their collective psyche.

column1: He stumbled through the valleys in mourning
column2: He was certain that
column3: even if the magic of the crystals still endured
column4: it would quickly fade in the hands of mortals.

column1: Yet
column2: as the sun broke over the horizon many weeks later
column3: Skarner heard the faintest of echoes calling out in his mind. These were not the soaring harmonies he had known before
column4: but a terrified
column5: urgent keening
column6: imploring him to act. He hesitated for just a moment
column7: knowing that if he went in search of his stolen kin
column8: then those who still lay beneath the sands would be defenseless…

column1: But as the cries died away
column2: he knew he had no other choice
column3: and strode out eastward into the desert.

column1: Though Skarner’s search is lonely
column2: he sometimes hears the cold
column3: disembodied song of a lost crystal drawing nearer
column4: only to fade once more. It is a feeling that brings hope and anguish in equal measure
column5: and he focuses his sorrow into unshakable determination
column6: knowing that the survival of the brackern race is all that matters.

column1: 106;Volibear;the Relentless Storm;Thunder Lord Volibear;Northern Storm Volibear;Runeguard Volibear;Captain Volibear;El Rayo Volibear;The Thousand-Pierced Bear;Duality Dragon Volibear;Duality Dragon Volibear Prestige Edition;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Fighter;Tank;Mana;7;7;4;3;580.0;90;350.0;70.0;340;31;4.0;32.0;1.25;150;9.0;0.75;6.25;0.5;60.0;3.0;2.0;0.625;Thundering Smash;Volibear gains speed towards enemies, <status>Stunning</status> and damaging the first one he Attacks.;Frenzied Maul;Volibear damages an enemy, applying on-hit effects and marking them.  Casting this ability again on the same target deals bonus damage and Heals Volibear.;Sky Splitter;Volibear summons a lightning bolt at a location, dealing damage and Slowing enemies while granting Volibear a Shield if he's inside the blast radius.;Stormbringer;Volibear leaps to a target location, Slowing and damaging enemies beneath him while gaining bonus Health.  Enemy towers near his landing location become temporarily disabled.;The Relentless Storm;Volibear's Attacks and abilities grant Attack Speed, and eventually cause his Attacks to deal bonus magic damage to nearby enemies.;
To those who still revere him
column2: the Volibear is the storm made manifest. Destructive
column3: wild
column4: and stubbornly resolute
column5: he existed before mortals walked the Freljord’s tundra
column6: and is fiercely protective of the lands that he and his demi-god kin created. Cultivating a deep hatred of civilization and the weakness it brought with it
column7: he now fights to return to the old ways—when the land was untamed
column8: and blood spilled freely—and eagerly battles all who oppose him
column9: with tooth
column10: claw
column11: and thundering domination.

column1: To some
column2: he is the Thunder’s Roar
column3: the Greatstorm
column4: or Valhir. To others
column5: he is Ruin
column6: the Thousand-Pierced Bear
column7: or He Who Stands. But to most of the tribes who still hold to the old ways
column8: he is known as the Volibear.

column1: Destruction
column2: strength
column3: and the storm made manifest
column4: the Volibear represents the unstoppable power and fury of the Freljord itself. It was the Volibear and his demi-god kin who formed the land they called Vorrijaard long before the arrival of the mortal races. The sagas tell how he created the Five Fjords with one mighty swipe of his claws
column5: and how his epic battle with the savage magma-serpent
column6: Rhond
column7: formed countless valleys and ravines. When the Volibear finally felled the beast
column8: its blood became the first river in the Freljord
column9: and its colossal corpse formed the Wyrmback Mountains.

column1: In the days of the first tribes
column2: wild magic ran rampant. The Volibear was venerated and worshipped by all
column3: for they needed his indomitable strength to survive. Great wars were waged
column4: and the Volibear took to the field alongside his followers
column5: clad in rune-inscribed armor made by his brother Ornn
column6: demi-god of the forge. At the time
column7: the brothers’ bond was strong—they often fought at each other’s side
column8: even though Ornn never had quite the same lust for battle. The Volibear reveled in hard-fought victories
column9: and as ever more blood offerings were made to him
column10: his power swelled.

column1: In time
column2: the Volibear and his kin drifted apart
column3: each focusing on their own pursuits. Even so
column4: there was no true division between them… until new ideas began to usurp the old beliefs.

column1: Three sisters rose to power
column2: seeking to control and impose order on the Freljord
column3: and the demi-gods could not agree on how to proceed. A few
column4: like Anivia
column5: seemed inclined to work with the sisters
column6: while the Volibear and the Iron Boar wanted to destroy them. Others would have been content to ignore them completely
column7: since these feeble creatures would eventually die like all before them.

column1: The Volibear looked to the most animalistic and savage of his followers
column2: known as the Ursine. With them
column3: he would defeat the three sisters. In preparation
column4: he sought out Ornn to arm his warriors for battle.

column1: But Ornn refused. He did not approve of the Ursine’s savage ways
column2: and a terrible fight erupted between the two demi-gods. In the aftermath
column3: the Volibear cursed his brother’s name
column4: and cast off his rune-inscribed armor. He would fight from then on with just tooth
column5: and claw
column6: and might
column7: and thunder. Far from being lessened
column8: the Volibear found his full power was now unleashed.

column1: With newfound rage
column2: he confronted one of the mortal sisters who sought to steal the power of the demi-gods for herself. Before her entire army
column3: he struck her down
column4: blinding her—but he was unable to stop what she had already set in motion.

column1: As the centuries rolled by
column2: and despite the Volibear’s resistance
column3: tribes began to venerate and worship the Three Sisters instead.

column1: Many of the more ancient practices were forgotten. He saw tribes cowering behind stone walls rather than face the rawness of nature. He saw fields being tilled
column2: and farmers herding cattle rather than hunting. He bellowed in fury to see great rivers dammed rather than be allowed to roar free. This was not his Freljord. The change had happened slowly—glacially—but the Volibear finally came to realize that the tribes had been cut off from the wild spirit of the land
column3: making them frail
column4: compliant
column5: and soft. These weaklings had no reverence for the old ways
column6: or old gods.

column1: Anger and determination rumbled within him. He vowed to tear down all evidence of civilization and return the Freljord to its ancient state as a true wilderness. The people would become strong once more. He would again be honored and feared by all.
As the call of the Volibear reverberates across the mountains and plains of the north
column2: more and more Freljordians are responding. Slowly
column3: the old ways are being remembered and re-embraced
column4: and his strength grows with each new follower.

column1: A reckoning of blood awaits… and the Volibear is rushing toward it.
