If the target dies a grave will be dug.;Dark Procession;Yorick summons a destructible wall at target location that will block enemy movement.;Mourning Mist;Yorick throws a globule of Black Mist that damages, slows and marks enemies.;Eulogy of the Isles;Yorick summons the Maiden of the Mist that causes Yorick's attacks against the Maiden's target to deal bonus damage. The Maiden will also automatically raise Walkers from dead enemies.;Shepherd of Souls;The Cursed Horde: Yorick can summon Mist Walkers to swarm and attack nearby enemies.;
The last survivor of a long-forgotten religious order
column2: Yorick is both blessed and cursed with power over the dead. Trapped on the Shadow Isles
column3: his only companions are the rotting corpses and shrieking spirits that he gathers to him. Yorick’s monstrous actions belie his noble purpose: to free his home from the curse of the Ruination.

column1: Even as a child
column2: Yorick’s life was never normal. Raised in a fishing village at the very edge of the Blessed Isles
column3: he always struggled to find acceptance. While most children his age were playing hide-and-seek
column4: young Yorick was making friends of a different kind—the spirits of the recently deceased.

column1: At first
column2: Yorick was terrified of his ability to see and hear the dead. Whenever someone in the village passed away
column3: Yorick would lie awake all night
column4: waiting for the chilling cry of a new visitor. He could not understand why they chose to haunt him
column5: and why his parents believed the spirits to be nothing more than nightmares.

column1: In time
column2: he came to realize the souls were not there to harm him. They were simply lost and needed help finding their way to the beyond. Since only Yorick was able to see these spirits
column3: he took it upon himself to be their guide
column4: escorting them to whatever awaited in eternity.

column1: The task was bittersweet. Yorick found that he enjoyed the company of ghosts
column2: but each one he brought to rest meant saying farewell to another friend. To the dead
column3: he was a savior
column4: but to the living
column5: he was a pariah. The villagers only saw a disturbed little boy who spoke to people who weren’t there.

column1: Tales of Yorick’s visions soon spread beyond his village
column2: and drew the attention of a small order of monks who dwelled at the heart of the Blessed Isles. Its envoys traveled to Yorick’s island
column3: believing he could become an asset to their faith.

column1: Yorick agreed to journey to their monastery
column2: and there
column3: he learned the ways of the Brethren of the Dusk and the true significance of their trappings. Every monk carried a spade as a symbol of their duty to conduct proper burial rites
column4: which ensured souls would not lose their way. And each brother wore a vial of water drawn from the Blessed Isles’ sacred spring. These Tears of Life represented the monks’ duty to heal the living.

column1: Yet
column2: no matter how he tried
column3: Yorick could never gain the acceptance of the other monks. To them
column4: he was tangible proof of things that should only be known through faith. They resented his power to easily perceive what they themselves had struggled their entire lives to understand. Shunned by his brothers
column5: Yorick found himself alone again.

column1: One morning
column2: as he tended to his duties in the cemetery
column3: Yorick was interrupted by the sight of a pitch-black cloud roiling across the surface of the Blessed Isles
column4: devouring everything in its path. Yorick tried to run
column5: but the cloud quickly enveloped him and plunged him into shadow.

column1: All around Yorick
column2: living things began to writhe and contort
column3: corrupted by the foul magic in the Black Mist. People
column4: animals
column5: even plants began to transform into vile
column6: ghoulish mockeries of their former selves. Whispers emanated from the turbulent air around him
column7: and his brothers began ripping the vials of healing water from their necks
column8: as if the objects were causing them great anguish. A moment later
column9: Yorick watched in abject horror as the monks’ souls were ripped from their bodies
column10: leaving cold
column11: pale corpses behind.

column1: Among the quieting screams of his brethren
column2: Yorick alone could hear voices within the mist.

column1: “Remove it. Join us. We will become one.”
He felt his fingers grasping for the vial at his neck. Mustering all his resolve
column2: Yorick forced his hands away from his throat and commanded the howling souls to stop. The Black Mist writhed violently
column3: and darkness overtook him.

column1: When Yorick awoke
column2: the winds had calmed
column3: and the once-fertile lands had transformed into the grotesque hellscape of the Shadow Isles. Isolated tendrils of the Black Mist clung to him
column4: trying to overtake the one living thing not yet corrupted. As the Mist wrapped itself around him
column5: Yorick saw it suddenly recoil from the vial at his neck. Yorick clutched the blessed water
column6: realizing it was all that kept him alive.

column1: In the days that followed
column2: Yorick scoured the islands for survivors
column3: but found only the twisted remnants of what once lived there. Everywhere he walked
column4: he witnessed wretched spirits rising from the bodies of the dead.

column1: As he searched
column2: Yorick slowly pieced together the events that led to the cataclysm: A king had arrived seeking to resurrect his queen
column3: but instead
column4: had doomed the Isles and everything on them.

column1: Yorick wished to find this “Ruined King” and undo the curse he had unleashed. But he felt powerless in the face of the seemingly endless death that surrounded him.
Almost lost within his grief
column2: Yorick began to speak to the spirits around him
column3: attempting to find solace with them as he had as a child. Instead
column4: as he communed with the Mist
column5: corpses left their graves
column6: guided by his voice. He realized the bodies he once laid to rest were now his to command.

column1: A glimmer of hope shone from the heart of his despair. To free the dead of the Shadow Isles
column2: Yorick would wield their power and their strength.

column1: In order to end the curse
column2: he would be forced to use it.

column1: 80;Pantheon;the Unbreakable Spear;Myrmidon Pantheon;Ruthless Pantheon;Perseus Pantheon;Full Metal Pantheon;Glaive Warrior Pantheon;Dragonslayer Pantheon;Zombie Slayer Pantheon;Baker Pantheon;Pulsefire Pantheon;Ruined Pantheon;Ascended Pantheon Prestige Edition;;;;;Mortal Will activates after 5 spells or basic attacks - plan your way through fights to allow you to activate it more than once.;Whittle the enemy down with Comet Spears before you jump in.;If an enemy is going to get out of range of your Aegis Assault, you can recast the spell to immediately fire the shield slam.;;;Pantheon's Aegis Assault makes him invulnerable from the front. Use this time to get out of the way or to form a plan to deal with him.;;Fighter;Assassin;Mana;9;4;3;4;580.0;95;317.12;31.0;345;40;3.75;28.0;1.25;175;9.0;0.65;7.36;0.45;64.0;3.3;2.95;0.644;Comet Spear;Pantheon either thrusts his spear or throws his spear in the chosen direction.;Shield Vault;Pantheon dashes to a target, damaging and stunning them.;Aegis Assault;Pantheon sets his shield, becoming invulnerable to damage from the front and striking repeatedly with his spear.;Grand Starfall;Pantheon composes himself and then leaps into the air, landing at a chosen location as a comet.;Mortal Will;Every few spells or attacks, Pantheon's next spell is empowered.;
Once an unwilling host to the Aspect of War
column2: Atreus survived when the celestial power within him was slain
column3: refusing to succumb to a blow that tore stars from the heavens. In time
column4: he learned to embrace the power of his own mortality
column5: and the stubborn resilience that goes along with it. Atreus now opposes the divine as Pantheon reborn
column6: his unbreakable will fueling the fallen Aspect’s weapons on the field of battle.

column1: Atreus was born on the hostile slopes of Targon
column2: and named after a star in the constellation of War
column3: known as the Pantheon.

column1: From an early age
column2: he knew he was destined for battle. Like many in his tribe
column3: he trained to join the Rakkor’s militant order
column4: the Ra’Horak. Never the strongest or the most skilled warrior
column5: Atreus somehow persevered
column6: standing up
column7: bloodied and bruised
column8: after each bout. In time
column9: he developed a fierce rivalry with a fellow recruit
column10: Pylas—but no matter how often Atreus was cast onto the stones
column11: he stood back up. Pylas was impressed by his unrelenting endurance
column12: and through the blood they spilled in the training circle

column1: Atreus and Pylas were among the Rakkor who stumbled across a barbarian incursion
column2: surviving the ambush that left the rest of their patrol dead. When the Aspect of the Sun refused to destroy these trespassers
column3: Atreus and Pylas swore to capture the power of the Aspects themselves by climbing to the peak of Mount Targon.

column1: Like so many before them
column2: they underestimated how arduous the ascent would be
column3: with Pylas shivering his last upon finally reaching the summit. Only Atreus remained as the skies opened
column4: making him host to a divine Aspect
column5: with the power to take revenge.

column1: But it was not a man who returned to the Rakkor afterward
column2: spear and shield gleaming with celestial might. It was the Aspect of War itself
column3: the Pantheon. Judging Atreus unworthy
column4: a warrior who had known only defeat
column5: it had taken control of his body to pursue its own ends—a task it considered too great for mortal men.

column1: Cast into the furthest corners of his own mind
column2: Atreus endured only vague visions as the Aspect scoured the world for Darkin
column3: living weapons created in a bygone age.

column1: Eventually
column2: Pantheon was goaded into battle not far from Mount Targon by the Darkin Aatrox
column3: who sought the mountain’s peak. Their fight raged into the skies
column4: and swept through the armies of men beneath… until the impossible occurred. The Darkin’s god-killing blade was driven into Pantheon’s chest
column5: a blow that carved the constellation of War from the heavens.

column1: But as the Aspect faded
column2: Atreus—the man it had considered weak—awoke once more. Impaled upon Aatrox’s blade
column3: and with the power of the Aspect’s weapons dimming
column4: he took a ragged breath
column5: and spit in the Darkin’s face. Aatrox sneered
column6: and left Atreus to die.

column1: Hours later
column2: as the crows descended
column3: Atreus painfully stood back up
column4: stumbling back to the Rakkor in a trail of blood. After a lifetime of defeat
column5: his will to live
column6: and his anger at betrayal
column7: were enough to stave off the death that had claimed War itself.

column1: Atreus recovered on Pylas’ homestead
column2: nursed back to health by his friend’s widow
column3: Iula. There
column4: Atreus realized he’d spent his life looking to the stars
column5: never considering what lay beneath. Unlike gods
column6: mortals fought because they must
column7: knowing that death lay in wait. It was a resilience he saw in all life
column8: the threats unending.

column1: Indeed
column2: barbarian invaders now threatened the Rakkor’s northern settlements
column3: including Iula’s farm. Though it was months before he could lift a spear
column4: Atreus was determined to end this scourge himself
column5: and eventually set out with the Aspect’s dulled weapons in hand.

column1: Yet
column2: when he arrived
column3: he found his sworn enemies already under siege. He knew from their cries
column4: from the overwhelming stench of blood… they faced Aatrox.

column1: It was Aatrox who had driven the barbarians into Targon
column2: Atreus realized. Though he’d considered them his foes
column3: they were much like the Rakkor—mortals who suffered in the conflicts between greater powers. Atreus felt a cold rage at both the Darkin and the Aspects. They were no different. They were the problem.

column1: Atreus put himself between the barbarians and Aatrox. Recognizing the battered shield and spear of the fallen Aspect
column2: the Darkin mocked him—what hope had Atreus now
column3: without the Pantheon’s power? But even though Aatrox’s blows cast him to his knees
column4: Atreus’ own will reignited the Aspect’s spear
column5: upon hearing the cries of the people around him… and with a mighty leap
column6: he struck a blow that severed the Darkin’s sword arm.

column1: Both blade and Darkin fell to the ground. Only Atreus still stood
column2: and watched his namesake star blaze back to life in the heavens.

column1: Though he often yearns to return to Iula’s farm
column2: Atreus vowed that day to stand against Aspects
column3: Ascended
column4: demons
column5: and any who wield power so great
column6: it can only destroy. Forsaking his own name
column7: he has become a new Pantheon—the Aspect’s weapons fueled by the will to fight that can only exist in the face of death.

column1: For with the divine Pantheon gone
column2: War must be reborn in man.

Once honored defenders of Shurima against the Void
column2: Aatrox and his brethren would eventually become an even greater threat to Runeterra
column3: and were defeated only by cunning mortal sorcery. But after centuries of imprisonment
column4: Aatrox was the first to find freedom once more
column5: corrupting and transforming those foolish enough to try and wield the magical weapon that contained his essence. Now
column6: with stolen flesh
column7: he walks Runeterra in a brutal approximation of his previous form
column8: seeking an apocalyptic and long overdue vengeance.

column1: Whether mistaken for a demon or god
column2: many tales have been told of the Darkin Blade... but few know his real name
column3: or the story of his fall.

column1: In ancient times
column2: long before desert sands swallowed the empire
column3: a mighty champion of Shurima was brought before the Sun Disc to become the avatar for a now forgotten celestial ideal. Remade as one of the Ascended
column4: his wings were the golden light of dawn
column5: and his armor sparkled like a constellation of hope from beyond the great veil.

column1: Aatrox was his name. He was at the vanguard of every noble conflict. So true and just was his conduct that other god-warriors would always gather at his side
column2: and ten thousand mortals of Shurima marched behind him. When Setaka
column3: the Ascended warrior-queen
column4: called for his help against the rebellion of Icathia
column5: Aatrox answered without hesitation.

column1: But no one predicted the extent of the horrors that the rebels would unleash—the Void quickly overwhelmed its Icathian masters
column2: and began the grinding annihilation of all life it encountered.

column1: After many years of desperate battle
column2: Aatrox and his brethren finally halted the Void’s perverse advance
column3: and seared the largest rifts shut. But the surviving Ascended
column4: the self-described Sunborn
column5: had been forever changed by what they had encountered. Though Shurima had triumphed
column6: they all had lost something in their victory... even noble Aatrox.

column1: And in time
column2: Shurima fell
column3: as all empires must.

column1: Without any monarch to defend
column2: or the existential threat of the Void to test them
column3: Aatrox and the Sunborn began to clash with one another
column4: and eventually this became a war for the ruins of their world. Mortals fleeing the conflict came to know them instead by a new and scornful name: the darkin.

column1: Fearing that these fallen Ascended were as dangerous to Runeterra’s survival as the Void incursions had been
column2: the Targonians intervened. It is said that the Aspect of Twilight gave mortals the knowledge to trap the darkin
column3: and the newly reborn Aspect of War united many in fighting back against them. Never fearing any foe
column4: Aatrox and his armies were ready
column5: and he realized only too late that they had been deceived. A force greater than a thousand dead suns pulled him inside the sword he had carried into battle countless times
column6: and forever bound his immortal essence to it.

column1: The weapon was a prison
column2: sealing his consciousness in suffocating
column3: eternal darkness
column4: robbing him even of the ability to die. For centuries
column5: he strained against this hellish confinement... until some nameless mortal was foolish enough to try and wield the blade once more. Aatrox seized upon this opportunity
column6: forcing his will and an imitation of his original form onto his bearer
column7: though the process quickly drained all life from the new body.

column1: In the years that followed
column2: Aatrox groomed many more hosts—men and women of exceptional vitality or fortitude. Though his grasp of such magics had been limited in life
column3: he learned to take control of a mortal in the span of single breath
column4: and in battle he discovered he could feast on his victims to build himself ever larger and stronger.

column1: Aatrox traveled the land
column2: searching desperately
column3: endlessly
column4: for a way return to his previous Ascended form… but the riddle of the blade proved unsolvable
column5: and in time he realized he would never be free of it. The flesh he stole and crudely shaped began to feel like a mockery of his former glory—a cage only slightly larger than the sword. Despair and loathing grew in his heart. The heavenly powers that Aatrox had once embodied had been wiped from the world
column6: and all memory.

column1: Raging against this injustice
column2: he arrived at a solution that could only be born of a prisoner’s desperation. If he could not destroy the blade or free himself
column3: then he would embrace oblivion instead.

column1: Now
column2: Aatrox marches toward this merciless goal
column3: bringing war and death wherever he goes. He clings to a blind hope: if he can drive all of creation into a final
column4: apocalyptic battle—where everything
column5: everything else is destroyed—then maybe he and the blade will also cease to exist.

Hecarim is a spectral fusion of man and beast
column2: cursed to ride down the souls of the living for all eternity. When the Blessed Isles fell into shadow
column3: this proud knight was undone by the destructive energies of the Ruination
column4: along with all his cavalry and their mounts. Now
column5: whenever the Black Mist reaches out across Runeterra
column6: he leads their devastating charge
column7: reveling in the slaughter and crushing foes beneath his armored hooves.

column1: Born into an empire long since gone to dust and forgotten
column2: Hecarim was a lieutenant of the Iron Order—a brotherhood sworn to defend their king’s lands.

column1: As Hecarim won victory after victory from the back of his mighty warhorse
column2: the commander of the Iron Order saw in him a potential successor… but also a growing darkness. His obsessive hunger for glory was eroding his honor
column3: and over time the knight-commander came to realize this young lieutenant must never lead them.

column1: When he was told this
column2: Hecarim was furious. Even so
column3: he bit back his anger
column4: and continued in his duties.

column1: When they next rode to war
column2: the commander found himself surrounded by enemies
column3: and cut off from his fellow knights. Hecarim
column4: seeing his chance
column5: turned away and left him to die. At battle’s end
column6: the Iron Order
column7: oblivious to what Hecarim had done
column8: knelt on the bloody ground and swore allegiance to him.

column1: Hecarim rode to the capital to take his formal oaths
column2: and met with Kalista
column3: the king’s most trusted general. She recognized his prowess and leadership
column4: and when the queen was wounded by an assassin’s poisoned blade
column5: Kalista was comforted to know the Iron Order would remain with the king while she sought a cure.

column1: Gripped by paranoia
column2: and seeing new threats in every shadow
column3: the king raged at those he believed were trying to separate him from his dying wife
column4: and dispatched Hecarim to quell dissent throughout the kingdom. The Iron Order earned a dreadful reputation as ruthless enforcers of the king’s will. Towns and villages burned. Hundreds were put to the sword.

column1: With grim inevitability
column2: when the queen died
column3: Hecarim chose to sour the king’s grief into hatred
column4: seeking sanction to lead the Iron Order into foreign lands. He would avenge her death
column5: while earning yet more dark renown for himself.

column1: But before they could ride out
column2: Kalista returned. She had found what she sought upon the distant Blessed Isles—and yet it was now too late. The king would not believe this
column3: and had Kalista imprisoned as a traitor. Intrigued by what he had heard
column4: Hecarim visited her cell
column5: and they spoke of the pale mists that protected the islands from all invaders… and also of the inhabitants’ immense wealth
column6: including the legendary Waters of Life.

column1: Knowing only Kalista could lead them there
column2: Hecarim eventually persuaded her to guide the king’s fleet through the veil that concealed the Blessed Isles from mortal sight.

column1: They landed at the city of Helia with the queen’s body in solemn procession. The Iron Order led the way
column2: only to be met by the city’s masters
column3: who now refused to help. Enraged
column4: the king ordered Kalista to kill them
column5: but she refused
column6: and Hecarim smiled as he made the decision that would damn him for eternity. He drove a spear through Kalista’s back
column7: and ordered his knights to ransack the city
column8: looting its vaults of arcane treasures.

column1: Amid the chaos
column2: a lowly custodian agreed to grant the king access to the Waters of Life—but not even this could distract Hecarim from the revelry of bloodshed
column3: and so it was that the Ruination of the Blessed Isles would take him almost completely by surprise.

column1: A blastwave of magical force tore across Helia
column2: shattering every last building and leaving the fragments suspended in searing un-light. In its wake came the Black Mist
column3: a billowing hurricane that dragged every living creature it touched into its shrieking
column4: roiling embrace. Hecarim tried to rally the Iron Order
column5: hoping to make it back to their ships
column6: but the mist claimed them one by one as they fled.

column1: Alone
column2: and defiant to the end
column3: the knight-commander was taken by the shadows. He and his mighty steed were fused into a monstrous
column4: spectral abomination that reflected the darkness in Hecarim’s heart—a brazen creature of fury and spite
column5: at one with the Black Mist and yet utterly enslaved by it.

column1: Bound forevermore to these Shadow Isles
column2: Hecarim has spent centuries in a sinister mockery of his former life
column3: cursed to patrol the nightmarish lands he once intended to conquer. Whenever the Black Mist reaches out beyond their shores
column4: he and the otherworldly host of the Iron Order ride out to slaughter the living
column5: in memory of glories long passed.

column1: 9;Fiddlesticks;the Ancient Fear;Spectral Fiddlesticks;Union Jack Fiddlesticks;Bandito Fiddlesticks;Pumpkinhead Fiddlesticks;Fiddle Me Timbers;Surprise Party Fiddlesticks;Dark Candy Fiddlesticks;Risen Fiddlesticks;Praetorian Fiddlesticks;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Mage;Support;Mana;2;3;9;9;580.4;92;500.0;28.0;335;34;3.5;30.0;0.5;480;5.5;0.6;8.0;0.8;55.36;2.63;2.11;0.625;Terrify;Fiddlesticks damaging enemies with spells while unseen or targeting an enemy with Terrify's activation strikes a target unit with fear, causing it to flee in terror for a duration.;Bountiful Harvest;Fiddlesticks drains health from nearby enemies, dealing bonus execute damage at the end of the duration.;Reap;Fiddlesticks slashes an area with its scythe, slowing all enemies hit and silencing enemies hit in the center of the slash.;Crowstorm;A murder of crows flock wildly around Fiddlesticks, dealing damage per second to all enemy units in the area.;A Harmless Scarecrow;Fiddlesticks' trinket is replaced by scarecrow effigies.;
Something has awoken in Runeterra. Something ancient. Something terrible. The ageless horror known as Fiddlesticks stalks the edges of mortal society
column2: drawn to areas thick with paranoia where it feeds upon terrorized victims. Wielding a jagged scythe
column3: the haggard
column4: makeshift creature reaps fear itself
column5: shattering the minds of those unlucky enough to survive in its wake. Beware the sounding of the crow
column6: or the whispering of the shape that appears almost human… Fiddlesticks has returned.

column1: Long
column2: long ago
column3: in a tower by the edge of the sea
column4: a foolish young mage summoned something into the world that he was not prepared to control. What stepped before the boy was something older than recorded history. Something darker than a yawning
column5: starless night. Something the world had desperately tried to forget—and in an instant
column6: the mage
column7: the creature
column8: and the tower itself were lost to all of time.

column1: At least
column2: that’s what the stories say.

column1: In the Freljord
column2: children frighten each other around the fire with tales of a monster that raises itself from untended graves in the ice
column3: its body a shambling mass of helmets
column4: bucklers
column5: furs
column6: and wood. In Bilgewater
column7: drunken sailors trade accounts of something standing alone on a tiny
column8: distant atoll from which no one has ever returned. An old Targonian legend speaks of how a child of twilight stole the only joy from a ragged
column9: whispering horror
column10: while veteran Noxian soldiers prefer the fable of a lonely farmhand who was blamed for a poor harvest and fed to the crows
column11: later returning to the world as a demon.

column1: Demacia. Ixtal. Piltover. Ionia. Shurima. In every corner of Runeterra
column2: these myths persist—reshaped
column3: respun
column4: and passed down by countless generations of storytellers. Stories of a thing that looks almost human and stalks places thick with fear.

column1: But these are simply fables to frighten young children. No one would ever be afraid of a silly old monster called Fiddlesticks…
Until now.
Something has awoken in the Demacian hinterlands
column2: drawn by the climate of rising fear and paranoia. Rural protectorates
column3: separated from the capital by hundreds of miles of farmland
column4: are emptying in mere days. Travelers vanish from the old footpaths. Guard patrols fail to report back from the edges of the kingdom. And wild-eyed survivors claw at their faces from the safety of roadside taverns
column5: wailing of crows that aren’t crows
column6: sounds that aren’t sounds
column7: and a lopsided horror in the shape of a scarecrow that croaks in the stolen voices of the dead.

column1: Most blame rogue mages. Such accusations are common in these days of rebellion.
Yet the truth is far worse. Something has returned
column2: just as it had in the fictitious tale of the young mage in his seaside tower. An evil gone from the world for numberless centuries—long enough that the warnings of a nascent humanity passed into rumor
column3: then myth
column4: then legend… until all that remained were simple fables. An entity so utterly alien that it defies almost all contemporary knowledge of magic. So impossibly ancient that it has always been. So universally feared that even animals grow nervous when someone speaks its name.

column1: In the wake of this revival
column2: another tale
column3: nearly lost to memory
column4: has seen a resurgence throughout the hinterlands. A legend of a great evil that has no form
column5: no thoughts
column6: and no understanding of the world it inhabits
column7: instead building itself into the crude shape of those that fear it. The terror of all living things
column8: given life in that first terrible scream of creation. A demon before demons were known.

column1: At least
column2: that’s what the stories say.

column1: But Fiddlesticks is real.

Darius and his brother Draven grew up as orphans in the port city of Basilich. Darius struggled to provide for them both
column2: constantly fighting with gangs of older urchins and anyone else who threatened his little brother—even the city guard. Every day on the streets was a battle for survival
column3: and Darius earned more scars by his twelfth summer than some soldiers do in a lifetime.

column1: After Basilich was seized by the expanding Noxian empire
column2: the victorious commander Cyrus saw the strength in these defiant brothers
column3: and they found a home within the ranks of his warhost. Over the years
column4: they fought in many grueling campaigns of conquest from one end of the known world to the other
column5: as well as crushing a number of rebellions against the throne.

column1: Within the empire
column2: anyone could rise to power
column3: no matter their birth
column4: culture
column5: or background
column6: and none embraced this ideal more fervently than Darius. From humble beginnings
column7: he rose steadily through the ranks
column8: always putting duty before all else
column9: and garnering great respect for his aggression
column10: discipline
column11: and refusal to ever take a backward step. On the bloodsoaked fields of Dalamor Plain
column12: he even beheaded a Noxian general after the coward ordered a retreat. Roaring in defiance and hefting his bloodied axe overhead
column13: Darius rallied the scattered warbands and won a great and unexpected victory against a far more numerous foe.

column1: He was rewarded with a senior command of his own
column2: attracting many thousands of eager recruits from across the empire. Darius turned the majority away
column3: accepting only the strongest
column4: the most disciplined and iron-willed. Such was his fearsome notoriety
column5: even in the lands beyond Noxus
column6: that it was not uncommon for entire cities to surrender at the first sight of his banners.

column1: After a grinding victory against the cloud-fortresses of the Varju
column2: a proud warrior people who had resisted decades of Noxian aggression
column3: Darius was named the Hand of Noxus by Emperor Boram Darkwill himself. Those who knew Darius best knew he craved neither power nor adulation—he wished merely to see Noxus triumph over all—so Darkwill ordered him and his warhosts far north into the Freljord
column4: to finally bring the barbarian tribes to heel.

column1: The campaign dragged on for years
column2: ending in a bitter
column3: icy stalemate. Darius narrowly survived assassination attempts
column4: ambushes
column5: and even capture by the vicious Winter’s Claw. He was growing weary of endless wars of attrition
column6: and returned to Noxus to demand a reconsolidation of the military.

column1: He marched his veterans into the capital
column2: only to find that the emperor was dead
column3: killed in a coup led by Jericho Swain. The act had been supported by many allies
column4: including Darius’s own brother
column5: Draven.

column1: This was a difficult position. As Hand
column2: many of the noble houses would expect Darius to avenge Darkwill
column3: but he had known and greatly respected the disgraced general Swain
column4: and had spoken against his discharge after the botched offensive in Ionia some years earlier. The oaths of the Hand were to Noxus
column5: not any particular ruler
column6: and Swain was a man who spoke honestly of his new vision for the empire. Darius realized this was a leader he was prepared to follow... but Swain had other ideas.

column1: With the establishment of the Trifarix
column2: three individuals would rule Noxus together
column3: each embodying one principle of strength: Vision
column4: Might
column5: and Guile. Darius gladly accepted his place on this council
column6: and pledged to raise a new
column7: elite force—the Trifarian Legion
column8: the most loyal and prestigious warriors the empire could produce—and lead the armies of Noxus into a glorious new age of conquest.

column1: 53;Blitzcrank;the Great Steam Golem;Rusty Blitzcrank;Goalkeeper Blitzcrank;Boom Boom Blitzcrank;Piltover Customs Blitzcrank;Definitely Not Blitzcrank;iBlitzcrank;Riot Blitzcrank;Battle Boss Blitzcrank;Lancer Rogue Blitzcrank;Lancer Paragon Blitzcrank;Witch's Brew Blitzcrank;Space Groove Blitz & Crank;Victorious Blitzcrank;;;The 1-2-3 combo of Rocket Grab, Power Fist, and Static Field can devastate an individual opponent.;Using Blitzcrank's grab to pull an enemy into your tower range followed by a Power Fist will allow the tower to get several hits on them.;;;;Blitzcrank's passive Mana Barrier grants him a shield when he is low on health.;Staying behind creeps can prevent you from being Rocket Grabbed. Blitzcrank's Rocket Grab only pulls the first enemy target it encounters.;;;Tank;Fighter;Mana;4;8;5;4;583.0;95;267.0;40.0;325;40;3.5;32.0;1.25;125;8.5;0.75;8.5;0.8;62.0;3.5;1.13;0.625;Rocket Grab;Blitzcrank fires his right hand to grab an opponent on its path, dealing damage and dragging it back to him.;Overdrive;Blitzcrank super charges himself to get dramatically increased Move and Attack Speed. He is temporarily slowed after the effect ends.;Power Fist;Blitzcrank charges up his fist to make his next attack deal double damage and pop his target up in the air.;Static Field;Enemies attacked by Blitzcrank are marked and take lightning damage after 1 second. Additionally, Blitzcrank can activate this ability to remove nearby enemies' shields, damage them, and silence them briefly.;Mana Barrier;Blitzcrank gains a shield based on his mana when dropping to low health.;
Blitzcrank is an enormous
column2: near-indestructible steam golem originally built to dispose of hazardous waste in Zaun. Evolved beyond his primary purpose
column3: Blitzcrank selflessly uses his strength and durability to protect others. Able to see past false veneers and artifice to the truth of an intention
column4: Blitzcrank moves to help those in need.

column1: Shortly after the development of hextech
column2: inventors and scientists flocked to Zaun
column3: a place where they could experiment with volatile materials undeterred by the stringent regulations and rules of Piltover. Their experiments often ended in disaster
column4: with entire buildings destroyed and toxic chemicals spilled into nearby streets. A team at the College of Techmaturgy developed steam-powered golems who would remove the hazardous debris
column5: a task deemed too dangerous for even the most desperate of Zaunites.

column1: The golems labored tirelessly through the streets
column2: carrying waste to the growing number of disposal sites around the city. Even among such hardy machines
column3: accidents were common
column4: and the automatons were frequently sent back to the college in pieces. Dredging up slime at the bottom of Zaun was no easy task
column5: and acidic
column6: noxious chemicals gradually wore down their metal shells.

column1: An ambitious young inventor known as Viktor longed to create a durable machine that could clean more effectively and eliminate the need for costly repairs. He gathered broken parts from the retired golems
column2: avoiding the flashier components popular among his peers. Even employing an assemblage of unwanted materials
column3: Viktor designed a more resilient machine.

column1: He named his creation Blitzcrank
column2: hoping the golem would quickly eradicate all waste and become far greater than the sum of his discarded parts. After instilling in Blitzcrank a relentless desire to serve the people of Zaun by removing the toxins in their path
column3: Viktor sent him into the Sump to help.

column1: The golem took Viktor’s ideology to heart
column2: believing self-sacrifice and altruism could lead to true greatness for the entire city. Blitzcrank joined the other machines in their cleanup program
column3: leading scouting efforts far past the usual areas of pollution. He fearlessly cleansed toxic neighborhoods of the most noxious chemical spills without any need to return to the college for repairs.

column1: As Blitzcrank encountered other civic dangers
column2: he developed increasingly ambitious plans for his crew of golems
column3: but found his own design was limited such that he could not extend his work beyond cleaning chemical spills. One night
column4: he borrowed Viktor’s prized toolbox
column5: and wrenched open his own steam-engine. He reconfigured his mechanics and removed all limits to his function so that he could make an even greater difference in the city.

column1: In the following weeks
column2: Blitzcrank orchestrated neighborhood-wide evacuations to help people avoid toxic fumes
column3: redirected a food distribution system to increase its efficiency
column4: and repaired an elaborate filtering system to dispense clean water into a community well. With every good deed
column5: Blitzcrank’s sense of his own purpose solidified
column6: and he gained a consciousness that no other golem had yet achieved.

column1: Viktor noticed the unusual changes in his creation
column2: and sought to replicate Blitzcrank’s profound sentience and self-sufficiency in other machines. But Blitzcrank never revealed what had caused his awakening
column3: and without that knowledge
column4: Viktor could not replicate his success.

column1: Blitzcrank roamed the streets of Zaun at all hours
column2: refusing to pause or rest when there might be people in need. His assistance extended beyond just humans to street animals and even broken-down automatons. When a gas fire devastated the Davoran Clocktower
column3: he rescued a family of mechanics and their soot-black cat with his enormous crank-like arm — even stopping to recover a miniature mechanical dancer from a child’s bedroom.

column1: No task was too small for the steam golem - in a single day he stopped a chem-punk robbery
column2: caught a child’s icefruit before it fell to the pavement
column3: and rounded up a lost poro from a traveling circus before it collided with a malfunctioning velocipede.

column1: As time passed
column2: Blitzcrank learned that several of the people he had previously saved succumbed to illnesses after their exposure to noxious chemicals. Anxious at his inability to help
column3: he turned to his creator. Viktor
column4: who had an interest in evolving humanity beyond its frail mortality
column5: was eager to assist. He promised Blitzcrank that
column6: with his developments in techmaturgy
column7: they could defeat death.

column1: Blitzcrank convinced a family of sump dwellers to try Viktor’s approach
column2: and worked with the inventor to install machinery that seamlessly integrated with their bodies to eliminate the disease.

column1: At first
column2: the transition was a success
column3: and the family regained the mobility they had lost since falling ill. But after a few months of good health
column4: their bodies began to fail. Viktor and Blitzcrank worked tirelessly to try to find a cure
column5: but their efforts only delayed the inevitable. Before long
column6: the entire family was dead.

column1: Saddened by their failure
column2: Blitzcrank knew this way of helping people was not his. He parted ways with his creator as a friend and peer
column3: hoping to make the greatest difference he could for the people of Zaun.

column1: While some view Zaun as a chaotic place where reckless experimentation and lawlessness run rampant
column2: Blitzcrank sees only its infinite possibilities. He searches Zaun for ways he can create change for good
column3: paying extra attention to those forgotten or discarded by society. With a bit of axle grease
column4: Blitzcrank believes Zaun will grow into the greatest city Valoran has ever seen.

column1:
36;Dr. Mundo;the Madman of Zaun;Toxic Dr. Mundo;Mr. Mundoverse;Corporate Mundo;Mundo Mundo;Executioner Mundo;Rageborn Mundo;TPA Mundo;Pool Party Mundo;El Macho Mundo;Frozen Prince Mundo;;;;;;A well-timed Sadism can bait enemy champions into attacking you even when they lack the damage to finish you.;Spirit Visage will increase the healing done by your ultimate and lower cooldowns on all of your abilities.;Cleavers are a powerful tool for killing neutral monsters. Instead of returning to base, farm neutral monsters until your ultimate can heal you.;;;Try to coordinate high-damage abilities with your allies right after Dr. Mundo uses his ultimate, but if you're unable to kill him quickly with burst he will heal through the damage.;Try casting Ignite when Dr. Mundo uses Sadism to negate a large portion of its healing.;;;Fighter;Tank;None;5;7;6;5;583.0;89;0.0;0.0;345;32;3.0;32.0;1.25;125;8.0;0.75;0.0;0.0;61.0;4.2;3.3;0.72;Infected Bonesaw;Dr. Mundo throws an infected bonesaw, dealing damage to the first enemy hit based on their current health and slowing them.;Heart Zapper;Dr. Mundo electrocutes himself, dealing persistent damage to nearby enemies and storing a portion of damage he takes. At the end of the duration or on Recast, Dr. Mundo deals a burst of damage to nearby enemies. If the burst hit an enemy, he heals a percentage of the stored damage.;Blunt Force Trauma;Passive - Dr. Mundo gains bonus Attack Damage, increasing based on his missing Health.

Active - Dr. Mundo slams his “medical” bag into an enemy, dealing additional damage based on his missing Health. If the enemy dies they are swatted away, dealing damage to enemies they pass through.;Maximum Dosage;Dr. Mundo pumps himself with chemicals, instantly healing a percent of his missing Health. He then gains bonus Attack Damage and Move Speed, and regenerates a portion of his maximum Health over a long duration.;Goes Where He Pleases;Dr. Mundo resists the first Immobilizing effect that hits him, instead losing Health and dropping a chemical cannister nearby. Dr. Mundo can pick it up by walking over it, restoring Health and reducing this Ability's Cooldown.Dr. Mundo also has significantly increased Health regeneration.;
Utterly mad
column2: tragically homicidal
column3: and horrifyingly purple
column4: Dr. Mundo is what keeps many of Zaun’s citizens indoors on particularly dark nights. Now a self-proclaimed physician
column5: he was once a patient of Zaun’s most infamous asylum. After “curing” the entire staff
column6: Dr. Mundo established his practice in the empty wards that once treated him and began mimicking the highly unethical procedures he had so often experienced himself. With a full cabinet of medicines and zero medical knowledge
column7: he now makes himself more monstrous with each injection and terrifies the hapless “patients” who wander near his office.

column1: In the wards of Zaun’s infamous asylum
column2: a single monstrous figure roams the halls. His methods are bold
column3: his bonesaw is sharp
column4: and his patients are terrified. For this man is no doctor at all
column5: except in the fancy of his own mind.

column1: Though his true name has been lost to both time and memory
column2: Dr. Mundo was once an enforcer for one of Zaun's most powerful chem-barons. Known for his boisterous affability
column3: he was remarkably good-natured for a man who made his living off physical intimidation. He was always quick with a familiar nickname and a friendly clap on the back
column4: and often blissfully unaware of the toes he was stepping on. It wasn’t long before he had stepped firmly on the toes of his boss.

column1: Determined to make an example of his underling
column2: the chem-baron had him committed to Osweld Asylum—a place well known for its inhumane treatment and questionable cures. The baron watched with satisfaction as his enforcer was placed in restraints and dragged away to the padded confines of the asylum’s most secure cell.

column1: As months went by
column2: the enforcer suffered unspeakable horrors at the hands of his supposed caregivers. Experimental treatments were rendered without concern for the patient's well-being. Nerves were prodded
column3: lobes were severed
column4: and unproved medicines were administered in large quantities. The enforcer began to change
column5: his large frame gaining more muscle by the day. His brain
column6: however
column7: suffered a far worse fate. As he lost all memory of his past life
column8: the enforcer struggled to make sense of the cruel world around him. He looked down at his old restraining jacket—it almost resembled the white coats of the medical professionals that surrounded him.

column1: Misreading the words on his own uniform
column2: he began to assume a new name and new profession for himself.

column1: I must be a doctor
column2: too. Why else would I be in this wretched asylum? he reasoned. And all these other people... must be my patients.

column1: At last
column2: the day came when the chem-baron arrived to discharge his enforcer from the asylum. To his surprise
column3: there was no one to greet him in the lobby. The halls were empty and dead silent
column4: save for the faint
column5: incoherent babbling of a deranged patient in a room at the end of the hallway.

column1: The baron entered the room to a horrifying sight: Scattered across the floor were countless bodies—staff and patients alike
column2: dismembered beyond recognition. Standing above them
column3: a hulking
column4: purple monstrosity blathered unintelligibly as a large blue tongue lolled out the side of its gaping mouth. Muscles bulged grotesquely beneath its undersized garments
column5: and its fist tightened around the handle of a surgical saw. The baron turned pale as his gaze found the face of the monster—and recognized it as his old enforcer.

column1: The enforcer
column2: who recalled nothing of his old boss
column3: saw only another patient in desperate need of treatment. The purple thing lumbered toward the chem-baron
column4: wagging his bonesaw in anticipation. The baron drew his chem-tech pistol and fired. The shot tore through the looming mass in front of him
column5: staggering the monster...

column1: But only for a brief moment.
The hole in the creature's flesh quickly closed as new slabs of muscle rapidly regrew over the wound. The monster paused
column2: eyed the baron quizzically
column3: and uttered
column4: “You sick. Need help!”

column1: Mimicking what he had seen performed countless times by the asylum's former practitioners
column2: the enforcer threw the man on a nearby gurney
column3: strapped his arms into the restraints
column4: and prepared his instruments for surgery. The chem-baron turned pale as he realized the grim fate that awaited him.

column1: The ensuing surgery—like so many before and after it—was not successful. The burgeoning doctor added the remains of his latest patient to the pile on the floor. Though he was saddened he could not save them
column2: he knew he had done all he could. Besides
column3: he would have other chances. Zaun was full of sick people just waiting to be cured. With a smile returning to his face
column4: he left the hospital and set out into the streets to find more patients.

column1:
238;Zed;the Master of Shadows;Shockblade Zed;SKT T1 Zed;PROJECT: Zed;Championship Zed;Death Sworn Zed;Galaxy Slayer Zed;PsyOps Zed;PROJECT: Zed Prestige Edition;;;;;;;;Saving energy and spell cooldowns until you use your ultimate will maximize Death Mark's damage.;Quickly double tapping Living Shadow will teleport Zed to his shadow immediately for rapid escapes.;Placing a Living Shadow before using Death Mark can give Zed a safe escape from combat.;;;Zed receives bonus effect from Attack Damage items he purchases, so Armor is super effective against him.;After Zed uses his Living Shadow, he is at his most vulnerable as his damage, slow, and mobility are both dependent upon it.;Zed's Shadow Slash can only slow you if his shadow hits you with it. ;;Assassin;;Energy;9;2;1;7;584.0;85;200.0;0.0;345;32;3.5;32.0;1.25;125;7.0;0.65;50.0;0.0;63.0;3.4;3.3;0.651;Razor Shuriken;Zed and his shadows throw their shurikens.

Each shuriken deals damage to every enemy hit.;Living Shadow;Passive: Zed gains energy whenever he and his shadows strike an enemy with the same ability. Energy can only be gained once per cast ability.

Active: Zed's shadow dashes forward, remaining in place for a few seconds. Reactivating Living Shadow will cause Zed to switch positions with this shadow.;Shadow Slash;Zed and his shadows slash, dealing damage to nearby enemies.;Death Mark;Zed becomes untargetable and dashes to an enemy champion, marking them. After 3 seconds the mark triggers, repeating a portion of all the damage Zed dealt to the target while they were marked.;Contempt for the Weak;Zed's basic attacks against low health targets deals bonus Magic Damage. This effect can only occur once every few seconds against the same enemy champion.;
Utterly ruthless and without mercy
column2: Zed is the leader of the Order of Shadow
column3: an organization he created with the intent of militarizing Ionia’s magical and martial traditions to drive out Noxian invaders. During the war
column4: desperation led him to unlock the secret shadow form—a malevolent spirit magic as dangerous and corrupting as it is powerful. Zed has mastered all of these forbidden techniques to destroy anything he sees as a threat to his nation
column5: or his new order.

column1: Beneath Ionia’s veil of harmony lie the tales of those left behind. For Zed
column2: his story began as a boy on the cold steps of the home of the Kinkou Order.

column1: Taken in by Great Master Kusho himself
column2: Zed found his place within the temple’s ancient walls. He dedicated himself to understanding the Kinkou’s spiritual tenets
column3: quickly outpacing his peers both in combat and study. Even so
column4: he felt overshadowed by another—his master’s son
column5: Shen. Though Zed’s passion shone through in every technique he perfected
column6: he lacked Shen’s emotional balance. In spite of this
column7: the two pupils became like brothers.

column1: In time
column2: they journeyed together with their master to track down the infamous Golden Demon. When they finally succeeded in capturing this feared “monster
column3: ” it was revealed to be a mere man named Khada Jhin. The young Zed marched forward with his blades held high
column4: but Kusho stopped him
column5: ordering that Jhin be imprisoned instead.

column1: Returning to their temple
column2: Zed’s heart bloomed with resentment
column3: and he began to struggle in his studies. He was haunted by the memories of Jhin’s grisly murders
column4: and rising tensions between Ionia and the imperialistic forces of Noxus only worsened his disillusionment. While Shen was growing to adopt his father’s dispassion
column5: Zed refused to let lofty notions of balance stand in the way of punishing evil.

column1: He ventured deep into the temple’s hidden catacombs
column2: and there he discovered an ornate
column3: black box. Even though he knew it was forbidden to any but the masters of the order
column4: he peered inside.

column1: Shadows enveloped Zed’s mind
column2: feeding his bitterness with contempt for the weak
column3: and hinting at an ancient
column4: dark magic.

column1: Returning to the light of the temple
column2: he came face to face with Great Master Kusho. Zed demanded the Kinkou strike at the Noxian invaders with every means at their disposal. When Kusho refused
column3: Zed turned his back on the order that had raised him.

column1: Unbound by Kinkou doctrine
column2: he raised a following of warriors to resist Noxus. Any soul who threatened his homeland
column3: or stood idle in its defense
column4: was marked for death without mercy—including native vastaya who wavered in their allegiance. Zed urged his followers to embrace the fervor of war
column5: but soon enough he realized his own abilities would never match his ambitions without the black box.

column1: Amassing his new acolytes
column2: he returned to the Kinkou temple
column3: where he was met by Kusho. The elderly man laid his weapons at Zed’s feet
column4: imploring his former pupil to renounce the shadows in favor of a more balanced path.

column1: Moments later
column2: Zed emerged back onto the temple steps. In one hand
column3: he grasped the box—and in the other
column4: his freshly bloodied blade.

column1: The Kinkou
column2: frozen with shock
column3: fell in droves as Zed’s warriors cut them down. He then claimed the temple for himself
column4: establishing his Order of Shadow
column5: and began training his acolytes in the ways of darkness. They etched their flesh with shadowy tattoos
column6: learning to fight alongside shrouded reflections of themselves.

column1: Zed took advantage of the ongoing war with Noxus
column2: and the suffering it brought to the Ionian people. In the wake of a massacre near the Epool River
column3: he came upon Kayn
column4: a Noxian child soldier wielding nothing but a farmer’s sickle. Zed could see the boy was a weapon waiting to be sharpened
column5: and took him as his personal student. In this young acolyte
column6: he saw a purity of purpose to match his own. In Kayn
column7: Zed could see the future of the Order of Shadow.

column1: Though he did not reconcile with Shen and the remaining Kinkou
column2: now scattered throughout the provinces
column3: they reached an uneasy accord in the aftermath of the war. Zed knew what he had done could not be undone.

column1: In recent years
column2: it has become clear that the balance of the First Lands has been disrupted
column3: perhaps forever. For Zed
column4: spiritual harmony holds little consequence—he will do what needs to be done to see Ionia triumph.

column1:
202;Jhin;the Virtuoso;High Noon Jhin;Blood Moon Jhin;SKT T1 Jhin;PROJECT: Jhin;Dark Cosmic Jhin;Shan Hai Scrolls Jhin;DWG Jhin;;;;;;;;;Deadly Flourish has incredible range. When approaching a fight be sure to look ahead for enemies that could be rooted.;Your ultimate deals significantly less damage to enemies with full health. Look to pick off weakened targets as they run away.;You can still cast your spells while reloading. Use them to fill the down time.;;;Deadly Flourish only roots those hit by one of Jhin's basic attacks, traps, or allies within the last 4 seconds.;Jhin places invisible traps around the map. Watch where you step!;Jhin's attacks are quite potent, but he runs out of ammo after the 4th shot. Use this window to jump him and burst him down.;;Marksman;Mage;Mana;10;2;6;6;585.0;93;300.0;50.0;330;24;3.5;30.0;0.5;550;3.75;0.55;6.0;0.8;59.0;4.7;0.0;0.625;Dancing Grenade;Jhin launches a magical cartridge at an enemy. It can hit up to four targets and gains damage each time it kills.;Deadly Flourish;Jhin brandishes his cane, firing a single shot with incredible range. It pierces through minions and monsters, but stops on the first champion hit. If the target was recently struck by Jhin's allies, lotus traps, or damaged by Jhin, they are rooted.;Captive Audience;Jhin places an invisible lotus trap that blooms when walked over. It slows nearby enemies before dealing damage with an explosion of serrated petals.

Beauty in Death - When Jhin kills an enemy champion, a lotus trap will bloom near their corpse.;Curtain Call;Jhin channels, transforming Whisper into a shoulder-mounted mega-cannon. It is able to fire 4 super shots at extreme range that pierce through minions and monsters, but stop on the first champion impacted. Whisper cripples enemies hit, which slows them and deals execute damage. The 4th shot is perfectly crafted, epically powerful, and guaranteed to critically strike.;Whisper;Jhin's hand cannon, Whisper, is a precise instrument designed to deal superior damage. It fires at a fixed rate and carries only four shots. Jhin imbues the final bullet with dark magics to critically strike and deal bonus execute damage. Whenever Whisper crits, it inspires Jhin with a burst of Move Speed.;
Jhin is a meticulous criminal psychopath who believes murder is art. Once an Ionian prisoner
column2: but freed by shadowy elements within Ionia’s ruling council
column3: the serial killer now works as their cabal's assassin. Using his gun as his paintbrush
column4: Jhin creates works of artistic brutality
column5: horrifying victims and onlookers. He gains a cruel pleasure from putting on his gruesome theater
column6: making him the ideal choice to send the most powerful of messages: terror.

column1: For years
column2: Ionia’s southern mountains were plagued by the infamous “Golden Demon.” Throughout the province of Zhyun
column3: a monster slaughtered scores of travelers and sometimes whole farmsteads
column4: leaving behind twisted displays of corpses. Armed militias searched the forests
column5: towns hired demon hunters
column6: Wuju masters patrolled the roads - but nothing slowed the beast’s grisly work.

column1: In desperation
column2: the Council of Zhyun sent an envoy to beg Great Master Kusho for help. Upon hearing of the region’s plight
column3: Kusho feigned an excuse for why he couldn’t help. But a week later
column4: the master
column5: his son  Shen
column6: and star apprentice Zed
column7: disguised themselves as merchants and moved to the province. In secret
column8: they visited the countless families emotionally shattered by the killings
column9: dissected the horrific crime scenes
column10: and looked for possible connections or patterns to the murders.

column1: Their investigation took four long years
column2: and left the three men changed. The famous red mane of Kusho turned white; Shen
column3: known for his wit and humor
column4: became somber; and Zed
column5: the brightest star of Kusho’s temple
column6: began to struggle with his studies. Upon finally finding a pattern to the killings
column7: the Great Master is quoted as saying: “Good and evil are not truths. They are born from men and each sees the shades differently.”

column1: Depicted in a variety of plays and epic poems
column2: the capture of the “Golden Demon” would be the seventh and final great feat in the illustrious career of Lord Kusho. On the eve of the Blossom Festival in Jyom Pass
column3: Kusho disguised himself as a renowned calligrapher to blend in with the other guest artists. Then he waited. Everyone had assumed only an evil spirit could commit these horrifying crimes
column4: but Kusho had realized the killer was an ordinary man. The famed “Golden Demon” was actually a mere stagehand in Zhyun’s traveling theaters and opera houses working under the name Khada Jhin.

column1: When they caught Jhin
column2: young Zed marched forward to kill the cowering man
column3: but Kusho held him back. Despite the horrors of Jhin’s actions
column4: the legendary master decided the killer should be taken alive and left at Tuula Prison. Shen disagreed
column5: but accepted the emotionless logic of his father’s judgment. Zed
column6: disturbed and haunted by the murder scenes he had witnessed
column7: was unable to understand or accept this mercy
column8: and it is said a resentment began to bloom in his heart.

column1: Though imprisoned in Tuula for many years
column2: the polite and shy Khada Jhin revealed little of himself - even his real name remained a mystery. But while a prisoner
column3: the monks noted he was a bright student who excelled in many subjects
column4: including smithing
column5: poetry
column6: and dance. Regardless
column7: the guards and monks could find nothing to cure him of his morbid fascinations.

column1: Outside the prison
column2: Ionia fell into turmoil as the Noxian empire’s invasion led to political instability. War awoke the tranquil nation’s appetite for bloodshed. The peace and balance Kusho had famously fought to protect was shattered from within as dark hearts rose in power and secret alliances competed for influence. Desperate to counter the power of the ninja and Wuju swordsmen
column3: a cabal within the ruling council conspired to secretly free Jhin and turn him into a weapon of terror.

column1: Now with access to the Kashuri armories’ new weapons
column2: and nearly unlimited funds
column3: the scale of Khada Jhin’s “performances” has grown. His work has brought fear to many foreign dignitaries and to Ionia’s secret political underground
column4: but how long will a serial killer
column5: craving attention
column6: be satisfied working in the shadows?

column1: 6;Urgot;the Dreadnought;Giant Enemy Crabgot;Butcher Urgot;Battlecast Urgot;High Noon Urgot;Pajama Guardian Cosplay Urgot;;;;;;;;;;;Pay attention to your individual leg's cooldowns, as they make for a signficiant portion of your damage;Land Corrosive Charge or Disdain to lock on to target's with Purge - a great way to trigger multiple legs in rapid succession.;Save Fear Beyond Death for opponents you know are already too weak to survive. It's especially good for picking off fleeing foes.;;;Urgot relies heavily on blasting opponents with his legs, which have their own cooldowns and only detonate when he attacks in the direction they are facing. Avoid getting hit by multiple.;Urgot can deal and absorb tremendous amounts of damage with Purge, but slows himself while firing.;If you are struck by Fear Beyond Death, do your best to avoid falling below the execution threshold (25% of your Maximum Health) until the effect times out.;;Fighter;Tank;Mana;8;5;3;8;585.0;88;340.0;45.0;330;36;4.25;32.0;1.25;350;7.5;0.7;7.25;0.8;63.0;4.0;3.75;0.625;Corrosive Charge;Fires an explosive charge at the target location, dealing physical damage and slowing enemies caught in the explosion.;Purge;Urgot slows himself while he unloads his weapon on nearby enemies. Prioritizes enemy champions Urgot has recently struck with other abilities and triggers Echoing Flames.;Disdain;Urgot charges in a direction, shielding himself and trampling non-champion enemies. If he catches an enemy champion, he will stop and hurl them out of his way.;Fear Beyond Death;Urgot fires a chem-drill that impales the first enemy champion hit. If that champion falls below a health threshold, Urgot judges them weak and can execute them.;Echoing Flames;Urgot's basic attacks and Purge periodically trigger blasts of flame from his legs, dealing physical damage.;
Once a powerful Noxian headsman
column2: Urgot was betrayed by the empire for which he had killed so many. Bound in iron chains
column3: he was forced to learn the true meaning of strength in the Dredge—a prison mine deep beneath Zaun. Emerging in a disaster that spread chaos throughout the city
column4: he now casts an imposing shadow over its criminal underworld. Raising his victims on the very chains that once enslaved him
column5: he will purge his new home of the unworthy
column6: making it a crucible of pain.

column1: Urgot always believed he was worthy.
As a headsman
column2: an executioner of the weak
column3: he was a living embodiment of the Noxian ideal that strength should rule
column4: making it a reality with every swing of his axe. His pride swelled as the bodies piled ever higher behind him
column5: and his intimidating presence kept countless warbands in line.

column1: Even so
column2: a single word was all it took to seal his fate. Sent to distant Zaun to eliminate a supposed conspiracy against the ruler of Noxus
column3: Urgot realized too late the mission was a setup
column4: removing him from the capital even as the usurper Swain seized control of it. Surrounded by agents of the chem-barons
column5: and enraged that everything he believed was a lie
column6: Urgot was dragged down into the chemtech mines beneath Zaun. He was defeated. He was enslaved. He was not worthy after all. He endured the mine’s hellish conditions in grim silence
column7: waiting for death.

column1: In the Dredge
column2: death came in many forms…

column1: The mine’s warden
column2: Baron Voss
column3: would sometimes offer freedom in return for a prisoner’s tortured confession—granting it with the edge of her blade. From the screams that echoed through the tunnels
column4: Urgot learned about the wonders of Zaun. There was something special about the city
column5: something marvelous and evident even in the secrets that spilled from slit throats. Urgot didn’t know what it was until he was finally brought before Voss
column6: fearing that she would break him.

column1: But as the baron’s blade cut into his flesh
column2: Urgot realized that his body was already wracked with agony
column3: far beyond anything Voss could inflict. The Dredge had made him stronger than he’d ever been as a headsman.

column1: Pain was Zaun’s secret. His laughter drove Voss back to the surface
column2: and a reign of anarchy began in the depths.

column1: Seizing control of the prison
column2: Urgot reveled in new trials of survival. He found the parts of his body that were weakest
column3: and replaced them with scavenged machinery
column4: technology created by those who would die without it—necessity being the mother of pain.

column1: The guards could no longer enter the areas Urgot had carved out of Voss’ grasp. The prisoners themselves were more afraid of their new master than they were of her. Many even grew to hold a fanatical respect for Urgot
column2: as they were forced to hear his feverish sermons on the nature of power
column3: his grip tightening around the necks of those who would not listen.

column1: Only when a Noxian agent arrived in the Dredge was Urgot finally forced to confront his own past. Though the spy recognized him and sought his aid in escaping
column2: Urgot beat him mercilessly
column3: and hurled his broken body into the darkness.

column1: It was not strength that ruled Noxus
column2: Urgot now realized
column3: but men… and men were weak. There should be no rulers
column4: no lies
column5: nothing to interfere with the pure chaos of survival. Starting a riot that ignited a chemtech vein within the mine
column6: Urgot shook the city above
column7: and cracked the prison open in an explosion that rivaled the birth of Zaun itself. Many prisoners died
column8: with thousands fleeing into the Sump—but the worthy
column9: as ever
column10: survived.

column1: From that day
column2: Urgot’s reign of terror only grew. A hideous fusion of industrial machinery and Noxian brutality
column3: he slaughtered chem-barons and their lackeys one by one
column4: gathering a following among Zaun’s downtrodden masses. He was said to be a new savior
column5: one who would lift the boot of the oppressor from the neck of every common Zaunite.

column1: However
column2: his actions did not make such distinctions
column3: as Urgot tested the worthiness of the meek and the powerful alike. To any who found themselves spared in his deadly trials
column4: his message was clear: he was not there to lead
column5: but to survive. If others were worthy
column6: they would survive
column7: too.

column1: When Urgot finally struck at representatives of the Piltovan merchant clans
column2: the Wardens were forced to intervene
column3: hauling him in chains to a fortified prison cell—though this merely seemed to confirm “the Dreadnought” as a legend among the gangers
column4: the sump-snipes
column5: and the forgotten.

column1: For Piltover is not the first to shackle Urgot
column2: and one must wonder if any cage can ever hope to hold him for long…

column1: 427;Ivern;the Green Father;Candy King Ivern;Dunkmaster Ivern;Old God Ivern;;;;;;;;;;;;;Try to help allies follow up a good Rootcaller hit with Triggerseed!;Use Brushmaker to set up future ambush spots!;Daisy can block skillshots and slow down enemies. Use her to peel for your teammates!;;;Ivern can be deceptively slippery. Be careful chasing him too far.;Ivern's brush has a long duration. Watch out for ambushes!;Be careful when fighting Ivern alone if he has Daisy ready to help!;;Support;Mage;Mana;3;5;7;7;585.0;85;450.0;60.0;330;27;3.5;32.0;1.25;475;7.0;0.85;6.0;0.75;50.0;3.0;3.4;0.644;Rootcaller;Ivern conjures a vine, dealing damage and rooting enemy targets hit. Ivern's allies can dash to the rooted target.;Brushmaker;In brush, Ivern's attacks deal bonus magic damage. Ivern can activate this ability to create a patch of brush.;Triggerseed;Ivern places a shield on an ally which explodes after a short duration slowing and damaging enemies.;Daisy!;Ivern summons his Sentinel friend Daisy to fight with him. Daisy will send out a shockwave if she attacks the same champion three times in a row.;Friend of the Forest;Ivern cannot attack or be attacked by non-epic monsters. Ivern can create magical groves on jungle camps which grow over time. When the grove is fully grown, Ivern may free the monsters to receive gold and experience. After level 5 Ivern can share jungle buffs with allies.;
Ivern
column2: known to many as Bramblefoot or the Old Woodsman
column3: is a peculiar half-man
column4: half-tree who roams the wilds of Runeterra
column5: cultivating life everywhere he goes. He knows all the secrets of the natural world
column6: and holds deep friendships with things that grow
column7: fly
column8: and scuttle. Ivern enriches the forests
column9: imparts strange wisdom to any mortal he meets
column10: and occasionally entrusts loose-lipped butterflies with his secrets.

column1: Ivern the Cruel was renowned as a fierce warrior
column2: in the latter days of the ancient Vorrijaard. His clan followed the most warlike of the old gods
column3: and would not kneel before the upstart “Three Sisters” like so many others had.

column1: However
column2: the dark sorcery that strengthened their armies was undeniable. Ivern and his kin plotted long and hard to overthrow these hated Iceborn
column3: eventually setting sail into the east—in search of the land where the sun first rose
column4: from where it was said that all magic flowed into the world. If Ivern could seize such power for his own
column5: then he could surely break any foe.

column1: As his fleet sailed over the horizon
column2: they passed out of memory and into myth
column3: for they were never seen in their homeland again.

column1: In truth
column2: Ivern the Cruel landed on the shores of Ionia. After cleaving through a dozen coastal settlements
column3: he and his warriors discovered a sacred grove known as Omikayalan
column4: “the Heart of the World”. And there
column5: in that strange and verdant garden
column6: they met the fiercest resistance. Chimeric beings—half human
column7: half beast—came at them again and again beneath the twisted branches.

column1: Undeterred
column2: Ivern pressed on
column3: until the battered remnants of his expedition reached what the Ionians held so sacred: the legendary God-Willow.

column1: Ivern was transfixed
column2: even as the fighting raged around him. It was a truly colossal tree
column3: dripping with long gossamer leaves that shimmered with golden-green light. It was magic like nothing he had ever felt before
column4: and it was clear these inhuman creatures would die to protect it. Seeking to shatter their resolve
column5: he took up his war axe
column6: and roared with hatred as he struck at the God-Willow over and over again.

column1: The great tree fell. In a riot of life-energy
column2: Ivern the Cruel was instantly undone.

column1: Detached
column2: drifting
column3: he saw the battle was over. The flesh of the fallen fed carrion birds and insects alike
column4: or decayed under bursts of colorful mushrooms. Bones rotted into fertile soil
column5: and seeds within it budded and sprouted into trees bearing fruit of their own. Leaves and petals pulsed like colorful hearts. From the death that surrounded him
column6: life exploded forth in ways too numerous to believe.

column1: Never had Ivern beheld such beauty. Life
column2: in all its forms
column3: was tangled together like an impossible knot that didn’t want to be untied. He wept
column4: and those dewdrop tears fell upon his changed body. He was taller than he remembered
column5: his limbs rough with bark and leaves. The magic of an entirely different world coursed through him. He did not know why
column6: or how
column7: but he was all that now remained of the God-Willow.

column1: With that realization
column2: he heard the bawling of hills
column3: the howling of trees
column4: and the dripping tears of moss. He reflected on the mistakes he’d made
column5: the cruelty he’d visited on others. Remorse washed over Ivern
column6: and he cried out for forgiveness.

column1: When he finally moved
column2: so much time had passed that the world felt… new? The violence and sadness of his former self were mere echoes in his heart. He found he could dig his toes deep into the soil
column3: and commune with the roots
column4: rocks
column5: and rivers. Even the dirt itself had opinions!

column1: Ivern wandered far—across Ionia
column2: and beyond—and the strange magic of Omikayalan followed in his wake. He developed close kinships with creatures great and small
column3: observing their foibles
column4: delighting in their little habits
column5: and occasionally offering a helping hand. He shortened the inchworm’s path
column6: played tricks with mischievous bramblebacks
column7: hugged thorny elmarks
column8: and laughed with wizened elder-fungus.

column1: In one instance
column2: he found a wounded stone golem. Knowing the poor thing’s spirit was fading
column3: he fashioned her a new heart from a river pebble
column4: and the golem became Ivern’s devoted life-friend. He named her Daisy
column5: after the flowers that mysteriously sprouted from her stone body.

column1: Sometimes
column2: Ivern encountered mortals
column3: and many of them were at least somewhat peaceful. They called him Bramblefoot
column4: or Green Father
column5: or the Old Woodsman
column6: and told tales of his strange benevolence. But he was filled with sadness to see how they still took more than they gave
column7: how they could be so cruel and so careless
column8: and he retreated from their company.

column1: If he bore the God-Willow’s legacy
column2: he needed to cultivate humanity—help them watch
column3: listen
column4: and grow. Being mortal once himself
column5: Ivern knew this would be difficult
column6: so he smiled and challenged himself to complete this task before the final sunset.

column1: He knew he would have time.
