Remember to save your displacement effects until after she's done charging.;;Fighter;Assassin;Mana;8;5;3;4;585.0;85;295.0;65.0;340;30;4.0;32.0;1.25;125;10.0;1.0;8.0;0.65;63.0;3.5;2.0;0.644;Vault Breaker;Vi charges her gauntlets and unleashes a vault shattering punch, carrying her forward. Enemies she hits are knocked back and receive a stack of Denting Blows.;Denting Blows;Vi's punches break her opponent's Armor, dealing bonus damage and granting her Attack Speed.;Relentless Force;Vi's next attack blasts through her target, dealing damage to enemies behind it.;Cease and Desist;Vi runs down an enemy, knocking aside anyone in the way. When she reaches her target she knocks it into the air, jumps after it, and slams it back into the ground.;Blast Shield;Vi charges a shield over time. The shield can be activated by hitting an enemy with an ability.;
Once a criminal from the mean streets of Zaun
column2: Vi is a hotheaded
column3: impulsive
column4: and fearsome woman with only a very loose respect for authority figures. Growing up all but alone
column5: Vi developed finely honed survival instincts as well as a wickedly abrasive sense of humor. Now working with the Wardens to keep the peace in Piltover
column6: she wields mighty hextech gauntlets that can punch through walls—and suspects—with equal ease.

column1: Vi remembers little of her childhood in Zaun
column2: and what she does remember
column3: she wishes she didn’t. Running with the sump-snipe gangs
column4: she quickly learned to use her wits
column5: as well as her fists
column6: to survive. Everyone who encountered Vi knew she could talk—or punch—her way out of trouble. More often than not
column7: she chose the latter.

column1: None of the old-timers from her youth could tell her anything of her parents. Most assumed they had died in one of the industrial accidents that were
column2: sadly
column3: all too common in the undercity. Though she had ended up in the crumbling Hope House orphanage
column4: a notoriously mad sump-scrapper claimed to have found her adrift in a bassinet large enough for two in the ruins of a collapsed chem-lab. In the end
column5: Vi figured some things were best left unknown.

column1: With her wild pink hair
column2: she became a distinctive sight on the streets of Zaun—hightailing from angry shopkeepers in the boundary markets
column3: swaggering through the colorful bazaars of the Black Lanes
column4: or hitching rides up into Piltover aboard the hexdraulic conveyors. Wherever there was a scrape to be gotten into or a scam to be run
column5: Vi was in the thick of it
column6: though she never stole from those that couldn’t cover the loss… and never hurt those that didn’t deserve it.

column1: As she got older
column2: the capers of childhood became more audacious and daring
column3: and Vi formed a gang of her own. Brash and quick to anger
column4: she still relied on her fists a little too much
column5: and was rarely without a black eye or split lip.

column1: She found a mentor in the owner of a bar on the edge of the Lanes
column2: who tempered some of her more self-destructive tendencies. He tried to reinforce her moral code
column3: and showed her how to fight with discipline
column4: as well as teaching her ways to better direct her simmering anger.

column1: In time
column2: Vi earned a reputation as someone who got things done
column3: no questions asked.

column1: Listening to the chatter of the Zaunite miners who frequented the bar
column2: she came to learn when big deals were being made
column3: and how payments were to be delivered. To a chem-baron
column4: this was chump change—but to her and her friends
column5: it would be a fortune. She planned a heist
column6: but knew it would require extra bodies to pull off
column7: so Vi reluctantly brought a rival gang
column8: the Factorywood Fiends
column9: in on her score.

column1: Everything was going fine
column2: until the leader of the Fiends killed the mine owner with a pair of oversized pulverizer gauntlets
column3: and trapped the rest of the workers in the tunnels. Even as both gangs fled with the loot
column4: Vi knew she could not leave these innocent people to die. She snatched up the gauntlets
column5: the wrist mechanisms clamping down painfully on her arms
column6: but she endured the agony long enough to smash open a path to free the miners.

column1: The following day
column2: Vi paid a visit to the Factorywood Fiends. Still wearing the powered gauntlets
column3: she took on the entire gang
column4: administering a beating so legendary that it is still spoken of in the Lanes to this day.

column1: Vi eventually disappeared from Zaun during a time of great upheaval
column2: when tensions with Piltover were running high. Rumors circulated between the gangs that she had been killed in a huge explosion in the heart of the undercity
column3: or that she had turned her back on her friends and struck out for distant lands. The truth
column4: however
column5: finally came to light when Old Hungry’s Scars—a vicious gang whose murder sprees had spread topside—were brought down by the Sheriff of Piltover and her new ally… Vi.

column1: The former gang leader was now in the employ of the Wardens
column2: and she had replaced the chem-powered pulverizer gauntlets with a pair of brand new hextech Atlas prototypes.

column1: No one yet knows the exact reason why or how Vi came to be working alongside Caitlyn—but given the anarchic nature of the crime wave now sweeping Piltover
column2: speculation runs rife that it might involve a certain blue-haired hellion from Zaun…

column1:
107;Rengar;the Pridestalker;Headhunter Rengar;Night Hunter Rengar;SSW Rengar;Mecha Rengar;Pretty Kitty Rengar;Guardian of the Sands Rengar;Sentinel Rengar;;;;;;;;;Use Rengar's ultimate to find and assassinate high priority targets in team fights and skirmishes.;A lot of Rengar's power comes from empowered abilities he uses at the right moment - choose wisely!;Make sure to take paths through brush when chasing opponents to take advantage of Rengar's passive.;;;Rengar gains an empowered ability when his resource bar is full. Try to confront him when it's low.;Rengar's passive enables him to leap out of brush, so avoid fighting him when near bushes.;Rengar puts an indicator over the nearest enemy champion when he is camouflaged during his ultimate.;;Assassin;Fighter;Ferocity;7;4;2;8;585.0;90;4.0;0.0;345;34;3.0;32.0;1.25;125;7.0;0.5;0.0;0.0;68.0;3.0;3.0;0.667;Savagery;Rengar's next attack brutally stabs his target for bonus damage.

Ferocity effect: deals increased damage and grants Attack Speed.;Battle Roar;Rengar lets out a battle roar, damaging enemies and healing for some of the recent damage he has taken.

Ferocity effect: additionally breaks crowd control effects.;Bola Strike;Rengar throws a bola, slowing the first target hit for a short duration.

Ferocity effect: roots the target.;Thrill of the Hunt;Rengar's predatory instincts take over, Camouflaging him and revealing the nearest enemy champion in a large radius around him. During Thrill of the Hunt, Rengar gains Movement Speed and he can leap to the tracked enemy without being in brush, reducing their armor.;Unseen Predator;While in brush, Rengar leaps at his target with his basic attack. Leaping while at no Ferocity generates Ferocity.At Max Ferocity, his next ability is empowered. Casting an empowered ability increases Rengar's Movement Speed for a few seconds.Killing enemy champions awards trophies on Rengar's Bonetooth Necklace, granting bonus attack damage.;
Rengar is a ferocious vastayan trophy hunter who lives for the thrill of tracking down and killing dangerous creatures. He scours the world for the most fearsome beasts he can find
column2: especially seeking any trace of Kha'Zix
column3: the void creature who scratched out his eye. Rengar stalks his prey neither for food nor glory
column4: but for the sheer beauty of the pursuit.

column1: Rengar hails from a tribe of Shuriman vastaya known as the Kiilash
column2: whose society venerated the honor and glory of the hunt. Rengar was born the runt of the litter to the tribe's chieftain
column3: Ponjaf. Ponjaf believed Rengar's diminutive size would make him a worthless hunter. He ignored his child
column4: assuming the runt would starve to death.

column1: Eventually
column2: the young Rengar fled the camp
column3: ashamed that he had disappointed his father. He subsisted on grubs and plants for weeks until
column4: one day
column5: he was nearly killed by a legendary human hunter named Markon. Upon seeing Rengar's state
column6: he took pity on the creature and let it live. Besides
column7: this was no mighty vastayan warrior worthy of Markon's blade.

column1: Rengar spent months following Markon
column2: feeding off the corpses the hunter left behind. He still hoped to one day rejoin his tribe
column3: and so took great care in observing how Markon took down his quarries.

column1: After some time
column2: Markon grew sick of the pathetic Kiilash following him around. He put a knife to Rengar's throat and informed him that the only way to be a hunter was to hunt. He tossed Rengar the blade and kicked him down a ravine
column3: where he was forced to make his first kill to survive.

column1: From then on
column2: Rengar spent years pushing himself almost to breaking point. He scoured Shurima for the most powerful and dangerous prey. Though he would never be as big as other Kiilash
column3: Rengar was determined to be twice as ferocious. Over time
column4: instead of coming back to his camp each time with fresh scars
column5: he began to come back with trophies. He polished a sandhawk's skull to a sheen; he braided the teeth of a shrieker into his hair.

column1: Then
column2: when he decided the time had come
column3: Rengar returned to his tribe
column4: ready to be accepted as a true hunter.

column1: Ponjaf scoffed at Rengar and his trophies. He decreed that only by bringing back the head of the elusive and legendary Void-abomination known as Kha'Zix would Rengar be welcomed back into the tribe.
Blinded by his eagerness
column2: Rengar allowed this cunning beast to get the drop on him. The Void creature ripped out one of Rengar's eyes and escaped. Furious and defeated
column3: Rengar admitted his failure to Ponjaf. As expected
column4: his father chastised him.

column1: But as Ponjaf spoke
column2: Rengar noticed all the trophies adorning his father's hut were dusty and old. The chieftain had not hunted anything in a long time—he had likely sent Rengar after Kha'Zix because he was too afraid to do it himself.

column1: Rengar interrupted his father and called him a coward. Many Kiilash were blessed with strong bodies or comfortable homes. Rengar
column2: conversely
column3: was born facing death. He had taught himself how to hunt
column4: and had the trophies and scars to prove it. Even his own bloody eye socket was a trophy: proof that though Rengar was born with disadvantages
column5: he never gave up.

column1: Rengar leapt onto his father and gutted him from neck to belly. The fiercest hunters of the tribe crowned him with flame-roses
column2: marking him as their new chieftain.

column1: But Rengar didn't need his village's acceptance. All he needed was adrenaline pumping through his veins as he chased down his prey. He left the village
column2: without even pausing to take a trophy from what was left of Ponjaf—his father was not a kill worthy of remembering. Instead
column3: he set off determined to find and slay the Void creature that had tried to blind him.

column1: Not to satisfy the Kiilash
column2: but to satisfy himself.

column1: 141;Kayn;the Shadow Reaper;Soulhunter Kayn;Odyssey Kayn;Nightbringer Kayn;Nightbringer Kayn Prestige Edition;;;;;;;;;;;;Look at the line-up of both your team and the enemy's team when picking your form.;Remember that nearby enemies can see which wall you're in.;;;;Umbral Trespass requires Kayn to damage a target first. Try to dodge Blade's Reach to deny him a long range cast of Umbral Trespass.;When Kayn is in terrain near you, you will get a visual warning on the edge of the terrain he's in.;Damage Kayn while he's in Shadow Step to shorten its duration, or apply hard crowd control (stun, charm, knockup, etc) to end Shadow Step immediately.;;Fighter;Assassin;Mana;10;6;1;8;585.0;85;410.0;50.0;340;38;3.3;32.0;1.25;175;8.0;0.75;11.5;0.95;68.0;3.3;2.7;0.669;Reaping Slash;Kayn dashes, then slashes. Both deal damage.;Blade's Reach;Kayn damages and slows targets in a line.;Shadow Step;Kayn can walk through terrain.;Umbral Trespass;Kayn hides in an enemy's body, dealing massive damage when he bursts out.;The Darkin Scythe;Kayn wields an ancient weapon and fights Rhaast, the darkin within it, for control. Either the Darkin will triumph, or Kayn will master Rhaast and become the Shadow Assassin.Darkin: Heal for a percentage of spell damage dealt to champions.Shadow Assassin: For the first few seconds in combat with enemy champions, deal bonus damage.;
A peerless practitioner of lethal shadow magic
column2: Shieda Kayn battles to achieve his true destiny—to one day lead the Order of the Shadow into a new era of Ionian supremacy. He audaciously wields the sentient darkin weapon Rhaast
column3: undeterred by its creeping corruption of his body and mind. There are only two possible outcomes: either Kayn bends the weapon to his will... or the malevolent blade consumes him completely
column4: paving the way for the destruction of all Runeterra.

column1: Noxian by birth
column2: Kayn and others like him were conscripted as child soldiers
column3: a cruel practice employed by only the most devious commanders of the empire. Ionian compassion was a weakness to be exploited—their warriors would hesitate before striking down a supposed innocent. Thus
column4: barely able to lift the blade he had been given
column5: Kayn’s first day in battle was also expected to be his last.

column1: The Noxian forces landed at the mouth of the Epool River. Kayn and the others were a reluctant vanguard
column2: facing disorganized bands of locals defending their home from these returning invaders. While his young comrades were cut down or fled the battlefield
column3: Kayn showed no fear. He dropped his heavy sword and snatched up a fallen sickle
column4: turning to face the shocked Ionians just as the Noxian regulars swept in from the flank.

column1: The carnage was staggering. Farmers
column2: hunters—even a handful of vastaya—all were butchered without ceremony.

column1: Two days later
column2: after word had spread throughout the southern territories
column3: the Order of the Shadow came upon the grisly scene. Their leader
column4: Zed
column5: knew this area had no tactical significance. This massacre was intended as a message. Noxus would show no mercy.

column1: A flickering glint of steel caught his eye. A child of no more than ten lay in the mud
column2: leveling his broken sickle at the master assassin
column3: bloody knuckles straining white. The boy’s eyes harbored a pain that belied his age
column4: yet still burned with all the fury of a hardened warrior. This tenacity was not something that could be taught. Zed saw in this child
column5: this abandoned Noxian survivor
column6: a weapon that could be turned against those who had sent him here to die. The assassin held out his hand and welcomed Kayn into the Order of the Shadow.

column1: Acolytes traditionally spent years training with a single weapon of their choosing
column2: but Kayn mastered them all—to him
column3: they were mere tools
column4: and he was the weapon. Armor he viewed as a cumbersome burden
column5: instead cloaking himself in shadows and slaying his enemies with quickness and stealth. These swift executions instilled fear in the hearts of those fortunate enough to be spared.

column1: And as Kayn’s legend grew
column2: so did his arrogance. He truly believed that one day his power would eclipse even that of Zed himself.

column1: This hubris led Kayn to embrace his final test: to seek out a darkin weapon recently unearthed in Noxus
column2: and prevent it being used against the weary defenders of Ionia. He accepted without hesitation
column3: never questioning why he had been chosen for this task. Indeed
column4: where any other acolyte would have destroyed the living scythe known as Rhaast
column5: Kayn took it for himself.

column1: The corruption took hold the moment his fingers closed around the weapon
column2: locking them both in a fateful struggle. Rhaast has long awaited the perfect host in order to join its darkin brethren and lay waste to the world
column3: but Kayn will not be easily dominated. He returns to Ionia in triumph
column4: convinced that Zed will name him the new leader of the Order of the Shadow.

column1: 245;Ekko;the Boy Who Shattered Time;Sandstorm Ekko;Academy Ekko;PROJECT: Ekko;SKT T1 Ekko;Trick or Treat Ekko;True Damage Ekko;Pulsefire Ekko;;;;;;;;;Chronobreak is a potent escape tool, but it can also be quite powerful when used offensively. Don't underestimate its damage potential.;If you can proc Z-Drive Resonance on an enemy champion, it's worth taking risks to do so. The bonus movement speed makes it easy to escape.;Phase Dive's dash is a great tool for setting up Ekko's other abilities. Use it to get double hits with Timewinder or get into position to detonate Parallel Convergence.;;;Ekko is significantly weaker when his ultimate is down. Watch for the trail he leaves behind to determine if Chronobreak is available.;Ekko's stun zone takes 3 seconds to arm. Watch for the image he creates on cast and try to guess where the zone was placed.;The second hit of Timewinder does more damage than the first; try to avoid it.";;Assassin;Fighter;Mana;5;3;7;8;585.0;85;280.0;70.0;340;32;3.0;32.0;1.25;125;9.0;0.9;7.0;0.8;58.0;3.0;3.3;0.688;Timewinder;Ekko throws a temporal grenade that expands into a time-distortion field upon hitting an enemy champion
column2: slowing and damaging anyone caught inside. After a delay
column3: the grenade rewinds back to Ekko
column4: dealing damage on its return.;Parallel Convergence;Ekko's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage to low health enemies. He can cast Parallel Convergence to split the timeline
column5: creating an anomaly after a few seconds that slows enemies caught inside. If Ekko enters the anomaly
column6: he gains shielding and stuns enemies by suspending them in time.;Phase Dive;Ekko rolls evasively while charging up his Z-Drive. His next attack deals bonus damage and warps reality
column7: teleporting him to his target.;Chronobreak;Ekko shatters his timeline
column8: becoming untargetable and rewinding to a more favorable point in time. He returns to whenever he was a few seconds ago
column9: and heals for a percentage of the damage received in that duration. Enemies near his arrival zone take massive damage.;Z-Drive Resonance;Every third attack or damaging spell on the same target deals bonus magic damage
column10: and grants Ekko a burst of speed if the target is a champion.;"

column1: A prodigy from the rough streets of Zaun
column2: Ekko manipulates time to twist any situation to his advantage. Using his own invention
column3: the Zero Drive
column4: he explores the branching possibilities of reality to craft the perfect moment. Though he revels in this freedom
column5: when there’s a threat to his friends he’ll do anything to defend them. To outsiders
column6: Ekko seems to achieve the impossible the first time
column7: every time.

column1: Born with genius-level intellect
column2: Ekko constructed simple machines before he could crawl. Amazed by these displays of brilliance
column3: his parents
column4: Inna and Wyeth
column5: vowed to provide a good future for their son. In their mind
column6: Zaun
column7: with all its pollution and crime
column8: was no place for a child of his genius. They toiled through long factory hours and worked in dangerous conditions in order to forge a path for their son to have opportunities in Piltover.

column1: But Ekko saw things differently.
He witnessed his parents aging beyond their years
column2: trying to make ends meet with small wages while their handmade goods were sold to wealthy Piltovans for exorbitant profits
column3: profits they’d never see thanks to the greedy Factorywood overseers and their shrewd buyers. Pilties wandered over to the Promenade for good
column4: cheap times or down to the Entresol to indulge in “everything goes” type clubs. No
column5: his parents’ vision of Ekko living a good life in the privilege-filled City of Progress was one he didn’t share.

column1: Zaun
column2: however… Where his parents only saw the oppressive layers of choking pollution and a blight of criminality
column3: Ekko looked beyond and discovered a dynamic city overflowing with energy and potential. It was a hotbed of pure innovation
column4: a melting pot of faraway cultures
column5: immigrants united by a single desire to pioneer the future. But even they could not hold a candle to the native Zaunites. Not the tech-augmented thugs or bottom-feeding scum whose wicked deeds dominated Piltover newspapers; but the sump-scrappers
column6: the chem-jacks
column7: the horticulturalists that tended to the cultivairs. These
column8: and so many more
column9: were the heart and soul of the city. They were resourceful
column10: resilient
column11: and industrious. They built a thriving culture out of catastrophe and flourished where others would have perished. That Zaun spirit enchanted Ekko and drove him to build his machines exclusively out of junk no one else valued
column12: and spurred him on to test them on himself.

column1: He wasn’t alone in possessing that spirit. Ekko befriended scrappy orphans
column2: inquisitive runaways
column3: and anyone whose thirst for excitement was as infectious as the grey-pox. Each had unique talents: from climbing to sculpting
column4: from painting to planning. Many Zaunites eschewed formal education in favor of apprenticeships
column5: these self-dubbed Lost Children of Zaun looked to labyrinthine streets to be their mentor
column6: and as such wasted time in glorious
column7: youthful fashion. They challenged each other to footraces through the Border Markets. They dared each other to climb the precarious routes from the Sump to the Entresol and up to the Promenade. They ran wild and free
column8: answering to no one except their own whims.

column1: To stand out from criminal gangs and other chem-punks
column2: he and his friends opted to keep their bodies whole. Augmentation was
column3: to them
column4: a waste of money and frowned upon. So was stealing from anyone who had nothing or less than they had. This made uppercrust Pilties and tech-enhanced bullies such enticing targets for their mischief. They adorned their secret hideouts with pilfered goods and works of art painted directly on walls. The Lost Children of Zaun felt invincible.

column1: As he grew up
column2: Ekko’s inventions became more fantastic and complex
column3: requiring exotic components that needed to be “liberated” from the scrapyards. Good thing he subscribed to a conveniently flexible view of trespassing. Soon
column4: tech-enhanced vigilnaut thugs and unnervingly aggressive security guards were constantly on lookout for Ekko and his misfit crew
column5: and often gave the teens a merry chase. It always amused him how Piltover laboratories and Chem-Baron factories fiercely guarded their junk. It’s not like they were using these discarded bits of tech for anything. He
column6: on the other hand
column7: could put their trash to good use with a little ingenuity.

column1: One night
column2: while Ekko scoured the rubble of a recently demolished laboratory
column3: he made an astonishing find: a shard of a blue-green gem that glittered with magical energy. He quickly searched and discovered other fragments of the glowing jewel. The shards hummed like they were trying to sing a broken melody
column4: the song growing louder when near other pieces. He painstakingly searched for every splinter of the broken crystal
column5: though some were buried deep beneath tons of debris that required him to squeeze and wiggle between chunks of smelly rubbish. Every child of Zaun heard tales about hextech crystals. They powered weapons and heroes. They could create energy on their own. Hextech crystals had the potential to change the world. Now he held a broken one.

column1: Before he could celebrate his find
column2: the place was crawling with vigilnauts scanning the ruins
column3: searching for something. Ekko knew it was the pieces of the crystal he held in his hand. He barely escaped detection.

column1: After meticulous study
column2: Ekko noticed that faint traces of energy surged when the crystals were brought closer together; the edges crackled and sent waves of rippling distortion through the air. When he pulled the pieces apart
column3: a magnetic-like resistance fought his efforts. It was as if the splintered crystals remembered being whole. Even curiouser
column4: Ekko felt the strangest sensation; a haunting feeling of remembering a moment
column5: only slightly differently.

column1: His hands couldn’t keep up with the ideas his mind had for the crystal. During one of his less-than-scientific experiments
column2: the gem exploded into a vortex of shimmering dust
column3: triggering eddies of temporal distortion. Ekko opened his eyes to see several splintered realities—and several “echo” versions of himself— staring back in sheer panic amid the fractured continua.

column1: He’d really done it this time.
After some tense coordination between Ekko and his paradoxes
column2: they contained and repaired the doozy of a hole he’d torn in the fabric of reality.

column1: Eventually
column2: Ekko harnessed the shattered crystal’s temporal powers into a device that would allow him to manipulate small increments of time — well
column3: at least in theory. Before he could test his latest machine
column4: his friends badgered him into climbing Old Hungry to celebrate his name day – so Ekko slung the device over his shoulder and brought it along.

column1: They trekked out to the old clockwork tower in the heart of Old Zaun
column2: and climbed
column3: occasionally stopping to paint an obscene caricature of a prominent Piltie or two. They were near the top when a handhold gave way causing one of his friends to slip and fall off the spire. Instinctively
column4: as if he’d done it a thousand times before
column5: Ekko activated the crystal-containment device. The world shattered around him and he was wrenched backward through swirling particles of time.

column1: The hair on his arms tingled with electricity. A strange wooziness clouded his mind. Then he saw his friend reach for the rotting plank to repeat his soon-to-be-fatal error. CRACK! The plank gave under the boy’s weight
column2: but Ekko reached out and grabbed his plummeting friend by the shirt collar and swung him to a nearby ledge. Unfortunately
column3: he misjudged the trajectory and tossed his friend into the clockwork tower’s grinding gears. Whoops.

column1: Numerous rewinds and some adjustments for windshear later
column2: Ekko saved his friend’s life. To others
column3: it looked like Ekko had the reflexes of a god. Instantly
column4: his status was elevated. He told them about the crystal and the time manipulation and made them swear to keep quiet. Instead
column5: they shamelessly exaggerated their friend’s exploits and dared each other to attempt increasingly reckless stunts
column6: knowing they would be kept safe. With each trial (and so much error) the time-warping device – which he’d dubbed the Zero Drive – grew more and more stable. Ekko found he could pilfer components
column7: clobber imposing chem-punk bullies
column8: and even get pickup lines right
column9: making a good first impression every time. The only limit was how much his body could take before exhaustion set in.

column1: Rumors and tales of Ekko’s time-bending antics reached the ears of certain powerful people within the twinned cities. Viktor
column2: a much respected (and feared) Zaunite scientist
column3: has a keen interest in an audience with this defiant genius
column4: and outfitted several of his low-level enforcers with powerful enhancements to encourage the boy to join his services. Piltover-renowned innovator Jayce
column5: meanwhile
column6: was eager to size up the Boy Who Shattered Time and reverse-engineer his technology. However
column7: Ekko values his independence too much
column8: and has no desire to be a part of anyone’s agenda. A few pursuers might catch a glimpse of Ekko before being thwarted
column9: often embarrassingly so
column10: by the sump-snipe with a preternatural knack for pinpointing their exact weakness.

column1: In his wildest dreams
column2: Ekko imagines his hometown rising up to dwarf the City of Progress. Piltover's golden veneer would be overshadowed by the sheer ingenuity and relentless spunk of a Zaun born not from generations of privilege but from utter daring. He may not have a plan yet
column3: but Ekko has all the time in the world to make his dream a reality.

column1: After all
column2: if he can change the past
column3: how hard could it be to change the future?

column1: 56;Nocturne;the Eternal Nightmare;Frozen Terror Nocturne;Void Nocturne;Ravager Nocturne;Haunting Nocturne;Eternum Nocturne;Cursed Revenant Nocturne;Old God Nocturne;Hextech Nocturne;;;;;;;;Using Paranoia at a critical moment is well worth it even if you cannot use the dash.;Duskbringer isn't only an offensive ability. It can be used to close distance out of combat or escape from certain death.;Use Shroud of Darkness in tandem with Paranoia's dash. Your opponents may panic and waste a critical disable on your spell shield.;;;Stay close to your allies when Paranoia is cast - there is strength in numbers!;Nocturne's Unspeakable Horror is broken with range, so try to save your movement abilities for when he casts it.;;;Assassin;Fighter;Mana;9;5;2;4;585.0;85;275.0;35.0;345;38;3.5;32.0;0.75;125;7.0;0.75;7.0;0.45;62.0;3.1;2.7;0.721;Duskbringer;Nocturne throws a shadow blade that deals damage, leaves a Dusk Trail, and causes champions to leave a Dusk Trail. While on the trail, Nocturne can move through units and has increased Movement Speed and Attack Damage.;Shroud of Darkness;Nocturne empowers his blades, passively gaining Attack Speed. Activating Shroud of Darkness allows Nocturne to fade into the shadows, creating a magical barrier which blocks a single enemy ability and doubles his passive Attack Speed if successful.;Unspeakable Horror;Nocturne plants a nightmare into his target's mind, dealing damage each second and applying fear to the target if they do not get out of range by the end of the duration.;Paranoia;Nocturne reduces the sight radius of all enemy champions and removes their ally vision in the process. He can then launch himself at a nearby enemy champion.;Umbra Blades;Every few seconds, Nocturne's next attack strikes surrounding enemies for bonus physical damage and heals himself. Nocturne's basic attacks reduce this cooldown.;
A demonic amalgamation drawn from the nightmares that haunt every sentient mind
column2: the thing known as Nocturne has become a primordial force of pure terror. It is liquidly chaotic in aspect
column3: a faceless shadow with cold eyes and armed with wicked-looking blades. After freeing itself from the spirit realm
column4: Nocturne now continually descends upon the waking world
column5: to feed on the kind of fear that can only thrive in true darkness.

column1: While all magic can be dangerous and unpredictable
column2: there are some forms or disciplines that even the most skilled mages and sorcerers will shun
column3: and with good reason. For centuries
column4: the practice of “shadow magic” was all but forbidden across Runeterra
column5: for fear of reawakening the horrors it once unleashed upon the world.

column1: The greatest of those horrors has a name
column2: and its name is Nocturne.

column1: Towards the end of the Rune Wars
column2: desperate for victory
column3: cabals of warrior-mages sought any advantage they could find over their foes. Although no record names the first of them to cast off their flesh and enter the spirit realm
column4: it is known that they came to stalk one another not only on the battlefield
column5: but in landscapes shaped by their own subconscious thoughts and emotions. Unconstrained by the laws of physical reality
column6: they fought in ways that more mundane minds could scarcely comprehend
column7: even conjuring subtle
column8: etheric assassins to do their bidding. Shadow mages seemed particularly skilled at such things—and so it was
column9: for a time
column10: that they came to dominate the spirit realm
column11: casting it into twilight.

column1: The thoughts of mortals everywhere were touched by this darkness. It sapped their morale and infected their dreams
column2: with nameless fears hounding them day and night
column3: driving some to commit ever more horrendous acts against their own kin.

column1: No one can say for certain whether all this suffering created Nocturne from nothing
column2: or if it merely corrupted a lesser assassin-construct into something more willful and deadly
column3: but the shadowy creature that resulted was one of insubstantial form and fathomless dread. Nocturne understood nothing of kindness
column4: honor
column5: or nobility—it was terror made manifest
column6: with none of the restraint necessary to control itself.

column1: This demonic creature howled within the spirit realm
column2: and set upon those foolish
column3: errant mages who had given it life
column4: thrashing in desperation for an end to its own suffering. It was in pain
column5: and that pain made it cruel
column6: but it quickly acquired a taste for mortal fear. Time has little meaning in that other place
column7: but Nocturne dragged out each and every pursuit for as long as possible
column8: savoring the prey’s anguish before cutting their life’s silvery thread in an instant. Soon enough
column9: there were none left who dared to enter Nocturne’s domain.

column1: Would the outcome of the Rune Wars have been different if the demon had not played its part beyond the veil? It is difficult to say for certain
column2: but afterwards
column3: what little remained of the lore of shadow magic was hidden away
column4: and its practice carried the sentence of death in many lands.

column1: Trapped in the spirit realm
column2: and with precious few intruders to sustain it
column3: Nocturne began to starve. The only thing close to the delectable feasts of fear it had once tasted was when mortal minds unknowingly drifted through the ether in the hours of sleep. Drawn on currents of magic to where the two realms divide—and where peaceful dreams can easily become night terrors—Nocturne found a way to manifest itself into the waking world.

column1: Existing now as a shade
column2: eyes burning with cold light
column3: Nocturne has become a sinister reflection of the most primal fears of the many peoples of Runeterra. From the bustling cities to the desolate plains
column4: from the mightiest king to the lowliest peasant
column5: the demon is drawn to any weakness of spirit it can twist into mortal terror
column6: and everlasting darkness.

column1: 420;Illaoi;the Kraken Priestess;Void Bringer Illaoi;Resistance Illaoi;Cosmic Invoker Illaoi;;;;;;;;;;;;;Tentacles are an immense source of power. Don't fight without them.;Spirits inherit their target's current health. If making a ;Vessel; is your goal, try whittling your opponent's health down a bit first to make killing the spirit easier.;Leap of Faith is best used to follow-up a strong engage or when being engaged upon. Be careful about being the first one into a fight.;Killing Tentacles whenever possible will make it much easier to win a fight against Illaoi.;When your spirit gets pulled out, fight back if you can. Dealing damage to Illaoi reduces the spirit's duration.;Avoid grouping up for Leap of Faith to reduce the number of Tentacles available to Illaoi.;;Fighter;Tank;Mana;8;6;3;4;586.0;95;300.0;50.0;350;35;3.8;32.0;1.25;125;9.5;0.8;7.5;0.75;68.0;5.0;2.5;0.571;Tentacle Smash;Increases the damage dealt by Tentacles. When activated, Illaoi smashes down a Tentacle that deals physical damage.;Harsh Lesson;Illaoi leaps to her target, dealing physical damage and causing nearby Tentacles to also swing at the target.;Test of Spirit;Illaoi rips the spirit from a foe's body, forcing it to stand before her. Spirits echo a percentage of the damage they take to the original target. If killed, or if the target gets too far from the spirit, the target will become a <font color='#669900'>Vessel</font> and begin spawning Tentacles.;Leap of Faith;Illaoi smashes her idol into the ground, dealing physical damage to nearby enemies. A Tentacle spawns for each enemy champion hit.;Prophet of an Elder God;Illaoi and the Vessels she creates spawn Tentacles on nearby impassible terrain. Tentacles swing at spirits, Vessels, and victims of Illaoi's Harsh lesson. Tentacles deal physical damage to enemies hit, and will heal Illaoi if they damage a champion.;
Illaoi’s powerful physique is dwarfed only by her indomitable faith. As the prophet of the Great Kraken
column2: she uses a huge
column3: golden idol to rip her foes’ spirits from their bodies and shatter their perception of reality. All who challenge the “Truth Bearer of Nagakabouros” soon discover Illaoi never battles alone - the god of the Serpent Isles fights by her side.

column1: All who encounter Illaoi are struck by her presence. An intense woman
column2: the priestess is fully committed to the experience of living. She takes what she wants
column3: destroys what she hates
column4: and revels in everything she loves.

column1: However
column2: to truly know Illaoi you must understand the religion she has devoted her life to. Nagakabouros
column3: the deity of her faith
column4: is usually depicted as an enormous serpent head with tentacles spiraling around it in endless motion
column5: with no beginning and no end. Also called The Mother Serpent
column6: The Great Kraken
column7: or even The Bearded Lady
column8: Nagakabouros is the Serpent Isles’ god of life
column9: ocean storms
column10: and motion. (The literal translation of its name is “the unending monster that drives the sea and sky.”) Central to the religion’s theology are three tenets: every spirit was born to serve the universe; desire was built into every living being by the universe; the universe only moves toward its destiny when living creatures chase their desires.

column1: Lesser priestesses are tasked with maintaining temples
column2: calling holy serpents
column3: and teaching people the ways of Nagakabouros. As the religion’s Truth Bearer
column4: Illaoi’s role is to serve the god directly by unblocking the flow of the universe. To this end
column5: she has two sacred responsibilities.

column1: The first duty of a Truth Bearer is to be the spearhead in the war against undeath. Having fallen outside of the normal flow of the universe
column2: the undead are considered an abomination against Nagakabouros. While it is the responsibility of every priestess of the Kraken to protect the indigenous population from the Harrowing
column3: a Truth Bearer directly engages its most powerful spirits and drives the Black Mist back.

column1: Second
column2: Illaoi is tasked with seeking out individuals of great potential and challenging them with the Test of Nagakabouros. This task is the burden Illaoi’s title reflects. With her massive
column3: holy relic
column4: The Eye of God
column5: the Truth Bearer strips the subject’s spirit from their body then forces them to stand against her to prove their worth. She does this knowing those who fail will be completely annihilated
column6: for the great Kraken has no tolerance for cowardice
column7: doubt
column8: or restraint. But destruction is never the goal. Survivors of the ordeal are forever changed and often find the will to pursue their true destiny.

column1: Though Illaoi is the most powerful and respected Truth Bearer in a hundred generations
column2: it is where she has broken the traditions of her faith that speaks the most about her. Having completed her training as a Truth Bearer
column3: and at the height of her power
column4: Illaoi left the golden temples of Buhru for the squalor of nearby Bilgewater.

column1: The pirate city is the only place foreigners are permitted on the Serpent Isles
column2: viewed as a fetid gutter by Illaoi’s people. Previous Truth Bearers ignored the city and viewed the arriving foreigners as little better than untouchables. Illaoi broke with tradition when she chose to protect residents of Bilgewater from the Harrowing
column3: or even more controversially when she decided that some of its residents had souls worthy of the great test. Despite this
column4: only a handful of temples have been opened in the city
column5: and very few paylangi (islander slang for residents of mainlander descent) have ever been permitted inside. Regardless
column6: it is Illaoi who has brought the widespread awareness of the Mother Serpent to Bilgewater
column7: and it is her indomitable spirit that has brought her religion into favor there.

column1: Rumors persist that Bilgewater’s most bloodthirsty and infamous pirate had his heart broken by the towering priestess. To anyone who has ever met her
column2: this is no surprise. Illaoi’s rough manner belies subtle intelligence
column3: strength
column4: and a magnetic confidence.

column1: Many seek Illaoi’s favor and welcome her to Bilgewater... yet everyone fears being tested by the Kraken’s Prophet.
“There can be no rest. We are the motion.”
—From The Twenty Wisdoms of Nagakabouros

91;Talon;the Blade's Shadow;Renegade Talon;Crimson Elite Talon;Dragonblade Talon;SSW Talon;Blood Moon Talon;Enduring Sword Talon;Talon Blackwood;Withered Rose Talon;;;;;;;;You can use Assassin's Path to get behind the enemy and set up for Noxian Diplomacy's melee attack.;Shadow Assault is a powerful escape tool, but can also be offensively used to assault a group.;Remember to pick your target before the fight. Make sure to keep track of his position or force him to stay in lane by pushing aggressively.;;Assassin;;Mana;9;3;1;7;588.0;95;377.2;37.0;335;30;3.5;39.0;1.25;125;8.5;0.75;7.6;0.8;68.0;3.1;2.9;0.625;Noxian Diplomacy;Talon stabs the target unit. Talon's earliest memories are the darkness of Noxus' underground passages and the reassuring steel of a blade. He remembers no family
column2: warmth
column3: or kindness. Instead
column4: the clink of stolen gold and the security of a wall at his back are all the kinship he has ever craved. Kept alive only by his quick wits and deft thievery
column5: Talon scraped out a living in the seedy underbelly of Noxus. His mastery of the blade quickly marked him as a threat
column6: and Noxian guilds sent assassins to him with a demand: join their ranks or be killed. He left the bodies of his pursuers dumped in Noxus' moat as his response.

column1: The assassination attempts grew increasingly frequent until one assailant met Talon blade-for-blade in a match of strength. To his surprise
column2: Talon was disarmed and facing down his executioner's sword when the assassin revealed himself to be General Du Couteau. The General offered Talon the choice between death at his hand
column3: or life as an agent of the Noxian High Command. Talon chose life
column4: on the condition that his service was to Du Couteau alone
column5: for the only type of orders he could respect were from one he could not defeat.

column1: Talon remained in the shadows
column2: carrying out secret missions on Du Couteau's orders that took him from the frigid lands of the Freljord to the inner sanctums of Demacia itself. When the general vanished
column3: Talon considered claiming his freedom
column4: but he had gained immense respect for Du Couteau after years in his service. He became obsessed with tracking down the general's whereabouts
column5: and scours the land in search of those responsible for Du Couteau's disappearance.

It is easy to overheat if you rapidly use your abilities.;Try and keep targets in the range of your Flamespitter. If you see him Overheat, go in for the kill while his skills are disabled.;Rumble's ultimate can deal a lot of damage if you stay inside the area of effect. When you see the missiles falling, move out of the way as quickly as possible.;Rumble deals almost entirely magic damage. Build some Magic Resistance to reduce his damage.;;Fighter;Mage;Heat;3;6;8;10;589.0;85;100.0;0.0;345;31;3.5;28.0;0.75;125;8.0;0.6;0.0;0.0;61.0;3.2;1.85;0.644;Flamespitter;Rumble torches opponents in front of him, dealing magic damage in a cone for 3 seconds. While in Danger Zone this damage is increased.;Scrap Shield;Rumble pulls up a shield, protecting him from damage and granting him a quick burst of speed. While in Danger Zone, the shield strength and speed bonus is increased.;Electro Harpoon;Rumble launches a harpoon, electrocuting his target with magic damage, slowing their Move Speed, and reducing their Magic Resist. Rumble can carry 2 harpoons at a time. While in Danger Zone the damage and slow percentage is increased.;The Equalizer;Rumble fires off a group of rockets, creating a wall of flames that damages and slows enemies.;Junkyard Titan;Every spell Rumble casts gives him Heat. When he reaches 50% Heat he reaches Danger Zone, granting all his basic abilities bonus effects. When he reaches 100% Heat, he starts Overheating, gaining bonus Attack Speed and granting his basic attacks bonus damage, but making him unable to cast spells for a few seconds.;
Rumble is a young inventor with a temper. Using nothing more than his own two hands and a heap of scrap
column2: the feisty yordle constructed a colossal mech suit outfitted with an arsenal of electrified harpoons and incendiary rockets. Though others may scoff and sneer at his junkyard creations
column3: Rumble doesn't mind—after all
column4: he's the one with the flamespitter.

column1: 516;Ornn;The Fire below the Mountain;Thunder Lord Ornn;Elderwood Ornn;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Learning build paths of items can help quickly select upgrades in lane.;Volcanic Rupture can be used to set up zoning areas to threaten enemies.;The order of your abilties matters! Try to optimize Brittle usage.;;;Try to stay away from walls. Ornn is much less strong if he cannot stun you.;Attack Ornn to keep him from creating items in lane.;;;Tank;Fighter;Mana;5;9;3;5;590.0;95;340.6;65.0;335;33;4.0;32.0;1.25;175;9.0;0.9;8.01;0.6;69.0;3.5;2.0;0.625;Volcanic Rupture;Ornn slams the ground, sending out a fissure dealing damage and slowing enemies hit. After a small delay, a magma pillar forms at the end location.;Bellows Breath;Ornn advances, breathing fire. Enemies hit by the final gout of flame become Brittle.;Searing Charge;Ornn charges, dealing damage to enemies he passes through. If Ornn collides with terrain while charging, the impact creates a shockwave around him which deals damage and knocks up enemies.;Call of the Forge God;Ornn summons a massive elemental at a location which travels toward him with increasing speed. Enemies run over by the elemental take damage, are slowed and are made Brittle. Ornn can recast the ability to charge into the elemental, redirecting it in the direction he hits it, causing the elemental to affect any enemies it runs over to be knocked up, dealing the same damage and re-applying Brittle.;Living Forge;Ornn gains an additional bonus Armor and Magic Resistance from all sources.Ornn can spend gold to forge non-consumable items anywhere.Additionally, he can create masterwork items for himself and for his allies.;
Ornn is the Freljordian demi-god of forging and craftsmanship. He works in the solitude of a massive smithy
column2: hammered out from the lava caverns beneath the volcano Hearth-Home. There he stokes bubbling cauldrons of molten rock to purify ores and fashion items of unsurpassed quality. When other deities—especially Volibear—walk the earth and meddle in mortal affairs
column3: Ornn arises to put these impetuous beings back in their place
column4: either with his trusty hammer or the fiery power of the mountains themselves.

column1: More than any other of his kind
column2: Ornn values privacy
column3: solitude
column4: and focus. Beneath a dormant volcano that bears scars from some ancient eruption
column5: he labors day and night
column6: forging whatever his heart desires. The results are priceless tools destined for feats of legend—the lucky few who have stumbled upon these relics note their bewilderingly high quality. Some claim that Braum’s shield was made by Ornn thousands of years ago
column7: as it remains as sturdy as the day it was finished. No one can be sure
column8: however
column9: for none can find the forge-god to ask him.

column1: Ornn’s name was once spoken throughout the lands that would one day become known as the Freljord. However
column2: almost all of his legends were excised from history by his enemies and the slow march of time—now only a few of his exploits are known
column3: by the handful of tribes who can trace their lineage back to a forgotten culture of blacksmiths
column4: architects
column5: and brewmasters. This long-lost populace was called the Hearthblood
column6: apprentices who journeyed from all corners of the world and gathered on the slopes of Hearth-Home to follow Ornn’s example.

column1: Despite this imitative form of worship
column2: Ornn never considered himself their patron. He would only give them curt nods or frowns when they offered up their work
column3: and yet the Hearthblood accepted this and were determined to hone their craft. As a result
column4: they came to create the finest tools
column5: design the sturdiest structures
column6: and brew the tastiest ales the world had ever beheld. Ornn secretly approved of the Hearthblood’s perseverance
column7: and the fact that they were always looking to improve.

column1: But
column2: in one catastrophic night
column3: all they had accomplished was destroyed when Ornn battled with his brother Volibear at the mountain’s peak
column4: for reasons no mortal could comprehend. The resultant cataclysm was a storm of fire and ash and lightning so intensely violent that it was seen ten horizons away. When the dust settled
column5: Hearth-Home was a smoldering caldera
column6: and the Hearthblood were reduced to scattered bones and cinders.

column1: Though he would never admit it
column2: Ornn was devastated. Through the Hearthblood he had glimpsed the sweeping potential of mortal life
column3: only to see it all lost beneath the indiscriminate wrath of the immortals. Wracked with guilt
column4: he retreated to the isolation of his foundry
column5: and buried himself in his work for an age.

column1: Now
column2: he senses that the world is on the cusp of a new era. Some of his siblings have taken physical form once more
column3: their cults of followers growing restless and aggressive. The Freljord itself is fractured and leaderless
column4: and ancient horrors are lurking in the shadows
column5: waiting for any opportunity to strike. A great change is coming.

column1: During the wars to come
column2: and in their aftermath
column3: Ornn knows the Freljord—and the rest of Runeterra—will have need of a good blacksmith.

column1: 498;Xayah;the Rebel;Cosmic Dusk Xayah;Sweetheart Xayah;SSG Xayah;Star Guardian Xayah;Elderwood Xayah;Brave Phoenix Xayah;;;;;;;;;;Xayah's attacks and abilities leave Feathers on the ground that she can later recall for massive area damage and control.;Xayah can use Featherstorm to dodge almost any ability while also creating a ton of Feathers. Try to utilize the offensive and defensive aspects of this ability.;;;;Xayah's Bladecaller will only root targets hit by 3 or more returning Feathers.;Long fights in the same area with Xayah will allow her to drop a lot of Feathers. Try to stay on the move!;Make sure you are ready when you go for the kill. Untargetability from Featherstorm can quickly turn an ambush in Xayah's favor.;;Marksman;;Mana;10;6;1;5;590.0;88;340.0;40.0;330;25;3.0;30.0;0.5;525;3.25;0.75;8.25;0.75;60.0;3.5;3.9;0.625;Double Daggers;Xayah throws two damaging daggers that also drop Feathers she can recall.;Deadly Plumage;Xayah creates a storm of blades that increase her Attack Speed and damage while also granting her Move Speed if she attacks a champion.;Bladecaller;Xayah calls back all her dropped Feathers dealing damage and rooting enemies.;Featherstorm;Xayah leaps into the air becoming untargetable and throwing out a fan of daggers, dropping Feathers she can recall.;Clean Cuts;After using an ability, Xayah's next basic attacks will hit all targets along their path and leave a Feather.;
Deadly and precise
column2: Xayah is a vastayan revolutionary waging a personal war to save her people. She uses her speed
column3: guile
column4: and razor-sharp feather blades to cut down anyone who stands in her way. Xayah fights alongside her partner and lover
column5: Rakan
column6: to protect their dwindling tribe
column7: and restore their race to her vision of its former glory.

column1: As a child
column2: Xayah loved listening to her father sing the ancient folk-hymns about vastayan heroes. The haunting melodies transported her to a long-forgotten time
column3: when the spirit realm danced freely throughout the physical world. But
column4: with every new generation
column5: humans encroached further into the Lhotlan tribelands
column6: disrupting the raw
column7: chaotic essence of Ionia for their own purposes. Unwilling to stand by and watch her kind fade
column8: Xayah ignored the decrees of her people and set out to reason with the humans.

column1: She ventured into villages beyond her secluded tribal home
column2: and learned how little she knew of the outside world. A group of poverty-stricken villagers mobbed her
column3: some of them trying to steal her feathers as priceless trophies. Others were fearful of her strange appearance and summoned the authorities
column4: forcing her to defend herself. Xayah’s attackers were soon taught the dangers of getting in her way
column5: as she skewered them with her lethal quills.

column1: Dismayed
column2: she returned to her home
column3: only to discover that her tribe
column4: including her father
column5: was missing without a trace. An ancient vastayan temple had been tainted by unnatural shadow magic
column6: disrupting its connection to the spirit realm. Xayah destroyed the temple in order to dispel the corruption. Almost instantly
column7: magic flowed back into the surrounding lands. It was a beautiful sight
column8: but her tribe was still nowhere to be found.

column1: After years spent flitting in and out of the most fortified strongholds and leaving a trail of bodies in her wake
column2: she became known as “The Violet Raven.” She lived alone
column3: focused only on the next mission
column4: and the next step toward freedom for her kind.

column1: But then she met another vastayan who would change her life forever. As she entered the remote mountain town of Vlonqo in search of a stolen vastayan artifact
column2: she was struck by the strange sight of a braying crowd of excitable humans. Onstage before them stood a preening
column3: flamboyant performer
column4: a veritable golden peacock
column5: who sang old vastayan songs for his captivated audience. As he finished his show with a dazzling array of cheap tricks—as Xayah saw them—the crowd erupted and chanted his name: “Rakan.” He took a theatrical bow. She dismissed him as a buffoon.

column1: Xayah willed herself to ignore the entertainer
column2: and completed her mission. She made her escape
column3: which she had to admit had become far easier thanks to the buffoon’s distraction of Vlonqo’s inhabitants.

column1: Despite vowing never to see this “Rakan” again
column2: she couldn’t seem to get him off her mind. It was a strange and complicated feeling; there was a lightness to his spirit that she found aggravatingly alluring.

column1: As she left town
column2: Xayah was preoccupied by these strange thoughts
column3: leaving her momentarily distracted to an ambush from a group of mercenaries. She had been expecting a fight
column4: so she was glad to get her feathers bloody. A good brawl seemed the perfect antidote for useless diversions and unwanted feelings.

column1: That was when Rakan made his grand entrance.
Xayah insisted she didn’t need the swaggering vastayan’s help. Rakan insisted he didn’t care—he just didn’t want to miss the party. Through the course of the fight
column2: Rakan proved an unorthodox
column3: but surprisingly dauntless and effective
column4: ally. He leapt and pirouetted through the attackers who couldn’t take their eyes off him
column5: providing Xayah ample time to strike them down with devastating accuracy.

column1: In spite of her protestations
column2: Rakan continued to follow Xayah. Over time
column3: she grew to welcome his company and—though she was initially loath to admit it—the world didn’t feel so broken and lonely. They became inseparable
column4: with her passion for the vastayan cause infecting the showboating battle-dancer. She has adapted to his free-spirited ways
column5: utilizing the chaos Rakan creates as perfectly timed distractions. Together
column6: they fight to release Ionia’s abundant flow of magic so that the vastaya might thrive once again.

column1: 58;Renekton;the Butcher of the Sands;Galactic Renekton;Outback Renekton;Bloodfury Renekton;Rune Wars Renekton;Scorched Earth Renekton;Pool Party Renekton;Prehistoric Renekton;SKT T1 Renekton;Renektoy;Hextech Renekton;Blackfrost Renekton;PROJECT: Renekton;;;;Slice and Dice excels at harassing maneuvers. Slice in, follow up with another skill and then Dice back out to safety.;Cull the Meek drains an enormous amount of life when used in the middle of the fray. You can use this to bait opponents into thinking you are weaker than you really are.;Cooldown reduction is especially good for Renekton, allowing him to both quickly build up and use his Fury.;;;Pay close attention to Renekton's Fury gauge as that will usually signify when he is about to attack.;Keeping Renekton from being able to fight and gain Fury by continually harassing him will severely reduce the effectiveness of his abilities.;;;Fighter;Tank;Fury;8;5;2;3;590.0;92;100.0;0.0;345;35;4.0;32.0;1.25;125;8.0;0.75;0.0;0.0;69.0;3.75;2.75;0.665;Cull the Meek;Renekton swings his blade, dealing moderate physical damage to all targets around him, and heals for a small portion of the damage dealt. While in this form, Renekton gains Fury periodically.;Reign of Anger;Renekton's attacks generate Fury, increased when he is low on life. This Fury can empower his abilities with bonus effects.;
Renekton is a terrifying
column2: rage-fueled Ascended being from the scorched deserts of Shurima. Once
column3: he was his empire’s most esteemed warrior
column4: leading the armies of Shurima to countless victories. However
column5: after the empire’s fall
column6: Renekton was entombed beneath the sands
column7: and slowly
column8: as the world turned and changed
column9: he succumbed to insanity. Now free once more
column10: he is utterly consumed with finding and killing his brother
column11: Nasus
column12: who he blames
column14: for the centuries he spent in darkness.

column1: Renekton was born to fight. From a young age he was constantly getting into vicious brawls. He had no fear
column2: and was able to hold his own against much older children. It was often pride that led to these confrontations
column3: as Renekton was unable to back down
column4: or let any insult pass. Every evening
column5: he came home with cuts and fresh bruises
column6: and while his more scholarly older brother
column7: Nasus
column8: disapproved of his street-fighting
column9: Renekton relished it.

column1: Nasus soon moved away
column2: having been chosen to join the elite Collegium of the Sun
column3: and in the years he was absent
column4: Renekton’s skirmishes became increasingly serious. On a rare visit home
column5: Nasus was horrified to see his bloodied young brother return home from yet another street fight. Fearing Renekton’s violent nature would see him imprisoned or in an early grave
column6: Nasus helped him enlist in the Shuriman army. Officially
column7: Renekton was too young for this duty
column8: but his older brother’s influence smoothed away this detail.

column1: The discipline and regimentation of the army was a blessing for Renekton. Within a few years
column2: he rose to become one of Shurima’s most feared and capable war-captains
column3: and he fought on the front line in numerous wars of conquest to expand the empire. He garnered a reputation for ferocity and toughness
column4: but also for honor and bravery. Nasus became a decorated general
column5: and the two of them served in a number of campaigns together
column6: remaining very close despite their inherent differences and frequent disagreements. Nasus’s skill lay in strategy
column7: logistics and history; Renekton’s lay in battle. Nasus planned the wars
column8: and Renekton won them.

column1: Renekton earned the title Gatekeeper of Shurima after fighting a desperate battle in one of the mountain passes bordering Shurima. An invading force had landed on the south coast
column2: striking toward the isolated city of Zuretta. If it was not halted
column3: the city was certain to be razed
column4: and its populace massacred. Outnumbered ten to one
column5: Renekton and a small contingent faced these aggressors
column6: determined to buy time for the city to be evacuated. It was a battle that none expected Renekton to survive
column7: let alone win. He held the pass for a day and a night
column8: long enough for a relief force led by Nasus to arrive. With barely a handful of warriors left standing
column9: none uninjured
column10: Renekton was hailed a hero.

column1: Renekton served on the frontlines for decades
column2: and never lost a battle. His presence was inspiring to those fighting alongside him
column3: and terrifying to his enemies. Victory after victory were his
column4: and such was his reputation that some wars were won without a sword even being lifted
column5: enemy nations surrendering as soon as they heard Renekton was marching on them.

column1: Renekton was of middling years
column2: a grizzled and battle-scarred veteran
column3: when word reached him that his brother was close to death. He raced back to the capital to find Nasus a pale shadow of his former self
column4: having been struck down by a debilitating wasting malady. The sickness was incurable
column5: similar to the rotting curse said to have cut down an entire noble line in antiquity.

column1: Nevertheless
column2: Nasus’s greatness was recognized by one and all. As well as being a highly decorated general
column3: he curated the great library of Shurima
column4: and penned many of the finest literary works in the empire. The priesthood proclaimed it to be the sun’s will that he undertake the Ascension ritual.

column1: The whole city gathered to witness the holy rite
column2: but the tragic illness had taken a terrible toll
column3: and Nasus no longer had the strength to scale the stairs to the Ascension dais. In the ultimate act of self-sacrifice and love
column4: Renekton lifted his brother in his arms
column5: and climbed the final steps
column6: fully expecting to be obliterated in the process by the holy energies of the sun disc. He deemed his sacrifice a small thing to ensure that his brother would live on. He was just a warrior
column7: after all
column8: albeit a talented one
column9: while his brother was a peerless scholar
column10: thinker and general. Renekton knew that Shurima would need Nasus in the years to come.

column1: Renekton was not destroyed
column2: however. Beneath the blinding radiance of the sun disc
column3: both brothers were raised up and remade. When the light faded
column4: two mighty Ascended beings stood before the onlookers
column5: Nasus in his lean
column6: jackal-headed body
column7: and Renekton in his immense
column8: crocodilian form. Their forms seemed apt; the jackal was often regarded as the most clever and cunning of beasts
column9: and the fearless aggression of the crocodile fit Renekton perfectly. Shurima gave thanks to have these new demigods as guardians of the empire.

column1: Renekton had been a mighty war hero before
column2: but now he was an Ascended being
column3: blessed with power beyond mortal understanding. He was stronger and faster than any regular man
column4: and seemed virtually immune to pain. Though Ascended beings were not immortal
column5: their lifespans were dramatically increased
column6: so that they might serve the empire for hundreds of years.

column1: With Renekton at the head of the Shuriman armies
column2: the empire’s military was all but unstoppable. He had always been a ruthless commander and ferocious fighter
column3: but his new form gave him power beyond belief. He led the soldiers of Shurima to many bloody victories
column4: neither giving nor expecting mercy. His legend spread far beyond the borders of the empire
column5: and it was his enemies that gave him the name Butcher of the Sands
column6: a title he embraced.

column1: There were those
column2: Nasus among them
column3: who came to believe that a portion of Renekton’s humanity had been lost in his transformation. As the years progressed
column4: he seemed to become crueler
column5: relishing the spilling of blood more than was natural
column6: and whispers circulated of atrocities he committed in the name of war. Nevertheless
column7: he was a staunch defender of Shurima
column8: and he faithfully served a succession of emperors
column9: ensuring the security and greatness of Shurima for hundreds of years.

column1: During the reign of the Emperor Azir
column2: word arrived that a magical being of fire had escaped the magical sarcophagus that bound it in its underground prison. It had laid waste to a Shuriman town
column3: before fleeing across the desert to the east. Renekton and his brother Nasus set forth to recapture this legendary foe. While they were absent
column4: the young emperor
column5: guided by the manipulations of his magus
column6: Xerath
column7: attempted to join their ranks and become one of the Ascended. The results were catastrophic.

column1: Renekton and Nasus were a day’s ride from the capital
column2: but even so
column3: they felt the shockwave as the Ascension ritual went awry. Knowing that something terrible had come to pass
column4: they raced back to find the glorious city in ruins. Azir had been killed
column5: along with most of the city’s populace
column6: and the great sun disc was falling
column7: drained of all its power.  At the epicenter of the ruin
column8: they encountered Xerath
column9: now a being of pure
column10: malevolent power.

column1: The brothers sought to bind Xerath in the magical sarcophagus that had held the ancient being of fire. For a day and a night they battled
column2: but the magus was powerful
column3: and would not be held. He shattered the sarcophagus
column4: and assailed them with spells fueled by the power of sun disc
column5: which crashed to the ground as they fought.

column1: Knowing that they could not destroy Xerath
column2: Renekton finally wrestled him into the depthless Tomb of the Emperors
column3: and bade his brother seal them inside forever. Knowing there was no other way to stop Xerath
column4: Nasus reluctantly did as his brother ordered. As Renekton and Xerath fell into darkness
column5: Nasus sealed the tomb for all eternity.

column1: In the darkness
column2: Xerath and Renekton continued their battle. For uncounted years they fought
column3: as the once-great civilization of Shurima collapsed to dust in the world above. Xerath whispered poison in Renekton’s ear
column4: and gradually
column5: as the centuries rolled on
column6: his viperous words and the ever-present darkness took its toll. The magus implanted the notion in Renekton’s mind that Nasus had sealed him in on purpose
column7: jealous of his success
column8: and unwilling to share his Ascension.

column1: Piece by piece
column2: Renekton’s sanity cracked. Xerath drove a wedge into these cracks
column3: corrupting his mind and twisting his perception of what was real and what was imagined.

column1: Thousands of years later
column2: the Tomb of the Emperors was opened by the mercenary Sivir
column3: freeing Renekton and Xerath. Renekton roared his fury and thundered out into the Shuriman desert
column4: sniffing the air for the scent of his brother.

column1: Renekton now roams the deserts
column2: seeking the death of Nasus
column3: the traitor he believes left him to die. His grip on reality is tenuous at best
column4: and while there are moments when he resembles the proud
column5: honorable hero of the past
column6: much of the time he is little more than a devolved hate-maddened beast
column7: driven on by the thirst for blood and vengeance.

column1: 24;Jax;Grandmaster at Arms;The Mighty Jax;Vandal Jax;Angler Jax;PAX Jax;Jaximus;Temple Jax;Nemesis Jax;SKT T1 Jax;Warden Jax;God Staff Jax;Mecha Kingdoms Jax;Conqueror Jax;Conqueror Jax Prestige Edition;;;Jax can Leap Strike to friendly units, including wards. You can use them to plan your escape.;Jax benefits greatly from items that have both Ability Power and Attack Damage such as Guinsoo's Rageblade and Hextech Gunblade.;;;;Try to engage him in short bursts instead of going toe-to-toe with him. Preventing him from attacking consecutively drastically lowers his damage output.;Jax can dodge all incoming attacks for a very short amount of time and stuns enemies in melee range when it ends. Wait to strike him until after his dodge is finished.;;;Fighter;Assassin;Mana;7;5;7;5;593.0;85;339.0;52.0;350;36;3.0;32.0;1.25;125;8.5;0.55;7.58;0.7;68.0;4.25;3.4;0.638;Leap Strike;Jax leaps toward a unit. If they are an enemy, he strikes them with his weapon.;Empower;Jax charges his weapon with energy, causing his next attack to deal additional damage.;Counter Strike;Jax's combat prowess allows him to dodge all incoming attacks for a short duration and then quickly counterattack, stunning all surrounding enemies.;Grandmaster's Might;Every third consecutive attack deals additional Magic Damage. Additionally, Jax can activate this ability to strengthen his resolve, increasing his Armor and Magic Resist for a short duration.;Relentless Assault;Jax's consecutive basic attacks continuously increase his Attack Speed.;
Runeterra’s greatest weapons master
column2: Jax is the only survivor of the Kohari—champions sworn to the defense of Icathia. But when the Void was unleashed against the Shuriman empire’s Ascended Host
column3: Icathia was destroyed
column4: leaving Jax without a home or purpose. He gathered the “last light of Icathia”
column5: a symbol of his hope to one day defeat the Void
column6: and now travels the world
column7: searching for warriors strong enough to face the coming darkness by his side.

column1: Saijax Cail-Rynx Icath’un grew up in Icathia
column2: a satrapy of the Shuriman empire. Ever since he was a boy
column3: his father told him of when their home was a proud
column4: independent nation
column5: before it was ground under the heel of Shuriman oppression. He told him of the Kohari
column6: heroes who protected Icathia and its Mage King. The Mage King had resisted Shurima’s conquest
column7: but when he died in battle
column8: his Kohari protectors followed him
column9: committing ritual suicide. The Shuriman emperor displayed the Kohari’s decaying bodies for all to see
column10: and the Mage King himself was impaled above the city gates
column11: his bones left to molder.

column1: Saijax’s father had witnessed this cruel act
column2: and over time he passed down to his son the burning resentment that was growing in every Icathian heart. Even so
column3: Saijax committed himself to the study of arms
column4: learning from Shurima’s weapons masters as well as his own clan’s elders.

column1: After many centuries of Shuriman rule
column2: a massive earthquake struck the coastal province of Saabera. The destruction revealed something hidden deep beneath the earth
column3: something dark and of great power—perhaps strong enough even to overcome Shurima’s god-like Ascended warriors. Saijax was entrusted with protecting the Icathian mages who encountered this discovery… which the guards just barely contained with brazier-staves that blazed with conjured elemental fire. Disturbed
column4: he escorted the mages to the governing council so they could tell of what they’d learned.

column1: They called this power the Void.
Immediately the council recognized its potential
column2: but Saijax saw the doom the Void portended. As a master of weaponry
column3: he knew the danger of using a weapon they could neither fully understand nor safely harness. He regretted that he didn’t kill the mages as they rode from Saabera. He would regret it even more in the days to come.

column1: Confident that the Void could defeat their Shuriman overlords
column2: the council crowned a new Mage King. The Kohari were rebuilt
column3: with Saijax among the first to join their ranks. They triumphed in early engagements
column4: and Saijax even killed one of the vaunted Ascended in battle
column5: watching with pride as its corpse was paraded around the liberated city of Bai-Zhek.

column1: When the Ascended Host approached Icathia
column2: Saijax and his brethren assembled on the front lines. As the two armies churned the earth beneath them into crimson loam
column3: Icathia’s mages and priests deemed the time had come to unleash the Void.

column1: Ruin swept over the land
column2: as Icathians
column3: Shurimans
column4: and even Ascended were unraveled from existence. The city’s walls collapsed as the Void swallowed thousands into cold
column5: silent oblivion.

column1: In moments
column2: Icathia was lost.

column1: Saijax rode to the ruined crater where the Void had been summoned
column2: determined to fall upon his sword like the Kohari of old. But before he could take his life
column3: he saw among the devastation a discarded brazier-stave that he recognized from Saabera—it still blazed with elemental fire that harmed the Void. This flame kindled a spark in Saijax’s heart. He took up the stave and left behind the ruins of his homeland
column4: tending to this “last light of Icathia”
column5: and the hope it represented.

column1: Grieving and ashamed
column2: Saijax Cail-Rynx Kohari Icath’un forsook his old name
column3: and from that day was known only as Jax.

column1: He became a wanderer
column2: traveling across the known world and to places beyond any map. As he bore the elemental fire
column3: Jax’s life extended beyond even the expectations of his long-lived people. Yet the farther he went from Icathia
column4: the lower the flame burned
column5: until it threatened to gutter out once and for all. Jax understood with grim resolution that he couldn’t run from his past. He had a duty to return
column6: and fight. The advance of the Void had been halted by the last surviving Ascended
column7: but its singular threat endured.

column1: For centuries since
column2: Jax has roamed
column3: a vagabond warrior searching for those strong enough to rebuild the Kohari. Though he has fought countless times against beings of great skill
column4: courage
column5: and power
column6: none have yet convinced him that they can march against the coming darkness. The fall of Icathia has plagued Jax with doubt
column7: but one thing remains certain: when the final battle comes
column8: Jax will stand against the Void.

column1: Even if he has to face it alone.
