Udyr is more than a man—he is a vessel for the untamed power of primal Freljordian animal spirits. When tapping into their bestial natures
column2: he can harness different strengths
column3: channeling untold speed
column4: resilience
column5: and brutal ferocity. With their combined might
column6: Udyr will turn back all those who dare to harm the natural order of the world.

column1: In the harsh lands of the Freljord
column2: there are those gifted with a deep connection to spiritual magic. These warrior-shamans
column3: known as “spirit walkers”
column4: serve among the many different tribes
column5: offering their abilities in exchange for a community where they may live and train.

column1: Born under a blood-red moon
column2: Udyr displayed an awareness for the intangible at an early age. He could feel the raw emotions of nearby creatures
column3: understanding the mournful howls of tundra wolves before he even uttered his first words. Destined to become a great spirit walker
column4: he was taken in by the Winter’s Claw
column5: and set on a path to mastering his innate talents.

column1: While his mentors expected him to grow into his powers with ease
column2: the boy soon found himself crippled by his own gifts. The chaotic thoughts of so many other living beings flooded his mind to the point of near insanity. Day and night
column3: Udyr wished desperately for even a moment of solitude… but his wish was to be granted in the worst possible way.

column1: One dreary evening
column2: his tribe fell victim to an ambush by the Frostguard.

column1: Merciless and cruel
column2: these sworn followers of a mysterious Ice Witch slaughtered entire families
column3: taking special care to eliminate anyone displaying hints of spirit magic. If not for the heroic sacrifice of his mentors
column4: Udyr may have met his end on that frightful night.

column1: Filled with sorrow
column2: and tormented by the pained screams of his tribespeople
column3: Udyr lost control. He unleashed his fury
column4: causing an explosion of spiritual energy so strong that it shook the nearby mountaintops.

column1: The packed snow crumbled. Within seconds
column2: an avalanche rained down upon the battlefield
column3: forcing the Frostguard to flee.

column1: When the young spirit walker clawed his way out
column2: he found few survivors. Fearing his destructive power
column3: the Winter’s Claw abandoned him—all save for one. A sympathetic Iceborn looked past Udyr’s inner turmoil. She saw a man with strengths and flaws like any other
column4: and the two cherished what little time they had together
column5: between the bitter demands of Freljordian life.

column1: Outside of this relationship
column2: however
column3: Udyr grew accustomed to being alone. The mere sight of him scared most others away
column4: until the day he met a stern monk who had traveled far
column5: from foreign lands.

column1: This man sought the wisdom of those who could tap into the spirits of primal beasts. Wary of all strangers
column2: Udyr lunged at the monk again and again
column3: only to find him dodging every blow. When they were both exhausted
column4: the monk introduced himself as Lee Sin—in him
column5: Udyr saw someone who truly shared his struggles. The two men forged a quick friendship
column6: with Lee Sin offering to take Udyr east to Ionia
column7: a place where generations had studied how to keep the spirits at peace.

column1: On their travels
column2: they learned that the empire of Noxus had invaded Ionia
column3: and Udyr offered to fight alongside his friend in defending the monastery at Hirana. The spirit walker’s skills proved invaluable as he drew upon the strength of mighty beasts
column4: channeling their untamed vigor into his mortal fists. After a fierce and fiery battle
column5: he stood beside the wounded monks. They were victorious.

column1: Encouraged by the Ionians’ understanding of the spirit realm
column2: Udyr chose to stay and train under Hirana’s esteemed elders. He appreciated how the people here valued harmony and
column3: over the seasons
column4: felt his mind and body calmed by their compassion.

column1: But still
column2: Udyr could not deny the call of his homeland.

column1: He heard the anxious cries of Freljordian spirits carried by the westerly winds
column2: and sensed great danger stirring beyond the horizon. Bidding farewell to Ionia and Lee Sin
column3: he set out to rejoin the Winter’s Claw
column4: knowing not how he would be received…

column1:
102;Shyvana;the Half-Dragon;Ironscale Shyvana;Boneclaw Shyvana;Darkflame Shyvana;Ice Drake Shyvana;Championship Shyvana;Super Galaxy Shyvana;Ruined Shyvana;;;;;;;;;Shyvana's abilities all benefit from attacking units. Shyvana is a creature with pure elemental magic blazing in her heart. Though she most often appears humanoid
column2: she can take her true form when necessary—that of a fearsome dragon
column3: incinerating her foes with fiery breath. Having saved the life of the crown prince Jarvan IV
column4: Shyvana now serves uneasily in his royal guard
column5: struggling to find acceptance among the suspicious people of Demacia.

column1: Though they are rare creatures now indeed
column2: there exist a handful of places across Runeterra where the great elemental dragons still nest.

column1: Long after the fall of the Shuriman empire
column2: in the chambers beneath a lost volcano
column3: the elder beast known as Yvva guarded her clutch of eggs. Beyond the depredations of rival drakes
column4: dragon eggs were priceless almost beyond a mortal’s comprehension
column5: and so many were daring or foolish enough to try their luck. Yvva feasted upon the charred remains of a score or more would-be thieves over the years… before one succeeded in his attempt.

column1: This upstart mage fled the mountains with the large egg hugged close to his chest
column2: the jungle at his heels set ablaze by Yvva’s fury. Against all odds
column3: he reached the coast and left the dragon to slink back to her lair in defeat. She had lost one egg. She would not lose another.

column1: The mage traveled north to Piltover—but before he could find a buyer
column2: the egg began to hatch. Whether it was the act of removing it from the nest
column3: or the last moon of autumn giving way to winter
column4: something had changed. It was no infant dragon that emerged
column5: but an apparently humanoid baby girl with pale
column6: violet skin
column7: and the mage found he could not bear to abandon her. He raised the child as his own
column8: naming her Shyvana after the dark legend of her brood-mother.

column1: It became clear that Shyvana was no mortal. From an early age
column2: she was able to shift her form into something monstrous
column3: akin to the half-dragons of ancient myth. This made living among the common folk of Valoran difficult
column4: to say the least. One thing was clear: Yvva retained some connection with her lost daughter
column5: and it grew stronger over time. When her other offspring finally took flight
column6: Yvva left her empty nest and soared far over the ocean in search of Shyvana.

column1: The land was wracked by fierce border wars
column2: but armies and villagers alike scattered at the great dragon’s approach. Seeking refuge in a ruined farmhouse
column3: Shyvana saw her adopted father engulfed in flames as Yvva swept low overhead—the young woman dragged him into the nearby forest
column4: but there was nothing more she could do. She buried him in a simple grave beneath a spreading oak
column5: and set off alone.

column1: After many weeks in hiding in the wilds
column2: always on the move
column3: Shyvana picked out the faint scent of blood among the trees. She found a wounded warrior
column4: close to death
column5: and knew this was someone she could save.

column1: Without a thought for the beast that hunted her
column2: she assumed her half-dragon form and carried the unconscious man far away
column3: to an outpost on the borders of Demacia.

column1: There
column2: in the castle at Wrenwall
column3: Shyvana discovered that this warrior was none other than Prince Jarvan—the king’s only son
column4: and heir to the throne. Though the stationed soldiers regarded her violet skin and strange manners with some suspicion
column5: she was made welcome. Demacians
column6: it seemed
column7: always looked out for one another
column8: and her time in the town was the most peaceful she had ever known.

column1: The peace was not to last. Shyvana sensed darkness on the wind. Yvva was coming.
The recovering prince
column2: knowing that he had to marshal Wrenwall’s garrison
column3: brought the terrified locals inside the stronghold in preparation for the coming battle. Even so
column4: Shyvana prepared to make her escape. Jarvan confronted her
column5: and she admitted that the creature in pursuit of her was of her own blood. She could not allow innocent people to die for that.

column1: Jarvan refused to let her go. Shyvana had saved his life
column2: so it was only right that he fight at her side
column3: now. Moved by his offer
column4: she accepted.

column1: As Yvva came into view
column2: Demacian archers loosed volleys of arrows to keep her distracted. In retaliation
column3: she bathed the battlements in flame
column4: tearing at the stonework with her powerful talons and sending armored warriors tumbling from the parapet. It was then that Shyvana leapt forth
column5: transforming in mid-air and bellowing a challenge to her brood-mother. In a sight seldom witnessed in Valoran since the Rune Wars
column6: the two dragons clashed
column7: tooth and claw
column8: in the skies over Wrenwall.

column1: And finally
column2: bleeding from a dozen wounds
column3: Shyvana grappled Yvva to the ground
column4: and broke the creature’s neck upon the flagstones.

column1: The prince himself honored Shyvana’s bravery
column2: and promised that she would always have a place at his side
column3: if she would return with him to his father’s halls. With Yvva’s skull as proof of their triumph
column4: they set out for the Great City of Demacia together.

column1: Shyvana has learned that King Jarvan III’s realm is somewhat divided—with the people’s distrust of mages and magic putting them at odds with the noble ideals upon which it was founded. While she has found a measure of acceptance as one of the prince’s most trusted guardians
column2: she is left to wonder whether that would still be the case if her true nature were more widely known…

column1: 11;Master Yi;the Wuju Bladesman;Assassin Master Yi;Chosen Master Yi;Ionia Master Yi;Samurai Yi;Headhunter Master Yi;PROJECT: Yi;Cosmic Blade Master Yi;Eternal Sword Yi;Snow Man Yi;Blood Moon Master Yi;PsyOps Master Yi;;;;;If you're in a lane against ranged players, leveling up Meditate can allow you to stay in the lane longer and gain levels faster than they will.;Wuju Style is very strong early for last hitting minions.;Try using Alpha Strike on a minion in front of an enemy champion so you are placed at a safe distance at the end of the spell.;;;Meditate is an effective method of healing damage over time, but Master Yi is susceptible to coordinated team ganks early in the game.;If Master Yi tries to farm with Alpha Strike, hit him a few times so he has to use mana with Meditate to heal.;Although Master Yi cannot be slowed while using Highlander, other disables can stop him in his tracks.;;Assassin;Fighter;Mana;10;4;2;4;599.0;92;251.0;42.0;355;33;3.0;32.0;1.25;125;7.5;0.65;7.26;0.45;66.0;3.0;2.0;0.679;Alpha Strike;Master Yi teleports across the battlefield with blinding speed, dealing physical damage to multiple units in his path, while simultaneously becoming untargetable. Alpha Strike can critically strike and deals bonus physical damage to monsters. In addition, Master Yi will gain stacks of Double Strike and pause the remaining duration on Wuju Style and Highlander for each second he channels.;Wuju Style;Grants bonus true damage on basic attacks.;Highlander;Master Yi moves with unparalleled agility, temporarily increasing his Move Speed and Attack Speed as well as making him immune to all slowing effects. While active, Champion kills or assists extend Highlander's duration. Passively reduces cooldown for his other abilities on a kill or assist.;Double Strike;Every few consecutive basic attack, Master Yi strikes twice.;
Master Yi has tempered his body and sharpened his mind
column2: so that thought and action have become almost as one. Though he chooses to enter into violence only as a last resort
column3: the grace and speed of his blade ensures resolution is always swift. As one of the last living practitioners of the Ionian art of Wuju
column4: Yi has devoted his life to continuing the legacy of his people—scrutinizing potential new disciples with the Seven Lenses of Insight to identify the most worthy among them.

column1: In Ionia’s central province of Bahrl
column2: a mountain settlement once stood
column3: hidden away in its serene beauty. Here
column4: in the village of Wuju
column5: the boy Yi grew up learning the ways of the sword
column6: chasing a dream that later turned to tragedy.

column1: Like most children
column2: he admired those who wore silk robes and carried blades with poems to their name. His parents being swordsmiths
column3: Yi made a strong impression on the local warriors who frequented their workshop. He spent his mornings in the garden
column4: sparring with his mother
column5: and his nights reciting poetry to his father by candlelight. When it came time for Yi to study under Wuju’s masters
column6: his parents could not have been prouder.

column1: Carrying his talent and discipline over to his training
column2: he surpassed every expectation. Soon
column3: the whole village knew of the “Young Master” Yi.

column1: Still
column2: the humble student wondered about the rest of Ionia. From atop the tallest pagodas
column3: he spotted faraway towns no one else ever mentioned
column4: but when he sought to journey down the mountain with blade in hand
column5: his mentors forbade him. Wuju was founded by those believing their swordsmanship to be too precious to share
column6: too sacred to draw blood—so for centuries
column7: it flourished in isolation
column8: with no outsiders knowing its true nature.

column1: All this changed the day Yi saw vast plumes of smoke rising above the distant towns. Noxian warbands had invaded from the coast
column2: conquering settlement after settlement in waves that washed the provinces red. Choosing the people of Ionia over Wuju’s hallowed tradition
column3: Yi ventured down to help defend the First Lands. To astonished eyes
column4: he swept across the front lines in a blur
column5: routing the enemy with blinding swordplay never before seen by outsiders.

column1: Word of the one-man army spread far and wide
column2: like mist in the mountains. Inspired by his courage
column3: even his fellow disciples joined the fight
column4: and together they journeyed to Navori where the greater war was raging.

column1: The Noxian commanders saw in Wuju a threat that could not be ignored. They scouted the origin of these peerless warriors
column2: and elected to strike at their home without mercy. In a single night
column3: the entire village was destroyed
column4: its people and culture obliterated by chemical fire that no steel could hold back.

column1: After the war finally ended
column2: Yi returned as the only surviving disciple
column3: to find nothing but ruins. The very magic of the land had been defiled
column4: and everyone he had known and loved was no more. Slain in spirit
column5: if not in body
column6: Yi became the attack’s final casualty. With no other practitioners of Wuju left alive
column7: he realized the title of master was his to bear alone.

column1: Grief-stricken
column2: he chose seclusion
column3: training obsessively to bury the guilt of his survival
column4: but the wisdom of bygone masters seemed to fade with the haze of time. He began to doubt if one man could preserve an entire heritage… until he encountered the least expected of individuals.

column1: A curious
column2: monkey-like vastaya challenged him to a duel. Reluctantly
column3: Master Yi entertained the creature’s demands
column4: defeating him with ease. But the vastaya refused to give up
column5: returning day after day with increasingly clever tricks that forced Yi to react and improvise. For the first time in years
column6: Yi felt the spirit of Wuju once more.

column1: The two clashed for weeks
column2: until the bruised stranger finally knelt on the ground and introduced himself as Kong
column3: of the Shimon tribe. He begged to learn from Yi
column4: who saw in this reckless but determined fighter the makings of a new disciple. Through teaching
column5: Yi found his purpose restored. He would pass on the ways of Wuju
column6: and gifted his pupil an enchanted staff and an honorific as a sign of this vow—from that day onward
column7: Kong was known as Wukong.

column1: Together
column2: they now travel the First Lands
column3: as Yi seeks to honor the legacy of his lost home
column4: allowing him to fully embody the “master” in his name.

column1: 12;Alistar;the Minotaur;Black Alistar;Golden Alistar;Matador Alistar;Longhorn Alistar;Unchained Alistar;Infernal Alistar;Sweeper Alistar;Marauder Alistar;SKT T1 Alistar;Moo Cow Alistar;Hextech Alistar;Conqueror Alistar;Blackfrost Alistar;Lunar Beast Alistar;;Using Pulverize can allow you to establish better positioning for Headbutt.;Movement speed is very important on Alistar. Consider which boots to buy carefully.;Using Flash can allow you catch your target off guard to knock them back into your allies with Pulverize and Headbutt.;;;Alistar is very disruptive but very tough - try to target more fragile damage dealers.;Watch out for the Pulverize-Headbutt combo when around turrets.;When Alistar uses his ultimate, it's often better to move back and wait until the effect wears off before attacking him.;;Tank;Support;Mana;6;9;5;7;600.0;106;350.0;40.0;330;44;3.5;32.0;1.25;125;8.5;0.85;8.5;0.8;62.0;3.75;2.125;0.625;Pulverize;Alistar smashes the ground, dealing damage to nearby enemies and tossing them into the air.;Headbutt;Alistar rams a target with his head, dealing damage and knocking the target back.;Trample;Alistar tramples nearby enemy units, ignoring unit collision and gaining stacks if he damages an enemy champion. At full stacks Alistar's next basic attack against an enemy champion deals additional magic damage and stuns them.;Unbreakable Will;Alistar lets out a wild roar, removing all crowd control effects on himself, and reducing incoming physical and magical damage for the duration.;Triumphant Roar;Alistar charges his roar by stunning or displacing enemy champions or when nearby enemies die. When fully charged he heals himself all nearby allied champions.;
Always a mighty warrior with a fearsome reputation
column2: Alistar seeks revenge for the death of his clan at the hands of the Noxian empire. Though he was enslaved and forced into the life of a gladiator
column3: his unbreakable will was what kept him from truly becoming a beast. Now
column4: free of the chains of his former masters
column5: he fights in the name of the downtrodden and the disadvantaged
column6: his rage as much a weapon as his horns
column7: hooves and fists.

column1: Many civilizations have resisted Noxus
column2: but none as long as the clans of the Great Barrier mountains. Though these fierce minotaurs had protected the overland trade routes to the ancient city of Zaun for centuries
column3: they preferred to avoid Valoran’s wider conflicts.

column1: The noble warrior Alistar was respected among all the clans. Out on the mountain peaks
column2: his roar could scatter even the bravest trespassers
column3: leaving only the foolhardy to face him in combat. Even so
column4: in the moot halls he would always urge his kin to forge greater bonds with other mortal races. Many saw minotaurs as little more than beasts
column5: which soured any interaction and kept them firmly as outsiders.

column1: Then Noxus came
column2: promising something better. Their emissary
column3: the matriarch of House Tewain
column4: proclaimed that the empire was poised to take Basilich
column5: a coastal city to the east. However
column6: she pledged that they would not do this without the support of the great clans of the mountains
column7: and called for parley on neutral ground.

column1: Many of the minotaurs were eager to accept her offer. This was a way to gain the power and recognition they sought
column2: by joining with Noxus.

column1: But Alistar remained skeptical—he had encountered many Noxian scouts in recent years
column2: and knew them to be a duplicitous and cunning people. For this reason
column3: his clan sent him to meet Tewain
column4: along with fifty of their mightiest warriors
column5: to reject any alliance. The other clans could do as they wished
column6: but Alistar would not accept the rule of some distant “Grand General”.

column1: Under the banners of truce
column2: he and his kin were betrayed.

column1: The larger clans had already pledged themselves to Noxus
column2: and their representatives turned against him as soon as he made his position known. The battle was swift and bloody
column3: and Alistar himself crushed Lady Tewain’s skull with his bare hands—but soon enough he and his surviving warriors found themselves bound in chains
column4: headed for the distant Noxian capital
column5: accused of inciting rebellion.

column1: These unfortunate minotaurs found themselves cast into the Reckoning arenas of the capital
column2: as part of a grim gladiatorial festival known as the Fleshing.

column1: Alistar was appalled by the chanting of the bloodthirsty spectators. He implored his clanfolk not to fight back
column2: not to give these Noxians the monstrous display they so craved…

column1: When the festival ended twenty-one days later
column2: Alistar was the only member of his tribe left. Pelted with pebbles and rotten fruit from the crowd
column3: dragged out to face Reckoner after Reckoner
column4: he was driven to fight like a beast—and think like one. He killed and killed until even his memories of home became stained with blood.

column1: Alistar had fallen far by the time he met Ayelia
column2: a servant girl in the arenas. At first he bellowed and charged the bars of his cage
column3: expecting her to fear or goad him like the others
column4: but Ayelia did neither.

column1: She returned every day
column2: and spoke to him with gentle respect
column3: until eventually Alistar answered in kind. Ayelia’s homeland had also been claimed by Noxus
column4: and seeing his suffering had convinced her they should leave this hateful city together. She whispered her plans through the bars
column5: and for the first time in years Alistar found he could think of home without dwelling on the way it had been taken from him.

column1: One night
column2: Ayelia brought Alistar the key to his cell. She had sacrificed much to arrange this escape
column3: and he swore he would repay her tenfold.

column1: They hurried to the river
column2: where a cargo barge awaited them. However
column3: as they boarded
column4: Noxian agents burst from the shadows. Alistar hurled himself into battle
column5: his vision tunneled with rage
column6: and although Ayelia called out to him again and again
column7: he did not hear.

column1: By the time Alistar had slain their attackers
column2: the boat was gone—and Ayelia with it—so he fled south on foot instead. He searched everywhere for the servant girl
column3: but found nothing. Had she been captured? Killed? It seemed there were no clues left to find.

column1: Weeks later
column2: a political coup shook the empire to its dark foundations
column3: and the arena minotaur’s escape was quite forgotten.

column1: Alistar now travels alone
column2: as quietly and anonymously as he can
column3: encouraging resistance in Noxian-held territories and fighting on behalf of the downtrodden and the abused. Only when he has cleared the shame from his heart
column4: repaying every cruelty and every kindness
column5: will Alistar return to the mountains and leave his rage behind.

column1: And in every city he passes through
column2: he asks after Ayelia.

column1:
10;Kayle;the Righteous;Silver Kayle;Viridian Kayle;Transcended Kayle;Battleborn Kayle;Judgment Kayle;Aether Wing Kayle;Riot Kayle;Iron Inquisitor Kayle;Pentakill Kayle;PsyOps Kayle;Dragonslayer Kayle;Pentakill III: Lost Chapter Kayle;;;;Using Divine Judgment on a high-DPS ally can turn the tides of battle by giving your ally free reign to attack. ;Kayle's attacks become incredibly powerful once she gains attack range from Divine Ascent. Play safe until then. ;Kayle benefits greatly from Attack Damage and Ability Power, making hybrid items like Nashor's Tooth and Hextech Gunblade very effective on her.;;;Divine Judgment only grants Kayle or her allies immunity to damage. Slows and stuns can still be applied, so trap them if they're being overzealous.;Kayle is usually a fragile target. If you see her ultimate cast on an ally, switch to attacking her.;Kayle starts the game as a weaker melee champion. Try to put her behind before she ascends to her ranged form.;;Fighter;Support;Mana;6;6;7;7;600.0;85;330.0;50.0;335;26;3.0;26.0;0.5;175;5.0;0.5;8.0;0.8;50.0;2.5;1.5;0.625;Radiant Blast;Kayle conjures a portal, summoning a celestial sword that pierces through enemies, slowing, damaging, and reducing the resistances of all hit.;Celestial Blessing;Blessed by the divine, Kayle heals and grants movement speed to herself and the nearest ally.;Starfire Spellblade;Passive: Kayle's celestial sword, Virtue, deals bonus magic damage to enemies she attacks.

Active: Kayle's next attack smites her target with celestial fire, dealing bonus damage proportionate to their missing health.;Divine Judgment;Kayle makes an ally invulnerable and calls upon former Aspects of Justice to purify the area around her target with a holy rain of swords.;Divine Ascent;Kayle's attacks are empowered by the heavens as she levels up and spends skill points. Her wings are lit aflame as she progressively gains Attack Speed, Movement Speed, Attack Range, and waves of fire on her attacks.;
Born to a Targonian Aspect at the height of the Rune Wars
column2: Kayle honored her mother’s legacy by fighting for justice on wings of divine flame. She and her twin sister Morgana were the protectors of Demacia for many years—until Kayle became disillusioned with the repeated failings of mortals
column3: and abandoned this realm altogether. Still
column4: legends are told of her punishing the unjust with her fiery swords
column5: and many hope that she will one day return…

column1: As the Rune Wars raged
column2: Mount Targon stood as a beacon against the oncoming darkness—Kayle and her twin sister Morgana were born beneath that light. Their parents
column3: Mihira and Kilam
column4: began the perilous climb in search of the power to save their tribe from destruction.

column1: Even when Mihira learned she was with child
column2: she pushed onward. At the mountain’s summit
column3: she was chosen as a divine vessel for the Aspect of Justice
column4: wielding a sword that blazed with a fire brighter than the sun.

column1: Not long after
column2: the twins were born. Kayle
column3: the elder by a breath
column4: was as bright as Morgana was dark.

column1: But Mihira had become a fearsome warrior
column2: far greater than any mortal. Kilam began to fear her new divinity
column3: and the sorcerous enemies that were drawn to her light. He resolved to take the girls out of harm’s way
column4: journeying across the Conquerer’s Sea to a settlement where the land itself was said to offer protection against magic.

column1: In their new homeland
column2: Kilam raised the twins
column3: their temperaments growing more different with each passing day. Kayle was precocious
column4: often arguing with the settlement’s leaders about their rules—she had no real memory of her mother’s powers
column5: but knew the laws were meant to keep them all safe. Her father rarely spoke of such things
column6: but Kayle was certain Mihira had saved them by ending the Rune Wars on some distant battlefield.

column1: When the twins were teenagers
column2: a streak of flame split the sky. A sword smoldering with celestial fire struck the ground between Kayle and her sister
column3: breaking in two—Kilam was distraught when he recognized the blade as Mihira’s.

column1: Kayle eagerly snatched up one half of the weapon
column2: feathered wings springing forth from her shoulders
column3: and Morgana cautiously followed her example. In that moment
column4: Kayle felt more connected to her mother than ever
column5: certain that this was a sign she was alive and wanted her daughters to follow the same path as her.

column1: The people of the settlement believed the girls had been blessed by the stars
column2: destined to protect the fledgling nation of Demacia from outsiders. These winged protectors became symbols of light and truth
column3: and were revered by all. Kayle fought in many battles
column4: flying at the head of the growing militia and imbuing the weapons of the worthy with her own sanctified fire… but in time
column5: her pursuit of justice began to consume her. Seeing threats within and without
column6: she founded a judicator order to enforce the law
column7: and hunted down rebels and reavers with equal fervor.

column1: But there was one person she softened her judgment toward. To the dismay of her followers
column2: Kayle allowed Morgana to rehabilitate wrongdoers who appeared humble enough to admit their guilt. Kayle’s protege
column3: Ronas
column4: was the most disapproving of all—he swore to do what Kayle would not
column5: and attempted to imprison Morgana.

column1: Kayle returned to find the people rioting
column2: and Ronas dead. Consumed by rage
column3: she looked down upon the city
column4: and summoned her divine fire to cleanse the city of its sins.

column1: Morgana flew up to meet her
column2: raising her blade. If Kayle was to purge the darkness she saw in mortal hearts
column3: she would have to start with her own sister. The two battled across the heavens
column4: each matching the other’s terrible blows and striking the buildings beneath them to rubble.

column1: Abruptly
column2: the fight was halted by their father’s anguished cry.

column1: Kayle watched Kilam die in her sister’s arms
column2: a senseless victim of the violence that had overtaken the city that day. Then she held the two halves of their mother’s sword in her hands
column3: and vowed she would never again let mortal emotions rule her. As she leapt back into the sky
column4: soaring high above the clouds
column5: she felt she could almost see Mount Targon beyond the horizon
column6: its formidable peak bathed red by the setting sun.

column1: There she would seek perfect
column2: celestial clarity. There she would stand at her mother’s side
column3: and fulfill her legacy to the Aspect of Justice.

column1: Though she has been absent from Demacia for many centuries
column2: Kayle’s legend has inspired much of the kingdom’s culture and law. Grand statues and icons of the Winged Protector give strength to the heart of every warrior who marches to illuminate the night
column3: and banish all shadows from their land.

column1: In times of strife and chaos
column2: there are many who cling to the hope that Kayle might eventually return… and others who pray that such a day will never come.

column1: 875;Sett;the Boss;Mecha Kingdoms Sett;Obsidian Dragon Sett;Obsidian Dragon Sett Prestige Edition;Pool Party Sett;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;Fighter;Tank;Grit;8;5;1;2;600.0;93;0.0;0.0;340;33;4.0;32.0;1.25;125;7.0;0.5;0.0;0.0;60.0;4.0;1.75;0.625;Knuckle Down;Sett's next two attacks deal additional damage based off of the target's max health. Sett also gains movement speed while moving towards enemy champions.;Haymaker;Sett passively stores damage he takes as Grit. On cast, Sett expends all stored Grit to gain a shield and punch an area, dealing true damage in the center and physical damage on the sides.;Facebreaker;Sett pulls in all enemies on opposite sides of him, dealing damage and stunning them. If enemies were only on one side, they are slowed instead of stunned.;The Show Stopper;Sett carries an enemy champion through the air and slams them into the ground, dealing damage and slowing all enemies near where they land.;Pit Grit;Sett's basic attacks alternate between left and right punch. Right punch is slightly stronger and faster. Sett also hates losing, gaining additional health regeneration based off of his missing health.;
A leader of Ionia’s growing criminal underworld
column2: Sett rose to prominence in the wake of the war with Noxus. Though he began as a humble challenger in the fighting pits of Navori
column3: he quickly gained notoriety for his savage strength
column4: and his ability to take seemingly endless amounts of punishment. After fighting his way through the ranks of local combatants
column5: Sett muscled to the top
column6: seizing control of the pits he once fought in.

column1: Though now a powerful player in Ionia’s flourishing criminal underworld
column2: Sett had humble origins. Born from an Ionian vastaya and a Noxian human
column3: the “half-beast” child was an outcast from the start. His birth appalled his mother’s vastayan community
column4: which expelled the family for violating its tribal norms. The humans of Ionia were no more accepting of the taboo union
column5: though Sett’s father’s infamy as a local pitfighter usually kept them from voicing their disapproval.

column1: What little security the family enjoyed vanished the day Sett’s father disappeared. All of a sudden
column2: those who had bitten their tongues at the sight of young Sett felt free to express their contempt. The boy was bewildered
column3: wondering where his father had gone
column4: and why trouble suddenly seemed to be following him.

column1: Sett grew up quickly
column2: becoming calloused in the face of the taunts and threats he endured
column3: and before long
column4: he began using his fists to silence the insults. When news of his fights reached his mother
column5: she made him swear not to go near the Noxian pits where his father had fought.

column1: But the more Sett fought
column2: the more he thought of his father.

column1: Longing to find the man he only vaguely remembered
column2: Sett snuck away to the pit late one night
column3: after his mother had gone to bed. Immediately
column4: he was enthralled by the spectacle. Scores of Noxian soldiers
column5: fresh to the shores of Ionia
column6: roared with bloodlust from the stands around him. Down in the center of the arena
column7: fighters from all backgrounds and martial disciplines clashed in gruesome duels with a variety of weapons—the winners handsomely paid in Noxian coin. When the event was over
column8: Sett inquired about his father
column9: and learned a hard truth: his father had bought out his contract and left to tour more profitable pits abroad. He had deserted his family
column10: to seek fortune on the other side of the world.

column1: Burning with rage
column2: Sett asked the arena’s matchmaker for a fight
column3: hoping that somehow his father would return from his tour—and be the opponent standing across the pit from him. The matchmaker assigned the boy a fight on the next card
column4: figuring he would be easy fodder for one of his star combatants.

column1: Sett would prove him wrong.
From the moment he threw his first punch
column2: “The Beast-Boy Bastard” was a pit-fighting sensation. Though Sett had no formal martial arts training
column3: his primal strength and ferocity more than compensated
column4: and he leveled his more technically sound opponents like a battering ram. Never abandoning hope that he might one day fight his father
column5: he soon became the undisputed “King of the Pit”
column6: with a swollen coffer of prize money—and a trail of broken opponents—to his name.

column1: Night after night
column2: Sett brought money and comforts to his mother
column3: always lying about how he had acquired them. It warmed his calloused heart to see her so proud of his success
column4: no longer forced to toil at menial jobs. Still
column5: Sett couldn’t help but feel he could do better. Being the King of the Pit was good
column6: but being the person who owned the pit… that was where the real money was.

column1: Late one night
column2: after defending his title in front of a record-breaking crowd
column3: Sett presented his new demands to the Noxian matchmaker and his cronies. He suggested they grant him control of the arena and its revenue. When they refused
column4: Sett barred the doors. Minutes later
column5: the doors re-opened
column6: and the Noxians emerged
column7: badly maimed
column8: with a message on their bloodied lips: the half-beast was the new boss.

column1: With the promoters out of the picture
column2: Sett took control of the pit he once fought in. Ionians
column3: who had only recently been conditioned for war
column4: flocked to the arena
column5: paying to satisfy an urge they only now knew they possessed. Sett took full advantage of their newfound bloodlust
column6: accumulating wealth and power beyond his wildest boyhood dreams
column7: as he transformed the pit into the hub of an underground empire of gambling and vice.

column1: The half-beast who reigned supreme in the pit now runs his illicit enterprises with the same iron fist. Any time someone challenges his authority
column2: he personally reminds them where they stand. Every punch Sett throws is a blow to his old life of poverty and ostracism
column3: and he intends to make sure that old life stays down.

column1:
145;Kai'Sa;Daughter of the Void;Bullet Angel Kai'Sa;K/DA Kai'Sa;K/DA Kai'Sa Prestige Edition;iG Kai'Sa;Arcade Kai'Sa;K/DA ALL OUT Kai'Sa;K/DA ALL OUT Kai'Sa Prestige Edition;Lagoon Dragon Kai'Sa;;;;;;;;Try to catch enemy carries alone to burst them with Icathian Rain.;Work with your teammates to set up your Ultimate and optimize damage with your passive.;Make sure to buy items that will evolve at least 1 or 2 of your spells.;;;Kai'Sa is very good at picking off isolated enemies. Stick together against her.;Kai'Sa is very vulnerable to getting outranged by mages and long range carries.;Make sure to place wards in your blind spots so you can see Kai'Sa coming.;;Marksman;;Mana;8;5;3;6;600.0;88;344.88;38.0;335;28;3.0;30.0;0.5;525;3.5;0.55;8.2;0.45;59.0;2.0;1.8;0.644;Icathian Rain;Kai'Sa shoots a swarm of missiles that seek out nearby targets.

Living Weapon: Icathian Rain is upgraded to shoot more missiles.;Void Seeker;Kai'Sa shoots a long range missile, marking enemies with her passive.

Living Weapon: Void Seeker is upgraded to apply more passive marks and reduce cooldown on champion hit.;Supercharge;Kai'Sa briefly increases her Move Speed, then increases her Attack Speed.

Living Weapon: Supercharge is upgraded to briefly grant Invisibility.;Killer Instinct;Kai'Sa dashes near an enemy champion.;Second Skin;Kai'Sa's basic attacks stack Plasma, dealing increasing bonus magic damage. Allies' immobilizing effects help stack Plasma. Additionally, Kai'Sa's item purchases upgrade her basic spells to have more powerful properties.;
Claimed by the Void when she was only a child
column2: Kai’Sa managed to survive through sheer tenacity and strength of will. Her experiences have made her a deadly hunter and
column3: to some
column4: the harbinger of a future they would rather not live to see. Having entered into an uneasy symbiosis with a living Void carapace
column5: the time will soon come when she must decide whether to forgive those mortals who would call her a monster
column6: and defeat the coming darkness together… or simply to forget
column7: as the Void consumes the world that left her behind.

column1: Perhaps the most remarkable thing about the fearless hunter of the Void known as Kai’Sa is how unremarkably her life began. She did not descend from tribal warriors hardened by generations of battle
column2: nor was she summoned from distant lands to fight the unknowable menace lurking beneath Shurima. Rather
column3: she was just an ordinary girl
column4: born to loving parents who called the unforgiving southern deserts their home. This was where she would spend her days playing with friends
column5: and her nights dreaming about her place in the world.

column1: In her tenth summer
column2: the young girl Kaisa’s destiny would be changed forever. Had she been older
column3: she might have noticed more of the unusual events that had begun to unfold in the villages—every day
column4: her mother urged her stay home
column5: for fear of strangers wandering the land
column6: demanding tribute to dark powers below. Kaisa and her friends did not believe it
column7: until one evening they came upon a pen of sacrificial goats bought from nomad herdsmen. Using the knife her father had given her on her eighth birthday
column8: she cut their tethers and set the animals free into a nearby canyon. It seemed like a harmless prank
column9: until the unthinkable happened. The ground began to quake
column10: flashes of light scorched the sky
column11: and the children ran for their lives.

column1: The Void had been awakened. A great rift split the bedrock
column2: swallowing up Kaisa’s village and everyone in it
column3: leaving nothing behind but sand pierced with twisted columns as black as night.

column1: Kaisa regained consciousness to find herself trapped underground. She was filled with crippling fear
column2: but there was still hope; she could hear the faint cries of other survivors. They called out to each other feebly
column3: repeating their names one by one like a mantra. Sadly
column4: by the third day
column5: hers was the only voice left. Her friends and family were all gone. She was alone in the darkness.

column1: It was only when all seemed lost that she saw the light.
She followed it down.
Along the way
column2: she found meager sustenance. Amid the debris left by the collapse were ragged waterskins
column3: rotting peaches—anything to keep starvation at bay. But
column4: eventually
column5: Kaisa’s hunger was replaced by fear once again. She found herself in a vast cavern
column6: illuminated by an otherworldly purplish glow
column7: and she could see she was no longer alone.

column1: Skittering creatures swarmed in the depths. The first that came for Kaisa was no bigger than her
column2: and she clutched her knife in both hands
column3: ready to defend herself. The voidling horror knocked her to the ground
column4: but she drove the blade into its pulsing heart
column5: and the two of them tumbled deeper into the abyss.

column1: The creature was seemingly dead
column2: but its unnatural skin had taken hold upon the flesh of her arm. The dark shell tingled
column3: but was hard as steel to the touch. In a panic
column4: Kaisa broke her knife trying to remove it. But when the larger beasts came
column5: she used it as a shield to make her escape.

column1: Soon enough
column2: she realized the shell was becoming part of her. As her daily struggle to survive drew out into years
column3: this second skin grew with her
column4: and so too did her resolve.

column1: Now she had more than hope
column2: she had a plan. Fight hard. Stay alive. Find a way back.

column1: She was transformed
column2: from frightened girl to fearless survivor
column3: from prey to predator. For almost a decade
column4: she has lived between two worlds in an attempt to keep them apart—the Void hungers to consume not only the scattered villages of Shurima
column5: but the whole of Runeterra. She will not allow that to happen.

column1: Though she has slain countless Void-constructs
column2: she understands that many of the people she protects would see her as a monster herself. Indeed
column3: her name has begun to pass into legend
column4: an echo of the ancient horrors of doomed Icathia.

column1: No longer Kaisa… but Kai’Sa.

555;Pyke;the Bloodharbor Ripper;Sand Wraith Pyke;Blood Moon Pyke;PROJECT: Pyke;PsyOps Pyke;Sentinel Pyke;;;;;;;;;;;Pyke is very fragile so don't be afraid to temporarily run from a fight. You can regenerate a significant amount of health from Gift of the Drowned Ones when enemies can't see you.;Hitting an enemy with the Hold version of Bone Skewer will always pull them the same distance. Use it in melee range to throw targets behind you.;The Tap version of Bone Skewer is much faster and deals additional damage.;A lot of your agressive spells are also your escapes. Make sure you always have a plan to get out of the fight.;;Pyke regenerates a significant amount of damage he has taken from enemy champions, but only when you can't see him!;When Pyke is hidden nearby in his Ghostwater Dive, sharks will circle underneath your feet.;Try not to stand near low health allies. If Pyke executes them using Death From Below, you might be next on the list.;;Support;Assassin;Mana;9;3;1;7;600.0;90;415.0;50.0;330;45;3.5;32.0;1.25;150;7.0;0.5;8.0;1.0;62.0;2.0;2.5;0.667;Bone Skewer;Pyke either stabs an enemy in front of him or pulls an enemy towards him.;Ghostwater Dive;Pyke enters Camouflage and gains significant movement speed that decays over time.;Phantom Undertow;Pyke dashes and leaves behind a phantom that will return to him, stunning enemy champions along its path.;Death From Below;Pyke blinks to and executes low health enemies, allowing him to cast this spell again and granting additional gold to an ally who assists.;Gift of the Drowned Ones;When Pyke is hidden from enemies, he regenerates damage that he has recently taken from champions. Pyke also cannot gain extra Maximum Health from any source, and instead gains Bonus AD.;
A renowned harpooner from the slaughter docks of Bilgewater
column2: Pyke should have met his death in the belly of a gigantic jaull-fish… and yet
column3: he returned. Now
column4: stalking the dank alleys and backways of his former hometown
column5: he uses his new supernatural gifts to bring a swift and gruesome end to those who make their fortune by exploiting others—and a city that prides itself on hunting monsters now finds a monster hunting them.

column1: As a youth
column2: Pyke started out like many in Bilgewater: on the slaughter docks. All day
column3: every day
column4: monstrous creatures of the deep were hauled in for rendering in the butcheries that lined the waterfront. He found employment in a district known as Bloodharbor
column5: as even the tide itself was not strong enough to wash away the red slick that ran constantly down its wooden slips.

column1: He became well acquainted with the trade—both the gruesome work and meager paychecks. Over and over
column2: Pyke watched heavy purses of gold being handed to captains and crews in exchange for the daunting carcasses that he and his fellows would hack into salable chunks. He became hungry for more than a few copper sprats in his pocket
column3: and managed to talk his way onto a ship’s crew. Few individuals dared to hunt in the traditional Serpent Isles manner: launching themselves at their targets to secure tow-hooks with their bare hands
column4: and beginning to butcher the creatures while they yet lived. Fearless and highly skilled in this regard
column5: Pyke soon cut a name for himself as the best harpooner a golden kraken could buy. He knew meat was worth pennies compared to certain organs from the larger
column6: more dangerous beasts… organs that needed to be harvested fresh.

column1: Depending on the difficulty of the hunt
column2: each sea monster commanded its own price
column3: and the most desired by Bilgewater traders was the jaull-fish. From its razor-toothed maw
column4: priceless sacs of sapphilite were coveted across Runeterra for various sorcerous distillations
column5: and a small flask of the glowing blue oil could pay for a ship and its crew ten times over. But it was while hunting with an untested captain that Pyke learned where a life of blood and guts would land him.

column1: Days into their journey
column2: a huge jaull-fish breached
column3: opening its maw wide to reveal rows of sapphilite sacs. Several harpoon lines secured the beast
column4: and though it was far bigger and older than any he had encountered before
column5: Pyke leapt into its mouth without hesitation.

column1: As he set about his work
column2: a deep vibration began to stir in the creature’s cavernous gullet. Roiling bubbles broke the ocean’s surface
column3: and an entire pod of jaulls began to push against the tethered ship’s hull. The captain lost his nerve
column4: and cut Pyke’s lifeline. The last thing the doomed harpooner saw before the beast’s jaws snapped shut was the look of horror on his crewmates’ faces
column5: as they watched him being swallowed alive.

column1: But this was not the end for Pyke.
In the deepest fathoms of the unknowable ocean
column2: crushed by the titanic pressure
column3: and still firmly trapped within the jaull’s mouth
column4: he opened his eyes once more. There were blue lights everywhere
column5: thousands of them
column6: seemingly watching him. Tremulous echoes of something ancient and mysterious filled his brain
column7: crushing his mind
column8: showing him visions of all he had lost whilst others grew fat.

column1: A new hunger overtook Pyke
column2: one for vengeance and retribution. He would fill the depths with the corpses of those who had wronged him.

column1: Back in Bilgewater
column2: no one thought much of the killings at first—for so dangerous a place
column3: the occasional red tide was nothing new. But weeks became months
column4: and a pattern began to emerge. Captains from many ships were found carved up and left out for the dawn. Bar-room patrons whispered it was a supernatural killer
column5: wronged at sea
column6: gutting his way through the crew manifest of some damned ship called the Terror. Once a mark of respect and celebrity
column7: the question “You a captain?” became a cause for alarm.

column1: Soon it was the caulkers
column2: too
column3: and the first mates
column4: merchant officers
column5: bankers… indeed
column6: anyone associated with the bloody business of the slaughter docks. A new name went up on the bounty boards: a thousand krakens for the infamous Bloodharbor Ripper.

column1: Driven by memories twisted by the deep
column2: Pyke has succeeded where many have failed—striking fear into the hearts of unscrupulous businessmen
column3: killers
column4: and seafaring scoundrels alike
column5: even though no one can find any mention of a ship named the Terror ever docking in Bilgewater.

column1: A city that prides itself on hunting monsters now finds a monster hunting them
column2: and Pyke has no intention of stopping.

column1: 79;Gragas;the Rabble Rouser;Scuba Gragas;Hillbilly Gragas;Santa Gragas;Gragas, Esq.;Vandal Gragas;Oktoberfest Gragas;Superfan Gragas;Fnatic Gragas;Gragas Caskbreaker;Arctic Ops Gragas;Warden Gragas;;;;;The damage reduction from Drunken Rage is applied when you start drinking, try to use it when you see damage coming your way.;Try to knock enemies back into your towers with Explosive Cask.;Try to combo Body Slam with Explosive Cask to set up kills for your team.;;;Gragas can knock everybody away with his ultimate. Be careful that you don't get knocked into him or, worse, an enemy tower.;Body Slam is on a very low cooldown, making it difficult to pursue Gragas. Don't overextend yourself chasing him.;;;Fighter;Mage;Mana;4;7;6;5;600.0;95;400.0;47.0;330;38;3.6;32.0;1.25;125;5.5;0.5;6.0;0.8;64.0;3.5;2.05;0.675;Barrel Roll;Gragas rolls his cask to a location, which can be activated to explode or will explode on its own after 4 seconds. The potency of the explosion increases over time. Enemies struck by the blast have their Move Speed slowed.;Drunken Rage;Gragas guzzles down brew from his cask for 1 second. After finishing, he becomes drunkenly empowered, dealing magic damage to all nearby enemies on his next basic attack and reducing damage received.;Body Slam;Gragas charges to a location and collides with the first enemy unit he comes across, dealing damage to all nearby enemy units and stunning them.;Explosive Cask;Gragas hurls his cask to a location, dealing damage and knocking back enemies caught in the blast radius.;Happy Hour;Gragas periodically heals upon using a skill.;Equal parts jolly and imposing
column2: Gragas is a massive
column3: rowdy brewmaster on his own quest for the perfect pint of ale. Hailing from parts unknown
column4: he now searches for rare ingredients among the unblemished wastes of the Freljord
column5: trying each recipe as he goes. Often intoxicated and extremely impulsive
column6: he is legendary for the brawls he starts
column7: which often end in all-night parties and widespread property damage. Any appearance from Gragas must surely foreshadow drinking and destruction—in that order.

column1: The only thing more important to Gragas than fighting is drinking. His unquenchable thirst for stronger ale has led him in search of the most potent and unconventional ingredients to toss in his still. Impulsive and unpredictable
column2: this rowdy carouser loves cracking kegs as much as cracking heads. Thanks to his strange brews and temperamental nature
column3: drinking with Gragas is always a risky proposition.

column1: Gragas has an eternal love of good drink
column2: but his massive constitution prevented him from reaching a divine state of intoxication. One night
column3: when he had drained all the kegs and was left wanting
column4: Gragas was struck by a thought rather than the usual barstool: why couldn't he brew himself something that would finally get him truly drunk? It was then that he vowed to create the ultimate ale.

column1: Gragas' quest eventually brought him to the Freljord
column2: where the promise of acquiring the purest arctic water for his recipe led him into uncharted glacial wastes. While lost in an unyielding blizzard
column3: Gragas stumbled upon a great howling abyss. There he found it: a flawless shard of ice unlike anything he had ever seen. Not only did this unmelting shard imbue his lager with incredible properties
column4: but it also had a handy side effect - it kept the mixture chilled at the perfect serving temperature.

column1: Under the spell of his new concoction
column2: Gragas headed for civilization
column3: eager to share the fermented fruits of his labor. As fate would have it
column4: the first gathering to catch Gragas' bleary eyes would shape the future of the Freljord. He blundered into a deteriorating negotiation between two tribes discussing an alliance with Ashe. Though Ashe welcomed a break in the tension
column5: the other warriors bristled at the intrusion and hurled insults at the drunken oaf. True to his nature
column6: Gragas replied with a diplomatic headbutt
column7: setting off a brawl matched only in the legends of the Freljord.

column1: When the fallen from that great melee finally awoke
column2: Ashe proposed a friendly drink as an alternative to fighting. With their tempers doused in suds
column3: the two tribes
column4: formerly on the brink of war
column5: bonded over a common love of Gragas' brew. Although strife was averted and Gragas hailed a hero
column6: he still had not achieved his dream of drunken blissfulness. So once more
column7: he set off to wander the tundra in search of ingredients for Runeterra's perfect pint.

column1: 55;Katarina;the Sinister Blade;Mercenary Katarina;Red Card Katarina;Bilgewater Katarina;Kitty Cat Katarina;High Command Katarina;Sandstorm Katarina;Slay Belle Katarina;Warring Kingdoms Katarina;PROJECT: Katarina;Death Sworn Katarina;Battle Academia Katarina;Blood Moon Katarina;Battle Queen Katarina;;;Picking up Daggers will significantly reduce Shunpo's cooldown.;Try waiting until the other team is distracted with fighting your team, and use Shunpo to teleport into the fray and unleash a devastating Death Lotus.;Using Shunpo on an allied Champion, Dagger, or minion can be a great escape tactic.;;;Katarina's abilities deal magic damage, so even if she's building Attack Damage items, get magic resistance to counter her.;Try to save a disable for when Katarina uses her Death Lotus.;;;Assassin;Mage;None;4;3;9;8;602.0;94;0.0;0.0;335;28;3.5;32.0;1.25;125;7.5;0.7;0.0;0.0;58.0;3.2;2.74;0.658;Bouncing Blade;Katarina throws a <font color='#FFF673'>Dagger</font> at the target that then bounces to nearby enemies before ricocheting onto the ground.;Preparation;Katarina gains a burst of Move Speed, tossing a <font color='#FFF673'>Dagger</font> into the air directly above herself.;Shunpo;Katarina blinks to the target, striking it if its an enemy, or striking the nearest enemy otherwise.;Death Lotus;Katarina becomes a flurry of blades, dealing massive magic damage while she channels to the 3 nearest enemy champions.;Voracity;Whenever an enemy champion dies that Katarina has damaged recently, her remaining ability cooldowns are dramatically reduced.If Katarina picks up a Dagger, she uses it to slash through all nearby enemies, dealing magic damage.;
Born to one of the most respected noble families of Noxus
column2: Katarina Du Couteau found herself elevated above others from an early age. While her younger sister Cassiopeia took after their politically brilliant mother
column3: Katarina was very much her father’s daughter
column4: and the wily General Du Couteau pushed her to learn the way of the blade; to cut away the empire’s enemies not with reckless brutality
column5: but deadly precision. He was a harsh teacher with many pupils
column6: and notoriously difficult to impress.

column1: So it was that Katarina’s childhood—if it can be called such—had little room for kindness or rest. She spent every waking moment honing herself into the ultimate weapon
column2: testing her endurance
column3: her dexterity
column4: her tolerance for pain. She stole poisons from the city’s least reputable apothecaries
column5: testing their efficacy in tiny increments upon herself
column6: gradually building her resistance even as she catalogued their effects. She scaled the tallest towers in the dead of night
column7: unseen by anyone.

column1: She yearned to do her part for Noxus. She yearned for the opportunity to demonstrate her hidden strengths in service of the empire
column2: and the throne.

column1: Her first mark came straight from her father
column2: camped with his warbands on the eve of one of the military’s innumerable westward invasions… She was to assassinate a line officer of the opposing army
column3: a low-born wretch by the name of Demetrius.

column1: Katarina was livid. She hadn’t trained her entire life to have her talents wasted on some dungheel barely skilled enough to swing a sword! He simply wouldn’t do. Instead of her assigned target
column2: Katarina stole into the enemy camp and slit the enemy commander’s throat as he slept. It was a flawless execution. It would bring a swift victory
column3: and glory to Noxus. It would make her father proud.

column1: At dawn
column2: his face daubed with ashes
column3: the vengeful hero Demetrius led a berzerk charge into her father’s encampment. Dozens of Noxian soldiers were slaughtered
column4: along with the general’s personal retinue. Katarina’s father himself barely escaped with his life.

column1: He was furious beyond words
column2: refusing even to look his daughter in the eye. She had shamed him
column3: and their family name. The greatest assassins do not seek recognition or glory
column4: he reminded her. They do not expect to occupy a place of honor at their master’s right hand.

column1: Overwhelmed
column2: Katarina struck out into the wilderness
column3: alone. She would complete her original mission. Demetrius would pay with his life. Even so
column4: her mind swam. Could she ever forgive herself? How had she been so foolish?

column1: She was so distracted
column2: she didn’t see her attacker until he had nearly taken her eye out.

column1: For Katarina’s failure
column2: General Du Couteau had sent another of his protégés after her; a nameless whelp dragged up from one of the lesser assassins’ guilds. But even with blood streaming down her face
column3: the years of rigorous training kicked in
column4: and her blades were in her hands in an instant.

column1: Six hours later
column2: she tossed Demetrius’s severed head at her father’s feet.

column1: She told the general she had considered taking his head instead
column2: but eventually decided—as much as she hated to admit it—that he had done the right thing in ordering her death. She had failed. Not just as an assassin
column3: or as a daughter
column4: but as a Noxian.

column1: And failure must have its consequences. She ran her fingers along the raw
column2: deep gash over her left eye
column3: and thought of the price others had paid for her arrogance.

column1: She knew she had lost her father’s favor
column2: and could never regain it. He would raise others in her place
column3: simply to spite her. Still
column4: she vowed to redeem herself
column5: no matter the cost—to rededicate her talents to the empire
column6: and to become the sinister weapon she always intended to be.

column1: 119;Draven;the Glorious Executioner;Soul Reaver Draven;Gladiator Draven;Primetime Draven;Pool Party Draven;Beast Hunter Draven;Draven Draven;Santa Draven;Mecha Kingdoms Draven;Ruined Draven;;;;;;;If Draven doesn't move, Spinning Axe will fall near his present location. It will fall directly on him, or just to the right or left.;If Draven does move after attacking, Spinning Axe will lead him in the direction of his movement. Use this to control where the Spinning Axe will go.;;;;Launch skillshots toward the landing position of Draven's Spinning Axes.;Disrupt Draven with the goal of making him drop his axes. If you do, his power drops dramatically.;;;Marksman;;Mana;9;3;1;8;605.0;90;360.56;39.0;330;29;3.3;30.0;0.5;550;3.75;0.7;8.04;0.65;60.0;3.61;2.7;0.679;Spinning Axe;Draven's next attack will deal bonus physical damage. This axe will ricochet off the target high up into the air. If Draven catches it, he automatically readies another Spinning Axe. Draven can have two Spinning Axes at once.;Blood Rush;Draven gains increased Movement Speed and Attack Speed. The Movement Speed bonus decreases rapidly over its duration. Catching a Spinning Axe will refresh the cooldown of Blood Rush.;Stand Aside;Draven throws his axes, dealing physical damage to targets hit and knocking them aside. Targets hit are slowed.;Whirling Death;Draven hurls two massive axes to deal physical damage to each unit struck. Whirling Death slowly reverses direction and returns to Draven after striking an enemy champion. Draven may also activate this ability while the axes are in flight to cause it to return early. Deals less damage for each unit hit and resets when the axes reverse direction. Executes enemies who have less health than Draven's number of Adoration stacks.;League of Draven;Draven gains his fans' Adoration when he catches a Spinning Axe or kills a minion, monster, or tower. Killing enemy champions grants Draven bonus gold based on how much Adoration he has.;
In Noxus
column2: warriors known as reckoners face one another in arenas where blood is spilled and strength tested—but none has ever been as celebrated as Draven. A former soldier
column3: he found that the crowds uniquely appreciated his flair for the dramatic
column4: not to mention the spray of blood from each of his spinning axes. Addicted to the spectacle of his own brash perfection
column5: Draven has sworn to defeat whomever he must to ensure that his name is chanted throughout the empire forever more.

column1: Even as an orphan on the streets of Basilich
column2: Draven was headstrong and full of bravado
column3: frequently getting into vicious brawls with older street children and shady underworld thugs. While supremely confident in his own ability—some would say overconfident—it is unlikely he would have survived childhood had it not been for his older brother
column4: Darius
column5: who invariably finished the fights Draven started.

column1: When Basilich fell to the warhosts of Noxus
column2: the brothers came to the attention of a captain named Cyrus
column3: after Draven made an ill-considered attempt on his life. Impressed with their fighting spirit
column4: Cyrus allowed them to join the Noxian ranks.

column1: For years
column2: the brothers fought as part of Cyrus’ warhost—yet while Darius took to this life easily
column3: Draven grew steadily more bored. His martial skill was beyond question
column4: but the daily drudgery of soldiering felt like too much effort for too little reward… and not enough personal glory.

column1: Darius inevitably rose to command his own warband
column2: and Draven joined him. However
column3: if he thought that would be easier
column4: or a way to achieve greater individual recognition
column5: he was sorely disappointed.

column1: Some say Draven chose to leave Darius’ command. Some say he was forced out. Either way
column2: his skills were highly sought after as a champion and duelist
column3: and he was enticed to join a succession of warbands during the occupation of Ionia
column4: before ending up with a fairly respectable contract in the Reckoning pits.

column1: For centuries
column2: the gladiatorial Reckoners had performed a vital role in Noxus—punishing criminals and settling disputes between the noble houses—and Draven was determined to receive the riches
column3: adoration
column4: and renown he felt he deserved. However
column5: with long
column6: protracted wars on many fronts
column7: the spectacle was beginning to lose its appeal for the common citizen. As the attention of the crowds drifted
column8: Draven fell into a slump
column9: spending more and more time in the seedier drinking halls and gambling dens of the capital.

column1: He was washed-up and broke when the former general Jericho Swain found him.
Swain had a plan to reclaim Noxus’ lost glory
column2: and needed Draven’s help to achieve it. Perhaps Swain only enlisted him as a way to ensure his brother Darius’ support after the fact. Regardless
column3: Draven proved integral to Swain’s plan—to depose the Grand General himself
column4: Boram Darkwill.

column1: Standing triumphant with Swain
column2: Draven smiled for the first time in months as the cheers of the Noxian people washed over him.

column1: But duty called. In the days and weeks following this unprecedented coup
column2: many among the noble elite refused to honor Swain’s succession
column3: so they were sentenced to death in the arena.

column1: One condemned man escaped his handlers ahead of his execution. Operating on pure instinct—as was ever his wont—Draven leapt from the high balcony and hurled a pair of axes at the fleeing man
column2: cutting him down in a heartbeat. After a moment of stunned silence
column3: the crowd roared their approval. Draven retrieved his axes
column4: spinning them high in the air
column5: playing to his new fans
column6: and savoring their rapturous applause.

column1: Thus Draven became the Glorious Executioner
column2: turning routine bouts into grand spectacles that drew ever larger crowds.

column1: Soon enough
column2: an enterprising (and diminutive) promoter
column3: tired of paying to house
column4: feed
column5: and train Reckoners only for them to die in front of dwindling audiences
column6: approached Draven with an idea. What if the drama of the classic pit fights could be combined with Draven’s natural showmanship?

column1: The Reckoners quickly became entertainers as much as combatants
column2: each with their own carefully constructed backstory
column3: fighting style
column4: and flamboyant personality. The fights were often bloody—this was still Noxus after all—but far less often ended in death. The rivalries
column5: trash-talking
column6: and intrigue between the best-known Reckoners became the stuff of legend throughout the empire
column7: but none were talked about more than Draven.

column1: For a time he lived the high life
column2: receiving invitations to a never-ending stream of parties and banquets
column3: mixing with the wealthy and influential of Swain’s new Noxus. He even reconciled with Darius
column4: and would occasionally still march out with the warhosts
column5: defeating enemy champions and generals in single combat.

column1: Nevertheless
column2: Draven has started to grow restless once again. He has all that he could have ever imagined
column3: and more
column4: but now dreams of the day when the whole world knows his name.

column1: 222;Jinx;the Loose Cannon;Crime City Jinx;Firecracker Jinx;Zombie Slayer Jinx;Star Guardian Jinx;Ambitious Elf Jinx;Odyssey Jinx;PROJECT: Jinx;Heartseeker Jinx;;;;;;;;Rockets aren't always the best choice! Jinx's minigun is incredibly powerful when fully ramped up. Switch to it whenever an enemy champion gets too close.;Jinx's rockets deal full damage to all enemies in the explosion. Use them on minions in lane to hit nearby enemy champions without drawing minion aggro.;When a fight starts try to stay on the edge of fray by poking with rockets and Zap!. Do not run in and unload with the minigun until you feel it is safe.;;;Jinx's minigun takes time to ramp up. If you see her poking with rockets try to jump on her and burst her down.;Jinx's ultimate does less damage the closer you are to her.;Jinx's snare grenades have a long cooldown and are her primary means of protecting herself. If she misses with them she will have a hard time escaping if engaged upon. ;;Marksman;;Mana;9;2;4;6;610.0;86;245.0;45.0;325;26;3.5;30.0;0.5;525;3.75;0.5;6.7;1.0;57.0;3.4;1.0;0.625;Switcheroo!;Jinx modifies her basic attacks by swapping between Pow-Pow, her minigun and Fishbones, her rocket launcher. Attacks with Pow-Pow grant Attack Speed, while attacks with Fishbones deal area of effect damage, gain increased range, but drain Mana and attack slower.;Zap!;Jinx uses Zapper, her shock pistol, to fire a blast that deals damage to the first enemy hit, slowing and revealing it.;Flame Chompers!;Jinx throws out a line of snare grenades that explode after 5 seconds, lighting enemies on fire. Flame Chompers will bite enemy champions who walk over them, rooting them in place.;Super Mega Death Rocket!;Jinx fires a super rocket across the map that gains damage as it travels. The rocket will explode upon colliding with an enemy champion, dealing damage to it and surrounding enemies based on their missing Health.;Get Excited!;Jinx receives massively increased Move Speed and Attack Speed whenever she helps kill or destroy an enemy champions epic jungle monster, or structure.;
A manic and impulsive criminal from Zaun
column2: Jinx lives to wreak havoc without care for the consequences. With an arsenal of deadly weapons
column3: she unleashes the loudest blasts and brightest explosions to leave a trail of mayhem and panic in her wake. Jinx despises boredom
column4: and gleefully brings her own chaotic brand of pandemonium wherever she goes.

column1: While most look at Jinx and see only a mad woman wielding an array of dangerous weapons
column2: a few remember her as a relatively innocent girl from Zaun—a tinkerer with big ideas who never quite fit in. No one knows for certain what happened to turn that sweet young child into a wildcard
column3: infamous for her wanton acts of destruction. But once Jinx exploded onto the scene in Piltover
column4: her unique talent for sowing anarchy instantly became the stuff of legend.

column1: Jinx first gained notoriety through her anonymous “pranks” on the citizens of Piltover… particularly those with connections to the wealthy merchant clans. These pranks ranged from the moderately annoying to the criminally dangerous. She blocked streets on Progress Day
column2: with a stampede of exotic animals freed from Count Mei’s menagerie. She disrupted trade for weeks when she lined the city’s iconic bridges with adorably destructive flame chompers. Once
column3: she even managed to move every street sign in town to new and utterly confusing locations.

column1: Though this unknown troublemaker’s targets seemed random
column2: and her motivation nothing more than pure chaos
column3: her actions always served to bring the city’s orderly bustle to a screeching halt.

column1: Naturally
column2: the wardens attributed some of her crimes to chem-punk gangs from the undercity. Having others get credit for her manic schemes didn’t sit well with Jinx
column3: and so she made sure to make her presence known at every future crime scene. Rumors soon circulated of the mysterious
column4: blue-haired Zaunite girl carrying chemtech explosives
column5: a shark-mouthed rocket launcher
column6: and a repeater gun. Still
column7: the authorities dismissed these reports as preposterous. After all
column8: how could a lowly street punk possibly obtain such lethal ordnance?

column1: Jinx’s bombastic spree seemed endless
column2: with the wardens’ attempts to catch the culprit thwarted at every turn. She began tagging her works of destruction with vivid graffiti
column3: and other taunting messages directed at the city sheriff’s newest ally in the fight against crime
column4: Enforcer Vi.

column1: Jinx’s reputation grew
column2: leaving the people of Zaun divided as to whether she was a hero for sticking it to the arrogant Pilties
column3: or a dangerous lunatic for escalating existing tensions between their two cities.

column1: After months of ever-increasing carnage
column2: Jinx unveiled her biggest plan yet. In her trademark electric pink
column3: Jinx daubed the walls of the Ecliptic Vaults—one of Piltover’s most secure treasuries—with a very unflattering caricature of Enforcer Vi
column4: and the details of her own intention to rob the stores within.

column1: An uneasy sense of anticipation settled on Piltover and Zaun leading up to the promised date of the heist. Many doubted even Jinx would have the guts to show up and risk almost certain capture.
When the day arrived
column2: Vi
column3: Sheriff Caitlyn
column4: and the wardens prepared a trap for Jinx outside the treasury. But Jinx had already smuggled herself inside by way of an oversized coin crate that had been delivered days before. When Vi heard pandemonium erupt from inside the structure
column5: she knew the wardens had been outclassed once again. She burst into the treasury
column6: and the ensuing confrontation left the Ecliptic Vaults a smoldering ruin
column7: and the merry mischief maker Jinx nowhere to be found.

column1: Jinx remains at large to this day
column2: and is a constant thorn in Piltover’s side. Her schemes have inspired copycat crimes among the chem-punks
column3: as well as numerous satirical plays lampooning the incompetence of the wardens
column4: and even a smattering of new colloquialisms throughout both cities—though no one has yet had the courage to call Enforcer Vi “Pretty-in-Pink” to her face.

column1: Jinx’s ultimate endgame
column2: and her obvious obsession with Vi
column3: both remain a mystery
column4: but one thing is certain: her crimes are continuing and growing in sheer audacity.

Twitch gains Attack Speed for a short duration.
