column1: A plague rat by birth
column2: a connoisseur of filth by passion
column3: Twitch is a paranoid and mutated rat that walks upright and roots through the dregs of Zaun for treasures only he truly values. Armed with a chem-powered crossbow
column4: Twitch is not afraid to get his paws dirty as he builds a throne of refuse in his kingdom of filth
column5: endlessly plotting the downfall of humanity.

column1: 32;Amumu;the Sad Mummy;Pharaoh Amumu;Vancouver Amumu;Emumu;Re-Gifted Amumu;Almost-Prom King Amumu;Little Knight Amumu;Sad Robot Amumu;Surprise Party Amumu;Infernal Amumu;Hextech Amumu;Pumpkin Prince Amumu;;;;;Amumu is highly dependent on teammates, so try laning with your friends for maximum effectiveness.;Cooldown Reduction on Amumu is very strong, but it's often difficult to itemize for it. Grab the Golem buff whenever possible to gain Cooldown Reduction without sacrificing stats.;Despair is very effective against other tanks, so make sure you're in range of opponents with the highest Health.;;;Avoid bunching up with other allies when Amumu has his ultimate available.;Erratic movement, or hiding behind creep waves can make it difficult for Amumu to instigate a fight with Bandage Toss.;Amumu's Despair makes purchasing primarily Health items a risky proposition.;;Tank;Mage;Mana;2;6;8;3;615.0;75;285.0;40.0;335;30;3.5;32.0;1.25;125;9.0;0.85;7.38;0.53;53.0;3.8;2.18;0.736;Bandage Toss;Amumu tosses a sticky bandage at a target, stunning and damaging the target while he pulls himself to them.;Despair;Overcome by anguish, nearby enemies lose a percentage of their maximum Health each second and have their <font color='#9b0f5f'>Curses</font> refreshed.;Tantrum;Permanently reduces the physical damage Amumu would take. Amumu can unleash his rage, dealing damage to surrounding enemies. Each time Amumu is hit, the cooldown on Tantrum is reduced by 0.5 seconds.;Curse of the Sad Mummy;Amumu entangles surrounding enemy units in bandages, applying his <keywordMajor>Curse</keywordMajor>, damaging and stunning them.;Cursed Touch;Amumu's basic attacks Curse his enemies, causing them to take bonus true damage from incoming magic damage.;
A lonely and melancholy soul from ancient Shurima
column2: Amumu roams the world in search of a friend. Cursed by an ancient spell
column3: he is doomed to remain alone forever
column4: as his touch is death and his affection ruin. Those who claim to have seen him describe Amumu as a living cadaver
column5: small in stature and covered in bandages the color of lichen. Amumu has inspired myths
column6: folklore
column7: and legends told and retold for generations – such that it is impossible to separate truth from fiction.

column1: The hardy folk of Shurima agree upon certain things: the wind always blows from the west in the morning; a full belly on a new moon is an ill omen; buried treasure hides under the heaviest of rocks. They do not agree
column2: however
column3: about the tale of Amumu.

column1: One oft-told story links Amumu to the first great ruling family of Shurima who succumbed to a disease that corrupted flesh with hideous speed. The youngest child
column2: Amumu
column3: was quarantined in his chambers and befriended a servant girl who heard his cries through the walls. She regaled the lonely heir with courtly news and stories of her grandmother’s mystic powers.

column1: One morning
column2: the girl brought word that Amumu’s last remaining brother had passed away
column3: making him Emperor of Shurima. Saddened that he had to bear this news alone
column4: she unlocked his door and ran inside to comfort him face to face. Amumu threw his arms around her
column5: but as they touched
column6: he fell back
column7: realizing he had condemned her to the same terrible fate as his family.

column1: Upon the girl’s death
column2: her grandmother placed a twisted blight on the young emperor. In her mind
column3: Amumu had as good as murdered her kin. As the curse took effect
column4: Amumu was trapped in his moment of suffering like a locust ensnared in honeyed amber.

column1: A second tale whispers of another crown prince
column2: one given to bouts of petulance
column3: cruelty
column4: and murderous vanity. In this telling
column5: Amumu was crowned Emperor of Shurima at a young age
column6: and convinced he was blessed by the sun
column7: he forced his subjects to worship him as a god.

column1: Amumu sought the fabled Eye of Angor
column2: an ancient relic entombed in a gilded crypt
column3: said to grant eternal life to whoever looked upon it with an unflinching heart. He hunted the treasure for years with a host of slaves who carried him through labyrinthine catacombs
column4: sacrificing themselves to traps so the emperor could continue without hindrance. Amumu finally reached the cyclopean golden archway
column5: where upon dozens of his stonemasons labored to breach the sealed door.

column1: As the young emperor rushed within
column2: determined to look into the Eye of Angor
column3: his slaves seized their chance and sealed the stone doorway behind him. Some say the child emperor endured in the darkness for years
column4: his loneliness driving him to insanity and causing him to claw at his own skin
column5: which he was forced to wrap in bandages. His life was extended by the power of the Eye as he meditated on his past transgressions
column6: but the gift was a double edged sword
column7: for he was cursed to remain forever alone.

column1: When a series of devastating earthquakes shattered the foundations of his tomb
column2: the emperor escaped with no knowledge of how much time had passed
column3: seeking to undo the suffering he had caused in life.

column1: Yet another story of Amumu tells of the first and last Yordle ruler of Shurima
column2: who believed in the innate goodness of the human heart. To prove his detractors wrong
column3: he swore an oath to live as a beggar until he made one true friend
column4: convinced his people would rally to help their fellow Shuriman.

column1: Though thousands walked by the disheveled Yordle
column2: not one stopped to offer a helping hand. Amumu’s sadness grew until he eventually died of a broken heart. But his death was not the end
column3: for some swear the Yordle still wanders the desert
column4: forever searching for someone who might restore his faith in humanity.

column1: These stories
column2: despite their differences
column3: are woven with parallels. Whatever the circumstances
column4: Amumu is doomed to exist in a broken state of emptiness
column5: eternally alone and friendless. Fated to forever search for a companion
column6: his presence is cursed and his touch is death. On long winter nights when the fire is never allowed to burn low
column7: the sad mummy can sometimes be heard weeping in the desert
column8: despairing that he’ll never know the solace of friendship.

column1: Whatever Amumu searches for – atonement
column2: kinship
column3: or a single act of kindness – one thing is as certain as the western wind at dawn: he has yet to find it.

You can crush the goo pieces by stepping on them.;Kill all of Zac's bloblets when he splits apart to stop him from reforming.;Silences, stuns, roots and knockups will all interrupt Zac when he is charging Elastic Slingshot.;;Tank;Fighter;None;3;7;7;8;615.0;95;0.0;0.0;340;33;3.5;32.0;1.25;175;8.0;0.5;0.0;0.0;60.0;3.4;1.6;0.736;Stretching Strikes;Zac stretches an arm, grabbing an enemy. Attacking a different enemy will cause him to throw both targets towards each other.;Unstable Matter;Zac explodes outward towards nearby enemies, dealing a percentage of their maximum health as magic damage.;Elastic Slingshot;Zac attaches his arms to the ground and stretches back, launching himself forward.;Let's Bounce!;Zac bounces four times, knocking up enemies hit and slowing them.;Cell Division;Each time Zac hits an enemy with an ability, he sheds a chunk of himself that can be reabsorbed to restore Health. Upon taking fatal damage, Zac splits into 4 bloblets that attempt to recombine. If any bloblets remain, he will revive with an amount of Health depending on the Health of the surviving bloblets. Each bloblet has a percentage of Zac's maximum Health, Armor and Magic Resistance. This ability has a 5 minute cooldown.;
Zac is the product of a toxic spill that ran through a chemtech seam and pooled in an isolated cavern deep in Zaun’s Sump. Despite such humble origins
column2: Zac has grown from primordial ooze into a thinking being who dwells in the city’s pipes
column3: occasionally emerging to help those who cannot help themselves or to rebuild the broken infrastructure of Zaun.

column1: A group of Zaunite children first encountered Zac when they were out skimming rocks over a sump pool and some of the stones were thrown back. The “Returning Pool” became well-known to Zaun’s Sump dwellers
column2: and eventually drew the attention of a shadowy cabal of chemtech alchymists. Over the protests of the local residents
column3: the alchymists pumped the contents of the pool into vats and carried the substance back to their laboratories for experimentation.

column1: Via a series of experiments designed to test negative and positive reinforcement techniques
column2: the alchymists discovered the coagulate mass within the pool appeared to have psychotropic tendencies. Simply put
column3: it mirrored whatever stimulus was provided to it. If treated well
column4: it responded with childlike glee and playfulness
column5: but when its response to pain and aggression were tested
column6: the alchymists lost numerous augmented sump-scrappers in the ensuing destruction.

column1: Most of the alchymists attributed this to nothing more than a simple reflex response
column2: but two among their number weren’t so sure. They questioned the morality of experiments that seemed entirely driven to produce a creature of unmatched aggression. When the pair dug further
column3: they discovered the project was being funded by Saito Takeda
column4: a Chem-Baron with a notoriously violent temperament and reputation for bloody gang warfare. The implication was clear; Takeda sought to develop a fighter who could shrug off mortal wounds
column5: squeeze into places humans could not and who would obey any command. They also discovered the project’s true name; the Zaun Amorphous Combatant.

column1: As they pondered the best course of action
column2: the two dissenting alchymists saw more than just a mirroring of whatever stimulus was applied to the viscous gel. They saw behaviors manifest without any obvious stimulus - behaviors consistent with sentience. They came to know the creature as Zac and concluded that he exhibited the behaviors of a thinking
column3: feeling being. They brought their findings to the spindle-limbed leader of their research team
column4: but their concerns were ignored.

column1: Unwilling to let the matter drop
column2: they began their own covert efforts to counter the violent teachings of the rest of their team. They sought to show Zac right from wrong
column3: exposing him to acts of altruism and generosity. Their efforts bore fruit
column4: with Zac showing sadness when one of the researchers hurt her hand and reacting badly when another killed a rat in the laboratory. Eventually
column5: they could no longer tolerate the cruel experiments being done to Zac by their fellow alchymists.

column1: One night
column2: during Zaun’s Progress Day remembrances
column3: when the laboratory was empty
column4: they drained Zac into a wheeled septic tank and dragged him to a far distant part of Zaun. When their act was later discovered
column5: the footsoldiers of Baron Takeda sought them out. But Zaun is a big place
column6: and the researchers were able to hide from their pursuers. They had thought to give Zac his freedom
column7: but Zac did not want to be released
column8: for he now considered the two researchers his family. They alone had shown him kindness
column9: and he wanted to learn more from them. In truth
column10: they were pleased by his reaction
column11: for they had become so fond of Zac that they considered him their adoptive son.

column1: To stay hidden from Takeda’s men
column2: they changed their identities and appearance
column3: taking up residence in a remote part of the Sump
column4: far from prying eyes. Zac learned to mimic their voices
column5: and quickly adapted to shift his gelatinous mass into the required shapes to form sound. He lived alongside his adoptive parents for many years
column6: hiding when necessary in sump pools or in the cracks in the cliffside rocks. His ‘parents’ told Zac of the world in which he lived
column7: how it could be beautiful and full of wonder. They showed him the moon rise over the Sun Gates
column8: the play of rainbow light on the stained glass roofs of Zaun’s commercia halls
column9: and the bustling
column10: vibrant beauty of their city’s heart. They also explained how the world could be cruel and harsh
column11: and Zac learned that people were sometimes mean and unkind
column12: hateful and prejudiced. Zac rejected such behaviors and helped his parents where he could as they used their skills to aid the people around them without attracting undue attention.

column1: They did what they could to treat the sick
column2: mend broken machinery or otherwise put their chem-knowledge to benign use. These were golden years for Zac
column3: and he roamed Zaun through its almost limitless network of pipes and through the many cracks in its bedrock. As much as Zac was a sentient being
column4: too much stimulus from his environment could sometimes overwhelm his senses and cause him to temporarily absorb the dominant emotions around him
column5: for good or ill. Oft-times he couldn’t help getting involved in aiding the oppressed and downtrodden against thuggish bullies; leading to rumors of his presence spreading through Zaun. Though the majority of tales were of him helping
column6: others attributed destructive events to Zac; a factory destroyed or a crevasse ripping open in a Sump neighborhood.

column1: Eventually
column2: those rumors reached the ears of Saito Takeda
column3: and he sent a band of augmented thugs to retrieve what he saw as his property. His alchymists had been attempting - without success - to replicate the process that had created Zac from droplets left behind in his vat. Takeda wanted the creature returned
column4: and his augmented heavies surrounded Zac’s parents’ home and attacked. They fought back
column5: for they were chemtech researchers and not without esoteric means of defending themselves
column6: but their defiance could not last forever and eventually they were killed
column7: despite Takeda’s order that they be taken alive.

column1: Zac had been exploring subterranean seams far below Zaun
column2: but sensed his parents’ distress and raced back through the pipes of the city to the rescue. He arrived too late to save them
column3: and the fury that overwhelmed him upon seeing their bodies was unmatched by anything the baron’s men had ever seen. Zac attacked in a ferocious display of stretching
column4: smashing
column5: and crushing. In his grief and anger
column6: he demolished dozens of nearby dwellings
column7: and by the time the battle was over
column8: all the augmented thugs were dead.

column1: When the heightened emotions of battle drained from Zac’s consciousness
column2: he was overcome with remorse for the homes he had destroyed
column3: and vowed to continue the good work done by his parents. He helped rebuild what he had destroyed
column4: but as soon as the work was done
column5: he vanished into Zaun’s vast network of pipes.

column1: Now Zac lives alone
column2: dwelling in the tunnels and caverns threading Zaun
column3: and bathing in the emotions of the city’s inhabitants. Sometimes this enriches him
column4: but other times it saddens him as he takes on both the good and bad of the city. He has become something of an urban legend among the people of Zaun
column5: a mysterious creature that sometimes emerges from cracks in the rock or a section of damaged pipework. Most times this is to help those in need
column6: but in times of trouble
column7: when the city’s moods turn grim
column8: his appearance can be cause for trepidation.

column1: 48;Trundle;the Troll King;Lil' Slugger Trundle;Junkyard Trundle;Traditional Trundle;Constable Trundle;Worldbreaker Trundle;Dragonslayer Trundle;;;;;;;;;;Trundle excels at fighting within his Frozen Domain. Try to draw enemies onto it.;Use Subjugate to soften a powerful enemy tank or to create a target for your team to focus fire.;Chomp is good for lowering the physical damage of enemies; try to focus it on enemy physical damage dealers.";;;Trundle is very powerful at location-based combat. Try to draw him off of his Frozen Domain.;Make sure to get out of his Pillar of Ice as quickly as possible
column2: as it significantly slows you down.;;;Fighter;Tank;Mana;7;6;2;5;616.0;96;281.0;45.0;350;37;2.7;32.0;1.25;175;6.0;0.75;7.5;0.6;68.0;3.0;2.9;0.67;Chomp;Trundle bites his opponent
column3: dealing damage
column4: briefly slowing and sapping some of their Attack Damage.;Frozen Domain;Trundle turns target location into his domain
column5: gaining Attack Speed
column6: Movement Speed
column7: and increased healing from all sources while on it.;Pillar of Ice;Trundle creates an ice pillar at target location
column8: becoming impassable terrain and slowing all nearby enemy units.;Subjugate;Trundle immediately steals a percent of his target's Health
column9: Armor and Magic Resistance. Over the next 4 seconds the amount of Health
column10: Armor

column12: he heals for a percent of its maximum Health.;"

column1: Trundle is a hulking and devious troll with a particularly vicious streak
column2: and there is nothing he cannot bludgeon into submission—not even the Freljord itself. Fiercely territorial
column3: he chases down anyone foolish enough to enter his domain. Then
column4: his massive club of True Ice at the ready
column5: he chills his enemies to the bone and impales them with jagged
column6: frozen pillars
column7: laughing as they bleed out onto the tundra.

column1: Trolls are
column2: for the most part
column3: hulking and brutish creatures
column4: found in many of Runeterra’s least hospitable environments. Though not invulnerable
column5: they are blessed with a hardy constitution and the ability to heal more quickly than other mortal races—especially the feeble humans. This means they can endure extremes of climate and scarce resources merely by out-surviving their rivals
column6: and this is the most likely reason some of the largest known tribes still call the mountains of the Freljord home.

column1: Trundle was whelped in a filthy cave
column2: along with a brood of fifteen brothers and sisters. Times were particularly hard
column3: so that only seven of them grew strong enough to join the ranks of their chieftain’s warband… and only three remained after their first winter of raiding.

column1: As the warband feasted
column2: the chieftain spoke of his intention to circle back and raid the same lands again. All would fear them. It would get easier every time.

column1: Frowning
column2: Trundle stood up
column3: and said this plan was no good. The people they had crushed had nothing left for the tribe to take—they should return next winter when the granaries were full again
column4: and the livestock grown big enough to make more than a single mouthful.

column1: Many of the other trolls did not like this at all. They ground their teeth and thumped the sides of their heads
column2: trying to comprehend what Trundle was suggesting. Was he a coward? Had the cold got into his brain and turned it to slush? The chieftain beat Trundle with a rock
column3: and threw him away down the mountainside. Fools had no place in his warband.

column1: Trundle wandered far
column2: for he knew he would not be welcome anywhere nearby. He avoided other troll tribes scattered across the tundra
column3: and was careful to keep his distance from the feral yetis that roamed the highlands. By night
column4: he gazed up at the stars and remembered all the stories he had been told as a pup—legends of Grubgrack the Wise
column5: and other ancient troll kings
column6: who followed the old gods and were gifted powerful weapons as symbols of their right to rule the world.

column1: Eventually
column2: Trundle came to a great crack in the ground. While he was glad to be out of the wind
column3: he soon found himself lost in a maze of twisted
column4: howling canyons that seemed to sink deeper beneath the Freljord than the mountains rose above it.

column1: And at the very bottom of that abyss
column2: he met the Ice Witch.

column1: She waited for him on a shimmering
column2: frozen lake
column3: surrounded by little human warriors skinned in furs and metal. Trundle was not daunted by any of this; but the Ice Witch wanted to know how he had found his way here
column4: into the very heart of her domain
column5: and how he was able to walk upon her lake.

column1: Trundle looked down. The ice beneath his feet was darker than the night sky
column2: far overhead. It made his brain want to squirm around inside his skull.

column1: The Ice Witch told him he was special—something called “Iceborn”
column2: which meant he should stay there with her. But Trundle did not want this
column3: and told her how he had been cast out by the chieftain
column4: and that he wanted to find a great weapon and become a troll king like Grubgrack and all the others. To his surprise
column5: the Ice Witch agreed
column6: and handed him a mighty club of ice called Boneshiver. With this
column7: he could become king of all trolls
column8: and form a great alliance with her human tribe.

column1: He eagerly agreed
column2: and began the long journey home.

column1: When Trundle arrived
column2: the chieftain laughed in his face… until Trundle bashed him over the head with Boneshiver. In an instant
column3: the old troll was frozen solid by the club’s icy magic
column4: and a second blow shattered his body into tiny pieces.

column1: Awed by Trundle’s newfound strength
column2: the rest of the warband listened to his tale of the Ice Witch
column3: and the alliance she had promised. Trundle was smart. Trundle had been chosen to wield great power. Trundle would be their king.

column1: And with Trundle leading the charge
column2: the time of the trolls is surely coming.

column1: 86;Garen;The Might of Demacia;Sanguine Garen;Desert Trooper Garen;Commando Garen;Dreadknight Garen;Rugged Garen;Steel Legion Garen;Rogue Admiral Garen;Warring Kingdoms Garen;God-King Garen;Demacia Vice Garen;Mecha Kingdoms Garen;Mecha Kingdoms Garen Prestige Edition;Battle Academia Garen;;;Garen's regeneration greatly increases if he can avoid receiving damage for several seconds.;Judgment deals maximum damage when only hitting a single target. For effective trading, try to position such that only the enemy champion is hit.;Garen is only constrained by cooldowns, making items such as Black Cleaver very effective for him.;;;Stack armor items to lower the large amount of physical damage that Garen deals out.;Try to run away from Garen as your health gets lower, as he can execute you quickly with Demacian Justice.;Be careful about attacking Garen in brush. It often will lead to taking full damage from Judgment.;Judgment deals maximum damage when only hitting a single target. If getting out of its radius isn't possible, move through allied minions to reduce damage taken.;Fighter;Tank;None;7;7;1;5;620.0;84;0.0;0.0;340;36;3.0;32.0;0.75;175;8.0;0.5;0.0;0.0;66.0;4.5;3.65;0.625;Decisive Strike;Garen gains a burst of Move Speed, breaking free of all slows affecting him. His next attack strikes a vital area of his foe, dealing bonus damage and silencing them.;Courage;Garen passively increases his armor and magic resist by killing enemies. He may also activate this ability to give him a shield and tenacity for a brief moment followed by a lesser amount of damage reduction for a longer duration.;Judgment;Garen rapidly spins his sword around his body, dealing physical damage to nearby enemies.;Demacian Justice;Garen calls upon the might of Demacia to attempt to execute an enemy champion.;Perseverance;If Garen has not recently been struck by damage or enemy abilities, he regenerates a percentage of his total health each second.;
A proud and noble soldier
column2: Garen fights at the head of the Dauntless Vanguard. He is popular among his fellows
column3: and respected well enough by his enemies—not least as a scion of the prestigious Crownguard family
column4: entrusted with defending Demacia and its ideals. Clad in magic-resistant armor and bearing a mighty broadsword
column5: Garen stands ready to confront mages and sorcerers on the field of battle
column6: in a veritable whirlwind of righteous steel.

column1: Born into the noble Crownguard family
column2: along with his younger sister Lux
column3: Garen knew from an early age that he would be expected to defend the throne of Demacia with his life. His father
column4: Pieter
column5: was a decorated military officer
column6: while his aunt Tianna was Sword-Captain of the elite Dauntless Vanguard—and both were recognized and greatly respected by King Jarvan III. It was assumed that Garen would eventually come to serve the king’s son in the same manner.

column1: The kingdom of Demacia had risen from the ashes of the Rune Wars
column2: and the centuries afterward were plagued with further conflict and strife. One of Garen’s uncles
column3: a ranger-knight in the Demacian military
column4: told young Garen and Lux his tales of venturing outside the kingdom’s walls to protect its people from the dangers of the world beyond.

column1: He warned them that
column2: one day
column3: something would undoubtedly end this time of relative peace—whether it be rogue mages
column4: creatures of the abyss
column5: or some other unimaginable horror yet to come.

column1: As if to confirm those fears
column2: their uncle was killed in the line of duty by a mage
column3: before Garen turned eleven. Garen saw the pain this brought to his family
column4: and the fear in his young sister’s eyes. He knew then
column5: for certain
column6: that magic was the first and greatest peril that Demacia faced
column7: and he vowed never to let it within their walls. Only by following their founding ideals
column8: and by displaying their unshakeable pride
column9: could the kingdom be kept safe.

column1: At the age of twelve
column2: Garen left the Crownguard home in High Silvermere to join the military. As a squire
column3: his days and nights were consumed by training and the study of war
column4: honing his body and mind into a weapon as strong and true as Demacian steel. It was then that he first met young Jarvan IV—the prince who
column5: as king
column6: he would one day serve—among the other recruits
column7: and the two became inseparable.

column1: In the years that followed
column2: Garen earned his place in the shieldwall as a warrior of Demacia
column3: and quickly gained a fearsome reputation on the battlefield. By the time he was eighteen
column4: he had served with honor in campaigns along the Freljordian borders
column5: played a key role in purging fetid cultists from the Silent Forest
column6: and fought alongside the valiant defenders of Whiterock.

column1: King Jarvan III himself summoned Garen’s battalion back to the Great City of Demacia
column2: honoring them before the royal court in the Hall of Valor. Tianna Crownguard
column3: recently elevated to the role of High Marshal
column4: singled out her nephew in particular
column5: and recommended him for the trials necessary to join the ranks of the Dauntless Vanguard.

column1: Garen returned home in preparation
column2: and was greeted warmly by Lux and his parents
column3: as well as the common people living on his family’s estate. Though he was pleased to see his sister growing into an intelligent
column4: capable young woman
column5: something about her had changed. He had noticed it whenever he visited
column6: but now Garen wrestled with a real and gnawing suspicion that Lux possessed magical powers… though he never let himself entertain the idea for long. The thought of a Crownguard being capable of the same forbidden sorceries that had slain their uncle was too unbearable to confront.

column1: Naturally
column2: through courage and skill
column3: Garen won his place among the Vanguard. With his proud family and his good friend the prince looking on
column4: he took his oaths before the throne.

column1: Lux and her mother spent much more time in the capital
column2: in service to the king as well as the humble order of the Illuminators—yet Garen tried to keep his distance as much as possible. Though he loved his sister more than anything else in the world
column3: some small part of him had a hard time getting close to her
column4: and he tried not to think about what he would be forced to do if his suspicions were ever confirmed. Instead
column5: he threw himself into his new duties
column6: fighting and training twice as hard as he had before.

column1: When the new Sword-Captain of the Dauntless Vanguard fell in battle
column2: Garen found himself put forward for command by his fellow warriors
column3: and the nomination was unopposed.

column1: To this day
column2: he stands resolute in the defense of his homeland
column3: against all foes. Far more than Demacia's most formidable soldier
column4: he is the very embodiment of all the greatest and most noble ideals upon which it was founded.

column1: 23;Tryndamere;the Barbarian King;Highland Tryndamere;King Tryndamere;Viking Tryndamere;Demonblade Tryndamere;Sultan Tryndamere;Warring Kingdoms Tryndamere;Nightmare Tryndamere;Beast Hunter Tryndamere;Chemtech Tryndamere;Blood Moon Tryndamere;Nightbringer Tryndamere;;;;;Delaying the activation of Undying Rage is a very effective way to make an enemy champion over-commit to trying to kill you.;Bloodlust is an excellent way to heal Tryndamere. Try not to let it fade off before you activate it.;If the enemy is stacking Armor, try building items like Last Whisper or Youmuu's Ghostblade.;;;Try harassing Tryndamere early so he can't kill minions and heal with Bloodlust.;Remember, Tryndamere can only slow you if you are facing away from him.;Most of Tryndamere's damage is physical. If he's getting too strong, consider buying a Thornmail.;;Fighter;Assassin;Fury;10;5;2;5;626.0;98;100.0;0.0;345;33;3.1;32.0;1.25;125;8.5;0.9;0.0;0.0;72.0;3.7;2.9;0.67;Bloodlust;Tryndamere thrives on the thrills of combat, increasing his Attack Damage as he is more and more wounded. He can cast Bloodlust to consume his Fury and heal himself.;Mocking Shout;Tryndamere lets out an insulting cry, decreasing surrounding champions' Attack Damage. Enemies with their backs turned to Tryndamere also have their Movement Speed reduced.;Spinning Slash;Tryndamere slices toward a target unit, dealing damage to enemies in his path.;Undying Rage;Tryndamere's lust for battle becomes so strong that he is unable to die, no matter how wounded he becomes.;Battle Fury;Tryndamere gains Fury for each attack, critical strike, and killing blow he makes. Fury passively increases his Critical Strike Chance and can be consumed with his Bloodlust spell.;
Fueled by unbridled fury and rage
column2: Tryndamere once carved his way through the Freljord
column3: openly challenging the greatest warriors of the north to prepare himself for even darker days ahead. The wrathful barbarian has long sought revenge for the annihilation of his clan
column4: but more recently he has found companionship with Ashe
column5: forging an alliance of marriage with the Avarosan warmother. His almost inhuman strength and fortitude are legendary
column6: and have delivered him and his new allies countless victories against the greatest of odds.

column1: Tryndamere came into the world knowing only the harshness of survival
column2: for the frozen steppes where his clan made their home never truly thawed. Though they praised all the Freljord’s old gods
column3: as well as the Cult of the Three
column4: they prayed most often to a spirit-deity known to ravage the tundra—a hearty and unkillable tusklord. Since the raw materials required for armor were scarce
column5: the clan instead put its resources toward the forging of great blades
column6: inspired by their god’s ivory canines.

column1: The stamina and dueling prowess of Tryndamere’s people became legendary. They were able to fend off other raiding tribes
column2: slay the great beasts of the mountains
column3: and repel Noxians encroaching to the south. Tryndamere himself grew to be a brash and formidable warrior
column4: but it wasn’t until a particularly cruel midwinter night that his strength was truly tested. An unusual storm swept in from the east
column5: bringing with it an icy darkness
column6: and a towering
column7: horned figure silhouetted against the full moon.

column1: Some in the clan knelt
column2: believing that their boar-god stood among them. This creature dripped with ancient magic
column3: true enough
column4: but he was not of the Freljord… and those that knelt were the first to die.

column1: Tryndamere looked on in horror. He could feel unhinged brutality rising in his heart at the sight of the invader’s cruel
column2: living sword. Whether taken by bloodlust or some other madness
column3: Tryndamere raised his own blade
column4: and let out a defiant roar.

column1: The dark figure swatted him aside like an insect.
Tryndamere lay surrounded by the dead
column2: in snow soaked almost black with blood. He drew what he thought would be his last breaths as the creature approached and spoke. Tryndamere tried to hold onto the strange
column3: archaic words
column4: but as his life force slipped away
column5: it was the thing’s laughter that burned itself into the young warrior’s memory.

column1: For Tryndamere did not die that night. He was revived by a rage unlike anything he had ever experienced. He looked to the eastern horizon
column2: intent on avenging not only the destruction of his clan
column3: but the desecration of his own martial pride.

column1: However
column2: retribution was not what the steppes offered him. There were survivors
column3: and they would not be long for this world if Tryndamere could not find others to shelter them. There were Noxians to the south
column4: Frostguard to the north
column5: and the dark figure had come from the east. To the west
column6: it was said that some tribes were gathering before the supposed reincarnation of Avarosa—once
column7: he might have dismissed such fanciful rumors
column8: but now he knew this was his only recourse.

column1: Tryndamere and the remnants of his people arrived in the valley as little more than beggars. The young warrior was determined to show his clan’s worth
column2: and win them the Avarosan leader’s protection so that he could return to thoughts of revenge. Brandishing his tusked sword
column3: he did what came naturally
column4: and challenged others to duels. Holding the image of the dark figure and its echoing laughter in his mind
column5: Tryndamere quickly bested anyone who stepped forward.

column1: His singular fury was deeply unsettling to the Avarosans. The northern warriors
column2: too
column3: noted his rapid healing between bouts—unlike the Iceborn that walked among them
column4: the more Tryndamere gave in to his rage
column5: the more quickly his body healed. Many suspected he and his clan practiced strange and unnatural magics
column6: and so Tryndamere’s plan to prove his worth was now endangering the wider acceptance of his people.

column1: But not all of the Avarosans had turned against him. Their warmother
column2: Ashe
column3: was looking to strengthen her position with a political marriage… to someone who could face down the endless challengers for her hand
column4: and to her rule. Seeing an opportunity in the handsome barbarian
column5: she pledged to take in his clan as Avarosans
column6: if Tryndamere became her first and only bloodsworn.

column1: As he spent more time in Ashe’s company
column2: he began to believe what others had whispered—that she was indeed the divine reincarnation of Avarosa herself. His rage found temperance in her thoughtful leadership
column3: and a genuine affection grew between them.

column1: Even so
column2: serving as Ashe’s champion
column3: Tryndamere now looks to an uncertain future. The barbarian king can see war brewing all too clearly on the Freljord’s horizon
column4: yet he still thirsts for his own
column5: personal vengeance
column6: and begins to wonder if his predestined fate might not be at his queen’s side after all…
